recent_reviews.author: Lauren Varley
recent_reviews.text: Came for a visit to the sunflower field and had a great time, lots of photo spots! Had lunch in the cafe, food was good although the app was a bit confusing as not everything on the menu was on the app so I had to go inside to order. Farm shop is brilliant and the gelato was absolutely amazing, Iâ€™d come back just for an ice cream!

recent_reviews.author: Elisa Winstanley
recent_reviews.text: We had a very pleasant afternoon having lunch and browsing the farm shops! Itâ€™s very well organised and has plenty of parking. Itâ€™s dog friendly everywhere including the farm shop which was brilliant! Thereâ€™s plenty of space for children to let off steam! Theyâ€™ve currently have PYO sunflowers which you need to book tickets online. Lunch was great and you can order from a QR code at your table!

recent_reviews.author: Mary Al
recent_reviews.text: We have been here in May with the family/kids (lots of them!)  for strawberry picking and in June for a lovely breakfast with my husband. The strawberry picking is super accessible for all ages and wheel chair friendly and you donâ€™t need to lean over /crouch to pick the strawberries. The customer service here is amazing and so welcoming! The strawberries are THE best that I have EVER had, literally tastes like honey and so juicy! The breakfast we had today was amazing (halloumi slice) . The coffee is also great (I love my flat whites and it was done properly ) . We also had the ice cream last time and my family loved it, again no exaggeration one of the best ice creams! Lel served us today at breakfast and she was so lovely! Everyone was so polite at the restaurant. I would definitely come here again, we have officially become regulars! My family came all the way from roundhay (they canâ€™t wait to come again) and we came from garforth. Itâ€™s worth the visit!!

recent_reviews.author: Steven reddey
recent_reviews.text:
Well my 1st ever visit to Hemsworth in yorkshire was a treat. Wonderful weather scenery and people so friendly. As part of the visit I was taken to farmer copleys.featherstowe near pontefract wf7 5af. well what an experience. The place,  the restaurant,the staff,the atmosphere. And the food.we sat near the serving hatch and watched meal after meal as it was served it was impressive and looked amazing.  Well  I myself ordered the bangers and mash thick gravy and fried onions.wow it was beautiful and I licked the gravy clean mmmmm.my friend had the posh fish finger sandwich wow and the onion rings And the cheese and bacon quiche all big portions and so tasty..
it was amazing and highly recommended.on the dear side but an experience indeed.get in there

pumpkin_patches.address: Ravensknowle Farm, Pontefract Road, Pontefract WF7 5AF

recent_reviews.author: Glen
recent_reviews.text:
We visited for the spring Tulip festival and as first time visitors, we were greatly surprised and enjoyed the event.
Very well spaced areas and lots to see. Great amenities for food areas, toasting marshmallows, drinks, ice cream and snacks. Nice walks around the displays, with plenty of those all important photo moments to take advantage of, these not overly busy due to the well though our set up.
We went with our 3 year old, who enjoyed the many colours of tulips, the ice cream and the feature photo areas.
We will visit again potentially for pumpkin season or Christmas!
Highly recommend!!!

recent_reviews.author: Yuga Patil
recent_reviews.text:
We went to tulleys tulip festival and oh my God!! It was the best experience we had in a very long time.

Tulleys Tulip Festival was an absolute delightâ€”well-organised, vibrant, and full of charm. The tulip fields were beautifully maintained, with plenty of stunning photo spots and creative props. The food was delicious, and clean toilets were conveniently located every 200 metres. A perfect day out surrounded by natureâ€™s beauty!

Totally recommend it!!

recent_reviews.author: London Jaffna Boy
recent_reviews.text:
We visited Tulleys Farm in Sussex this spring for a relaxed family day out and a casual photoshoot with the kids, and it turned out to be a lovely experience. The farm had a peaceful countryside vibe with the early bloom of flowers and fresh greenery everywhereâ€”perfect for some natural, charming photos.

Thereâ€™s plenty of open space for children to explore, and the setting feels safe and family-friendly. The staff were welcoming, and while it wasnâ€™t as packed with activities as during their big seasonal events like Halloween or Christmas, the slower pace was actually a plus for usâ€”it made the whole visit more calm and enjoyable.

Itâ€™s a great spot for family photos if youâ€™re into rustic backdrops, and there are lots of little corners and farm features that make for really cute shots.

recent_reviews.author: Kay V
recent_reviews.text: Great day at the farm during the Easter holidays. Most beautiful scenic tulip farm. So much colour and most enjoyable walking through unicorn and flower filled routes.

pumpkin_patches.address: Tulleys Pumpkin Festival, Turners Hill Rd, Crawley RH10 4PD

recent_reviews.author: Jamie Knight
recent_reviews.text:
Iâ€™ve been coming to Cairnie Fruit Farm for 18 years now, and honestly, Iâ€™m beginning to wonder why. In nearly two decades, nothingâ€”and I mean nothingâ€”seems to have been updated or improved. For a place that prides itself on being a family attraction, it feels more like a business stuck in time.

Letâ€™s start with the maze. This year it was downright appalling. Instead of being surrounded by healthy, tall corn, I found myself wading through more weeds than anything else. The whole thing looked neglected, like no care had gone into it at all. To make matters worse, the boards youâ€™re supposed to find were plastered with so many stickers you couldnâ€™t even see what they were meant to show. It completely ruins the experienceâ€”how on earth are kids supposed to get any fun or challenge out of it when some parents canâ€™t be bothered to teach their kids basic respect, and the farm itself canâ€™t be bothered to maintain things properly?

Yes, the playground is still decent and the kids enjoyed it, but after 18 years I would expect to see some improvements, upgrades, something to show that Cairnie is actually reinvesting into the place. Instead, it feels tired, dated, and in desperate need of a shake-up.

Cairnie has so much potential, but right now itâ€™s letting itselfâ€”and its long-time visitorsâ€”down badly. After all these years, I shouldnâ€™t be leaving feeling more disappointed than when I arrived.

recent_reviews.author: Atz A
recent_reviews.text: This is great day out for families, so much to do and ofc the highlight is strawberry picking! The cafe was also really nice, after strawberry picking we had some tea and strawberry tart. Been 3 years now we go every summer. Definitely recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Prabakaran Natarajan
recent_reviews.text: â€œFresh Fruit Farm and Mega Maze is such a fun family day out! The fruit-picking was amazing â€“ sweet, fresh, and plenty to choose from. The Mega Maze was a real adventure, with clever paths and clues that kept both kids and adults entertained. Lovely farm shop, friendly staff, and clean facilities. Highly recommend for anyone looking for fresh air, good food, and lots of fun!â€

recent_reviews.author: Emma Black
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant day out.  Just be mindful that fruit picking closes early afternoon.  Also the tractor ride is an issue.  Selfish and entitled parents buck the queue and the lad doesn't seem able to control the idiots.  We ended up waiting two cycles and still did not get on.  Food prices are quite high.  I recommend a picnic!  Although the cafe is fantastic.

recent_reviews.author: Alphy Thomas
recent_reviews.text:
We went strawberry picking at Kenyon Hall Farm on a lovely Saturday morning with family and friends. We booked our slots online the night before, but Iâ€™d definitely recommend booking in advanceâ€”especially if youâ€™re going in a groupâ€”so you can get multiple slots together.

Each picking slot costs Â£5.59, plus a small booking fee. The process was easy, and the experience was absolutely worth it.

The strawberries were plentiful, ripe, and BIGâ€”many of them that perfect deep red you hope for. The properly red ones were sweet and deliciousâ€”exactly what you want from fresh, local fruit. They provide a small box to collect your berries, which isnâ€™t weighed. But if you ask for an extra box, it will be weighed and priced separately.

Aside from strawberries, there were also raspberries, blackberries, and a few other types of berries available for picking, depending on the season. Itâ€™s great to see that kind of variety.

The farm also has a shop with fresh farm food and quality vegetables and fruit for saleâ€”definitely worth a browse after your picking session.

Overall, it was a wonderful experienceâ€”fun for all ages and a great way to enjoy the outdoors with friends and family. Highly recommend it if youâ€™re in or around Warrington!

recent_reviews.author: Mon S
recent_reviews.text:
We recently visited Kenyon Hall Farm for their pumpkin planting experience, and it was absolutely brilliant!
The price was really reasonable for what you get. A lovely lady from the farm shared so much interesting information about its history, explaining how they used to plant pumpkins and how modern machinery has changed things. She also detailed how pumpkins grow and how long it takes before they're ready to pick.
What made it even better, especially for kids, were the illustrations she used to support her explanations â€“ my 5-year-old was captivated! He absolutely loved it.
As part of the experience, we also got to plant a sunflower seed to take home, which was such a nice touch. My boy is diligently taking care of it and can't wait for it to blossom!

We got incredibly lucky at the end of our pumpkin planting session; they had an unexpected surplus of strawberries and offered us the chance to go strawberry picking. While this experience was a bit more expensive than I'd ideally have liked, it was still such a wonderful spontaneous activity for the family. And seriously, these were the most beautiful strawberries I've ever seen!

Kenyon Hall Farm is clearly beautifully maintained and offers so much. I'd wholeheartedly recommend booking an adventure there â€“ it's a fantastic day out for the whole family.

recent_reviews.author: Rose_Gh
recent_reviews.text:
We recently visited Kenyon Hall Farm and had such a lovely day out with family and friends. Itâ€™s the perfect place to enjoy a mix of fresh air, local produce, and family-friendly activities. The farm shop is packed with seasonal fruit and vegetables, homemade treats, jams, and even fresh buttermilk. We also spotted grapefruits, leafy greens, and other farm-fresh produce, which makes it a fantastic spot for anyone who values quality and locally sourced food.

We spent time in the pick-your-own fields, which was such a fun experience for both adults and children. Depending on the season, you can pick strawberries, raspberries, pumpkins and more, and itâ€™s a really hands-on way to enjoy the farm. The staff were welcoming and helpful, explaining how everything works, and the fields were clean and well organised.

The cafÃ© is also worth a visit, we enjoyed freshly baked cakes with coffee, and there are plenty of light bites, sandwiches, and hot meals to choose from. Everything tasted fresh and was reasonably priced for the quality.

What makes Kenyon Hall Farm so special is how relaxing and inviting it feels. Thereâ€™s plenty of safe space for children to play, and itâ€™s such a refreshing escape from city life. Whether youâ€™re stopping by for the farm shop, the cafÃ©, or a family day in the fields, itâ€™s the kind of place youâ€™ll want to return to again and again as the seasons change.

recent_reviews.author: Ben
recent_reviews.text: Nice couple of hours at the farm. Nice selection of gifts and food at the farm shop and there is also a very popular restaurant)cafe which is now part of the farm. We had a nice picnic at the large selection of tables available outside,had some of the fantastic strawberries from the farm shop, recommended ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: sophie bowe
recent_reviews.text: Very interesting and historical place. Brilliant potatoes and people!

recent_reviews.author: Peter Wilson
recent_reviews.text: Cheap as chips

recent_reviews.author: Kayleigh McDine
recent_reviews.text: This was our second time staying at Arnprior farm and we have already booked to go back because we love it so much. It's also nice to see it at different times of the year. The pods feel luxurious and warm. All the little details like the board games are much appreciated. Our kids love the pool and the hot tub. There is also a swing and friendly chickens. We took part in the lambing experience while we were there. We booked in advance because we know how popular it is, and it did not disappoint. The owners are very friendly and hard working. We even saw a lamb being born. Thanks again for a lovely stay and we are already looking forward to coming back in the summer. :)

recent_reviews.author: Caitlin Girvan
recent_reviews.text:
Arnprior Farm Pumpkins is such a fantastic experience! We've been going, I think for 8 years now?! Every year, it is beautifully decorated. There are many free activities for the children to explore.. large hay bales, colouring area, make your own badge, photo props (so many and decorative displays). The marshmallow roasting was Â£2.50 and the quad pods were Â£3. It's really affordable to take part in the extras. During the ASN session, it's really peaceful (less people). No loud sounds, some extra activities are closed like the canon. Which is great for us.
Perfect family halloween day out. Best pumpkin patch near us! ğŸƒ ğŸ–¤

recent_reviews.author: Clare Lands
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely fabulous wigwam set up. Immaculate inside, so well equipped with literally everything you need. Your own hot tub and private gorgeous family shower room and toilet plus the pool. So peaceful and relaxing and space for the kids to play and have fun. Cannot recommend highly enough. The best glamping set up when have stayed at.

recent_reviews.author: Graeme Lynch
recent_reviews.text:
This was our first experience of Arnprior Pumpkin Picking. On arrival we found check in and parking very easy.

There were lots of portaloos available which is handy for young children and plenty of food stalls. Admittedly the price of everything was on the steep side with medium chrurros costing Â£7 and large Â£7.50.

There was plenty of free activities, the play barn, colouring, and more. There are also paid activities like the cannon and the bouncy castles, again it's a lot if you have a few kids with you.

The field of pumpkin was huge and there were loads of fun signs about to take pictures at. A great morning out, everyone enjoyed it.

recent_reviews.author: Jain
recent_reviews.text:
Maxeyâ€™s Farm Shop provided one of the best experiences and meals Iâ€™ve ever had. The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming, which made the visit even more enjoyable.

The outdoor seating area overlooks a beautiful green field, creating a peaceful atmosphere that really connects you with nature. We ordered the Chicken Club Sandwich with a salad and the soup of the day both were absolutely delicious! The portions were enough for two adults and a child. It cost us Â£21, which we felt was great value for the quality and quantity.

The shop itself was lovely, offering a wide variety of products. Everything felt thoughtfully curated and fresh. Another great bonus is the free car parking, which makes visiting even more convenient.

If thereâ€™s one suggestion Iâ€™d make, it would be to add a small playground area for children that would make it even more family-friendly. Overall, Maxeyâ€™s is well worth the visit great food, great service, and a charming environment. Highly recommended!

recent_reviews.author: Steven Mallyon
recent_reviews.text: I've been to maxey's may be 10 times in the past but definitely not be going again in any rush. Stood about 20 minutes to be seated and an hour and 2minutes to get our meal. Meal was very small and clearly skimping on things like cheese but topping up on cheaper products like salad. Overall the meal was bland,  tasteless  and lacking portions to call it a meal, a starter at best. Staff are polite but clearly are under pressure to rush around to the point of losing that personal interaction with customers. Well if finished eating now and feel the need to go home to have something to eat... that's not good. Going to pop in the shop to pick up a cake which are lovely.

recent_reviews.author: Danny Iwan
recent_reviews.text:
This is a nice farm shop stocked with a lot of locally produced goods.
In autumn, it is great for the pick your own pumpkins, which my daughter enjoys.
This new farm shop also has a large tea room attached to it, which I haven't personally tried, but it looks very nice.

recent_reviews.author: Dianne Hammond
recent_reviews.text: I canâ€™t believe we have lived locally for nearly two years and have not been to Maxeyâ€™s before today. The food is worth every penny and the service is outstanding!! Itâ€™s a pleasure to eat in such beautiful surroundings with staff who are both polite and very helpful!! Ten out of ten from us. Mr & Mrs Hammond

pumpkin_patches.address: Brickfield Farm, Hockerton Road, Kirklington, Newark NG22 8PB

recent_reviews.author: Shannon Heslop
recent_reviews.text: We went for the car show event which was well organised. The farm shop is lovely! Food from the courtyard kitchen is delicious! The farm shop is very reasonably priced, particularly in comparison with others I have been to and I bought some lovely things to take home. Would definitely recommend coming. There is a play barn for the children too which is great! I will definitely come back â˜ºï¸

recent_reviews.author: Amie Hunter
recent_reviews.text: I visited brockbushes farm yesterday with my two children's. Firstly I had booked the wrong day but sent an email and the staff were amazing, I got a quick response and they sorted it out for me which I massively appreciated. I booked to go to the family fun day then to go to the barn soft play afterwards. We paid per child for the family fun day which was Â£10.99 per child and Â£1.00 per adult which for what you get i think is amazing. Two hour slots, and once you get in everything was free except a hook a duck which was Â£5 but it was win every time and that's always a saviour for me personally,  no disapointed children. Inside there were bouncy castles, instable slides, outdoor games, fair rides etc which were also free i though this was amazig. Usually you pay to get in to somewhere then have to spend a fortune in there, so amazing value for money. There was also a more quiet section which really suited my son as he has SEN and there was a sand pit and obstacles. Everything was so clean and staff were really friendly and ready to help where needed. Inside there is a restaurant, the play barn and a farm shop. We booked separately into the play barn which again was a two hour slot it was really big and had loads for the kids to do to keep them entertained the full 2 hours. There was alot an outdoor play area attached and a cafe that served food and drink which was reasonably priced. We of course visited the farm shop on our way out to try some cheescake and other sweet treats which were absolutely delicious. It was a but for us to travel but I can say for sure this will be somewhere we return to.

recent_reviews.author: Silvia Del Din
recent_reviews.text:
Great experience: picking up berries with our toddler. Plenty of room.to get our with the pram.
We arrived for the 9am slot so it was not too busy or too hot.
We stopped also to buy a few items at the market and we had a nice breakfast in the cafÃ¨.
Strongly recommend .

recent_reviews.author: Byron Farrow
recent_reviews.text: A good stopping place for a beverage and a snack if taking the A68 to the north or the south. Decent prices and shop with more parking than many shopping malls. One issue is that the toilets, particularly near the end of the day, can get a bit manky.

recent_reviews.author: Mervyn Neill
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic place for all ages and really well laid out. Plenty of activities going on throughout the day. Pip the sheepdog was put through her paces and was a real star. The tractor ride was good and is advised because you get to see the small herd of deer, some very hungry Jacob's Sheep and a Highland Bull.
There is a cafe serving burgers etc. and plenty of places to keep washing your hands. You could spend a whole day here without any bother.
Great place highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Norman Sayers
recent_reviews.text:
Brilliant date night at Streamvale Open Farm with my wife and kids (adults) and their partners.
Would highly recommend this to anyone.

If I could recommend two things to Streamvale.
1. With it being date night you could have a photographer taking candid photos for free on your site and offer professional photo at a cost for specific animals. Just a thought.

2. Personally would have loved to sit on for a bite to eat after closing the animal activities at 9pm. If you moved the burger van to near the exit I think lots of people would sit on for a little while.

Hope that helps. We loved it and will be back again next year.

recent_reviews.author: Ayesha Iftikhar
recent_reviews.text:
Streamvale Farm Belfast Northern Ireland UK is really a good idea to spend a day out with family. Nature is at its best here. Barrel rides and tractor rides are very fantastic. Chicken and rabbit cuddles are pure love.
Kids love to spend time with farm animals. Lama, sheep, deer, donkeys, horses, goats and all the other animals are kept in their natural environment. Deer and sheep feeding is a next level experience. Whenever you find some time from your busy schedule do visit Streamvale Farm. Google maps will help you to go there.

recent_reviews.author: Cuddles 2506
recent_reviews.text:
Yesterday was 30 years since I  began our annual Easter Wed trip to Streanvale Farm,  with my youngest daughter not even born. We have carried the traditional passing on to our grandchildren.
Yesterday, I took my 3 children ADULT children on our Easter Wed trip, and we were NOT disappointed . There was so much to do and catch up with. We were in our element.
The child in each of us was evident from the chick's to the tracker ride to feed the deer to the nursery and much much more ending with gifts from the fantastic gift shop. No one was disappointed,  picnic in the garden and plenty of photos. Thank you for a fantastic day ğŸ’—

recent_reviews.author: ashley Stephens
recent_reviews.text:
Great value for money, and kids had lots of fun!!!!!

Visited Walby farm on a wet and windy day and have to say I was pleasantly surprised.

The reception staff were very welcoming and helped to explain where to find everything.

We didn't venture outside due to the weather but managed to fill hours of time.

The whole park was clean, including the indoor play areas.

The animals were very friendly and there were good hand washing facilities for when leaving the barn area.

The soft play is big enough for the kids to really burn off some energy, and the layout means that they can't disappear without getting past their parents.

The wooden indoor play area looked fairly new. It is very well designed and my kids tell me it was great fun, they'd just like more balls for the air blasters....

We had lunch here and it was actually very good! The kids' meals were large enough for bigger, more hungry kids.

recent_reviews.author: A â€œA.J.â€ Jack
recent_reviews.text:
Great for kids. Adults pay almost as much. Fun attractions, most of them at no extra costs. The barrel train behind the quad was a hit.
Tip:
Get one adult to accompany the kids and have a nap in the car.

recent_reviews.author: Invision Game Community
recent_reviews.text: Walby Park Farm is a fantastic day out for families, offering a wide range of activities that kept the children engaged all day. The only slight drawback was the lack of direct animal feeding opportunities, which are often a highlight at similar attractions. Overall, an excellent experience.

recent_reviews.author: kitties63
recent_reviews.text:
Excellent day out today.
Lots of experiences for everyone! Our children were3, 8, 11 and 14. They could all find things to enjoy!
Loved the goat race, ferret show, candy cannon, foam party and wildflower field. Weâ€™d love to return. The staff were all really friendly and happy to help.
Thank you for adding to our holiday memories!â¤ï¸

pumpkin_patches.address: Walby Farm Park, Walby, Crosby-on-Eden, Carlisle CA6 4QL

recent_reviews.author: Zabih â€œzâ€ Tasooji
recent_reviews.text:
Last year I was there with my family and friends.
Children were so happy and bought some pumpkin.
There was a lot of varieties colour and size pumpkin .
Really worth to spend time with your family.
Highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Minch
recent_reviews.text:
Good experience. Well organised event.

So many varieties, size , colour, shapes of pumpkin . ğŸƒğŸƒğŸƒğŸƒ

Sharing Halloween decorations and ghost rooms.

Fun activities for kids like pumpkin tunnel , ghost train , pumpkin house, metro go round etc

Washrooms available.

Two good c trucks serving coffee, hot chocolate,  chips, bacon .

You can choose whatever pumpkin you want.

Very good collection of Halloween stuff in the shop at exit .

Lot of photo booths for kids and family.

It was a sunny day , so we enjoyed a lot.

Note: donâ€™t go with actual google maps. The roads are closed. Get into the polo club within which the pumpkin R Us is there. Sign boards available.

Free parking.

Wish they had a pumpkin carving contest . ğŸƒ

Some information on pumpkin and Halloween would be great .

recent_reviews.author: Elizabeth
recent_reviews.text:
Beautifully presented and spacious ground with a variety of pumpkins and visual entertainment. It was more than expected. I liked that there were enough buggies and 2 sizes available. The larger one was able to sit 2 children as well as bags and pumpkins. The 3 year old enjoyed being pushed and pulling his selection of pumpkins.
Wellies are recommended. We took a packed lunch. However, there are refreshments available. The shop inside had a lovely variety of Halloween decor and treats to purchase. Will definitely visit again.

recent_reviews.author: Myfamilylifex
recent_reviews.text: First time visiting this year and did really enjoy this patch. Lots of different variety of pumpkin to choose from compared to other patches weâ€™ve visited. Was quite busy and muddy so itâ€™s a good idea to bring wellingtons. Plenty to see and appreciated all the different displays, one walkthrough which is completely dark and has clowns so be wary if you have young children but great that they separated this part off! Our pumpkin was big and only Â£5 which was good value. Toilets on site and plenty of picture opportunities. Some negative points would be the dramatic parking stewards who were shouting at people to park in the lines. We parked further up away from all of this and coped perfectly fine by ourselves finding a space. The next point is it all felt very money grabbing, there was a small selection of rides but Â£4 each for the bumper cars?? Absolutely ridiculous and we was shocked by the coffee prices Â£4 for a cappuccino!! We ended up leaving it as never heard of coffee so expensive! The Halloween shop had a lovely selection but the wreath we picked up was Â£55 and the signs all scattered round the shop saying â€˜ANYTHING BROKEN MUST BE PAID FORâ€™ was not necessary, I was scared to touch anything! Lastly the woman at the check out who had dark short hair with glasses was very rude and needs a lesson in customer service. She spoke to my partner in a condescending and passive aggressive tone when all he simply asked was how much the pumpkin was. Such a shame as she ruined it for us.

pumpkin_patches.address: Dallas Burston Polo Club, Southam CV47 2DL

recent_reviews.author: Bebeliana C
recent_reviews.text: Very good natural outdoor place for children and family. You can drive your car into the Pick Your Own (PYO) farm. Can just park next to the farm. There are several sections. We went there end of June. Itâ€™s perfect time for Cherry and strawberry picking! Sweet and juicy! They provide you a box for pick up and you can check out while you approach the exit! There is a big garden shop selling all related garden products and plants. The cafe inside the shop is amazing! After a sunny day itâ€™s super nice to enjoy an ice coffee/ smoothie or tasty ice cream Sunday!! Remember to book your ticket in advance. Price is calculated on how much you pick. Will definitely come back again!

recent_reviews.author: Chathu Fernando
recent_reviews.text:
Fruits are very tasty and itâ€™s a really nice place to visit. You can even drive your vehicle into the fruit-picking areas, which is very convenient. When we went, a lot of the fruit areas were closed, but we still had a good time. One thing to be aware of: the entrance ticket price (Â£10 for 4 people tickets) cannot be redeemed against the fruits you pick. Last year they allowed it, but this year they donâ€™t. Overall, still a good experience and worth visiting!
â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Claudio Iannella
recent_reviews.text: Highly recommend! Took my 15 month and she loved picked all the raspberries and plums. Fruit and vegetable picking all depends on what's available and we were lucky enough to pick: apples, blackberries, raspberries, plums, broccoli, onions, sweetcorn and sunflowersğŸŒ»

recent_reviews.author: Muhammed Shaistah Mustaqeem
recent_reviews.text: Great for a fun day out! You can pick your own fruit and veggies, look around the garden centre, and grab a bite in the cafÃ©. Itâ€™s clean, well-stocked, and easy to get around.

pumpkin_patches.address: Garson Farm PYO, Winterdown Rd, Esher KT10 8LS

pumpkin_patches.place_name: The Dunham Apple Festival (Formerly Dunham Pumpkins)

recent_reviews.author: Katherine Hancock
recent_reviews.text: We had a wonderful experience at Dunham Pumkin Patch! We visited on the second to last day of the season but there were still lots of pumpkins left in all shapes and sizes! The staff couldnâ€™t have been more helpful directing the cars and welcoming people to the patch. The pumpkins were really well priced and we love our display at home! The hot chocolate was yummy too! Thank you for a great morning ğŸƒğŸ§¡ğŸ‚

recent_reviews.author: Bernard C.
recent_reviews.text:
We had such a fantastic time at the field today, thanks for the hard work and what a season(storm and lots of rain!!)! The field is huge with lots of pumpkin ğŸƒ to pick, but to me, itâ€™s about the fun time with your family!

We read the complaints about car park being too muddy. It was indeed very muddy this morning, but it was not their fault and all the staff was extremely helpful, thanks for the boys for pushing my car out of the mud!

Yes, cars are getting stuck but letâ€™s just chill and have fun!

Everyone working there were very friendly and polite, lots of smile on their faces.

Will definitely come back next year!

recent_reviews.author: Jessica Mysiw-Hart
recent_reviews.text: A genuine pumpkin patch where you can grab a wheelbarrow and pick your own off the vines. It's now an annual tradition for us to come and take lots of photos while rooting out the best pumpkins. It is a little expensive for the pumpkins themselves, but you can get some good shapes and colours that aren't available in the supermarket. The best pumpkin patch in Dunham Massey!

recent_reviews.author: Helen Taylor
recent_reviews.text: A really fantastic day out! Tickets were really reasonably priced and you get a lot included: apple picking, tractor ride, bouncy pad. We loved the Apple character hunt too! All staff lovely and friendly. Great food and drink options including gluten free pizza!

pumpkin_patches.address: Sawpit St, Dunham Massey, Altrincham WA14 5SN

recent_reviews.author: Jess Carberry
recent_reviews.text:
My fella was working away this weekend
The weather was good, and I didnâ€™t want to take them to another grimy soft play
After a 25 mile round-trip, we made it
And it didnâ€™t disappoint
It was enjoyable and chilled and safe enough to solo parent there with both of my girls
All of the staff were really helpful, kind and considerate
Weather there were a lot of safe places to get out of the Sun with them lots of lovely food and lots of lovely activities for the kids. I wonder 2 to 3 hour time killer.
Definitely do more of these over the summer periods and maybe introduce things like bouncy Castle Inflatables pig races all of that sort of stuff, but we definitely still got our moneyâ€™s worth
Well done secrets

recent_reviews.author: hag
recent_reviews.text: Itâ€™s great to able to support local produce. Lovely to see lots of visitors despite narrow walkways in the shop. Fresh vegetables, fruits and olives bar my husband fav. Wld b great if u stock up more Swedish food. Lots of parking.

recent_reviews.author: Cheryl Hathaway
recent_reviews.text: PYO, Strawberries, rhubarb, herbs and chard. Fun day out for kids and adults alike. Highly recommend. Would also suggest signing up to their email for up to date events

recent_reviews.author: Rocky Odysseos-Beaumont
recent_reviews.text: First time going to secrets cafe Milford since the new owner took over! Beautiful set up of new tables, and the coffee was spectacular! Wonderful service too, very friendly staff which is always a win win from a local cafe. The coffee is speciality, tasted amazing and the latte art was perfect. Canâ€™t recommend enough, new localâ€¦ Iâ€™ll be back

pumpkin_patches.address: Chapel Ln, Hurst Farm Hurst Farm, Milford GU8 5HU

recent_reviews.author: Megan Stevens
recent_reviews.text:
What a beautiful day!
The sun shinning, people smiling and sunflower ğŸŒ» everywhere ğŸ’›

Loved the bubble station that was super fun, all the other kid activities were also so fun, we all had a good 30mins playing. The maze was great, lots of running around and hiding.

The Sunflowers ğŸŒ» were so beautiful, I loved all the photo opportunities with all the props they'd added in, I especially love the bath and panio.  I captured some stunning photos.

I do like how they have little choice of food, makes it easy to choose. A nice tasty hot dog with all the trimmings and they do a kids hot dog too, which went down well ğŸ˜€

Definitely come again for your pumpkins ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Vania F (Pringles)
recent_reviews.text: I've been to the Pop up farm a number of times, for Sunflowera, corn and pumpkins.  We always have a great time. The kids love picking their own and then going for a play on the hay. Great little spots for photos and a cafe with hotdogs, tea, ice cream. Toilet facilities and you can paint pots too.

recent_reviews.author: Holly Lawrence
recent_reviews.text:
Went for the Sunflower Picking back on Sunday 25th August. It was quite at the time we had booked and entry slot time of 4-5pm. You get 5 sun flowers per ticket and the kids loved it. They had hay bails for climbing/playing on and they have a cafÃ© serving food and drinks. Also lots of Photo opportunities.
Sun flowers opened up beautifully and lasted a full 2 weeks. Looking forward to when they open for Pumpkin picking now!

recent_reviews.author: E K
recent_reviews.text: We had a great time at The Pop Up farm. It is a family run farm which is absolutely amazing . The staff is super friendly and they are always willing to help . The sunflowers are gorgeous and we were able to pick 7 sunflowers. This enabled us to take some beautiful pics holding sunflowers . There is a small cafe there and the parking is spacious . It is an easily accessible place and I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to recommend it ..

pumpkin_patches.address: M1 Junction 9, Flamstead, St Albans AL3 8HT

recent_reviews.author: Jo-anne Mathieson
recent_reviews.text: We booked the Easter Baby Experience. We loved it. We held a chick each, stroked the ducklings and held a lamb, stroked more lambs. There was a little talk on all three, all in all, very friendly and a positive experience. Quick mooch to see the other animals, then coffee and cake, both delicious! We finished off in the farm shop, well stocked and far too tempting! We would recommend it to others and will be returning.

recent_reviews.author: sophie
recent_reviews.text: had a lovely time strawberry picking, we got a load of strawberries for only Â£5 which was great! we went on a Tuesday on a whim so it was rather quiet but i can imagine it being busy on the weekends so book your tickets in advance ğŸ“ overall a nice experience especially with the farm shop and cafe being right next door you can spend a whole day there.

recent_reviews.author: Sam Weir
recent_reviews.text: We come here once a year for cherry picking. Staff are friendly and helpful. There's a nice farm shop and cafe on site as well. Good value and amazing produce. Would recommend signing up to emails to get tickets the night before.

recent_reviews.author: John Harding
recent_reviews.text: Always a terrific experience, even when accused of bringing rain on my visits. This year has yielded gooseberries (for gooseberry and elderflower ice cream), and redcurrants (for redcurrant jelly - shown) both of which were highly successful. Then the old regulars - lots of raspberry and strawberry jam as shown. Iâ€™m always rather deflated when the season approaches its end.

pumpkin_patches.address: Beehive Ln, Great Baddow, Chelmsford CM2 8LX

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Dickinson
recent_reviews.text: Just brilliant. The first of many visits to this fabulous place. See you again shortly for the rest of them mulch bags.

recent_reviews.author: Gary Blundell
recent_reviews.text: Small but a good range of hanging plants with very reasonable prices.small ice cream shop good quality ğŸ‘Œ.

recent_reviews.author: Leigh Cartwright
recent_reviews.text: Really enjoyed this experience with the Children.  The prices were very reasonable, a large selection of pumpkins, plenty for the kids to do plus some nice food.

recent_reviews.author: Rob Chisholm
recent_reviews.text: Always have a great time here in October picking our pumpkins for Halloween.  There is also a farm shop open during the year.

pumpkin_patches.address: 79 Heatons Bridge Rd, Scarisbrick, Ormskirk L40 8JQ

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Hallifield
recent_reviews.text: Me and my partner love this place. The range of fruit and vegetables is amazing. They also have a butchers who has a great variety of meats from pork joints to beef steaks and their sausages are amazing and packed with lots of flavour. They also have an amazing variety of freshly baked breads that are baked in store and a huge variety of freshly baked cakes and pastries. Their deli counter has a variety of samosas and pasta bowls and my favourite Mediterranean Bruschetta. Their Cheese counter also has a variety of different cheeses from around the local area as well as from around the world. I would 100% recommend going to this place as they also have a pick your own fruit which I'm yet to go and do in the next few weeks.

recent_reviews.author: Chathura K
recent_reviews.text:
It's a family run Farm, Shop & Cafe situated on the beautiful Trent & Mersey Canal.  aim to use locally sourced ingredients wherever possible, and their own producrts in season. these are a big part of the meals that they offer in the Cafe.

Can buy lots of things  meat, chees , jam, bakery items, fresh fruits, etc.

Also , you can pick your own strawberries

recent_reviews.author: Igor Janik
recent_reviews.text: My first stop was the cafe to taste the breakfast which was on the higher price end but definitely worth it, golden yolk perfectly good eggs, a good portion for the full English breakfast, the coffee was lovely and the carrot and chocolate fudge cake was to die for, moist but most importantly well balanced and not too sweet! The farm shop was well stocked up with loads of home baked goodies to choose from.

recent_reviews.author: Jo Pittaway
recent_reviews.text: We had a birthday celebration afternoon tea today at The canal Farm cafe. I have to say it's one of the nicest ones I've had. Sandwiches, pastries, cakes and a huge scone was included along with 2 drinks of your choice from the hot drinks menu. To top off the amazing afternoon tea we had Amelia serving us. What an amazing member of staff she is, she had a smile on her face from the moment she welcomed us in and sat  us at our table, nothing was too much trouble. Amelia was so attentive and whatever was asked of her she did it with a can do, smiley attitude, a credit to her collegues and the cafe ğŸ‘

pumpkin_patches.address: Mill Ln, Great Haywood, Stafford ST18 0RQ

recent_reviews.author: John Sharman
recent_reviews.text: Very good farm shop with very good range of fruit and vegetables dairy products and its own butchers with great range of meats. Bread cakes ect .New cafe/restaurant has just opened . Inside and outside seating. good food and service all round .Have been using the farm shop for over 5 years love it. Also a range of tinned and dried products and beers ciders ect. Free parking and toilets

recent_reviews.author: Ryan Woodruff
recent_reviews.text:
First time here, we don't live locally, service was brilliant, food amazing, all very clean, tidy
Would highly recommend

recent_reviews.author: Bex Florence
recent_reviews.text: Second time we have done the pumpkin picking here. A lot of rotten pumpkins around. But very well decorated and well set up. The decorations were nice. A bit more interesting for younger kids. But we still all had fun.

recent_reviews.author: James
recent_reviews.text:
Good place to visit for Halloween with the family weâ€™ve turned it into a tradition. They have plenty of toilets to and the food is prepped and served fast.

However, we will not be returning next year unless they remove the entry fee per person. This year (2023) was not worth it, there was just nothing interesting, a complete lack of stuff to look at compared to previous years. I would visit if it was just the parking you pay but thatâ€™s as far as we go now. Â£20 entry to seeâ€¦nothing, dunno where all that money they are given goes and far less than last year. Big entry fee then to pay for the pumpkins etc just a shame really. Will be visiting else where now. Still nice to do once

pumpkin_patches.address: Sunnyfields Farm, Jacob's Gutter Ln, Totton, Southampton SO40 9FX

recent_reviews.author: Caroline
recent_reviews.text:
Just found this charming farm today. Lots of easy parking and electric charging points.

I had wonderful on site reared pork sausages in a lovely fresh bread roll for breakfast. I sat outside in the open air, covered restaurant. There is an inside restaurant too. The strawberry ğŸ“ smoothie was delicious and strawberries on the breakfast plates were a great touch!

Everything was clean and the service was exceptional!

Fruit picking, a duck/chicken area, lots for kids to do including a go cart area and snack shack.

The star of the show for me was the shop! I only got into the first section and bought Balsamic Vinegar, Tablet, Cake, Relish and Chocolate!

I will go back in a few days and look around the rest of the shop!

Thank you all. A real treat!

Caroline

recent_reviews.author: Mhairi Mushroom
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful fruit farm, farm shop, cafe, play area and of course, fruit picking, all at Charleton farm. The breakfast was delicious, lots of helpful staff, very varied menu, lovely deserts. Pick your own or buy from the shop. Very family/kid friendly and accessible.

recent_reviews.author: Viktorija Desiatnikova
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely loved it! Plenty very delicious strawberries! but also so much fun for kids to do! Definitely will be back again, highly recommend to visit with family â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Emz
recent_reviews.text: Stunning setting, super dog friendly and delicious food and drink. Every member of staff was lovely and helpful. Really can't recommend this place enough! Great place to bring kids too.

recent_reviews.author: Hayley Trunks
recent_reviews.text: We loved it here! The kids can hold guinea pigs and chicks as well as stroke rabbits, bottle feed lambs and hand feed sheep, goats and more. The play area is brilliant and the addition of tube slides, toboggans, jumping pillows, a climbing wall, water shoot out, ball gun fort, tractor ride and indoor soft play make this a great value day out. You can tell they've worked really hard to make this an attraction rather than 'just' a farm and as such it appeals to families much more. We went in the school summer holidays but it wasn't crowded and wait times were minimal. Well worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Kelvin Anderson
recent_reviews.text: Took our Newrly 2yr old Grandson. He loved it and tbf so did we. Its been at least 10yrs since we have been with our own kids. Loads to do and majority of things are free once you have paid you admission.  Will definitely return.

recent_reviews.author: Emma May
recent_reviews.text: My husband adopted me a highland cow for my birthday, I even got to meet and feed her! Happy bunny. Animals are well looked after lots of different animals you can interact with. Very clean. Lots of hand cleaning stations. Restaurant was lovely and food was nice too. Kids play park, tractor rides and other activities going on all day

recent_reviews.author: Lu A
recent_reviews.text:
TLDR: If you are in the area you should change your plans and go spend the day feeding and cuddling animals (It has a lot of well maintained areas for the kids to play as well) ğŸ˜ƒ
.................................
This place is amazing. I like feeding animals because it is very therapeutic. My husband comes with me ğŸ™‚

The place is not very big but it has a lot there. The space has been well thought out. There are a lot of play areas for the kids. There is a barrel ride - first time I have seen anything like that at one of these places. On the 'not seen it before' trail. I have never seen sheep racing. It is a short course and 2 x per day they race 4 difference sheep. So funny.

Animal feeding - the layout is circular which makes it nice and easy. All animals were very friendly.  They have 2 barns one has chicks in and the other has rabbits and guinea-pigs. You can go and sit in either barn and hold the animal for as long as you like. No queuing for a 2 minute hold and moving on. Never seen a set up like this before and think it's awesome.

A great day spent recharging batteries by feeding and cuddling animals.

Only negative is the cafe seemed a little over priced. They do have picnic tables if ya want to take ya own food though.

pumpkin_patches.address: Hall Hill Farm, Lanchester, Durham DH7 0TA

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Roby Mill Farm Shop (and Pumpkin Patch)

recent_reviews.author: Kathryn Sangster
recent_reviews.text: What a little gem this place is. We have been previously to pick Sunflowers so thought we would have our first go at pumpkin picking. The setup is well executed and all the staff are very very friendly. There were just too many pumpkins to choose from and the variety in shape and colour was amazing. Not sure who was more excited, me or our 3 year old. The price of the pumpkins are very reasonable, so much so we asked to round up our payment. Please dont think you're going to get Tesco prices, these pumpkins are far superior and the cost keeps these places going so you can have the experience. The stalls are worth a visit. I had the best pork pie I've ever had and the lady was so engaging with our little boy. The bakery stall serves delicious sweet treats which we indulged in. Overall, a brilliant morning spent getting muddy with plenty smiles. You have to give it a go and we will 100% be back next year!

recent_reviews.author: Little lili
recent_reviews.text:
Went Sunflower picking with the kids and we really enjoyed such a beautiful field.
Lovely staff and i did not struggle with parking. Price is reasonable.
Bought some cherry cake and it was delicious!

recent_reviews.author: Ems
recent_reviews.text:
This little, cute farm shop was amazing, selling a variety of vegetables, sauces, Halloween decorations, many different flavours of ice cream, and different types of eggs, seeds, fire wood, jars of jam and honey and such, and fruit for very good prices.

The pumpkin patch was also amazing! It was my very first pumpkin patch and I loved the variety of pumpkins they had as well as fun things that were set around the patch for everyone of all ages to do. The little shop they had for the pumpkin patch was also amazing with many different goodies, toffee and chocolate covered apples, knitted pumpkins with cinnamon sticks, and so on. Also, the pumpkins we chose were bought at a very good price as well. Definitely want to come back here again!

recent_reviews.author: Freya Starkey
recent_reviews.text: Haven't had the chance to visit the pumpkin patch yet but the farm shop was amazing :) Delicious ice cream, carrots in all different colours, quail eggs and duck eggs! A good range of whole spices. Overall a great little shop full of things often difficult to come by.

pumpkin_patches.address: Johnsons Farm, Lafford Ln, Up Holland, Skelmersdale WN8 0QY

recent_reviews.author: Jarvis Jarvis
recent_reviews.text: This is such a magical little place! We have had THE best day here! Everything is so hands on and the lamb feeding is such an experience for any age! Lots of gorgeous little animals to cuddle & hold including Toffee the baby guinea pig! We didn't want to leave! Plus the coffee is nice too ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Hill
recent_reviews.text:
Wow!! (Nothing else needs to be said)

We decided to have a day out at this farm as it was local to us, had lambs and there was a feeding session, I had no idea it was going to be so great.

Upon arrival we met the Farmers at the coffee station, they were extremely friendly and told us all about the farm. We bought coffeeâ€™s and animal food.

Once inside there is a lovely play area with seats to sit and watch your children. There are so many animals to see, my children were thrilled to be able to feed the animals too.

Facilities around the farm are very good with hand washing stations, toilets and a couple of play areas.

The lamb feeding session was the highlight of our trip and my two girls were chatting about it non-stop on the way home. Izzy and her assistant were so knowledgeable about the lambs, explaining where they are from and what will happen to them when they grow. They went through what would happen step by step. They not only fed the lambs but made their very own bottle up and go to handle the lambs at the end.

This is probably one of the best animal experiences we have had. We will definitely be back.

You can see how hard the staff have worked to get the farm open and how well the animals are looked after too.

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸ Five stars from us! The Hill family from Leeds.

recent_reviews.author: richard Taylor
recent_reviews.text: Found a real Gem. Came with the Mrs and thought we would be here for a hour, 3 hours later our hearts were full and our heads were clear. If you want to step off for a break in life I truly would recommend. Big shout out to Farmer Steve and Farmer Beth who did the lamb feeding they were amazing making sure everyone got one and one time with the lambs. All the staff were really friendly and made us feel really working, the place had a really personal vibe and we would recommend to everyone. Will we be back? Most definitely

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Dews
recent_reviews.text: We love it here. It's small and friendly, and not too many animals but it's perfect for children. We have just done the lamb feeding and it was amazing! It's an extra Â£3 on top of general admission, and well worth it. You can hold and stroke the lambs after feeding and it was absolutely amazing! Everyone there loved it. We bought some feed afterwards for the goats who are a comical and greedy bunch! The van where you pay also serves drinks and snacks, and there is seating outside. Since we last visited, there is a younger child's play area. Can't wait to go back!

recent_reviews.author: C W
recent_reviews.text: Our family had a great experience here. Highly organized and the staff members are very friendly! You only pay for the pumpkins you've picked up and take cash and/or card. Bring waterproof shoes as it can get muddy out there! Highly recommended for a family fun day out.

recent_reviews.author: Denise Wood
recent_reviews.text:
Had a wonderful morning with 4 children. Lovely welcome from all staff, well organised from parking, tractor ride to pumkin field. Food stalls to purchase lunch and barn with tables, seating, games and photo opportunities. Then off home for afternoon of pumkin decorating. Great experience and Will have great memories for myself and children for years to come. Thank you to all staff for making this day a special one.
Regards Mrs D Wood.

recent_reviews.author: Amez
recent_reviews.text: Had a great afternoon here. The weather being great certainly helped. Very affordable compared to other pumpkin patches and more to do. Food, face painting, shops and even owls to hold. Will visit again next year ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Larissa Brierley
recent_reviews.text: Busy opening weekend, be prepared for a queue, however this moves quickly due to constant flow of tractor/trailer rides. Organised with plenty of staff and volunteers. Food was well priced and pumpkins fields are abundant. Will visit again, suitable for all the family with free parking on site.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Pick Your Own Pumpkin Farington Moss

recent_reviews.author: Maksim Kiva
recent_reviews.text: Good place, big field for pumpkin hunt

pumpkin_patches.address: Moss Ln, Farington Moss, Leyland PR26 6QD

recent_reviews.author: Zoe Stock
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous pick your own pumpkin event! Only Â£5 entry with LOADS of activities included in the price. Face painting, bouncy castle, photo ops, tractor ride with info to learn about the cows and pumpkin painting.

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Brewis
recent_reviews.text: It was a pleasant place with lots to do for the kids .5 pound entry fee includes tractor rides, face paints and  bouncy castle .plenty of pumpkins too

recent_reviews.author: Ashley Grainger
recent_reviews.text: Visited the pumpkin patch, and activities  the past 2 years. Lovely family day out. We will be back next year.

recent_reviews.author: Diane Gimeno
recent_reviews.text: Was a fabulous morning - super activities and lovely photo opportunities! Will be back next year ğŸ¥°

recent_reviews.author: Kris
recent_reviews.text:
We visited Smithy Open Farm last month as a family, and it was a truly wonderful experience. The farm is well-kept and full of charm, and the animals are all very gentle and friendly â€” perfect for children to interact with. From calves and lambs to many other farm animals, you can really enjoy close-up encounters and even watch the process of milk production, which was fascinating to see.

There are plenty of activities for children and families, and feeding the animals is made easy with affordable feed available on-site. Itâ€™s both fun and educational, giving kids the chance to experience farm life in an authentic and enjoyable way.

One of the highlights for us was trying the farmâ€™s own freshly made yogurt â€” it was absolutely delicious and highly recommended!

Overall, itâ€™s a fantastic place for a family day out, especially with young children. Warm atmosphere, well-cared-for animals, and plenty to see and do â€” weâ€™ll definitely be coming back again.

recent_reviews.author: Jay Carson
recent_reviews.text: Really enjoyable family day out. Lots available for small children, from donkey and tractor rides to feeding the cows and other farm animals. Also being able to interact and hold baby lambs, baby goats, Emu's, Rabbits and chicks in pets corner. The specific animal based talks were really informative and the kids had chance to get a photo which was great. There are also a selection of parks for the children to enjoy and multiple shops were you can grab a coffee and locally produced ice cream which was delicious.

recent_reviews.author: Z Uddin
recent_reviews.text:
I visited Smithills Open Farm on Easter Sunday, and although it was extremely busy, it was still a great experience. The farm is very family-friendly, with plenty to doâ€”you can easily spend a couple of hours there exploring. Thereâ€™s a wide range of animals to see and interact with, and they also offer donkey and tractor rides for an additional cost. These were really popular, so expect a bit of a queue, especially on busy days.

Booking is online only, which helps manage entry but doesnâ€™t necessarily ease the crowds on public holidays. Throughout the day, there are several pet shows which are fun for both kids and adults. Each paying visitor gets a feed bag to interact with the animals, which adds to the hands-on experience.

The farm is well-staffed and really well maintained. There are multiple cafÃ©s and ice cream huts dotted around the site for when you need a break or a sweet treat. Near the entrance, thereâ€™s a farm shop that sells their own fresh flavoured milks, regular milk, cheesecakes, butter, and local honeyâ€”all farm-produced and worth checking out.

Iâ€™ll definitely be visiting again, though probably not on a public holiday next timeâ€”it was packed! That said, itâ€™s a brilliant day out for families and animal lovers alike.

recent_reviews.author: Anita Sharman
recent_reviews.text: Every single member of staff we encountered made this day super special! They were so warm and welcoming, all made an effort to educate us on the animals and help us to get as much from the experience as possible. We loved it! P.s weâ€™re still dreaming about the ice cream!

recent_reviews.author: David Nightingale
recent_reviews.text: We arrived without realising that we had booked the wrong week and that it wasnâ€™t half-term. Despite this, we were warmly welcomed. Noticing that the children were dressed in Halloween and pumpkin attire, we were allowed to see the animals and pick a pumpkin. The two ladies we met were lovely and made us feel very welcome despite our mistake, as did their granddaughter, Ellie. It was quite magical actually. Thank you, and we wish this event and the farm as a whole the best of luck for the future. We will be sure to book the correct dates for next year. Thank you! David, Adele, Olivia, and Harry

recent_reviews.author: John Greasley
recent_reviews.text: Great experience for the children watching twin lambs being born

recent_reviews.author: Steph L
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic family day out

pumpkin_patches.address: Stephney farm, Calder Bridge, Seascale CA20 1DQ

recent_reviews.author: Dean Fletcher
recent_reviews.text: Really good farm. I'm definitely worth a visit. Great for the kids! There are lots of animals to see along with some great large playgrounds! Plenty of activities for the little ones! There is also a huge indoor play area with food available. I'm terrible to sit down and eat! Would recommend a d great value for money in my opinion! ğŸ™Œ

recent_reviews.author: Theresa Cox
recent_reviews.text: The parking was really big and more than enough spaces. We pre paid online. The farm is fantastic, it's well set out and enough for all ages to enjoy. The animals are well looked After and the surroundings are well cared for.  Love the farm shop.  Definitely will be back again.  You could take your own food and leave it in your car until needed,  also cafe well laid out, clean and has a play area for. Kiddies.

recent_reviews.author: Nicola Taylor
recent_reviews.text:
Had an amazing day here. Loads to see
Very well set out
They do tractor rides and sheep and ferret racing at specific times.
There are various play areas for children of all ages, plenty of picnic benches so you can cater for yourself if you want to make the visit easier on your pocket. There is a reasonably priced restaurant and a burger van and cafe. Great farm shop.
Will definitely be returning ğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: Elisabeth
recent_reviews.text:
This place has been on my bucket list for such a long time. What a gem! I couldâ€™ve have walked around three times instead of twice. Visited with my teenage son and hubby. We all loved it. Staff are friendly. The lemon drizzle style ice cream was AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS ğŸ˜‹ The chips are delightful. The shop was great. But the highlight for us all was all the fabulous animals. Piglets, chickens, sheep, meerkats, alpacas, Guinea pigs, reptiles, cows, goats, reindeer. I could go on and on. The animal feed was cheap and loved by the sheep and cows.
I was disappointed that we couldnâ€™t get closer to the animals but it was still a fantastic day and I didnâ€™t want it to end.
The paths are well maintained. The animals look so happy and well looked after.
I was sad to leave, especially as weâ€™d not seen farmer Dave or Rob, but maybe next time as I will be back.

pumpkin_patches.address: Bark House Ln, Cawthorne, Barnsley S75 4AT

recent_reviews.author: Ryan Wellens
recent_reviews.text: A lovely farm, we go every Sunday for the ice cream and also been occasionally for the meat they sell. Lovely people and the kids can't get enough of the edible ice cream tubs.

recent_reviews.author: Shannon Mcgee
recent_reviews.text:
Had a wonderful day pumpkin picking.
Lovely people tasty fresh produce and lots of fun for the little ones

recent_reviews.author: Daniela Melisikova
recent_reviews.text: You can get everything there! Is very nice place. You can have quick coffe on the bench or delicious ice cream. And  cakes there you can't resist. I buy hay for guinea pigs there, they have a smaller size than bale. And the most important are the people who run the place. Thumbs up,  thank you for all your delicious and help

recent_reviews.author: Maggie Allen
recent_reviews.text: A really good setup. The quality and variety is good, the butchers is top notch. The lamb and steaks are lovely. Very friendly people running it. A gem of a place for reliable produce.

pumpkin_patches.address: The Narrowgate Farm Shop, Narrowgate Brow, Royton, Oldham OL2 6XU

recent_reviews.author: Seyi Oâ€™Shea
recent_reviews.text: The farm is decent with loads of fun activities for kids and adults. There are a few animals on the farm, but we only saw the Swans and ducks when we visited. The pumpkins are of good sizes, and the biggest ones are available at the till. There is hot food on site, i.e., burgers, chips, sausages etc. Also, there is a farm shop with fresh fruits and vegetables available for sale. Overall, a good day out for about 2 hours.

recent_reviews.author: Anne Dos
recent_reviews.text: fab place x we were able to enjoy the fun of picking our own pumpkins for halloween as well as have a little brew while kids play and the baby went on a donkey ride for the first time and loved it x

recent_reviews.author: harrison wadhams
recent_reviews.text: My family and I were visiting the area for a week, and the cottage in which we stayed, recommended this farm shop. Full of fresh fruit and veg, local honey, wide variety of jams plus all of your essentials. (Milk, butter, etc). The lady was very kind and attentive, and gave our daughter her own little trolley. Definitely made our roast dinner a success.

recent_reviews.author: Liz Hall
recent_reviews.text: Went pumpkin picking. Fun experience. They've added extra pumpkin parking which is very helpful. Parking is free. Good selection of pumpkins to pick in the field. This year they had carnival rides, ice cream van, donkey rides, and alpacas and a pony you could feed.

recent_reviews.author: Adam Mooney
recent_reviews.text: It's Been a long time since. IV met such genuine people. Really humble made me feel welcome

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Boughen
recent_reviews.text: Pumpkin picking 2023. Take wellies and a change of clothes, it gets super muddy even though you aren't getting pumpkins from a field as such. Pumpkin not included in the price (just an FYI) Very expensive (and muddy) fairground rides (Â£4 for 4 turns on a small inflatable slide) Â£4 for a can of pop from the bar! I don't know what I expected as never been pumpkin picking before but I was disappointed. The actual pumpkin part is quite cute but aside from that I wouldn't rush back next year. As a positive the singer was very good!

recent_reviews.author: A M DC
recent_reviews.text: My family and I went last sunday 15th. What a flipping disappointment!! Pay to get and pay for everything once you're in. Very small pumpkin area. Wouldn't recommend or return. Charging Â£8 for a small pumpkin, needless to say its a money trap. Very disappointed.

recent_reviews.author: Martin Patterson
recent_reviews.text: Drivers think it's OK to park in disabled bays.

pumpkin_patches.address: Lintz La, Newcastle upon Tyne NE16 6AS

recent_reviews.author: Derek Ward
recent_reviews.text: What a great day out for all the family. Nice place to just wander around and look and meet the animals. Nice restaurant on site, plenty to keep the young ones entertained.  Great play areas, the granddaughter loved her day out.

recent_reviews.author: Rakesh Acharya
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic experience â€” by far the best hands-on farm visit in the UK! The farm wasnâ€™t crowded, which made the visit even more enjoyable. There were plenty of activities for kids, including a fun tractor ride that they loved. The cafÃ© offered a great selection of warm, tasty food at very reasonable prices. Highly recommended for a family day out!

recent_reviews.author: Edmond S. L. Ho
recent_reviews.text: Great place for a family day! We book the ticket online and the car park is already quite busy at 10:30 on a Saturday morning. Plenty of things too do. There are lots of animals, playgound, trampoline, paddle go-kart and big slide.  There is a cafe as well but the queue was super long during lunchtime, glad that we prepared our pack lunch. The soft ice-cream there is quite tasty!

recent_reviews.author: David Hutchison
recent_reviews.text:
We came here with our young daughter, for young children who don't get to see farm animals very often, this is a great place to bring them, the animals are able to be fed and interacted with and as we were there during lambing, nothing was hidden away, with the expectant ewes giving birth in the petting barn, maybe not for everyone, but something that I feel is important for children to see and understand.

There are plenty of opportunities to pet and handle a lot of the animals, including goats, lambs, horses, mice, rats, rabbits and guinea pigs. And you can feed reindeer, and various other larger animals. We also got to handle the owls when we were there, which was a nice thing to be able to do.

There is plenty to do to fill a whole day, the cafe is reasonably priced and the food, while we didn't buy anything as we had our own picnic, looked great. There is a separate barn for picnics if this is more your thing.

Worth the money and a good day out.

recent_reviews.author: Oliver Singh
recent_reviews.text:
Beautiful and vibrant atmosphere. It's a lovely place to bring your family or you can enjoy here with friends.
Food options are enormous, and delicious too.
The staff is friendly and the service quality is exceptionally high.
The highlight of the venue is its energetic vibe, despite being a farmhouse atmosphere,  the place is vibrant, and one can also enjoy peaceful surroundings in case you want to avoid crowds, as they have ample seating.
Totally loved our visit.

recent_reviews.author: Ayesha Khan
recent_reviews.text: Delicious fruits, definitely the best cherries i have ever had! Probably better for fruit picking rather than buying fruit from their shop as i found some rotten fruit on the display. Toilet definitely not very clean, felt stuffy and stank of strawberries n pee and staff is more concerned about schooling their customers in the cafe rather than how clean the toilets are (were told by one staff member to sit on this particular table not that and had to change our place after we had settled thr, by another staff member not to eat anything we brought with us even after ordering from the cafe as well). The cafe food, on the pricey side, was delicious loved their cheesecake.

recent_reviews.author: padders
recent_reviews.text:
Went for lunch with my wife and my dog, went through to go sit on the balcony just through the shop only to be met with "you have to eat in the Canine Cafe". There was no clear signage on the door we went through to say there were no dogs allowed or where the Canine Cafe was situated.

Fully aware we had to sit outside as we had our dog, but did think we could go through to the balcony with the views.
We then found one really small sign stating where the Canine Cafe was. On another door that we didn't go through. See pictures.

The Canine Cafe feels like a bit of an afterthought, a few picnic benches, some fake grass and a view into the delivery yard of the of the Cafe.
Canine Cafe needs some shelter, I.E some brollies for a little shade would be lovely.

Overall 3 stars.

recent_reviews.author: Shakes Wang
recent_reviews.text:
Iâ€™ve been to this farm twice now, both times for fruit picking. The first visit was for strawberries, and the second was for plums, cherries, and even carrots. Every time I go, I make sure to stop at the farm restaurant for lunchâ€”itâ€™s honestly one of the best parts. Their beef burgers are amazing (I ordered them both times), super juicy and flavorful.

The orange juice is also a must-try. Itâ€™s so sweet and refreshing, without any sourness at all. We liked it so much that we bought a whole bottle on our first visit. Sadly, the machine was broken last time, so we couldnâ€™t get another one.

Getting there is a little tricky if you donâ€™t drive. The bus drops you off about a 15-minute walk away, and when we tried calling an Uber to head back to the city, no drivers were available even after waiting 20 minutes. So just keep that in mind.

Other than that, everything about this place is perfectâ€”Iâ€™ll definitely be back!

pumpkin_patches.address: West Craigie Farm, Queensferry, South Queensferry EH30 9AR

recent_reviews.author: G A (Improve My World)
recent_reviews.text: The restaurant is beautifully appointed. The people are wonderful, the service is excellent and the food is excellent, we had the steak and it was delicious. We had a three course meal which was unbelievable value for money. I will be going back very soon. Thank you so much for a wonderful meal and a wonderful evening. Would definitely recommend

recent_reviews.author: Rory Biggar
recent_reviews.text: Cycled here with my gran, lovely views on the way and hugely idyllic. Their homemade Gelato was incredible and I had to get a second serving from their wonderful staff. Couldn't think of much better to do on a sunny day!

recent_reviews.author: Heather Tyson
recent_reviews.text: Ernespie Farm is a must visit for us every time we are in Castle Douglas. Delicious cakes, clean softplay & one of the best outdoor play areas we've been to. Our little boy particularly likes the huge sand pit & the whole family enjoys the bouncy cushions! When we needed medical assistance from the staff this week they couldn't have been any better-helpful & kind, so thank you. We will definitely be visiting again!

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Ulyatt
recent_reviews.text:
Very friendly staff and well organised. A great farm park for our 5 year old and he enjoyed the soft play too. The combine harvester you could play on was a highlight!

It's a shame you're not allowed to bring a picnic as it ends up being an expensive day out of you have to buy lunch too.

pumpkin_patches.address: Old Military Rd, Castle Douglas DG7 3JG

recent_reviews.author: Alex Irvine
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing fun for all the family. The kids had a fantastic time picking ğŸƒ. The oldest got some recipes ğŸ¥§, from the farm shop. Lots of things for young and old to do. The family run event is definitely one for the ğŸ“†.
Hope they have the ğŸ¦€ ğŸ jam next yearğŸ˜ƒ.

recent_reviews.author: Iain W
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful visit to the farm today. Cattle were in fine form

recent_reviews.author: John Sievwright
recent_reviews.text: Tremendous. Ended up spending a fortune on pumpkins but the bairn had a blast. Great fun picking your own. Really nice people there and best marshmallows I've had!

recent_reviews.author: Greg Howie
recent_reviews.text: A little expensive but it's a great event every year, we've been coming for a good few years now and can imagine coming for many more yet

pumpkin_patches.address: South Ardbennie Farm, Madderty, Perthshire PH7 3PT

recent_reviews.author: Anna Goettel
recent_reviews.text: The pumpkin festival is amazing and staff is so friendly. All the decorations and attractions for the festival have been set up with so much attention to detail and you can feel the love that is being put into the festival. It was an absolutely fantastic day out!

recent_reviews.author: Tunde S.
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely place with wild range of pumpkins and photo opportunities. We'll organized event with guidance how to access to and from the farm, on the farm kinda map leading what spots to find. They worked hard to create many spots to entertain all ages.
Congratulations!

recent_reviews.author: Donna Paterson
recent_reviews.text: Great experience was had by our whole family, we all loved choosing our pumpkins and left with several of different colours and sizes. Lot's of other things to do, loved the hay maze and buying some craft gifts from the small shop. Parking was well organised, everyone was friendly and helpful and prices were very reasonable. I'd definitely recommend a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Kerryann Phillips
recent_reviews.text: After being to another pumpkin patch previous years I was absolutely amazed at kilduff Farm. Not only were everyone from parking attendants to attendants in the patch. They had a weight machine so gave you an idea of how much it would cost so no shocks when you go to pay. Kilduff also have photo props throughout the pumpkin patch. I really enjoyed that it was all in one area and place and not having to walk from field ro filed. Would highly recommend and will be back next year.

pumpkin_patches.address: Kilduff Farm Drem, North Berwick EH39 5BD

recent_reviews.author: Frazer Stephenson
recent_reviews.text: What an amazing wee place, I had the absolute time of my life here, such lovely staff so warm and welcoming. 100% would totally recommend doing this. Keep up the great great work, and we shall see you next year. Xxx

recent_reviews.author: Paul Finch
recent_reviews.text:
Not just a pumpkin patch.
Plenty of amazing family friendly games and experiences and some lovely food.
What a great experience

recent_reviews.author: Stickmin Playzz (StickminYT)
recent_reviews.text: A good place to but pumpkins, but there isn't just pumpkins! They have so many fun and kid-friendly attractions, like the train or the haybales! This place is a solid 9.4/10

recent_reviews.author: Christine Fletcher
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous afternoon wandering lost in a field of beautiful sunflowers followed by a truly scrumptious afternoon tea.

recent_reviews.author: lynn
recent_reviews.text: The sunflower trail was 10/10! so pretty and such a nice way to spend the morning . Plenty photo ops and nice places to sit and take it all in. Highland cows on the walk up to were a great addition. Only negative I would point out is the price of the food. I understand food and drinks are always more expensive in these places but Â£8 for a basic roll with 2 thin sausages and Â£12 for a burger with 1 slice of cheese on a bun with no other toppings is extortionate and there really is no justification in charging that. I would recommend taking your own food and drinks to avoid being robbed when youâ€™re there . Otherwise a lovely morning out enjoying the views.

recent_reviews.author: Craig Bull
recent_reviews.text:
Had an amazing day here for the Pumpkin Picking!!!

This is one of the best Iâ€™ve been to. Huge area. Very very well organised. Easy to get parked. Not overly expensive like other events like this can be.

There were loads of pumpkins and lots of different varieties and sizes. Some Iâ€™ve never seen before.

There was a great Halloween trail to go on which the kids loved. (My kids are 6 and 9)

There were food vans too (which again werenâ€™t that expensive)
Special shout out to the Wild at heart street food van. The cheesy beanos toastie was absolutely superb. Plus the service from you guys was great too. Friendly and welcoming. My son says the fries he got were the best he has ever had.

Would highly recommend this to anyone. We travelled over from Glasgow and it took about an hour and 20 mins. Was well worth the drive!!!!!

recent_reviews.author: Elaine Scott
recent_reviews.text:
An excellent day out today, grandchildren had a fantastic time.
So well laid out and organised.
Ladies making the bouquets were so talented my daughter was thrilled with her flowers.
Food vans offered a good selection of food which was delicious.

recent_reviews.author: Charne van Heerden
recent_reviews.text:
Gorgeous family visit to Balgone Estate to see the amazing sunflowers in full bloom! Parking was great and excellent communication and help from friendly staff. The Sunflower I picked is still blooming beautifully a week later. Highly recommend this experience ğŸŒ»
Dogs welcome!

recent_reviews.author: Nicola Hamilton
recent_reviews.text:
Have been visiting since March 2025 with my 1 year old and she absolutely loves the place.
Especially the play park equipment that is spread out across a large field. I love how the equipment suits different ages/stages. I also love getting to see the baby animals and it was so fun feeding the lambs and the piglets that are there just now are so cute! The animals all look happy and have plenty of space. My little one also loves the soft play area indoors and playing with the toys and books while we wait for food. Food is also great!
The only constructive thing Iâ€™d suggest is a wee update on the toys indoors. Great dolls house but no dolls. Not sure if the farm rely on toy donations for this area or not though. Iâ€™d happily donate old toys if they were accepted. My little one has since turned 2 and she now has her own membership too now.

recent_reviews.author: Claire McAughtry
recent_reviews.text: Great day out! There is much to do everything and has been really thoughtfully done. My toddler loved it! From swings, slides, bouncy pillows and things to climb, to a range of farm animals that you can see and feed, to the fun and educational tractors rides. I would highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: N. Hope
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic day out with my grandchildren at Briarlands. Safe, secure and so much to see and do!  They were running about all day, playing, exploring and interacting. Great place for their imagination.
