We went to the small animal petting area at the end of the day where the rabbits and guinea pigs were put on a boardwalk at a height for the children to feed them carrots and stroke them. I must say, all the children there were so lovely and well behaved, it was a really chilled, relaxed day. Thereâ€™s a shop, a cafe with great menu, a toddlerâ€™s jungle gym and a picnic area at the entrance/exit so all within easy reach no matter where you are in the park. Definitely going back!

recent_reviews.author: AMR
recent_reviews.text:
Greta place for a day out with kids and the family, so many activities for the kids to do for different ages. The cafe offered several options and many places to sit indoors and outdoors. Lots of animals to see and certain times to feed the small animals. Tractor ride was great too, the guide is very friendly and allows the kids to interact with them. Mazes were interesting, and the setup of the farm in general was nice.

Recommend to go early as it gets extremely busy

pumpkin_patches.address: Sat Nav follow, Blair Drummond, Stirling FK9 4UR

recent_reviews.author: Nikhil Reji Mathew
recent_reviews.text: Excellent experience and we did enjoy plucking strawberries and raspberries. Thereâ€™s a small childrenâ€™s area with trampolines, which everyone really seemed to enjoy. Never leave the farm without trying the ice cream made from fresh fruits grown right there. Thereâ€™s also a lovely shop that sells organic items. Overall a great experience. Please keep in mind that weekends can be busy  so it's better to plan accordingly. Thank you.

recent_reviews.author: Lorinda North
recent_reviews.text: We didnâ€™t end up staying here the night (BritStop) BUT we stopped in to pick our own fruit. The shop staff are friendly, the pick-your-own fruit is amazing quality and so much fun! There is plenty of parking here, lots of picnic tables and even trampolines and playground in the picnic space. Highly recommend stopping into this lovely spot either as part of your trip or for the night.

recent_reviews.author: Natalie Kiely
recent_reviews.text:
We have been a couple of times now.  The fruit picking is excellent with plenty to pick (though the strawberries have started to turn - highly recommend the raspberries!)

I love that they have a park for kids to play on and their very berry ice cream is recommended!

I personally believe that the prices for everything are very reasonable and it makes a good day out!

recent_reviews.author: Robin Tan
recent_reviews.text:
Fair prices, decent location.

Shopkeepers were friendly, and the strawberry picking experience was straightforward, simple, and honest. We had a lovely time and had no issues filling up our basket with sweet, juicy berries.

Would return again!

recent_reviews.author: A
recent_reviews.text: Had a great day visiting here with my two kids. They both loved feeding the animals and had good fun playing on all the kids play equipment.  Plenty to see and do. Didn't have any food as we brought packed lunches but we got ice cream and juice and bought stuff from the gift shop. The whole place is lovely, well kept and very reasonably priced. Staff were all lovely too. Would highly recommend coming ğŸ™‚

recent_reviews.author: Tom Raistrick
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant for the kids. Easily a day out. Expensive day out if yo'ure planning on eating here like we did. But you can bring your own picnic. Lots to do, many many animals that you can feed. We would definitely come back, 100%.

recent_reviews.author: Denise Williams
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous fun filled farm! the staff are so friendly, helpful and make you feel special. Exceptional value for money, the animals are so well looked after, their welfare is paramount! The food/drinks in the cafe is fabulous with a wide choice of yummy desserts! The cleanliness is exceptional throughout the cafe, farm park and toilets. The gift shop/toy shop has a wide selection of fantastic goodies! A visit to Dalscone Farm is highly recommended!

recent_reviews.author: Jolita Hoodless
recent_reviews.text:
Brilliant Farm Park!! We had such a lovely day and so much to do! We always loved Dalscone farm, but we went for the first time since outside play area has been revamped! Wow Dalscone Team! You've done such a great job and thought through everything! Animals are so well looked after and we were impressed with the new addition! Was clean and well stocked up! Icecreams were the best!!!
Such a good value for money! All the staff are so lovely and helpful.

recent_reviews.author: Chloe Gregory
recent_reviews.text: Weâ€™re up in Scotland visiting and came here and would 100% recommend coming here, so much for the kids to do for such good value. We spent a good 6 hours here and could of been here even longer. A good choice of food too. The only let down was needing coins for the vending machine for animal food but this is minor. We visited farm ness the day before which was a huge let down in comparison with its size and things to do. The staff were also super friendly and accommodating.

recent_reviews.author: julie little
recent_reviews.text: Such a wonderful place! We do not have kids but my Mom wanted to see some highland cows. We got to see them and much, much more- to include tons of babies!  The girl who gave us our tickets made sure we'd be able to see the cows up close with some extra treats, and at the end she gave me her own personal citronella to avoid the midges on the rest of my trip. That was beyond thoughtful and sweet!!! I could see taking kids here and spending the entire day. It is a wonderful adventure park with tons to do!

recent_reviews.author: Paul Mooney
recent_reviews.text: We visited yesterday for the first time and itâ€™s safe to say we will definitely be back . I have 5 children age range 4months to 10 years and can honestly say there is something for everyone including us adults. Big hits were the mini land rovers, feeding the animals, the soft play, mini golf and much more. We stayed from open to close and not once did i hear complaints of boredom from any of the kids. We were lucky enough to catch good weather but im positive even on a rainy day with wellies and puddlesuits the same fun would be had. The staff were lovely and nothing was a trouble, food was 10 of 10! We had a fab day! See yous again soon :)

recent_reviews.author: Anne-Marie Copely
recent_reviews.text: We really enjoyed our day at Wynford Farm Park. The highlight of our visit was the farm safari trailer ride. The ranger was really knowledgeable and made the trip fun and interesting. My young grandson loves Wynford Farm Park. There is so much to do he brushed guinea pigs during the fluffy animals session, he fed the Koi carp, held an iguana and cleaned a tortoise. There are plenty of indoor and outdoor play areas to keep the children entertained. The restaurant serves good quality food which is delicious. We found all the staff were friendly and polite.

recent_reviews.author: Kevin McAuley
recent_reviews.text:
I recently had a family day out to visit the family park and everyone loved it.

The train ride was the highlight for our wee ones. Seeing the animals and being able to feed them was great and then having a walk around was lovely. The upstairs of the main barn is a great fun area for the kids to run around in.

The only reason I took a star off is our kids are quite young and it has several large slides in the play barn that are unsupervised, so worried they might just fall down one accidently whilst running around.

recent_reviews.author: Klaudia R
recent_reviews.text: Well worth visit. This place will entertain your child (and your inner child) from the start till the end. From animals experience, trough train rides, hay castle, water play, amazing slides, sand play, go karts, mini golf and lovely walks around the place. Staff helpful and friendly, taking great care of all facilities. Toilets clean, animals happy, picnic places provided. Pushchair friendly. Highly recommend for a nice day out ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Lisa D08
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant day out with the kids! Animals are beautiful and the park has lots of fun things for the kids to do! Buy tickets in advance as it's cheaper than on the door and lots of places to eat a packed lunch too!

recent_reviews.author: Salman Anwar
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely place for kids and adults day out. Lots of fun activities to do.
Good parking space and facilities for toilets and sinks to wash hands after you feed the animals.

pumpkin_patches.address: Clyde Valley Family Park Crossford, by, Carluke ML8 5NJ

recent_reviews.author: Claire Neill
recent_reviews.text: Such a welcome stopping place. We were running late for the ferry and they made us amazing sandwiches to go. No fuss and just really tasty food in a very nice shop.

recent_reviews.author: Elaine
recent_reviews.text:
Bought two bags of Ayrshire potatoes and a bunch of spring onion. Â£10.30, on the Tuesday, one for my Mum the other for myself.
Went to have them on the Thursday and they were rotten the smell was really bad. Mums were the same. If it wasnâ€™t as far I would have taken them back to show them.
Very disappointing.

recent_reviews.author: Matthew Paton
recent_reviews.text:
My wife and I popped into Dowhill farm shop ( Sunday 20th July 2025 ) on our way
home to Cumnock.
We like the previous review customer  decided to buy Ayrshire potatoes ğŸ¥”,but
unlike Elaine we went to use them the next day ( Monday 21st July 2025 ) only to find
that we also had a bag full of rotten Ayrshire potatoes ğŸ¥”.
WILL DOWHILL FARM SHOP PAY MY PETROL MONEY, IF I RETURN THE ROTTEN
POTATOES?

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Neilson-Bell
recent_reviews.text: My husband and I had so much fun here pumpkin picking! It's the cutest farm with so much love and effort put in by the staff to make it a fun experience :)

recent_reviews.author: Kyle Manikowski
recent_reviews.text:
Found this place while falling in love with Scotland - Recommended Road trip stop, Beautiful fields of yellow in every direction - Nearby Historic Village, and Maggieâ€™s Wall for those into Witchcraft/and or unique history.

Fresh Baked Goods
A mix of Local Quality Scottish Cheeses
Were my highlights while there.

Met one of the owners, she provided a nice history of the area, and insights into the family farming operations.

Well worth visiting!

Meant to share this review over a year ago, loved it enough to still share it now!

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Johnston
recent_reviews.text: Great food and great views with a nice atmosphere both tables and comfy lounge chairs. Breakfasts are particularly good. Staff were warm and friendly. Prices are ok. Nice gift shop with Scottish crafts. Lots of parking. Farm tracks for about a mile off the main road but partly gritted.

recent_reviews.author: Hussain Alhinyami
recent_reviews.text: A beautiful and peaceful farm experience! The service was lovely, the atmosphere was so welcoming, and itâ€™s truly a family-friendly place. We enjoyed picking fresh berries and spending time in nature. Highly recommended for a relaxing and fun outing!"

recent_reviews.author: Gill Wilson
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little place in the country. Had a nice bit of soup for lunch but not much vegan options. Service is slow so don't be in a rush. Staff were lovely.

recent_reviews.author: Nicole Mason-Rawle
recent_reviews.text: This was a great day out! Our 3 year old lad had so much fun meeting all the animals. He always wants to feed them as well which was perfect at hillview. We bought food when we entered and could also buy food in the enclosures for those that needed special food. He had so much fun and we even met the piggies! The staff were so friendly and kind, they answered our questions and provided lots of information about the animals. Jack fell in love with coco the sheep who we found out is famous as she appeared on this morning!  Iâ€™ve attached photos, but if youâ€™re looking for something to do with your little ones and they love animals this is the place for you! They have toilets which were clean! Picnic area and lots of animals to meet. They also have a small shop which was such good value. Thanks so much for a good experience! We also managed to get a pram around too with our 11month old. The donkeys seemed to love him and has a good old sniff when we saw them! They were very gentle!

recent_reviews.author: Loredana Ioana
recent_reviews.text: We were in Fife looking for a fun outdoor activity, and this little animal farm turned out to be a lovely choice. Itâ€™s not a huge place, so we spent about an hour there, but the experience was totally worth it. Feeding the animals was a wholesome and funny momentâ€”especially the llamas, who definitely kept us entertained! Most of the animals were mainly interested in the food (understandably!), and some were a bit shy, which made the interactions feel more natural and unscripted. The area itself is beautiful, so combining the visit with a walk around makes for a great day out in nature.

recent_reviews.author: Cate Patterson
recent_reviews.text: First time visiting with my children and they had a blast, plenty of animals to feed and pet. They especially enjoyed the chicks at the end. The staff were great, were very friendly and engaging. The girls enjoyed talking with a gentlemen that happily answered all their questions about the chicks and the various animals within the park. They have a great set up with picnic benches where we had a bit of lunch in between activities.Will make a point of coming back.

recent_reviews.author: andrew barker
recent_reviews.text: Really great family day out with lots of animals and activities. Very reasonable pricing and even got the chance to handle the pigs which was a bonus. The staff team were friendly, informative and made the experience even better. We will be back

recent_reviews.author: Gemma Birch
recent_reviews.text:
First time visiting this family park. It was great for adults and Children. The train was so much fun and the train driver was very knowledgeable about the animals around the park.
The play park and the fortress was a great addition to the park.
Feeding the animals was fun.
The cafe had an extensive menu with hot food, sandwiches, ciabattas and a good kids menu. Prices were reasonable and staff very friendly.
The shop was just a nice size and not too expensive. Would highly recommend this for some family fun.

recent_reviews.author: Pan Yaso
recent_reviews.text: Nice for family activities. I went there alone , the entry price a bit expensive Â£19 . They have highland cows which is lovely included others kind of animals highly recommend if you have a car . I took x7 bus from princess street and then walk 10-12 mins . If you have a kid, itâ€™s a good idea to take them there so they can have experiences lots of activity days for children

recent_reviews.author: Shirley Porter
recent_reviews.text: We visited as a family of 6, ranging in age from 2-70. The park was suitable for everybody to visit. We went for refreshments (overpriced) in a nice cafe onsite. We went on the train round the park, which was good fun and informative.  We fed the animals, who are quite tame and interested in people (lovely). We used the trampoline, soft play, go-carts, log swing, sand pit, family bikes, musical forest, big chair and gift shop. The weather was nice and the overall day was very enjoyable

recent_reviews.author: Nic Saunders
recent_reviews.text: Loads to do and once in all was included (trains, go carts) small charge for animal feed (Â£1) but one cup per child lasted all day. Loads of places to sit and eat as well as the cafe on site. We spent almost 4.5hours here and could have done more. Ideal for families with kids (mine are 2 and 6).

pumpkin_patches.address: East Links Family Park, Dunbar EH42 1XF

recent_reviews.author: Steve Brooks
recent_reviews.text:
We attended as 2 adults and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

The small park is well laid out, well marked and an easy walk to see the animals.

The animals are well cared for with the highlight of seeing Hairy Coos on our Scottish adventure.

recent_reviews.author: Lisa Taylor
recent_reviews.text:
This was my second weekend in a row here, as we just discovered it and loved it so much. It's not as big, busy or as expensive as Heads of Ayr, and a bit fancier than Barnhill. Perfect for toddlers, and very tidy.
We ate in the Tea Room the first time round, and it was ok. The wee cafe in the indoor play bit was just as good and offered vegan alternatives - including wee chocolates.
Definitely worth a visit, or even splashing out on their affordable 6 month pass!

recent_reviews.author: Rosangela
recent_reviews.text: My favorite place. Family atmosphere, polite and kind staff, suitable place for families. There is a part where if you pay Â£7 you can see the animals and there is a park and walk around the farm.Outside there are almost always some animals to see. There are some products for sale and a great place to have a coffee. Reoxmendo

recent_reviews.author: LM
recent_reviews.text:
Been here many times and we always make a day out of it, plenty of things to do with the children.
The indoor play area is the main reason we come as itâ€™s the best weâ€™ve ever been to.
Thereâ€™s a giant inflatable pillow and small cars for the kids to play on. There is also a wooded area with a sand pit and some climbing frames with slides. Thereâ€™s also pedal carts for bigger kids.
There are lots of animals at Montyâ€™s - Thereâ€™s donkeys, pigs, goats, alpacas, sheep, chickens and ducks. They sell bags of feed for the animals so you can get that experience too.
Thereâ€™s also a restaurant inside aswell as a picnic area outside.

recent_reviews.author: Stephen McConnachie
recent_reviews.text: We have went here for the last few years and will keep coming back. Staff are very friendly and helpful and the kids love it.

recent_reviews.author: Richard Long
recent_reviews.text: They sell pumpkins but you have to pay Â£7 plus booking fee for a ticket to park your car in a muddy car park and then you pay for anything that you buy including any pumpkins, food or drinks. Also, a lot of the pumpkins were rottten from lying out. Pumpkins and snack bar were expensive. Don't think we will go back as you don't get much for your money

recent_reviews.author: Ar R Charles
recent_reviews.text: Very nice place

recent_reviews.author: Bill J
recent_reviews.text:
We stumbled upon this place whilst passing by and wished we'd had more time to spare. We drove in past the fresh donut and coffee stand and had to stop. The donuts were delicious and freshly made to order.  We drove further in and found the dairy selling fresh milk and shakes as well as homemade ice cream. We decided on a shake to go with the donuts, again very nice. They also sold homemade corned beef pasties so we took them home for later. Lots of friendly chickens
meeting the crowd and access to a dog walk that's private if you pre book. It's currently sunflower season and you can pick your own for Â£1 a stem. Well worth the visit.

recent_reviews.author: liam parry
recent_reviews.text: I go to the dog field alot its really good lovely and big for my dogs to have a proper good run around. Also I normaly grab a milkshake that are always banging. Only thing with the field is that there's not much to do in there it would make the field so much better if there was agility stuff there.

recent_reviews.author: James
recent_reviews.text:
We booked in for the Pumpkin experience and an experience it certainly was.
We had a great time, the parking was well organised and orchestrated by a young man as we entered the farm. There had been heavy rain the night before, so we were well prepared with our wellies and wetsuits. The atmosphere created by the staff was really good, especially the people working at the pumpkin kiosk on the field. All the props and food areas were decorated with great imagination but at the same time kept the farm vibes.
The conditions were challenging if you were one of the unfortunate few who had forgotten your wellies. My kids absolutely loved the mud and the challenges it presented us.
The cafe had a pizza stall and served goods that are made at the farm, milkshakes, etc. The coffee was good, and the price was what I would expect to pay at a family attraction like this. We payed 12 quid for 2 large pumpkins, which is obviously overpriced, but to be honest, it was worth it just for the day out and memories.
Will definitely be back next Halloween.

recent_reviews.author: Erasmus In Cardiff
recent_reviews.text: A wonderful experience after a big disappointment at a Cardiff sunflower field. Pencoed Fach is beautifully maintained, lots of small children activities, friendly staff, lovely dairy and overall a fantastic vibe. Gorgeous sunflowers this year, such a pleasure to visit you!

pumpkin_patches.address: Heol Y Cefn, Bedwellty Rd, Blackwood NP12 0BQ

recent_reviews.author: sonnie browning
recent_reviews.text:
Always drive past this place but finally decided to drive in and have a look. The milkshake section you do yourself, which was fun and prices are decent for the amount you're getting, let's not forget that it's all fresh! We had 3 different flavours, the nutty one was subtle but the other two were much stronger and really good!

There's also a farm shop which has a lot of fresh food on sale, all sorts too. It's definitely worth taking a look. We bought some large duck eggs which look good. The owners are big supporters in a few charities, which is lovely, Morgans army being one.

Give them a visit and support local businesses ğŸ„

recent_reviews.author: Aimee Hopkins
recent_reviews.text: Organised parking on arrival which helps a lot during peak times. A huge array of pumpkins to choose from on the fields. Farm shop has a large selection of locally grown produce, and a few nice cakes too! The milk vending machine is also a must.

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Jones
recent_reviews.text: Our first time here today pumpkin picking lovely muddy experience and to finish off on site fresh milkshakes machine will definitely return

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Briggs
recent_reviews.text: Bit expensive but worth it for the outstanding produce they sell. Their duck and hen eggs are amazing.  Love seeing the ducks, hens just roaming around the farm and the gorgeous cows in the shed. They could do with a cafÃ© but guess space is an issue.  They have lots of gluten free products too which is a bonus in our household.

recent_reviews.author: Paul Evans
recent_reviews.text: What a wonderful place to have food. I will say that the food was amazing. The service by a young gentleman Neo was excellent. In fact I will say all the staff were great and very helpful, from the supervisor who was looking after the front of house customers and also the restaurant manager. The chef and his team are presenting you with some great looking food, but not only is the presentation fantastic, but the quality of the food was second to none. The way the food was cooked was just perfection, and I will say we had a lovely evening with quality products and service with a lovely Welsh lager as well. All the food and drink products are locally produced and bought. This place is well worth a visit to have a wonderful meal and to be honest it is excellent value. 100% we shall go back again.

recent_reviews.author: Cymru Jon
recent_reviews.text: A wet Thursday lunchtime and the restaurant at Forage is as busy as ever, what a success story this place has been! The emphasis on local produce, a talented kitchen team and good service is a winning combination. We tried a spring salad and an open mushroom sandwich and both were excellent. Not the cheapest place, but a lovely spot for a quality lunch with views.

recent_reviews.author: John Kinchin
recent_reviews.text:
Close to Cowbridge this farm shop is a little gem. A decent play park for the kids nestled amongst plenty of picnic tables.
You can get  breakfast/lunch or just a coffee and a cake. Plenty to see/ buy in the artisan farm shop and a nice butchers too.

recent_reviews.author: Viv
recent_reviews.text:
Great local farm shop find on our way out of Wales. Food and drink choice were great with lots of hyperlocal produce.

Lots of staff on the floor but could never get the attention of anyone as they were all gathered by the tills. Staff were polite but did not seem to have the right training.

We were given an old menu so we ordered the lamb main and got given the lamb starter. If the staff member had noticed this when we ordered then it would have avoided the issue of the wrong dish being served. We then had to wait for a new main course for my husband which didn't come until after I'd finished my food. Staff could have managed this better and offered for both dishes to come out at the same time or for him to have the starter whilst he was waiting. Condiments were also not offered though they did have a good selection of Stokes sauces.

Would definitely visit again though as the farm shop and outdoor area were nice too.

pumpkin_patches.address: Penllyn Estate Farm Llwynhelig, Cowbridge CF71 7FF

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Windsor Farm and Pumpkin Patch ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Thom James
recent_reviews.text: Windsor Farm was good last year (2020) but this year, itâ€™s stepped it up a little more. One way circular driving helps to keep the flow of cars coming in and out much better, though do take care on the new exit road as itâ€™s bumpy. The selection of pumpkins is great, the addition of a coffee and drinks truck is great, especially in the cold and the guys there staffing it all are brilliant.

recent_reviews.author: Myles Thomas
recent_reviews.text: Very organised Pumpkin farm! Really enjoyed our time here! Nice touch having a barn cafe open too!

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Holborow
recent_reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Horseshoe Hut. What a hidden little gem in the heart of Pembrokeshire! Peaceful and tranquil with elegance and luxury. The hosts were equally as friendly and weâ€™ll definitely be coming back again in the future!

recent_reviews.author: joshua madden
recent_reviews.text: Great experience. Will definitely be back next year. Staff are very welcoming and helpful. And the pumpkins are fairly priced.

recent_reviews.author: Conor N
recent_reviews.text:
We visited green acres twice on our visit to pendine and if we weren't pressed for time would have visited a third! The farm shop is wonderful and it's so nice to see local produce on display. You can tell how much work has gone into the shop and id absolutely recommend a visit! We brought cheesecake, mayo and bacon jam. Ran by some absolutely lovely people who work tirelessly, we didn't get a chance to do any strawberry picking or grab some elephant garlic but we'll be making a return visit next year, just because we enjoyed the shop so much!

We also stopped for a bacon cheeseburger and a cream tea both of which were delicious. Can't wait to visit again!

recent_reviews.author: Becky Smith
recent_reviews.text:
Was absolutely lovely, plenty of pumpkins to pick from! The little
touches of the spooky house and the marshmallow toasting was absolutely amazing!!! A lovely area for kids to colour and parents to have a coffee! They've thought of everything! Our family of 5 absolutely loved our day out!!

recent_reviews.author: Rachel O'Gorman
recent_reviews.text: Bit of a hidden gem! Delicious food from the little cafe (we had bacon cheeseburgers) followed by strawberry picking and a mooch around the shop. Strawberries were absolutely delicious. Nice vending machines with local produce out the front - meat, eggs, butter, desserts, fresh milk..... wish we had this at home! Worth a stop if you are in the area.

recent_reviews.author: Mike Robinson
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic toddler friendly strawberry picking (no nettles or thorn bushes.) Very good choice of fresh produce and local goods. I would recommend ğŸ‘

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Bellis Brothers Farm Shop and Garden Centre

recent_reviews.author: Keith Vernon
recent_reviews.text: Many thanks to Adrian and Laura. Bought a load of strawberry and raspberry for jam making this afternoon. Great quality fruit. Good solution to our little problem.

recent_reviews.author: Elizabeth Jamieson
recent_reviews.text: Pleasant garden centre with lots of room to walk around.  The butchers here are superb, great quality meats and value for money alongside the farm shop fruit and vegetables. However, the gift shop is totally overpriced, which is such a shame. I have seen exactly the samel items.much cheaper in other shops ( Â£5/Â£10 cheaper which is outrageous) Cafe food is good but again cakes in particular are overpriced compared to other outlets. It would be nice to have a separate outdoor .cafe area for well behaved dogs.

recent_reviews.author: Faithbop1
recent_reviews.text:
Great morning out, strawberries where delicious and smelt as good as they looked.
Lovely garden centre with a variety of fresh produce, butchers and fresh fruit. Great verity of plants and flowers. Lovely ground for the children to run around in with a small climbing frame. We visit every year

recent_reviews.author: Jackie Towner
recent_reviews.text:
Had Sunday dinner and was not disappointed.
Lovely fresh food.
Service great.
Plenty of variety of outdoor plants and good selection of pots.
The deli section has great selection of home made pies, sausage rolls etc and the shop sells a good choice of food stuffs. Small area selling nice choice of clothes with changing rooms.
Well worth a visit if only for Sunday dinner.

pumpkin_patches.address: Road Farm, Wrexham Rd, Holt, Wrexham LL13 9YU

recent_reviews.author: Joanne Bretherton
recent_reviews.text: Called here today as desperate for a very quick pit stop between Swansea and York. Small dark shop and nothing else. Bought some meats that we didnâ€™t actually need from the shop to justify the stop and usage of loo, then wanted to walk for a few mins so the two dogs that had been in the car for several hours could stretch their legs. Literally two minutes is all we needed for the dogs and said to the woman who approached us. Incredibly rude woman effectively marched us back to the car. There is a way to approach and speak to customers that doesnâ€™t necessitate being so impolite. I was stunned. Then to add insult to the experience, got home to find the sausages Iâ€™d bought were significantly out of date - almost 3 weeks. They were partially frozen which I was confused at, but now makes sense. See photo. There are no words really except avoid. Thankfully found a much more welcoming spot a little further up the road.

recent_reviews.author: James Walters
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little shop, exactly what you'd expect of a proper local farm shop. Great to see them stocking organic products. All the regular fruit and veg, lots of herbs and spices, pasta, rice, meat, pies, and lots more.

recent_reviews.author: Katherine Satoor
recent_reviews.text: Thank you for the lovely welcome you gave us and the nine children we brought along to pick pumpkins today. We had a lovely day. The owners and staff went out of their way to look after us, looking after our picnic while we went around the maze and pumpkin fields so we didnâ€™t have to carry it, finding us some little tables and chairs inside for our picnic, noticing that one of our children was frightened of the blow up pumpkin and deflating it for us, offering to bring our hot drinks over for us etc, etc. We have sung your praises to all our childminding parents who have said they will visit and we will definitely be back next year. There were so many different types of pumpkinsâ€¦.really pretty and tactile. We have bought lots for our children to touch, hold and explore at our setting Thank you xx

recent_reviews.author: Emma Pierce
recent_reviews.text: Lovely pumpkin patch with loads of pumpkins to pick. Free use of carts to carry pumpkins in. Bouncy castle and tea cups over the road. Spent around 2 hours there in total. Wellies are a must!

recent_reviews.author: Amy Proctor
recent_reviews.text: Had a very good few hours out here, beat our expectations to what we thought it was going to be like, being a working farm. Laura was an amazing host showing us around, passionate about what they do, and the love for the animals can clearly be seen in how well the animals look. Whilst we went purely to meet the beautiful Highlands, those goats are just the cutest. Will definitely return

recent_reviews.author: Cameron Edwards
recent_reviews.text:
Great little weekend experience. We did the Highland cow experience on a Saturday afternoon slot, the highland cows are beautfiul and Laura was a super lovely and friendly host and we felt really comfortable touring the farm with just her ( and Dip the collie who got most of our attention ). Even snagged some fresh sausage and bacon from the farm shop at the end. Would definitely come back and see the farm for other events they may host in the future and to see how highland calfs are getting on!! ğŸ˜ŠğŸ®ğŸšœ

Thanks again Laura and Matt

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Spencer
recent_reviews.text:
We visited the farm today to use our farm experience present the children had for Christmasâ€¦.we live just across the road from the farm and it was lovely to come somewhere local to experience the way of a farm. I have a farming mad son so he was really looking forward to thisâ€¦.

Laura, the owner/host for the experience was absolutely lovely, very knowledgeable and great with the kids tooâ€¦.she explained what we were going to do and made it exciting for the kidsâ€¦..we got to feed the goats and kids, highland cows, lambs, pigs and piglets, calves and mucked out and put new hay down, swept the yard and then got to walk out peanut the pony down to the fieldâ€¦..it was such a lovely few hours and the kids absolutely loved itâ€¦.would recommend it so much for the kids, especially for those kids who are interested in farming  and the way a farm worksâ€¦.thank you so much to Laura (Jacks already asked if he can come back tomorrow ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚)

recent_reviews.author: Michelle Ballard
recent_reviews.text: What a lovely experience feeding the highland cows and getting to meet their calves. Laura the host was knowledgeable and very friendly throughout. Bonus getting to feed the sheep and goats too.

pumpkin_patches.address: Lower House Farm, Llanvair-Discoed, Chepstow NP16 6LX

recent_reviews.author: Marie Lloyd
recent_reviews.text: We went yesterday with my two grandchildren. The experience from beginning to end was excellent. It was amazing when all the lambs came bouncing in.. Trying to get first dibs on a bottle of milk. I have been to similar events elsewhere but this was far the best. Will definitely return. The owners were so relaxed and stayed with us to answer any questions. Again... Amazing.

recent_reviews.author: Su Thomas
recent_reviews.text: Whilst it's a wonderful experience for children we are an adult couple a d loved it. Ian, Jack, Tom and the girls were great with us and chatted about the lambs and the farm. We were given a little safety talk first then shown how to feed a lamb (very simple, they are greedy for their bottle) then in came the lambs and found a person with a bottle within seconds. Then we were allowed to have a lamb on our lap and lastly led through to wash our hands in their newly constructed wash area. A lovely experience and a great price too. Totally recommend it.

recent_reviews.author: Sam
recent_reviews.text:
I had a wonderful morning at Berry Hill Farm Gwent. A new lamb had just been born as we got there and we watched as the mama sheep cleaned her baby and bonded in her gentle way of nudging and talking to her child. It was just wonderful to see and the guys and girls at the farm explained all about the process and the markings on the sheep. One of the new mamas had triplets and she was fetched up to them in her pen quite content.
After all the health and safety hygiene protocols was gone through to protect both animals and people from germs, the friendly folk allowed us into the feeding pen. We sat on bales of hay while the babies were released and they were so excited and came straight up to seek a feeding bottle. We sat for about an hour feeding and playing with the lambs who all had different personalities and markings. Dave and Dotty for me stole the show and Spike and Gizmo made sure to greet everyone. A lovely experience for adults and children, we were allowed to hold the lambs and children were picking up their favourites for cuddles. After an hour the lambs needed their naps ready for their next feeding. The farm is easy to find, has parking is well maintained and run by a lively family who really care for their animals and land. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience and highly recommend a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Duncan Powell
recent_reviews.text:
We went to the Lamb feeding on Saturday. It was incredibly well organised, all the guys running it were incredibly friendly with the kids and it was a really fairly priced experience. There were about twenty lambs running around, everyone fed a lamb and then there were loads of chances for cuddles and photos. Not rushed at all.

Iâ€™d advise everyone to make hay in the dark shop afterwards. We bought some gorgeous eggs, bacon, sausages and a couple of heavenly T-bone steaks.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Magical Malpas PYO Farm, Malpas Road, SY134RB

recent_reviews.author: Holly Hall
recent_reviews.text:
We stayed overnight here in our campervan with 2 children (5&11) and our collie dog. The generous pitches have the most wonderful 360Â° views of the countryside. Stella and Nancy are the most amazing hosts, there are toilets also which is rare for a farm pitch up.
There's a small park for children to play and free ranging goats which are super friendly and the sweetest pair of donkeys. the children spent their time playing with super host Nancy and riding their bikes up and down the field.
Totally unspoilt views of the night sky gazed at next to a firepit in the peace and quiet was the perfect way to spend the evening! 100% recommend!!
Thank you both!!!

recent_reviews.author: Jemma Phillips
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous 2 night stay at Magical Malpas! Canâ€™t recommend highly enough - what the site lacks in facilities (this is a no frills campsite but the toilets and kitchen area are perfectly clean), it more than makes up for in location, incredibly friendly owners and being surrounded by free ranging gorgeous goats, sheep and donkeys! Plus waking up to a huge herd of dairy cows in the field right next to us was a lovely surprise ğŸ¤©

recent_reviews.author: Emma Ngoga
recent_reviews.text: We did the Magical Christmas experience and it was unfortunately far from magical. At Â£120 for two families, and having driven an hour, we were left very disappointed. The tractor ride was fair, meeting Santa was nice, but it fell down on the lack of staff and the play area lacked magic. It was more about waiting around to see Santa. After seeing him, we were moved to the farm bit where there was no staff at all, just very jumpy goats and sheep. For the price, not really worth it. We have been to far better farm experiences. In fairness, the appalling weather didnâ€™t help. Wouldnâ€™t recommend

recent_reviews.author: Lisa
recent_reviews.text: Nice and quiet place for camping if youâ€™re looking for something nice friendly owner and her daughter so helpful we enjoyed our stay will be back thank you

recent_reviews.author: Linda Jones
recent_reviews.text: Went pumpkin picking today before lock down....absolutely loved it so many varieties to choose. The barn was so well decorated and the farmer and his wife were lovely. The pumpkin soup was amazing....I'm so glad we were able to go my little grandson loved it .....

recent_reviews.author: Hayley Thomas
recent_reviews.text:
Great place for a family day out! We visited today for the Maize Maze. The team there are super welcoming! It took us around 50 minutes to do the maze, then we came up to the welcome area again. The welcome area has a tent selling produce, paintings and soft drinks and snacks. There are ice lollies from 50p making it affordable and very welcome after a run around the maze! There are also games like Welly Wanging, Quoits and Coconut Shy.
My advice - take drinks round the maze, it's harder than it looks! Highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Helen Potts
recent_reviews.text:
Had a fantastic time today lovely place
Went back to get our family Christmas tree ğŸ„  a little bit more in price than an IKEA tree but you can't put a price on family memories

recent_reviews.author: Monica Martin
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely family vibes, lots of clear parking, thousands of pumpkins in different varieties!

The barn has music, animatronics and a little cafe. For the field you can use wheelbarrows given.

pumpkin_patches.address: Michaelston off Pentrpoeth Road, Cardiff CF3 6XT

recent_reviews.author: Tash
recent_reviews.text: Went to ty poeth farm today and it was lovely, took the kids for a walk through the beautiful sunflower fields there! Plenty of fantastic opportunies for great photos and an amazing sunflower heart shaped arch to stand under! They had a couple of drinks and food vans set up aswell from local restaurants like Ositos the burrito/breakfast place, I'd ordered from them before so knew the food was lovely was nice to see them mobile, visited the lovely shop at the farm full of fresh produce and their own honey in jars for sale some super cute crochet bits and got to take home a bunch of sunflowers that we had picked out, super it was and the kids had a great day there ğŸ˜ğŸ´ó §ó ¢ó ·ó ¬ó ³ó ¿ lovely friendly staff too on site and some piggies, sheep and cows to show the children â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Julie Brown
recent_reviews.text: A lovely farm shop situated just off the canal. The staff are friendly and there's  a  few cabins selling Asian food or British abd refreshments.  The two dogs we encountered were so friendly and amazing with the children â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Sophia Dowling
recent_reviews.text: Saw on Facebook this morning that there was an opportunity for strawberry picking today- messaged the page and they responded really quickly. Went up and picked the best strawberries weâ€™ve ever tasted! Along with some bacon from the farm shop- itâ€™s really lovely up at Ty Poeth- you wonâ€™t be disappointed ğŸ™‚

recent_reviews.author: Shweta Pamula
recent_reviews.text: Felt pretty ripped off, charged Â£3 per person just to enter the sunflower fields. Which might have been fine except the flowers were 80% wilting at this point. Somehow get the impression that charging for entry isnâ€™t standard as there is nothing on the website. The pigs were cute though !

pumpkin_patches.address: Ty Poeth Farm, Llanvihangel Crucorney, Pontypool NP4 8QU

recent_reviews.author: Keith Williams
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely afternoon tea with the family on a beautiful spring day. The afternoon tea selection was excellent - everything very fresh and beautifully presented.
We then spent time in the wonderful grounds with so much space for the grandkids to run around and lots of different activity installations to keep them entertained

recent_reviews.author: Cait Webster
recent_reviews.text: Gorgeous place. I donâ€™t normally leave reviews but I wanted to give a little shout out to the staff. Whenever me & my toddler come everyone is so lovely but one girl in particular is absolutely amazing (darker hair, wore a striped top today - 29/04/24. She always goes out of her way to interact with my little boy & is so friendly. Thank you for helping to make having a coffee out with a little one a lot easier. I think we will be spending most our summer with you guys!

recent_reviews.author: Elly Lim (Ellylin)
recent_reviews.text:
Baby friendly, vegan, remarkable outdoor, outdoor tables with ğŸ”¥, dog friendly, delicious pastries and food, A bit pricey but coffee is good!

I love this place so much. I was into pastries so much, and pizza and breakfast are very good.
Lovely place to take my baby. He could walk and run around outside in the field. My boy and I were amazed by the view of long big trees ğŸŒ³

Absolutely recommended place to visit with your loved oneğŸ˜˜

recent_reviews.author: nikki dunn
recent_reviews.text:
The food was really good but it was a pity the same couldnâ€™t be said about the service.
Having had delicious burgers, we were keen to finish the meal with a coffee or ice cream but despite asking for a menu to be able to choose, no one came to take an order.  After waiting 20 mins, and the cafe not being busy, we decided we had places to go! The frustration didnâ€™t stop there though as I waited to be able to pay whilst the 4 young women seemed more keen to discuss who was doing (or not doing) what. In fact, they were so distracted, I thought that I could easily walk out without them noticing!!! I wonder how many customers do just that?! A tip to management - donâ€™t let your staff let you down - service is everything in hospitality.
Again, i finish as I started, the food was really tasty, probably 5 stars, so Iâ€™d recommend eating here - just make sure you have time to spare.

recent_reviews.author: HH 88
recent_reviews.text: We had the best family day out here! Super friendly and organised operation. Fun and thoughtful activities for kids - pigs, games, scavenger hunt, toy tractors for toddlers etc. The pumpkin patch itself was great, lots of choice and varieties plus the wheelbarrows made for a fun alternative to the pram. Excellent food vendors too. Highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Jinx Ter
recent_reviews.text: Tha Maze was awesome so well organised. Drinks very fairly priced EVERY member of staff were friendly welcoming and made sure we all had a great time.

recent_reviews.author: Lee B
recent_reviews.text: Great day out for the family and kids theres pedal tractors farm animals and small attractions spread around the site... toilets and refreshments are available and plenty of friendly helpful staff, unfortunately the actual pumpkin patch is not very accessible for people with mobility issues so thats one thing to keep in mind, but everything else is located in the farm area on solid ground so still a good day out!

recent_reviews.author: Chaz Bundy
recent_reviews.text: What a lovely afternoon me and my family had, very friendly and welcoming when you arrive greeted the owners and plenty for the kids to do including a treasure hunt ride on tractors pumpkin ping and plenty of opportunities for picture taking and the selection of pumpkins was amazing all shapes and sizes will definitely be there again next year. Well done the pumpkin patch Hereford.

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte Dalrymple
recent_reviews.text: A lovely family farm, great for all ages. Fresh strawberry picking is available at the moment and pigs, geese and goats for children to enjoy, with picnic benches and space for children to eat.  Couldn't recommend this place more :)

recent_reviews.author: Nic
recent_reviews.text: Pumpkin picking was the most fun, a huge field with loads of different varieties, loads of different sizes, shapes and colours. People who run it are super friendly, they also have lovely farm produce from local Bee's (the honey is amazing) fresh rescue chicken eggs, reindeer, pigs, a couple of geese and some cows. You can go and get a freshly made cup of coffee and some homemade cake after you've gathered your pumpkins and sit and enjoy it. Fab few hours spent there, would definitely reccomend a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Craig Gosney
recent_reviews.text: We decided in a random stop for some fresh pick your own strawberry's. The farm is easy to find, the staff are really friendly and the strawberry's are superb. A must stop off.

recent_reviews.author: Jessica Busby
recent_reviews.text: Me and my daughter visited the farm to kill an hour and so glad we did! Strawberries are delicious and the farm is very clean and tidy. The animals are friendly as well. 10/10 experience!

recent_reviews.author: Lisa Jones
recent_reviews.text: What a wonderful experience at the sunflower maze! ğŸŒ» Absolutely lovely welcome, plenty to do for the kids as well as the maze, some giant games, an picture stock, an colouring! An some lovely cakes an drinks. Wonderful hospitality, an very friendly! Highly recommend, we will certainly be returning, an can't wait for the pumpkins next time! We really enjoyed our time here. Thank you so so much ğŸ’›ğŸ’›!!!

recent_reviews.author: Briony Beasor
recent_reviews.text: Beautifully placed in the Welsh countryside! Bethan and her whole family were so helpful and kind! Never been to a pick your own where you actually had to pull them free, lovely morning activity and the weather was glorious too! Definitely will be returning next year and for any other events! ğŸƒğŸ§¡

recent_reviews.author: chaosenergy1990
recent_reviews.text: Had a great time pumpkin picking! ğŸƒ There are all different sizes and colours, and I even found a cute miniature one! Homemade pumpkin cakes, pies and hot drinks there as well ğŸ˜‹ Will definitely be back next year ğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: Felicity Rowlands
recent_reviews.text: Definitely recommend Moel Famau Pumpkins, they have such a big variety of pumpkins, lots of different colours, shapes and sizes to choose from, also have a lovely selection of homemade cakes and pies, we tried their homemade pumpkin cake which was absolutely delicious!!

pumpkin_patches.address: Tyddyn Y Foel, Pentre, Cilcain, Mold CH7 5PF

recent_reviews.author: Robert Stark
recent_reviews.text: A great hour or two out with the kids. Â£5 per pumpkin and a wheelbarrow to take with you. Great value. Portaloo on sight and a little burger van for food. Ample parking, though a bit rough on the tyres. They take cards too.

recent_reviews.author: Simon Smith
recent_reviews.text: Massive pumpkins are only Â£5. Worth it for the experience and the photos. Definitely bring wellies though. The mud added to the fun

recent_reviews.author: Dan Woods
recent_reviews.text: Excellent, great section of pumpkins, all prices the same so choose carefully as the small ones are the same as the big ones but itâ€™s about the experience of selecting your own and wandering seeing an even better one and swapping and changing our boys loved ever second and have selected their own perfect pumpkins

recent_reviews.author: Emma payne (Sophie and Charlotte)
recent_reviews.text: Really enjoyed this afternoon , so much choice and friendly staff made it a worth while trip. Make sure you have your wellies tho.

recent_reviews.author: Gwilym Oliver Page-Lee
recent_reviews.text: Highly recommended. Fantastic experience, great for kids, dogs welcome, hot drinks only Â£1! Friendly owners. Will visit again. Remember your wellies if you plan on picking your own pumpkin ğŸƒ.

recent_reviews.author: Emma N
recent_reviews.text: Lovely destination for pumpkin picking. The kids love the cows and there has been such hard work gone into making it a lovely experience for all. Hot drinks available and plenty of photo opportunities. Remember your wellies!

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Barber
recent_reviews.text: Very good I drove my school kids down

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Mclavy
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic morning out at the pumpkin patch. Owners very friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Soniya Laveen
recent_reviews.text: A must visit for strawberry picking and evening tea. Itâ€™s a hidden gem. Highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Aj Williams
recent_reviews.text: Amazing place to stay! Highly recommend! Such nice views by the River!

recent_reviews.author: emma jones
recent_reviews.text: Went here on Bank Holiday Monday and I have to say it was a lovely afternoon picking ğŸ“ with family and the staff are so friendly. Looking forward to going back now for pumpkin picking and even enjoy having something from the cafe. Ohh and I have to say you have to check out the toilet it's very clean but wow its just needs to be seen ğŸ˜ ğŸ“

recent_reviews.author: gavin drobac
recent_reviews.text:
Arrived on a sunny afternoon on a very pleasant looking site with my son. Little did we know that a large group was gathering just along from us. Although I have to say we had no issue with them but what happened is exactly why large groups shouldnâ€™t be allowed on campsites.
Music was being played long after the 10.30 curfew and the owner eventually confronted the large group of around 30 guests. And what ensued was upsetting for my family. Shouting, swearing and threats of violence from the guests and the site owner.
If handled differently there could have easily been a peaceful outcome.
Once we could see the large party was staying for the Saturday night I removed my child from the situation and made the 90 minute journey back home.

Such a shame as upon arrival it looked a perfect site.

recent_reviews.author: Dawnmarie Neet
recent_reviews.text:
What a spectacular place to take your children. We spent two hours here and it was barely enough.
There are animals there feed, parks to play at, tractor rides, and so much more!

recent_reviews.author: Clare Hegarty
recent_reviews.text:
I had my daughter's 5th birthday party today and the farm and I can, without hesitation HIGHLY recommend the farm to anyone!!! From first contact with the staff, they were accommodating, friendly and attentive via email etc and the birthday booking experience was simple and hassle free.

We arrived at the farm today and the garden room, where the party was, was fully equipped with tea and coffee making facilities for adults, Bluetooth speaker, clean and spacious and a little play park and pic nic tables outside the room.

We were greeted by our host Sarah, who deserves a medal for her energy and enthusiasm. She gave us a guided tour of the farm and was super fun and engaging, with a great knowledge on all the animals. The kids were so entertained. The farm has so many excellent resources for kids - play parks, sand pit, tractor rides, barrel rides, a foam party, jumping pillows, a magical fairyland forest and jurassic park walk - PLUS so many adorable animals.

We went back to the party room after meeting loads of the animals and had hot food served for the kids. The food was delicious. We had sandwiches and gourmet Sausage rolls served for the parents and everyone commented on how beautiful the food was.

From start to finish every single guest spoke about the friendly staff.

Stress free, family vibe and well organised - great place for a kids party. We will be back

recent_reviews.author: Ella Ross
recent_reviews.text: Had a lovely day out at the Ark Open Farm. I visited with my partner and we spent a couple of hours here. It's in a great location and is fab to just have a dander around and see all the animals. They seem happy and kept in good conditions. Food is available to buy for them and there's timeslots where you can handle the small animals for free. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable. There's also a cafe where we got some hot drinks to walk around the park with - the hot chocolate was gorgeous. Would definitely recommend for a family day out or couples activity!

recent_reviews.author: Kim Mullan
recent_reviews.text: Went yesterday and had sooooo much fun. I thought we would stay for a couple of hours, but there was so much to do that we stayed all day long. As well as the place being really well looked after and thoughtfully put together, the thing that made it the most special were all the staff. Special shout out to Patrick who remembered ever single childâ€™s name on his barrel ride and was just so fun and caring and kind. They all seem like they really enjoy their work and it makes such a difference to the farm goers experience. The animals all seem so well cared for and the food in the cafe is good. Would highly recommend for all ages. Thanks Ark Farm â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Chris McCann
recent_reviews.text:
We had a class time in fantastic weather. Animals and tractor ride loved by our 1 year old and the staff in the sheds went outta their way, chasing after and catching a lamb to let Wee Man pet it!!

Food in the wee Cafe was cracker too and staff all round the place were lovely. Didn't get to the soft play but it looks good

recent_reviews.author: Thomas Fyvie (Tom)
recent_reviews.text: Always a lovely day out. Staff are great and farm is good for the young ones

recent_reviews.author: Paola Tejada
recent_reviews.text: I loved this farm today! Everything was so perfect! Kind staff and all clean! The indoor play so perfect! I will back definitely. 100% recommended ğŸ«¶ğŸ¼

recent_reviews.author: Vera Veraleto
recent_reviews.text: Amazing place to spend the whole day with your child. Soft play area sessions are 1.5 hour long. There are farm animals to see around the place, a big sandpit with toys (which gets sauna hot on a warm day), pet zoo with another soft play area and a few toys, pedal go-carts, cafe and picnic areas. We booked the earliest available soft play 9:30 slot, my toddler then took a nap in the pram and then we spent the rest of the day playing around. We left around 4pm. Fantastic day, will be definitely coming back. I must say the staff is really friendly, especially the guy working at the pet zoo.

recent_reviews.author: Emma Mccready
recent_reviews.text:
From the minute we arrived to the minute we left we had a brilliant time!
The bouncy pillow was a big hit with all of us, the animals are clearly very well looked after and the amount of seating was unreal!
The kids loved going into the enclosures and being able to be close to the animals, who were very friendly!
The best bit for us was the staff, two young lads in particular (I didnâ€™t catch the name of the first fella but he was firstly letting people into the goats enclosure and then letting the children pet the small animals and the second fella was called Dominic, he was with the reptiles and he was so friendly and informativeâ€¦. Both guys were so lovely with the children and clearly are very good at their jobs) we would visit again just knowing how fab the staff are!!! Thanks for a great day out!!!

recent_reviews.author: James Patterson
recent_reviews.text: Cool exotic animals, lemurs, kangaroos, mini goats and a scary giant lizard. Not a massive place, a tenner in. Dad's in free on father's day, same with mothers day id presume. Major fun for young peeps

recent_reviews.author: Carmeleta Morgan
recent_reviews.text:
The animals look physically well and you can see staff are taking good care of them, they are gentle with the animals, have great knowledge about them and are very attentive towards them.
The grounds are quite some size, clean and well run. Coffee shop is also clean. The price of a ticket is very reasonable and good value for what you have access too. A program is given which explains what's available.
We had a great experience, spent a pleasant afternoon there and would definitely return

recent_reviews.author: Shill Mc
recent_reviews.text: This is a great place for a family day out . The staff were great especially Dan who took us on the deer safari.  10 out of 10

recent_reviews.author: Justin Orr
recent_reviews.text:
Anytime my kids are down they love the place, always just pay the all day pass Â£15 each gets them on every multiple activities, multiple times. All they need to do is join back of a que.

The splash park bit when it's decent weather they probably love the most.

The cafe/food shop really does great food. I actually love the beef burger, bacon and cheese and the chips are real chips. 5/5

recent_reviews.author: Lorna Parker
recent_reviews.text: Like Bangor itself, this place seems to have been allowed to be run down. Not many visitors in the summer-usually full. Cafe staff seem to not care anymore, ice cream hut run out of most things. Swans need a good clean.

recent_reviews.author: Emma D
recent_reviews.text: Nostalgic visit to Pickie Park to the swans and The Pickie Puffer and to get a drink with my little girls and some of our friends. I was pleasantly surprised at the well maintained facilities and range of activities on offer. Would recommend to others.

recent_reviews.author: Keira O'hare
recent_reviews.text: Really great place. Kids love it. Not a long wait for rides etc. Really clean tidy. Staff really friendly and helpful. Highly recommend

recent_reviews.author: Lynsey Richards
recent_reviews.text: Love this family run farm! Bargain entry price of Â£7 per person, under 2s are free. Lovely walks, play park, bouncy castles, indoor and outdoor picnic areas and indoor play area too. Can buy carrots to feed the animals in the cafe or at the entrance hut. Barrel rides available on good days for Â£1.50/2ish per barrel. Great spot for a family day out.

recent_reviews.author: Kirk Lendrum
recent_reviews.text: We love this place. We keep coming back! On hot days, the blue lagoon beach is amazing, the kids (and adults) love the cool water to cool down in. Once your finished in the water you can walk around, see some more animals and have a burger or hotdog.

recent_reviews.author: Maurice Brereton
recent_reviews.text: Didn't know this place existed until lately and I have to say it was a great experience.

recent_reviews.author: mark Alexander
recent_reviews.text: Surprised by how good place was... Plenty to see and do, great for day out with kids.

recent_reviews.author: Laura Butler
recent_reviews.text: Went here for the first time today and had a great time- babies under 1 get in for free which is also a plusğŸ‘ love how there are different animals you wouldnâ€™t see in other farms. Very well set up and nice to be able to feed the animals.

recent_reviews.author: Paul Finegan
recent_reviews.text: An amazing place. You can see loads of different animals here. You get to hold and feed some. Great play park for kids. An excellent restaurant on site ( The Hungry Goat) and thereâ€™s even B&B if you wish to stay. A real gem in the heart of the countryside. Great facilities for all the family

recent_reviews.author: K
recent_reviews.text: Attended today with my 9 year daughter and the place did not disappoint. Very friendly staff especially the girl in the petting part. Very knowledgeable when the kids had questions. Ate at the hungry goat restaurant and again didn't disappoint it was lovely even had mocktails. Lovely day and great memories made. Recommended to all.

recent_reviews.author: Arthur Alexander
recent_reviews.text: Simply one of the highlights of our trip to Northern Ireland. If you have kids and youâ€™re looking for a place to chill while they explore around, the petting farm and cafe is a must-visit. The cafe (and restaurant) has a three floor building where you find from breakfast to larger meals like burgers and soups. If you donâ€™t plan to have lunch or dinner here, you can stop by their window to buy ice-creams or others snacks. Attached to the building, thereâ€™s a large playground for toddlers and more grown up kids, and also a petting farm with all sorts of animals such as kangaroos, macaws, and lemurs. Thereâ€™s a fee for entrance and itâ€™s only open from Thursdays to Sundays.

pumpkin_patches.address: Unit 1, dyanmill, Mullyneill Rd, Dyan, Caledon BT68 4XX

recent_reviews.author: Ya-Wen Cheng
recent_reviews.text: Highly recommended! We took a lot of nice photos and had a great time thereğŸƒThe staff and owner are sooooo helpful and friendly. They also run an Airbnb which would be a great idea to spend a relaxing weekend in DerryğŸ˜‰

recent_reviews.author: JY Yang
recent_reviews.text: A lovely place to visit! The boss and workers are super friendly! We had a good time and took a lot of photos there.â˜ºï¸ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Jamie Kane
recent_reviews.text: Loved it , great day out staff really friendly worth traveling to , loads of props to get photos with, simple but really well set up ! Thank you will be going next year again ğŸ™‚

recent_reviews.author: Eugene Gallagher
recent_reviews.text: This was our first time at Fultons Pumpkin Patch. It was very well organised and the Maize Maze was great. It was very muddy so wellies are a definite must. There were hundreds of pumpkins so there is plenty to go around. You simply take your pick. There were plenty of photo ops for the kids which was good. They also have small lid size wheel barrows which looked fun. It was a great family day out. We got one decent sized pumpkin for Â£5.  The weather wasnt the best but what do you do. We will definitley be back next year.

recent_reviews.author: David Palmer
recent_reviews.text: What an excellent place to bring the kids. Open farm done right. Our kids had a ball. The facilities were brilliant. From play parks to picnic areas and lots of animals to see. The lifesize dinosaur show was a scream. Gotta say, the effort the owners have gone to is commendable and all the staff were really engaging.  We will definitely be back.

recent_reviews.author: Amit Ram
recent_reviews.text: If you have kids that are primary school age or younger, it's a full day of fun and reasonably priced. Would love the dinosaur walk to be bigger. Staff very friendly

recent_reviews.author: Branislav Stano
recent_reviews.text: We spent half a day here and I have to say It's 1 of the better places we visited in Ireland. ( north or South). Well organized, cleaned , lots to do for kids and lots of places to sit and relax. But the highlight was the girl in the shop. We asked if there might be nuts in chocolate ice cream as our little one is nut alergic. Even tho there is not, she opened a new box of ice cream and new chocolate sprinkles and cleaned the spoon and pot with boiling water . Just wau..this mean more than you can imagine.

recent_reviews.author: Bart Piasek
recent_reviews.text:
Magnificent and brilliant experience.
I think it is one of the best such places on the island of Ireland.
First thing, first, it is very reasonably priced, parking is included in the ticket and there are plenty of spaces that are managed by the stewarts.
We visited during the busy May bank holiday weekend and the place was very busy. Yet, toilets were cleaned regularly, staff was working very hard on making sure that each visitor looked after. Time tables with day events like bottle feeding and petting animals were clearly displayed and we were able to find it easy . We also appreciated that staff was knowledgeable and knew some interesting facts about animals they were showing. Like snakes and tortoises.
The park is kept tidy and clean, you could spot the staff picking up rubbish and ensuring all is in good order.
Definitely a highly recommended location, if you are lucky with the weather, this is a deffo a full day attraction.
Finally, on site there is a bistro restaurant where you can buy some burgers and nuggets , ice creams and similar items at not too exaggerated prices.and they actually taste not bad. Especially the burge.

recent_reviews.author: Sheryl Dunn
recent_reviews.text: We have visited Maxwells Pumpkin patch the past 2 years and the kids have really enjoyed it. The kids love walking through the maize and pulling the carts to get their pumpkins.  There are lots of great props throughout the pumpkin patch for fantastic photos. We have also found the staff to b very helpful.

recent_reviews.author: T S
recent_reviews.text: Great healthy fun place to visit. Kids absolutely love it they've been going for last 3 years. Take your wellies though.

recent_reviews.author: patricia m.
recent_reviews.text: Booked tickets thinking this will be an actual pumpkin patch come to find out these were pumpkins on a field, the corn maze was very small and honestly this was very expensive considering itâ€™s only 30 mins and if itâ€™s raining youâ€™ll be out of there in 20 thatâ€™s Â£40 for 20 mins. Fulton pumpkin patch is an actual patch where they grow the pumpkins and they are still on the pumpkin plant which was what I was expecting here aswell a few scare crows in the corn maze wouldâ€™ve made a great difference. Overall not satisfied with the experience for the price

recent_reviews.author: Anita Mc Nally
recent_reviews.text:
Our third year visiting - some extra props for family photos and a little barn open with interesting old farming items to look at and some spookies and ghosts throughout - friendly engaging and welcoming staff all around - seems to be gaining more and more popularity each event they hold.
Little one loved the basketballs and hoopsğŸ™‚
I did like that the pumpkins were sold at a flat Â£5 on our visit - they explained that it was the large pumpkins left...and indeed they were! Absolutely huge, like butter to carve thankfully.
Did not get to experience the food tent as was a little busy for us at the time - no complaints though, maybe next time!

recent_reviews.author: Stacey Shemmeld
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely amazing place!
We recently donated two Duckings and Ross made us feel so comfortable with the process. They were also very well knowledgeable and made sure to explain the next steps.

The farm overall is so well laid out and you can tell the love for animals all of the workers have.

We will definitely be back for further visits!!

recent_reviews.author: Fiona Liston
recent_reviews.text:
Great visit today with our 4 year old grandaughter. The farm is well set out, not too far for small legs. The food basket is fun. Ruby enjoyed the pony walking and the play barn particularly.  Lots of picnic tables available.
The staff are friendly and helpful.

recent_reviews.author: Gill Entwistle
recent_reviews.text:
We had a great day. The car boot sale was tiny but we still found a few treasures! We spent a good few hours at the Fun Farm. The children got to hold guinea pigs and rabbits, they brushed the ponies and led them around for a bit. The tractor ride was excellent and very informative.
We enjoyed play areas inside and outside, fed all the animals. Had lunch at the cafe and bought wristbands so the children could go on the tea cups and paddleboats as often as they wanted. Despite some sudden downpours we had a great day!

recent_reviews.author: Angie Sz
recent_reviews.text: This is a wonderful destination for families with children. The staff is not only friendly but also knowledgeable about the animals, ensuring a great experience for visitors. The animals appear well cared for and happy in their environment. However, I did notice that one deer shares a cage with the goats, and it seemed to be frightened as the goats were nipping at it. Despite this concern, the overall experience is fantastic, and I highly recommend visiting with kids.

pumpkin_patches.address: 4 Slate Quarry Ln, Lisbellaw, Enniskillen BT94 5BB

recent_reviews.author: Fiona Liston
recent_reviews.text: I went with my 2 year old granddaughter. She loved everything, especially getting to pet the rabbits. We thought the food truck was great value for hot dogs and chips, and all the staff were very friendly. The venue was well set up. Wear your wellies.

recent_reviews.author: gerard crawford
recent_reviews.text: Drove an hour on Sunday to visit the patch having purchased tickets at the beginning of the week. Arrive to find no activity whatsoever only to see a Facebook post that the event was cancelled. No communication with ticketholders despite having access to all our contact information. What a waste of a trip. No refund so far either.

recent_reviews.author: Stephen
recent_reviews.text: Went with small group of kids for summer scheme day out. Really enjoyed the day as much as the kids did. Very impressed with the football golf setup. Been to others and this has definitely been thought out and looked after better. The boys I had loved the paint ball targets the best. I enjoyed doing some archery for the first time ever. Boys have asked to go back again which is a good sign of a good day out.

recent_reviews.author: Leanne Jordan
recent_reviews.text:
Had my sons 7th birthday here today and I have to say David and Logan who were taking us around were so welcoming and great with the kids. Always keeping them entertained and there was so much to do! From reptile handling to bouncy castle, barrel rides and feeding the animals. The kids most enjoyed the mini quads and the rodeo bull! The food provided as part of the party package went down and treat and was good portion sizes.
Everyone said they had a ball! Thanks for having us!

recent_reviews.author: Lemmy Russell
recent_reviews.text: I enjoyed my day at spruce meadows. The reptile house is impressive, and there is lots of different activities to participate in. It's alot quieter and smaller than other farms which I enjoyed. There isn't a whole lot of animals but the ones there are very friendly. A good day out !

recent_reviews.author: Anthony Boyd
recent_reviews.text: Went to play football golf with my son and nephews. It was good fun and got them out into the open air for a couple of hours. Definitely recommend it and will be back again. We loved it.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Crumlin Road Gaol Visitor Attraction and Conference Centre

recent_reviews.author: Suzanne Ling
recent_reviews.text: One of the most well curated museum Iâ€™ve visited. Interactive, informative with a well-mapped visitor journey. Definitely a must a visit in Belfast. Do expect to spend 2-3 hours here as it has a lot of information and videos.

recent_reviews.author: John Dersley
recent_reviews.text: It would have been five stars if the cafe had been open! We spent about 4 hours at the Gaol and had lunch at the distillery next door. The Gaol is definitely worth a visit, to learn about the Victorian view of appropriate penal conditions for men women and children, as well as about the imprisonment of people during the Troubles. The exhibits are well laid out but the individual stories, set in different cells by video, tended to overlap with those in adjacent cells. The video would benefit enormously from subtitles. Nevertheless the overall impression was vivid and authentic.

recent_reviews.author: David and Frances van Gestel
recent_reviews.text:
Visited Crumlin Road Gaolâ€”an eerie but fascinating experience. The cold, dark cells, padded room, and execution chamber gave a real sense of its grim history.

The exhibition is well-curated, with videos and displays that bring the stories to life. Seeing old armoured vehicles from the Troubles was also very interesting.

A must-see in Belfast for anyone interested in its past. Great value and very memorable.

recent_reviews.author: Louise Prosser
recent_reviews.text: The Gaol was easy to navigate, friendly staff and plenty to see and hear. There is both a mix of indoor and outdoor to explore and there are some really informative push button videos to explain more history on the Gaol and prisoner's. My only criticism is that some of the TV screens and push buttons weren't working which meant there were certain topics that couldn't be explored. Worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: George Stewart
recent_reviews.text: I love a good farm shop and this is a good farm shop!  It has great produce from their own farm and other bits and pieces from across the island.  There is so much more to it than a farm shop with tours, supper clubs etc, check out the website. We did buy some produce, burgers, sausages and goat chops which I am very much looking forward to cooking and eating.  Well worth the trip!

recent_reviews.author: Shannon LeBlanc-DeMille
recent_reviews.text:
Such an amazing experience here! Felt so welcomed.
The food was wonderful!

recent_reviews.author: Patrick Cassidy
recent_reviews.text:
Great visit with our tour group!  Everyone treated us like kings.
Interesting, informative, and great food.  Thanks so much!

recent_reviews.author: J & M
recent_reviews.text: Lovely, sustainable farming and well looked after animals. We have visited several times with kids and grandparents. We also really love the cafe - especially recommend the full fry made with local products, the baking (lemon poppyseed cakes, brownies and scones were all lovely) and great coffee and service. If you arrived at 11am (opening), you might wait a bit for food, but itâ€™s well worth the wait!

recent_reviews.author: Mhairi Walton
recent_reviews.text: Amazing hospitality from Mr Jimmy Lapin so knowledgeable about his veg , definitely will be buying locally from him again .

recent_reviews.author: Johnny Hart
recent_reviews.text: Great place to visit and take photos .  Kids enjoyed it and so did the adults. We will post a vlog on our Ever Wander channel on YouTube if you would like to see more . They have a vegetable farm connected to the site, we got fresh produce potatos ect and I must say they were delicious... We will return at Halloween for the pumpkin harvest ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Padraig Crudden
recent_reviews.text: Awesome vegetable farm shop. Great place to get super fresh veg straight from the fields that morning. Even bring your kids along to pick your own! The veg is always better value than the big supermarkets and you get the added value of keeping it local! Can't recommend this place more. Always great service too from big Jim and Esdille!

recent_reviews.author: Lindy Casey
recent_reviews.text: Good prices on fresh vegetables. The other customers were friendly and the farmer himself waited on us. We had a nice chat. (We were the 2 American ladies staying at the Airbnb cottage.)

recent_reviews.author: Adrian Finnegan
recent_reviews.text:
Water Park:
Went with a big group of mates - the place seems very well run and while there was about 60+ of us in the water the guards were very attentive.
Wetsuits, socks and life vest all provided and felt comfortable.
Some of the facilities could do with attention, like the lockers. We struggled for some time to find lockers that weren't smashed in. Felt like being at school

Suggestion: Some mirrors would be ideal, so that I can see that my wetsuit is on both inside-out and back-to-front :).

recent_reviews.author: Paul Clasper
recent_reviews.text:
Great we spot for my twins birthday celebrations.   1 hour of running along a water assault course and buzzing down slides into what was once a resivoir.

Kids and I both loved it although some of the features are beginning to look a little tired and in need of repair.  Wet suits that are provided are also a bit worn out.

recent_reviews.author: Gemma Coogan
recent_reviews.text:
We went yesterday with 12 family members. I had been there 5 years ago and found it brilliant.
This time, we arrived for the 2â€“3pm session at the aqua park, and it was a huge disappointment. The place was dirty, with rubbish everywhere â€” including dirty socks, underwear, food, and drink cartons. Sweet wrappers were scattered all over, and the toilets were filthy.
We couldnâ€™t wait to leave. We all went straight home to have showers.
Would not recommend â€” it has gone downhill a lot.

recent_reviews.author: Sebastian W
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant idea!!! With a few tings to do around, plenty of car park spaces. Easy to get in and out. Very good idea for family day /weekand away. We visit this place few times over the last few years and never got disappointed. Every time Iâ€™ve visiting i can see improvement. Keep up the good job. Could be a good idea to lover  the prices

pumpkin_patches.address: Knockbracken Reservoir, 1 Mealough Rd, Carryduff, Belfast BT8 8GB

recent_reviews.author: Robert Huxley
