recent_reviews.text: Fantastic place, we went for the pumpkin patch for our kids this year, did not disappoint

recent_reviews.author: Chris Mcdowell
recent_reviews.text: Streamvale for Halloween or Christmas is brilliant or just going to the place to see all the farm animals the kids love it, friendly staff really good at what they do, good parking aswell, can be hectic in busy periods but show you how popular it is easy to find aswell, will def be back for the Christmas streamvale kids are looking forward to it

recent_reviews.author: Vikas Dhawale
recent_reviews.text: how far is it from the bus stop?

recent_reviews.author: Cano Can
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic

recent_reviews.author: Alanah Mullin
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant family run farm with a great range of animals. Lovely play are also with picnic benches

recent_reviews.author: Jonathan Black
recent_reviews.text: Lovely open farm in a lovely setting. Compact layout is suitable for young and old alike.

recent_reviews.author: Jacqueline Scott
recent_reviews.text: Took kids they had a really good time weather was good and bouncy castle was a bonus.

recent_reviews.author: Samantha Forde
recent_reviews.text: Good wee place lots of nice animals

recent_reviews.author: Tess Weightman
recent_reviews.text: Me and my boyfriend did the Treetop Obstacle Course and had the best time. The course was so much fun, with lots of various challenges to cross. Our instructor Charlie was awesome, felt more like being there with a friend. He was very encouraging and ensured we knew what we were doing, and made the whole experience even better. Thank you Charlie!! :)

recent_reviews.author: Sophie Hall
recent_reviews.text: We are just after a paint balling session with a group of 11 in jungle ni and it was fantastic. Josh and Adrien did a great job explaining everything while also having a good laugh with us. They couldn't have been more accommodating and would highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: karen morrow
recent_reviews.text: I highly recommend the forest school for organisations, birthday parties or school groups. Having had a school group of approximately 30 children visit I can say that this was an extremely enjoyable and valuable experience. The facilities at the Jungle are excellent for groups e.g. toilets and indoor area for food. At the forest school, the activities are planned to a high standard, everything is well prepared, organised and pitched at the appropriate level for group. The staff are extremely professional and knowledgeable about nature.  The opportunities to connect with nature on a deeper level, improve mental and physical health, confidence, self esteem and social skills make this a worthwhile trip/ visit and and experience not to be missed!

recent_reviews.author: Jenny Suiter
recent_reviews.text:
I highly recommend The Jungle NI for an end of year school trip .

The trip was extremely well organised - from safety briefings to activity scheduling . The team we worked with at the Jungle - Jason, Jamie, Anna and Charlie, worked above and beyond to ensure our school trip ran as smooth as it did. We were offered a range of different activities including Tree Tops and Zorbing . Their thoughtful adjustments to the activities allowed all participants to take part and get involved . The entire day was a great success!!

Thank you very much, we will definitely be back.

Jenny

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Crockford Bridge Pick Your Own Farm

recent_reviews.author: Katie Jacobs
recent_reviews.text: Had such a nice experience here! Easy to book a slot online and the price comes off the fruit you pick. Strawberries were finished but got loads of raspberries and some blackberries. Lovely sunflowers too! All the staff were very friendly and welcoming. The ice cream from the cafe is also very tasty with loads of flavours to choose from.

recent_reviews.author: Edith Ng
recent_reviews.text: The strawberries are small but incredibly sweet and full of flavor. Unlike some other farms where the fruit is placed on shelves, youâ€™ll need to squat down to pick them here. While the variety of fruits is limited, the focus is clearly on strawberries, which is perfectly fine. Thereâ€™s also a gelato cafÃ© on-site, and the gelato is absolutely delicious!

recent_reviews.author: Adem Akosman
recent_reviews.text:
After reading the positive reviews online, we decided to visit this farm. Following a pleasant drive of over an hour, we arrived at the farm. Our first impression was very positive; the spacious and well-maintained grounds created a peaceful atmosphere.
As mentioned frequently in the reviews, the ice creams at the farm were truly fantastic. We had a hard time choosing from the wide variety of flavors, but each one we tried was delicious. The small playground for children was a big plus for families. While the kids played safely, we were able to relax and enjoy our time.
The farm also offers the opportunity to pick your own fruits and vegetables. I picked sweet corn, and its freshness and taste were simply amazing. This experience is both enjoyable and educational for those who love being close to nature.
Overall, we were very satisfied with our visit to the farm and are definitely considering going back. Itâ€™s a great escape for both children and adults. If youâ€™re looking for a peaceful, nature-filled, and delicious day out, I highly recommend visiting this farm.

Thanks,
Adem

recent_reviews.author: Linds
recent_reviews.text:
Came here for a half term Halloween event,  and boy am I so glad I did! It was done in the wizard of Oz theme, they had amazing actors who fit their parts and roles so perfectly!
All the staff were definitely amazing in what they did, even the security, the security guard was up for a good laugh too!

Pumpkin picking, Halloween costume competition, food, drinks, clean lavatories, a fun maze and a fun fair!

The music they used for the event was absolutely amazing too, not songs used often but I know my music very well and I loved that they played music that isn't heard on the radio, music that isn't very well known but sounds sooo good!

There were mini games for the kids to do, like as if it was a fair but you help yourself, no added cost to do them!!!!

Carve your Pumpkin there too, so no mess at home!

I wish this was an every weekend event, I'd be there every weekend!

I'll see you next year for Halloween but I'll also be back in the summer for fruit picking with the kids!

Thank you so much, you really do know how to make an event a proper good one!

When we got there, there was a brilliant story line put onto the tannoy to get you into the spirit of it, the actors asked us to click our feet like Dorothy  - 34 and still can't haha! But I put in the effort and tried because it was so well done, the announcement did go on for like 20 mins but that's only because they wanted to make sure the early arrives weren't bored while we waited for the gates to open and more people to get their wrist bands, so I completely understand, kept us entertained anyway!

The food stalls were divine, smelt incredible too!

The amount of thought, effort and time put into this event was definitely shown through in everyday and I absolutely CANNOT  fault a thing! I think, it was the best day out I've ever had with my family!

You should be so proud of your achievements, and also, you should be doing many many many more events, seasonal ones!

pumpkin_patches.address: New Haw Rd, Weybridge, Addlestone KT15 2BU

recent_reviews.author: Anni Undomiel
recent_reviews.text: I visited on a cloudy/drizzly day towards the end of the season, so it was very quiet! Person who greeted me was very friendly. Parking was Â£3 all day, and I spent a good hour pottering around the field choosing flowers. Would be a lovely excursion with little ones

recent_reviews.author: Sam Simmons
recent_reviews.text: Great day at Ashover Family Farm on Saturday. The Maise maze was a lot of fun and the pick your own fresh flowers are great quality at a good price. The picnic area with sand pit, inflatable farm animals and giant connect 4 is a nice touch.

recent_reviews.author: Elaine Woodhall-Windle
recent_reviews.text:
I have been here a few times for sunflowers & tulips & enjoyed every visit. There are other sunflower fields locally, and they are pretty, but I love how these tower over you.
There is a food waggon on-site, loos and photo opps. My only downside was the lack of seating at the top of the field for those of us with older legs & poor mobility, but the owner is looking into it.
Costs Â£3 to get in and Â£1 per bloom, which I think is reasonable as you don't have to pick anything if you don't want. There are also gladioli this summer.
It's just nice to get out in real countryside & just enjoy yourself.
Have been before & will go again.

recent_reviews.author: Elle Wright
recent_reviews.text:
We visited the sunflowers this Summer with friends and had an absolutely wonderful time!

The owner was friendly and approachable and it was nice to see thoughtfulness put into accessibility by having portaloo toilet and disabled toilet in the car park. There was a nice hay bale play area for children to play in with bouncy horses which brought them much delight!

The sunflower field itself was stunning! It is a much longer walk around than it looks due to a wildflower add on at the top and the gradient of the field, but manageable.

I was so impressed how many sunflowers there still were when we went at the end of the season and got some beautiful bundles of flowers!

pumpkin_patches.address: Eastwood Hall Farm, Eastwood Ln, Chesterfield S45 0BD

recent_reviews.author: Charley
recent_reviews.text:
We had a fantastic evening at the adults only event.
We took a picnic and sat surrounded by gorgeous huge sunflowers.
The mini maze was fun, but weâ€™re werenâ€™t brave enough to take on the big maze with darkness coming.
The staff were lovely and welcoming, helping and so friendly. We ended up having one of the best child free evenings here just relaxing and having fun.
Please do more adult only evenings.

recent_reviews.author: Julie Birch
recent_reviews.text:
We had a lovely few hours at the maize . Enjoyed navigating around the two maizes and we took some lovely photos.  Then chilled and enjoyed an ice cream
I would highly recommend this experience.
Look forward to doing the autumn ğŸ‚  one .
Julie and Rob

recent_reviews.author: Carly Spittle
recent_reviews.text: Visited on bank holiday Monday, I booked the early spot. It was nice and quiet plenty of parking. Really worthwhile visiting, the staff are so lovely and helpful and the venue is perfect for those who want some quiet time wondering through the sunflowers and for families alike. Will definitely visit again.

recent_reviews.author: J W
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely amazing day today! The staff were so friendly and very helpful. We were in a group and they advised how we could attempt to stay together, tips for if we didnâ€™t. The staff explained the day to the children themselves which I found really lovely as often people just talk to the adults.
We also picked sunflowers which was such a wonderful experience - again staff helpfulness was beyond anything we couldâ€™ve expected.
We are already planning the next trip and we all had such a great day with a range of kids ages

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Spilman's Pick Your Own Soft Fruits. Spilmans Pumpkin Festival. Farm Shop & Cafe.

recent_reviews.author: sitikadhijah samad
recent_reviews.text:
My family and I took a fun summer trip to Spilman Farms! Picking fresh strawberries was such a sweet experienceâ€”literally! They smelled amazing and tasted even better. Just donâ€™t forget to pay before you snack ğŸ˜‰.
The place is huge, with a big green lawn, a fun play area for the kids, and a beautiful sunflower field thatâ€™s perfect for photos. We also made a quick pit stop at their little shop and treated ourselves to some tasty pizza. Yum! Summer is summering ğŸ’ƒğŸ»ğŸ’ƒğŸ»

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Stares
recent_reviews.text:
We had such a wonderful time at Spilmans Farm. We went for the very first day of Strawberry picking and despite knowing what was there, we didnâ€™t appreciate how much was there to keep us all entertained. We went wild flower and strawberry picking, had wood oven pizzas, played on the outside park equipment and played in the play barn. We thought we would be there for an hour, and were there for over three.
There is a beautiful farm shop and lovely cafe too. It was a stunning way to start the strawberry picking season.
Thank you to everyone who makes these days possible for us to enjoy.

recent_reviews.author: rabina ali
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant place. Booked our slot, wasn't expecting much but it was amazing. There are 3 parking places so plenty of room, the layout is nice . There's a bit of a walk from the entrance to the fields,but it wasn't too bad. Maybe for elderly it might be long. Fields were full of massive strawberries all ripe,we filled so many punnets, enjoyed the wild flowers field as well and you get vouchers for all your tickets that you can use when buying your strawberries. We had rain so we went to the cafe for wood fire pizza and chips. It was nice but really expensive, Â£7 for a small margherita. Other than that had a good day. Will definitely go again soon.

recent_reviews.author: Lauren
recent_reviews.text:
We always have a really nice time at Spilman's farming. We did visit quite late in the season this year though so they only had a handful of tabletops strawberries open, which was disappointing as we enjoyed picking them from the ground last year and they didn't have that this year. I will say as well that the strawberries weren't as sweet as last year, we found them quite sour and tarte.

They had a jumping pillow which was great, but it was really quiet, no tractor rides etc. They do have a new play area and inside they have a sandpit and some tractors to play on so that was good, just wish we went earlier in the year, especially to pick some raspberries!

We will still come back next year!

recent_reviews.author: Claire B
recent_reviews.text:
Review: Pumpkin Picking

Firstly; they have toilets on site.

We greatly enjoyed our experience at the pumpkin picking farm today. It truly was one of our favorite outings. This was our first time participating in such an activity, and it was so good.

The farm is conveniently located just a fifteen-minute drive from Sale, making it easily accessible.

Upon arrival, we were greeted with ample parking and friendly staff who assisted us in finding a convenient spot, despite the chilly outdoor conditions.

The tractor ride to the farm was a delightful addition, allowing us to enjoy the scenic views of horses, goats, hens, and cows along the way.

The farm itself is beautifully decorated, featuring numerous photo opportunities, picnic benches, and a food area offering a variety of items such as hot dogs, bacon rolls, and even a drinks cart. I particularly enjoyed a delicious pumpkin spiced latte topped with whipped cream and pumpkin sweetâ€”it was a highlight for me.

There was an impressive selection of pumpkins, showcasing various colors, shapes, and sizes that I had not anticipated. My friend initially thought we might overspend, but to our surprise, all the pumpkins we selected totaled under Â£20, which was remarkable.

We also enjoyed food and explored a maize maze, collecting clues to solve a puzzle along the way.

As we wrapped up our visit, the staff kindly transported our pumpkins back to the car park via tractor.

Overall, we had an excellent time, and I look forward to returning next year!

recent_reviews.author: Mon S
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely Time at Brookheys Farm Pumpkin Patch, Though Some Room for Improvement

Weâ€™ve just visited the Brookheys Farm pumpkin patch for the second time, having first gone in 2022, and itâ€™s still a fun experience for the family. We loved the tractor ride to the patch and the maize labyrinth, which adds a playful element for the kids.

While the pumpkins were smaller and there seemed to be fewer compared to our previous visit, it was still enjoyable to pick our own. The admission fee of Â£4 per adult and Â£3 per child is reasonable, but I think it would be great if they added a few more activities or touches to make it feel like a fuller experience, especially considering how magical it felt the first time.

All in all, itâ€™s a nice way to spend a day with family, and with a bit more variety, it could become a truly standout event each year!

recent_reviews.author: Sunil Patel
recent_reviews.text:
Great day with the little one.

Only negative is the long wait for the tractor going to the picking and getting back to the car. Also, after picking your pumpkin there should be somewhere to wash your hands.

Potentially more food stalls? Veg options

recent_reviews.author: Cat Staniforth
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic experience pumpkin picking. I thought for the price of admission we got a lot for our money! Tractor ride with a little tour of the farm and animals on the way in, beautiful field to pick pumpkins from , all different colours shapes and sizes and not ridiculously priced. Lovely snack and tea/coffee stands. Maize maze as well. We spent a good 2hrs there just enjoying ourselves. Would definitely go again.

pumpkin_patches.address: Brook Heys Farm/Brook Heys Rd, Altrincham WA14 5SY

recent_reviews.author: Anusha H
recent_reviews.text:
I was delighted to take my aged parents along with my kid here. Everyone had a great time as the farm had a lot of produce for everyone! I wish people didn't throw things everywhere. The farm had so many veggies which were wasted around. I wish that wasn't the case and the people really only took what they needed and respected the farm produce.
The season is now for pumpkin and the pumpkins are huge and amazing. I would definitely recommend this place

recent_reviews.author: Sai
recent_reviews.text: This farm is such a delightful place to get truly fresh and affordable fruits and vegetables! We've made it a part of our weekly routine and always look forward to our visits. The anticipation for the seasonal pick-your-own sessions is building â€“ what a wonderful opportunity! It feels good to support our local farmers by visiting often, and we really appreciate all the hard work that goes into it. Keep up the fantastic job, team!

recent_reviews.author: Macy Incywincymacy
recent_reviews.text: I checked the website to see what produces are in season before I went there , the update is accurate, I was able to pick what I wanted. The courgette is priced at Â£0.5 sounded more expensive than street market but once you see the size of them , you know you get a fresh bargain. The marrow's size is like a new born baby.

recent_reviews.author: Mo Mo
recent_reviews.text: Cute shop on the farm with a variety of product including fresh eggs, vegetables, fruit, meat all locally sourced in Kent. Kale and parsnips are from Stanhill farm and you can pick your own in the autumn. They also sell packaged organic goods, crisps, drinks, bottled cordials, cakes and other packets. You can also fill up dried foods as they have refillable options

pumpkin_patches.address: The Farm House, Birchwood Rd, Dartford DA2 7HD

recent_reviews.author: Sarah
recent_reviews.text: We had a fantastic afternoon. Lots of animals to feed, a cuddle corner, the best play house I've ever seen, loads of ride on toys in the play area, the maize maze was a-maze-ing (sorry, not sorry) and we managed to find all 7 of the bumble bees for a bag of sweets â¤ï¸ Farmer Helen was lovely to chat to and all the staff were friendly and knowledgeable. I'm not sure I'd come back as we have teenagers and once is probably enough for them, but if I still had little ones I'd definitely get the annual pass

recent_reviews.author: Amanda Till
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous place. So much to do and see. Children can go on the bouncy castle, pet and feed the animals and explore. Farmer Helen is wonderful and her team are super. Been several times and every time has been wonderful. See you again soon.

recent_reviews.author: Luan Holland
recent_reviews.text: My grandchildren had the time of their lives at ridgeway farm. The staff were awesome taking the time to handle the animals and feed the baby lambs. There was lots of little areas for the children to play with toys abd games. And the area felt really safe. We will definitely visit again and many thanks

recent_reviews.author: Dominic M
recent_reviews.text:
5ğŸŒŸ Pumpkin Picking at Ridgeway Farm is Amazing! We met Farmer Helen and her mum! We explored the tree house, visited the pumpkin house, the pumpkin patch, sunflower field, fed the goats, ducks, chickens, donkeys, cows, sheep. It's far more than just a pumpkin picking. You can get a warm drinks and snacks in the cafe. Bouncy castle and paints in the barn. Prices are fantastic for what you do and receive.
Animal feed is Â£1.50 for a good size bag.
Thank you for a great morning!

pumpkin_patches.address: Ridgeway Farm, Peel Rd, Blackpool FY4 5JX

recent_reviews.author: Theresa Ennis
recent_reviews.text: Making the most of the facilities and the kids did enjoy themselves but some elements were not acceptable. The toilet facilities, the rusty old tractor the kids could play on and the very bumpy tractor ride. I went with the kids just to keep them safe but wished I hadn't as it was very uncomfortable. The strawberries were fabulous and the flowers looked great too. This place had a lot to offer, it just needs a few tweaks to reach it's full potential.

recent_reviews.author: paul swan
recent_reviews.text:
We had a great time here.  Plenty of parking and plenty to do before choosing our pumpkins (of which there were plenty to pick)  there were pumpkins in the field, in crates, in boxes just laying about, all sizes though the huge ones had all been sold by the time we went there.
My partner read about it being really muddy and not good for pushchairs so we didn't take ours for our 10 month old and had to carry her round but found it wasn't too bad and definitely not too muddy for pushchairs as the put walkways down.
Plenty of activities for the kids, couple of places to get food and even a mobile bar for people to grab a pint etc.
There was even a ghost "bus" ters bus as a haunted house (or bus) for the kids to go in.
Will definitely be taking the pushchair next year.

recent_reviews.author: Ewelina Minda
recent_reviews.text: If I could give this farm 10 stars I would. What a great entertainment for the kids! Hot food, coffee on site. Weâ€™ve only discovered this farm this year and it will be one of my favourite places to go to in autumn and summer. Thank you for opening your doors to the public.

recent_reviews.author: Lydia Misson
recent_reviews.text: We had a lovely time here. First time, and will definitely return. Tickets booked online. Â£3 entry per person. We went at 3 pm which appeared a good time to go, busy but not too busy. Plenty of time to see everything. Food and drink available to buy at an extra cost. My children loved picking their pumpkins, so many different kinds to pick from. Lots for the children to do. A maze, bales to climb on, graveyard, pumpkin shooter, craft activities, and a area if you wish to carve your pumpkins. Plenty of car parking, which was free. We went on a lovely sunny day but would recommend wellies if the weather was rainy. Pumpkins I felt were fairly priced. They range from Â£1 to Â£10. Only suggestion it would have been nice to have the pricing guide to see how costly your pumpkin was before the tills. I would recommend visiting.

recent_reviews.author: Clare Taylor
recent_reviews.text: We visit every year for our pumpkin pick, we love the photo props animals and buggy ride etc. I always end up spending a small fortune between food and activities but it really is a fun couple if hours out. The problem is getting in and out! The mud has cars slipping and sliding everywhere, thankfully my car already needed a wash! I honestly don't know what's more filthy, the kids or the car ğŸ™ˆ

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Allen
recent_reviews.text: We went late (28th) and there were still loads of pumpkins! Plenty of choice and we came home with a wheelbarrow full! The patch is a lot bigger than it looks when you first pull in as well. My two year old loved exploring the field and choosing his favourite pumpkins. Good variety as well, we brought home some orange, green, white, and grey pumpkins of varying sizes. Not too many small ones or really large ones left (although we did manage to snag one of each) but there's plenty of the middle sizes to choose from! We really enjoyed our visit, and our bacon baps! My son loved the sheep and chickens at the entrance as well.

recent_reviews.author: Leigh Cowley
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic place, well worth taking the kids too. When we went it was a foggy morning which added to the Halloween eeriness! Not too expensive for the pumpkins either. I would say get there early in the morning as it can get quite busy!

recent_reviews.author: Cher Renshaw
recent_reviews.text: Been every Yr for the last few years, always great, parking is good, everything is well organised and there are always lots of pumpkins and other things to occupy the kids. The weather was fantastic on Sunday and we got some fabulous pumpkins. See you nxt yr

recent_reviews.author: Paul Holt
recent_reviews.text: Round, wide, oval, long, bumpy, smooth, spotty, striped, red, grey, yellow, black, pink, white, terracotta andâ€¦orange!  Yes itâ€™s Pumpkin time again..and If you have never had the pleasure of picking your owen giant globes straight from the farmers field then get yourself down to Beluncle Farm in Rochester, Kent. This for me is essentially the best way to swing into Autumn, a sunny afternoon in fields ablaze with fiery coloured fruits is sure to lift anyoneâ€™s spirits. Whether you want an afternoon out with the kids, a Jack O lantern or two or just a good laugh in the dirt with your friends then PYO Pumpkins will not disappoint.  This family run business is in its 15th year of pick your own pumpkins, so itâ€™s was one of the first farms in the South East to start this Halloween tradition and itâ€™s simple: just book a online slot, turn up, grab a barrow and enter the fields of joy. The pumpkins and squash are grown in rows acording to variety, and you pick them right from the soil where they are grown, you donâ€™t get anymore down to earth than that. Special Varieties include: the salmon pink â€˜Porcelain Dollâ€™, â€˜Jarrahdaleâ€™ a slate grey chunky beast of a fruit and â€˜Over the Moonâ€™, which was almost glowing in the fields in all its neon yellow glory. The fantastic French heirloom variety â€˜Galeux D'Eysinesâ€™ and of course thereâ€™s thousands orange and white ones suitable for carving too. And whatâ€™s more, the staff are super friendly and the prices great, so donâ€™t delay, get yourselves glowing today.

recent_reviews.author: Ben Robbins
recent_reviews.text:
It was really good! A definite workout with pushing the wheelbarrow. The only thing it could have improved with (and advice to people considering to go here should take) is WEAR WELLIES!!! I went in my old shoes (I knew it would be muddy, but not that muddy) and let's just say that I probably won't wear those shoes again! ğŸ˜…

Overall, it was an amazing day and would go here again. Great for all the family!

recent_reviews.author: Stretch Darkmagi
recent_reviews.text:
THIS IS ONLY OPEN TWO WEEKS BEFORE HALLOWEENğŸƒğŸ¦‡.

Very friendly ğŸƒknowledgeable staff, great prices. All of the pumpkins ğŸƒ (excluding decorative) are edible ğŸ˜‹a far bigger variety than at the supermarket. They have about 30-40 varieties.
The later in the 2 week picking season you go the further you need to walk. There are crates of pre-collected pumpkins and all pumpkins are already off the vine. You may need boots in rainy weather warning some varieties are a tad prickly bring gloves.
One down side is that there is no indication where to go for specific pumpkins.
This is Wheelchair accessible however as it is a working farm, it is not bump free and verges are grassed. The further you go the more difficult it is to get to. I would however recommend a power chair self propelled will be more of a challenge.
The aforementioned crates are good for picking. I am sure the friendly staff will help where possible.
The pumpkin shop is a nice little stop for pumpkin decorating items and carving sets. (If you are carving your pumpkin be sure to save the flesh to make some yummy pumpkin soup, pie, cake.... Don't waste such great produce) The pumpkin chutney is great and worth getting a couple of jars.
[We did not try the burger van]
Looking forward to next year's event

recent_reviews.author: Gemma Skinner
recent_reviews.text: This is the first time we have ever picked our own pumpkins, but god it was fun! Great atmosphere really easy to get to and lots of parking available. They have a small shop on site where you can buy locally made pumpkin chutney and other Halloween goodies. There are portaloos available on site also. The pricing is really good for the pumpkins and gourds available and some also suggest what to do with them if you want to eat them. Easy to navigate site with very friendly and helpful staff. We will be returning every year from now not just because it's fun but it helps support local businesses.

pumpkin_patches.address: Beluncle Farm, Stoke Rd, Hoo, Rochester ME3 9LU

recent_reviews.author: Humza Ali
recent_reviews.text: A great family day out with lots to do and delicious fruits to eat

recent_reviews.author: libra
recent_reviews.text:
Really great place for kids and adults. Lovely seating area outside and in. Great shop sells all sorts of goodies. Nice cafe with home made cakes and a nice menu. We were just there as a couple but if you have kids there
loads for them to do including a maze.

recent_reviews.author: Emma Brown
recent_reviews.text: We had a lovely hour here picking the most delicious strawberries ever,  which my kids (8 and 11) hugely enjoyed the experience.  Lovely shop, and wow the cakes looked absolutely delicious.  I was nearly put off coming by the moany reviews but I needn't have been.  Some people are just moany and yes, the place is clearly a money pit but if you just stick to picking fruit and maybe a cuppa and cake then what's not to love?!  We sat on a picnic table outside in the sun and ate half the strawberries before we left - so nice.  Only deducted a star because there is no clear signage/ instructions on what to do/where to go for fruit picking so you are wandering about following giant strawberry signs and hoping that's it and there will be punnets for you (there was).  Also no clear pricing for Â£ per kg. But overall a lovely time spent,  and we will definitely return when back in the area.

recent_reviews.author: Carmen Chan
recent_reviews.text: Simple and easy system where you get a punnet and start picking strawberries. Visited during the weekends and most of the strawberries were small sized, still juicy and sweet. Thereâ€™s a nice cafe with interesting fruit desserts and tea and coffee. They also sport a small souvenir and local produce store. Very welcoming to children as there is a play park.

recent_reviews.author: BANDAR HUSAIN
recent_reviews.text: My experience has been working here for 2 seasons, among other farms, this farm is the best I have ever found, I feel like home and the people there I consider like family. There are parties every season which are very exciting and fun. The atmosphere is very good, there are football fields, gym, billiards, table tennis, volleyball, etc.

recent_reviews.author: Ø¹Ø§Ø´Ù‚ Ø¹Ù…Ø§Ù†
recent_reviews.text: A large strawberry farm with a large and organized area of â€‹â€‹32 hectares and a production of 50 tons in the current season. We thank the farm owner Mr.Allan W Clark.  for cooperating with us and explaining what this farm contains, the types of strawberry seedlings, and how to market them to large stores in Scotland and the world.

recent_reviews.author: Teddy Graham
recent_reviews.text: THE most amazing Strawberries!! ğŸ˜ I'm writing this review after my second visit as I'm just so impressed with the quality both times. I think this will become a regular stop for me during the strawberry season. Staff always friendly in the kiosk too!  Nothing bad to say - well worth ducking in to grab some - you won't be sorry you did!!

recent_reviews.author: Colleen O'Keeffe
recent_reviews.text: Expecting a pick your own, as advertised on here. A small little hut selling strawberries and eggs. Disappointed

recent_reviews.author: Dorothy Warren
recent_reviews.text: A lovely place to stop off for a relaxing lunch in their large conservatory with our dog. Even better there is a gluten free menu. I was a little disappointed they've stopped doing gluten free fish and chips as they can no longer get the fish dressing but was very happy with the potato rostis and salad that I had instead. Absolutely delicious and my husband enjoyed his normal fish and chips. There is a handy playpark out the back if you have children. Staff are welcoming and so friendly. Farm shop has great assortment including gluten free crisps in pop up tube just like Pringles. We'll be back soon.

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Brodie
recent_reviews.text: Great place for breakfast, nice staff and service. The only thing I would mention is the cappuccino is far too expensive at Â£4.65!! Would recommend and go again ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: EMM Y
recent_reviews.text: Most fabulous strawberry tart Iâ€™ve had. Pricey but you pay for quality and grown on farm. Drooling for another  one ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

recent_reviews.author: Dawn
recent_reviews.text: We made a return visit on the strength of a good experience last time. Unfortunately this time was not enjoyable, as firstly, the quality and size of the drinks are not sufficient to justify the high prices. The QR code ordering is impersonal, and service wasn't great in either cafe or shop even though it was quiet. My iced coffee had no coffee in it and this was not acknowledged or rectified satisfactorily. It would have been more appropriate to make a new one but instead I paid Â£5 for half a cup of cold milk with added coffee. The member of staff who seated us was friendly and the cappuccino was nice, but had this been my first visit I would not have returned. I hope that this feedback is helpful as it is intended.

pumpkin_patches.address: Castleton Farm Cottage, Fordoun, Laurencekirk AB30 1JX

recent_reviews.author: Joao Paulino
recent_reviews.text: It was a new experience for me, but it was great. The view of all those pumpkins was wonderful! Adults and kids were happy! There, everybody can   chose their own pumpkin! Try it!!

recent_reviews.author: Deacon Smith!!!
recent_reviews.text: Wasn't expecting that much since it was free, but this place was awesome. The pumpkin patch was huge and there were lots of other activities for my 6 year old, , and lots of awesome photo opportunities.... We loved it!!

recent_reviews.author: LeeAnne Davidson
recent_reviews.text: Such a great place. Lots of pumpkins to choose from of all sizes. Little games to play too. Loved it.

recent_reviews.author: Nathan Dedman
recent_reviews.text: Really nice setup for Pumpkin picking. A few games, refreshments, a tractor to sit in, a maze and lots of pumpkins! Good value too.

recent_reviews.author: Livia Fraser
recent_reviews.text: Charming little farm. Family run, with a decent cafe and lots of opportunities to touch goats, rabbits, sheep and horses. Ideally suited to families with children under 10. Beautiful views from all over the farm. Older children would enjoy the maize maze when it is on (summer months).

recent_reviews.author: kim higgins
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing place to visit with children. Just the right amount to do. The tractor ride ( included in the entry fee) allowance you to gwt up close to horses for a pet or a feed ( small fee for food as you go in).
Bouncy pillow an extra bonus.
The cafe was amazing, catered for our daughters allergies demonstrating extra care and knowledge, guiding us to make safe choices.
The bunny barn was highlight of my daughters visit.

recent_reviews.author: Hayley Smith
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely wonderful day out for all. From bunnies to pet, lambs to see, piglets, wonderful staff (especially the guy from new Zealand), tractor ride, jumping pillow, a nice walk and lovely well kept outside space!
Enjoyed by all 3 adults and 2 kids (9&11).
You can take your own picnic (which we should've done) but food reasonable on site and cakes looked good too.
Dog friendly which was nice to include her.
I enjoyed the whole day and recommend to anyone with kids.
(PS nothing for ceoliacs food wise apart from cake or crisps)

recent_reviews.author: Josh Dodd
recent_reviews.text:
Foel Farm Park is a charming escape for animal lovers. You can get hands-on with lambs, goats and rabbits, all of which seem well-cared for. The staff is friendly and informative, making the experience educational and fun.

Besides the animals, there's a play area, a cafe with tasty treats (even a chocolate shop which I had to visit of course) and scenic walks. It's a great spot for a family day out, offering something for everyone. The farms appeal is its simplicity and the connection it creates with nature and animals.

Overall, Foel Farm Park is a delightful and engaging experience that's perfect for a family outing. The combination of animal interaction, play areas and beautiful scenery makes it a memorable visit.

recent_reviews.author: Lesia Vanova
recent_reviews.text:
We visited Finlayâ€™s Farm with my 4-year-old daughter, who is autistic, and I canâ€™t express how positive the experience was. The environment was calm, welcoming, and thoughtfully set up â€” perfect for little ones who may get overwhelmed easily.

Staff were incredibly kind and patient, giving us the space to explore while being nearby if we needed anything. The animals were gentle and well cared for, and there were lots of opportunities for hands-on interaction, which my daughter loved.

What really stood out to me was how sensory-friendly the whole place felt â€” not too noisy, not too busy, and plenty of room to move around. My daughter felt comfortable enough to engage, and it was so heartwarming to see her smiling and enjoying herself so freely.

Finlayâ€™s Farm is a hidden gem for families looking for a relaxed, inclusive day out. Weâ€™ll definitely be coming back!

recent_reviews.author: Donna Rooney
recent_reviews.text: We are just finished picking strawberries, they are the largest strawberries and they look so juicy! Cannot wait to get home and make strawberry cheesecake ğŸ˜‹  huge box for Â£27! Looking forward to the blackberry picking next time! Thank you so much

recent_reviews.author: Mr Mint
recent_reviews.text: Pick your own Strawberries with the kids! Good prices and fantastic fruit! Great place.  ğŸ˜ƒ

recent_reviews.author: Sonia Hastings
recent_reviews.text:
The guy that welcomes you (I'm guessing it's Finlay himself) is friendly, great with kids and helpful. The place is so well run but it just makes you feel like you've been allowed to pick fruit on a friend's farm which is awesome.

Me, my husband and my 5 year old son absolutely loved finding and picking the best strawberries, blackberries, gooseberries and red currants we could find.

We'll definitely be back.

recent_reviews.author: George Stewart
recent_reviews.text: This is a destination farm shop.  The variety of food available is outstanding.  They have everything from fresh veg and meat to pies, ready meals and baked goods.  There's even an old fashioned sweet shop!  (Check the photos). We had lunch in the restaurant which was really good and probably worth the visit alone.  The view from the restaurant, over Strangford Lough and Scarborough tower was impressive.  Overall, McKees is worth a visit even if you're not local.  I'll definitely be back at some point.

recent_reviews.author: Stephen
recent_reviews.text:
I always like here and it's a very special treat to get stuff here as quite expensive. Saying that last night we had the steak and onion pie with new potatoes and lemon and blueberry cheesecake.
I don't think I will ever buy a normal supermarket pie ever again as this was just so delicious. To get a pie full of big chunky bits of steak was brilliant. It was for 2 nights and all gone in one go. Can't wait to try the other options.

recent_reviews.author: David Munroe
recent_reviews.text: Great spot for breakfast or coffee and cake. Splendid views towards Scrabo Tower. As for the Farm Shop great variety of meat and vegetables and almost everything else in between. As for the sweetie section, brings back memories of childhood,â€¦.. at least until you have to pay :-)

recent_reviews.author: mplex social
recent_reviews.text: Great lunch spot, and not too pricy considering the quality. Could easily lunch for 10-14 quid including drinks. Farm shop was amazing... We bought too much, so had to freeze half of it. Staff were all very friendly. Ill defs be back, even if i have to find an excuse

pumpkin_patches.address: Strangford View, Holywood Rd, Newtownards BT23 4TQ

recent_reviews.author: margaret jess
recent_reviews.text: My two granddaughters learning to swim and they're both doing brilliant, I'd highly recommend this place .

recent_reviews.author: David Shaw
recent_reviews.text: Great place to teach kids how to swim. Everyone who works there are brilliant. The facilities are clean and maintained throughout

recent_reviews.author: Alison Kavanagh
recent_reviews.text: Nice shop and a good selection of plants and bulbs beautifully presented. A good selection of fresh vegetables and stunning cut flowers. Experience was let down by the service. A young man on the till watched a lady with a walking aid struggle to pick up and carry the items she purchased which included loose cut flowers, and he made no attempt to help wrap or assist with the items.

recent_reviews.author: JC mill
recent_reviews.text: I just love visiting Woodview Garden Centre. The store is just my style so dreamy and I always find something to bring home! The owner is such a lovely person always smiling and the staff are so helpful! I could highly recommend. It's one of my favourite garden centres around.

recent_reviews.author: Michelle Dyer
recent_reviews.text: Visited the Garden Shop yesterday. Customer service was extremely poor. Most unhelpful and unfriendly staff. I Will not be back.

recent_reviews.author: S L
recent_reviews.text: It's been my second time at Woodview,well impressed,I got some lovely indoor plants,home grown plums and apples.Also got a fry at their cafe shop,was delicious ğŸ˜‹ staff are so helpful and friendly.would highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Philisiwe Zuma
recent_reviews.text: We loved the experience. It was our first time visiting and it was brilliant. My daughter especially loved the wicked witch, she was chatting her up and my daughter came back with loads of information. Can't wait for next year!

recent_reviews.author: Brian Donovan
recent_reviews.text:
Fabulous place, very well laid out and organised. Lots of effort put in and a real Halloween atmosphere. Absolutely amazing, kids really had a great time.
Pumpkins are very expensive, food nice but again very expensive. Gift shop is an absolute rip off.

recent_reviews.author: Shannen Smith
recent_reviews.text:
The pumpkin farm was absolutely brilliant today. It was a first for my mother and friend. We were surprisingly impressed with everything to the food, the story telling, the experience and of course having great fun picking the pumpkins and around every corner was something. Adults to children will enjoy it.
The attention to detail in many things made the experience worth while and the far drive we made for it

recent_reviews.author: Dermot Moynihan
recent_reviews.text:
We visited with our two children and loved every bit of this.
It was raining heavily but we put on our coats and walked through it all.
Everything is well designed and very interesting.
The witch was excellent and not really that scary. The field with the pumkins is not that far and we were able to collect a few in a wheelbarrow.
We spent much of our time dancing at the Pixie Disco in the marquee due to the rain and got some face painting done.
Grabbed some nice food and coffee before we headed off.

pumpkin_patches.address: Pumpkin Farm, Carran, Killarney, Co. Kerry, V93 HXF6, Ireland

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Butt Farm Pumpkin Patch, Beverley (Open from 27th September 2025)

recent_reviews.author: J K
recent_reviews.text:
Visited the pumpkin patch today and had an amazing afternoon. A lot of effort had gone into setting up the patch and it was lovely to walk around. I think the fact itâ€™s free is absolutely amazing, as a lot of pumpkin patches so charge an entrance free and although this often includes a free pumpkin we normally only pick one for the kids to take home. We picked up three pumpkins two big and one small and only spent Â£7.50 which I think is a bargain.
They also have a spooky trail which was free to join in and the prize was a glamping break and a little bit of fun for the kids as you go around
Overall really pleased and will definitely return.

Only negative I will say is the little gift shop was expensive and didnâ€™t have any prices advertised so I would ask the prices beforehand but otherwise amazing day out.

recent_reviews.author: Edyta Dzikowska
recent_reviews.text: Nice place to spent some quality, family time.

recent_reviews.author: Emma Smith
recent_reviews.text:
From the moment we pulled into the pumpkin patch, we knew it was going to be something special. The grounds were pristine, the air was crisp, and the colours of autumn were stunning. Hereâ€™s why this visit deserves a five-star shout-out:

The staff greeted us with big smiles and were incredibly friendly. They could not have done more for us during our visit, they were very approachable and friendly, nothing was too much.

There were several charming backdropsâ€”rustic fences, sunlit pumpkin patches, that made our photos look like postcard material.

Our visit well-paced and reasonably priced. We felt like we got a full, authentic day of fun without any pressure or overcrowding.

Would highly recommend visiting this pumpkin farm in this season. Itâ€™s a heartwarming, photo-ready, family-friendly destination that leaves you with a big grin and a bucket full of memoriesâ€”and pumpkins. Weâ€™ll be back next year for sure!

recent_reviews.author: Brian
recent_reviews.text: A fantastic family and dog friendly pumpkin patch. Super friendly staff. Shout out to Jen who helped us get the perfect Halloween family photo ğŸƒ. Great value for money! Weâ€™ll be back this year.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Kilnford Farm Shop & Farmhouse Kitchen Cafe

recent_reviews.author: George McLeod
recent_reviews.text: Remembered the cafÃ© had a nice â€œvibeâ€ but disappointed today. Asked if the Lentil Soup was vegetarian and they were unable to confirm. Chefâ€™s day off apparently. Perhaps not somewhere to go if details matter such as allergies. Opted for the macaroni cheese which was very good but came with chips. I was expecting salad and a look at the menu later said salad or chips. We werenâ€™t given an option. So, not sure weâ€™ll be back.

recent_reviews.author: Marta Skorubska
recent_reviews.text: Great place, the farm shop with great variety of products   fresh meat already seasoned meat. Reasonable prices , good quality of food. Restaurant stuff is super friendly , has a good size menu , delicious food, and drinks.

recent_reviews.author: Betty â€œBbeeâ€ Brown
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely and friendly cafe.
Food is great ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Graham Foster
recent_reviews.text: Lovely butcher and small shop stopped at the cafe for a coffee and Tea tray bake millionaire short cake and plain scone with jam excellent on our way home going to stop  and buy some meat from butcher home grown from owners farm and a big selection of cheese and curry sauces and   honey and cheese biscuits. All are good prices as was the Cafe. Recommend.

pumpkin_patches.address: The Old Glen Road, Dumfries DG2 8PT

recent_reviews.author: Danielle Herbert
recent_reviews.text: A great place for children to burn off a lot of energy. We went on a very hot day and being able to be inside was great- the barns were cooler. The range of soft play was great especially as we had children ranging from 3-11 years old in our party. Not a huge amount of animals to see- would be even better if there was a small animal area to pet rabbits etc. The outside play areas were great and even though it was busy there was lots of space etc. My daughter got bitten quite badly on the hand by one of the ponies but a member of staff carried out first aid and completed an accident form. The animals are very used to being fed so if you don't have food they think you are the carrot!!

recent_reviews.author: Laura Jones
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant place to visit with children! Tons of things for children to do, inside and outdoor play areas. Beautiful animals to stroke and feed, especially the donkeys. We didn't eat here but the menu was available, prices were brilliant.

recent_reviews.author: Bryan Rosie
recent_reviews.text: Lovely for a day out. So so many different play areas for children, both indoor and out. An excellent tractor and old farm machinery exhibition and lovely friendly Â£1 tractor rides.

recent_reviews.author: Valley family
recent_reviews.text: Amazing for the kids. Good butchers, lovely fresh meat, good prices in the cafe. All around great day out only problem you'll struggle to get your kids to leave!

recent_reviews.author: Karolina Morris
recent_reviews.text: Really nice surroundings, in case of bad weather you do have a shelter, I visited when the weather was stunning. I haven't had food but shopped for some local Pembrokeshire produce, food looked nice and fresh. The place could do with small playground for kids. You can feed animals, which is nice, relax and have a chat. I have also noticed and read you can book to stay for few nights Becks Bay camping. Nice little place.

recent_reviews.author: Jamie Lawrence
recent_reviews.text: Very nice atmosphere, beautiful view, pigs/goats/chickens in view, nice hills im sight. I arrived after 3pm so couldn't get proper food but had sausage rolls. Have nice selection of drinks

recent_reviews.author: Benjie Haston
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place, serving great local food and draft beers & ciders. Picturesque setting in the countryside and farm animals to see. We were staying onsite in the Shepherds Hut set aside in a quiet location which was amazing with a wood fired hot tub. Thanks for a great stay

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte
recent_reviews.text: Staying for few days very near by so based on reviews called in for lunch. Welsh rarebit and ham & brie toasted sandwich with flat white and tea. Service was quick and friendly. Plenty of seating chose outside under canopy. Food was tasty and good portions. Shop had lots of goodies to be tempted with. Nice to see animals and feed for families with children young or old .

recent_reviews.author: Sian Creak
recent_reviews.text:
We visited the Saturday before Easter for the first time & loved it.
We didnâ€™t arrive until 2:30 (planned arrival time) and had so much fun outside we didnâ€™t have the chance to explore inside other than to grab a coffee and cake.

In my opinion itâ€™s fairly priced, not cheap for a family with a few children but worth it. Clean & plenty to do. Lots of animals and a huge indoor play centre that looked great so you can spend the whole day to get value for money.

My little boy is almost 3 and loved it, weâ€™ll definitely be back.

The coffee and cake(s) were lovely, we also bought a few bits from the farm shop on the way out. I really appreciate local goods being sold so that was great as I didnâ€™t know there was a farm shop. Iâ€™d seen comments that the food there is expensive, but personally didnâ€™t think it was too bad when looking at the menu while getting coffee. Maybe not as cheap as some play centres but I canâ€™t comment more as we didnâ€™t buy them.
Picnics are allowed on picnic benches outside and not in the cafe area.

Also thanks to the social media team, I messaged the evening before to ask what sort of food is served as I couldnâ€™t see anything online and had an informative reply quickly even though it was out of typical office hours.

We bought tickets in advance as it was Easter weekend so thought that would be best. There were some Easter activities going on which was lovely too.

There are additional costs for the train ride and a few other things but the train was only Â£3 per person which if you have a little one that likes trains isnâ€™t too bad. You can purchase tickets online with your entry, at the entrance and at the train station before getting on (card accepted).

recent_reviews.author: Megan Stevens
recent_reviews.text:
On entering Cefn farm in knew i was going to enjoy, the first thing I saw was The GUINEA PIGS.. I absolutely love guinea pigs.

We started at the petting zoo, which was great, my son is now old enough to enjoy petting animals too, so that made our experience even better.
As we walked around, we fed some of the other animals, which my boy enjoyed very much.
I love how there were view points for photo opportunities.
The farm was a really good size, I felt we had a decent time and was able to go back and forth to the farm.

Softplay was great, lots to do for kids and great value, Â£11 for the farm, softplay and playground too.
I loved this little farm, a lovely good few hours and even better with friends.

recent_reviews.author: Big Brain Languages
recent_reviews.text:
So much more than a farm!

Really impressed with the facilities - it could cater for all weathers and there are lots of different spaces for kids to enjoy - from stables to playground and a large indoor soft play. Thereâ€™s a cateen there with decent enough food.

recent_reviews.author: Gwynfor Rees
recent_reviews.text: The facilities are great. A fantastic treat for the kids. Fun activity area is a bonus

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Cantref - Adventure Farm in South Wales

recent_reviews.author: Caroline White
recent_reviews.text:
My daughter and I have just returned home from a Cantref Riding holiday. We had the most amazing stay in one of their pods that was self-contained in its own private space with its own wood fired hot tub and bbq. The views from there, and actually everywhere on the farm, are stunning. The beds were so comfortable and spacious, and we had everything we needed.
The horse riding was incredible. We were allowed to groom and tack our ponies in the morning before heading out with our group.  Our guide took us up into the valleys and hills, allowing the group to go at a faster pace when the terrain allowed and if we were comfortable with it. The horses go  up and down some really rough terrain in places with ease. We stopped for lunch midway through the day where we were provided with a delicious packed lunch freshly made, and the horses had time with their bridles off.
All in all, the most incredible hands-on riding experience we could have wished for, all made that much better experience because of the fabulous staff who work in every part of the park. We loved it from the moment we arrived, to the time we left.

recent_reviews.author: Michelle McArdle
recent_reviews.text: Wow!!! What an amazing time we had from start to finish , we were quite nervous at the start especially myself as I hadnâ€™t been on a horse for awhile due to having a double hip replacement, this didnâ€™t phase our instructor who was amazing she talked us through every step of the trek and was so patient and kind to myself and my daughter! The views when going over the mountain were incredible and my daughter had amazing opportunities for photos! Thank you so much to all at Cantref! Highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Naomi W
recent_reviews.text: We did a half day ride at Cantref yesterday. It was amazing!! The horses were clearly well cared for and enjoyed their job. They really looked after us over some quite tricky  terrain. The route was great and was enjoyed by all of our family who ranged from beginner to intermediate riders. We loved it and will definitely be back to do it again.

recent_reviews.author: John Dufton
recent_reviews.text: Had a fantastic 2 hour ride on Dexter while my friend rode Dumbledore. Both horses were super and so gentle natured. The ride was very scenic and quite varied and we had the opportunity to do a bit of cantering. The set up at Cantref is very professional. The horses were well cared for and our guide whose name escapes me was very friendly and communicative throughout the ride. There are so few true trekking centres left in Wales and a reflection on how well things are done here that they are still around.

pumpkin_patches.address: Upper Cantref Farm, Cantref, Brecon LD3 8LR

recent_reviews.author: Katie McAtamney
recent_reviews.text:
We Had a Fab Time Walking Around the Pumpkin ğŸƒ Field.
The variety and size of pumpkins is great catering for all your Halloween needs.
The staff are really friendly and happy to help.
The prices depend on the size you choose, but the most is Â£10 which I think is very reasonable.(start at Â£2)
They have 7 different colours to choose from which we thought was amazing.
Definitely worth a visit with lots of photo opportunities too. ğŸ˜Š
We will be back next year.

recent_reviews.author: Lucia Lietke
recent_reviews.text: Recommend going to the pumpkin farm in the autumn and pick some fruit in the summer it's a lovely place! Friendly staff.

recent_reviews.author: jlashm lashm
recent_reviews.text: Lovely pumpkin picking farm. We come here every year and the farmers are always friendly. You can tell it's a working farm as you drive in there are beautiful fruit trees in autumnal colours. The pumpkins are grown there in the field and there's usually a trailer and hay bales to explore. All different types of pumpkins and gourds and they really know their crop- always get good advice on preparation and cooking. The kids love it and it's a good place to spend a couple of hours letting them do their thing, as the carpark is far from the field, good visibility for letting them explore free range.

recent_reviews.author: Louisa Bond
recent_reviews.text:
Went there this morning, was amazing! The amount of pumpkins in the field and the range was incredible. The staff were very friendly and welcoming.
For the variety the price was very good, small pumpkins for only Â£1 and they are so pretty!
Larger pumpkins from Â£4-Â£8 but are definitely much better than the ones in supermarket.
Overall the experience was great, I definitely feel halloween coming !!
Would recommend!!!

recent_reviews.author: Paul Cayzer
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place, lots of fun and great value. Very helpful farmers explaining which varieties are actually good to eat. Looking forward to next year.

recent_reviews.author: Del Salhi
recent_reviews.text:
ğŸAmazing day out in the patch! Exceptional pumpkins, family-friendly setup, and top-notch staff (big shout-outs to George, Anna and Roman!

Only open on weekends and during mid-term. Prices extremely reasonable with a great selection of varieties of pumpkins.

Day out brought a smile to this American's face!ğŸƒ

pumpkin_patches.address: Camping and Caravanning Club, Hoath Fruit Farm Opposite, Bekesbourne Ln, Canterbury CT3 4AB

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Holmeswood Flower Farm / Pumpkin Place Pick Your Own

recent_reviews.author: Faye Whittaker
recent_reviews.text:
A beautiful farm with gorgeous staff to match.
I visit for pumpkins every year but have never been for flowers before! The fields are stunning, flowers are beautiful and its really easy to get round. The staff are wonderful, in particular Grace, who is so kind. She even gave me a free sunflower ğŸŒ». Loved the little caravan and enjoyed a red velvet cupcake which was a lovely treat. Cant wait to come again! Super dog friendly and all round gorgeous place to visit.

recent_reviews.author: Jane Kimberley
recent_reviews.text: A truly wonderful place to visit. First went in 2022 for pumpkin picking and it was so much fun and have been back every year since, plus the added bonus of sunflower picking last year and just had a visit this weekend to do more of the same. Great place to meet with friends and their kids. Loads for them to do and itâ€™s dog friendly also. Farmer Grace and the rest of the team are just super friendly. Definitely recommend. See you soon.

recent_reviews.author: Elizabeth Quick
recent_reviews.text: Myself and my friend took our children to Holmeswood Flower Farm to go flower picking. We absolutely loved it there and are already trying to plan our next visit...hopefully to the wreath making! The flowers are beautiful and there were such a good selection available to pick. We then had these carefully wrapped by Grace. We will definitely come back. Thank you!

recent_reviews.author: Julie Kuczera
recent_reviews.text: This was our first visit to Holmeswood flower farm but definitely wonâ€™t be our last.  What a fab place. We went in search of sunflowers and were not disappointed in the size quality and the price per stem to be able to cut our own fresh sunflowers!  What did surprise us was the scale of the British grown garden flowers also available for cutting yourself, and again so reasonably priced. Farmer Grace was so welcoming and generous with her time, enthusiasm and knowledge. The farm is a credit to her and her team. With on site refreshments and play facilities for children the farm is a fab place to visit and spend an afternoon.

recent_reviews.author: Julia Lu-Sellers
recent_reviews.text: Great selection of pumpkins combined with a fantastic view. Good facilities too.

recent_reviews.author: Muzamil
recent_reviews.text: Dan was extremely helpful, especially when it came to explaining the documents.

recent_reviews.author: Gus Ferguson
recent_reviews.text: Great afternoon picking pumpkins! Good selection of all shapes and sizes of pumpkins ğŸƒ and great coffee

recent_reviews.author: Grace Harding
recent_reviews.text: Took my son pumpkin picking and itâ€™s lovely at Country Pumpkins. Loads of pumpkins, with a variety of species and sizes available. Muddy but thatâ€™s part of the experience. Good facilities too.

pumpkin_patches.address: Country Pumpkin PYO Patch, Tunbridge Wells TN3 0RL

recent_reviews.author: TOM
recent_reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at Delamere Farm! Itâ€™s a great place to spend the day with family. You can pick fresh strawberries and sunflowers â€” such a lovely experience. Thereâ€™s no entry fee for the strawberry farm; you simply pay for the strawberries you pick, which are weighed at the end. They accept both cash and card, making it very convenient. The farm shop has a fantastic selection of fresh produce and other items. Plenty of parking is available too. Highly recommended for a fun and wholesome day out!

recent_reviews.author: Ian M T
recent_reviews.text: Rugged, rustic, enjoyable strawberry picking, with a small farm shop and plant sale. Entrance is hard to find and the ground is not suitable for the partially ambulant, but it is a cheshire farm doing what it does best. The hydroponics are at or just below eye level so no need to bend down to pick the fruit. Great fun with the little people.

recent_reviews.author: Brett Robertson
recent_reviews.text:
Visited here today for strawberry picking. There was a good selection of strawberries and we even picked some sweetcorn too.

I was however rather surprised and disappointed to see a charge for the sunflower field as in previous years it has been free. Â£3 for adults and Â£2 for children I think is steep as for us that would have been Â£16 in addition to the Â£20 we'd just spent on strawberries and corn. Â£1 per person, or a charge for just those not buying strawberries and just coming for the photo opportunities I'd agree with, but for those already spending I think it's a bit much.

recent_reviews.author: Lindsay Park
recent_reviews.text:
Good quality produce,well presented.
New Cheshire potatoes and their own grown Asparagus were purchased.
Numerous well tended plants were also offered for sale.

recent_reviews.author: Charles George
recent_reviews.text:
Very nice place
Can't eat while you pick the fruits but you can pay after you purchase the box.
Also good play ground for kids and good cafe

recent_reviews.author: Sharaline Samuel
recent_reviews.text: It's was a very good experience for the family. We got to pick some raspberries and strawberries. After we took a few photos while my little one played in the big sandpit. We also bought a jar or raspberry and strawberry jam to take home. I would definitely visit again

recent_reviews.author: Oliver Frisk
recent_reviews.text: Amazing place! The most delicious strawberries we have ever had. We have an hour drive but sooo worth it! Lovely coffee and playground for kids. Dan is lovely always chatting to people. They even have strawberries at the shop if you are short of time. Raspberry season is also a must.

recent_reviews.author: Dean Hayes
recent_reviews.text:
This is nice and local to us albeit down some tight lanes who's upkeep is questionable in places. Drivers are usually pretty courteous though, unless they have someone's amazon basics parcel to deliver.
Once on site there is plenty of parking that is hard packed so not an issue when wet.
There's a little cafe on site but we haven't used it yet and the pick-your-own is as easy grabbing a container or wheelbarrow and heading off into the farm.
Prices are reasonable and the fruit/veg/pumpkins are always good quality.
The play park is a good size with lots of covered seating for parents.
A nice hour or two out in the fresh air.

pumpkin_patches.address: Strawberry Fields, Hampshire, Egbury Rd, St Mary Bourne, Andover SP11 6DQ

recent_reviews.author: Hollie Delsignore
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely place to visit with so much choice of fresh fruit to pick. The strawberries are under cover - so donâ€™t let the weather change your plans!
The whole site is clean, tidy and plenty of room for parking. Itâ€™s encouraging to see eco friendly tubs and packing used.
The staff are friendly and helpful, plus a huge bonus they have a park, lots of benches and somewhere you can purchase hot and cold drinks, plus snacks etc.

recent_reviews.author: LiamF123
recent_reviews.text: Attended today for my partners birthday with her parents and were told we couldnâ€™t share a pot as a couple, so her parents had to give up their pot so she could walk round with me and they had to wait at the cafe as they were told they werenâ€™t allowed to walk through the strawberry field with us, I would highly recommend amending this rule as i can picture many families and couples having the same issue. This wouldâ€™ve made all the difference in my review as we had a nice time wouldâ€™ve been nice to share it with the rest of her family.

recent_reviews.author: Ursula Oliver
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place. We enjoyed this far more than we expected. Not just a pyo experience but things for the children 2 do and somewhere 2 get a cuppa. Highly recommend

recent_reviews.author: Sophie Brewer
recent_reviews.text: Wide variety of pumpkins and large field to squelch around in. Well thought out experience with activities for children in addition to pumpkin picking. Great choice of food outlets and awesome photo opportunities. It was our first time visiting and we will definitely be back next year!

recent_reviews.author: Nada Al-Kharusi
recent_reviews.text: Lovely experience with the family. Great sweet juicy fruits available for picking. We got to pick strawberries, raspberries and plums.

recent_reviews.author: heidi dachs
recent_reviews.text:
We had a lovely breakfast here. The full English was enjoyed by my partner and I had the pancakes with yoghurt and fresh berries. Both plates were completely empty when we finished. Then we went in to the farm shop and bought fresh supplies for the rest of the weekend.
Plenty of outside tables, including some undercover and a few tables inside. Good parking. Playground for the children. Dog friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Darren. Ellis
recent_reviews.text:
Awesome my grandkids and my mother and wife loved it strawberries were plentiful the two gremlins each cheekily tried one and offered me a bite .... omg so sweet 4 full punnets in total and bought some awesome plums too ... one little gripe we went to the cafe first cappuccinos were lovely the kids had apple juice but that's where the gripe is .. why is it Â£1.00 more expensive  to buy the same applejuice that is sold in the shop ??? Otherwise we will be there earlier next year.
Also other fruit picking places want nearly a tenner per person to fruit picking clives only Â£2 that's always going to get me there from now on

recent_reviews.author: Andrea Edwardson
recent_reviews.text: Considering this place isn't very big, we were there for nearly 3 hours. We had a lovely lunch in the cafe; lamb kebab, sandwiches and salad and fries. We picked our own strawberries, visited the shop, the kids played in the playground, and finished off with ice-cream.

pumpkin_patches.address: Willingsworth, Clive's Fruit Farm, Upton Upon Severn, Worcester WR8 0SA

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Stanleys Farm Shop & Pick Your Own

recent_reviews.author: Aravinth Samy
recent_reviews.text:
We visited Stanleys farm today for a dayout.
We are warmly welcomed by the owner lady, who gave us the necessary instructions. We picked up some baskets and a wheelbarrow and started to continue to handpick fruits and vegetables.
Fruits and vegetables are seasonal. It was sunny and the breeze from the field felt refreshing. We spent a few hours in the field, and took our time to pick our vegetables.
Once done we headed to the shop, which had milk, meat, dairy, jam,pickles,cakes, fruit and vegetables.
Staff was friendly and due to the quantity we picked they offered a box and packed it by the lovely lady. Prices are fairly priced for the quality.

There is a small cafe and it's run by the husband. He was also friendly and had a good conversation. There is tea, coffee, water, cold drinks and sandwiches. Prices are reasonable.

Overall it is worth visiting with your family and enjoying the calm, cool and relaxing nature.

recent_reviews.author: Ellie Young
recent_reviews.text:
We had the best afternoon visiting what we are now coining 'Kidderminster's sweetest spot"!
Immediately you could feel this place was strong on family values with strong core values.
As we admired the Caboose we were greeted by Jed, who advised us of the menu in the week as opposed to the weekend. On weekdays they mainly serve sandwiches and sausage rolls, whereas on the weekend the full menu. Which wasn't an issue at all. We enjoyed delicious homemade milkshakes, coffees, sandwiches, and sausage rolls which were all absolutely incredible and reasonably priced! The weather was glorious so we spent some time basking in the sun, while my little boy made a friend and were running and playing in the fields in our eyeline.
We headed out to the picking fields, full of choice fruits, veggies and flowers. We did take our pushchair for our baby who was a bit sleepy at this point, which wasn't an issue, but if you can avoid I probably would for space.
After fruit picking, we headed to the shop to pay for our goods and were so impressed with the shop offerings and made some impromptu purchases.
All staff we encountered were super friendly, helpful and smiling.
What a lovely place!

recent_reviews.author: Emma Sharp
recent_reviews.text: Great place with friendly staff. Pick your own veg and fruit very reasonably priced.

recent_reviews.author: Colin Darling
recent_reviews.text: Good farm shop with a variety of local produce. Pick your own. Will use this more often now we have found it. They sell Drew's tomato products from Little Whitley which is nice. There is a cafe selling good barista style coffee and snacks such as hot chicken sandwich.

pumpkin_patches.address: Fishers Castle Farm, Sandy Ln, Harvington, Kidderminster DY10 4NF

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Wasing Pick Your Own Pumpkins & Woodland Trail

recent_reviews.author: Sylwia Galka
recent_reviews.text: It was first time that we attended PYO at Wasing and we could not love it more ğŸ¥° The best part was wishing well, fairy garden and space to light the candle for the loved one who is no longer here. My daughter loved picking her own pumpkins and we carved them this evening â˜ºï¸Not to mention food and coffee which was delicious â˜ºï¸ I would like to also add that I completed the woodland trail on crutches without any issues. Thank you Wasing for the great event and we cannot see you in the future. Sylwia, Gabi & Jan â˜ºï¸

recent_reviews.author: Max Nova
recent_reviews.text: We spent a lovely morning with our daughter, she had tons of fun on the magical trail and choosing the pumpkins in the field. Friendly stuff and overall a very well organised event that we highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Clive Richardson
recent_reviews.text:
I read some of the comments but have to say my kids absolutely loved it â€¦ yes can you buy a pumpkin cheaper in Lidl or aldi â€¦ probably â€¦ but itâ€™s about the experience for the kids!

My kids loved the face painting and hair / makeup lady â€¦ especially her design for my son.

Absolutely recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Denisa Costin
recent_reviews.text: Was good fun! Always enjoy coming here with the little one. The decorations were lovely and creative! I do think it is a bit pricey for what is it and wish they had more children activities, like a drawing hut or pumpkin wheelbarrow games or something. But nonetheless, it's once years and little ones enjoys running through the fields ğŸ˜‚

pumpkin_patches.address: Pick Your Own Pumpkins & Woodland Trail, Wasing Ln, Aldermaston, Reading RG7 4LY

recent_reviews.author: Berglas71
recent_reviews.text: A great wee gem of a local farm shop selling local produce. There is a nice selection of fresh and frozen foods along with a variety of drinks and every ingredient you would need in the kitchen. The prices reflect the quality of food for sale. The assistants were polite, prompt and well presented. There is a large free carpark outside.

recent_reviews.author: Tommy -
recent_reviews.text: A splendid family run farm shop offering an array of quality fresh produce from their own farm and other local producers alongside an impressive selection of carefully sourced artisan fare from further afield. A thoroughly wholesome setup with friendly & welcoming service at the heart. A real gem of a place.

recent_reviews.author: Lee_a _Donaldson
recent_reviews.text: I love, LOVE, a farm shop, I do not know why for the life of me I had not been to this farm shop as we have spent time in the area over the years. So our first visit was of course one of grabbing all the goodies I spied. The meat looked fantastic and we picked up lots to take home and freeze. I loved the look of their frozen meals section, made in their on site kitchen, they looked very tasty. The shop is packed with lots of local suppliers and lots of fresh produce, it is hard not to get carrier away when you do not have the luxury of such a great store closer to home. Staff are amazing, so friendly and lovely to have a chit chat when going through the check out. One of my new fave farm shops and it will always be on my list any time I am in the area from now on.

recent_reviews.author: Jamie Young
recent_reviews.text:
Incredible farm shop packed with all sorts of goodies!
Well priced, well stocked, friendly staff. Nice seating area outside to enjoy a coffee

recent_reviews.author: Radu Moldovan
recent_reviews.text: Best easter ever.... Perfect choice!!!

recent_reviews.author: Deb
recent_reviews.text: Gorgeous setting.

recent_reviews.author: Johnny Szaka
recent_reviews.text: One of the greatest kids playgrounds I have seen. A timber castle with slides, rope bridge, and a sensational view of farm animals. The shop is just as incredible. What a range of produce, including the biggest blueberries I have ever seen, deli items, snacks, gifts, and clothing. There was a very popular cafe too, but we opted for coffee and ice cream, both very good. Highly recommend stop in here.

recent_reviews.author: Pauline Duncan
recent_reviews.text: Very enjoyable time at Gloagburn Farm Shop - lunch, shopping and flower picking. Starting with lunch, as we had our small dog with us, we were shown to the outdoor dining area and a heated booth by  a friendly male server. Service was pleasant and efficient and the food delicious. After lunch took the opportunity to do some shopping and also pick some tulips. The whole experience was a pleasure - each member of staff was polite and helpful. Looking forward to our next visit already.

recent_reviews.author: Yarpole Belfry
recent_reviews.text: Lovely lady on the cheese counter, very helpful and nice to chat to so we came away with so much cheese ğŸ˜‚ cost a small fortune but worth it. Lovely farm shop, very well stocked and in beautiful surroundings. Adored the sheep and highland cows just chilling in the sun.

recent_reviews.author: val Forbes
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful place and family friendly. Good food and spacious parking. They have a playground and a wee farm, spotted a highland coo

recent_reviews.author: Derek G
recent_reviews.text:
Great little cafÃ© & grocers. Very friendly. Soon to expand their kitchen~
We had a tasty fresh soup & smoothies - great selection in the grocery.
Excellent seating, big comfy antique lounging. Rustic vibes. Dog friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Joanna Gale
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely always worth a visit to Westerton! We went down in the Easter holidays and we spent hours there! We seen the animals, fed the goats, played in the sand pit, played on the swing & slide, kids jumped on the bouncy castles in the barn and we had absolutely delicious lunch and bakes. All the staff are super lovely and welcoming. Can't wait for our next visit

recent_reviews.author: Z D (Zacitup)
recent_reviews.text:
This farm shop is an excellent place for grocery shopping, and I find myself visiting occasionally due to the freshness and quality of the products. The staff are exceptionally welcoming, and the service is outstanding. It is somewhat expensive, but the quality justifies the higher prices. I do wish they offered a greater selection of locally sourced products and foods.

I plan to continue shopping here, especially because I'm particularly fond of the peanut butter machine, it's a highlight for me. I would definitely rate this place 10 out of 10. The only drawback is its remote location, making it quite a journey to reach since it's quite literally in the middle of nowhere. However, the trip is worthwhile for anyone looking to source top-notch ingredients for cooking or baking and to explore the farm and make it a day out.

recent_reviews.author: Lorna McCallum
