recent_reviews.text: Discovered this little oasis travelling from Fraserburgh to Edinburgh.  5mins off the A90.  What a delight - lovely setup with comfy chairs, good coffee and local supplier products.  Big thanks to Scott who made us feel so welcome.  We'll definitely be back.

recent_reviews.author: Annwyl Rogers
recent_reviews.text: Such a great place to visit with the kids. Dylan and Laura are very warm and welcoming and have created a lovely little setup. We attended pumpkin picking in the evening and had a great time. There were lots of different types of pumpkins and lots of props around - great photo opportunities. The kids also loved playing in the play area whilst we enjoyed a drink and homemade cake. So nice to see the Welsh language being used on signs etc too. We are excited to return for strawberry picking in a few months

recent_reviews.author: John Torbet
recent_reviews.text: Lovely PYO just outside Pwllheli. Really good set up with 2 fields of strawberry beds which are grown off the ground which helps the quality. Offer of other items at the the small payment shack.

recent_reviews.author: Lirdane Freeman
recent_reviews.text: I have visited for both strawberryğŸ“ picking and pumpkinğŸƒ picking .... well, what an amazing place to go lots fun to have, great little cafe to grab and cake and drinks ğŸ˜ğŸ‘ still can't get over the different variety of pumpkins and how red and delightful them strawberry are !!!  Thank you for having us will be back soon â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Kimberley Howie
recent_reviews.text: A great place for pumpkin picking, the little ones loved using their wheelbarrow to collect the pumpkins. The staff were lovely and we enjoyed nice weather for a cuppa and cake afterwards. Would highly recommend ğŸ˜€

recent_reviews.author: Mrunal Deshmukh
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful farm. Sunflowers were in full bloom so best time to visit is August. Milkshakes were a bit expensive  I thought but tasty nonetheless. Ice creams were delicious too. all homemade. There's a couple of milk dispensing machines , the milk comes from their own dairy. Family run business, very nice people.

recent_reviews.author: Tracy Lou
recent_reviews.text:
First time visiting â€” great experience!
The directions from the website were spot on. Just a heads up: the turn into the farm has some large potholes, so take it slow when turning in.

We tried the ice cream â€” absolutely delicious! The burger bar looked great too; weâ€™ll definitely be coming back to try that.

The views are stunning, and there are picnic benches available, perfect for enjoying your ice cream outdoors.

We also visited the sunflower field for pick-your-own (PYO).

Plenty of parking, The staff were all extremely friendly and welcoming.

Highly recommend â€” weâ€™ll be back!

recent_reviews.author: Glynn Williams
recent_reviews.text:
First visit to Wallhope, and it was just a quick one. Their gelato was absolutely lush, and decently priced. I had strawberry & chocolate, and they tasted amazing!
7 flavours out today, and all seemed very popular!
We'll definitely be back!

Looking forward to the burgers, when that opens!

recent_reviews.author: Eric Engstrom
recent_reviews.text: Nice little farm that we found ourselves at quite accidentally. We had just enough time to enjoy some gelato and were very pleased. The staff was very friendly and easy to talk to. It made our day better.

recent_reviews.author: Karen Crossland
recent_reviews.text: Quaint farm shop, cafe that welcomes dogs. Lovely food. Nice outdoor area where events often played. Good parking, even some pigs to look at. Overall excellent place

recent_reviews.author: Karen Scott
recent_reviews.text: Went to support the Mowgli dog show in aid of Claire House. First time iâ€™d been and wasnâ€™t disappointed . Plenty of food outlets , nice areas to sit and have a bite to eat or drink. Met Nisha Katona who always takes time to chat and have a pic taken, lovely lady. Nice day out and glad to support such a worthy cause.

recent_reviews.author: Sam R
recent_reviews.text: Visited for Wirral Classic Car show 2nd year to see if any better & answer is NO, we arrived at Clatterbridge roundabout at 1:00pm to get to field were parking was at 1:45, many cars over heating including our classsic car & alot turning round & gave up. Traffic managment is not working!!!! - Once in show some classic cars were already leaving such a shame because some really nice cars!!! Food in cafe very expensive.

recent_reviews.author: Dan Foy
recent_reviews.text: We went on the Wirral Classic cars show day,we go every year its always a good turn out and the farm shop was busy and the was a few food and drink stalls.

pumpkin_patches.address: Old Clatterbridge Road, Bebington, Wirral CH63 4JB

recent_reviews.author: Matt Watkeys
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic place to pick your own fruit and very friendly farmer. Will go again

recent_reviews.author: Ben Cook
recent_reviews.text: This is a great 'Pick Your Own' farm in season. Nice place to take children to in the months of June and July to pick strawberries and raspberries on a warm day. Prices are very reasonable too - made some nice jam this year with what we picked - Thanks!

recent_reviews.author: charlotte F
recent_reviews.text: Was looking forward to some fruit picking, finally found the place after asking a man, The place has been closed for the last 2 + years! What a waste of a day so disappointed

recent_reviews.author: Lorraine A
recent_reviews.text: Hidden gem in Pembs. Visited this year for Pumpkins - huge range, great quality and lots of fun walking around with the sledge! Friendly local farmer. Highly recommend.

pumpkin_patches.search_query: pick your own pumpkins Northern Ireland

recent_reviews.author: Franchesca Causin
recent_reviews.text:
Â£5 entrance fee!
You can pay with cash or PayPal.

The owner was very lovely. My family enjoyed taking pictures in the sunflower fields. The blackberries were sweet and free to pick.

There was a fake hale bale cow to the left when you walked in the entrance. My little cousins enjoyed climbing up and down it.

There's also a little house if you keep walking right after you enter. There are 2 swings that my cousins enjoyed bumping into each other. There's also an adorable fairy walk. It's a wee path where you can see a bunch of fairy statues and houses as well as big ladybugs.

There are animals you can pet as well but when we went they stayed in a corner away from everyone, I think they were tired. I loved the goat that welcomed everyone who entered the animal petting area.

recent_reviews.author: Myles Wolfe
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant farm to take the kids to and the host was so friendly and welcoming definitely recommend

recent_reviews.author: Lynsay D
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful animals who are very friendly and extremely well treated. Very professional

recent_reviews.author: Beth Mulholland
recent_reviews.text: This is my family-run business and this is not an open farm â˜ºï¸

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Corderry Fruit Farm - Pick your Own
pumpkin_patches.search_query: pick your own pumpkins Northern Ireland

recent_reviews.author: Seta McEvoy
recent_reviews.text: We had a fantastic experience at Corderry farm for the Easter trail. All the staff were very welcoming and helpful. Our little girl is 2 and there was so much for her to see and get involved in, no matter the weather. We look forward to booking the next event. Highly recommended!! Thank you â˜ºï¸!

recent_reviews.author: Sabarrish Srinivasan
recent_reviews.text: A beautiful farm with many covered kids activities corners and a covered picnic area, that is perfect for the Irish weather. The strawberry tunnels are fully covered so even on a rainy day, you can still have a great day at this farm.  The staff are absolutely friendly and helpful.  Having experienced one too many fruit pickings on a weekend only to have the rain ruin the plans, this place has been a fantastic option for all weathers.

recent_reviews.author: lynn coffey
recent_reviews.text: My two little girls and myself go everytime they have an event on, itâ€™s one of the best farms weâ€™ve ever been at. From face paint to pony rides to the pizza from Tadgh and paddyâ€™s and the cute coffee truck. Itâ€™s a safe area to let the kids run around and have fun. Well done to all the team that make this happen.

recent_reviews.author: Leanne Callaghan
recent_reviews.text: Went for Easter, it was our first visit. It was a brilliant day, staff were so lovely and friendly and the grounds were beautiful, we really enjoyed our walk around, the egg hunt, meeting the Easter bunny, face painting, pony rides games galore and a fabulous pizza from Tadgh & Paddy's Pizzas to finish our day off. Highly recommend Corderry, can't wait to go back for another event

pumpkin_patches.address: Corderry House, Corderry, Dundalk, Co. Louth, A91 N62R, Ireland

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte Lawrence
recent_reviews.text:
Flower Fields ğŸŒ¸
Endless rows of vibrant blooms with amazing photo ops around every corner. What a brilliant family and pet-friendly day out.
There was no rush to leave, with plenty of picnic tables to chill on and brilliant food & drink vendors. Staff were super helpful, and even offered to take pictures of our whole family.
You can truly feel the passion poured into this event ğŸŒ¸

Can't wait to see what Hatterâ€™s Farm have instore for pumpkin season this year ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Francesca D'Alessandro-Heath
recent_reviews.text:
We came to the flower fields on a breezy day, but the sun was hot. Beautiful flowers, little straw maze and great photo opportunities!
Accessable for both my handicapped daughter and bestie. We all had a great time! Especially the face paint lady! Only suggestion would be more benches on the way round to stop and appreciate a 360 view of the fields. Maybe more variety of flowers might be nice, but we'll come next year for sure too! Many thanks Hatter Farm!! âœŒğŸ½ğŸŒ±âœ¨

recent_reviews.author: Caroline Hancock
recent_reviews.text: Love the flower fields at Hatters Farm. This was our second year attending. Fields are so pretty in bloom, friendly staff and a good selection of food suppliers. Love the props throughout for photo opportunities and also live that we can take our doggie with to enjoy as well. Thank you Hatters. See you again next year.

recent_reviews.author: Janice Stygall
recent_reviews.text: Lovely day out, exploring the fields of flowers, plenty of photo opportunities, Maize Maze for all ages plus a small straw bale maze for children, you can toast marshmallows, chill and just admire all the colours of the flowers, pick your own or buy some from the marquee.    Such a wonderful idea and time, no rush to leave, stay as long as you want, reasonably priced, cant wait to visit for Halloween.

pumpkin_patches.address: Hatter's Farm, Takeley, Bishop's Stortford CM22 6NP

recent_reviews.author: Z Uddin
recent_reviews.text:
We visited Cockfield Farm Park on a sunny Saturday morning and had a really lovely time. The weather was perfect and everything felt very relaxed and family friendly from the moment we got there.

When we arrived, we were told itâ€™s cheaper to book tickets online, so we did. We were also given some animal feed, which the kids really enjoyed using. The park wasnâ€™t too big or too busy, which was great because it meant the kids didnâ€™t have to walk too far and it was easy to keep track of them.

At the rabbit meet and greet, only two rabbits were out but it was really hot so thatâ€™s totally understandable. There were loads of hand washing stations around which was great after feeding and petting the animals.

The sand/beach play area was really nice and the kids loved it. There was also a big cafe with plenty of shaded seating which was perfect for taking a break and cooling down. Parking was easy too with lots of space.

Overall it was a lovely day out and perfect for younger kids. Weâ€™ll definitely go again.

recent_reviews.author: Z R
recent_reviews.text:
Fairly impressed with this farm. Admittedly if it didn't have the toddler spring bash on I wouldn't have visited. However my 3 year old really enjoyed it. Perfect age appropriate playground, the sand pit is great, the free carousel, cuddle time with rabbits and opportunities to feed the animals. Tractor ride was nice but a bit boring...not many animals to see just empty fields. A number of extras like the rides that you have to pay a few quid each for which are a bit of a bane in my eyes. Was pretty astounded by the price to join in the bottle feeding of the lambs which was Â£8. Considering my daughter has just done this twice at another farm for no extra cost I was pretty shocked. As I said if I had have paid anymore than Â£12.95 for myself and daughter I might have been a bit less pleased but considering that included a tub of animal food usually Â£2.50...and an Easter hunt with small chocolate at the end of it was all worth it.
Also very impressed by the cleanliness and tidiness of the whole farm.
It could have done with a few more schedule boards and better signage.

recent_reviews.author: Kim B
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic afternoon with the kids, loads of activities going on throughout the day. They loved feeding the animals and walking around the duck pond. Spent a good half hour jumping on the jumping pillow. Watched the pig race and rode on the tractor.

recent_reviews.author: Laura Jones
recent_reviews.text:
It was a nice day out. The only reasons it lost a star was,from a disabled person's view, the disabled toilet was closed for cleaning all the time we were there with no cleaning taking place. The main toilets hadnt got a wet floor sign and the floor was very wet and slippy, the seating was low down and the car park was full of pot holes right near the disabled spots so with mobility issues it wasn't ideal. But apart from that, everything else was accessible.
The animals were all well looked after and the tractor ride was good fun.
The cafe was nice, the pizza was lovely .

pumpkin_patches.address: Lees New Rd, Oldham, Ashton-under-Lyne OL6 8AR

recent_reviews.author: abdul Instructor
recent_reviews.text:
Came with Family here. Was a wonderful day out with it raining on and off. Lots too see and walk. Plenty of animals to pet and a kids play area. Hoping to visit soon when the weather is better.

Was a good day out little kid loved all the animals and we fed them with the food bought on entry at the kiosk.

Small car park just enough space to park if you get here during quiet times.

recent_reviews.author: Lianne Minshull
recent_reviews.text:
Last time I came here was about 6 years ago and there wasnâ€™t much to see or do.  A LOT has changed!!! Really impressed with the effort that has gone into upgrading the farm!! Plenty of animals to meet, really lovely staff, activities clearly posted so you can plan your day, activity parks with lots of activities for different ages.  My only criticism is that it wasnâ€™t clear which door of the petting barn you go into for the visit but thatâ€™s super small in comparison.  Even the poor chap who drove the caterpillar ride was kind to my son who followed him off telling him how awesome the ride was and thanking him a thousand times over!!

We will definitely be back!! Rivals the other farms in the area easily!

recent_reviews.author: Susan Jones
recent_reviews.text: Had a fabulous day. Plenty of animals to see and feed. Lovely walk around the park. Staff were friendly and willing to explain about the animals, very helpful and well informed regarding the welfare  of the animals. The play ground for the children was well equipped and plenty of picnic tables and chairs. There is a tea kiosk with a very friendly lady serving drinks and ice cream. Will definitely visit again.

recent_reviews.author: I H
recent_reviews.text: If youâ€™re looking for a fun day out with the family, this is definitely the place to bring the kids. Youâ€™ll get to see and even feed a variety of animals including sheep, rabbits, horses, alpacas, lambs, chickens, turkeys, peacocks, turtles, geese, and donkeys. Animal feed is available for just Â£2, which adds to the experience. Thereâ€™s also a lovely scenic walk through the farm, making it a great way to spend a few relaxing hours outdoors. A perfect spot for a family outing

pumpkin_patches.address: Middleton Road West, Chadderton, Oldham OL1 2TG

recent_reviews.author: Lee-ann Igbon
recent_reviews.text:
Value for money easy to reach, ample car parking. Animals looked after with options for interaction and to feed in great condition. Play area is good lots of choice for children under 13yrs, different variety wooden adventure play ground, beach area with toys, food and drinks, stage area, music and covered stage. Indoor play area very good lots of options soft play, role play, trucks and vehicles. You can bring your own food, the food choice is very good and good quality but can be expensive for families.
Only issue the footpath not easy to navigate a buggy with an autistic child and dangerous when walking on needs replacing as the stones are to big and a hazard .

recent_reviews.author: Bethany Jayne
recent_reviews.text: We visited for Fatherâ€™s Day on the Sunday, what a brilliant farm, 4 adults and one child, we all had a fab day! Will definitely be returning throughout the year and events! Thank you!

recent_reviews.author: Natasha Bee
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant! I went here for my child's 2nd birthday and I was rather impressed. At first I thought there was a few animals and a soft play centre and that's it but there was a massive playground with a few rides, zip wires and a decent sized sand pit. There's something for kids of all ages. I was skeptical beforehand as it's Â£10 per person including children but it was worth the money. The only downside was the highchairs weren't clean. I will be returning again at some point.

recent_reviews.author: Lynsey Kempson
recent_reviews.text: Had the most amazing time yesterday with my animal obsessed 2 and half year old daughter. So much to do and tickets were easy to book online will defo be back sheâ€™s not stopped talking about the animals and bouncy pillow :)

pumpkin_patches.address: Country Park, Reddish Vale Rd, Stockport SK5 7HE

recent_reviews.author: Charlie Jameson
recent_reviews.text:
ğŸŒ» A little slice of summer heaven!
Absolutely loved our visit â€” delicious ice cream, peaceful setting, and buzzing with life (literally â€” even the bees are happy here!). Perfect family stop with lovely outdoor vibes and friendly service. Highly recommend for a sunny day out! ğŸ¦ğŸğŸŒ

recent_reviews.author: Tasha Jade
recent_reviews.text:
Wonderful family day out, very affordable with delicious home made ice cream to top it off.

It was pure bliss to be completely surrounded by gorgeous sunflowers as well as the wildflower field.

The children were handed a paper trail to tick off the hidden flower and animal boards found within each field. The children, who were aged from 3 to 14, enjoyed doing this, as did the big kids!

We can't wait to come back and enjoy the other seasonal events ran here!

recent_reviews.author: Philippa P
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely half-day out â€“ perfect for a few hours!

Visited during the summer holidays and was pleasantly surprised it wasnâ€™t too busy. Spent a good 3 hours enjoying the sunflower trail and flower garden â€“ both really lovely. The cafÃ© was great too, with a nice selection of pizzas, garlic bread, and tasty ice cream. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout. Toilets were decent and fairly clean. Parking was fine, no issues. Overall, a nice little spot for a half-day trip â€“ wouldnâ€™t stay all day, but Iâ€™ll definitely go back again!

recent_reviews.author: Toxteth O' Grady
recent_reviews.text: Came for the Ice Cream, didnâ€™t bother paying extra for the Sunflower or Wild Flower trails. The Ice Cream satisfied a party of 4 of us who ordered Sunflower, Tiramisu Brownie, Coffee & Honeycomb flavours. For the record, the Sunflower didnâ€™t really taste of much other than sweet plain Ice Cream, but it did have Sunflower seeds in it!

pumpkin_patches.address: 34 Station Rd, Dunham Massey, Altrincham WA14 5SG

recent_reviews.author: S U
recent_reviews.text:
A lovely little spot! Fab coffee and treats.
A good range of plants for sale. The little animal farm and play area looks decent enough(but we didn't use as had no kids). ğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte Hains
recent_reviews.text: A lovely lunch out with grand son and son, the animals are very polite lamas goats and rabbits the cats hung out with us too    The lunch was lovely especially the cheese on toast   Sausage beans and cheese pasty was a hit for my son.    Bakewell cookie was delicious.   This farm shop sells everything from eggs to joints of meat well worth checking out.    Hanks for the service second to none

recent_reviews.author: Dorothy Lewis
recent_reviews.text: We stopped here on our way to the destination of a road trip. It's a lovely spot. We enjoyed delicious pasties with a great cup of coffee to refresh & fortify us so we could complete our journey. Highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Rebekah Papworth
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely lovely place perfect for families. There is a play area Â£4 for all day, a little shop, cafe and farm shop full of fresh veggies, meat and some tasty sweet treats. The animals are so cute and friendly. The staff are lovely and helpful. Highly recommend this place!

pumpkin_patches.address: Edge Ln, Mottram in Longdendale, Hyde SK14 6SE

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Lymefield Garden Centre, Farm Shop and Tea Room

recent_reviews.author: Matthew Neal
recent_reviews.text: We have recently purchased 120 rolls of turf and 12 ton of topsoil from Lymefield to help transform our garden. After a lot of research we ended up looking round our local garden centre for ideas. Rob and co really went above and beyond with their customer service. They talked us through the whole process and discussed our options in great detail and made recommendations of what would work in our garden and what wouldnâ€™t work. After agreeing what we needed all the product came the following week. When we put down all the soil we quickly realised we hadnâ€™t bought enough soil so immediately ordered 4 more ton. Rob understood our needs and delivered it the same day which was amazing and enabled us to crack on with it. Overall we were very happy with the product supplied and the customer service we received. The photos attached to the review were from when the turf and soil were delivered, after 12 ton of soil was put down, once the turf was put down, 3 1/2 weeks after laying and after the first cut. We are very happy the way itâ€™s turned out.

recent_reviews.author: Pixies Owner
recent_reviews.text:
We came across this centre after seeing the sign for a cafe - but this is so much more than that. As well as a gorgeous garden centre, there is a roomy restaurant with a very full menu of traditional food - we had the very tasty cheese and onion pie and the best home made coleslaw in the world. The service was top notch - friendly and attentive - and we even went mad and had a dessert. Their range of cakes was just gorgeous.
The shop/deli is filled with so many tempting goodies and everywhere looked clean and tidy. Will definitely return here again asap!

recent_reviews.author: Samuel Burgess
recent_reviews.text: This establishment consistently provides a wonderful experience.  The friendly staff create a welcoming atmosphere.  The garden center offers a fantastic selection of plants and products.  The cafe's delicious food is a highlight of any visit.  It's a pleasure to spend time in such a lovely place.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Laker
recent_reviews.text:
Highly recommend this family run garden centre and cafe.
Delicious food, great plants and the best Christmas trees for miles!
We've been supporting Lymefield for over 25 years and it just keeps getting better.

recent_reviews.author: Lauren May Ashbrook
recent_reviews.text: We visited today for my daughters 1st Birthday meal as a larger party and all our needs where catered for. The staff where extremely caring to my daughter who enjoyed her time at Grange Farm. Special thanks to Charlotte who kept us topped up with drinks and made sure everyone had everything they needed. It is so nice to have something so lovely on our door step, especially as you can also feed the animals. Thanks again!

recent_reviews.author: lucy geraghty
recent_reviews.text: Had the best afternoon at the farm with my mum, feeding the cows and llamas and a mooch around the farm shop before a sweet treat in the cafe & restaurant! The staff couldnâ€™t have been nicer and made sure we had everything we need, such a beautiful and well looked after farm! We will definitely be back :))

recent_reviews.author: Kerry Nuttall
recent_reviews.text: We came across the barn looking for breakfast and so glad we did. The food here is outstanding, the service just as good. The farm is a lovely place and the farm shop has lots of fresh produce farm produce, meat, eggs, raw milk. It was so good we came back for lunch the next day, steak and ale pie home made with a fish and chips for the hubby and again outstanding. Thank you we will be regulars from now on â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: RF xx
recent_reviews.text:
Really enjoyed feeding the highland cows, would recommend taking wipes and sanitizer as the facility the farm provide isnâ€™t the best!
Also if you want to go into the cafe make sure to book the day before as they donâ€™t take bookings on the day sadly and only have a few walk in tables
Overall a good experience with nice food!

pumpkin_patches.address: Stone Cross Ln S, Lowton, Warrington WA3 1JU

recent_reviews.author: Andrea Smith (Ange_thumb)
recent_reviews.text: Lovely family run patch. Lots of extras, a great maize maze with fun facts and spooky characters. Plenty of wheelbarrows, all sizes and colours of pumpkin, a giant spider, photo plaques. Mini bowling and big noughts and crosses. Lovely atmosphere. Not too busy in the morning. A pumpkin spa to finish before hot choc and coffee from the trailer. Oh and a guess the weight of the huge pumpkin prize quiz.

recent_reviews.author: Ravi Ahluwalia
recent_reviews.text:
Great pumpkin patch and Maize maze! Good range of sizes and colours/varieties. Wheelbarrows to carry them around and to car. Maze was fun!

Pro tip - wear wellies!

recent_reviews.author: Paula Hruby
recent_reviews.text: This place is very small but very subtle I like how it isn't busy but the place is overall very small . There isn't a lot of variations of pumpkins and very little of them.The entry for the pumpkins is free but for the maze it's Â£2 per person.The maze isn't really worth it either it's very small and there is some facts on the way and some Halloween props but there very small and hard to notice .

recent_reviews.author: Mark Dawson
recent_reviews.text: Possibly the stupidest way to spend money. 5 pumpkins Â£55 Tesco Â£15. ğŸ¤£ pay more for the world's most pathetic kids maze. Pumpkins are mouldy and rotting when we got them home. 100% never again.

recent_reviews.author: Andy Luxton
recent_reviews.text: Home of the Jersey girls Ice cream parlour.. for the very best farm made ice ceram on site. They also do a variety of pies, panini, crisps and good selection of non alcoholic drinks, such as canned pops, tea and a good coffee.

recent_reviews.author: sam morrow
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic staff, plenty of parking, can get close to all the animals and see what goes on.

recent_reviews.author: Ali Qazi
recent_reviews.text: Love this place ! One recommendation is that they should have their timings, for milk, advertised here or on their page. Cheers

recent_reviews.author: RAJA RAAJ
recent_reviews.text: Some people take milk from the farm but do not pay for it. And some people, for example, take 10 liters of milk but pay only for 2 liters.i saw them those people. You have to keep eye.

recent_reviews.author: Alex Waugh
recent_reviews.text: Came for the pumpkin patch and we all thoroughly enjoyed it. Bought some cute little pumpkins and had some yummy seasonal ice cream!

recent_reviews.author: Ruth Smith
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant afternoon spent together, a wide choice of pumpkins, not to expensive, Cafe with welcoming, friendly staff and fabulous cakes, with a very pretty shop. Thank you

recent_reviews.author: Jackie Field
recent_reviews.text: Lovely staff .very homely feeling  and the morning menu was fantastic.lovely and peacefull.to stay here.and great views

recent_reviews.author: Laura Jones
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little farm. Amazing ice creams and such a cute petting farm

recent_reviews.author: rick salt
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely loved this place. Loads of stuff for the kids to do although the weather does permit outdoor activities . The indoor soft play area is huge and the kids could easily spend half a day inside. The price is reasonable with Â£12 for kids and just Â£3 for adults( which if your kids can do everything you will be sat on the benches dotted about) There is a restaurant on site and table dotted around for picnics. The corn maze is ok and animals are dotted around.

recent_reviews.author: Kim B
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic day at the farm with the kids they enjoyed all the playground areas and feeding the animals, definitely recommend this place. Excellent value for money, could easy spend the full day here. They have both indoor and outdoor play areas. Was quite busy today however there was plenty for the kids to do.

recent_reviews.author: Kit Foster
recent_reviews.text:
This place is sick. I will go back time and time again.
I went with a school trip.
I thought 11.99 per learner was going to be steep but itâ€™s actually well worth it as there is so much to do.
The shop was great and everything was good quality and a decent price.
The bouncing pillows are a great idea and were everybodyâ€™s favourite.
The

recent_reviews.author: Vikki Connell
recent_reviews.text:
Brilliant day out! I had been looking at this place for a while but was unsure how good it would be. It was easy to find, there is plenty of parking, and it's cheap to go into the play areas (Â£11.99 per child and Â£2.99 per adult). I didn't see any disabled spaces, but there are no parking bays so you can leave a space next to the car for wheelchairs/pushchairs access. The car parking areas are well maintained, but are grass/dirt which might not be suitable for all wheelchairs. We went when it was really busy (hot day in the summer holidays) and it wasn't too busy. There are lots of well maintained paths around making it easy to navigate with disability aids (I myself use a stick and had no issues). There is a reasonably priced cafe, farm shop and concessions stand as well. You can also bring a picnic and there are plenty of benches/tables around to eat at! There are also lots of benches/seats in and around the play areas so it's easy to keep an eye on the kids and not have to be too far away. There are various types of play. areas for kids from toddlers to older kids.
My son is 5 and he had a brilliant day! The staff around the farm are really friendly, and they look after the grounds so well with regular bin emptying, litter picking and tidying. Well worth the low cost to get in! We will definitely be visiting again!
You can buy animal feed for Â£1 per bag at the entrance (reasonable bag size for the low price) to feed various farm animals on the way round. There are goats, ducks, geese, Free-roaming chickens, cows, horses, and pigs. Overall, I would easily give the farm 5 stars. It is a wonderful place to visit with the kids to get them off their tablets/devices and get them outdoors!

recent_reviews.author: David
recent_reviews.text: For years now this family run business is above and beyond other pumpkin patches for miles around. These pumpkins are not bought in the local supermarket and thrown in a field (yes it happens). No, these are grown with care. Cut straight off the vine and excellently presented. There is a real rustic homely feel as you scour the field for your favourite pumpkin of choice. All sorts of shades of colours and sizes and for a very reasonable price. There are plenty of wheel barrows for the in demand pumpkins and even smaller ones available for children. At weekends there is a catering van and some small rides. Accessible toilets and a big car park, it can get muddy so wellies a must. The best thing this year is the tractor ride through the pumpkin patch and the Gruffalo themed section of the tour. Like I said you wonâ€™t get much better than this around here.

recent_reviews.author: Marc McCullagh
recent_reviews.text: I had a great time...think my little boy did too. Tractor ride was good. Lots of cars having to get towed out stuck in the mud. All adds to the fun. Chips were nice from the van avoid the coffee tho.

recent_reviews.author: Sepideh Hosseini
recent_reviews.text:
Itâ€™s a great place with lots of creative decorations for Halloween. Free car park and a tap water for washing and toilet in site.
The price was 3 medium size for Â£10 or Â£3.50 each
3 large size for Â£12 or Â£4.50 each

recent_reviews.author: Mark Bradley marky-b-1986
recent_reviews.text: Good site and plenty of pumpkins to choose from. Some absolutely huge and some tiny ones good for decoration. The only reason I gave 4 stars was the sign with the prices on being a bit misleading. Under 28cm/over 28cm being easy to see. And then at the very bottom in small writing 35cm+ Â£10 each which is a big increase from the other sizes and if you donâ€™t know you get a bit of a shock when paying. It should say under 28cm/28-35cm/35cm+ one after the other

pumpkin_patches.place_name: The Lambing Shed Farm Shop & Kitchen

recent_reviews.author: Lindsay Bould
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely the best cakes and Millionaire Shortbread we have ever eaten - washed down with perfect Earl Grey tea .
Great staff great service great ambianceâ€¦. Absolutely faultless â€¦. Great find - highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Jess Y
recent_reviews.text:
Cute place to stop at. Two horses, a pig, and two goats can be seen from the parking lot and road. Walked over to the shop, which it is always nice to stop at a farm shop and check out the local delicacies.

Baked goods and produce along with meats, pies, and much more.  I loved the refill station for the different balsamic vinegar.  I wanted to take some home so bad.

We ended up order a scone with jam and clotted cream. The hand reared beef burger with truffle parmesean fries.  The scone had raisins instead of golden ones. Very thick bottom. It was alright.

The mince on the hand reared beef was very very fine. It was almost the texture you'd find in a sausage or kebab meat. It had a lot going on with the burger sauce, onion jam, lettuce, tomato, and pickle. The truffle fries lacked the truffle oil, for an extra Â£1.

recent_reviews.author: Jamie Roberts
recent_reviews.text:
Food was very nice and the farm shop/cafe is in a lovely area. Even for a rural farm shop cafe the prices are high. Â£16 for a breakfast then another Â£4 for a coffee. The breakfast was very nice but only on  par with other similar places. It was very busy so noisy as a result. The service was quick and efficient considering how busy the girls were.
Overall it was nice to visit somewhere different but I wouldn't rush back.

recent_reviews.author: Susan Parker
recent_reviews.text: Always a good stop. Serves a lovely breakfast till 11.30am. Chef quality superb. Only serves natural juices no name brand cold drinks. Coffee â˜•ï¸  great. Great  little country shop with unusual  goods for sale. Frozen made pies and meals , sweets, gifts things, bakery things. ğŸ˜‹

pumpkin_patches.address: Moseley Hall Farm, Chelford Rd, Knutsford WA16 8RB

recent_reviews.author: mark stewart
recent_reviews.text: A great farm shop with a huge range of products, many of which are local. They even have a good range of craft beer! We had breakfast in the restaurant, which was excellent! More than i could manage to be honest. We visited when the sunflowers were in bloom so were able to walk through the sunflower field which is a great experience. Well worth the visit!

recent_reviews.author: Arianne Clarke
recent_reviews.text: We had a quick bite to eat and hot drink at their cafe, staff are friendly and quick service. Well organised and presented shop. Plenty of parking spaces and a lot more shops to see around. Well worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Nadia Khan
recent_reviews.text: We went to visit the Easter Marquee at Becketts farm. At a cost of Â£3 per person it was a really budget friendly afternoon out. My daughter thoroughly enjoyed seeing the animals and potting her own sunflower seed. There was quite a few things to do and it was well organised. The farm shop and restaurant are also great to visit.

recent_reviews.author: Robert
recent_reviews.text: This place has some excellent produce . People like this place as the car park was full

pumpkin_patches.address: Heath Farm, Alcester Rd, Wythall, Birmingham B47 6AJ

recent_reviews.author: Lisa Bowles
recent_reviews.text: Went to the cafe, which should be lovely as overlooking the fields, but tables were not cleared, not sure why when staff come out with food they do not take dirty plates back into the kitchen. We had sandwiches which were overpriced, for what you get. They serve a small salad on the side, with dressing but no cutlery. Just not very good, which is a shame.

recent_reviews.author: Abrar Houssien
recent_reviews.text:
Such a lovely experience at this PYO farm. The setting is peaceful and surrounded by beautiful countryside. The strawberries were perfectly ripe, sweet, and full of flavour.. Really some of the best Iâ€™ve ever had ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ“ğŸ“
The staff were friendly and helpful. We were given baskets to pick our own strawberries, which was a fun and relaxing activity for both adults and children. The farm is clean, well organised, and has plenty of nice spots for taking photos ..
Ideal for families, couples or anyone who enjoys fresh produce and a bit of time outdoors. Highly recommend and will definitely be coming back again.ğŸ™ŒğŸ»â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Hannah Ryan
recent_reviews.text:
We have visited Essington Fruit Farm two years in a row now for strawberry picking, and it has quickly become a favourite tradition. The strawberries are always of excellent qualityâ€”large, juicy, and beautifully sweet, making the experience even more enjoyable. Itâ€™s such a lovely way to spend a morning, wandering through the fields with a basket and selecting your own fruit straight from the plants.
Alongside the fruit picking, the farm also has a fantastic farm shop that is well worth a visit. Itâ€™s full of fresh local produce, ranging from high-quality butcherâ€™s meats to homemade cakes, wines, and other delicious treats. Thereâ€™s always something tempting to take home, and the variety means thereâ€™s something for everyone. One of our firm favourites has to be the fresh cream cakes, which are consistently excellent and feel like a real indulgence.
The farm also has a cafÃ© on-site, which always looks inviting, although I have not tried it myself. Judging by the quality of everything else at Essington, I imagine itâ€™s just as good as the shop. The whole place has a welcoming, relaxed feel to it, and itâ€™s a lovely spot for families, couples, or anyone looking for a peaceful outing.

recent_reviews.author: Ian Sharpe
recent_reviews.text: A great farm shop with a huge range of items, and appeared to be superb quality, especially the meat.  Their sausages are the best I've tasted so I always use them.  The downside are the prices are  quite  expensive, but then it's to be expected tbh  as almost everything is noticeably superior to what you would buy from a supermarket, especially meat, bread and fruit n veg. There is also a nice restaurant/cafe which is similar, great food but quite expensive.

recent_reviews.author: Ian Sharpe
recent_reviews.text: We visited for a sunflower event. It was absolutely beautiful.  The staff were lovely, especially the girl on the gate. The weather was perfect, there was food, a bar, bbq for corn on the cob, a singer and some animals to see.  The kids loved to be out in the open air. Top marks, really enjoyed it ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Tazanawai Banyamyan
recent_reviews.text: We love it everytime, affordable and fun. So much to see. Great for a family day out. However the Food is expensive. They have a nice indoor play area for kids for a small fee for 1 hour, and a out door play area which is free.

recent_reviews.author: Anne-marie power
recent_reviews.text: Brought summer passes for here as thought great value. At the start of the summer the play area was in fab condition, however over the summer the standards have dropped so bad. I have spoken to the play area people several times and they Blamed it on being busy but when I visited at opening this week the play area was filthy.

recent_reviews.author: Gilez Barkz
recent_reviews.text:
If you love and like to pet and feed,
Goats, baby goats
Sheep, lambs
This is the place to be.
2 barns packed with goats and sheep (super cute)
Outside there is
chickens, hens, roosters, ducks
Cows, baby cows
Small horses
Alpacas
Donkeys
Angus horned cattle and other stuff like a play barn, shop, cafe, snack bar etc
It's geared up for kids but adults can have just as much fun.
A lingering visit can occupy 1 to 2 hrs of your time.
Check their website for What's On, prices and opening times etc.
Council car park is 80p for 2 hrs

recent_reviews.author: Kanchana Godage
recent_reviews.text: We had an amazing experience at Rymanâ€™s Pumpkins! Even though bookings were fully booked, they graciously accommodated us as walk-ins, which was such a pleasant surprise. The staff was friendly and welcoming, making us feel right at home. The pumpkin patch itself was beautiful, with a fantastic selection of pumpkins in all shapes and sizes. It was a perfect family day out, with plenty of photo opportunities and a wonderful fall atmosphere. Weâ€™ll definitely be back next year! Highly recommend visiting for a fun and memorable day. ğŸƒğŸ§¡

recent_reviews.author: Faye Allen
recent_reviews.text: This is my second year coming here and we brought all the family this time. Iâ€™ve recommend Rymans to loads of people as itâ€™s such a great experience. I love that you get the tractor up to the pumpkin patch and you go through the fields to get there. All the games back at the farm are fantastic and keep the kids and adults entertained! The staff are all so friendly and helpful. The ride in tractors are a lot of fun- remember Â£2 cash per child if you want to go on them. Will be back next year for sure!

recent_reviews.author: Ivy Tse
recent_reviews.text: Lovely family run pumpkin farm, enjoyed a couple of hours there with my kids during half term break. Friendly staff. Small farm but packed with lots of activities for kids. Reasonably priced admission fee. Defo love the pumpkin carving shed which already included in your ticket. Carving tools were supplied and you could just do carvng straight away with your pumpkin picked from the field! Super nice!

recent_reviews.author: Jane Holyhead
recent_reviews.text: We had a great afternoon pumpkin picking with our dogs. So happy to find a dog friendly place . Such a warm welcome , everyone we spoke to was just lovely. Lots of pumpkins of all shapes , sizes and colours . Plenty of wheelbarrows, tractor ride to the patch if you needed it. We also picked some potatoes and carrots too. Great latte too , with oat milk so I was chuffed and the hot choc with all the trimmings looked amazing. Perfect for all age groups , really lovely few hours in the sunshine.

pumpkin_patches.address: Manor Farm, Wall Ln, Wall, Lichfield WS14 0AH

recent_reviews.author: Rhiannon Williams
recent_reviews.text:
Spent a good couple of hours here on Saturday morning. Ground was very waterlogged and muddy but they had put out boards for the cars and put fresh hay down in the field in the worst effected areas... We were definitely glad for the warning on Facebook about needing wellies/boots.

Free entry to enjoy all the various photo ops. Well priced refreshments and the pumpkins themselves are reasonable. Â£3 for a small, Â£6 for a medium, Â£9 for large. There is also more variety than just the regular orange pumpkins with a range of colours and sizes.

Enjoyed our hot donuts and tea after exploring the patch and picking out our pumpkin.

Definitely recommend and will be back next year

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Stanley
recent_reviews.text: Not as good an entrance as previous years. Last year we loved walking under the spooky Halloween decs on entry before we got to the field. It really did add to the experience. This year it's in a different field due to works being carried out in the other. We were directed well to park the car. They had laid a temporary track on top of the grass to combat vehicles being stuck in the mud. Worked well. We weren't told where to go once out of the vehicle so followed the perimeter round and found it without too much fuss. Walk past the bouncy castle slides and trampoline bounce with ropes and you come to a large selection of wheel barrows and the entrance. Plenty of pumpkins to choose from. Couldn't find one small pumpkin, let alone 2, so we opted for one medium sized at Â£6! Most, if not all the pumpkins, had been placed in the field. I did find some gourds which looked to be growing. Very muddy, wear wellingtons! Kids really enjoyed pushing the wheel barrows which got stuck in the mud a few times! The kids enjoyed exploring all the spooktacular props and hunting for the golden gourds - didn't find a golden one this year! They had goats this year, you could pay Â£1 for some feed. They had a small fire to toast marshmallows and a couple of other things. They had bouncy Castle slides, trampoline bounce with ropes, food and drink stalls. Plenty to see and do there including pumpkin carving! With no entry fee, you don't mind paying Â£3 for a small, Â£6 for a medium or Â£ for a large pumpkin. We went last year, couldn't wait to go again this year and will probably go back next year so all in all I highly recommend it!

recent_reviews.author: Barry Horne
recent_reviews.text:
This place needs more than five stars, they pulled out all the stops to have a great experience to find your perfect Pumpkim.
Free to park and enter as well.
They have decorated the fields exquisitely for the whole Halloween experience.
There is even a marquee set up to do Pumpkin carving.
Food is available with the chips made from potatoes that have been grown on the farm.
Great trip out.

recent_reviews.author: Charlie Swift
recent_reviews.text: We visited with a 4yr old and a 1yr old and I couldn't rate this place higher. For a event that's free to get in, they have put so much effort into making it fun and entertaining for all ages. Cool little decorated stands with activities to keep the kids engaged while you walk around. Some nice food and drinks stalls and a few reasonably priced rides for the kids. Plenty of pumpkins at a reasonable price. 100% worth a visit. Definitely wear wellies or be prepared to get muddy.

recent_reviews.author: H H
recent_reviews.text:
Great park for all ages! Ideal for a walk, run, or just relaxing. Thereâ€™s a lovely playground for kids, plenty of space for dogs, and a large lake surrounded by big trees and greenery. Peaceful, clean, and perfect for a quick visit or a longer stay. Highly recommend!

Follow more of my reviews and activities on Instagram: @h_bermani

recent_reviews.author: Matthew Brookes
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant place for fresh air children love it a massive playground for them to play no toilets or car park but all within all walking distance beautiful duck pond with ducks and gesse no fishing some picnic benches get full in the summer dog friendly load use it brilliant place lovely and clean

recent_reviews.author: Olivia Lucie
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely park. Great for kids and for wildlife spotting! Good parking and accessible too. Good day out for the family!

recent_reviews.author: Rob Lloyd
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely park. Wish it had a cafe and community hub though. There are buildings that can be used for such and it would definitely attract more people to the park.
Playground is nice and is a very good park to walk your dog

recent_reviews.author: Elizabeth Baker
recent_reviews.text: Love this place and visiting is part of our Christmas traditions! We have picked our Christmas tree from here for over 15 years. Great selection of trees, wreaths, foliage and there is also a very well stocked shop full of decorations. Lovely friendly staff too and if you don't feel Chrismassy when you arrive, you will be when you leave.

recent_reviews.author: stephanus sanjaya
recent_reviews.text:
Always come here for xmas tree. They always have a really really nice collections of xmas tree.
They do also pumpkin picking and kids can carve their own pumpkin as well. It's always nice with all cool decorations and they also have a decorations stores.
With a big spacious parking lot it's always a space or two even in the xmas busy time.

recent_reviews.author: Dave Warrender
recent_reviews.text: This place is amazing! Buy local to support our small businesses any you will not be disappointed! Excellent range of decorations, enormous range of trees and at prices that are exceptionally competitive - cheaper than the big chains. Trees are all sizes with or without roots - first time we have been - delighted!!!!

recent_reviews.author: Robert Sealey
recent_reviews.text: This is the place to buy your Christmas tree. Direct from the grower. Woods Farm have over 1 million trees growing and you can be sure to find the tree that's just right for you. Freshly cut and potted trees available and really friendly staff. We've been buying our trees from them for many years. If you look after your tree, it should last all the way until the new year. Ours quite often sprout new shoots over Christmas.

recent_reviews.author: Kelly Bacon
recent_reviews.text: First time here,  got lamb for Easter dinner with daughter and her partner,  delicious,  great cut of lamb, fresh produce is excellent,  great prices

recent_reviews.author: K S
recent_reviews.text:
Excellent produce all fresh and an amazing butchers will visit again. Hidden gem in the midlands
Best farm shop around

recent_reviews.author: Mika
recent_reviews.text: Donâ€™t have a good experience , any time went there during opening time and butcher was closed or recently called to order veggie box, was told it will be ready for Monday then it was moved to Wednesday , went to pick up on Wednesday and no one prepared any box as no one knew. So far just waisted time to go there and got nothing. Not fully reliable therefore not recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Barbara Davis
recent_reviews.text: Butchers has lots of pies with a big variety of fillings..... love 'em..... lovely Farm Shop with fruits, vegs and a few grocery items available. Saves going to big supermarkets!! Also sells bags of compost + a few garden ornaments for gifts.

pumpkin_patches.address: Hayhead Farm, Longwood Ln, Walsall WS4 2JT

recent_reviews.author: Shannon Ashley
recent_reviews.text: Spent a lovely hour here for the pumpkin picking. The people on site were lovely to talk to, really good stock and variety of pumpkins. Parking was being managed very efficiently while we were there. Plenty of places for photo ops if you're taking little ones. Reasonable pricing for the pumpkins. Really nice that there is the covered barn option as well as the outdoor patch. Small farm shop on site had some nice little bits of stock. No parking fee, covered barn is free to browse the pumpkins, Â£2 entry if you want to go pick in the pumpkin patch itself

recent_reviews.author: E. Delilah
recent_reviews.text:
Visited here to get a mountain of pumpkins for my workplace and what a lovely pumpkin patch it was! We pulled up yo be greeted by some lovely cows and chickens, and a brilliant display of pumpkins - big, small, knobbly, wonky, all kinds! The barn and the field were brilliant too and really great prices, accompanied by the friendliest staff!
The little shop had some fantastic locally sourced produce too ğŸ‘Œ

recent_reviews.author: James Bowden
recent_reviews.text:
2023 update - still a very charming setup, and a perfect place to get very reasonably priced pumpkins of all shapes and sizes, from decorative gourds to humongous orbs! No toastie van when we visited though as they were busy at a cheese show, which was a shame, but plenty of drinks and sweet refreshments still available.

2022 - Really wholesome setup with so many types of pumpkin! Staff were all extremely friendly and eager to help/chat, and the place just had a very warm atmosphere (despite it being mid-October). Pumpkin patch (new this year) was more find-your-own than a traditional patch as they'd been moved to a dedicated space, but said area featured theming and even a lovely bit of pumpkin art.

The perfect tonic to a lot of the more excessive setups in the area. Exactly what we wanted.

recent_reviews.author: charmaine maytum
recent_reviews.text: Great value for pumpkin picking and good amount of parking. Really friendly staff and ideal for young families

recent_reviews.author: Che GueMappa
recent_reviews.text:
How ever done we fell so darn far,
I ask the trees
They respond not
Just breeze

recent_reviews.author: rayzee von-wilzee
recent_reviews.text: Sterling work of groundsmanship by Mr John D Kelly...ğŸ˜€

recent_reviews.author: Sylvia Williams
recent_reviews.text: Great place to take children of all ages, back to nature.

recent_reviews.author: Marcus Belben
recent_reviews.text: Great quiet space tucked away in woods to the side of Highbury Park.

recent_reviews.author: Adele Jenkins
recent_reviews.text:
Had a really good day here! Lots of things to do and see from a tractor trailer ride to jumping pillows. The reptile talk show was good, the three hosting it were very nice and informative about the reptiles. The small animals were very cute, especially the ducklings. You can ask to pet the small animals such as the rabbits. The soft play is HUGE and so, so fun, it was in very clean and well kept condition, even the role play area seemed clean. There is a couple of good drop slides, the 2 in the drop slide area and one in the soft play. They have some other shows and experiences on, but we didn't attend those. Some very small areas were closed off as there was renovations going on there (or what seemed to be).

Hoping to come back soon to do their new maze, well worth the money. The onsite food places seemed reasonable priced, my partner had a brownie which he said was delicious. We did take our own food, but did get some snacks and drinks from there. Lovely little gift shop on the way out too.

recent_reviews.author: Bryony
recent_reviews.text: Has a brilliant time at Lower Drayton Farm. Plenty to do for my 2.5 year old! Alexia on the reception desk was super friendly. The soft play is huge - with more slides in the barn. Great range of animals, play equipment outside and bouncy pillows. Loved the special events that were on: dinosaurs and teddy bears picnic! Finished off the day with the Maize Maze and more dinosaurs. Great value for money: would definitely recommend. We stayed from 10am - 2:30pm. You can easily spend the whole day there, but my little one still naps!

recent_reviews.author: Kerry Brough
recent_reviews.text: We visited the farm yesterday, and I can say from the start to finish we had the best time. Was so much to do for my little boy. He is dinosaur mad, so this was perfect for him. We loved meeting all the animals, break in the soft play, yummy lunch, then ended the day at the form party. It was truly a magical day. We canâ€™t wait to return later in the year.

recent_reviews.author: David Morgan
recent_reviews.text:
Well worth the money for a whole day out
Huge play area with lots to do for a wide range of ages, we came with our 1 and 5 year olds and both loved it. We had lunch in the cafe as well which as very good quality and reasonable prices. Loved the shows we went to, the only downside was that the tractor rides were cancelled due to bad weather, but that's obviously not in their control. The large bouncy cushions were a massive hit with our 5 year old

pumpkin_patches.address: The Play Barn Lower Drayton Lane, Stafford ST19 5RE

recent_reviews.author: Nawaz Nazir
recent_reviews.text: Balsall Heath City Farm, very small but great fun for little kids. Suitable for children 2 to 10, older kids will probably not get much fun, but you never know. Free entry, which is great, but in these Covid times you have to book via email, and get a slot. You can feed animals, chickens, ducks geese, turkeys. You can also see Guinea pigs, rabbits etc which are in hutches. There are some sheep and goats in a separate enclosure, which you can feed also. Staff are friendly and very helpful, but most of the time it seems to be un maned. Remember it's a charity and not for profit farm. Enjoy!

recent_reviews.author: Corinne Mck
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful inner city farm. Friendly staff and a real community feeling.

recent_reviews.author: James Alan
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely experience Rose is a lovely and welcoming host ğŸ˜Š made us feel welcomed

Thanks again will definitely be back

Everyone should definitely donate guys we need these lovely little places

recent_reviews.author: Yusuf Murdock
recent_reviews.text: Very nice and quiet, had chickens, roosters, ducks, hamsters etc, perfect for kids and the best part, it's absolutely free

pumpkin_patches.address: Malvern St, Balsall Heath, Birmingham B12 8NN

recent_reviews.author: Donna Brown
recent_reviews.text: Lots of activities for the children. My toddler loved feeding the lambs, sitting on a horse, picking his own chicken egg and riding on a tractor trailer. Lots of animals to see and plenty of outdoor spaces to play in. Really lovely farm. (Soft play is also there but we didn't go in due to the gorgeous)  Recommended place to visit

recent_reviews.author: Nicola Robins
recent_reviews.text:
Came on Saturday for a day out with my brother and his son. It was a lovely day with lots to do. We arrived around 10 oâ€™clock and did the soft play for 2 hours first which was amazing! It consistent of a bouncy pillow, mini golf and even a ninja warrior area!
We headed into the farm after this. We left around 4 oâ€™clock in the afternoon so we had a really lovely day.  My children loved stroking the baby chickens and really enjoyed the tractor ride. We took our own pack lunch but the menu in the soft play looked really good. Lots to choose from, I thought there was something for everyone. Health and safety is also on point here too which is good.

What I will say is to be very weary of other people. There was a group of disabled people on a day out with carers and one of the guys was extremely abusive towards me and called me horrible names Infront of the my children. Using words I would never personally use. There was no staff on hand to intervene and his carer just stood there. I felt really uncomfortable. It ruined my whole day truthfully and I wouldnâ€™t be in a rush to return even though it was a good day out.

recent_reviews.author: Ian Garfield
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant value for money! A full day out the family with lots to see and do. Children really enjoyed getting close to the animals, a really nice relaxed atmosphere. Food is great and lots of play areas to let children burn off remaining energy. Clean and tidy too.

recent_reviews.author: InMyOwnWorld
recent_reviews.text:
What an amazing Farm!
Didn't realise how big it was - next time will plan for the whole day instead of a few hours. My Little boy, partner and myself had a fabulous time. Our little boy got to feed the lambs, stroke baby chick's, take an egg home, have a pony ride and got to feed some of the animals from the bucket you get given. The lady who was giving a talk with the buzzard was very friendly and informative as well as the man who gave us a talk on the tortoises; fabulous watching the big one trying to run for her dinner!.
We did pay for the big play barn but we ran out of time so wasn't able to use it; but we did use the small wishing well playground which was great.

Would definately return, really great experience

recent_reviews.author: Samantha Edwards
recent_reviews.text: Such a cute cafe. We visited for the first time last week for breakfast and it was absolutely delicious. Friendly staff, generous portions, looked and tasted amazing! The menu has great variety and caters for dietary needs, even the drinks. I didn't have cake this time, but I sure will be making another trip to try them next because they looked lush! ğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: Mark Upton
recent_reviews.text: Everytime we have been for breakfast it has been nothing but fantastic. Food is great and the staff are so friendly. And the selection of cakes are brilliant, so much choice ğŸ©ğŸªğŸ§ğŸ° would highly recommend to anyone ğŸ˜€

recent_reviews.author: Gemma Swingwood
recent_reviews.text: This was our second time of visiting today for breakfast and all we can say was that it was again a fantastic visit ğŸ˜€ staff are so friendly and polite and can have a laugh with. The food is absolutely delicious ğŸ˜‹ we all had a full breakfast, followed by a lovely piece of cake ğŸ‚ ğŸ¥® there is so much cake to choose from ğŸ˜Š will without doubt be back for more.

recent_reviews.author: kingmoochoo
recent_reviews.text:
The shop has a lovely modern rustic style feel to it.
The food was fast and delicious.
The prices are good as well.
Would recommend this place for cake to take away or for breakfast/lunch to sit in.

pumpkin_patches.address: Unit 2, Hawks Green District Centre, Heath Way, Cannock WS12 3XP

recent_reviews.author: Jodie
recent_reviews.text: Visited Bishop farm today to feed the goats and see the animals and decided to have lunch. The food by Donna was absolutely delicious so fresh and tasty so I would definitely recommend this place. The staff are very friendly and the place is so beautiful and clean. Thank you for giving us a great experience on our day off. We will be back!

recent_reviews.author: David Prosser
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant wedding venue,  lovely cafe, all operated to be able to run the Charity behind it all. Family Care Trust, set up to help adults with Mental, learning and physical disabilities. They put in amazing family events around the farm for all to enjoy as well as many craft events throughout the year

recent_reviews.author: Melanie Brown
recent_reviews.text: Local farm. Lovely place to take the kids. Goats, sheep and ponies. You can pay to feed the goats. Cafe on site. Great staff.

recent_reviews.author: JPS JPS
recent_reviews.text: My wife recently discovered this place online so we went as soon as we could.  Lovely little area to feed the goats and the breakfasts were fantastic. That's before you realise it's a charity doing great work with people who may require a little more assistance. Amazing staff. We will go wherever we are in the area

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Winwood
recent_reviews.text:
We got married at Bertâ€™s Barrow in June 2024 and it was absolutely fantastic! The venue is stunning and incredibly versatile â€“ we were able to personalise it to reflect us. From the very beginning, Charlotte and Jason were amazing. Nothing was too much trouble, and they were so helpful in bringing our vision to life (the disco ball was a brilliant touch!).
They gave us loads of time to decorate, which made the lead-up stress-free and relaxed. On the day, they ran everything like clockwork â€“ we didnâ€™t have to think about a single logistical detail. It all flowed perfectly around us, allowing us to just enjoy the day.
The venue itself is a dream: beautiful fields filled with flowers for photos, plenty of outdoor space to enjoy the sunshine, and great indoor areas just in case the weather doesnâ€™t cooperate. We loved how much personality we could inject into the day â€“ and Charlotte and Jason had loads of fun, creative ideas to elevate the experience. One of our favourites was the band making a surprise grand entrance and leading everyone into the hidden party room!
Transport back to Leeds was easy to organise for guests too, which made the day even smoother.
If youâ€™re looking for a wedding venue thatâ€™s beautiful, flexible, and fun â€“ we couldnâ€™t recommend Bertâ€™s Barrow enough!!

recent_reviews.author: Aisling Walsh
recent_reviews.text:
We had our wedding at Bert's Barrow last year, and it was truly the most magical experience. From the moment we first saw the venue, we knew it was the perfect place for our big day. We got married on the lawn in the sunshine with the beautiful view, ate in the corn store with the gorgeous fairy light wall backdrop, and partied in the bunting barn with a band and dance floor. The separate barns work so well for that reason and the setting is stunning.

Charlotte and Jason are the loveliest, most accommodating and hardworking people. They truly went above and beyond to make sure everything ran smoothly and we really did have the best day ever. We went with most of the recommended suppliers which was great as it all worked so seamlessly. We felt completely at ease throughout the planning process and on the day of the wedding.

Our guests couldnâ€™t stop telling us what a perfect day it was. We couldnâ€™t have asked for a more perfect place to get married. Highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Daniel Berry
recent_reviews.text: As a wedding photographer this venue is absolutely outstanding. A true family run business who care so much about their couples and vendors alike. The staff are brilliant and the venue itself is so stunning. Highly recommend to any couples looking to book their wedding venue. Thank you for having me.

recent_reviews.author: Reece Glover
recent_reviews.text:
Huge thank you to Charlotte and Jase for making our wedding day so specialâ¤ï¸
The first time I went to the venue was for a works party back in 2021, that is when I knew I wanted to get married there. The venue is stunning and so well maintained, I love that each couple can style it to their own taste.
Communication is fantastic, Charlotte is always just a WhatsApp away which is so assuring when trying to plan a wedding! She recommended some amazing suppliers which we used and loved. Charlotte and Jason also communicated with most suppliers leading up to the wedding which was so helpful, they do all they can to minimise wedding related stress!
We received so many compliments on the venue, our guests loved it just as much as we did! Also, the photos taken there look unbelievable ğŸ˜
Myself and my husband are so grateful for everything Charlotte and Jase did for us, what a team! Highly recommend x

recent_reviews.author: Kristy
recent_reviews.text: Gorgeous farm, super friendly animals especially if you have a box of carrots. The sandpit and playground was a hit with my little boy. We had some gorgeous lunch at the cafe and bought a lovely teddy from the shop. The staff were so friendly and helpful.

recent_reviews.author: charles lam
recent_reviews.text: It was such a fun farm â€” I really enjoyed it! There were lots of different animals, and you could get really close and even pet them. I especially loved feeding milk to the calf and lamb. You must try it!

recent_reviews.author: Sandra Coomber
recent_reviews.text:
It's only a small place, but the staff are very welcoming, and it's great that the public can get close to some of the animals. Lamb and calf feeding was very interesting and hands-on, with the public able to do the milk feeding, with the supervision of the knowledgeable staff, who obviously care a great deal about their animals. It's a great way to introduce children to the importance of respecting animals and how important our farmers are, as this is a working farm.
At the gift shop, you can buy cartons of cut carrots to feed the animals as you walk around (if you do this, make sure you save a few pieces for the llamas, goats, donkeys and ponies near the end of the walk round). There is a family-friendly cafe with a few great lunch options, and as we were leaving, we saw a notice for dog training classes. This is really worth the visit and the Â£10 entry fee to keep this farm going.

recent_reviews.author: Cal Pat
recent_reviews.text: Great experience for kids and adults of any age. Walking around the farm feeding animals is a great time for the family. Food on site is okay too. Lots of activities for the kids to do so kept them happy. Will be back soon enough

recent_reviews.author: Denys Lynch
recent_reviews.text:
Great fun on the Halloween trail today, some lovely spooky surprises as you walk round. Itâ€™s been raining, so bring your wellies and get stuck in.

Very friendly service and a bonus for any Leeds United fans big or small, the trail is in the same field as the legendary Bielsa Barn!

Rare opportunity to have your picture with the great man up close - just watch out for the spider!

recent_reviews.author: Claire Griffin
recent_reviews.text: Brooklea pumpkins is a brilliant place to come with the kiddies they had a blast! 2nd year coming and especially loved the Halloween trail this year!

recent_reviews.author: Paul Dickenson
recent_reviews.text: Came at the weekend with my 10 week old for his first pumpkin picking experience. Only about 10-15 minute walk from the local train station if you donâ€™t drive and was nicely spaced out with a pumpkin picking field near the main house where they were serving drinks and food with a few props for photos, then a second bigger field filled with lots of Halloween props and statues to walk around. The family that run it were lovely and very friendly, can also recommend their chocolate brownie and hot chocolate with marshmallows for a post-picking treat!

recent_reviews.author: Dawn Kirby
recent_reviews.text: We had a brilliant time at the pumpkin trail today, loads of great decorations and really well organised. Also so accommodating and helpful when we needed to change our arrival time. Would 100% recommend for halloween fun and pumpkin picking!

recent_reviews.author: A Ghost In Your Phone
recent_reviews.text: I heard about Redwood by chance on Instagram and so glad I did. We went pumpkin picking, but saw they also do pyo fruit in the summer, so fingers crossed for next summer. We parked in the free reservoir car park right beside the farm. We got there for opening to avoid crowds and pick a good pumpkin. They had covid systems in place and an activity sheet for little ones. There were fun decorations at the farm shop and into the field, we picked a couple of good pumpkins, bobbed them in the car and took advantage of being right next to the reservoir,  going for a walk round, it was a great morning out, the staff were helpful and friendly, good selection of pumpkins, I'd definitely recommend

recent_reviews.author: Sharon Jones
recent_reviews.text: A really nice place to visit & not too far away , always a pleasant greeting from the staff very obliging ! Just had a fabulous day strawberry picking , canâ€™t wait to return for the sunflowers ğŸŒ» & of course pumpkin ğŸƒ picking too ! Thankyou for always making it a welcoming place ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Khalid Ali
recent_reviews.text:
Excellent! Free to get in. Make sure to grab a wheelbarrow if any are about and roam freely to grab your pumpkins. I brought along secateurs and some gardening gloves which came handy to pick my own. There are plenty already untethered.
You buy your pumpkins according to size.
The farm shop is small but the fruit and veg looks amazingly fresh - great colour.
The waffles and ice cream was thoroughly enjoyed by the kids. They ran around and took photographs and pushed each other around in the wheelbarrow whilst we grown ups enjoyed a nice cup of tea. All round an excellent hour or two experience.
The added bonus is the nearby Ardsley Reservoir which we didn't have time for, unfortunately.

recent_reviews.author: Itohan joy Okunzuwa
recent_reviews.text:
Nice place to come and pick your own pumpkin
We go here every year
Itâ€™s really nice
Highly recommend

recent_reviews.author: Heather Chadwick
recent_reviews.text: Went for the sunflower patch which was declared open.  I paid Â£5 for parking plus an additional Â£10 entry fee for two of us, which was supposed to include 6 sunflowers.  We couldnâ€™t find a flowering sunflower anywhere.  I returned to the kiosk to ask the person who had taken the entry fee if any sunflowers were actually ready and where I might find them, to which I got â€œdunno.â€   When I expressed my confusion over having paid Â£15 when the product wasnâ€™t even ready, I just got a rude shrug and he walked off.  I left empty handed.  Do not waste your money, what a dishonest rip off.

recent_reviews.author: Will Evans
recent_reviews.text: Great way to spend a morning, Â£10 for entry and can pick 6 sunflowers too. The actual patch is massive and took us a good 20 mins to walk around. There is also a great area for kids, with a sand patch and haystacks for climbing as well a climbing frame and tractor. For the adults there is a small cafe serving tea and cakes. Would definitely recommend and if youâ€™ve got kids you can easily spend a couple of hours

recent_reviews.author: Ian Cartwright
recent_reviews.text: Nice little family run pumpkin patch with pizza van, cafe, Play ground and hay bales.  Good value pumpkins.  Really good high monkey bars for older kids!

recent_reviews.author: Poppy Swales
recent_reviews.text:
ğŸŒ» Best day out ever at Pop up patch. We had a play in the park, walked around the sunflower maze where my son helped pick me out some lovely sunflowers. ğŸŒ»

Highly recommend for families as it was fantastic value for money at Â£10 per family and you get to take home 6 sunflowers.

One of our favourite parts of the day was all the bees and butterflies we saw while in the field.

They have a cafe for snacks and drinks, as well as a pick your own potato patch. We took home a bag for Sunday lunch ğŸ¤£

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Muffitt
recent_reviews.text: I was looking for a nice animal themed cheap trip out. Â£5 for the 4 of us and 2 bags of animal feed. Fed the goats, saw chickens, ducks ,geese, llamas, donkeys, rabbits, sheep, ponies, wallabies (I think) and then the babies. It may be a small loop but it's worth it and the kids loved it.

recent_reviews.author: Donna T
recent_reviews.text:
Friendly tame animals that happily and gently feed from your hands, the kids absolutely loved it! And amazing value with a lovely farm shop. I'm  told the fishing lakes are great too.

Update: There is now a lovely barn area with mums and babies as well as wallabies. It's always lovely to have a trip out here and a picnic.

recent_reviews.author: max saneesh
recent_reviews.text: We had a wonderful visit to the farm with our children. The experience was perfect for little ones, offering easy walking paths that made it a breeze to explore. The highlight was definitely feeding the animalsâ€”our kid loved getting up close to the friendly goats, sheep, and chickens. The farm shop was well-stocked with fresh, local produce and unique gifts, while the children's play area was a hit, providing a safe and fun space for the kids to burn off some energy. Overall, it was a delightful day out that we highly recommend for families!

recent_reviews.author: Loreta Kristapsone
recent_reviews.text: Today, my son was thrilled to visit the farm. He loved itâ€”there was so much laughter with the goats and the bigger pigs with their babies. We had the best time from morning until lunch. Itâ€™s such a beautiful place, full of nature and so peaceful. â˜ºï¸

pumpkin_patches.address: None Go Bye Farm Shop, Otley Old Rd, Leeds LS18 5HZ

recent_reviews.author: Kalina Fedorczuk
recent_reviews.text:
Loved it!!
The pumpkin patch is massive with tons of different pumpkins, we got an absolute carts full.. massive pumpkins; thought we would be paying Â£60 at least, turned out to only be Â£40 for what is enough to decorate our whole home! The staff even cut off an additional pound out of kindness! The pizza was amazing too and was of restaurant quality x

recent_reviews.author: Carl Thornburn
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic place to visit. So much to see and do and well worth spending a day in the pick your own fields and then some fantastic picture opportunities at the farm. Well done to the whole family who run such a brilliant event over the Halloween weeks. ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Liz Robertson
recent_reviews.text: What a fantastic family experience this was today.Â  The organisation, imagination, and creativity needs to be applauded. Not only was there a piano in a midst of a sea of sunflowers but a huge swing and other surprises asÂ  we wandered around the fields. As well as being able to pick pumpkins and magnificent sunflowers, there were lots of activities for children. The greatest fun was the tractor experience, firing water guns at Halloween Targets. What a marvellous idea this is and one that the family can enjoy together.Â  Quality refreshments were available and the Brownies and Pizza were delicious. Pumpkin Patch at Bewholme you have provided a lovely, outdoorÂ  experience for families to enjoy that is environmentally friendly with not a piece of plastic nor tacky rubbish insight. I hope this venture is a huge success for you because you throughly deserve it. Thank you for providing such a well planned, fun experience.

recent_reviews.author: Nathan Doran
recent_reviews.text: Me and my partner have been here a few times. Everyone there is very lovely and welcoming. It's honestly a great place. Pumpkins are great! The sunflowers are beautiful â¤ï¸ I also want to add that they had this really great "pumpkin house" of which I proposed to my now fiancÃ©e! The staff there almost cried and were kind enough to let us have the sunflowers and pumpkins we picked for free as a gift. I would wholeheartedly recommend this place.

pumpkin_patches.address: Homeland Farm, Catfoss Road, Bewholme, Driffield YO25 8DX

recent_reviews.author: Chelsea D
recent_reviews.text: Great place. Welcoming staff. Took 3 kids age 3, 4, and 6 and all had a blast. Plenty to do. Us adults also enjoyed whatever time we werenâ€™t herding our offspring. Only thing that slightly bothered me was the space for the baby birds inside. May be worth have a small space to hide from kids fingers inside  a larger cage for when theyâ€™re feeling confident.

recent_reviews.author: Charmaine Ayre
recent_reviews.text:
It's okay to go when kids are over 3 years old, we took our 16 month old and there was limited thing that he could do/ interact with due to age restrictions, the pink mini pig tractor has an age limit of 3 years old, "soft play area" that you get to via the tractor ride didnt actually contain a soft play area. In fact it was large slides that had age restriction of 5 years + and a sand play area/ tractor driving pit.
