We would have preferred more for littlies to do especially when paying Â£17 for admission of a over 1 year old. If there is age restrictions on majority of rides like 3+ i think it would be better that under 3's go free. As there isnt much as stated he could do.

However the fairy/ troll walk, farm animal barn walk through & maze were attractions we were able to do and as for play areas, he could go on the small climbing house, mini trampoline and push about tractors. As I said very limited with what we could do after paying Â£17 for him to "go play" but was a lovely day for a trip out with the sun.

recent_reviews.author: Steve Ralph
recent_reviews.text:
What a brilliant animal adventure park this is. It's fairly pricey but worth it.
Animals of all kinds to interact with, games, live shows and various (free) rides.
Then there are the large play areas with the one titled " beach" being fantastic.
Just let the kids loose. You won't see them again.
There are food vendors on site, so a packed lunch isn't necessary, but probably having a backup is a good idea.

My one small annoyance was the ice vendor at the beach, my order was wrong on two elements for higher priced items!!
Secondly, ice cream for kids usually includes, sprinkles, sauce etc oh no, my mistake 60p a drizzle times 3 !!##
It probably wouldn't have filled a tablespoon for Â£1.80......naughty.

recent_reviews.author: Richard Thomas
recent_reviews.text:
Piglets is still one of my favourite places to take kiddo (I'm actually going to miss it when they are too old to want to come)
there is just enough to do without feeding the urge to rush .

pumpkin_patches.address: Towthorpe Grange, Towthorpe Moor Ln, Towthorpe, York YO32 9ST

recent_reviews.author: Abby
recent_reviews.text: Visited for the first time yesterday & it was a brilliant afternoon spent. It was quite busy with it being lovely weather but thereâ€™s plenty of space for parking. You donâ€™t need to book, you simply grab a bucket or a punnet and start picking! Thereâ€™s a huge area of beautiful sunflowers & wildflowers, you can pick these too. I think you can grab pruning shears from near where you pay for your pickings, we didnâ€™t know this when we started walking through. You can buy a variety of fresh fruit, veg & eggs m from the payment area. Thereâ€™s a little cafe but is a little expensive. It cost us Â£8.50 for 2 small punnets, 3 sunflowers & a bunch of wildflowers. The strawberries are delicious! Iâ€™d highly recommend visiting, Iâ€™d love to come again!

recent_reviews.author: The Ground Below
recent_reviews.text:
Great farm which is open for strawberry picking during the summer. Huge place, plenty of kids and families there and you can also pick your sun flowers.
There is a farm shop as well which has some other produce and a cafe.
Staff welcoming and friendly and the strawberries were very reasonably priced!

recent_reviews.author: Jake Watson
recent_reviews.text: Always a good trip, getting a lot more popular over recent years I've found, plenty of bees and flies on the sunflowers and the strawberries were lovely as always. Top tip the sunflowers will house a load of flies so be careful where you put them inside for that first day. Will be back for the maze and pumpkins later in the year.

recent_reviews.author: Kate Trodden
recent_reviews.text: Had a lovely afternoon here with my friend and her 3 year old daughter. We picked wild flowers and sunflowers and enjoyed a drink at the cafe. Staff were really helpful and welcoming.

recent_reviews.author: Pat Goose
recent_reviews.text: Great selection of pumpkins and helpful friendly staff who advise on best for cooking, carving etc. You can pick your own or buy from the stall. Wheelbarrows provided to transport them to car (some are really big). Genuine homemade made soup and various home made cookies on sale, along with snacks and drinks. Dining marquee tastefully decorated in autumnal theme. Great place to spend an afternoon. Strawberries available earlier in year.

recent_reviews.author: Khanz
recent_reviews.text: Not many strawberries left but had a lovely experience of picking them. Staff were nice despite being busy.

recent_reviews.author: Lois Dale
recent_reviews.text:
Our first time visiting yesterday but will certainly not be the last. What a fantastic place to pick fresh fruit and make some lovely memories with my daughter and mum.
Highly recommend a cup of tea and fruit scone after picking. All of the staff were extremely friendly and welcoming.
We cannot wait to return later in the year to try out the pumpkin picking !!

recent_reviews.author: hebby 73
recent_reviews.text:
Free parking, tea & coffee, scones etc etc Amazing place, lovely strawberries we picked 3kg ğŸ˜‚ no idea what we are going to do with them all, probably give most of them away, was great to get out with the family, pick some strawberries and have a picnic ğŸ§º

1 year laterâ€¦managed to get here for the raspberries, lots of plants to pick from, still plenty left, will be back for the pumpkins when there grown

recent_reviews.author: Leanne Field
recent_reviews.text:
BONFIRE NIGHT 2023
WOW what an amazing night!!!! We went to last years bonfire and that was great, but this year EVEN BETTER!!!! Great food, great fireworks, theres a little bonfire people can get close to, to keep warm and then a BIG bonfire too. There are beautifully decorated tents if you want to hide from the weather and tuck into the food which is offered inside the tents. The Hot dogs were lovely, great selection of food including burgers pulled pork sandwhiches, soup, chocolate apples, chocolate, brownies and more plus coffee, tea, hot chocolate and a range of beer. It was really muddy this year due the to the weather. This cannot be helped but my little girls absolutely loved this, they jumped and slided in the mud and had a great time, so it just goes to show whatever the weather kids can have great fun so if you're going to come next year I'd say bring wellies and good over alls and a family can have a great night of fun, whatever the weather â¤ thank you for a spectacular bonfire night. We will be here again next year.

recent_reviews.author: Daniel Roberts
recent_reviews.text: Good afternoon out. Main tent was too loud for my eldest (autistic), but the Maze kept him busy and he loved picking out his pumpkin. No tractor rides this year but maybe that's because we arrived quite late.

recent_reviews.author: Tommo
recent_reviews.text: went for a maze adventure today - staff were all lovely and very friendly and accomodating - despite going on a very quiet day they were very happy to facilitate us with food, drinks and warmth. interior tent was very nicely decorated and enjoyed spending my time there. would go back again for other events

recent_reviews.author: Chloe Leaver
recent_reviews.text: Bonfire night. It was incredible.. parking was easy, the white tent was warm with beer and got drinks.. I'm a veggie so I couldn't have any of the food (hog roat, pie and peas and hot dogs) but it was set out lovely and inviting! The bonfire itself was amazing and the fireworks really were the highlight. Can't wait to go again next year

On the hot days to come 21 degrees local over next few day worth booking if you can get in there it's something else along side the food out of this world  absolutely ğŸ’¯ % perfection mash potatoes and local sausages is the best mash and sausages I've ever tasted beat any competition in West Yorkshire.

recent_reviews.author: Nicola L
recent_reviews.text: First visit to this cafe & had brunch- 5 items of English breakfast. We hadnâ€™t booked but were happy to wait for a table & it was totally worth it! The barn itself is beautiful, the food was delicious & reasonably priced. Will definitely go back.

recent_reviews.author: andyj h
recent_reviews.text: Greeted by friendly staff and was shown to our table. The cafe was busy and we had afternoon tea for two, this was delivered with great service and attentive staff. All the food and cakes were tasty with as much tea as you could drink. We will be back. Thank you.

recent_reviews.author: DanniE
recent_reviews.text: Really great cafe. Actually it's more of a restaurant than a cafe as it was so good. Would highly recommend. The food was delicious and the service was great.

recent_reviews.text: Amazing experience. Lots of fun activities to enjoy. Plenty of picnic benches if you want to bring your own food. Friendly staff. Fantastic value for money.

recent_reviews.author: Julie faz
recent_reviews.text:
What a great place to visit. There is something for every age and you can easily spend the day here. If
your kids like.climbing and slides this is the place. There are lovely little interactive  statues that keep.you entertained as you walk around from.one area to another to keep the kids engaged.

recent_reviews.author: Adrian Pantea
recent_reviews.text:
The Enchanted Forest is a delightful venue, filled with charming nods to various childrenâ€™s stories and offering plenty of engaging activities for young visitors. We particularly enjoyed the boat lake - lots of fun, with the occasional splash when bumping into others, though the bumps are very gentle and part of the experience. For something a bit more mentally stimulating, the maze is a great option. Itâ€™s entertaining and a little tricky â€” you might find yourself going in circles, but thatâ€™s part of the fun!

Unfortunately, we didnâ€™t have time to explore everything, so we may plan a return trip.

The car park is large, but given the popularity of the attraction, itâ€™s wise to book in advance (thereâ€™s also a discounted rate if you arrive after 2 PM). The staff were incredibly kind and professional throughout our visit, which made the experience even more enjoyable.

recent_reviews.author: louisa malee
recent_reviews.text:
ğŸŒŸ A Fantastic Day Out at Stockeld Park! ğŸŒŸ
We visited Stockeld Park with our two little ones (ages 4 and 3), and honestly, it exceeded all our expectations! The park is bursting with fun, imagination, and adventure â€“ our kids had the best time. Even our very energetic 4-year-old with ADHD was totally worn out by the end of the day... which, trust me, is nothing short of a miracle!

The weather was glorious, which made the experience even better. The staff were so friendly and helpful throughout the park, and the food was absolutely delicious â€“ a pleasant surprise for a family attraction! Everything was also really reasonably priced, which made the day feel even more enjoyable without worrying about breaking the bank.

From the adventure playgrounds to the enchanted forest and everything in between, it was a magical day for all of us. Weâ€™re already planning our return â€“ canâ€™t recommend Stockeld Park enough for families with young kids. â­â­â­â­â­

recent_reviews.author: Nurjahan Ullah
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful family environment. Very welcoming staff. You can even pick your Very own wild flowers which was the high light for me. The strawberries are delicious. Once you have purchased the strawberries then you can eat them. Beautiful day out with the family. They have raspberries too. It's very local so you are doing your bit for local business too.

recent_reviews.author: AbuAadam
recent_reviews.text: Great location for strawberry picking in Yorkshire being close to the airport. Tractors provide a lift to the picking fields. First stop is the wild flowers. Nice picturesque location. From there next stop are the strawberry fields or can walk it as itâ€™s only a few minutes walk. Must purchase tickets which canâ€™t be used against the price of the strawberries. Â£7.50kg for strawberries. Also have raspberries at Â£10.50kg. However not all strawberries we picked were that sweet I have to be honest. Spillmans had sweeter strawberries. However still decent and should still visit as kids enjoyed it a lot. Nice play area for kids and nice ice cream available. Overall decent visit.

recent_reviews.author: Biswajit Kar
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely loved the experience of picking fresh juicy strawberries and raspberries. The picking season starts from mid June and lasts still mid of August. Sometimes depending on the weather the season might start sooner or last longer. They release the picking slots depending on how much ripe fruit is available for picking. Ring them to know the slots or check in their website. The admission fees includes a tractor ride and unlimited flower picking. Strawberry and raspberry however is priced around 7.5 and 10.50 Â£ per kilo. Inside there is a small park for kids and a cafe for sandwiches, coffee and ice cream.

They also do various other events as well throughout the year. Example: Tulips, turkey and pumpkin picking. Lastly, a huge shout out for all the staffs who were very friendly.

Definitely worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Shahzaeb Aslam
recent_reviews.text: We had a lovely time visiting Horsforth Pick Your Own at Kemps Farm today! The farm is beautifully maintained, and the whole experience was family-friendly and enjoyable from start to finish. There was a fresh, ripe strawberries available to pick since it is strawberry season right now â€” everything looked so healthy and delicious.

recent_reviews.author: Alan Hay

One of the happiest moments of my life. ğŸŒ»â™¥ï¸ğŸŒ»

Beautiful vistas wherever I looked. The family of helpers were working very hard to ensure the evening was magical for everyone. Iâ€™ve been in previous years, but late August 2025 is as good as it gets. No need to change anything now. Perfection. ğŸŒ»ğŸŒ»ğŸŒ»ğŸŒ»

Have visited this place twice now and loved it. This year they really upped their game increasing the size of the field. Absolutely beautifully set out with various props for photos. Pick your own, food trucks, clean toilets etc. We will be back!
We took some amazing pics, only a small selection below ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: Coco â€œÎ”â€ Coco
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful! This year was even better than one year ago. Super friendly&helpful staff â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Zara Shepherd
recent_reviews.text:
We visited here with 3 adults and 2 kids under 5 and we really enjoyed ourselves.
Loads of spaces for parking when we arrived and would recommend booking ahead as we did as did get busy.
We did the walk around the farm to pick fruit and veg which was fun but did recommend to staff to invest in kids trolleys or something as alot of walking. Staff were super friendly and helpful advice for going round.
Kids loved the indoor playground and there is a little outdoor bit as well. The animal viewing was fun but thought could be more access to other animals. This place is great for families and day outs, there is also the farm shop and we treated ourselves to their milkshake machine on leaving.

recent_reviews.author: Amanda Henderson
recent_reviews.text:
My kids love coming here during the holidays when we visit Nana.  My daughter has special needs and it caters for all her needs of space to play and climb, different sensory area such as the pulley system, rope bridge, amazing slide and sand/water play outside.  Cafe menu has been improved and is much better.

Only down side is the cost for adult entry, due to this we donâ€™t tend to spend as much in the cafe or stay for lunch.  If the cost was lower for adults I believe more would be spent in the cafe for the adults as it is a lovely space for both kids and adults to go, safe and adventurous play for the kids and comfortable area with good food for adults to converse.

Overall I would highly recommend to any of my family and friends to visit.

recent_reviews.author: Christine Lewis
recent_reviews.text:
Wonderful experience. Absolutely worth it and a great day out. Book tickets online. Staff are so Friendly and great with the kids. Once inside there is one door out which is locked and operated electronically by a staff member. So the kids are safe inside and free to roam and have fun. Outdoor seating area with games. Outdoor play area for kids. Indoor wooden built play arena. There is an animal section free to roam in with three feeding sessions a day for the kids to see.
Venue has a cafe which does beverages and food.
We purchased the play and pick tickets. We played for 1hr and picked for 1hr however the kids could of done longer at both.
Massive grounds large carpark
Totally separate building from the farm shop

recent_reviews.author: Alexandra Watt
recent_reviews.text: Little Farmers is a great fun place for all children. I think it's more aimed for younger children up to 8 or 9 but any older wouldn't enjoy as much.  I find Â£7 for an adult ridiculous so only come once a year you do get a tea or coffee token but for Â£26 for an adult & 2 children is a lot when there isn't anything for you to do except supervise.  Love seeing the wee animals on our visit & look forward to the lamb feeding soon.  The girls had a ball which is the main thing.

recent_reviews.author: Lynda Christie
recent_reviews.text:
I have been to this shop a lot .
Due to ill health I have been unable to go .
However canâ€™t wait for my trip back this week .
Great service fresh food .
And I always seem to fine something else to buy .

recent_reviews.author: Pim van Oerle
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely place with a great selection of veggies, including some nice more unusual ones thatcare harder to find elsewhere. Good selection of local meats and cheeses too!

Awesome to see such a great place pop up close to home - and run by super friendly people!

recent_reviews.author: Marc Wood
recent_reviews.text: Turned up at 6pm to find shop closed, advertised as open till 7pm. No famous steak pie for me. ğŸ™

recent_reviews.author: Jez Jackson
recent_reviews.text: Found this place by accident in December when buying a Xmas tree from the adjoining garden centre. Great selection of local fruit n veg. Went back week later for whole Xmas dinner shop. Even had sausage and bacon. Made tastiest Xmas dinner ever. Great cheese too.

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Hynd
recent_reviews.text: Superb Visit , kids loved it especially the Tractors never seen a place like it before . If weather changes , indoor softplay ( separate price and cost ) went for outdoor experience . Arrived time slot 2-5 and was plenty for Kids to do for 3 hours . Plenty staff on hand especially helping younger kids with tractors , looking forward to return for Halloween events and see what extension plans current underway building . Added extra Bonus - airport so close and sight many flights is brilliant .

recent_reviews.author: Richard Curran
recent_reviews.text:
Alright, buckle up, buttercups, for a review of Conifox Adventure Park â€“ a place that promises endless fun and delivers... well, mostly.

We arrived, brimming with the kind of optimism only parents armed with caffeine can muster. And fair play, the place has it all! You can run wild like a sugar-crazed squirrel, tackle obstacle courses that make you question your life choices, zip around on go-karts (because what's an adventure without a mild risk of whiplash?), and generally exhaust your offspring into a blissful, silent coma. Plus, there's an indoor play area, which is perfect for when the Scottish weather inevitably decides to reenact a scene from The Perfect Storm.

Now, here's where my eyebrows did a little dance of surprise, and not the good kind. It turns out, "adventure" at Conifox comes with a side of "separate billing." You want to hit the outdoor thrills and let the little darlings loose in the indoor soft play? That'll be two separate transactions, please! My wallet felt like it had just completed its own obstacle course, and the finish line was a rather deflated sense of "did we really just spend that much?" for a day out. It felt a tad on the expensive side when you tallied up both tickets.

BUT! (And this is a big, glorious 'but')... the saving grace, the true hidden gem, the sprinkle of magic dust on this slightly pricey confection? Adults are allowed to play too! Oh, the unbridled joy! Watching my kids' faces as I belly-flopped down the slides, got tangled in the netting, and (unintentionally) wiped out another parent on the go-karts was worth every penny. It added a whole new layer of hilarity and slightly embarrassing parental participation that genuinely elevated the fun. Nothing quite says "quality family time" like seeing your dad get stuck in a tunnel meant for toddlers.

And finally, a tradition as old as time itself at these sorts of places: the food and drink. Prepare to take out a small, secured loan. The prices here are more ambitious than my attempts to look graceful on the climbing frame. My advice? Pack a picnic, smuggle in some snacks, and maybe bring a hip flask of moral support.

Conifox is a blast, especially if you embrace your inner child and get stuck in. Just be prepared for the dual pricing structure to hit your bank account like a rogue go-kart, and plan your refreshments strategy like a military operation. You'll leave tired, happy, and slightly poorer, but with some genuinely funny memories.

recent_reviews.author: David Shemilt
recent_reviews.text: Great place for kids both inside and out. Breathtakingly expensive so go for the day and take a picnic because the kids will love it

recent_reviews.author: Ryan Wilson
recent_reviews.text: We loved this place! We took our YOUTHSPACE youth group of primary aged kids to this during the summer holidays and were able to play both in the soft play and the adventure park outside. The kids had an amazing time, especially in the soft play, which has so much to offer for all ages, even the adults! The party rooms are super comfortable and the food options were brilliant. From the booking to the day, the staff were all wonderful and helpful, ensuring the kids had the best time, and they were well prepared for us arriving, with our very own sign on the door to greet us! We will definitely be back!

recent_reviews.author: The Yorkshire Chef
recent_reviews.text: Cocktails & Geeks in Edinburgh is an absolute must visit for any fan of pop culture and creative cocktails. Tucked away beneath the Market Street arches, this immersive bar transforms its theme every few months, drawing inspiration from iconic franchises like Game of Thrones, Jurassic Park, and Stranger Things. The attention to detail is incredible from the dÃ©cor to the drink names and flavours, every element is crafted with care and a deep love for fandom. The cocktails are as imaginative as they are delicious, with bold flavour combinations and stunning presentation. The staff are friendly, knowledgeable, and genuinely passionate, adding to the overall experience with great recommendations and explanations. While the space is small and booking ahead is advised, the atmosphere is vibrant, the service outstanding, and the concept totally unique. Itâ€™s far more than just a cocktail bar, itâ€™s a themed experience that keeps you coming back every time the menu changes.

recent_reviews.author: M Taylor
recent_reviews.text: Love this place. Themes are always on point and the cocktails are amazing. Staff are always friendly and make it a great experience. They can discuss the inspiration behind the drinks as well as the process of making the weird and wonderful combinations of flavours.  If you are unsure about flavours they will help you find something that you will enjoy.  I didn't have any food so cannot rate this. My favourite cocktail bar in Edinburgh ğŸ¥‚

recent_reviews.author: Camilla Green
recent_reviews.text: Wow what an experience! The service was amazing and they told us all about the drinks and why they were named what they were. Such a good atmosphere! The theme was Stranger Things and the cocktails were so delicious and perfectly made - you can tell they really thought about the ingredients as well as the presentation - will definitely back next time weâ€™re in Edinburgh! ğŸ¥°

recent_reviews.author: Ella
recent_reviews.text: Such an incredible bar! Decor, uniforms & menus change with the themes and are done in-house. The artwork was all so so cool! We were served by a lovely Australian lady (I didnâ€™t get her name sorry) who was so fun & explained the menu so well, she had super cool earrings that matched the vibe too. The Upside Down menu is so well thought out with the 80s classics and the â€œupside downâ€ twist on them. Great range of non-alcoholic cocktails which were non-alc versions of the actual menu drinks, which I was very impressed by!

pumpkin_patches.address: Arch 14, 27 E Market St, Edinburgh EH8 8FS

recent_reviews.author: bob â€œFlorida bobâ€ peter
recent_reviews.text: Great place for all types garden and home shopping even large food area. Lovely coffee shop restaurant Great selection.  Big tip there are 2 counters for getting coffee and cakes second is further in restaurant.  Great play area for kids up to 4 and 3 10 .outside play area as well. Chairs could do with a bit TLC

recent_reviews.author: Steve Catto
recent_reviews.text:
We recently had the pleasure of calling in for lunch on our way back from The Borders while the car charged.  The right-hand part of the cafe, heading towards the outdoor garden centre, is the dog friendly section, identified by markers on the windows and on the tables.  There is table service here, unlike most other Dobbies.  We were all made very welcome, including the four-legged friends.

For lunch we chose the Cumberland Sausage and Mash, with Red-onion Gravy, and the Mac and Cheese.
I traditionally expect Cumberland to be a long, curly sausage, but the description of "3 sausages" implied otherwise. It was served with seasonal veg, which was cooked relatively soft.  The gravy was nicely sweet and the sausages were tasty with slightly crispy skins.  I am told the Mac and Cheese was very cheesy on top.

In all, it was delicious comfort food, just what was called for as a travelling lunch on a cold day. My expectations for a high-class restaurant would have been much higher, but for a pub/garden centre lunch it really doesn't get much better than this.

recent_reviews.author: ava mckenzie
recent_reviews.text:
As a Dobbies member, you receive a voucher for free coffee and cake for your birthday.
The only word I can use for the seating in the coffee area is, disgusting. Nearly all of the sofas/chairs were heavily stained, and it clearly had been like that for some time.
As there were no other seats left, we had to sit there. There was food all over chairs and the floor, trays of dirty dishes etc on tables. A member of staff did come and start cleaning away the trays but left all the food on the chairs/floors and walked away.
The place just seemed a shambles, we won't be back.

recent_reviews.author: Uilleam Cameron
recent_reviews.text:
3 â­ï¸ average

Great service in the plant area, with helpful advice for what might work for what I planned. â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

Complete contrast in the cafe when we went for refreshment. Many tables had not been cleared or cleaned, which gives a poor impression of service quality, and one result was that there were no clean trays available. There was a growing queue and only one person serving and taking money. This was painfully slow and we gave up and left. There were at least 7 or 8 customers joined the queue behind us (3 in from) by that time. Staff seemed lackadaisical and uninterested. Clearly short staffed that day. There was no supervisor in sight to raise this at the time. Very disappointing. â­ï¸â­ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Roanna Hutcheson
recent_reviews.text: 10/10 top lad, great farmer

recent_reviews.author: Iain Weir
recent_reviews.text:
Being a blue badge holder I was able to get parked pretty much right at the entrance. As they say, wellies or sturdy outdoor footwear is a must as it is located in fields - there is hardcore down but still very muddy, part of the fun!  There was a selection of food and drink vans with undercover seating area.  The seating area filled up very quickly though and was very noisy with all the children being excited.  Food and drink wasnâ€™t really much more expensive than youâ€™d pay on high street.

Haunted Trail was a bit of a disappointment and we felt that it could have been so much more fun.  There wasnâ€™t anything really apart from some sheets handing as ghosts until you got to the cauldron area for buying marshmallows to toast.

Pumpkin patch had a huge selection of pumpkins to choose from all ready to be picked up.  There were the usual people watching their children kicking and stomping on pumpkins (really disrespectful in my opinion) but apart from that was good fun choosing which pumpkins you wanted to take home. Pumpkins cost a lot more than they would in the supermarket but you need to keep in mind it was only Â£7 to get entry for the car.

There was a maize maze as well but we didnâ€™t go into that area.

The waiting area for dogs wasnâ€™t enclosed so I was a bit unsure how dogs could be left there.

Overall a good day.

recent_reviews.author: Jamie MacKinnon
recent_reviews.text: The pumpkin patch is second to none, the best spread and so much cheaper than other patches. (Some better than supermarket prices too!) The best thing is the haunted trail, canâ€™t find this anywhere else, the kids absolutely loved it and so did I, such an amazing setting! Staff lovely, set up obviously had so much thought put in to it and we will 100% be back. I canâ€™t recommend this enough.

recent_reviews.author: Sara Covey
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic day out with the family at Balgone Estate to pick pumpkins and squashes from their pumpkin patch. A great â€˜haunted trailâ€™ to follow round the loch and a good selection of food trucks. An autumn must!

recent_reviews.author: Jesse Turner
recent_reviews.text: This place is the perfect autumn Halloween season outting for the whole family. A spooky trail with witches, ghosts, and even toasted marshmallows is excellent. The "maize maze" is exactly what you want. The pumpkin patch is huge with loads of different colours and sizes of pumpkins to choose from, with cute photo op stands sprinkled throughout. There's a nice food and drink area, with good choice of proper food, not just snacks, and alcoholic drinks available, with seating and good dog watching (and portaloos). And to top it off, everywhere we spent money took card / mobile payments. This is an outstanding set up and the ideal way to spend a couple autumnal hours. Very highly recommended!

recent_reviews.author: Ms S Brand
recent_reviews.text: Lovely company. All wooden toys and packaged in reused packaging so no extraneous plastic. Products were sent out with 48h tracked delivery  and so arrived really quickly. The table we ordered wasnâ€™t in stock at other suppliers so we were doubly grateful. Would definitely recommend.

recent_reviews.author: John
recent_reviews.text: If you have children here will be interesting, there is a labyrinth, interesting locations, but unfortunately, you need to come in the first days, because then you will not see much, pumpkins all dismantled, you will not see beautiful fields, the labyrinth is a little spoilt. And if it's still raining, it's great, just a swamp. But the idea and the atmosphere is very cool, the main thing is to choose the right day

recent_reviews.author: Jonny B
recent_reviews.text:
First time visit here on day it opened for pumpkin picking (1st october), we had great day walk up and down, whilst pick biggest pumpkins out from thousands on the farm. It also has fresh sweetcorn which you can pick, Wheelie barrows are supplied up on entry, nice prices for the pumpkins we picked. The owners and staff are very polite helpful, toilets on sites, food & ice cream van was on site aswell, if you have never been pumpkin picking I would recommend you experience it (especially) here ğŸ™‚ if you own pair wellies take them with you (which we did). If your pumpkins are muddy they will wash them for you (when buy them).
Highly recommend hereğŸ‘Œ

recent_reviews.author: Naomi Jones
recent_reviews.text: Amazing experience with all the family. Staff were amazing. My daughter cut her finger in the maze and they made sure to help with stopping the bleeding and putting plasters on. A real pleasure spending the day here. Hopefully the corn is as delish as last year. Thank you hightown pumpkin patch ğŸ˜ŠğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Colin
recent_reviews.text: Been going here for years now.  Went 20/10/24. Seems to have got a lot busier now. Queue for a wheelbarrow was about 15 mins. Due to the fact of bone idle people not returning their barrows after use. There wasn't a lot to choose from inside. Mustn't of been a good year for the pumpkins to grow. Lots of yellow flowers about. Ended up with 2 medium sized green pumpkins and was told to leave them outside in the sun for them to ripen. Â£6 a pumpkin or 3 for Â£15. Stalls are a rip off Â£3 for a thimble of coffee.  Picture added was from a few years ago to show you what it used to be like.

recent_reviews.author: Iulianna Tescu
recent_reviews.text: The place in itself is not to big, but the setting is lovely and the atmosphere is very relaxed when you think of so many children around! Soft play areas, some nice flowers, few chickens , outdoors play zone! Free parking on site! Not to pricey!

recent_reviews.author: Dan
recent_reviews.text: Nice day out plenty for the kids to do here. Soft play was good, prices are on the stepper side for alot of the things here. The farm shop was the best place to buy ice-cream and drinks etc cheaper then buying at the soft play, cafe or chips shop. If you go to the chip shop then portions are massive quite easy to share a regular chips between two or even three people

recent_reviews.author: chelsea maddison
recent_reviews.text: I cannot recommend Farrington farm cafe enough for hosting my baby shower last weekend. It was beautifully laid out and the afternoon teas were amazingâ€¦ especially the sausage rolls! Everyone loved it and the food! Thanks again!

recent_reviews.author: Lawsome Just Lawsome
recent_reviews.text: Very nice shop with local selection. Had some breakfast in the cafe. Filthy egg bacon and cheese muffin and some pancakes. Very delicious food and very friendly staff.

pumpkin_patches.address: Main St, Farrington Gurney, Bristol BS39 6UB

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Pumpkin Picking Patch & Halloween Maze Bristol

recent_reviews.author: charlottebb
recent_reviews.text: Such a fun time! The maze was BRILLIANT, I wasnt expecting it to grow so high. Lots of lovely pumpkins with various colours available. The stuff were lovely too, perfect autumnal vibes

recent_reviews.author: Ali Morris (Unique Dress)
recent_reviews.text: We had so much fun picking our pumpkins, and all the staff were really friendly. Iâ€™d totally recommend going here, itâ€™s reasonable too ğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: connie console
recent_reviews.text: This pumpkin patch was amazing! After a terrible experience in bath pumpkin patch, my family of four were in tears, my three year old disabled daughter who was looking forward to picking pumpkins all year was destroyed when bath pumpkin patch had nothing, on a quest to save the day, we embarked on a perilous journey to this Salford picking patch, and it was incredible! So many pumpkins with so much choice so near to Halloween, my ninety year old father with Down syndrome was beyond happy and we all went to a pub to celebrate

recent_reviews.author: Atlas Alexander
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful day out, perfect for low cost day out. Made my goth gf very happy

recent_reviews.author: daniel plummer
recent_reviews.text: A great day out! Free entry, great food and you actually get to pick pumpkins where they are grown, unlike the patches near by we have visited. They also have a selection of varieties from standard carving pumpkins to other tasty varieties for cooking as well.

recent_reviews.author: Josie Maskell
recent_reviews.text: Such a great pumpkin patch! Free entry and more varieties than I've seen anywhere else. Reasonable prices too! We got 2 very large pumpkins, 1 medium and 5 small for Â£30. Lots of other cheap activities such as welly wanging, squash skittles and marshmallow roasting. Will definitely be back next year! ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Wheeler
recent_reviews.text: Not many pumpkins. Very very muddy and a big hill to navigate in that mud. They were nice enough to let us take the dog in, and there was a lovely seating area at the bottom to get a coffee.

recent_reviews.author: Amelia Ollis-Olds
recent_reviews.text: We visit Bath Pumpkin Patch every year and are never disappointed, it is always great value and fun for everyone. They have a great selection of pumpkins and fantastic activities for children. The staff are always helpful, friendly and will help you lift the giant pumpkins into your car!  We always pop to the farm shop before hand for the best breakfast in Bath!

pumpkin_patches.address: JPs Meadow, A4, Newbridge Rd, Bath BA2 9EU

recent_reviews.author: Jack Wise
recent_reviews.text:
Do not go here in a wheelchair unless your very brave!!

This venue advertises as fairly flat and wheelchair friendly. However it is far from that! A boulder filled minefield for wheelchair users. There is a few patches of tarmac where using a wheelchair is easy but more the most part you are either going to struggle or its going to be inaccessible.

The ramps getting in and out of the indoor areas are lacking and are in poor repair. The disabled toilet facilities are dirty and seem to not be checked throughout the day. The disabled toilets would benefit from a key system as the toilets are clearly abused.

The food venues around the site had a good selection however the prices are very high and most of the venues went out of stock shortly after 12.

Despite the poor facilities for my visit there is lots going on throughout the day for children, if it was more accessible 4 stars would be given.

recent_reviews.author: Matt Wells
recent_reviews.text:
Booked with my two kids (10f 7m) and my parents to go in the afternoon on a weekend. There was plenty to do as we walked around the park. Kids never stopped and were never bored. The adventure playground dominates the main field with plenty of things to climb, swing on, or slide down.
Other activities the kids enjoyed were peddle karts, climbing wall, feeding the goats, mini golf, and the slip n slide and pools (summer only). They had a great time and I thought it was definitely good value.

recent_reviews.author: Philip
recent_reviews.text:
A lovely trip for kids, with a huge range of things to see - play areas, soft play, dinosaurs, tractor rides, mini golf, slip n slides, little railways and the list goes on - all of which is included (except for go karts), which is good at Â£55/Â£65 for a family of 4.

Staff are great and engaging, facilities are clean and lots of food and drink options. Only dropped a star on account of a Â£4.95 online booking fee in the year 2025 (and no you can't buy them on site), that's just nuts, sorry.

recent_reviews.author: Briony Johannah
recent_reviews.text:
We had a birthday party and hired the whole play barn this weekend. Was so impressed with everything! The staff working (Ellie and Caitlin) were super helpful and were so kind to my boy when we had to leave the play barn and she let him have one last go on the slide, just the small things are what matters. The space we had was incredible and they tidied up really well after the party before us, no issues whatsoever!
Recommend having birthday parties here ğŸ‘ğŸ¼

pumpkin_patches.address: Pixash Ln, Bath Rd, Keynsham, Bristol BS31 1TP

recent_reviews.author: James Kay
recent_reviews.text:
Excellent zoo, first time visiting. We stopped here on the way down to our holiday to Cornwall, to break up a 6.5 hour journey.
They have a good selection of animals that look very healthy and have plenty of outdoor space. We managed to see all the animals quite easily (unlike some other well known zoos).
A big shout out to Eric who was doing tractor rides for the visitors, my little boy loved it.
They had plenty of indoor play areas and big slides that the kids loved.
The zoo looks to be slowly growing and have a Tiger enclosure planned very soon. We would definitely visit again in future.

recent_reviews.author: Kate
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely amazing!!
Would recommend time after time. One of the best zoos I have been too. Normally in zoos you get the feeling that the animals don't have much room, or place to roam and genuinely feel sorry for them but here you have such a feeling of happiness for them, they have so much room to walk around, enrichment to play with and look so happy and healthy! Not only that, the talks and experiences they have whilst there are so lovely, they tell you so much about each animal, show you their way of feeding them, and get to know each animal on a personal level. The play centre for children is lovely too, really inclusive of all ages.
The cafe their was amazing! Yes prices are a little more than your average cafe prices but I think its so so worth it. The food was absolutely perfect and is the quality you would find in an upmarket place. Definitely go!

recent_reviews.author: Rachel
recent_reviews.text:
We had the best day out at Noahâ€™s Ark Zoo Farm! It was a family visit with my 3 year old and 8 year old, and it was such a wonderful experience from start to finish.
There are so many animals to see, and my kids were especially fascinated by the elephants - such a rare and special treat in the UK. The monkeys put on a great show for us too!!!Every part of the zoo felt like it deserved its own highlight.
The range of activities is amazing:
- Fantastic playgrounds for both little and big kids.
- A huge maze that kept us all entertained.
- And plenty of space to explore and run around.

There were lot of seating areas, picnic spots, ice-cream shops and a food area as well. Itâ€™s very thoughtfully laid out and very family-friendly.
Ample parking spaces - no stress in finding one! An absolutely brilliant day out. We will definitely be coming back!

recent_reviews.author: Tony Jefferies
recent_reviews.text: This is a fantastic place to visit it has lots of different options apart from the brilliant Zoo ,including a food outlets and several different play themed activities for children,including soft play,parks,trampolines. The zoo side the animals have some of the best enclosure I have seen in a zoo,with lots of outdoor areas for them to roam they seem very content. Itâ€™s also has  several places for a quick pit stop to get refreshments also several  toilets . The only thing I wasnâ€™t happy about was the soft play structure it looks like a converted barn  itâ€™s brilliant inside with well planned and built amenities but my concern is the roof,itâ€™s asbestos corrugated sheeting (I noticed the animals indoor building has corrugated metal sheeting ) I canâ€™t understand why asbestos has been used. Whilst its use can pose a risk if in any way it breaks down,all materials eventually deteriorates,whilst a small risk ,I really canâ€™t understand its use especially in a childrenâ€™s environment.

recent_reviews.author: Kenzie Beames
recent_reviews.text: A hidden oasis of fun and exploration in the heart of Bristol. It wasn't on our tourist list but so glad some friends recommended we meet there. Our kids had a blast and we enjoyed having breakfast while the kids were very busy. Free to enter but donation recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Bookwormdystopian
recent_reviews.text: 3.5 I like the animals and there were lots of vegan options in the cafe. There was a lady bird in a salad which was funny. Their  goats were really friendly especially one that was pregnant. It was a shame that the staff and volunteers were not the same. One staff member and another. Two women staff seemed particularly rude and snotty and were exaggerating about the Geese pecking people. There was also no water for them to play in either.

recent_reviews.author: Susana Stokes
recent_reviews.text: Super family friendly place. Eva's 1st birthday party here was lovely ...only issue is parking tricky in surrounding streets but you can park to drop off ...

recent_reviews.author: RafaÅ‚ DrÄ…g
recent_reviews.text: The city farm is really a great place to spend time with family. Iâ€™m impressed by how amazing it is to see animals right in the middle of the city. The kids love feeding the goats and rabbits, and I love the peaceful, countryside-like atmosphere. I think itâ€™s the perfect spot for a weekend walk.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Pumpkin Patch Hut - Noahs Ark Farm Shop

recent_reviews.author: Chris Brookes
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic selection of homegrown pumpkins, gourds & squashes
Great photo opportunities for all the family.
Great food and amazing pumpkin themed hot chocolate.
Plus some fantastic ideas for cake, soups  or curries recipe's

recent_reviews.author: Paulina Owczarska
recent_reviews.text: Loads of pumpkin ğŸƒ love it ğŸƒğŸƒğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Annalise Chandler
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant choice and we're half price

recent_reviews.author: Catherine Bishop
recent_reviews.text: We had a wonderful afternoon at the community farm. Everyone there was friendly and itâ€™s just lovely to be able to take little ones there to see farm animals in a farm setting. Added bonus, cafe ( tasty cakes & coffee) and lovely play area. Great free afternoon out but I do think itâ€™s important to leave donations as this is clearly a community venture providing joy to many!

recent_reviews.author: Chris Rose
recent_reviews.text: Love it here ğŸ˜Š you can feed the animals too and it's perfect to visit on a nice sunny day. There is a cafe too

recent_reviews.author: Tony Jefferies
recent_reviews.text: Grimsby community farm ,its set in some nice surrounding fields, its a little run down, but on a nice day its a great way to spend a hour or two, there are various animals like Chickens, Goats ,Donkey's,Rabbits and birds various. It also has a nice cafe for drinks and food. Nice to take small Children.

recent_reviews.author: Sean Wright
recent_reviews.text: Great place to take the sprogs - especially if you're on a budget. Free to enter and, given that, it's great value. My kids loved the park and meeting the farm animals. The cafe on site is great too and there is plenty of parking. An oasis of green and nature in Briz.

pumpkin_patches.address: Grimsbury farm near, Baden Rd, Kingswood, Bristol BS15 9SE

recent_reviews.author: Fabiana Fazzino
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely selection of plants, friendly staff and there was even a cat at the till!!!

I was going to mention that the only downside was that their website said they did PYO fruit as mentioned in previous reviews, but we were informed that they no longer did this. However, I have just checked and their website has been updated so hats off to the team for the quick fix!!

Will be backğŸ‘ğŸ»

recent_reviews.author: Paul Guard
recent_reviews.text:
Such a nice place , peaceful , quiet, lots and lots of incredible variety of plants , and other things that you need for the Garden.
Helpful staff , friendly and knowledgeable, set in acres of fields, it's almost like a drive in the Country...

recent_reviews.author: Jo Pollitt
recent_reviews.text:
I would highly recommend for bedding plants - and advice.
Great value with friendly, helpful and extremely well informed staff.

recent_reviews.author: magdalena reglewska
recent_reviews.text:
Best nursery in the area! I have been buying my plants from there for the last 5 years. They are always of an excellent quality! Staff are always very helpful and friendly.
I Went there today to pick some pumpkins and my goddaughter truly enjoyed it!
I also picked some winter pansies.
I would like to also mention that every summer they offer â€œpick your ownâ€ fruit! Such an enjoyable experience and a chance to make your own fruit preserves! Yummy!
They also sell seasonal veg. Rucksacks of potatoes are a great price and they are delicious! Red potatoes are my favourite! But be quick! They sell out fast!
Will be back soon for more plants!

recent_reviews.author: Paul Saunders
recent_reviews.text: Getting the kids out in the fresh air to pick their own pumpkins, a great start to Halloween.

pumpkin_patches.address: Puxton Park, cowslip Lan, Hewish, Weston-super-Mare BS24 6AH

recent_reviews.author: Eloise C
recent_reviews.text:
Popped in for a late lunch. It was about 2.30pm and not busy. Lovely area! We ordered and were told they were out of numbers so gave us a green cup instead. Went to sit outside, there were lots of empty tables with the numbers on! They just needed collecting.

Tried a couple of tables, all quite dirty/messy. When they brought our drinks out, they struggled to find us because theyâ€™d given multiple people the same colour cup! Again, they simply needed to collect the table numbers! Considering they werenâ€™t even busy, I would expect more.

After 40+ minutes, our food came out, we were waving but they struggled to find us (because of the multiple cups the same colour!). Our food was placed on the table and then we were told they were out of certain items so had replaced them with others (without checking with us!). We were asked if it was ok but weâ€™d waited 40 minutes and cleaned the table the best we could so just ate the food we were given (a cooked breakfast with 4 hash browns, an extra tomato (not even vine tomatoes as menu stated), and a â€œbigger portionâ€ of beans to replace the missing items!). Itâ€™s quite poor that we werenâ€™t told that items were out of stock when ordering, and that they didnâ€™t even check with us for alternatives during the 40 minute wait.
Further to this, the eggs were cold, the beans were cold, the rest was barely warm with the exception of the very hot hash browns. With a 40+ minute wait for the food, we expected the food to be hot (and as ordered!).

We live local and itâ€™s the first time weâ€™ve popped in after driving past multiple times a week. We donâ€™t think weâ€™ll be back because we were quite disappointed. The location is nice and the sausages are tasty but not much else going for it! As you can see from the photo, we were served quite a sad looking breakfast really (that was cold too)!

recent_reviews.author: Leah Dennison
recent_reviews.text: Searched online for Farm Shop cafÃ© and this one came up which we haven't tried. We booked our table online. Came over and found our table easily and quickly. Ordering is easy and there is a good clear selection of Vegetarian and Vegan food. Our food came out very quickly and it was a really delicious breakfast. Staff are friendly. Great atmosphere. Plenty of cakes to purchase and also a farm shop next door. We will definitely be back. ğŸ˜‰

recent_reviews.author: Paul Graham
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little mini farm with a fantastic cafe. Very helpful and attentive staff. Had a lovely bacon sandwich.

recent_reviews.author: Lucy Burgess
recent_reviews.text: Great cooked breakfast! Will definitely be coming back again! Great to check out the little farm shop too and see some of the animals.

pumpkin_patches.address: Poplars Farm, Bristol Rd, Frampton Cotterell, Bristol BS36 2AW

recent_reviews.author: Matt Friend
recent_reviews.text: Oh my gosh, this place is incredible! Only popped along to get a coffee and a sausage roll (missed out, they sell out fast) but ordered the pork belly with bread and Thai green curry sauce - wow. Will be back soon!

recent_reviews.author: Purplelemon
recent_reviews.text: Nice place to visit and get away from bustle of city life.

recent_reviews.author: J
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic food!

recent_reviews.author: Ted Fowler
recent_reviews.text: Excellent salad bags and veg boxes. We're get 4-6 substantial bowls of salad from each bag. Diverse herbs and leaves make each mouthful tasty and aromatic.

recent_reviews.author: Polly Barsby
recent_reviews.text:
What a haven of tranquility. Thank you Sally and Tom for pouring so much love into this land. Iâ€™ve had the pleasure of being at Wild things farm a few times and each time I come back renewed and revived.  The restored marshland is remarkable. So much diversity. It just goes to show what can be achieved with love and respect for nature. It truly is full of wild things. I had the exquisite pleasure of listening to otters splashing about in the river. This is what all of Somerset could be like.
There has clearly been a review posted to the wrong place below. Must be for the neighbours who have horses. So ignore that.
Thanks Tom and Sally for your wonderful hospitality and open hearts, that together create a little slice of heaven.
Xxx

recent_reviews.author: Mark Bishop
recent_reviews.text: What a beautiful piece of land! The area is really well cared for by Tom & Sally. It is a great place to connect with nature.  Thank you for putting so much love into the land. A hidden gem!

recent_reviews.author: Charlie

recent_reviews.author: Tom Wilding
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful, friendly team offering nature connection & conservation volunteering.

pumpkin_patches.address: Pensford Ln, Stanton Drew, Bristol BS39 4DX

recent_reviews.author: wendy tobiassen
recent_reviews.text:
I so enjoy this place, lovely staff, good parking, loads of beautiful
Plants to wander amid and lots to buy and good prices. The farm shop is good, nice and eggs and fresh farm sausages . Crafts available and environment  a delight

recent_reviews.author: Raffaele Pellegrino
recent_reviews.text: Elm tree farm itâ€™s a great farm shop where you can mainly find a super fresh selection of freshly harvested organic seasonal vegetables but also other products like eggs and herbs, highly recommended

recent_reviews.author: Nick Holder
recent_reviews.text: I didn't even know this place existed, it is a great city farm attached to an autistic school (maybe the other way around) I am not sure if you can visit the farm in the day as it is a working farm. We came here for the bonfire and fireworks event this year. It was a really well put on event with a huge bonfire, great low bang fireworks, hot food and drinks and live music. My kids loved it. Keep up the good work folks, see you next year.

recent_reviews.author: Alec Johnson
recent_reviews.text: Bought a Christmas tree. Lovely craft and food shops. Parking is easy and free.

recent_reviews.author: Gareth Hodge
recent_reviews.text: Our grandchildren loved this place, especially the indoor area. Our youngest grandson is only 2 1/2 but his big sister (7) took him around the older area and he loved it. Outdoors was fun too, but it was a little chilly so we didn't spend as long there, the Easter treat hunt was fun though. The pricing was excellent especially the fact that parents get in for free, even though several were enjoying the play area too. :) It does say you can't bring your own food, but that didn't appear to be enforced, the cafe was reasonably priced as well though. Big recommend from us.

recent_reviews.author: Rita Bailes
recent_reviews.text: Been today with granddaughter who is 20 months old. Great that no charge for accompanying adults.  Staff lovely. Only complaint is the soft play for under 5's only was constantly having older children in who were far too boisterous for the young tots making it a little bit unsafe for them. Seemed to worry some of the younger children , my granddaughter included, and made it less enjoyable for them.

recent_reviews.author: Tony Jefferies
recent_reviews.text: This is a very great place to visit, we took our granddaughter to visit the play centre there  as lots of activities for the smaller children. This area also as a food outlet. Its only a small charge to enter .Also on site our lots of interesting shops ect and another food out.It a very nice experience .It part of a farm so obviously there are animals. I would highly recommend a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Tamas Ujvari
recent_reviews.text: Coffee was very nice, food was good, the menu had good selection and the kids had a great time running all over the place. ğŸ˜

pumpkin_patches.address: Farrington's Farm Home Farm, Main St, Farrington Gurney, Bristol BS39 6UB

recent_reviews.author: Izaac Izaac
recent_reviews.text: Great time with my little girl, loved the veg!

recent_reviews.author: Bryony Greenwood
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful being able to support a lovely lil local business, and their Customer Support is above and beyond - we've been really well looked after by Sally!! Any issues or queries we've had have been speedily addressed and resolved.

recent_reviews.author: Helen Hooper
recent_reviews.text: Such a beautiful place with really friendly people and a great ethos

recent_reviews.author: Sandra Witzel
recent_reviews.text:
We get our weekly veg box delivered from the Community Farm. The produce is excellent, deliveries reliable and communication with the farm very good. They reply to emails quickly and are always helpful. I also like that you can easily set 'holidays' in the account when you don't need the box.

I initially chose this service because they offer veg boxes without potatoes (which I don't eat). We always add a few one-off items to each box, e.g. milk, fresh eggs and seasonal fruit and it has greatly reduced our need to shop plastic-wrapped, bland-tasting produce from the supermarkets. I highly recommend this place!

pumpkin_patches.address: Denny Ln, Chew Magna, Bristol BS40 8SZ

recent_reviews.author: R A
recent_reviews.text:
Brilliant place to visit with family of all ages. I went with a group of 14 and all ages really enjoyed it, the train ride, park and the soft play area were really good. Different selection of animals to see and for Â£1 you can get a bag of animal feed to feed some of the animals with, an interesting and ticklish experience for some of the kids! :)

We also purchased some fresh milk and also chocolate flavoured which was very tasty!

recent_reviews.author: Paul Graham
recent_reviews.text: I remember taking my older children here some years ago and then enjoying it. Return today with my youngest and she absolutely loved it. The whole Park feels very fresh and clean and there are lots more attractions than I remember. The soft play and slides are very well maintained And thoroughly enjoyed by all the children. The farm zoo has lots of animals and you can buy feed for them. We went on the train ride and tractor ride both included in the price. I was particularly impressed with the crazy golf. The sculptures of the octopus and whale were very impressive and you could see a lot of love had gone into creating this attraction. We had a late lunch in the restaurant which was very tasty and good value. The farm shop is well stocked and has a lovely butchers. It would definitely come again.

recent_reviews.author: Ayyub Chowdhury
recent_reviews.text:
Puxton Park is an absolutely fantastic place for a day out and I cannot recommend it enough. From the moment we arrived the atmosphere was welcoming and exciting. The car park is huge and completely free which makes things so much easier and stress free. Once inside there is so much to do for all ages. My personal favourite was the water bumper ride which had me laughing and getting soaked in the best way possible. I could have stayed on it all afternoon. I also loved feeding the animals. They are clearly well cared for and very friendly. There are goats alpacas sheep and many more and you can get up close which is such a fun experience.

The indoor play area is massive and full of activities to keep children entertained for hours. Outside there are brilliant adventure playgrounds climbing frames and open spaces to run around. The tractor rides and the little train are perfect for taking a break while still enjoying the park. There is also a lovely cafÃ© that serves tasty and reasonably priced food and drinks which is perfect for a pit stop. Everywhere is clean and well looked after and the staff are friendly and helpful.

Puxton Park is one of those places where time flies because there is so much to see and do. Whether you are visiting with family friends or just want a fun day surrounded by animals and activities it is worth every penny. I am already looking forward to going back and enjoying it all over again.

recent_reviews.author: Abi Booth
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely fantastic. Paid one entry free which was less than other parks around, paid Â£45 for a family of 4 (I had a blue light discount), and it was worth every penny. There are so many attractions that are included, didnâ€™t pay a penny for anything besides an ice cream. Thereâ€™s paddle boats, train, high ropes (and smaller one for littler children), and huge soft play, and lots more too. We spent the whole day interacting with animals and playing. It was clean and well looked after, staff were pleasant and friendly and animals seemed happy and well looked after.
Absolutely brilliant, will be returning soon.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Flourish at Glenavon Farm - Foodhall & Kitchen and Home & Lifestyle

recent_reviews.author: jonbristolbs4
recent_reviews.text:
Stunning full breakfast meal with really tasty products and not your usual â€œgreasy spoonâ€ offering. Plus other delicious choices. Not an extensive menu but what we had was absolutely delicious which is all that really mattered.
The shop has 100â€™s of great looking produce should you wish purchase.
Very friendly staff also.

recent_reviews.author: Simon
recent_reviews.text:
Very nice here the staff are lovely and the food is amazing ( they best black pudding ever), plenty of parking and lots of room to eat, inside and out.
Then there is the shop   quite pricey but it's very nice indeed    Top Marks   Thank you

recent_reviews.author: Siri
recent_reviews.text: Flourish is one of my favourite places to catch up with friends. I've been here many times, and it seems busy and popular all the time. Good menu choices, fresh and organic ingredients, very nice presentable dishes. Excellent and very friendly service. I can't fault them. Coffee and cake or pudding are very nice too. Highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Lee Hodgetts
recent_reviews.text:
Perfect place to come and do some much needed admin catch up! Great soup and chips (the chunkiest!) and a lovely calming atmosphere.

Also special mention to my server Harrison, who fixed a wobbly table without asking and was friendly and welcoming without being too much! Thumbs up to you, bud!

Easily come again!  :)

pumpkin_patches.address: Glenavon Farm, Bath Rd, Saltford, Bristol BS31 3TJ

recent_reviews.author: Imogen Dufty
recent_reviews.text: Had a great day out at Fairfield Pumpkins and think Iâ€™ve found the coolest pumpkin in the patch. Didnâ€™t find the golden pumpkin, will have to come back for it another day. Would definitely recommend it for families or dates as you can get some food and also say hi to some baby goats in the barn.

recent_reviews.author: Jess Witkowska
recent_reviews.text: We had so much fun at this spooky pumpkin field and barn! Amazingly decorated with fantastic Halloween games for the kids and we even got to feed some baby goats! Great food and drink too - thank you!

recent_reviews.author: Gabriella Dobson
recent_reviews.text: Loved visiting here! And absolutely loved seeing the baby goats !

recent_reviews.author: Natasha Perry
recent_reviews.text: Good selection of pumpkins and helpful staff. Not too pricey as youre also getting the experience of picking them yourself !

recent_reviews.author: Arigmaric
recent_reviews.text: Always a blast. This is our second year going and there always seems to be something new to see. Our favourite experience is Vita Nova although this year X4 came close as they improved it this year by casting you into darkness with only a glowstick to light your way. We eneded up arriving after our intake time due to a medical emergency but the staff were und and we were still allowed in :). Do recommend catching the two shows available too, they always have extra scares and pretty lights to see.

recent_reviews.author: Beer Ticker
recent_reviews.text:
All of our party of 5 thoroughly enjoyed the whole night. Arrived just before they opened and while waiting for the "attractions" to open we were "assaulted" by mental clowns. Every experience we went into was well thought out and well executed.
There were two food trucks which didn't seem to be enough but they didn't run out. Food was great but not cheap but it was on a par with what you expect at these events now; around Â£13 for a "messy mac" ( mac n cheese with toppings) but the portion was a good size. Overall a good night out.

recent_reviews.author: TheKaKaNow YouTube
recent_reviews.text:
Great, but they kick you out before you been on all the rides that you paid for. We didn't even go to the toilet or eat food, only queued and you can't see it all with the time slot they provide.

They rush you in so you don't even get scared because they only scare the person in front so you already seen it.

One maze electrocuted me really painful and it hurt my hand for 30mins. When you go through you touch the walls because it's dark. There were no signs at all about it. I think it was Dangerous. Someone with pacemakers could die.

Disappointed.

The shows are about 3-5mins long and it's just actors dancing, not an actual fire show etc.

If we at least got to see what we paid for or did the scare factor it would be worth it

recent_reviews.author: Graham Smith
recent_reviews.text:
Spooky experience, loved it! Great mazes, actors were brilliant, scary for everyone and the actors were friendly too.

We got the RIP pass for unlimited soft drinks and snacks, plus fast track on all the mazes. Definitely worth it to avoid the queues at peak times!!

recent_reviews.author: Cole Leo-matthew (Ceilno)
recent_reviews.text: Can't wait to go agen and agen and agen love this place

recent_reviews.author: Kelly Brooke
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely experience pumpkin picking. Well organised with booking so that it wasn't crowded. Great activities for kids. Good selection of pumpkins. Great views as an added bonus. Will definitely visit again

recent_reviews.author: Steve Mitchell
recent_reviews.text: My daughter and the Mrs were there today along with some other family stragglers ..Ho...and little Remi...! It's a grown up thing really but take the kids and pretend the occasion is for them....ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€ Thanks so much for their lovely adventure..Special thanks to Wurzel for making my mother in law feel so special....See you next year....ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Carol Tucker
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic fun kids loved it ğŸƒ excellent pumpkins ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Gareth Davies
recent_reviews.text:
Had a great day here today with my family.
It's got lots of really great activities for the kids including a dinosaur trail with moving dinosaurs and sound effects, mini golf, bouncy castles and fairground rides, animals and much more.
I'd strongly recommend taking your kids along for the day because it represents great value.

recent_reviews.author: catherine curtis
recent_reviews.text: We visited Fantasy Farm today 6/6/25 which is at Cattows Farm Leicester. Tickets we're 12.50 pp, 5 of us went, it included a sunflower trail, walk around the Jurrasic jungle which had jungle animals and dinosaurs hiding in the corn crops, a small train ride, game of golf and a game in the wet section, each person got a water gun and it's every person for themselves, be prepared to get soaked! There were 2 big inflatables which were free, a small fair ground, Â£Â£ for each ride. A food van, a bar(alcohol is served) slushie and doughnut van, game of hook a duck and a game of throw the ball in the milk urn, which of course was Â£Â£. I spent Â£53, 3 children on 3 rides, Â£5pp bungy jump, Â£3pp run away train, bumper cars Â£4 per car upto 2 people per car, a game of hook each a duck Â£5pp we purchased some mini doughnuts  10 for Â£6, slushes were Â£3pp (Nan brought). We did however take a picnic and there were several benches to sit at, just beware of a few wasps, plenty of bins for rubbish, a few portaloo's that were clean, had plenty of toilet roll and hand sanitiser, we had our own hand wipes too, 1 was for disabled access, I think I saw baby changing facilities in one, but didn't take that much notice (sorry). Overall it was a great day out, kids had a lot of fun. I would definitely go back. We did go last year when they had a Halloween fair on, despite the muddy conditions that was good also. Hope this helps.

recent_reviews.author: iftekhar choudhury
recent_reviews.text:
The Farm was accessible only from one side, plan carefully.

The farm had free parking and we'll organised no issues. The farm itself was covered in Corn plants and sunflowers. Very vibrant.

Sadly and good points; there was more dinosaurs than actual animals... on a farm. Very confusing, there are more funfair rides than anything else.

The water fun, was the highlight but if it was a cold day there wouldn't have been much to do.

The golf was easy family fun minus some bumpy joints...The train journey was nice minus the uneven grounding.

There was a lack of excitement for kids, please look into this.

1. More Farm animals... chickens? Cows? More than One sheep? Horses? No feeding capacity for the animals
2. More actual things to do rather bouncing Castle, water fun and safari golf

recent_reviews.author: Chris Woodman
recent_reviews.text: Visited Halloween Farm on a Friday so it wasnâ€™t busy at all, the attractions were decent enough, my little girl really enjoyed the spooky train ride and the dinosaur maze, the animal maze was also very good with great props in there, the fair was Â£3 a ride which is pretty normal for fairground rides! The chips from the food van was also good and fresh with plenty of ketchup. Trick or treat street was also good as my daughter got to knock on all the doors and received a fair amount of sweets and they had great props throughout! Iâ€™m glad we visited on a quiet day as reading other reviews this would have been extremely busy in peak times. The farm was very well decorated for the Halloween vibe with massive props everywhere and plenty of photo opportunities, my daughter did have a really good time here but I can see that older kids would probably not enjoy it as much. Overall it was great day out

recent_reviews.author: Claire Nichols
recent_reviews.text: Cute little day out to do the Maize Maze and pick wildflowers. Spent a good few hours playing. Lovely cakes! The maze was very challenging so take snacks to keep the little ones going if doing the big version.

recent_reviews.author: Fiona Hatton
recent_reviews.text: Went here today for the pick your own flowers - lots of flowers and was a lovely activity to do with kids. Cafe was open too so we could grab a drink. Will definitely go back again!

recent_reviews.author: Sai
recent_reviews.text:
We have just spent the best part of a day here. We enjoyed the maze, flower patch, feeding the sheep and climbing the hay bales. Lots of fun activities to do. Would recommend the brookies from the cafe-they are enormous and absolutely delicious. We will be back when the pumpkin patch opens at Halloween. ğŸƒ Edited to add: don't wear white. ğŸ˜‚
Double edited to add: don't enter the maze without the map and clues like we did. ğŸ¥´

recent_reviews.author: Clarissa Meek Lopez
recent_reviews.text: The maize maze is a great family activity! We had plenty of laughs along the way.

recent_reviews.author: Lucy Davis
recent_reviews.text: This is a lovely farm experience for young children. I took my 3 year old and he loved it. We had great fun feeding them animals and he particularly enjoyed the pigs and the peacock as you come out of Brianâ€™s wood. My son also enjoyed the tractor ride around the farm. I love that this is all part of the experience and you donâ€™t have to pay extra for this. We also enjoyed the new addition to the outdoor play area (the water play).

recent_reviews.author: jojo Shilz
recent_reviews.text:
A wonderful outdoor place, kids loved the giant pillows. Little one had to try but opted for the smaller one.  The feeding and races were well organised. Great tractor ride. We took a picnic but food available on site.
Great day out and highly recommend.
Thank you.

recent_reviews.author: Jo Carver
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous day out with the grandchildren. Something to keep them busy for 5 hours!! So many different experiences from other farm parks weâ€™ve visited. Loved the guinea pig â€œfishingâ€ and the egg collecting. Also goat racing was a huge hit. Staff were super friendly and helpful. 10/10 would definitely visit again

recent_reviews.author: Kate Morris
recent_reviews.text: Took my 3 1/2 year old great niece. She had a brilliant day. Didn't want to leave the indoor play area. I did manage to get her to feed the animals in the barn, which she loved. Unfortunately, each time we tried to venture out into the paddocks it started raining. We got there at 10 and didn't leave until 3.45. So great value for money. Staff very friendly and helpful. Food in the cafe was nice. Not a huge range of choice of hot food. The jacket potato I had was slightly undercooked but the filling was delicious. Will definitely be back but on a nicer day.

pumpkin_patches.address: Langton Rd, Kibworth Harcourt, Leicester LE8 0PR

recent_reviews.author: Amy Lawes
recent_reviews.text: Visited while staying in the area. The selection and choice is vast. Can recommend the classic sausages, really tasty, firm skin and little fat when cooking. Also picked up salad, fresh rolls and fruit from here, great quality and reasonable prices. Parking is easily accessible, sat nav took us to a caravan site just down the road - stay on the main road and you'll find it!

recent_reviews.author: Jean Whitehead
recent_reviews.text:
Beautiful farm shop with lots of different foods, excellent selection of cheeses, meats, fruit and veg.
If I could give the cafe 10 stars, I would! The staff were lovely and helpful and the food was delicious and plentiful. The beer battered haddock was superb and I'm difficult to please. Will definitely return.

recent_reviews.author: R J
recent_reviews.text:
The postcode took me 300 yards down the road. Keep going, you won't miss it there are white signs on the road.
Plenty of parking.
Actually one of the best farm shops I've ever been too.
The cafe / restaurant is very nice with plenty of tables.
You can eat in the outside area with dogs.
The food that's served is fresh food from the shop itself.
I can recommend the vegetarian breakfast!!

The farm shop is quite large, with plenty of food and fresh counters.
To note, the homeware section is very small, this place is all about the food!!
There's an outside plant area,  although it's not very big.
It can get busy so arrive early.
Definitely worth a visit, I shall return !!
Toilets available in the cafe.

recent_reviews.author: Matt
recent_reviews.text:
Thought I would give breakfast a go again, after being disappointed the last time I tried for lunch.

Sausage sandwich - three chipolatas, cut in half, where the thickness of the bread was more than the sausage.

Just put more sausages in the sandwich and charge more.

Service was excellent I must say, but wonâ€™t be returning after the second bad food experience.

recent_reviews.author: Amy Lawes
recent_reviews.text: Called in while passing due to good reviews and staying locally. Minted lamb ribs were lovely, flavour amazing and they cooked well under the grill. Staff acknowledged us as soon as we walked in, both very polite and genuinely thankful for custom

recent_reviews.author: Amy J
recent_reviews.text:
We were looking forward to enjoying Sunday lunch here, particularly given the charming setting next to the farm shop. Unfortunately, our experience was extremely disappointing.

Upon arrival, we were surprised to find the dining area uncomfortably cold. The gentleman who served us (presumably the manager or owner) was notably brusque and dismissive throughout our visit. Shortly after being seated, we were immediately asked for our order, with little opportunity to even greet the rest of our family. When we politely requested a few minutes to review the menu, the response was curt and unwelcoming.

My mother, who is vegetarian, asked whether it would be possible to have the Sunday roast with the meat served separately, as she wished to enjoy the vegetables while allowing the rest of us to share the meat. This seemed a reasonable request, yet it was met with confusion and made her feel uncomfortable.

Similarly, when I enquired about a childrenâ€™s menu, I was abruptly told that it consisted only of half portions. As nothing on the menu suited my daughter, I asked whether we could order a separate portion of cauliflower cheese for her. The response â€œit will be a very big portionâ€ was unnecessarily sharp, although my daughter did in fact enjoy and finish it.

While the meat was of good quality, the remainder of the meal was substandard. The roast potatoes were overcooked and floury, the parsnip lacked flavour, the Yorkshire pudding was dry and cold, and a simple request for mayonnaise was never fulfilled.

It is rare that I feel compelled to write such a review, but the unwelcoming service overshadowed the entire experience. Having travelled nearly an hour for what we hoped would be an enjoyable family meal, we left feeling uncomfortable and disappointed. Regrettably, we would not consider returning.

recent_reviews.author: Ines Rodrigues
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely farm shop good quality products! Milk is highly recommended.
Lovely new cafe! Cakes are really yummy!
Staff is lovely and helpful!
We did the pumpkin picking was wonderful! Lots of options and by the way congratulations to the farm they let the garden grow wild which means leaving patches of land to grow wild let wildflowers grow and make great nesting and feeding sites for bees! Well done!
Car park free on the side.

recent_reviews.author: LP
recent_reviews.text: Popped in to the farm shop and decided to go for a breakfast. Nice cafe and the breakfast itself was lovely, with fresh hollandaise sauce. However, no vegetarian options listed on the menu and when I asked the waiter what could they do, it still didnâ€™t sound as though there were many options (he responded as if it was an unusual request). Ended up going for the eggs Benedict / Royale without the salmon or ham â€¦ still charged me the same though for the privilege of not serving the expensive ingredients ğŸ™„

pumpkin_patches.address: Top End, Great Dalby, Melton Mowbray LE14 2HA

recent_reviews.author: Jessica Staniforth
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely overjoyed with the visit we had to the pumpkin patch , what a lovely well thought out family friendly event they have  put on . A huge well done to all involved.

It was such a breath of fresh air to have a family day out that for Â£20 we  where able to buy pumpkins , go on the bouncy castle and a tractor rideâ€¦as well as lots of fun meeting the animals and climbing hay bales. Such lovely photographs with the props too.

I have to say after going to Cattows  for a few years and deciding to try somewhere else this year we are so glad we did.

We will be back next year ! Such a fantastic set up and one that is affordable to the many , Thankyou Broomleys  farm!!!

recent_reviews.author: Mathew Burton
recent_reviews.text: Went today 12/10/24 the entrance is great surrounded by pumpkins. Paid the Â£3 entrance fee & was really welcomed by the man.
