Great to support local farmers which is what it's all about. The animatronics dome was great with the scary figures. Went on the tractor ride & round the maze. The food stalls are the prices you pay now adays. Rounded off by buying some fabulous pumpkins well worth it.

recent_reviews.author: Lorraine Jones
recent_reviews.text: We were excited to go back after last year's event. We were disappointed to find that it had changed it's format and now had loads of outside vendors/stalls costing extra, as well as an entrance fee. The amount of pumpkins had been reduced and the fun of finding a good one to fill the kids sled gone.

recent_reviews.author: Kimberley W
recent_reviews.text:
What event is this?! Iâ€™m absolutely mind blown. Paid Â£3 per adult and Â£2 per child for entry and the inside is an absolute joke. A tractor ride that literally drives around the outside of a field - with nothing to see or spot along the way.

If you want to go on the (few very old and very tired rides and inflatables, Iâ€™d say maybe 5 total) itâ€™s an extra Â£6 each!! Weâ€™re literally talking about a few tiny bouncy castles suitable for a 5 year old and a little merry go round again aimed at toddlers.

There is an inflatable dome with a few Halloween movable statues (like a werewolf that turns its head, that sort of thing) which you can go in for free, but itâ€™s not even decorated, literally just a few of the things youâ€™d see in the range stood up around the outside.

Pumpkins - you can choose a pumpkin (small, medium or large) off the shelf and pay additionally for them if you choose. We didnâ€™t - it is not pumpkin picking at all, literally just pick one up like in Asda.

Then thereâ€™s about 6 stalls with people selling stuff like bath bombs, an ice cream van, a hook a duck (dreadful Â£ shop prizes for Â£5 fee) oh and a pair of donkeys, alpacas and sheep you can feed with a Â£2 bag of food.

This is for sure the Halloween equivalent of the Willy wonka mishap and we would not recommend. You do get a free return, but what on earth youâ€™d want to return for is beyond me.

recent_reviews.author: Chloe Brentnall
recent_reviews.text:
A Hidden Gem for Families and Food Lovers Alike!

We visited this delightful farm shop and cafÃ© for the first time today and were completely charmed. Thereâ€™s so much open outdoor space for children to exploreâ€”perfect for letting little ones run free in nature. A particular highlight was the beautifully crafted wooden tractor with a slide, which quickly became a favourite for our son.

After a peaceful walk around the scenic grounds, we tucked into a delicious breakfast accompanied by a refreshing and healthy smoothieâ€”just what we needed to start the day. The cafÃ© has a warm, welcoming atmosphere, and the staff were friendly.

The farm shop itself is a treasure trove of local produce and indulgent treats. We were especially impressed by the mouthwatering selection of cakesâ€”it was hard to choose just one!

Weâ€™re already looking forward to returning in mid-June when the strawberry picking season begins. This place is a perfect mix of countryside charm, family fun, and fantastic food. Highly recommend!

Plenty of parking outside too!

recent_reviews.author: JURIJUS Ivanovas
recent_reviews.text: Hm.....big field but no strawberries.... very little and very no much. Just grass. Cafe nice,tasty coffe,but i coming picking strawberries and nobody told me that there no luck. Sad. Very disappointing.

recent_reviews.author: Jason Hulley
recent_reviews.text: Although on our doorstep itâ€™s our first time visiting and we really enjoyed it. Great service, great food and competitively priced. Would highly recommend to others looking for a relaxed environment to have something to drink and or eat. We will definitely be back again!

recent_reviews.author: Philip Vince
recent_reviews.text:
The finest food, lovely atmosphere, and the most welcoming people. I have been coming here for many years, and it gets better and better.
We came for our Christmas lunch, and the whole experience was delightful. Delicious parsnip soup, gorgeous turkey roast, and Christmas pudding perfection.
I love the fact that dogs aren't allowed, which makes it so much more hygienic.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Blackbrook Farm PYO Pumpkins and Christmas Trees

recent_reviews.author: Laura Cooke
recent_reviews.text: Amazing local farm providing seasonal purchases. We've bought our Christmas tree from here for 4 years now and wouldn't go anywhere else! Service is wonderful, there's so much choice, and it's fab to support a local farm too

recent_reviews.author: L Cooledge
recent_reviews.text: Great choice of freshly cut & growing trees, all home-grown. The family/staff are friendly, cheerful & helpful. Highly recommended & hope to visit next year for the third time ğŸ„ Thank you!

recent_reviews.author: é–ƒè€€çš„æ˜Ÿå…‰Twinkle
recent_reviews.text:
2023 Autumn August
Lovely Weather ã€‚lovely dayã€‚lovely sunflowers field
No.1 to recommend

recent_reviews.author: Simon Cooper
recent_reviews.text: Bought from here for first time as local to us. Really friendly service ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: R D
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely little shop, full of lots of yarn as well as bits and bobs for crafting/making!

Very happy to see an independent business that is LGBT+ friendly! Guilt free buying all round!

I think the owner buys charms in bulk and then turns them into the things which is great, as it means I can match my earrings, to a necklace to a stitch marker They are usually Â£1-3 each which is delightful as I am prone to losing them!

The lady sits there crocheting / knitting which is very comforting and makes the browsing less stressful.

Great place for gifts, as there are some crochet key chains, candle gift sets etc

recent_reviews.author: Khadijah Aliyu Aziz
recent_reviews.text:
I highly recommend this store, not just for their vast collection, but for the welcoming atmosphere. Itâ€™s always been my favourite craft store in town, and this summer I decided to join their sewing classes with Dai. I can't praise the experience enough. We've made two pieces so far (the tote bag and the dress) and Dai has been an incredible teacher throughout. He's knowledgeable, receptive, and always made sure to bring my ideas to life (I love my dress!). His patience, diligence, and down-to-earth personality make him one of the best teachers Iâ€™ve ever had. Not only did I learn how to use a sewing machine, but I also gained skills like amending clothes, understanding how garments are made, cut, and assembledâ€”really diving into the science behind sewing. Beyond sewing, Dai offered advice on other interests of mine and even general life wisdom. Sundays quickly became my favourite day of the week thanks to him. These classes weren't just about learning to sew, they created a sense of community. It felt like being part of a friendsâ€™ book club or a social group, and I left every class feeling like I truly got my moneyâ€™s worth.

Sarah, the store owner, is also always so friendly and helpful, creating a welcoming space where you feel comfortable from the moment you walk in. She offers support and valuable advice on ongoing projects (crochet for me).

So, if you're looking for a welcoming place to spend your time, even if you're not into sewing perse, I would highly recommend these classes. They made my summer, and theyâ€™ll give you so much more than just masterful sewing skills.

recent_reviews.author: Niki Richards
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant local little shop for yarn, patterns, anything knit/crochet related really. Some nice gifts too. Recently I got perfect buttons from here at a bargain price. Great shop.

recent_reviews.author: Karen Henfrey
recent_reviews.text: Very helpful and friendly yarn shop with accessories and handmade gifts. Nice variety of wools. I refuse to purchase wool from any of the larger stores or charity shops, instead I focus on keeping my favourite independent businesses going. Always try here first.

pumpkin_patches.address: Grange Farm, Soar Mill Ln, Broughton Astley, Leicester LE9 6QH

recent_reviews.author: Alexandra Prentice
recent_reviews.text: It was such an easy place to walk around with very friendly staff! The pumpkins were all good quality aside from a few that had been dropped by people that had visited. There were some places while walking around where families could take photos as well, which was nice. There were also places to eat and drink and things for children to do as well! I would totally recommend as we had a great time going around and would go back next year!

recent_reviews.author: N M
recent_reviews.text: This is perfect for what we wanted. Not too commercialised like others nearby. Free entry and the pumpkin are reasonably priced. We went on a Thursday afternoon and there was only other one other family there. Lovely photo opportunities and so many pumpkin varieties! ğŸƒâ˜ºï¸

recent_reviews.author: Mehrunnisha Khan
recent_reviews.text: Came to look around the pumpkin patch and maize maze before the autumn season opens. It looks fab! Can't wait to come back in October and pick out a pumpkin.

recent_reviews.author: Chris Foulds
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing small pumpkin patch run by a family farm. Lots of great pumpkins to choose from, reasonably priced and a great treasure hunt for the kids.
For the adults stalls doing great food, coffee and cakes - recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Britney Louise
recent_reviews.text: we paid for Â£4.87 for 1.7kg of strawberries ğŸ“ you paid Â£3 entry each and the price per person you paid gets taken of the price of your strawberries at the end. plenty of parking and it was free. the staff was very friendly and helpful. there was a tractor to take you up to more fields if you donâ€™t want to walk. wouldnâ€™t be ideal for a pushchair as the rows are quite small. was a lovely morning. they have portable toilets, and a food van with drinks and fresh doughnuts. and they have a inflatable slide and a little feris wheel.

recent_reviews.author: Megan
recent_reviews.text:
Really disappointed to be leaving a 1* review as we love supporting local businesses, however we took our daughter strawberry picking yesterday for her first birthday and spent Â£20 on 2.7kg of strawberries. Yes itâ€™s a lot but she had so much fun so we didnâ€™t mind. Itâ€™s her birthday party at the weekend, theyâ€™ll last until then and at least weâ€™ve got plenty of strawberries to go aroundâ€¦ wrong.

We got home and immediately put them in the fridge. In less than 24 hours the entire basket was mushy and mouldy and every single strawberry has had to be thrown away.

My daughter was so upset this morning when she asked her strawberries and thereâ€™s not one that I can feed her. Itâ€™s also incredibly disappointing after spending so much money. We only wanted them to last three days, but they didnâ€™t even last 24 hours.

recent_reviews.author: William Danter
recent_reviews.text:
Had a lovely hour or so picking delicious Strawberries & RaspberriesğŸ‘
Nice to be able to get drinks, snacks and recommend the lovely locally made Thaymar ice cream. Chunky Choc wasğŸ‘Œ

recent_reviews.author: K K
recent_reviews.text: Great place, staff friendly,  welcoming.  We come every year, sadly, this year there were fewer strawberries,  but we equally had a great day out

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Pick up a Pumpkin Maxeys Farm Shop

recent_reviews.author: Get slim Cooking (Jbritt75)
recent_reviews.text:
What an amazing experience myself and the kids loved it and the price was reasonable.
There where enough porta loos and are the cleanest.
Hundreds of pumpkins if not thousands of different sizes and types.
Plenty of room to keep the kids out of trouble and burn off energy.
Only Â£2 for the bouncy castle.
The farm shop was great but a little cramped but probably was due to the time of year.
I will definitely being making a trip here for years to come.

recent_reviews.author: Tatiana Timoshenko
recent_reviews.text:
10 stars âœ¨
Went pumpkin ğŸƒ picking with boys to Maxeys Farm Shop Pumpkins as we entered the parking I punctured my car tire, it hissed and deflated in split of a second ğŸ˜«
We approached one off the Farms staff members just to ask where is the nearest tire shop, and to our surprise gentlemen immediately â€œunderstood the assignmentâ€ ğŸ« 
Nick dropped everything and rush to help us, he put the spear tire, found a pump to pump it ğŸ™ƒ and found as nearest place to fix the problem!
I was standing there in awe ğŸ¤© Forever grateful beyond words for all the help and support, for extra positive vibeâ€¦ I think boys had even more fun on the parking then while picking the pumpkin ğŸ™ƒ I really hope ğŸ¤ boys learned how to change the tire, so mama don't need to stress herself next time ğŸ˜ Michael even help with picking litter around the parking ğŸ˜
We will defo be back ğŸ˜‰ for even better experience ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Jennifer Potter
recent_reviews.text:
Staff are so friendly and helpful throughout the experience as well as in the Farm Shop.
They always have delicious seasonal items to try, both sweet and savoury. Worth every penny of the Â£2 adult entry fee and so instagramable!

recent_reviews.author: Aleksandra
recent_reviews.text: A really fun day out! There are plenty of different pumpkin varieties, all reasonably priced. A range of food stalls, bouncy castle(s) for kids, and a haunted woodland trail! It was quite busy but still plenty of space to manoeuvre around with a wheelbarrow:)

recent_reviews.author: Alen Thomas
recent_reviews.text:
It was a wonderful experience. We enjoyed a lot by picking fresh fruits from the plants themselves. All the plants are well maintained and cared for. All fruits are fresh and tasty. The ticket price is Â£3.5, and the wonderful part is that you can take fruits worth the ticket price home.

Always check online before going for the availability of fruits that are available for picking. It also had a wonderful shop, and you will get all kinds of products in that shop. Wonderful experience; highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Adithya Jakka
recent_reviews.text:
Malt Kiln Farm Shop is especially popular for its seasonal pick-your-own fruit, such as strawberries and raspberries, making it a fun outing for families.
The farm is clean, well-organised, and fully accessible, with helpful staff.

**While the cafÃ© food is tasty, the portion sizes feel small for the price. Our experience with the cafÃ© staff was disappointing, as we were told we couldnâ€™t eat food weâ€™d purchased from the farm shop while sitting in the cafÃ© something that wasnâ€™t clearly communicated and felt unnecessarily strict.**
*** The milkshake fell short in both flavor and overall quality***

Despite this, itâ€™s still a lovely place to enjoy fresh local produce and a peaceful countryside setting.

recent_reviews.author: shaunak samvatsar
recent_reviews.text:
The best place near to our home for the strawberry picking up experience. We had prebooked and bought loads of strawberries home.
The cafe has incredibly tasty milk, I would definitely suggest you have it. Kids went bonkers so cakes were essential to buy. They have a whole variety of local cheeses too, I got brie.
Overall a good day spent.

recent_reviews.author: Alex S
recent_reviews.text:
Good farm for picking ur own strawberries and enjoying the moment.
Natural taste and smell awesome.
Also they have a cafe and shop with different types of food and stuff
Some products are bit overpriced will say but the place itâ€™s not bad for a visit

pumpkin_patches.address: Main St, Stretton under Fosse, Rugby CV23 0PE

recent_reviews.author: E
recent_reviews.text:
My 4 year old said this about Poplar's, "I love you because I love and all the pumpkins, all the treats, all the drinks, but not the scary, talking pumpkin. Happily ever after."

We love this farm and try to go annually to support our local farm. We enjoy eating the pumpkins too. The piano outside was a happy addition and my son took to playing it, despite the missing central keys, beautifully. My daughter also enjoyed the bumpy tractor ride. We focused on picking smaller pumpkins of different colours, getting a few sunflowers and a purple cauliflower which we'd never tried before.

I can honestly say in the last week we've had roasted pumpkin, double chocolate pumpkin muffins, pumpkin pancakes, pumpkin spiced latte, pumpkin spaghetti, pumpkin soup and pie and we're still not sick of it! It's so yummy and versatile in recipes. Only negative is that the drinks and food on premises is quite expensive; my children shared a milkshake which was Â£5 (about the size of a Starbucks cold coffee).  Between the entry fee Â£3pp, drinks, and our pumpkins, we spent around Â£30.

In any event, we're supporting a 4th generation family business with organic products and will be going again!

recent_reviews.author: Maxine Baldwin
recent_reviews.text: Went pumpkin picking - wow.  Well thought out event, tractor ride was fun and informative, the spooky walk on the way in was great. Had a fabulous afternoon making memories with my family.  Daughter paid for tickets and said that they were reasonably priced.

recent_reviews.author: Romy Higgins
recent_reviews.text: A lovely farm to visit for pumpkin picking. Loads of nice varieties plus other freshly picked veg. The tractor ride is also really fun and there are a couple of food and drink stalls. Come prepared for lots of deep mud!

recent_reviews.author: laura edwards
recent_reviews.text:
Had an amazing time visiting this farm for pumpkin picking
Will be returning again next year
Amazing set up great atmosphere
Can freshly pick your own pumpkins
Dog friendly
The farm shop holds amazing foods

pumpkin_patches.address: Poplars Farm, 45 The Long Shoot, Nuneaton CV11 6JG

recent_reviews.author: Kerry Wilkins
recent_reviews.text: A lovely morning out at Wolvey with the family.  Some great additions this year, the kids loved the tractor/trailor ride! They even tow your car out with a tractor when it's stuck ğŸ˜‚ genuinely lovely people trying to give everyone a good experience.  Great memories and we will definitely be back next year ğŸƒğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: B.Shaw
recent_reviews.text:
Excellent pumpkin patch. Easy access and parking. Coffee and food vendors and very reasonably priced. Saw lots of families so very child and pet friendly.
Definitely need to wear sensible boots

recent_reviews.author: Larissa Forster
recent_reviews.text: A great variety of pumpkins, lovely food stalls and a few games for the children to enjoy. Well organised and not overcrowded like other places weâ€™ve been to! A lovely morning pumpkin picking with the family.

recent_reviews.author: Isaac Thrower
recent_reviews.text: Had an amazing experience at The Pumpkin Patch and the staff were so friendly. There were plenty of pumpkins plus the coffee and brownie vans were a great touch! There is also pumpkin themed games to keep you entertained. Absolutely recommend! ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Nicola Tame
recent_reviews.text: We love the pumpkin patch and itâ€™s now our go to place my children have additional needs and itâ€™s perfect for us and not too overwhelming. The only thing I would say the pumpkins are very very expensive this year Â£48 for 6 pumpkins was a little eye watering. Keep up the great work but please look at the price of pumpkins as I was honestly astounded!

recent_reviews.author: Amy Griffith
recent_reviews.text: We love the pumpkin place! Our second year visiting and it's even bigger and better. So much fun for all ages. Our 2 year old has asked to come back so we will be making another trip before Halloween! ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Vimala D
recent_reviews.text: I highly recommend , very friendly atmosphere, plenty of pumpkin to pick, decorations too good, maza was amazing. Totally it was fun day out with family and friends.

recent_reviews.author: Helen Smith
recent_reviews.text: Arrived for an after school visit and was greeted on arrival. Took two of our Grandchildren and three Nephews age range 5 to 14 years; all very excited! Children loved the maze and picking out their own pumpkins. Proprietors lovely and welcoming! Would certainly return in the future. Ps: pretending to be zombies ğŸ˜; not really biting his leg  .....no child was hurt in the photo.ğŸ˜‚.

recent_reviews.author: Tracey Ginnever
recent_reviews.text: Fresh produce and good bakery section plus various grocery items too. Plants and flowers are good. Nice variety. The animals section is cute too and the goats made an escape while we were there.

recent_reviews.author: James M (James)
recent_reviews.text:
Great little farm shop (closer to a mini supermarket honestly).
With a little food hut next door and some animals to see , itâ€™s a nice stop out

recent_reviews.author: Joe G
recent_reviews.text: Great little afternoon out. Nice animals and garden centre. Had the bacon we got for breakfast this morning. It was delicious ğŸ˜‹

recent_reviews.author: Faith Young
recent_reviews.text:
A true must for foodies!
During a visit to the area, we stopped off at this famous farm shop.
The layout is fantastic, with lots of fruit and veg near the entrance and then well-thought out food areas throughout the store.
It's probably lucky I don't live too near as I'd been practically living  there!
The staff were fabulous and as someone who works in retail I can tell the work that goes into the overall layout, from the salad area to the 'wine cellar'.
Pricing is reasonable too and there some excellent bulk buy opportunities.

pumpkin_patches.address: Keelham Hall Farm, Thornton, Bradford BD13 3SS

recent_reviews.author: Joanne Feltham
recent_reviews.text: A lovely authentic Father Christmas who took the time to make our boys feel relaxed and welcome. Our autistic son does not like loud, busy crowds so this was just perfect. Father Christmas was brilliant as were Mrs Claus and their elf. We received age appropriate gifts and had plenty of time for photos. A lovely calm experience for our family. Thereâ€™s also a lovely selection of Christmas decorations and trees too.

recent_reviews.author: Jenny Drew
recent_reviews.text:
Popped up here on Saturday evening after it was dark, and loved all the lights on the way up the drive. Then turning in, seeing the doors open to a winter wonderland of decorations and trees was brilliant!

Had a nose around the ornaments first, and couldn't resist picking a few up to give them a new home.

Finally started looking for trees, and explained to the lady the height, shape, and bushiness that I was after. She picked out a tree, opened it up, and it was absolutely perfect! Exactly what I was looking for.

I asked if they'd chop a little off the base, and while I waited for the chainsaw to arrive was offered a free mince pie which was a lovely touch.

Finally, on the way out we mistook some mud for a path, and got the car stuck. Oops! However they were very helpful, getting the tractor out to pull us out of the mud so we could be on our way.

A fabulous spot, and one I'll head back to next year for another tree for sure!

recent_reviews.author: Talitha Charlick
recent_reviews.text: We're very happy with our quirky new Christmas tree decorations (pictured not on tree just yet!) which are all high quality and reasonably priced, they're almost too nice just to be seasonal decorations! There were some early issues with using the website that Lisa took a great deal of time to help me with, which is much more than you'd normally expect and was quite refreshing (and by the way it was still a very good website, better than most). She was also very communicative about when we could expect to receive our goods and they arrived in the expected timeframe, which was very speedy once despatched, so it was nice to see a reliable courier being used when there are so many delays in the post in general at the moment. Overall would definitely recommend The Farm Shed.

recent_reviews.author: Cheryl Pearson
recent_reviews.text:
Very happy with everything at festive farm shed, everyone was friendly and helpful and fresh cut trees from the farm. Lots of nice decorations on offer too and honest advice.

We'll be back next year!

pumpkin_patches.address: The Farm Shed, Allerton Rd, Bradford BD15 8AB

recent_reviews.author: chris wood
recent_reviews.text:
We always enjoy our days out here,
From petting the animals, running wild in the indoor adventure park to riding the zip line and go karts outside.. there's lots to do for all ages and it has a real family feel about it..

Kids and adults are priced the same to enter currently Â£7.95 under 2's are free..

Ice-cream is local and tastes delicious.

We've done the maze
Pumpkin picking,
Wild flower field
Visit Santa
Pyo strawberries

And other random days out

recent_reviews.author: Ed
recent_reviews.text: Super friendly staff, good food and a good price for the park. My partner and I enjoy a trip here every few weeks to see the animals and enjoy their lovely ice cream.

recent_reviews.author: Chris Knight
recent_reviews.text: Great day out for young children. Pigs  sheep, rabbits, ducks and Guineau pigs. Bouncy castles, slides.  Nice cafe with home-made ice cream.

recent_reviews.author: Chloe Chapman
recent_reviews.text:
Really enjoyed our day here yesterday. Â£7.95 for entry is really reasonable for a full day here (and we didnâ€™t even get the the outdoor play area!)
The new indoor play area is fantastic! The indoor construction play area is much better with the bricks as current.
The lamb feeding is the best set up Iâ€™ve been to at any farm.
The staff are really friendly.
The ice cream is delicious!
My only quibble is paying Â£3pp for entry to the tulip field, and no stems being included. But we did it and we enjoyed it soâ€¦ğŸ˜Š

pumpkin_patches.address: Oakmount House, Birchfield Farm, Summerbridge, Harrogate HG3 4JS

recent_reviews.author: Aidan Greenwood
recent_reviews.text: What do you guys do at this farm

recent_reviews.author: Mandy Crowther
recent_reviews.text: Because I live here

recent_reviews.author: Forhad Talukdar
recent_reviews.text:
A Wonderful Day at Vale Pick Your Own

We had an amazing experience at Vale Pick Your Own! Itâ€™s a beautiful, peaceful place surrounded by nature, perfect for a relaxing day out. The farm is well-organised and very welcoming. As soon as we arrived, we felt happy and excited to start picking.

The strawberry fields were full of fresh, juicy strawberries, and we had so much fun walking through the rows, choosing the ripest ones. The strawberries were sweet, delicious, and far better than anything from the supermarket. It felt great to pick them with our own hands and enjoy them straight from the plant.

The staff were friendly and helpful, and the overall environment was clean and family-friendly. We also loved seeing other people enjoying the place â€“ kids, couples, and groups of friends all having a good time. Thereâ€™s something satisfying and joyful about picking your own fruit in such a lovely setting.

After picking, we relaxed and took some nice photos to remember the day. It was truly a refreshing and enjoyable experience, and we definitely plan to come back again soon.

If youâ€™re looking for a fun and fresh outdoor activity, we highly recommend visiting Vale Pick Your Own!

recent_reviews.author: Mystique
recent_reviews.text:
Such a wonderful experience! Fruits were super fresh and honestly so much better than what you get at a supermarket!

The staff were really friendly and helpful too. We had a Chicken and leek pasty and a strawberry milkshake which were both absolutely delicious!

Would definitely recommend 10/10 ğŸ’œâœ¨ğŸ«¶

recent_reviews.author: Phillip Francis
recent_reviews.text: Great place For An hour or two out To pick Fresh Strawberries and Raspberries both in Abundance, They have a small cafe and seating area To grab a Bite to eat or have A strawberry Milkshake or Coffee/Tea if you prefer we come here every year and look forward to our next visit

recent_reviews.author: Colin Cranness
recent_reviews.text:
Very good selection of pumpkins to pick,well thought out and excellent displays.
Top field closed today due to rain but plenty in other fields to pick.  Reasonable prices for all pumpkins.
Children will love it.
All staff very pleasant, welcoming  and helpful .
Well done everyone.

recent_reviews.author: Jess H
recent_reviews.text: Great for younger kids. Annual pass is very good value. Tractor and 1x barrel ride included per child per visit. Nice activities to do like feeding the lambs, petting the rabbits, brushing the donkeys etc. Ample play parks all around the farm enough to keep the children entertained all day. Swings, slides, tunnels, play frames and 2x bouncing pillows and a sand pit. Ride on tractors and go-kart type cars too. Face painting available and a cafe on site. Only had the ice cream (which is delicious and good value). Ample parking and clean on site with plenty of bins and hand washing stations dotted about. Cant wait until our next visit !

recent_reviews.author: Chris Key
recent_reviews.text:
A great trip! The animals seem very well cared for and the staff were helpful and engaged.

The kids love it, you can get up close to the animals and they love the feeding!

The included tractor ride and barrel ride are great fun, the play park is excellent and the cafe prices very fair

Had a great day and will be back to support our community!

recent_reviews.author: Claire Stevens
recent_reviews.text: A fun trip for younger kids for a morning or an afternoon. Best bit was the herd of red deer appearing over the hill to be fed. Worst bit was how dirty and stained the baby changing facilities were.

recent_reviews.author: Margaret Stokoe
recent_reviews.text: Really lovely little farm, well spaced out, plenty of parking spaces. Lots to keep children entertained. Food from cafe nice too.

pumpkin_patches.address: Burdon Lane, Houghton le Spring DH5 8JG

recent_reviews.author: Becca Robinson
recent_reviews.text:
Gorgeous little city farm! We spent a lovely hour having a look around- an hour is probably the maximum unless also visiting the cafe due to the size, but there's lots to do in the surrounding Ouseburn valley/area so it's a perfect addition to a day out.
The farm has a variety of traditional farm animals, birds and tropical animals to visit. There is also a beautiful garden area with flowers, plants and sculptures/art work. The farm is fantastically maintained and I could access almost all of it on my mobility scooter.

recent_reviews.author: Marzia Mahzabin
recent_reviews.text: Such a wholesome place in the heart of Newcastle. Small farm but very well maintained. Great for family visit or just for animal enthusiasts. The animals in the farm presented to be well cared for. Theres a cafe as well with a really nice view for chilling. Had loads of fun and enjoyed visiting. Must go place ğŸ’¯

recent_reviews.author: C
recent_reviews.text: A place im more than happy to donate too. Excellent work guys!!! Farm is free, parking is poor little to none. And there is a nice wild walk instead of all animals being enclosed. Biggest pigs ive ever seen also

recent_reviews.author: Milo Coates
recent_reviews.text: I've been here so many times over the years and I love coming back to see all of the animals. It's a lovely, peaceful, and well looked after area with animals to pet and feed, as well as a lovely garden area to stroll through too. I will definitely be back again in the future.

pumpkin_patches.address: Ouseburn Farm, Ouseburn Rd, Newcastle upon Tyne NE1 2PA

recent_reviews.author: A. Chong
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely free entry farm.
Staff friendly to introduce the animals. Great experience. Loved seeing the alpacas .

recent_reviews.author: Stephanie McIntyre
recent_reviews.text:
We visited this week and what a lovely welcome we had. Staff were very friendly and enthusiastic. The animals were even friendlier, especially one particular goat and alpaca. We petted bunnies, cuddled a goat, fed the pigs, and enjoyed a picnic taking in the views of the Tyne.

Not many places are free these days, but this was a refreshing change, for a small donation.

I look forward to seeing how this farm grows in the future with the help and support of future donations.

recent_reviews.author: David Mccartney
recent_reviews.text: The big goat she was so friendly and always willing to have her photo taken. The alpaca is very greedy and mischievous. And the little goats are very friendly with kids.

recent_reviews.author: Polina Borisocheva
recent_reviews.text: Very nice place. Would recommend to visit, especially with kids. Animals look happy. You can purchase animal feed at the farm to feed the animals. Coffee, tea, ice cream and dessert are also available to buy.

pumpkin_patches.address: Hainingwood Terrace, Bill Quay, Gateshead NE10 0UE

recent_reviews.author: C
recent_reviews.text: Great little dog friendly pumpkin patch, not sure my pooch enjoyed the experienceğŸ™„ğŸ¥² but itâ€™s a fab place. Really convenient not having to book. Thereâ€™s also Alpacaâ€™s there. Procured a magnificently ugly pumpkinğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: James Ballantyne
recent_reviews.text: Really fun pumpkin patch, we got here early, traffic was busy when we left at 12pm, good value pumpkins, snack trucks and animals to look at too

recent_reviews.author: kiera brunton
recent_reviews.text: such a lovely place plenty of pumpkins and lovely workers

recent_reviews.author: Melli Allen
recent_reviews.text: Had a great time loved the experience first time we had ever been girls had so much fun even in the rain,swapped a pumpkin right at the end for a photoshoot with the baby and got asked to share here he is in his lion glory

pumpkin_patches.address: Kinley Hill Farm, Hawthorn, Seaham SR7 8SW

recent_reviews.author: Lorraine Nelson
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant place and well set out. I accidentally bought a ticket for the wrong day and emailed to ask if I could change the date. I was expecting to be told the rules state I couldnâ€™t but the owners very kindly refunded me. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit and got some lovely photos. They have food stalls, toilets and a gift tent on the way out. Plenty parking space and itâ€™s easy to find. Great place for kids and I will definitely be back next year.

recent_reviews.author: Matt English
recent_reviews.text: What a beautiful place! Very relaxing walking around the sunflower maze, my 11 year old enjoyed answering the quiz questions and I liked looking in the shop at the end. The smells coming from the cafe was something special and something I will make use of on my next visit.

recent_reviews.author: RKR All Things
recent_reviews.text: Had lots of fun in the corn fields and sunflower fields. Pumpkins obviously not ready yet.  Cost Â£6 per person and you can pick sunflowers as you go round however costs Â£1 each.

recent_reviews.author: Liam Crow
recent_reviews.text: The pumpkin picking is always a yearly activity for our family, but we also enjoy visiting for the sunflower trail! This year there's 2.5 million sunflowers and you can pick your own for Â£1 per stem.

pumpkin_patches.address: East Grange Farm, High Shincliffe, Durham DH1 2TB

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Curran
recent_reviews.text: We took part in the Sunflower Field day again and as always it was an excellent day. Plenty of food and drink options this year and fun foe adulta and kids....as well as being cheap. Thank you

recent_reviews.author: Peter
recent_reviews.text: Itâ€™s so well organised, the sunflowers were ok but due to lack of rain were not as spectacular as previous years. 2022 was spectacular this year they are stunted less than 4ft mostly and wilting. We still took some home Â£6 for 5 stems. Canâ€™t complain.

recent_reviews.author: rachel tallentire
recent_reviews.text: We went sunflower picking here and it was a great day out! Something different to do. There was face painting, food, rides all great fun for the family.

recent_reviews.author: Matt Fussey
recent_reviews.text: Visited yesterday with all the family. This is a really fun family experience. Lots of different activities to do including childrens rides, face paintings and other similar type activities. Then there is the sunflower maze itself which again is really good. Looking forward in returning for the pumpkin picking ğŸ‘

pumpkin_patches.address: East, Grange Farm, High Shincliffe, Durham DH1 2TB

recent_reviews.author: Jake Hudson
recent_reviews.text: Great place for the family or a trip out with your partner. Been to both the day and night pumpkin picks. Would highly recommend. Nice staff, easy parking, food and drink available, prices all reasonable too!

recent_reviews.author: Whale Blue
recent_reviews.text: A fabulous sunflower field! Itâ€™s big and we took loads of good pictures in the sunflower maze. Spent good 2 hours there with a sandpit, small bouncy castle and haystacks to play on. Relaxing place!

recent_reviews.author: M Tem
recent_reviews.text: First time visit, was really impressed with everything on offer, pumpkin prices are excellent for the sizes you can get, the other stalls and food prices vary, but at what you expect at a event. My children loved the craft tent, facepainting and learning about a bee hive. Really good selection of pumpkins to choose in all varieties and colours, we came home with more than we went for !! Will be back next year and highly recommend to anyone who hasn't been yet!!

recent_reviews.author: Rebbecca Gray
recent_reviews.text: Our first visit to Sandy Bottom farm and we had a wonderful day. The staff were lovely, friendly and helpful. There was food and drink vans with lots of delicious choices. There was a good range of different pumpkins to chose from in various sizes. I thought it was a wonderful gesture that they were raising money for MND. There was a maze too and we could pick the lovely sunflowers and corn. Definitely worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Ewelina K.
recent_reviews.text: What a gem that farm is! We were visiting family nearby when we spotted it. My toddler had so much fun, and the farm is so well looked after, with plenty of attractions for kids and beautiful sunflowers! Great experience, thank you.

recent_reviews.author: Olivia Cochran
recent_reviews.text: such lovely staff and such a fun time. admission is only Â£2 and so much to do. well worth the trip out to get your pumkins from here!

recent_reviews.author: Matthew Rason
recent_reviews.text: Good pumpkin picking experience with wide selection of pumpkins. Food and drinks selection was good.

recent_reviews.author: G
recent_reviews.text:
It was our first time visiting here this year and all I can say is WOW!!!
It was everything we wanted and more. We travelling 40 miles to come here and it was so worth the drive.
The staff were all lovely, everything was set out and explained to us. They had a cute little face painting area and shop you could purchase things. We got sweet treats, a little pumpkin beret and spooky matching earrings for me and my daughter. We had some amazing Greek food and my daughter wanted to pick up every single pumpkin she seenğŸ¤¦ğŸ»â€â™€ï¸ğŸ¤¦ğŸ»â€â™€ï¸ The pumpkins are reasonably priced, we got 10 (all different shapes and sizes) for Â£25. It was a really good day out and we canâ€™t wait to visit again.

pumpkin_patches.address: B1240 Thorn Rd, Hedon, Hull HU12 8BB

recent_reviews.author: Charlie
recent_reviews.text: My family and I have been to a number of events at Tickton Farm including Easter egg hunt, pumpkin picking, family fun days and Silent Book club. We always have a great time, it is such a friendly and welcoming place that puts great effort into the events they host. The new coffee & cake trailer is fabulous (you need to try the brownies) and always get the eggs they are delicious and often double yolkers.

recent_reviews.author: sarah2572
recent_reviews.text:
I attended a Silent Book Club Event here. There was a coffee van available with coffee, tea and the most delicious cakes, plus their own honey and eggs. The tipi tent was a gorgeous place to sit and read for an hour -
even saw a deer prancing its way through the field. Much recommended- lovely people. Canâ€™t wait to return in a few weeks when the sunflowers grow.

recent_reviews.author: Claire Peak
recent_reviews.text: Went for pumpkin picking. Muddy as hell but great fun squishing around in it. The owners were very friendly and accommodating. Will most definitely be going back for the next event.

recent_reviews.author: Leah Dalton
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant Day out! Fantastic stalls and lots of fun activities for kids, including a photo opportunity with a tractor which my little one loved! Also picked up the most amazing honey and eggs ğŸ˜‹ Would definitely recommend visiting! X

recent_reviews.author: Kerry Conachie
recent_reviews.text: Came here today for the first time to get some pumpkins and me and my family really enjoyed it. The pumpkins are amazing and in great condition with excellent prices the monsters are Â£10 and then prices go down from there. They also had a pork van there serving food and drinks and also funtasia inflatables were there to which was great fun. Highly recommend going here.

recent_reviews.author: Tabitha Steemson
recent_reviews.text: One of the best pick your owns Iâ€™ve ever been to! Run by the kindest man, who was so helpful. More than just berries too! He taught us how to dig out carrots. The strawberries are by far the best Iâ€™ve ever eaten and plentiful. Such a great variety of fruit and vegetables all through the season, too. Iâ€™d give this place six stars if I could!

recent_reviews.author: Wan Nur Sakinah
recent_reviews.text: Chose to pick plums and raspberries. Weather was rly nice and Neil was great. Def recommend Pips pick your own farm for fruit picking

recent_reviews.author: Emily Wilson
recent_reviews.text: Kids had a really fun afternoon picking... we all tried honeyberries for the first time. Super delicious strawberries! Lovely friendly, relaxing place to visit.

pumpkin_patches.address: Behind Bens Farm Shop, Plymouth PL8 2LT

recent_reviews.author: Badar
recent_reviews.text: What an amazing experience it was. First time picking up the strawberries and it felt awesome. Although the farm had stated that it might be a bit hard to find strawberries due to end of season but oh boy, we and as I could everyone else was filling their buckets. It was such a fun. And then you can also get fresh milk which is delicious. The strawberries are so sweet and yummy. Lastly, itâ€™s easy on the wallet as well

recent_reviews.author: Laura Barioli
recent_reviews.text: Picked our own courgettes and french beans. Just love this place! (Good parking and takes card payments).

recent_reviews.author: Anastasia Grigoriadou
recent_reviews.text: We went to pick up strawberries today and it was amazing experience! Strawberries are full of flavour, sweet and tasty ! And there were lots of them! Thereâ€™s no fee for entry only pay for what youâ€™re taking home at a very good price.

recent_reviews.author: Ands (Moie)
recent_reviews.text: Went here for the pumpkin ğŸƒ patch! Beautiful pumpkins anddd lots of them! We came around 10am and it was not busy. They also have fresh milk available and lots of goodies from their farm shop.

recent_reviews.author: Meggan W
recent_reviews.text: Really really good fun. Iâ€™ve only been pumpkin picking once before at another farm. My boyfriend had never been before at all. We both really enjoyed it, and loved seeing all the different shapes and colours of the pumpkins on offer. The displays were also brilliant and you could really tell time and effort had gone into it all. Brilliant day out. Would highly recommend if you have children as itâ€™s not very expensive and you can really take your time and wander about! Will be back next year for sure!

recent_reviews.author: paul mathias
recent_reviews.text: Good for a few hours out with the kids, plenty of pumpkins, and lots for them to look at. Cafe is not bad awful coffee but the food is good and service is quick. Make sure to take wellies as it is a farm and very muddy.

recent_reviews.author: Sophie Baker
recent_reviews.text: fantastic! so many pumpkins to choose from and the halloween decorations tie the whole thing together! we stayed for lunch and it was delicious! 5/5 would definitely recommend ğŸ‘ğŸ¼

recent_reviews.author: Mark Marsh
recent_reviews.text: My Son is halloween mad loves this time off year thankyou for the huge effort which has been made by your staff for making it an incredible exciting experience for my son he was in his element with the different types of pumpkins and winter squash

pumpkin_patches.address: Sunnyfields Farm, Jacob's Gutter Ln, Southampton SO40 9FX

recent_reviews.author: Marc Vilalta
recent_reviews.text:
Great place to buy pumpkins for Halloween.
Then enjoy grabbing the ones you like with the kids.
100% recommendable

recent_reviews.author: Lauren Roberts
recent_reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed our morning pumpkin picking. Lots to choose from - and dog friendly too, unlike a lot of the other farms near us!

recent_reviews.author: Mr Z Ampino
recent_reviews.text:
Delicious strawberries ğŸ“
Tasty tomatoes ğŸ… and beautifully crunchy greens ğŸ¥¬
ğŸ˜‹ I am very happy to have taken the time to stop and visit this family farm shop. Located just outside the village, I had seen the sign ğŸª§ on the road side, on the left when heading towards the sea ğŸŒŠ but I had not stopped before as itâ€™s on a double lane stretch of road. Well worthy it. Seasonal, farm freshly picked ğŸ«¶ğŸ“ğŸ…ğŸ¥¬ğŸŒ±ğŸŒº

recent_reviews.author: Debra Phillips
recent_reviews.text: Really enjoyable hour,  pick your own pumpkin and squash

pumpkin_patches.address: Hollam Nurseries, 348 Titchfield Rd, Fareham PO14 3EU

recent_reviews.author: Andreea Brad
recent_reviews.text: We were visiting Hayling Island for the first time. It is a beautiful place and the beach has a mix of sand and pebbles. On our way to the beach I saw the Farm shop and it was a must to visit it. On our way back home we stopped there and I bought these amazing looking tomatoes, some oak smoked garlic butter which tastes amazing, some kefir and a loaf of bread. The butter with the bread and the tomatoes were absolutely delicious together. They have a variety of fresh products, cured meats, butter, eggs and vegetables. If you are in the area you should visit them.

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Welland
recent_reviews.text:
Pleasantly surprised! This farm shop held far more than I expected including items from the garlic farm! My favourite!

Fresh, local fruits, veggies and meats.
Very impressed and I don't know how I managed to work so many years on the island without knowing this was here!

recent_reviews.author: steve coulson
recent_reviews.text: what on earth has happened with the eggs? I appreciate that the eggs are smaller due to new hens but where has the deep golden yellow yolks gone to? all I am getting from the eggs on my last two visits are, weak, milky looking not good at all yolks. Very disappointing . will give it a break for a month to see if quality gets better.

recent_reviews.author: John Bowers
recent_reviews.text: Great range of produce, mainly local. Friendly staff. Proper farm shop but with sensible prices.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Pumpkin Picking Patch & Halloween Maze Fordingbridge

recent_reviews.author: DaisyMai Wyatt
recent_reviews.text: What an incredible place! Staff were really accommodating with my family, and despite the mud we all had a fantastic day. Some really great photo opportunities and also hot food and drinks on site which was s nice surprise. We all took some pumpkins home and have an incredible selection of all sorts of colours and shapes, a 10/10 day we come back each year.

recent_reviews.author: Ade
recent_reviews.text:
This is such a beautiful place.  Depending on the time of the year, there is the sunflower field, maize field, or the pumpkin patch to choose from. Fun activities have been designed around the year for each. For Halloween, the hidden gem is a double treat of the maize maze and pumpkin picking from the patch.

The pumpkin patch is free to enter, but the maize maze costs about Â£8 per person.  The maize maze offers a Halloween themed mysterious murder walk in the maize field. Clues are scattered all over and provide just the right incentive for the whole family to log some calorie burning steps. The pumpkin patch is gorgeous and expansive. There are varieties of pumpkins to choose from and lots of Halloween themed setups for photo opportunities.

Although it was wet and soggy, we enjoyed every bit of the experience.

P.S. There is a coffee shop on site and a fire pit for the kids to flame some marshmallows. Card and cash accepted. Free parking and porta loos, too. No dogs allowed!

5/5 any day!

recent_reviews.author: Lyndsey Hancock
recent_reviews.text: We had an amazing time here. The kods had a great time and even the grandparents enjoyed it. Lots of amazing pumpkins in different varieties and the Halloween maze was great! Especially the UV tunnel! Wow!

recent_reviews.author: Jonathan Parr
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic place, currently they have a Maize Maze and a lot of children going with their grandparents, we went to see and pick some sunflowers, they have various varieties of sunflowers and they charge Â£5 for 6 stems. An excellent morning out. The place is well signposted just south of Fordingbridge near Bickton. The pumpkins will be ready in October, there are two photos of the field. The place is well organised and Covid precautions have been taken.

pumpkin_patches.address: A338 Ringwood Rd, Bickton, Fordingbridge SP6 2HA

recent_reviews.author: Lou Wright
recent_reviews.text: Our daughter has been at Pumpkin Patch now for 2 years and we love it.  They were brilliant during the pandemic, providing information, regular communications and even when the nursery was closed online activities for the kids. They were also very fair regarding charges.  There is so much creativity with the atelier (art room) with wonderful lady who runs it, nature-related activities in the garden (there is an outdoor classroom) and now things are returning to normality Forest school and other trips outside the nursery.  I canâ€™t recommend it enough.

recent_reviews.author: Eleanor Beach
recent_reviews.text: Highly reccomend this nursery. My daughter Libby started there at 13 months, as a first time mum it is a big step and I am so happy we decided on Pumpkin Patch. I love the ethos, lovely big garden and it feels warm and loving. The staff are brilliant and give good updates on what she has been up to. In the mornings when we arrive Libby gets very excited and runs up the steps which says it all.

recent_reviews.author: Nicki McGoh
recent_reviews.text: So happy to have found this nursery for my little ones. The staff are caring, professional and creative meaning that the kids have a great time and are always busy! Especially like their approach to giving the children plenty of time exploring outside. Highly recommend this nursery to anyone!

recent_reviews.author: Tor Seacombe
recent_reviews.text:
I am gutted to be at the end of my families time at Pumpkin Patch Brighton!
Both my children attended from 2ish to school age.
So many things to say!
The consistency of a large chunk of staff over the years has been reassuring and useful.
The provision of 'education' is outstanding. It's never felt like 'education' hence the quote marks. The range of topics, the depths, the variety of methods has been brilliant. it was always good but has improved in our 5ish years with PP.
The environment is attractive, well maintained. Stimulating but with space to breath too. The environment has also been continually improved over the years.
The emphasis on being outdoors is great.
The communication system is now fantastic. easy to use, not clunky, covers messages, invoices, food intake and updates on the learning and fun stuff.
The communication form the team throughout the pandemic from the early days was exactly what I hoped for. Quick but without jumping to answers when there were none at first. Honest about the options and clear when they had to advise things that might have been tricky (but were clearly fair and the best that could be offered).
I have really missed being able to go in to the nursery during the pandemic, It was always so lovely to see.
Thoroughly recommend.

pumpkin_patches.address: 37 Preston Drove, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 6LA

recent_reviews.author: Az Ahmed
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic pumpkin patch with a great Halloween trail that was really fun for my son and me too. Loved the crafts and the pumpkins were really good quality too. We ended up buying three of them. Really friendly staff as well.

recent_reviews.author: Hannah Rignell
recent_reviews.text: Really disappointed to arrive Thursday morning at 10.45 to find everything locked up. Advertised opening hours are 10am. No staff to be seen and phone number listed on website did not work. Waited until 11 then left. One very disappointed 2 year old here.

recent_reviews.author: Carly Farun
recent_reviews.text: This is the best pumpkin patch I've ever been to. The staff are wonderful and so welcoming and they had an incredible selection of pumpkins. It's a great place to bring kids and spend time with the family. Also, the manager was such a pleasure.

recent_reviews.author: Luke Sweetlove
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely day out with the family. Great staff and the kids loved every minute of it. Would definitely recommend.

pumpkin_patches.address: Manor Garden, Preston, Preston Rd, Brighton BN1 6SA

recent_reviews.author: Gem James
recent_reviews.text:
Our Son absolutely loved Pumpkin Patch Hove and I would definitely recommend them to everyone!

The level of love and care in everything they do is second to none. The team were really helpful and attentive during our struggles with the settling process, which made it as easy as possible for our son (and us!).

There is always something fun going on during their day and you get regular update and photos of your little one. The children always seem so happy and the team are friendly, professional and kind.

recent_reviews.author: sharon lee
recent_reviews.text: Our daughter is loving Pumpkin in the Park, the staff and facilities are wonderful. They have a beautiful garden with a free flow policy so the kids can enjoy the garden all day long. The nursery is large, bright, well equipped and the staff are absolutely lovely. A hidden gem of a nursery in Wish Park. We are so pleased we found you!

recent_reviews.author: Oliver Lucraft
recent_reviews.text: The team at Pumpkin Patch are the phenomenal. They are so kind and caring, it's no wonder that they have been recognised for their outstanding care. Wouldn't hesitate in sending our second and whenever I am asked for nursery recommendations there is only one name on the list.

recent_reviews.author: Erica Sosna
recent_reviews.text: My son has been coming here since he was 13 months. The team are outstanding, taking time to really get to know each child, providing interactive activities that pursue their interests and providing nourishing food and a safe and happy environment. Our son has thrived here and is due to move up to pre school shortly. Not only have the team been amazing giving a lockdown social education to so many little ones, but our family experienced a number of health scares and losses. When I was hit by a car, resulting in life changing injuries, they acted like our extended family, offering comfort and emotional intelligence support to our son, gifting him books on hospital life and being really flexible about extra time as my hai and shirker between hospital and home. We cannot recommend them enough. They go above and beyond and have really helped our son and our family flourish. Thank you pumpkin!

pumpkin_patches.address: 109 New Church Rd, Worthing, Brighton and Hove, Hove BN3 4BD

recent_reviews.author: Erica Sosna
recent_reviews.text:
Son loves it here. Been with them since 13 months. All the staff at PP are attentive and friendly and there is a huge range of child led activity. Food really healthy and a lovely environment. I was in hospital for 4 months when he was small and they were such a help to him and my partner, even buying him a book to talk about hospital visits.

Only downside for 3-5 year olds is it is always full, so 60 kids at some times, which he finds a bit overwhelming. But cannot fault the service, care and wonderful experiential and creative hard-working Montessori/Reggio educators. Highly recommended.

pumpkin_patches.address: Saxon Rd, Brighton and Hove, Hove BN3 4LF

recent_reviews.author: Jenny Breitschmid
recent_reviews.text: This is a hidden gem for pumpkin picking outside of London - no entry tickets / pre book required. Check their facebook for more info. Super lovely staff. Cute ambiance and the pumpkin I picked was just utterly delicious ğŸ¤¤ ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Garry Mortimer-Cook
recent_reviews.text:
First time PumpkinğŸƒ picking here for us. Beautiful location, well organised, prices compare well with other fields.
Excellent variety and quality of Pumpkins and Squash. It was more fun to hunt through the still growing plants. Will go back next year. ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Dan Adsett
recent_reviews.text: Went pumpkin picking this morning for the 1st time, had seen pumpkin picking at Poynings in previous years so thought would give it a go. Was easy and free to access, you wander round choose how ever many pumpkins/sizes you want. Theyve got a size guide and how much so you can gauge how much they will all be. Great time

recent_reviews.author: Chel Hylott
recent_reviews.text: We really loved our visit today. It was rainy and misty and that did not detract from the experience. The views were stunning, there was a lot of variety in the pumpkin colours, shapes and sizes, and the wheelbarrows were so helpful! The staff were very helpful, and those pumpkin fritters were to die for. Cannot recommend more. We paid Â£34 for like 6 pumpkins. The most expensive (the biggest) pumpkins were only Â£10 and they were capped at that price. You could get little pumpkins for Â£2 as well. Lovely location, lovely staff, lovely food and lovely pumpkins. We canâ€™t wait to go back next year.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Pumpkin Picking Patch Sompting, West Sussex

recent_reviews.author: Jake S
recent_reviews.text: We went on the last weekend but still plenty of pumpkins around. Really friendly staff. Free tractor ride for a donation with the resident farmer giving a talk all about the farm and crops. Free range to explore the pumpkin patch with a range of pumpkins and squashes all planted. Very fair prices based upon size with toilets and catering on site. Plenty of free parking and kid friendly. Would happily return next year!

recent_reviews.author: Fiona Wade
recent_reviews.text: Awesome pumpkin patch! Free parking and entry - we just paid for the pumpkins we chose. The staff were all incredible and we had such a fun morning choosing our Halloween pumpkins (and our dinner!).

recent_reviews.author: Adam Terry
recent_reviews.text: Great fun today. Some of the large pumpkins are enormous! Much better to pick your own fresh from the field than buy one from ASDA.  Great fun for all the family.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Dawson
recent_reviews.text: We come back every year and every year it gets better! Bought all the family this time and the kids absolutely loved it.

recent_reviews.author: hannah horsman
recent_reviews.text: Nice little day out with young kids. Spent a few hours here. Not for bigger kids, as even play areas are more catered to younger kids.

recent_reviews.author: Emily Ward
recent_reviews.text: We went here for the Halloween event they had on. The Halloween set up was good, they made lots of effort with a spooky walk trail and added bits around the farm. But when it came to the animals, there wasn't a lot there. We liked feeding the pigs and the goats. The mini play houses were basic . It was very busy when we went. Much busier than I was expecting. We had 2 OAP's a carer and a disability with us but there were no concessions for them. It was hard to get round in places with the wheel chair too. They had pumpkin carving (pumpkin was a paid added extra) and Halloween pictures to do. They put in a lot of effort for the event . But that didn't make it worth what we paid. We only lasted about an hour and the girls were ready to come home.

recent_reviews.author: Katerine Sandri
recent_reviews.text: A great program for children of all ages. Toilets with changing tables and wheelchair access. Due to the long line at the small bar, I suggest bringing food for a picnic.

recent_reviews.author: Maria
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little farm, good for kids, has a play area and a little maze. The animals are well looked after and happy, the staff are really nice and friendly, one lovely lady spoke to us for ages about the rabbits and answered all our questions. I'll definitely recommend visiting here.

pumpkin_patches.address: Wykeham Way, Coulby Newham, Middlesbrough TS8 0TG

recent_reviews.author: Adam Whittred
recent_reviews.text: Love coming here, this time of year. Kids love picking their own Pumpkins ğŸƒ , been part of the family routine since they were little. Family who run the farm are always lovely as well. We try and support the local businesses were we can, long may they continue!!

recent_reviews.author: Daniel Goodrum
recent_reviews.text: We come here every year for pumpkin picking with the kids and a few times throughout the year. Really friendly staff, great produce and always good with the kids when they come along. Highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: MCS McDonagh
recent_reviews.text: Such a fun experience. HUGE pumpkins galore! Wheelbarrows available - sanitised after use. Plenty of parking. Pick your own - the better ones are farthest away! Sunday morning is very busy.

recent_reviews.author: Emily Smith
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful farm shop. We've picked our own raspberries in the summer and pumpkins in the autumn. Very reasonable prices especially when compared to other pyo's. Friendly staff and a lovely location in the Norfolk countryside!!

recent_reviews.author: Nicoletta
recent_reviews.text: Itâ€™s worth travelling over 20 miles just to have lunch there. The legendary begels with salmon and cream cheese / avocado are amazing! Tha staff are very helpful and the chef although never met him, creates good lunch.

recent_reviews.author: Kate Newton Oakley
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely cafe with fresh produce shed and a butchery.
The PYO in summer and autumn (sunflowers, strawberries previous years, pumpkins) is gorgeous - plus all the other things they have on site - from a brewery (Raider Cider), nursery, florist, dance studioâ€¦ itâ€™s a jewel of the community.

recent_reviews.author: Elizabeth S
recent_reviews.text: Great campsite. Good facilities. Great pitches.

recent_reviews.author: Sam James
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful little farm shop, cafe and butchers. We likely drive past 2 others to go to this place and absolutely love their black pepper sausages. I once had a spicy sausage roll from here that blew my mind, but they don't always have them or they sell out so quickly (not sure which). It's not cheap, but quality local produce is worth it. The staff behind all counters are always so helpful, kind and happy to help. Kid and dog friendly.

recent_reviews.author: ian Goodwin
recent_reviews.text:
WOW !! What a fantastic farm shop with a fantastic selection of produce !! I travel all over the Norfolk countryside daily and visit A LOT of farm shops during my week & this ones variety of fresh produce and many many different brands of sauces, spices, condiments, drinks/alcohol, oils, meats, crackers, biscuits (basically everything !) is so much more varied than most other Farm Shops (which tend to stock around 80% of the same brands).
Itâ€™s well worth checking out & gets a solid 5/5 from me ! â­â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸
(Thereâ€™s a cafe opening soon too, a good excuse to pop in as well ğŸ°â˜•ï¸ğŸ‘ŒğŸ»)

recent_reviews.author: Marc Lappin
recent_reviews.text: Looking great after their revamp. Lots of interesting products for you to browse and buy. Their choice of ice cream they stock isnâ€™t the best, who makes a premium chocolate ice cream without chocolate pieces ğŸ¤·â€â™‚ï¸. Their welcome could be better as both staff members were on their phones and didnâ€™t greet us. They were pleasant while we made our purchases though. A lovely addition to the growing number of Norfolk farm shops.

recent_reviews.author: auty florence
recent_reviews.text: lovely pumpkin patch - been two years in a row and love coming here for their display and high quality of pumpkins along with fair pricing! their farm shop is also very varied with vegan bits to buy! ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Cameron Caine
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely place to pick your pumpkin. The wood-fired pizza smelt good and the farm shop (although pricey as you'd expect) has some gems. The pork pie and popcorn are the highlights there!

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca
recent_reviews.text: All in all we had a lovely day out. Our kids are 3 and 1 years of age. We were there for a little over 4 hours but could have stayed longer as there was still lots to do. The place was clean, the staff very friendly and helpful. The rides were clean and in good working order, and it was great that you could buy a picture from the two roller coaster rides. The animals all look well cared for, and there are several places by the petting farm that you can get more feed, although one goat did try to eat my t shirt. They could do with another block of loos, and maybe another food option as the cafe is right by the entrance. Next time I think we would take a picnic lunch.

recent_reviews.author: Mimi H
recent_reviews.text: Had a nice day. Spent 5 hours here with my 7 year old. My advice would be to make sure you have pound coins on you for the car rides, grabbers and numerous other bits around the park. I hadn't read anywhere that these were there so didn't have many pound coins on me which lead to a bit of disappointment. Other thing was that the lady on the entrance gate was a bit of a dragon! Not a great first impression to a family day out. Anyway, pros were; the golf was fun. Lovely gift shop with items priced to suit everyone. Animals appeared well taken care of. Plenty of change machines around the park. And the staff operating the rides were brilliant seeings as they were a member of staff short. Overall would visit again! Remember to keep your half price anytime return in a safe place if you plan to go back!

recent_reviews.author: Keira Waller
recent_reviews.text: A fantastic day with 2 toddlers (2.5), a one year old and a new born! So much to do and see and perfect for small kids. No height limits on rides so they can all get involved. Highly recommend and well worth the ticket prices. You can go back for half price if you keep your receipt!

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte Nichols
recent_reviews.text:
Had a fantastic day here, we could have come back another day as we didn't quite do everything.
If we ever holiday in Great Yarmouth again, we'll definitely return
Perfect for all ages, fun for all.
We had lunch in the cafe, food didn't take too long to come out and was good!
Donut stall was awesome, lotsmof different topping flavours to pick from yum! ğŸ˜‹

Definitely highly recommend

recent_reviews.author: Tim Weller
recent_reviews.text: A cute, simple farm shop with a coffee machine. Lovely friendly staff serving Wendy's sausage rolls and home made carrot cake! Thank you Wendy, whoever you are. A good spot to stop off for a take-away lunch.

recent_reviews.author: JtotheW
recent_reviews.text: We went fruit picking here today, everyone was very friendly, we had a great time. The children loved it and it was a really inexpensive way to spend an afternoon. Highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: David and Jax Parkin
recent_reviews.text: A lovely little farm shop.  Selling a range of locally grown and sourced products.   The lady who served us was very friendly.   Parking was right outside the shop.  There is a bench seat outside and you can purchase a hot drink from a coffee machine inside.  We bought some flowers,  granola,  coffee and walnut cake and a lettuce cost just over Â£8.00.  They also have pick your own seasonal fruit and vegetables.   We will return when the strawberries are ready.

recent_reviews.author: Xena-Marie Horn
recent_reviews.text:
Just popped over to collect some strawberries, didn't take long as there was plenty to pick from. lovely weather and kind, friendly staff! would definitely recommend if you want something to do with the kids for an hour or so.
Very good value, for personally selected strawberries for under Â£2!

pumpkin_patches.address: The Grange, Rollesby, Great Yarmouth NR29 5AJ

recent_reviews.author: Lola Lank
recent_reviews.text: Me and My nephew had a lovely time especially looking for the animal stamps. We collected different styles of pumpkins and had fun cutting them from the plant. We also enjoyed looking around. Not only was there a pumpkin patch but areas where there were things to do for the children including art supplies. Different types of food and drinks. Me and my nephew happily tucked into a cookie. I would recommend and would be returning next year. All the people who were in charge were polite and happy to help.

recent_reviews.author: Amy Roberts
recent_reviews.text: We have been coming since the very beginning and it's so lovely to see Mrs G's evolve! Each year you can see money has been spent and it just keeps getting better. I love that it's one of the only pumpkin patches where you don't feel like you're being extorted for money at every turn! We spent nearly 3 hours at the patch with friends, 8 kids from age 10-4 & they all loved it and look forward to it each year. They loved the wand making this year especially but as usual the bales/slides and train ride were a big hit to o & then onto the patch for the scavenger hunt and to pick our pumpkins. All the family/staff you come across are lovely. We'll be back again next year!

recent_reviews.author: Sheree Hartwell
recent_reviews.text: We have been going withy children since this lovely pumpkin patch opened. Every year it gets better! My girls are 9 and 12 and really enjoy going. The pumpkins are grown on the vines, loads of variety's and priced well. Ther ware lots of activities there for the children to explore, craft, mud kitchen ( favourite! ) hay pyramid and the barrel train which is amazing! Brilliant food and drink vans of fantastic quality and a little craft shop on the way out too. You can literally spend hours here... highly recommend! Not a bad price to get in either!

recent_reviews.author: Camilla Hayne
recent_reviews.text: This has become our annual tradition and is as exciting as going to choose our Christmas tree in December! This is the third year we have been and it just keeps getting better. The patch has moved this year to another field opposite (I loved talking to the owner and hearing about how they rotate to help the fields) and it felt spacious and there was so much to do. They still have the barrel ride which is a favourite with our children and once youâ€™ve paid your entry fee you get a brilliant craft area, mud kitchen and play area for the kids, including a scavenger hunt in the patch. The selection of pumpkins they have grown is VAST and there are so many different varieties to choose from. It doesnâ€™t feel cramped which is good. You can tell this place is run and planned by people with families because itâ€™s really kid-friendly with so much to do and also with an eco-friendly eye. Each year they seem to be investing a little more into the patch and there is always something added each year to bring a bit of interest. Love it.

recent_reviews.author: John Palmer
recent_reviews.text:
Kids absolutely loved the pumpkin picking and trail for Mr bones this year, 2 years in a row we've come back and it's been completely different each visit.

2024 edit - the staff are as friendly and down to earth as you'd expect, still a top visit even during poor weather. The effort they manage to put in to events and day to day is exactly why people need to support this.

recent_reviews.author: Josie Skipper
recent_reviews.text:
Love visiting h
Rookery for the farm shop and fantastic festive events

recent_reviews.author: Becky Laws
recent_reviews.text: Really fun festive place for babies (for cute photos) and small children!

recent_reviews.author: Hannah May
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic fresh produce.  I always get my eggs from them. I love the sight of the accommodation with the fairy lights in the evenings when I drive past and the Christmas tree all lit up in the middle at the moment is wonderful!

recent_reviews.author: Roxanne Wilson
recent_reviews.text:
A wonderful afternoon spent at The Pulham Patch.
Really friendly and informative staff.
The Maze is great fun to complete, with a brilliant viewing platform to see the surrounding area from a height. Lovely savoury and sweet treats, with hot a cold drinks available too. Seating undercover and out in the open for all weathers.
The wildflowers are just stunning to walk amongst, a such great value to select and cut your own to take a bunch home.
Although we visited with no children, thereâ€™s plenty to keep them occupied - The barrel train looked great fun and climbing on the bales is always popular with kids.
Overall a fantastic time, would highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Hannah Royal
recent_reviews.text:
We went to the Pulham patch last year for their first year of opening and then returned today and THE GROWTH of it has been amazing! I took my 2.5 year old with a couple of other mums and the children had the best time. There is plenty of fun for them there including games which really help with their coordination and development such as the duck race - my daughter LOVED filling her bucket and emptying it on the ramp to make the duck move! Mini maize maze is perfect for little legs and the PYO wildflowers is a no brainer - bargain bunch of flowers, photo opportunity & fun activity. Whatâ€™s not to love. Toilet facilities on site with picnic areas to bring own food and despite there being lots of wasps this time of year, the facilities are actively doing all they can to minimise this.
Also LOVE that this small business supports other small businesses in way of local caterer and food supplier, photographers for mini shoots and so on. Canâ€™t wait to see next years development!
P.s. the pumpkins are looking fab already for the upcoming season!

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Meek
recent_reviews.text:
What a great way to support a local family run farm and spend a good few hours with the kids!

The staff are fantastic and helpful, the maize maze is a good head scratcher (as it should be!) And who doesnâ€™t love a barrel ride!
There is great sand pit and combine climbing frame.

I understand money is tight however I feel that other reviews are tarnishing a very well organised family run business!

There are good facilities with plenty of bins.

This is our second year visiting The Pulham Patch and canâ€™t wait to visit in the autumn to pick pumpkins too!

If youâ€™re in the area, Iâ€™d definitely recommend stopping by!

recent_reviews.author: Amy Downes
recent_reviews.text: We had a great day out at the Pulham Patch. Friendly staff and plenty of activities for my three year old. We really enjoyed the barrel train ride and mini ride on tractors. We will return!

pumpkin_patches.address: The Pulham Patch, Wood Ln, Diss IP21 4XU

recent_reviews.author: Selina Grazia
recent_reviews.text:
What an absolutely lovely pumpkin patch. The owners were the loveliest, really helpful and welcoming. We got two wheelbarrows full of pumpkins, huge ones bigger than beachballs, eating pumpkins and tiny decorative ones. We also had iced coffees and fresh pizzas, plus there's drawing and activities for kids.
The best pumpkin patch I've been to, and Halloween makes up at least 60% of my personality so I take this very seriously. We will definitely be back for more before Halloween.

recent_reviews.author: Penelope Hadingham
recent_reviews.text: My friend and I visited pumpkin barn yesterday, we had 5 children between us of all ages and we all had an absolutely brilliant day! We sheltered indoors while it rained, the children had a fantastic time playing in the wheat pit and bowling, we then headed out and picked a variety of pumpkins, very reasonably priced and a great selection, including some huge ones! We finished our day with pizza which was delicious. Thank you for a great day, we will be back next year!

recent_reviews.author: ColetteS
recent_reviews.text: We had the best time ever at the pumpkin patch this week. So much for children to do. My grandson had the best time ever and didn't want to go home. The ever attentive owners made sure the activities were always tidy and topped up. The spooky halloween trail was so good.. amazing actually and my grandson was enthralled. The food available was affordable. Just a great day. Thank you so much. We'll definitely cone back next year x

recent_reviews.author: Mike Thorne
recent_reviews.text: We had a great time today at pumpkin barn, my kids could have stayed all day. Great activities, food and pumpkins definitely worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Eglantine
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic visit again today! Such lovely fruit, all top quality. Picked 4 kilos of damsons and made delicious jam, flavour unbeatable.
Always a good experience here. Looking forward to the apples and pears next time.

recent_reviews.author: Michelle ST
recent_reviews.text: great PYO experience, staff are real friendly and knowledgable too. Strawberries were super sweet and delicious.

recent_reviews.author: Titin Setyorini (Titin Setyorini)
recent_reviews.text: The only downside is the puddling parking area. We went picking some strawberries and raspberries it! But it was at the end of the strawberry harvest time so it was not the best quality. But we especially my 3yo loved it! We couldn't stand eating what we just picked at the spot ğŸ˜‚ many beautiful flowers. Some are just Â£1 or 50p. It has beautiful teak furniture stall. Bring wellies in case it's muddy. The staf are friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Denton
recent_reviews.text: Great plant nursery, good range of plants. Nice farm shop and PYO fruit in the summer! Amazing tasting strawberries!ğŸ¤©

pumpkin_patches.address: Mill Lane, Thorpe- Next- Haddiscoe, Norwich NR14 6PA

recent_reviews.author: Calycious_Loves (Carolyne)
recent_reviews.text:
GREAT FIND
We were in Norwich for a wedding at the weekend and decided to find a farm shop on our way back.
I don't regret it. The raw milk is amazing- it says on the bottle its too good and addictive- I AGREE.
Try the jersey ice cream- its very light yet delicious.
Find all local produce there.
They have goats to look at if you come with the family. And loads of space to walk around.
If you go in the morning, you can watch them milking the cows.

*free parking available
*you can dine there as well.

recent_reviews.author: Chelsey Chick
