recent_reviews.text: We visited today for the 1 hour highland cow cuddling experience. I simply cannot recommend enough! The experience itself was absolutely amazing and one Iâ€™ll never forget. The young girl (so sorry I didnâ€™t get your name) was super friendly, knowledgeable and fantastic at her job! All of the staff here are so lovely. The cafe food & drinks are exceptional and we will certainly be back! It was super busy- so ensure you book! Thank you so much!!

recent_reviews.author: Millie Fuller
recent_reviews.text:
Took my mum for a surprise cow experience!
Got in one to one with the cows for an hour, brushing and stoking them and being told about them all! All the calves were so cute and have names on! All the animals look very well! So lovely to see a Calf at Food Dairy running so local! Had coffee in the shop after, they had forgot our booking despite an email confirmation and the service was abit slow, it took just under an hour for a coffee and scone each to arrive, but the food was lovely and staff friendly. Shop was filled was amazing goodies at su ha good price for a farm shop! Came away with Jersey Milk as it felt right after being with all the cows in the morning! Highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Katrina
recent_reviews.text: A great selection of locally grown and sourced products. Excellent meat counter, highly recommend their sausages - especially the sweet chilli. Large cafe with ample seating and the bonus of goats and peacocks on the grounds! A great place to visit for an hour or two.

recent_reviews.author: Spencer Swinston
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic chips! Best fries from the most ethically sourced potatoes. What a farm, 10/10 would work there

recent_reviews.author: Alex araez tena
recent_reviews.text: Eating your potatoes in a five guys. Valencia, Spain. So good!ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Pilar Conejero
recent_reviews.text: Potatoes from Spain Bro

recent_reviews.author: rebecca bryant
recent_reviews.text: 5 stars from us at stanleys castle adventures, a great venue for many events, like barn style weddings, lots of space, nice area.

recent_reviews.author: Renee Karunungan
recent_reviews.text: We went to Ha Ha farm to pick some pumpkins. There were a lot of people when we came and it's good to know they are very kid and dog friendly. They have wheel barrows for children and adult. They have huge fields of pumpkins and many varieties to choose from. After the pumpkin picking their were food trucks available and a live band was playing too. There were activities for children like face painting and crafts. Good fun!

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Louise
recent_reviews.text:
My friend suggested visiting here. I checked the website which is very modern and clear.
We went to HaHa field in Blofield. You can find it using sat nav but no signs if not using.
The cutest place to visit.
Free parking.
Dog friendly.
Pick your own sunflowers or pumpkins (depending on season). Reasonable prices for PYO.
Wrapping included.
Portaloos outside but a bit of walk from car park.
Dog bowls and snacks available.
Plenty of seating on hale bales and benches.
A food stall. Cakes Â£3 and drinks from Â£3.

recent_reviews.author: auty florence
recent_reviews.text: i came here with my friends to go pumpkin picking at halloween and it was such a fun time! we went quite late in the season so whilst there werenâ€™t many pumpkins left, we still managed to find some good ones! there was a little coffee / drinks shack at the back of the farm serving a variety of drinks, including offering oat milk which made us happy as not many rural / independent places do that. they also sold adorable jewellery at the front desk where you paid for your pumpkins which iâ€™m sad i forgot to buy. overall a very well run pumpkin patch, good fun for people of all ages, and canâ€™t wait to come back next year ğŸ˜ŒğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Glenn Morgan
recent_reviews.text: Found ourselves on a loose end and happened to be driving by, we played a round of mini golf, it was okay, but expensive for what it is, 9 pretty basic holes. But it was enjoyable, got through it pretty quickly though, but itâ€™s laid out really nicely and very well kept. Afterwards we played a few of the other games, nice and old school! The girl at the checkout was really nice and friendly, and we got some local ice cream and a drink to end off.

recent_reviews.author: Clare Gittins
recent_reviews.text:
We had such a fun time at the maze and mini golf site! The maze was cleverly designedâ€”challenging enough to keep us guessing, but not so hard that it wasnâ€™t enjoyable.
The mini golf course was creative and well-maintained which kept everyone entertained. The staff were friendly and welcoming, and the whole place was clean and family-friendly. A perfect spot for a day out - Weâ€™ll definitely be coming back!

recent_reviews.author: Treena Ryall
recent_reviews.text:
We had a really brilliant time at this maize maze.

My children are teenagers and we have been to lots of different maize mazes and this one was great value, fabulous maze with some other things to do too. Ice cream was local and very tasty and we all lived the mini golf. Owner was very helpful and friendly too. Fab activity for families.

recent_reviews.author: Viper !!!!
recent_reviews.text: This was our second visit to The Pumpkin House ! We visited last year whilst seeing family in Norfolk and after seeing the addition of Mini Golf we decided that despite the fact the maze wasnâ€™t open yet we still needed to come along and give it a go. The gentleman we met was so friendly and helpful and the coffee tasted amazing !   The children and I  played golf followed by welly wanging, tin can alley and hoopla. We couldnâ€™t believe that all of this was included in the price of our ticket.    100% recommend this place and we look forward to trying out the maize maze next year

recent_reviews.author: Sigrid VC
recent_reviews.text: Been here for October half term for the last 3 years and my daughter absolutely loves it. We pick some pumpkins and then do the stamp trail and she likes finding all the hidden things to do. Was quite busy today lots of cars and people waiting to get in so Iâ€™d suggest going early. We got a wheelbarrow full of pumpkins for Â£21! Lovely family day out that doesnâ€™t cost too much.

recent_reviews.author: Jessykar Hutton
recent_reviews.text: A great little farm hidden away. Plenty of space to park, loads of Pumpkins and a lovely stamp trail for the kids. Plenty of pumpkins to choose from and great prices too. My son especially enjoyed having his own little wheelbarrow. Thank you for your warm welcome and friendly staff. Definitely be back next year.

recent_reviews.author: Julia Pokora
recent_reviews.text: Second year coming now and always enjoy it. Pumpkins are a little more expensive than supermarket but at least you are supporting a local farm and are all organic and home grown, while also getting a fun afternoon out. Plenty of parking space too and friendly staff. Ate all of my pumpkins after carving too and they were yummy

recent_reviews.author: Daisy Blowers
recent_reviews.text:
We had a very fun experience picking our own pumpkins! Very good for kids as well with the free stamp trail and games
A brilliant Halloween day out for all ages and good value for money too - with the added plus of supporting a local family run business!

recent_reviews.author: jade lapsley
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely place for a trip out. We spent 4.5 hours here doing the Minecraft maze; smaller tractor maze, playing in the sandpit and on the giant stick and hay bales. The staff were so friendly. It is a small area which was great for me due to my disability, also all flat so wheelchair and pram friendly. Car park is right by the entrance so we left our lunch in the car until we were hungry. Cost us Â£15 for 1 adult and 2 kids. I assume 2 year old are free due to the cost we paid. The sunflowers are absolutely gorgeous!
Refreshments available, including water bowls for dogs on leads.

recent_reviews.author: Capricorn 11
recent_reviews.text: We had a nice time here. We paid Â£25 for a family ticket (4). The kids loved the Minecraft maze. Definitely take wellies with you as it gets muddy.

recent_reviews.author: Steve Blackman-Cross
recent_reviews.text:
Great evening event - Sundowner. Sunflowers in abundance. Well organised function, good pizzas, mobile drinks bar, nice live music, well laid out for children.
A maze through the sunflowers & the weather was perfect too.
Recommend & will be returning next year ğŸ‘.

recent_reviews.author: Jenette Kingsbury
recent_reviews.text:
We were greeted with enthusiasm and friendliness. Paid our entry and given instructions about the sunflower maze.
Stickers not available for the Minecraft maze but it didn't bother the children as they had no idea what that was !
Coffee machine wasn't operational at that time but was working later. I didn't enjoy the cappuccino and neither did my friend.
I would say that Â£25 for a family ticket is top end but on a good day you could spend from opening time until mid afternoon here.
Plenty of picnic benches available and as we took a picnic it worked well. Car park is close so you can collect picnic bags easily without having to carry them with you.
Sandpit was a definite hit ğŸ˜
I'd definitely return - the children really liked it and I was happy with being able to watch them both from a picnic bench - children aged 9 & 6 years

pumpkin_patches.place_name: The Pumpkin Patch Cookery & Gardening School @ Y Sied

recent_reviews.author: Lynda Anderson
recent_reviews.text:
First time at Pumpkin Patch yesterday, fabulous people excellent food.
Took part in a sewing workshop, we were made so welcome. Thank you.

recent_reviews.author: Linda Moore
recent_reviews.text: Lisa is a fantastic cook, her children's cookery school is a great way to get children cooking and to introduce them to new flavours.

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Evans
recent_reviews.text: We attend every month and enjoy ever time! Diolch Lisa x

pumpkin_patches.address: Y Sied, Allt y GÃ´g Farm Abergorlech Rd, A40, White Mill, Carmarthen SA32 7AY

recent_reviews.author: Meredith Ambrey
recent_reviews.text: An inspiring project. This is exactly the sort of three should be doing much more of. The benefit this offers to people is beyond measure. There is not only great work in the community, but a sustainable example of our heritage species of both plants and livestock.

recent_reviews.author: Emma Charles
recent_reviews.text: Lovely local farm, friendly atmosphere,  shame it's not bigger with more animals.

recent_reviews.author: Karen Evans
recent_reviews.text: What a fantastic experience we have had today at the farm. The Easter day here was amazing from start to finish despite the awful weather. Everything was undercover or inside and the staff here were very helpful, friendly and fun. The animals are just great and so, are the other things around the farm such as messy play, swings and vegetables being grown. It felt as if we were out in the countryside and I can't wait to visit again. The Cafe was absolutely beautiful and my Grandson loved playing with the toys there. A lot of lovely touches around the farm and very well thought out. What an amazing team that make the place magical...thankyou all for such a lovely day! ğŸ¥°

recent_reviews.author: Ray Verlaque
recent_reviews.text: The entrance fee was a donation. Although it was raining the day we went there, the staff were willing to show us around. We fed the pigs with apples collected from the farm. At the end of the day the animals were marched into the designated shelters for the night. Fun to watch.

pumpkin_patches.address: 2 Pontardulais Rd, Cadle, Fforest-fach, Swansea SA5 4BA

recent_reviews.author: Carla Benjamin
recent_reviews.text: Stunning experience, from start to finish, as we arrived there was someone to greet us and tell us where to go to parking the car and someone helping us find a space to the lovely chatty ladies at the hut. The Easter trail was fun and the tulips beautiful, best part is you can pick them with the bulb. Saw the reindeer/piglets and lambs, adorable and then to top that all off coffee/hotchocolates all round with a foam party!

recent_reviews.author: Kathryn Sillman
recent_reviews.text: We had a wonderful time here. The staff were amazing. The lights were lovely, and the toilets halfway through were great for our grandson. At the end of the walk, our grandson went on the funfair, and we had a well-deserved sit-down with lovely hot chocolate with cream and marshmallows; our grandson had strawberries and warm melted chocolate, which he really enjoyed. Well worth the money. Can't wait to come again.

recent_reviews.author: WINK
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely worth the drive! The kids had an amazing time, and we felt it was a safe, welcoming spot for toddlers and babies. Weâ€™d love to come back again soonâ€”highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Molly Eyers
recent_reviews.text: Overall, I had an okay time and managed to get a few lovely photos, but our experience was a bit dampened by essentially being told off. We are aware of the signs not to walk on the lavender - whatâ€™s not clear by this is that you can apparently only walk up 2 wide paths through the patch. My friend and I were taking some photos amongst the lavender on the narrow walk ways between, being very respectful and careful not to walk on the lavender. We were inspired by the photos shared on Facebook publicising the fields, and were disappointed when staff told us to move  so we werenâ€™t able to continue taking some lovely photos. What made this even more sour was that there were many other people doing what we were, the staff saw this but did not ask them to move. So if youâ€™re inspired by the photos used to advertise the lavender field, then you may be disappointed and told off if you try to do this.

pumpkin_patches.address: Poundffald Farm, Three Crosses, Swansea SA4 3PB

recent_reviews.author: Reddy Mog
recent_reviews.text:
I have been meaning to come year over the past few years and so glad I did this year.  Parking was easy and the staff were absolutely lovely.   I have never seen so many strawberries in my life and that was with only 2 of the Tunnels open.  The fruit was in abundance and some of the biggest I'd ever seen.
I also purchased a pot of their homemade jam and had the most delicious lemon cake.
There are tables provided outside and beautiful fields of wild flowers.
When I got home and ate the strawberries, every single one was the sweetest and juiciest I'd ever tasted.  Even my father enjoyed them and he's not a huge fan of them.
The jam was also so tasty and I have had it on my toast every morning since purchased.
I will be definitely returning and they also have raspberries and later in the season,  Runner beans and Broad beans.

recent_reviews.author: Swarna Jay
recent_reviews.text: Had a great time picking yummy strawberries and raspberries. There's a small play area for kids,  a cafe and a clean toilet. There's few patches of wildflowers and few benches where you can sit and spend a couple of hours looking at the nice scenery.

recent_reviews.author: Shalini K V
recent_reviews.text: Ample amount parking available as you enter. You need to weigh your basket if you have carried or else you can buy a plastic box before entering the field. Entry is free. You can see the field but if you pick the strawberry you need pay accordingly. Its 7.75pounds per kg. Raspberry is available. But when we went it was all dried. There is a tent like seating arrangements done where we can have our strawberry. Even of it rains we are covered. There is an outdoor seating area as well. One large easy chair to sit and click pics. Not easy enough to get up once we sit. A portable toilet available which is neat and clean. A cafe where we can buy ice cream, tea, coffee and some snack. Staffs are friendly. Nice place to spend half day with kids. There is a garden area with many colorful flowers. Good view.

recent_reviews.author: Emily Matthews
recent_reviews.text: Enjoyed being able to walk around and pick our own strawberries. Getting the kids involved too, they had a great time. The little cafe has a good selection of drinks and cakes for afterwards

recent_reviews.author: Richard Saunders
recent_reviews.text:
Would have had a 5 star but the prices are CRAZY.  Â£8 a burger, Â£7 for kids face paint and Â£a large pumpkin!
Good choice of attractions there though, roasting marshmallows, plenty of places to have pcs.

recent_reviews.author: Rhian Davies
recent_reviews.text: We go every year and it's brillant. Very helpful staff and a fun time with kids. pumpkins start from Â£1.50 to Â£25. Face painting range from Â£5 to Â£10. We all enjoyed and looking forward to going again soon. ğŸƒğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Alex Peterson
recent_reviews.text:
I recently visited the pumpkin patch and had a mixed experience. The field itself was enjoyable and offered a great selection. We picked out 7 pumpkins priced at Â£1.50 each and 2 pumpkins at Â£2.50 each. However, when we went to pay, the attendant charged us Â£19.50. I initially questioned the total, but he insisted it was correct, even though he acknowledged the individual prices.

Not wanting to make a fuss, I assumed I might have miscalculated. After leaving, I added it up and realised the total should have been Â£15.50. When I returned to the entrance to address the issue, the staff were unhelpful and dismissed my concern, saying the attendant has been doing this for four yearsâ€”as if that meant he couldn't possibly make a mistake.

While the outing was enjoyable, the overcharge and the dismissive attitude of the staff left a sour taste.

recent_reviews.author: Daisy Hogarth
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely place! Plenty of pumpkins, nice food and the children loved the animals :)

pumpkin_patches.address: Ty Coch Farm, Mount Pleasant Rd, Porthcawl CF33 4RR

recent_reviews.author: Ryan Callaghan
recent_reviews.text:
This is a great place to visit for your pumpkin picking experience! We enjoyed a wonderful few hours here with friends and family.

Parking was easy, the queue to get in with our car wasn't long at all. All of the staff we met were very friendly and helpful. Everyone seemed happy to be there which is such a rare thing to come across these days! The staff who were dressed up as characters were brilliant with the children. Our daughter's loved meeting the witches especially!

The pumpkin selection is vast and they're nicely spread about so you're not all on top of each other to find the best ones. As you walk round, there are plenty of photo opportunity points. This is also good, so you're not standing in extremely long queues waiting to take photos.

The biggest surprise we had was the price at the end, genuinely very reasonable! We have been to a few different pumpkin picking places and so far the pumpkins here have been the cheapest. We did attend an early bird session, so this may have been the reason the pumpkins were cheaper but even so, it was worth it. The ticket price was also very reasonable.

Overall, I'd recommend coming here. The kids will love it!

recent_reviews.author: Mitch
recent_reviews.text:
A great day out for everyone and surprisingly good value. Family ticket was Â£12 for everyone and pumpkins are great prices too.

There's loads of things to do on site as well, much of it for free. Multiple food stalls are available, favourite one was the Viking Coffee Hut. There's also pumpkin and fairy actors around and loads of photo ops.

The pumpkin field is well laid out as well and with some great varieties of pumpkins, blue and green ones were favourites.

Only thing I'd change is to have more seating at food area, the food stalls were so popular that there weren't many available even at 15:30.

Amazing day and look forward to going next year!

recent_reviews.author: Cheryl Huxley
recent_reviews.text:
Really glad we chose to visit Hurleys and not one of the other local options. It was set up really well, plenty of photo opportunities which is exactly what we wanted, and of course lots of pumpkins to choose from.

We had a really lovely time, would definitely recommend. We'll be back next year!

recent_reviews.author: AirÄ— Illek
recent_reviews.text:
Well organised. Loved the music, layout, activities for kids, all outfits of staff. Kids and toddler busy and lot of nice, very good price pumpkins for adults. Coffee and snacks on site too.
Just make sure you have right shoes. Very muddy.

recent_reviews.author: Ryan Callaghan
recent_reviews.text:
We have come here for the past few years and the previous 2 times it's been great. However this year, it was definitely not as good.

The pumpkins are pretty overpriced compared to other pumpkin picking places.

There were no characters or people dressed up when we visited.

Only 2 food vendors available and they were pretty pricey.

No activities for the kids, e.g. face painting, rides etc. I'm not saying these things are always there normally, just in comparison to other venues.

One good thing is there are plenty of photo opportunity points so you grab some good photos for memories but it seems to be missing more involvement for the kids. Perhaps we went on a day where the characters were not there but there was no warning when we booked the tickets regarding this.

One bad thing is the car park for the actual pumpkin village. So many pot holes which encourages massive puddles. I get most people arrive and have their wellies packed, but parking becomes a problem because nobody wants to park where the puddles are, so they don't have to struggle getting in and out of their cars.

I did see the maintenance team addressing problems with the pathway and the muddy sections inside the pumpkin village which was good.

I would still recommend coming here, the kids still enjoyed it but it just has been better for us previously.

recent_reviews.author: Vicki
recent_reviews.text: Amazing set ups, so autumnal and great layout and perfect for photo opportunities, took our 3 month old baby there and was ideal to get photos as it wasnâ€™t muddy like a pumpkin patch usually is however we picked up 3 tiny pumpkins (one that is the size of my babyâ€™s hand), got to the till and they came to Â£15?!! Really overpriced as they would be Â£1.50 at any other pumpkin patch or supermarket, so glad we didnâ€™t pick up any bigger ones, as just these little 3 are really over priced. I believe they import them in which is why they are over priced but something needs to be done to make them cheaper, especially tiny ones. Great there is dog friendly slots, we went on a weekday morning so it was so quiet, and its cheap to get in luckily, thereâ€™s gravel paths so not too bad for prams

recent_reviews.author: Georgina Bone
recent_reviews.text:
Myself and my 3 year old, came to the pumpkin village for the first time today and we LOVED it! The layout is brilliant and amazing. So many spots for great photo opportunities. They also do dog friendly sessions, so was an added bonus seeing so many dressed up pooches.

The price for us two was great and was only Â£8. I would say the pumpkins are a little pricey but they're worth it as there are so many, of many sizes.

Plenty of seating and places to get food and drinks.

recent_reviews.author: Rob Is
recent_reviews.text: Hi back again and this time we gonout with family to this place calling pumpkin picking village  . Just pick roundom place come to have some good time and don't be at home . We came to this beautiful place and on entrance they ask us to pay for entrance ok  we pay for entrance 6.99Â£ per person and soon we go out of then to pumpkin village was hundreds  of pumpkin have some seats burger van and facilities.  Some attractions for this place show in pictures below . But guess  what pumpkin prices very very small I mean smallest  one from 5Â£  yes 5Â£ lot of nice pumpkin  you can pick any you like it and on exit you will pay for what you will picked.  Most expensive  pumpkin  is 80Â£  yes that right  80Â£ for pumpkin  I don't know but is not fit to my head 80Â£ for pumpkin  must be from queen's  garden with gold plated skin but no . This is  where story ends we spend about 30 min in this place walk around picked few small pumpkin pay at checkout  15 Â£ for 3 small pumpkin and let it go  then when we comeback near home we come to our local shop and guess what same pumpkin  we buy for 15Â£ we found in our local show for 1Â£ each this is why businesses  owners  should shame to robbing  people  in middle of day i know businessesis struggling earn money but if local shop can sell for 1Â£ you can to . Sorry but  greedy people  shouldn't have any businesses  that why I wouldn't recommend  to come this place and stay away us far you can if you want save some  go somewhere else but not here . Thanks for everyone who reads  my reviews  hope this will helps you .

recent_reviews.author: Lindsey Barrington
recent_reviews.text: Myself, my husband and our three children went to this farm yesterday, and we had the best day. This is a family run, and very friendly working farm, with plenty of pumpkins to choose from. We spent ages choosing our pumpkins in the field, then did the Woodland walk, and finished off with a lovely hot chocolate at the refreshment tent. We got to meet the owners and their children, who were so polite and well mannered. We took home four giant pumpkins, and four smaller different varieties for Â£20, so it was very reasonably priced and far more personal than shop purchased. We all got completely covered in mud, and that just made it even more fun in my opinion. Wear sensible shoes, expect to get dirty as you are on a field open to the elements, and you will not be disappointed. We will definitely be back again next year!! ğŸ˜ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: charlie Dool
recent_reviews.text: Large pumpkin patch where you can pick your own pumpkins and take a large wheelbarrow around. There are some scarecrows and a separate scary woodland trail. Overall very good experience. You will Wellington boots as it's very muddy and I wouldn't recommend you take a pram but carry your baby in a Bjorn.

recent_reviews.author: Jade Moran
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely fantastic. I spent my birthday here with my nephews, couldn't of wished for more. The pumpkins were priced just right and did not rip us off like some places.
Very well done. Thank you

recent_reviews.author: Blue Kiwi
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic day out with my beautiful lady and the kids. Lots of different ones to choose from and the kids loved the woodland walk. We got 2 medium ones and about 10 small ones, came to a total of Â£8. We thought we would be paying more than Â£30. Hopefully we will be back next year with more.

recent_reviews.author: Sophie Kelly
recent_reviews.text: Our new favourite pumpkin patch! Having been to other local patches this is certainly the best and value for money. Itâ€™s not overcrowded and so much choice of different sizes, shapes and colours of pumpkins and all for a reasonable price. The tractor ride is also great for little ones. Will certainly be back next year.

recent_reviews.author: 01Marnie
recent_reviews.text: This has now become our annual pumpkin picking place. It's amazing, free to get in and prices are really reasonable. Food and drink is available from the catering vans and there are tractor/trailer rides. There's a little shed selling halloween gifts. So friendly and welcoming. Definitely better than the place we used to use.

recent_reviews.author: Mel Starkey
recent_reviews.text: Best time at beech house farm pumpkin picking. Our first time pumpkin picking and it was truly wonderful. Lovely food and drink vans with artisan hot chocolate and pull pork baps. The tractor ride was so lovely! Free to go round lots of games for the kids and pumpkins reasonably priced!

recent_reviews.author: Sarah
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place and staff very welcoming. Reasonably priced pumpkins. Dogs welcome. Definitely visit again

pumpkin_patches.address: Beech House Farm, Seisdon, Wolverhampton WV5 7EP

recent_reviews.author: Emel Sabri
recent_reviews.text: Love every bit about it. Butchers - excellent. High-quality grass-fed beef. Local honeys. Beautiful atmosphere. I'm sooooo happy they are close to me.

recent_reviews.author: Abdul Hafeez Qureshi
recent_reviews.text:
A hidden gem in Aldridge WS9 0QN:

Beacon Farm is a delightful spot that offers a genuine taste of the countryside. Their farm shop boasts a fantastic selection of fresh, locally-sourced produce, including organic fruits and vegetables that are both vibrant and full of flavour. The atmosphere evokes the charm of a traditional village setting, making each visit a refreshing escape from the hustle and bustle. The staff are incredibly friendly and always willing to assist, enhancing the overall experience. It's heartening to support a local business that prioritizes quality and community.

recent_reviews.author: Emily Truman
recent_reviews.text: Brought meat (sausages, chicken wings & lamb burgers) Friday afternoon. Saturday morning we had the sausage and no issues however when we came to marinate our chicken wings that same afternoon they had already gone off - the smell was rancid and unmistakable for gone off chicken. We then decided to check the burgers to be on the safe side to find these was also off. Will definitely not be returning which is a shame as was reasonably priced.

recent_reviews.author: craig hickman
recent_reviews.text: Good produce & friendly staff, the quality is much better thank your big chain supermarkets. I would also suggest the onsite butchers who are also very helpful with amazing quality meats.

pumpkin_patches.address: Shop Access, Beacon Rd, Aldridge, Walsall WS9 0QN

recent_reviews.author: Chelle Knight
recent_reviews.text: Amazing place, I love seeing what's on offer and talking to like-minded people there.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Sopley Farm Shop & Bakery - Dan Tanner's

recent_reviews.author: Gemeheme
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful,  huge space , to go with your family and have little walk around and pick your own fruits. What a lovely idea. Strawberries has been so juicy and sweet ! You won't get that in aby shop ! Love it

recent_reviews.author: Daniel Read
recent_reviews.text: My wife and I had the pleasure of visiting the farm to pick some fruit. The farm itself is lovely, spacious and the staff are friendly. Also, the quality of the fruit we bought was excellent. It saddens me, however, to see many visitors simply gorging on the fruit they pick, without any intention of paying for it. I sincerely hope the farm can tighten things up in this regard. Well worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Michael Pascoe
recent_reviews.text:
Unbelievable! A mini slice of heaven.
Fresh, home made cakes, pasties, etc. Variety of traditional and modern flavours.
Coffee shop as well. Lots of seating, inside and out.
Farmers shop adjacent.

recent_reviews.author: Josh Jennings
recent_reviews.text:
WE WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK !! ğŸ¥°

Spent the past week camping here and thoroughly enjoyed our stay , staff were friendly and welcoming, the self pick was great with a wide range of options, the shop and bakery were fantastic with a great selection of local and fresh produce.

Especially impressed with a stock of venison ğŸ˜‹

Thank you for making our trip so easy and enjoyable.

recent_reviews.author: Ellie Jones
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful little farm shop and POY, we picked sunflowers and gladioli today, had great fun and the dragon fruit juice from the cafe was lovely!

recent_reviews.author: chloe hana
recent_reviews.text:
There are always sooo many pumpkins here !
Lots of space to park so no need to worry about where to park!
A whole range of pumpkins to choose from , lots of different sizes and colours
There is a hose to wash down your pumpkins if its really muddy
Delicious coffee and hot chocolate at the cutest little cafe
Great for kids and families!

recent_reviews.author: Fatima A
recent_reviews.text:
I thoroughly enjoyed my visit at the Cat & Fiddle Farm & CafÃ©.
I started my visit with a nice hot chocolate with a delicious piece of cake. Then I went to pick my own sunflowers.
I bought some blackcurrant for home.
The staff were very friendly, welcoming and helpful.
It was a really pleasant visit and I will go back again very soon.

recent_reviews.author: Milad Jokari
recent_reviews.text:
A charming countryside gem! The Cat & Fiddle Farm & CafÃ© is the perfect place to relax and enjoy delicious, freshly prepared food while surrounded by nature. The staff are warm, welcoming, and genuinely attentive, making you feel right at home. The cafÃ©â€™s menu offers hearty portions with plenty of flavour, and the cakes are simply irresistible.

The farm animals are a delight to see especially for families and the overall atmosphere is peaceful and inviting. Whether youâ€™re stopping by for breakfast, lunch, or just a coffee and cake, this place is worth every visit. Highly recommended for anyone who loves great food in a beautiful rural setting!

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Fordingbridge Maize Maze and Sunflower Picking Patch

recent_reviews.author: Michael Privett
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely time spent with the family. There was a great range of sunflowers available to pick. It wasnâ€™t too busy and the coffee truck on site served me a beautifully made latte. Highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Chloe Birks
recent_reviews.text: A wonderful place to visit with many beautiful sunflowers to pick without too far to walk but enough space for it not to feel crowded. The owners were around and very kind and generous plus there were heaps of additional activities for kids and adults to enjoy. We loved our visit so much and will definitely come back next year!

recent_reviews.author: Marcela Soto Solano
recent_reviews.text: I loved it there! Perfect place to pick up some sunflower and also to play around with kids! My son enjoyed it so much, the bubbles, the swing,  the different figures or play areas. The price is good too!!! I absolutely recommend it.

recent_reviews.author: David James Clark
recent_reviews.text:
Really lovely experience, all the staff were very lovely and welcoming.

A great place to bring young children to have fun and explore. Many fun activities and crafts to do. The maize maze was good fun.

pumpkin_patches.address: A338 Ringwood Rd, Bickton, Fordingbridge SP6 2HA

recent_reviews.author: Elaine Barrow
recent_reviews.text:
Thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the New Forest Pumpkin Patch. A well laid out area with plenty of pumpkins to choose from as well as lots of fun activities. The staff were very friendly.

We loved the pumpkin catapult.

Having chatted to the owner and listened to his enthusiasm for this venture and future events we will return.

recent_reviews.author: Harry Martin
recent_reviews.text:
Such a lovely family day out!
Very friendly staff, they are super helpful!

Food is really tasty! And very good prices
Ice coffee is really yummy ğŸ¤¤

Overall a lovely place ğŸ«¶ğŸ½

recent_reviews.author: Chanelle Kang
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely loved visiting the patch! Lots of activities for the whole family and great selection of pumpkins. Love that you can carve the pumpkin there and save all the mess at home! Will definitely go back.

recent_reviews.author: Emm Hopkins
recent_reviews.text: Great set up! Perfect for an afternoon out with fun activities and a range of pumpkins to purchase. Absolutely loved the biscoff waffle!!

recent_reviews.author: Richard Slater
recent_reviews.text: Take your wellies and woolly hats and PYO pumpkins. Last year, there was an amazing choice. This year less so, but we were visiting later. Support a local business, not Tesco!

recent_reviews.author: Sarah
recent_reviews.text: Lovely staff. Good atmosphere, there was a cool fake spider decoration in the pumpkin patch area, also a lovely decorated chair with pumpkins to take photos with. You can tell there's been a lot of effort made and it shows. Would definitely go back highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Louise Allen
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic place. Great variety of free activities for young kids, some additional fee ones but fairly priced. Nice cafe , good selection of food and yummy treats. Friendly owners. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend to anyone.  Visited twice this year already, coming a little distance as soo good.  And Free to get in. Which is excellent given all they have to offer.

recent_reviews.author: cicizoomer
recent_reviews.text: My little boy had the BEST time at this patch last year and is so excited to go again this year. Such an amazing variety of pumpkins, wonderful craft activities and very lovely staff. Absolutely everything you could hope for from a pumpkin patch including heaps of parking. So excited to return this year.

pumpkin_patches.address: A338 Ringwood Rd, Slip Road, Fordingbridge SP6 2ET

recent_reviews.author: Steve Stacey
recent_reviews.text:
This has been the best pumkinp farm my Granddaughter has had so much fun  at.
Young lams to toach and the carfs also old tractor for the children to sit and have those photos off. And that be fore you get to a  wonderful layout of Halloween theam around the pumpkin ğŸƒ  field. So kids ğŸ§’ go have so fun next year my Granddaughter will be returning. So from Grandad well done to the family of the farm .

recent_reviews.author: claire griffin
recent_reviews.text: More then a little fun. Kids enjoyed it even more with the mud lol stuff friendly and calfâ€™s and lambs super cute .thank you Xx.even the pup had fun.

recent_reviews.author: Neill Wilson
recent_reviews.text: Had a great time choosing pumpkins to take home to carve. Daughter enjoyed the hay sculptures and farm animal petting

recent_reviews.author: MJ C
recent_reviews.text: Staff are extremely welcoming and friendly. No fee to park or enter. The field with the pumpkins is up hill but they provide transport to and fro if needed. Ideal for us with a 10 week old. It's muddy so definitely take wellies and avoid pushchair use and have fun. The displays made from hay bails are fab and the atmosphere great as everyone's getting nice pics. There's little wagons to carry the pumpkins in or use as a photo prop and even new born lambs and calf's. Pumpkins like most this year are smaller than usual but this isn't off-putting due to everything else being so good, the experience is whats counts. We're gonna make this family tradition from now on.

recent_reviews.author: Stanzey Rivon Deniz
recent_reviews.text:
Lotmead is a fantastic pick-your-own farm just outside Swindon, offering a delightful day out for families and friends. While famous for its strawberries, the farm also offers a variety of other seasonal fruits and vegetables, so it's worth checking their social media for the latest crop updates.
â€‹More than just picking, the farm features a play area, a small animal enclosure with goats and alpacas, and a farm shop and cafÃ© selling local produce and treats. A standout feature is the Strawberry Thief Trail, a fun, themed walk through the fields that keeps kids entertained while you're picking. It's a charming, family-friendly destination that provides a great break from city life, where you only pay for what you pick

recent_reviews.author: pam kwai
recent_reviews.text:
7.95/kg for strawberries.ğŸ“
Picked in mid July. Sizes of strawberries in range of small to medium. Taste is good for those ripen. Staff are friendly. Free parking for pick your own Farm park requires entry fee. Field open for picking is not big. But still good to pick for fun.

recent_reviews.author: J & T Rutherford
recent_reviews.text: We had an absolutely fantastic morning out with our toddler and some friends here. Super cheap to do the pick-your-own, and the price of the strawberries was very reasonable too (although they should have probably weighed the kids before and after too ğŸ˜…). Thereâ€™s also a great playground and obstacle course for after picking, and tables if you want to make a picnic of it.

recent_reviews.author: Dmytro Maliuk
recent_reviews.text: Nice and clean farm with plenty of strawberries and friendly animals like goats, rabbits, llamas, and even turkeys. Great place for kids and families to spend time outdoors.

recent_reviews.author: Ellen Chapman
recent_reviews.text: This was such a beautiful day out! All the activities were great and the play equipment was high quality, not at all run down. We treated ourselves to lunch there too and the food was delicious. All the staff there were really friendly and seemed to be enjoying their work which gave such a lovely feel to the day. The mazes were great and so different and we loved the sculptures and flower fields. This was my first time and I loved it but my Mum and girls have visited three years running and still can't wait to come again!

recent_reviews.author: Rebekah Willoughby
recent_reviews.text: What a great day out with the kids. So many activities to do and it's great for all kids, I took a 6 and 10yr old and they both thoroughly enjoyed their day. With mazes galore and so many other activities and walking around the flowers with their animal sculptures on display i really enjoyed myself too.

recent_reviews.author: April Morris
recent_reviews.text: Took my grandson age 6 for a day out on 08 Aug and have to say neither of us were disappointed. There is so much for children to enjoy, he loved the musical maze, have to confess so did I. He loves sunflowers and was just as excited to wander through the sunflowers and choose some to take home. We were there all day, highly recommended and will definitely be back.

recent_reviews.author: erica Davies
recent_reviews.text:
I won a family ticket on fb, I Love MK day.
My daughter and her family came to visit, so I purchased an extra ticket for me. It was a great day, the maizes and attractions within them are amazing.
I couldn't do the vortex, but both my grandchildren loved it. .... I backed out pretty quickly!
The barrel train was great fun, and the baby land rovers were a hit for the 5 year old .... He aced it!! So many things to do to keep the youngsters happy. The sunflower and sweetcorn picking was fun. We could have stayed longer, but we were exhausted from all the excitement. Fabulous day, and thank you The Patch for allowing picnics to be taken in. We had a few coffees and cold drinks from the vendors, but with some families and different eating habits, it is so much easier to take your own.... Keeps them all happy. I hope we will be back next year x Erica

pumpkin_patches.address: Mount Mill Farm, Milton Keynes MK19 6DG

recent_reviews.author: Elviera L
recent_reviews.text:
Fabulous place!
Visited with a friend for lunch and itâ€™s a lovely spot. You can eat inside or out on the terrace.
Wide range of freshly made food on the menu.
I had a flatbread with cajun chicken and rocket and it was delicious and very filling. We both had the homemade lemonade with elderflower and it was amazing.
No rush to have the table back which was very nice. A really relaxing atmosphere.
The shop was brilliant too. Lots of really different homewares and gifts.
The food and drink section too had really good produce and a wide range of unusual items. Real quality products.
Plenty of onsite parking.

recent_reviews.author: Will Jnr
recent_reviews.text: I'm so happy with my 2 new girls thank you very much for the lady who answered my call very polite and I shall be going for more soon the delivery was brilliant aswell I suggest you want great quality animals go here

recent_reviews.author: Mark Turner
recent_reviews.text: I drive hundreds of miles to visit the Farm. Great restaurant and the best pork pies ğŸ¥§ in the world by far.

recent_reviews.author: Denise Watts
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place, good coffee. Got three very nice hens but unfortunately they apparently had no ducks even though I had telephoned the previous day to ensure that they would have some. Something of a disappointment there

recent_reviews.author: Lauren Perthen
recent_reviews.text: Thereâ€™s a surprisingly large nature reserve here! Drive down the lane, park for free beside the offices and barns (used for events) and enjoy a wonderful, wild wander with some incredible views over Huddersfield! The staff were very welcoming and encouraged me to really explore the site. A hidden gem! ğŸŒ¿ğŸ¦‹ğŸ

recent_reviews.author: liz stearne
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place to go for a short walk. Take in the views and spot lots of insects and flowers. Great family  workshops (not during covid period) at various times of the year.

recent_reviews.author: Rhiannon Canoville-Ord
recent_reviews.text: My toddler and I came for the creepy crawly trail & pumpkin Picking event. The staff were lovely and welcoming. The lady I spoke to suggested that the nature tots session would probably be better for my little one and I was grateful for the suggestion! We had a really nice time and got some amazing pumpkins to take home too. Thank you.

recent_reviews.author: Tracy Crompton
recent_reviews.text: This is a lovely peaceful place to visit with breathtaking views whilst standing in the small fruit orchard overlooking the vegetable gardens. It also has  a herb garden and pond. There's a good nature trail too if your  feeling energetic!

recent_reviews.author: Surinder Dhaliwal
recent_reviews.text: Gorgeous farm brilliant selection of pumpkins was the perfect day out we all had so much fun!  food & drinks were available everyone was super friendly our first time in york pumpkin picking definitely be back again soon!

recent_reviews.author: Sian Thomas
recent_reviews.text: We've been three times to Yorkshire Pumpkins over the last few years and always really enjoyed it! An excellent selection of pumpkins, very well priced and some nice additional touches like toy tractors to ride on, hay bale mountain and pizza too!

recent_reviews.author: Olivia Brady
recent_reviews.text: Very friendly staff, lots of amazing pumpkins to choose from. Food and drink stalls were lovely and great amenities for cleaning our dirty wellies and also our pumpkins! There was stuff for the kids to enjoy such as hay bale climbing and the castle maze. We absolutely loved it! We will definitely be back next year! ğŸ§¡

recent_reviews.author: Chelsea lauren Crinnion
recent_reviews.text: Weâ€™ve been coming to Yorkshire pumpkins since 2021 and we wonâ€™t visit anywhere else. The children have loved it every year, easy to find, plenty of very reasonable XL pumpkins, plenty to do genuinely a fun morning out for us!

pumpkin_patches.address: Lodge Farm, Church Ln, Cundall, York YO61 2RN

recent_reviews.author: Joe G
recent_reviews.text: Had a really nice time here with my son and partner. Lots of variety with the pumpkins and a nice barn/shop to have a brew and a sausage roll after. Might need to get a bigger car park soon though. Was a bit of a tight squeeze. ğŸ˜…

recent_reviews.author: Beth Steer
recent_reviews.text: Lovely afternoon out on the hill. Everything was really well organised and the staff were lovely! Timed entry meant that there wasn't too many people at once and my toddler had a blast. We played hide and seek in the Christmas trees for ages finding the best pumpkin.

recent_reviews.author: Robs Repairs
recent_reviews.text: What a wonderful place for picking pumpkins amongst a pretty backdrop of Christmas trees. Â£12 per car entrance fee and then pay for your own pumpkins. Coffee is nice and bouncy castle and face painting for the kids in the barn. Probably my favourite of the many pumpkin patch places I've visited over the last 10 years

recent_reviews.author: Danielle H
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant pumpkin picking experience. We had the best time with our 18 month old and 3 year old. Absolutely tonnes of pumpkins to choose from and loads of space for kids to run around. Great photo opportunities too! Really loved the indoor activities with the bouncy castle and play area. We had the perfect day for it and didn't want to leave!

pumpkin_patches.address: Eccles Parlour, Ripponden, Sowerby Bridge HX6 4NU

recent_reviews.author: Becca Statham
recent_reviews.text: Visited with my 4 month old baby and my siblings. Welcomed as we got out of the car and shown to the pumpkin patch. Loads of choice in size and types of pumpkins/squash. Well priced. Field would be difficult to access if you arenâ€™t particularly mobile (no prams etc), plus recommend wellies! Able to pay by cash or bank transfer. Well worth a visit!

recent_reviews.author: Jimmy Law
recent_reviews.text: They got different pumpkin varieties. They all look awesome. Staff were nice and helpful. If you love pumpkin or you want some thing for Halloween decorations, this is the place you can't miss.

recent_reviews.author: Elliott Gales
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little farm shop......friendly staff, lots of fresh veg, eggs, chutney and jams plus there home made chilli jam wow very hot. And if your looking for that perfect real Christmas tree this is the place.

recent_reviews.author: Tim Owen
recent_reviews.text:
Really friendly staff and you can pick the tree you want cutting down.
Great experience.
Thank you.

pumpkin_patches.address: Whiteley's Farm, Hough Side Rd, Pudsey LS28 9JW

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Farmer Johnâ€™s Maize Maze and Pumpkin Patch

recent_reviews.author: Adrian Fiedosiuk
recent_reviews.text: We had such a fantastic time at Farmer Johnâ€™s Maize Maze! The corn maze was really well designed â€“ challenging enough to be exciting, but still great fun for the whole family. The atmosphere was welcoming and friendly, and everything was really well organised. A great extra highlight were the bikes for both kids and adults â€“ such a fun addition that made the day even better. Itâ€™s a perfect place to spend a few hours outdoors, laughing, exploring, and making memories. Highly recommended for families, friends, or anyone looking for a fun day out! ğŸŒ½âœ¨

recent_reviews.author: Mark Webber
recent_reviews.text: I brought my kids (6 and 9) to the maize maze on a very sunny day. They had a lot of fun going through and finding all the places to put their stickers. I quite liked following the map too! We spent a couple of hours here which was enough to go round both mazes, have an ice cream and have a play on the climbing bits and bouncy castle. There are some benches with a couple with some shade so you could quite easily stop for lunch too. There's plenty of parking too.

recent_reviews.author: Tony Lee
recent_reviews.text: This place is absolutely magic! I have to admit I was a bit reluctant to go, BUT, this place is great! Itâ€™s simple, uncomplicated old fashioned fun! Both the mini and main mazes are fantastic! Thereâ€™s a double mini farm rides track, a bouncy castle tractor, giant games and even a little gift shop for snacks! Thereâ€™s a pumpkin patch, loads of parking, hay bails to play on and toilets in the exact right place. It was less than a fiver for kids and I stayed here with more daughter for three hours!

recent_reviews.author: Jon Szeto
recent_reviews.text:
A fantastic spot for any families with young children to play and hang out. Prices are reasonable (Adults Â£7, Children 3 and above Â£5 and under 2s free) and the space is more than enough for kids with energy to burn. We went with our 3.5 year old (who is vehicle/tractor mad)  and 8month old and both had a great time. On our visit at the end of August 2024 there was a large inflatable tractor bouncy castle, welly wanging station, noughts and crosses, a large tractor riding area (with plenty of pedal tractors and walking tractors for the little ones), hay bale pyramid, hay bale animals, bench swing and pumpkin patch to see!

The main attractions are the two corn mazes (one easy and one harder) for which you are given a really well made map and stickers for the little ones to keep engaged throughout the maze. The smaller maze will take you approximately 15minutes where as the harder one is closer to 40/45min with children. Both our children who are not the most patient were entertained the whole time and there are the right number of clues and checkpoints.

The owner and staff are super friendly and really care about providing a positive experience and it shows. There are a small range of refreshments and ice creams/ice lollies and picnic tables dotted around (some under cover for shade).

A little bonus is that tractors and large farm vehicles are sometimes seen in the car park area (car parking is ample) which for any kids who love vehicles is another plus.

pumpkin_patches.address: Old London Rd, Capel St Mary, Ipswich IP9 2JU

recent_reviews.author: Beatrice (Bea)
recent_reviews.text: Went to rectory farm with my family in the Summertime and was an absolutely spectacular experience! We picked strawberries first, and it just took a bit of searching to find the perfect ones! Theyâ€™re very sweet and flavourful, much better than the stores! We then picked a punnet of blackberries, and they were spectacular! We then visited the shop, and it was very cool and pleasant, as well as the beautiful variety of fruits and veg! A very hot and sunny day as well, but we were relieved to know that there were shades over the strawberries!

recent_reviews.author: Thanh YÃªn
recent_reviews.text: We visited this lovely farm on a fresh and clear morning, and it was such a pleasant experience. Everything was well organized and enjoyable. The staff at the ticket gate were especially friendly and welcoming, which made us feel right at home. A perfect stop for families looking to enjoy some peaceful countryside charm!

recent_reviews.author: Hailey Grimes
recent_reviews.text:
We picked some huge juicy strawberries that my friend who doesnâ€™t like strawberries really enjoyed. Bought some very tasty soft fluffy bread rolls (would be even better if they came in packs of two as well as four)
And the kids got to burn some energy in the play park.
The only downside was the hot chocolateâ€¦.i have a sweet tooth but that was so sweet I couldnâ€™t drink it

recent_reviews.author: Etienne Arman
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful pick-your-own area ! We came for the strawberries and stayed for the gooseberries and flowers :) We'll be back for the blackberries later in the year ! The fact that you can picnic, grab a coffee and visit the farm shop makes this a brilliant day out for the whole family.

recent_reviews.author: Elaine Heaney
recent_reviews.text: Really well thought through rustic and family orientated pumpkin patch - great day out with food vans, coffee, vegetables and good parking - wheelbarrows for the pumpkins and best of all dog friendly!! ğŸ¾ ğŸƒ highly recommend

recent_reviews.author: james barnett
recent_reviews.text: Perfect muddy activity for the family! Pull up in your car, stick on your wellies and grab your pumpkins. They have 1000s of pumpkins with some speciality ones with unusual colours and shapes. Once you have picked your pumpkins, get them sized and pay. You then enter an area with a small fairground, think of the steam fair type ones. There are two barns where you can buy local veg, fruit and pies - all reasonably priced. The second barn had two food vans (waffles and toasties) that are perfect after a cold and windy pumpkin pick. There are even several portaloos with a baby change! We go every year and it is always a treat. However, go with white trainers at your own petrol - definitely pack boots or wellies!!! It is also dog friendly, they just need to be on the lead.

recent_reviews.author: Jaz G
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing place! Staff are so sweet and happy, explain everything and more than happy to help.
The gentle who was serving coffee in his van was so lovely and friendly and served some awesome coffee and hot chocolate!

recent_reviews.author: Michael Barrett
recent_reviews.text: Great fun with the kids searching for the best pumpkins! Lots of different kinds. The cinnamon buns in the jim shop at the end are amazing!

recent_reviews.author: Nailya Shamgunova
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic experience, well worth the drive from Cambridge! Free entry, a pumpkin patch with a wide variety of colours and shapes on offer, reasonable prices, photo ops, several stalls with food, drink, sweets, face paint etc. Very friendly staff, everything is really well organized!

recent_reviews.author: Aaron

Had a great afternoon at the pumpkin ğŸƒ patch with the kids and grabbed a nice selection of pumpkins ğŸƒ at a great price for carving for Halloween ğŸ¦‡ ğŸ¦‡ ğŸ‘»ğŸƒğŸƒğŸ•¸ï¸ğŸ•¸ï¸ğŸ•·ï¸ğŸ•·ï¸â˜ ï¸â˜ ï¸
I will also be making some wine with the leftovers ğŸ· Cheers ğŸ¥‚

recent_reviews.author: Chris Woodman
recent_reviews.text: Excellent PYO pumpkins, massive variety of sizes and very reasonable on prices, I will be coming here for my pumpkins every year now. Staff are also really friendly and helpful. 10/10

pumpkin_patches.address: Unnamed Road, Benwick Rd, Huntingdon PE26 2XU

recent_reviews.author: Tony Carlyon
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant! You can see it's been designed to give a lovely family experience, with plenty for the kids to do, even when they aren't collecting pumpkins. There are plenty of staff working, the toilets are kept nice and clean and overall a really lovely way to spend a few hours. Make sure you take your camera as there are lots of photo opportunities!

recent_reviews.text: Lovely patch. Naturally decorated and conveniently located close to Cambridge. Parking is ample and free. Huge play area to keep the kids busy. I was pleased to see they even have a first aid room set up there.

recent_reviews.author: Felipe Franciosi
recent_reviews.text: Itâ€™s great fun, but bring your own food and drink. Astounding Â£7 (SEVEN QUID) for this â€œloaded hot dogâ€ (bread, a sausage, and I could help myself to some mayo) in this photo.

recent_reviews.text: We went today for the first time today, it was lovely, a lot of things to do with the little ones from sliding, bikes and of course pumpkin picking! Great prices too

recent_reviews.author: Luke Prettyjohns
recent_reviews.text: Super pleased we stumbled across this little independent farm selling pumpkins! Great selection and owners were really friendly! Made the whole experience very wholesome!

recent_reviews.author: Will B
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place to get a pumpkin from - great selection from small to large. There's space to park beside the road, and some wheelbarrows to bring your pumpkins to your car if you're buying for a large group.

recent_reviews.author: Giorgio PedalÃ
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place to pick up some pumpkins ğŸƒ good price and very kind services ğŸ”ğŸ”ğŸ” I will come back next year.

Sweet lady also gave us lots of pumpkin recipes which was a lovely surprise!

Very fun maze for kids and adults it has a

fish1chips2

recent_reviews.text: Wonderful experience my kids loved we definitely come back â¤

recent_reviews.author: Rosie Thompson
recent_reviews.text: Went to the pumpkin patch in October half term. Lots of lovely crafts and things for kids to do, nice cake and a decent cup of tea. It was tipping it down with rain so we couldnâ€™t climb hay bales or spend much time actually picking pumpkins but a brilliant idea!

recent_reviews.author: Carly Harlock
recent_reviews.text:
Good amount of booking time to get around everywhere. The one way system was easy to follow. Lots of hand washing stations. It was great to see some small businesses using the paddock area and to see the blacksmith and wood carving being done. A small variety of animals to see and experience. The mill is always great to see every time I've visited and such a great learning experience for younger ones.
The new play park is a huge hit with our little one and the amount of variety of kit for a wide range of ages is just fantastic. It really has made a huge difference.
The ice creams were reasonably priced and the small gift shop area had an array of books and toys. The staff were polite and friendly. Lots of parking space and great sized spaces too. Definitely recommend coming here for all ages.
Lots of peacocks about. Beautiful but beware the odd one is brave enough to try and get very close to you for your food!

recent_reviews.author: Dan Cauia
recent_reviews.text: One of the best farm and activity centre by far.  Great big playground for kids, eating and camping. Well done for all of it. Will definitely come back again and send some friends your way ğŸ‘ŒğŸ‘ğŸ‘

I took my niece on a day out and there was loads to do from looking/stoking the animals, play areas, decorating chocolate, tractor rides ğŸšœ and loads more!
The staff were friendly and very helpful too!

recent_reviews.author: Neringa Juciene
recent_reviews.text: Lovely stargazing party , enjoyed every moment. Also halloween week, had so much fun. The best playground ever.Would definitely recommend to visit with all family.

recent_reviews.text: Really nice barn lovely food and the daughter loved the animals all friendly and you can feed them for a small fee of 50p a pot from the machines out side ..staff are helpful and very polite

recent_reviews.text: since the first time me and my brother went, we fell in love with the atmosphere, such a cozy country side place. we liked so much that we made a tradition to come at least once a week.

pumpkin_patches.address: Harvest Barn Farmshop, Whitehall Farm PE7 3DR

recent_reviews.author: Carrie-ann Cawthan
recent_reviews.text:
Today was our first visit to this farm and Iâ€™m sure it wonâ€™t be the last.
It was fantastic. So many things to do for children. Lots of play areas. Nature trails around the farm with more interactive play along the way. We didnâ€™t go inside the play barn we ran out of time being outside. Next time we will explore that area too.

recent_reviews.author: Janice Vernon
recent_reviews.text: An excellent family day out. Took our 2 grandchildren ages 6 and 4 and everything was accessible and appropriate for them. The play areas dotted around the site are excellent and love the fact that many feel natural and organic. Fun to see the animals and get up close to many. Would definitely recommend for a full day out with happy children!

Staff were polite and friendly .
Very few animals. Felt like I was at a play area with a few animals and not a farm with a play area. Lots of empty paddocks and birds in tiny cages due to risk of flu or something.  Probably the worst farm I've been to in regards to animals but a superb play area.  Restaurant also closed at half 2 which seems a bit silly

Easy stop off for coffee after an early start from the Norfolk coast to Cheshire. I had waited a significant period for a breakfast sandwich and needed to ask where it was (everyone else had their breakfast who had ordered after I had).

Other than the delay, food was good, and the coffee welcome after an early start.
I can imagine this place is very popular in the summer with a lovely camping field.

recent_reviews.author: Peter Robinson

Not to expensive and sensibly priced pumpkins!

We will definitely go again.

recent_reviews.text: Great staff , love the animals on site and lovely cakes, thank you for my son's free brownie.. he loved it...my son thoroughly enjoyed time spent there.

recent_reviews.author: Chris Moon
recent_reviews.text: What an amazing place! Great family day out to which me and my kids loved it!

recent_reviews.author: Celeste Jalbert

recent_reviews.author: James Horspool
recent_reviews.text: Excellent day out for the familiy, such a clean and welcoming atmosphere, such a friendly farmer who owns the property and puts on a great event every year, would highly recommend and will be back next year, thankyou.

recent_reviews.author: Julian Dowse
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely love visiting this farm shop and cafÃ©! The staff are always incredibly friendly and welcoming, making each visit a pleasure. The meat counter is not only beautifully presented but also offers top-quality cuts that are as delicious as they look. The cafÃ© serves fantastic food with a delightful atmosphere, perfect for a relaxing meal or a quick coffee break. Highly recommended!

recent_reviews.author: Helen Akitt-Heatley
recent_reviews.text:
An oasis in an area with very few cafes, we were very pleased to find this. The shop looked lovely but we were there for a light lunch.

At 1pm we had to wait 10 minutes for a table but the service was friendly and efficient. We just had tea and a cream scone, the scone had lots of fruit in. There is a light lunch menu which looked tasty.

recent_reviews.author: Ann Karelina
recent_reviews.text: Very friendly place, nice stuff, good selection of meat! And lovely tearoom with nice teapots and cups!)

recent_reviews.author: Tim O'Grady
recent_reviews.text:
Decided to find somewhere nice to stop off on the way to Norfolk....wow.
The place was rammed with folk having amazing looking breakfasts.
Every single member of staff said hello to us and we brought a scotch egg and what was possibly the best Quiche Lorraine I've ever had, good, firm pastry, quality cheese that left memories of it lingering in my mouth.
Apparently the red onion sausage roll was amazing but the wife thought it too good to share so I can't comment with authority.
The butchery counter was loaded, the dry good varied and the fresh veg was, well, fresh.
Can't rate it highly enough, looking forward to another pit stop on the way home

recent_reviews.author: Nina Lynch
recent_reviews.text: Had an absolutely amazing time. Kids loved choosing a coloured wheelbarrow and just wondering around the pumpkins. So hard to choose as there were so many and pretty good shapes too.  Been to other places where tgey were just oddly shaped. Car parking was easy and prices very good. So many different kinds. It was a fab quick easy visit.

recent_reviews.author: Chris Woodman
recent_reviews.text: Excellent place to go pumpkin picking, the farm really made the effort with all the props they had for photos, this is how a pumpkin patch should be! I highly recommend visiting here if you want great Halloween photos with the family. I have been to a few different pumpkin patches but this is by far the best! The prices are very reasonable and you can get a HUGE pumpkin for Â£12. I will be returning next year! 10/10 well done JW Tyrrell & Son.

recent_reviews.author: FC Costelloâ€™s
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic day out wonderful people to deal with so friendly and helpful and the main thing fantastic pumpkins and squashes at a great price what more do you want ğŸ§

recent_reviews.author: Verity Slattery
recent_reviews.text:
Great alternative to the big commercialised pumpkin picking places.

Lots of pumpkins! Loved how they had smaller ones at the end in giant crates to make it easy to choose with clearly marked prices for each.

Also, it's great that the pumpkins are measured fairly in homemade wooden size guides!

Fun decorations dotted around the field, portaloo toilets onsite, little sweet stall on site, and a black van serving hot drinks! Also, pumpkin face stickers are available to buy to take home and stick on your pumpkins if you don't want to carve!

Pop it in your sat nav and sloe down because it's easy to miss the turning on arrival, maybe a bigger sign could help with this :) not a gripe just we drive past and missed it the first time.

Car park warden very helpful and on hand, lots of parking in the field, wear wellies if you're precious about a bit of mud.

It was a lovely little afternoon out here. We definitely recommend it!

recent_reviews.author: Stacey Glossop
recent_reviews.text: We went with children aged 12 years to 2 weeks and all had a fab time. Lots of choice of food stalls, thought prices were steep initially but actually the food was delicious, fresh, very filling - worth the price (we went to various stalls and felt the same about each of them). The displays were brilliant, well thought out. Staff happily helped us take our group photos which are now very special photos, thank you! The fair ground rides were brilliant, was lovely to have more traditional rides rather than the flashy newer rides. Loved the makers market, was great to celebrate local small businesses, please keep this every year along with the social media promotions! The whole place was well thought out, areas for toddlers, seating, marquees, displays, signposts, celebrating all things pumpkins. I just wasnâ€™t prepared to spend so much, I wish I was more prepared. Thankfully card was accepted throughout. Thank you for a wonderful day out and the creativity with it!

recent_reviews.author: Stacey Whiteley
recent_reviews.text: Amazing day out fun for all the family including four legged fur friends. If you want more than just a field full of Pumpkins this is your place! Pumpkin Cannon, Maize maze, assault course, potato catapults fairground food and drinks and Craft Market as well as Pumpkin Market. Thank you for the invite Bells we will be back!!

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Harding
recent_reviews.text: I had a fantastic day out at Bell's Pumpkin Patch! So many fun activities for people of all ages, a great maize maze, such a fantastic selection of pumpkins in the pumpkin patch, as well as the outlet shop! Highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Simon Woodall
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing place. A little damp under foot for pumpkin picking but that's part of the fun.
Brilliant food outlets and loads to do.
100% going back next year.

recent_reviews.author: Ali Knox
recent_reviews.text: Great place, visit Active Acre

recent_reviews.author: Natasha Dettmer
recent_reviews.text: The best breakfast in Peterborough. Staff are kind and very helpful. Very clean and beautifully decorated.The food was delicious. Highly recommended. Do book so your not disappoint.

recent_reviews.author: Sueblue B
recent_reviews.text:
What a great place to welcome in a day with a hearty breakfast in a great spot!
We often come here for their breakfast and it's always a warm and welcoming cafe to come to.
The staff are really helpful and should be commended for their politeness and willingness to help.
It would be really helpful if you weren't just registered on Facebook as not everyone has or wants that option.
All the best for your future going brilliantly! Sue& Jim

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte Exton
recent_reviews.text:
Couldn't recommend more - always greeted by a smiley face, they have a great range of produce, very knowledgeable and polite staff and to top it off, there's always something yummy to cater for my gluten allergy!
Whether we pop in for a meat pack, a treat from the deli or just a coffee and a slice of cake, it's always been lovely
Keep up the brilliant work!

recent_reviews.author: Kate Isley
recent_reviews.text:
Getting really busy now and need to book a table at popular times. We go here a lot for either breakfast or just for coffee and cake.
Often buy their quiches , pies and chicken breasts.
Staff are really nice .

recent_reviews.author: Rachael Smith
recent_reviews.text:
My friend Kirsty and I have been so excited to come and cuddle the lambs at Bowthorpe Park Farm.

It did not disappoint!

This is the best way to spend adult money we are yet to find.

Making our visit all the more special was the superb customer service we received. This was true for all staff whether in the lambing shed or the shop.

However, we would both like to give the biggest and most heartfelt shout out to Grace. Grace was particularly warm and personable and went above and beyond. Thank you Grace!

recent_reviews.author: Lj Scorpio
recent_reviews.text: Farm was small but lovely. Perhaps not a lot to do for older kids and no animal feeding options when we went (Easter) so animals were visible but you couldnâ€™t pet them (except the pigs). There was a little food hut and a marquee to sit in. Small shop. The highlight was definitely the lamb cuddling (which ran very well and the people were lovely and chatty) the farmer even went and got a gorgeous piglet out for us to say hi to! All together a really lovely visit and very reasonably priced.

recent_reviews.author: Zhang Li
recent_reviews.text: nice farmï¼ we been there for Easter lamb cuddle. Very cute baby lambs and pigs! Nice area with very wide view ! All staff a so nice with smiling always!

recent_reviews.author: John Tunnard
recent_reviews.text:
Great day out at Bowthorpe Park Farm.
We saw lambs being born, baby pigs, and the famous Oak tree.
They have their own butchers there too with the highest quality meat.
Highly recommend visiting, fantastic day for all the family.

pumpkin_patches.address: Bowthorpe Park Farm, Witham-on-the-Hill, Bourne PE10 0JG

recent_reviews.author: Kevin. Turner
recent_reviews.text: Great please for veg & eggs. The sausage meat is the best we have had better than supermarkets. Thank you

recent_reviews.author: Saket Srivastava
recent_reviews.text: We visited here for pumpkin picking just a week before Halloween. Wanted some kind of different activity with kids during lockdown half term break. There wasn't much to do technically speaking as the pumpkin growing patch wasn't that big and so we were done in 10 minutes. There is a small farm shop, but we did not buy anything. Kids did love it.  Staff was very courteous and friendly.  Will probably visit again next year.

recent_reviews.author: Ed Brown
recent_reviews.text: We have great experiences with Lincoln farm every time we go there. Their produce is great and their craft printing is great too. We have been pumpkin picking there also and the kids love it. They let us look at the animals too which is a great bonus

recent_reviews.author: Sue Page
recent_reviews.text: Always friendly. Vegetables are good, meat excellent, especially like the sausages and burgers. .

recent_reviews.author: LÃ¡szlÃ³ Lovas
recent_reviews.text: Great place to get your Halloween pumpkins and fun for the kids. Friendly staff and ready wheelbarrows;) donâ€™t forget your wellies!

recent_reviews.author: Alec Cropper
recent_reviews.text: A brilliant pumpkin patch, and our family really enjoyed our visit. All the staff were very helpful, and some great refreshments on offer as well!

recent_reviews.author: Alex Keal
recent_reviews.text: best pumpkin patch in the area and would definitely go again. Amazing views and awesome customer service.

recent_reviews.author: Diane Houghton
recent_reviews.text: Very friendly staff the gift shop was amazing.  Ordered 2 fresh trees and although both  delivered.    We had a problem with the 6ft nordman with no fault of the farm however they still gave a full refund.   Will always use them and recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Willem Harvey
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous Christmas trees and a fantastic Christmas shop.   Definitely the best place to go in the area for trees. Free local delivery too.  Very highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Chris Merton
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful place to get your natural Christmas Tree ğŸŒ²

recent_reviews.author: David K
recent_reviews.text: Good choice and nice place to see as well

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Hill Farm PYO and Farm Shop

recent_reviews.author: Ramachandran Subramanian
recent_reviews.text: Hill Farm PYO is a delightful spot for a family day out. The farm offers a wonderful array of fresh, seasonal produce to pick yourself, with juicy strawberries being a real highlight. We had a fantastic time wandering the well-maintained rows, filling our baskets, and enjoying the beautiful countryside setting. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable, making our visit informative and fun. We left feeling rejuvenated and can't wait to return, perhaps for the plum or pumpkin picking seasons. Hill Farm PYO is a true gem - we highly recommend a visit to anyone seeking a wholesome, memorable day on the farm.

recent_reviews.author: Ramindu Thivanka Jayasuriya
recent_reviews.text:
We really enjoyed the time here. There are so many fruits to pick, plums, strawberries, Rasberry, and blueberry, and on the day we went, they had some sunflowers ğŸŒ» too.
Usually, plums are weighed, and you have to pay accordingly. We plucked 5kg+, and they charge something around 20 pounds. These plums were so yummy, not like the ones you see at the supermarkets. A sunflower is 1 pound. There's a small play area for little ones to enjoy and of course you can enjoy the sun having sipping a cup of coffee on a picnic bench.
They have a spacious car park, which is very close to the farm. So, no worries there, too

recent_reviews.author: Jacob Wilson
recent_reviews.text:
A very nice place!

We went out about lunchtime to go pumpkin picking and never having been before, it was very clear on where to go (parking, walking around site, shop, etc).

The staff are really friendly, helpful and polite and the website is informative on open times and whatâ€™s being picked when.

It was moderately busy but there was little to no queue times and plenty of field space to fit everyone in.

Definitely recommend going here! A lovely time out.

recent_reviews.author: Sanjay Pal
recent_reviews.text:
Awesome place, spend pleasant time with your family, little kids. Mostly kids will enjoy playing, running, jumping, picking strawberry  on the ground Field.

Beautiful scenery and surrounding areas. Explore with you child's strawberry, rashberey, blueberry, gooseberry plants....

There having car parking, toilet/washroom, place for seating and take your food items.

Better to go early to pick up fresh self hand picked berries and enjoy the day.

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Fenix
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place. We fed the animals, picked our own flowers and bought some fresh fruit and vegetables ğŸ˜€

recent_reviews.author: Deja Vu
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely loved our visit , if you know  for strawberry picking! The strawberries were ripe, plentiful, and delicious. A perfect family-friendly activity. Highly recommend!"

recent_reviews.author: Freddie Reynolds

Very reasonably priced and there are a few animals to see as well which is nice! There was no fruit picking when we visited but will definitely be returning to do this!

recent_reviews.author: Emma Louise
recent_reviews.text: A beautiful little find, animals, sweet local fruit and veggies. Polite and happy staff and the yummiest hot chocolate Iâ€™ve had in ages, canâ€™t wait to visit again â¤ï¸

pumpkin_patches.address: Ollerton Rd, West Drayton, Retford DN22 8DB

recent_reviews.author: DITZY Carley
recent_reviews.text:
Great family location for something to do. Arrived with plenty of parking considering it was peak time, as it was spring there were baby pigs, lambs and goats to see, bouncy castle, soft play is small and can get busy but kids enjoyed it, didn't use the cafe as the kids enjoyed a picnic but menu seemed reasonable and good choices, cakes and coffees available with snacks also.
Small gift shop but a good choice of different range priced gifts.
Ice creams were huge so a small is more than enough, plenty of places to wash hands to keep clean, mini tractors ğŸšœ for the kids to ride but can get busy. Great sized park but my two enjoyed the hay most of all, interactive with the animals really broke up the day and lots of photo opportunities. Over all the prices were more than acceptable and the staff are wonderful. We moved our day due to a sick child which wasn't an issue for staff and gifted some food as one parent with that child didn't make it in the end. Really appreciate the thought from the team and all pleasant to talk to. Amazing ğŸ¤©
