Yes I'd recommend, take your time, don't rush and just let the kids be kids.

recent_reviews.author: helen collins
recent_reviews.text: The park was smaller than i thought it was going to be but that suited us. My great granddaughter loved the park ,play houses and large sandpit. Im very sorry to give a negative review for the cafe but everything was cold and unedible the bacon was so hard i couldnt bite it at all. Sorry.   Back to the farm they have quite a few animals but unfortunatly my gr8 grandaughter wasnt interested in the animals just the play areas but she is only 21/2 lol i will go back it was a lovely day out. We only travelled from scunthorpe so not too far away

recent_reviews.author: Donna Thorpe
recent_reviews.text: A fantastic little farm. Added bonus with a good soft play for the smaller ones and a large bounce castle. Great for feeding the animals and 2 good playgrounds. The cafe is really nice with reasonably priced food. The toddler group is brilliant. Different theme every week where you do a farm activity and a craft - really good value. We've been to two. Lambing week where we fed a lamb and horse week where we brushed two ponies.

recent_reviews.author: G B
recent_reviews.text:
We visited here on a hot day in the summer holidays. Definitely aimed at under 10's and as many play areas as there are farm animals, but our 5 year old wasn't complaining! The animals that are there well worth seeing though. The piglets being especially cute.
Plenty of grass areas and benches to picnic but the cafe served decent looking food at standard prices. The maize maze was huge and had things to find for the kids to get sweets at the end.
As clean as could be expected considering the amount of children running around and good hand washing stations.
A full day there might be tricky but even a few hours are still worth it for the cheap entry cost.

pumpkin_patches.address: Bawtry Road, Hatfield Woodhouse, Old Cantley, Doncaster DN7 6DS

recent_reviews.author: Lesley
recent_reviews.text:
Great produce. Both the cooked and fresh meats are excellent quality.
The cafe is always busy but we haven't tried it yet.
We got our turkey and ham from them last Christmas, they were fantastic .

recent_reviews.author: andrew hoole
recent_reviews.text: Welcome stop after 4hrs on the bike. Nice pint of moretti. Staff excellent and new tent/cafe a lovely spot.  The farm shop adjacent is brilliant with locally sourced fresh produce......5stars

recent_reviews.author: Shane Smith
recent_reviews.text:
Great to see the farm, farm shop putting on some ğŸ‘» Halloween ğŸƒ fun in the village.

I assume they put this on during October.

Pumpkin picking ğŸƒ plenty of parking ğŸ…¿ï¸ on field/grass - where your wellies recommended (I got round in trainers, but....)

A lovely hat bale hill, covered seating area, mini rides, food, coffee vans and the tractor ğŸšœ ride ğŸ˜  the kids 6/8/12 all enjoyed it! Some of the rides were toddler age rated ğŸ’ª

The smashed burger and jacket potato were pukka! ğŸ¤©ğŸ’ª

Access was ok, but could be difficult in wet weather â˜”

We'll be back next year, but also into your farm shop soon and thanks again for putting this on! â¤ï¸ğŸ’ªğŸ¤©

recent_reviews.author: Jessica Good
recent_reviews.text: Stopped here to buy a treat for our dinner. Itâ€™s a farm shop so the high prices are a given. The quality of produce was great. I got jerked chicken legs which came in a foil container for the oven and it was delicious. Good quality chicken and a generous portion size. Lots of options if youâ€™re having a barbecue  and also some fancy prepared meats. Pies, sausage rolls etc, some ready meals, bakery items such as biscuits, but not as many options for you if youâ€™re veggie, vegan or donâ€™t eat red meat or wheat. Will pop back next time Iâ€™m in the area for another treat dinner. My only criticism was that I cycled here and I couldnâ€™t find anywhere to chain my bike.

pumpkin_patches.address: High St, Barnby Dun, Doncaster DN3 1DU

recent_reviews.author: Yasmin Shulitime
recent_reviews.text: Really friendly people, and good pumpkins! Small good van available to buy drinks and snacks

recent_reviews.author: Chris Lee
recent_reviews.text: Very expensive, Â£7 for a small supermarket size pumpkin, I suppose you pay for the pumpkin picking experience, not that they were still on the plant though.

recent_reviews.author: Yvette Barnes
recent_reviews.text: Was great getting to explore and pick our pumpkins. The staff were fab and very helpful.

recent_reviews.author: Shaun Walker
recent_reviews.text:
Overpriced!

Â£30 for three pumpkins is ridiculous.

pumpkin_patches.address: Holme Wood Ln, Armthorpe, Doncaster DN3 3FQ

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Goacher C M & G W Ltd

recent_reviews.author: Ebbie Olukoya
recent_reviews.text: Amazing collection of fruits, I picked Apple, Red plum and blue plum very juicy, yummy. What a place to be on a sunny day. Great for Family day out

recent_reviews.author: Petru Mugurel Iancu
recent_reviews.text: Interesting place, lot of fruits even if I founded quite late( I was interested on gooseberries) ,my daughter was thrilled by the fact she can pick the cherry and the strawberries, nice if you like this sport. Quite pricey if you ask me, you can buy cheaper from Tesco or other chains, one kilo of gooseberries Â£14 + plastic bucket, the strawberries are quite expensive to, but , you pay for experience, I guess. Of the money are not an issue ,go there and have fun with your kids. Highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Tejal Paliya
recent_reviews.text: Great place to pick a wide variety of fruits and buy fresh vegetables. Small parking lot with benches for picnics. Nice shop selling homemade jams, spreads, chutneys and conserves and other confectionery. Reasonably priced Pick-Your-Own fruits. The actual farm does not have a maintained path as such. I tripped a few times. Many apples and plums were on the ground (potential slip hazard). But otherwise is was a great trip down to a farm on a lovely sunny day.

recent_reviews.author: zifar azhar
recent_reviews.text: It was a disappointing experience. Before our visit, approximately seven families contacted the establishment and inquired about the availability of various fruits. However, upon arrival, we encountered a rather unpleasant individual, an elderly woman who was exceedingly rude and unfriendly. It is my sincere hope that I will not have the misfortune of encountering such a person again. Her demeanor unfortunately detracted from the overall experience. The only fruit available was cherries, which were difficult to pick due to the height of the trees. I would not recommend a return visit, as there are certainly more enjoyable destinations available. This particular location was, without a doubt, the least pleasant I have ever visited.

recent_reviews.author: John Limbert
recent_reviews.text:
We went to Wentworth food festival and were impressed by the fact that they were local and thought we would try their produce. We had lamb Koftas, and two packs of sausages, both were exceptional and full of flavour,
So we decided to order direct, more lamb Koftas, sausages, 1/2 leg of lamb, fillet steak. all were absolutely delicious, The lamb was so tender, steaks melt in the mouth, Sausages wow!!!.
we will be ordering more Their meat is second to none.

recent_reviews.author: Mark Griffiths
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic family providing great quality food. Ordered steaks, sausages and kebabs online, collected the following day directly from the farm and had the pleasure of meeting Nick & Caryâ€™s who have been rearing the animals. Highly recommend the website and believe delivery is also available, even easier to get locally sourced food.

recent_reviews.author: Heather Pierce
recent_reviews.text: What could be better than buying direct from the farm. Their web site has made ordering their meat products so easy . Whether sausages , burgers, mince, steak or koftas , weâ€™ve tasted them all and everything has been very tasty and excellent quality .

recent_reviews.author: james powell-brett
recent_reviews.text: We got a pack of meat direct from the farm to barbecue on a family holiday through their nationwide delivery service and were blown away by how great everything was! After some lamb burgers, koftas and tomato sausages all the family were singing the praises of the Nether Haugh Farm team!

recent_reviews.author: Emma Forsyth
recent_reviews.text: Auntie Angie's Pumpkin Patch at West Farm ğŸƒ so many pumpkins! All shapes, sizes and colours! The kids especially liked the photo props and face painting. Auntie Angie is friendly and welcoming, definitely recommended!

recent_reviews.author: Eddie Stokoe
recent_reviews.text: OK place.

recent_reviews.author: Abigail Rachele Salifu
recent_reviews.text: Lovely sunflower field. Well layed out with a slide for kids, sitting area, a prop to take pictures and animals to see around the farm.

recent_reviews.author: Kimberley Ohjustmylittleblog
recent_reviews.text: We absolutely love this place! Weâ€™ve been visiting since 2018 for pumpkin picking and itâ€™s our favourite tradition. Not fussy or gimmicky just fun and wholesome. Lovely photo opportunities to recreate year on year. Catering, parking and toilets on site. Soooo many pumpkins to choose from, all sizes, shapes and colours. Reasonably priced. My boys spend ages playing on the tractor and hay bale slide. We were really pleased they started doing strawberries this year, they were so tasty! And the sunflowers are gorgeous too. Really lovely people doing something great, definitely worth a visit!

recent_reviews.author: Carl Robinson
recent_reviews.text: What a great place to visit for all the family. From  pick your own strawberries June/July, sunflowers and wild flowers July-September then pumpkins after that. Great for photo opportunities throughout, and many things to entertain the younger members of the family, from animals, to tractors and slides. Great food served from snacks and drinks to fresh soup and pie, wood fired pizza and burgers. A great way to spend a few hours through the middle and latter months of the year. Staff are always friendly and will try to assist where possible during busy periods. The assortment of different types of pumpkins is amazing. Organised parking including disabled parking and onside toilet facilities. Â£3 per adult and children enter free.

recent_reviews.author: Cal Knight
recent_reviews.text: Â£9 for 3 adults to walk round a field full of smashed pumpkins that have all been imported (not grown on site) couldn't find a single decent pumpkin. Any decent looking one came to have damage or rot on closer inspection Overpriced snacks and drinks with a small petting zoo. Wouldn't recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Lovina Bhagchandani
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely farm with lovely people.
We got to pick apples and plums and the farm shop has a good selection of fruits and veg. Reasonably priced as well. This place will be a regular weekend options for us!

recent_reviews.author: Bravo Sierra
recent_reviews.text: What a nice place to make family visit. My 7 yrs son really enjoyed this farm. We got lots of fresh fruits and vegetables in own choice very reasonable price. Parking is free, and also staff are very friendly and helpful.

recent_reviews.author: OMAR
recent_reviews.text:
Great family friendly â€œpick your own farmâ€, there is a cafe and farm shop with a rich selection of local produce, and well equipped with superb customer service. Clean toilets and also a very friendly atmosphere. Love this place.
There's also a dedicated BBQ area, that's five pounds per car, reasonable price for an amazing place with huge open green space, great for the kids to play around.
Wonderful place, would love to come again.

recent_reviews.author: Nadia Aneesa Ramzan
recent_reviews.text: Great BBQ area. Pick your own needs some TLC but it's a beautiful farm non the let with a great tractor ride for all the family. great facilities for using the washroom and a cute little farm shop

pumpkin_patches.address: Hewitts farm, Court Rd., A224, Chelsfield, Orpington BR6 9BX

recent_reviews.author: Itmad Keshwani
recent_reviews.text: Great for ice creams.  Really wonderful ice creams and a mind boggling selection of flavours,  freshly - own dairy- made.  Now fresh farm eggs and a machine that vends bottles of milk or milk shakes.  I keep going back over and over again.  So horrid for my waist line!!  And yes very children friendly.  They have activities and events for kids to enjoy too.....see pics of an Easter event .

recent_reviews.author: Kinjal Pandya Wagh
recent_reviews.text: Great place for Easter activities. You can find chickens, lambs and cows. Great for toddlers to see and experience farm animals. Ice creams here are a great treat, great in quality. Best to check weather before you go as rains can be a spoil sport. Perfect for any summer morning or afternoon outdoor time for children. I only wish they had covered area outside so can continue being there even when it rains.

recent_reviews.author: Lyubomir Georgiev (Lyubo)
recent_reviews.text:
Our first visit was for a kids birthday party and we used the TIPI. Itâ€™s very nice and the area around it. A nice out of the way place, pleasant countryside views all on the edge of London.
A very good selection of ice creams over 25 and sorbets plus a few non dairy options.
They even had a  fresh milk dispensing machine (yum) and offered a chance to feed lambs. Also chickens and other small animals available. The mooland is nice fun for kids. Good place to enjoy with kids especially if the weather is nice.

recent_reviews.author: Farhana Manekia
recent_reviews.text: Lovely afternoon for the kids to get a fresh ice cream and play outside for a while. Moo-land is ideal for ages 1-5 but my kids aged 6 and 9 enjoyed themselves whilst we enjoyed some tasty ice cream flavours. Staff in the shop were fiery friendly and helpful, their service eased the long queues to get served, was very busy.

pumpkin_patches.address: Fold Farm, Galley Ln, Barnet EN5 4RA

recent_reviews.author: Caroline Zentbando
recent_reviews.text:
I recently visited the tulip farm located on Turners Hill Road, Crawley (RH10 4PE), and it was a truly wonderful experience. From the moment we arrived, everything was perfectly organized and welcoming.
The tulip fields were immaculately maintained, showcasing an incredible variety of colors and creating a magical atmosphere. The cleanliness of the entire place stood out, including spotless restrooms, which is always a plus. There was a strong sense of safety throughout the venue, and the staff provided excellent service at every point.
One of my favorite parts of the visit was the option to buy marshmallows and roast them over an open fire â€” a simple yet charming touch. I also loved the Ferris wheel, which offered stunning panoramic views of the tulip fields, making the experience even more memorable.
The farm offers free, spacious parking, and there are several food vendors and restaurants on site with very reasonable prices. It's clear that the space is thoughtfully designed for visitors of all ages.
This is the perfect destination for a day out with family or friends. You can even bring your dogs, which makes it even more special for pet lovers. Honestly, I wouldnâ€™t change a thing â€” everything was just perfect.
Highly recommended!

recent_reviews.author: Katrina Phipps
recent_reviews.text:
We visited Tullys Tulip festival on 7th April 25. The whole day from start to finish was amazing. The event was well managed and a lovely experience for families/friends/couples. The grounds were in fantastic condition and well kept. Paths were well marked out and disabled friendly. Plenty of seating available at all times and a huge variety of food options available from pizzas, burgers, loaded fries, donuts, pancakes ice cream and coffees.. just to name a few. The staff were welcoming, helpful and always available to assist. There was a large amount of staff and security around the fields themselves, probably to stop visitors from picking the tulips, but whilst we were there we didnâ€™t see any issues and everyone seemed to respect the rules.
We arrived at 11.30am and stayed until 2.30pm, but due to other commitments we had to leave but definitely could have spent a few more hours there enjoying the views, good food and entertainment. My daughter loved the enchanted forest walk and ferris wheel they had there. Would definitely recommend visiting. The photos speak for themselvesâ€¦ stunning.

recent_reviews.author: Rolf Evans
recent_reviews.text: My wife has lived in Amsterdam for a while and so was very keen to visit you.  We spent five hours yesterday exploring your gardens.  I have to say we were both very pleasantly surprised. It definately exceeded our expectations.  The flower displays were lovely, the park was clean and well staffed, the food was very good. Overall it was a most enjoyable experience for both of us. Thank you very much.

recent_reviews.author: Jackie Wateridge
recent_reviews.text: Tulleys farm. You have absolutely come up trumps again. We had tickets for both during the day and the lights in the evening. There were so many tulips, we didn't know where to look first. It was beautifully organised.They were outstanding. We had a lovely warm welcome from the staff in the coffee hut when we first got there. All the staff in other areas were very pleasant. The toilets were immaculate to have a wee in, so hats off to the cleaners. We then went on the following day to the lights event. They were spectacular. Everything about this event has been thoughly thought through and organised superbly. Tulleys farm, we love you.

pumpkin_patches.address: Tulleys Farm, Turners Hill Rd, Crawley RH10 4PE

recent_reviews.author: David Franklin
recent_reviews.text:
Visited on the Friday before the August bank holiday. There was a steady flow of people but never felt busy.
So many things in the woods for kids to explore and investigate. We ended up spending atleadt 5 hours here and had a picnic. Lots of space to sit. Good facilities and Refreshments and also access to the garden centre next door with a lovely cafe.
Will definitely be back

recent_reviews.author: Jan West
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful woodland walk. With lots of beautiful wooden play areas. Large picnic areas with lots of seating. Lake was full of wildlife. Well worth a visit and reasonable price for entry. Really lovely garden centre with a large restaurant. Highly recommend this place, a little hidden gem

recent_reviews.author: Claudio Iannella
recent_reviews.text: What a lovely place for the family. Took my 15 month old and she was able to do most things around the walk. Tree houses and mazes were so nice for her.

recent_reviews.author: milena justyna
recent_reviews.text: Priory Farm is a wonderful place for a day out with the whole family. The Discovery Walk is full of fun surprises for children, with creative nature-themed activities and beautiful scenery along the way. The farm shop is fantastic â€“ packed with delicious local produce, fresh baked goods, and lovely gift ideas. Everything is well organised, clean, and the staff are always friendly and helpful. A perfect mix of nature, adventure, and great food â€“ weâ€™ll definitely be coming back!

pumpkin_patches.address: Priory Farm Estate, Sandy Ln, South Nutfield, Redhill RH1 4EJ

recent_reviews.author: ClÃ©ment Dessort
recent_reviews.text:
I'm rating the camping, I haven't been in the restaurant.
We were 2 with a small tent. The field was dirty, a lot of cigarette butts, and plastic bags in the hedges.
No place to wash dishes.
The toilets are clean.
There is only one shower cabin for the whole camping, you have to pay 1 pound for 4 minutes of water, and the water was freezing...
I guess it's ok if you have a camping car full equiped, but for people in tent it's quite bad.

recent_reviews.author: Becky Jane
recent_reviews.text:
Visited here on a few occasions in the past and always had a pleasant experience. Iâ€™ve found it slightly pricey for what the food and drink is though.
We came yesterday for the family day event after Becksfest was postponed.
The bouncy castle area was overpriced for what was offered. Lots of groups of children ruining it for smaller kids by sitting on the roof area and gathering to stop kids getting through. Young girls staffing the bouncy castle area were sat on their phones and when approached the kids they didnâ€™t take much notice. I saw some other staff take a more stern approach as it was clear some kids got through the fencing and hadnâ€™t paid.

Final straw was leaving the event and seeing two men offering to have a fight. They went in to the staff area together very aggressive so I think they must have been staff. My children saw what was happening but they didnâ€™t seem to have any regard for others around them.
I did see security in the event so not sure why they didnâ€™t deal with this situation.

Will never return as I canâ€™t guarantee itâ€™s safe for my children.

recent_reviews.author: Lynsey Davis
recent_reviews.text: Lovely location with the lavender ğŸ’œ field, pizzas ğŸ• very nice. Service awful. First time visitor, won't be coming back. Only pizza was delivered, soup, sandwich and bruschetta wasn't. Staff speak little English and when they do they don't provide an update on food. Don't bother ğŸ˜Œ

recent_reviews.author: Emily Carter-Dunn
recent_reviews.text:
I took my just 2 year old and nearly 7 year old this morning.

The under 3s section is the best I've seen in a soft play, with things for babies all the way up to a mini version of the older kids frame. However, lots of the balls in the pit were dirty and some parts of the padded areas were in much need of replacement.

My eldest got a bit bored after 40 minutes. The frame isn't the biggest and she found it quite repetitive. A younger child would appreciate it a bit more I think.

Food is averagely priced for a soft play, came quickly and was nice.

There are lots of tables and seats, but the table closest the under 3 sections often blocked the doorway in and out of that section.

Lots of parking available, including places for electric cars and at least 2 overflow carparks - parking is not an issue here and is free!

pumpkin_patches.address: Beck Evans Farm, Water Ln, Sidcup DA14 5ET

recent_reviews.author: Billie-Jo Grayson
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant little farm. Has some pigs, sheep, goats, chickens, rabbits, a couple of donkeys, and a cat. Farm elderflower soda was refreshing, and cherry chocolate brownie is a must have if you're looking for a sweet treat! The farmers market stalls also look to have some good meat, cheese, bread and other products.

recent_reviews.author: Sara Roudbari
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely city farm!! Itâ€™s so so big!!! I didnâ€™t realise how big this was! So many plants growing everywhereğŸ¥¹ very well looked after !!
There are allotments, cafes, workshops, farmers market on Saturdays, plants for sale! There are bike parking available as well x

recent_reviews.author: mini moo
recent_reviews.text: I just visited recently, and it's such a cosy and friendly farm place to take the kids! It's a small yet lovely place to  learn about the animals and feed them too!

recent_reviews.author: jahangir alam
recent_reviews.text:
What a nice farm!
Lot of animal,vegetables garden, little ponds
Suitable for all age  of people for gathering together and enjoy,
No need any ticket

pumpkin_patches.address: Stepney Way, Stepney Green, London E1 3DG

recent_reviews.author: Danielle Logan
recent_reviews.text:
We booked the family experience and can say this is well worth the money!

Danny was very engaging and informative, my little girl had a brilliant day. Thank you so much for a brilliant afternoon!

recent_reviews.author: Caz Andrews
recent_reviews.text: Small working city farm.that has been there 50 years. Blacksmith experiance on site. Animal handling but check on line. You can buy food to feed the animals. Animals seem happy and relaxed.  Cafe with food and drink available. Toilets. Small farm shop.  Some vegetables for sale.

recent_reviews.author: Corina Badeanu
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm on the Thames path. We took loads of photos of the animals and bought some fresh produce from the farm shop.

recent_reviews.author: Jon
recent_reviews.text: This urban farm has a variety of flowers and plants as well as animals (sheep/lambs/pigs/ goats/ ducks and more). There is an amazing coffee shop selling drinks, pastries and toasties etc. - very tasty, good quality. A shop is there too and guides who can tell you about the farm and also the history of the wharf. There is a blacksmith there too. The building used for this is the old receiving station where Dr Ricketts assessed smallpox patients.  The wharf was originally called Albion Wharf before being bought by the Metropolitan Asylum Board (MAB) for Â£13,000 in the early 1880s. There are some pieces of MAB china in a display case; various  boards display historical facts about different eras with drawings and photos. An outstanding place! (Plus a visit nearby to the park, also free roaside parking for 3 hours, if you can get a space; or paid roadside parking for 4 hours).

pumpkin_patches.address: Rotherhithe St, South Wharf, London SE16 5ET

recent_reviews.author: Kay Stobbart
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic place to visit. Fun was had by all. We loved the maze, and it was so beautiful seeing all the sunflowers ğŸŒ» pointing towards the sun.
Everyone gets to take a sunflower home, too.
Face painting is available. The lady was quick, and the children loved them.
Little kiosk selling cakes,  pastries, and tasty drinks.  All very reasonable.
It was such a lovely experience and great to enjoy something outdoors!!
I noticed a sign advertising pumpkins ğŸƒ as we left, so another visit for us all soon.

recent_reviews.author: David
recent_reviews.text: They often run events like the Sunflower one, whether there's a field of sunflowers to walk through, and lambing day when you get to meet all the newborn lambs.  Worth keeping an eye out for their events.

recent_reviews.author: Josiie Hall
recent_reviews.text: Had a lovely afternoon here with friends, the kids loved seeing all the baby lambs, going on the bouncy castle and they especially loved the tractor trailer ride. Lovely place to visit if you get the chance.

recent_reviews.author: Cat C
recent_reviews.text: We went to lambing day and it was perfectly gorgeous ğŸ¥° beautifully set up and amazing for the kids to experience everything. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and will definitely go again. Bouncy castle, crafts, hot and cold food and a tractor trailer ride. And the lambs. ğŸ’”ğŸ’”â¤ï¸â¤ï¸ğŸ’”ğŸ’” SO SO SO SWEET!! Loads of space for picnics and children to run off all their energy and just be outside and so near nature. Thank you!!

recent_reviews.author: Lauren Johns
recent_reviews.text: We had a lovely family outing to Pumpkin Moon, excellent for children or even a unique kinda date for a couple. Plenty of pumpkins to choose from and a corn maze for more entertainment

recent_reviews.author: Gina Davis
recent_reviews.text:
Complete rip-off!
They charge entry fees per person, then I had to pay for the pumpkin I picked, which was 22 pound for 5 pumpkins. So much more than I'd pay in supermakets like Sainsbury.
Staffs were rude, I mean, they were just bunch of teenagers..
I would never go back there.

recent_reviews.author: S Jasper
recent_reviews.text:
It's become a family tradition to head of to Pumpkin Moon to pick our pumpkins for Halloween and beyond.  There is always lots to choose from in all different shapes and sizes. There is normally an activity for the kids to do as well.

This year was even better as there was a hot food stand as well as teas and coffees and icecream.

recent_reviews.author: amy bird
recent_reviews.text: It was our 1st time coming to pumpkin moon and what a fantastic afternoon we had my kids loved it and so did we we will be back next year

pumpkin_patches.address: Lower Rainham Rd, Rainham, Gillingham ME7 2YA

recent_reviews.author: Kerry Skarratt
recent_reviews.text: Gorgeous farm and garden. A lovely way to spend some time in nature. We particularly loved Shirley the cow and all the goats.

recent_reviews.author: Ellen Feuchtwanger
recent_reviews.text: Amazing farm! Adorable friendly animals! And lovely staff. Would highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Juliana Lopes
recent_reviews.text: It really saddens me to give me this rating, but I felt really disappointed in this farm. Apart from the sheep and the frogs, the animals have very little space and the farm is between two train tracks. The donkeys, that supposedly have a very sensitive audition according to one of the signs of the place, stay literally by the side of a track (you can see it in one of the pictures). I imagine that the volunteers do all they can to help the animals, and I believe that there must be more funding and investment to care appropriately for the animals, but they need urgently to move the place away from the tracks and to give more space for the animals.

recent_reviews.author: Kat T
recent_reviews.text: It was very small, but I would still recommend going if you're in the area.  You can't feed the animals or touch them and the horses aren't on site (construction of their area), but overall it was lovely for a quick outing. It was a bit confusing at first because it looks closed and I don't remember seeing any staff. You just sort of walk in the unlocked door and look around on your own. You just have to wash your hands before entering and can sign a visitor book.

recent_reviews.author: Mo HP
recent_reviews.text:
We had a lovely trip to the farm and the kids especially had great fun. There was also a little garden just next to the farm that had a fun activity trying to find all the different objects in the garden which the kids loved.

However, if youâ€™re planning a full day trip I wouldnâ€™t recommend this as a full day out activity as the farm was quite small. Instead thereâ€™s a kids play area just behind the farm to visit but also Victoria Park nearby which has lots of geese and boats which can be great fun. All in all loved the farm and will definitely be coming in the future! ğŸ¤

recent_reviews.author: Shanroy Dehaney
recent_reviews.text: Very nice farm for the kids. When went surprisingly there were a lot more adults than children, but this didn't spoil the day out. My kids enjoyed stroking the goats and getting really close up to the ducks. The animals all seemed so used to being around people, that they dazzled in the attention. Highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Beatrice Harr
recent_reviews.text:
We recently visited this farm and absolutely loved it! ğŸŒ¿ğŸ‘ The atmosphere is so warm and peaceful, and the animals are well cared for and incredibly friendly. My kids were over the moon meeting them â€” especially the little piglets, they were just the cutest! ğŸ–ğŸ’›

Itâ€™s a wonderful place to spend time as a family: fresh air, a welcoming vibe, and a chance to show children what real farm life looks like. Highly recommend visiting, especially with kids.

recent_reviews.author: Camilla Steel
recent_reviews.text: This is such a lovely, calm oasis in Hackney and a great opportunity for children to get close to animals. My friend and I went specifically to visit the new goats (the piglets were also an absolute delight) and if I lived closer, I'd definitely be there all the time. The animals are very used to humans, so you can get quite close to them. The goats love ear scratches and the poultry, even though you're not allowed to touch them, are quite content to wander around your legs, which is really lovely. It's very small, but very clean and great for a quick visit.

recent_reviews.author: Trudi Kaye
recent_reviews.text: Love this farm. Cath and Andy are super friendly and welcoming. We grt our eggs from them and have tried the Goose eggs and Duck eggs. Highly recommend. Love going to pick up my farm goods. They also do honey and a few other yummy things and host art and other creative events in their old brewery.

recent_reviews.author: Claire Gardner
recent_reviews.text: Having asked at very short notice for some special goody bags to be created for an important customer who was visiting for an away day, The Promise couldn't have made it easier.  Absolute dream to work with on it and fantastic to be able to support a small, independent business.  Would highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Vince Betty
recent_reviews.text: Great place, I have so far had eggs, Christmas trees and delicious honey. Worth a visit just to see what goods they might be offering, they work with a mix of local suppliers for quality goods. And the farmers are just the most lovely people!

recent_reviews.author: Andy J Heywood 63
recent_reviews.text: A very nice up and coming farm shop. Plenty of eggs, Sour Dough bread to order and local honey.

pumpkin_patches.address: Shudehill Rd, Worsley, Tyldesley, Manchester M28 1BD

recent_reviews.author: Tim J
recent_reviews.text:
We came for the outdoor play area on a summer day and enjoyed seeing a few of the animals.  The outdoor play area is mediocre and I wouldn't recommend for children over about the age of six - it caters more for little ones.
Coffee at the cafe was passable but not great.

recent_reviews.author: Olivia Jane (Liv)
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place for kids! Accessibility is lacking especially the inside play area, as I had to ask for help from two lovely people who had brought their kids to get my nephews wheelchair across the barrier. Food is amazing, and the icecream was one of the best iâ€™ve had!

recent_reviews.author: Z R
recent_reviews.text: Went in the outdoor play area with 3 year old. Coffee a bit overpriced as is the play area which is Â£8 for one child. Having said that it's immaculately clean and even though it seemed quite busy it didn't feel cramped or uncomfortable at all. Don't think it would be quite as enjoyable on a cold day.

recent_reviews.author: Kamal Riyani
recent_reviews.text: This charming tea shop worth visiting with its fantastic staff and delicious food! Perfect for adults and kids. the breakfast was both hearty and well-cooked especially their veggie sausages were really tasty and crispy. setting the stage for an amazing day for kids to have fun in their indoor and outdoor playgrounds. Plenty of toys available in the indoor playground (bear in mind you need to book online to avoid any disappointment when it's very busy) They also have a small space with pets and animals in cages to explore. The friendly staff only added to the positive experience. I will definitely be back again!

pumpkin_patches.address: Outwood Farm, Bolshaw Rd, Heald Green, Cheadle SK8 3PS

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Bell's Farm Shop & Pick Your Own

recent_reviews.author: Stuart Robson
recent_reviews.text: We had possibly the best ever breakfast here. Delicious bacon and sausages, the mushrooms and tomatoes tasted fresh, and the eggs (which Iâ€™m very fussy about) were cooked to perfection. The red and brown sauces tasted like they were homemade and were served in recycled glass jars which was nice. Friendly staff too

recent_reviews.author: aaron mcdermott
recent_reviews.text: Nice place, you can kill a couple of hours walking about. Produce is good and they have bread, cakes etc in the shop as well as a cafe. Farm shop prices are as you'd expect so bear this in mind. Pick your own food is good as well. They do have toilets so don't let that concern you if you have young children. It isn't a hotel, Google seems to think it is.

recent_reviews.author: hawran1212
recent_reviews.text: Great place for family! Most of staff very friendly and keen to help, waitress could wear more appropriate clothes ( uniform,  apron, maybe?) Also little smile from the coffee counter staff member would be beneficial for the business and customers

recent_reviews.author: Suzie Cooper
recent_reviews.text:
Food was great.

Staff were okay. Ignored me at the counter for several minutes whilst making drinks.

Had to ask three times for take home boxes as we had lots left.

Nice containers but no lids !

Asked for extra containers but only offered a sheet of tin foil.

Over Â£60.00 for 3 ploughman's lunches and three hot drinks.

I think we could have been spared an extra container !!

recent_reviews.author: Heather Preval
recent_reviews.text: Best butchers for miles, mark is always ready to greet you with a smile ğŸ˜ƒ

recent_reviews.author: Mick M
recent_reviews.text:
Great place to get reasonably priced fresh  produce from
We must look after our farmers because this lying labour government wont.

recent_reviews.author: Selina Jenkinson
recent_reviews.text: What a gem of a shop.Bought some sirloin steaks recommended by the very amusing and friendly butcher.Simply wonderfull and so tasty.Great selection of meats.

recent_reviews.author: Mandy Franklin
recent_reviews.text: Great quality meat. Very good value for money. Highly recommend

pumpkin_patches.address: Dewsbury Rd, Tingley, Morley, Wakefield WF3 1SH

recent_reviews.author: Katie McHale
recent_reviews.text: Small, cute farm. Staff I interacted with in the cafe were lovely, beautiful food. Cycled there, walked around the farm, and then went to check out the bike trail. However, may be my terrible map/sign using skills, but it wasn't too clear where I could cycle there to me. Of course, it could've been obvious and gone over my head. Went alone but saw children really enjoyed it. Chickens, goats, etc, had a fun time.

recent_reviews.author: charles lam
recent_reviews.text: A small farm with a reasonable entrance fee. There are different animals such as chickens, goats, alpacas, rabbits, and guinea pigs. A beautiful and peaceful place where you can relax and enjoy your time.

recent_reviews.author: Kane F
recent_reviews.text:
Really lovely place to visit. We have been twice now and its a heartwarming place full of lots of cute animals. This time we finally got to see the donkeys and they were sweet and friendly !

It was Â£3 per person which is a very fair price and it's a quiet place with a great community and a real essence of family within caring for the animals. One of our favourite places is the birdwatching area which is small but so full of life. On top of the animals listed such as goats, donkeys, alpacas and sheep, there is more to see within the wild.

This time won't certainly be our last, and we've loved it every time we've come here :)

recent_reviews.author: Jedidiah Ong
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful place just a short bus ride away from the University of Leeds. We didn't see a lot of animals, but I would still say it's worth a visit because the entrance fee is reasonable and the environment was very peaceful. Cafe food was nice as well.

pumpkin_patches.address: Sugar Well Rd, Meanwood, Leeds LS7 2QG

recent_reviews.author: J
recent_reviews.text:
Ordered a pork and stuffing but received a hot beef and onion. Wasnâ€™t edible because of the amount of raw onion that was in it.
The sausage sandwich and sausage rolls were good though

recent_reviews.author: M T
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely brilliant. Visited with my baby and friends, we sat downstairs at first while we played in the big play area. Then when lunch came we went upstairs to the baby/toddler play area and which was much better.
We also had lunch here which was so well priced. The staff are so friendly. This place is absolutely perfect for a well priced dayout.
The only suggest Iâ€™d have is directions to your play area as I wandered into the farm shop and got a bit lost.

recent_reviews.author: Dennis Marshall
recent_reviews.text: The meats great   the bakehouse products superb.  The STAFF ARE UNBELIEVABLE   YESTERDAY I ordered meat to fill my fridge    it was delivered 2 hours later and I am 5 miles away. If you want value for money and old fashioned. Service this is the place

recent_reviews.author: Ann-Marie Pearson
recent_reviews.text:
Â£5 plus stay and play all day for each child. There are different areas for ages and there is a cafe upstairs, farm shop and parking. I'll take more pictures next time. Not open on a Monday every week.

Been today on the 7th may and i could not take any pictures too busy. Â£5 each for the kids and 50p for each adult.

There is no lift for the cafe only stairs.

The only problem there is if you have different ages you can't watch them all in different areas.

The pictures are from toddler area. There are  3 levels to this playgym.

When you leave there is a farm shop.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: The Whole Hogg Farm Shop and Tearoom

recent_reviews.author: Mark Hampson
recent_reviews.text:
Stopped in for a homeward bound breakfast.
Had the 'Yorkshire Breakfast', a tea and a coffee.
Arrived just after 10am on a Thursday,  which was good timing, as it got quite busy after about 10:15am.
Breakfast was fantastic, bacon was probably the best I've ever had. A doorstop of a piece of Black Pudding was very tasty.
Now to have another coffee and a piece of cake...if there's enough room for it.

Oh, they also have Gluten Free options.

A nice little farm shop too

recent_reviews.author: Molly McMillan
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place, great food - we were in for breakfast and it was the perfect way to start the day. Staff weren't the most attentive but we still had a nice meal. Plenty of parking and the shop has so much on offer was a great stop on our trip.

recent_reviews.author: M S
recent_reviews.text:
Great end to a stay just down the road, left our accommodation at 10am and stopped off on the way home, really good breakfast.
Went for The Yorkshire Nahâ€™ then. Quality ingredients and cooked perfectly washed down with a pot of tea. Definitely recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Hazel Richings
recent_reviews.text: After a cheery welcome an excellent feast - baked spud and chilli (mild and tasty)  and a beautiful yorkshire cheeses ploughman with two pots of tea - left us satiated for the whole day.  Clean facilities, spacious car park and a farm shop, with butchery too. WELL worth a visit and well sited, just north of Eden camp on the Pickering road. A169.

recent_reviews.author: Shelby Toulson
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing farm shop!
Great value for money! Fresh quality meat, great variety of meat and pastries, great deal on eggs, plenty of veg and potatoes plus frozen section!
Staff are also very lovely and welcoming â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Petra B
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful location, very tasty eggs & great price, too! 30x medium Fresh Farm eggs for only Â£4! Brilliant. From now on, Iâ€™ll be getting eggs only from here.

recent_reviews.author: Jean Hullock
recent_reviews.text:
Best Farm shop! I have been using Willow Park Farm shop for over 12 years.  It has grown a lot over the years.  The fresh produce is i.e. all meats, eggs, and vegetables are tasty and fresh.  The prices are competitive and worth every penny.
They also have a large selection of ready-made pies. They have great turkeys, fresh chickens, and a frozen goods section.  I highly recommend them and the staff are welcoming too ğŸ˜ƒ.  See you soon, all at Willow Park Farm Shop !!

recent_reviews.author: steve mardon
recent_reviews.text: Entrance and parking sub standard and quality of meat I purchased from an overworked butcher was less than supermarket quality. The eggs were were very good

recent_reviews.author: Justyna Jastrzebska
recent_reviews.text: 5 stars from us! It was good experience! Santa and Mrs Claus were the best, looks so real and playing so well. The staff were very kind and helpful too. All was planned well. After Winter Wonderland we went for a lunch to restaurant. Staff were very kind and food was very nice, we didn't wait long even it was so busy. Overall it was worth the price and we have good memories (including nice photos) :)

recent_reviews.author: Sam Barka
recent_reviews.text: We visited the Winter Wonderland today. We were so impressed with the trail and the set up. The scenes had animatronics and were beautifully decorated. You get opportunities to take photos throughout, including with Santa - which you can purchase at the end. Staff were friendly and the rides at the end were good for the little ones. Overall very happy with our visit and would definitely recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Davina Douglas
recent_reviews.text: Went to see Alice in Wonderland and wasnâ€™t disappointed. The show was amazing our grandchildren were on holiday from France and throughly enjoyed it, have been talking about it ever since. Was fun filled and plenty audience participation. The sound of laughter and excitement from all the children in attendance  was heart warming. Well done everyone involved. Was a great hit. We were  in Gouldings across from the venue to eat. . The food was delicious in a comfortable atmosphere with very welcoming staff. Keep up the great work . We will all be back .

recent_reviews.author: Scott
recent_reviews.text: We went along to Valley View with our 2 year old boy and he had a great time running sound the spacious grass land. Plenty to do for him including sand pit, wooden toboggan race, massive tractor to climb and slide at the top which he didn't want to go down! Small slides and also big slides for the older kids. Massive foot golf field which he loved. We went on the nature trail tractor ride which was Â£1 and worth the money. Friendly staff throughout and the food inside the cafe was nice. We will come back again when he has grown.

recent_reviews.author: Helen Cowan
recent_reviews.text: What a great place for children. Lots for them to do and play on. Plenty of eating benched with umbrellas for adults to watch everything going on. Very good cafe with excellent food and choice.  Thanks to all the staff for making our day.  Friendly,  attentive and fun. â˜ºï¸

recent_reviews.author: Alex Sutherland
recent_reviews.text:
Great area for kids and adults. Had a great day there. Plenty to do. Lots of picnic benches at the front of the park and at the back bit. We had a ball. Has a snack bar where the food was great. Has a restaurant too as well as an ice cream bit. Food was good value for money.

We loved the foot golf, trampolines and sack throwing game.

Parking was good and gift shop was nice.

If there was one negative I'd say it was the area around the bouncy pillow's. It had the black chip stuff around it as most do but it stuck terribly to my sons socks and was a pain to get off.

We got a voucher from Itison which made it even better.

Great day out and would highly recommend it ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Sandra Smith
recent_reviews.text:
Great fun family day out plenty for kids to do particularly 5+ with lots of energy to burn.
Can bring own food and snacks but also plenty to choose from on site and is reasonably priced definitely return again kids loved it

recent_reviews.author: Dougie Gavin
recent_reviews.text: The Winter Wonderland was a great experience and was relatively quiet on a Monday afternoon. Grandson met a welcoming Santa which was good as he was put at ease. Toy shop well stocked for him to choose his present from Santa. The highlight was the free kiddie rides which he loved and the adults enjoyed their hot chocolate, whipped cream and marshmallows included in the price. Will book again next year.

recent_reviews.author: kim baxter
recent_reviews.text: This place rocks for local organic vegetables!  Suppliers to the Locavore shop on Nithsdale drive on the southside of Glasgow and run by lovely local growers.

pumpkin_patches.address: Left Field Market Garden, Kirkton Rd, Neilston, Glasgow G78 3HN

recent_reviews.author: Lynzi McCrorie
recent_reviews.text: A lovely girl called Cheryl signed me up to park farm products and Iâ€™m so glad she did. She was so bubbly and friendly, she is a real asset to your team. She talked through all the different products that were available and explained how the payments and deliveries work - she was very knowledgeable. I have had 2 orders delivered now and been extremely happy both times. The milk is so fresh and tastes amazing. So glad Cheryl chapped my door! Thanks again. Canâ€™t wait for delivery day!

recent_reviews.author: Melissa Stark
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely love our weekly milk delivery from park farm. The milk tastes so much better than the supermarkets and I get peace of mind that no nasties are added to the milk. I love that I can log on up until late at night to add items such as butter, eggs, flavoured milk. Iâ€™ve spoke to Tracy a few times and sheâ€™s so lovely, very helpful and accommodating. Previously used mcqueens dairy and I cancelled pretty quickly due to poor service !! Highly recommend park farm and love that Iâ€™m able to support a local family farm

recent_reviews.author: Dee Hunter
recent_reviews.text: Spoke to the delightful Cheryl and arranged doorstep delivery to new home. Products are excellent. Milk is truly delicious, in glass bottles - taste is amazing. Fresh orange juice is exactly that - fresh and tasty. Eggs are enormous and full of flavour. Great service - highly recommended. Thank you guys.

recent_reviews.author: S Martin
recent_reviews.text: The whole milk is the best I have tasted. Fresh and creamy. Deliveries are great!

pumpkin_patches.address: Hurlawcrook Rd, Auldhouse, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 0QL

recent_reviews.author: Garry McHutchieson
recent_reviews.text:
Excellent place.  My daughter loves it.
Excellent training and prices.

recent_reviews.author: Clare Davie
recent_reviews.text: Amazing awsome and fantastic my girls love it here

recent_reviews.author: di Cochrane
recent_reviews.text: Grand daughter loves tuition here

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Mayhew
recent_reviews.text: Amazing place. Xx

recent_reviews.author: Jennifer Davies
recent_reviews.text: These are the most beautiful veg boxes, the veg is always delicious and I love the variety you get, including the wee tub of microgreens! The potatoes are my husband's favourite! Great value for the produce and home delivery service.

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Crichton
recent_reviews.text:
Great area with no light pollution to see the Northern Lights.

Another appearance from the Northern Lights last night (10/10/2024) at the same location.

recent_reviews.author: Lisa
recent_reviews.text: This is the second year weâ€™ve had the veg box delivered weekly. I love having fresh local veg each week and always look forward to seeing what we get each week and coming up with recipes. The garlic is the best Iâ€™ve ever tasted but the turnips are my real favourite. Looking forward to next year already.

recent_reviews.author: Rhoda McVey
recent_reviews.text: We love the deliveries we get from Kinkell, lovely crisp fresh microgreens, and we're getting the veg boxes now too. Such a great variety of veg and always fresh, with wonderful taste. We've been using them for a couple of years now and thoroughly recommend them.

recent_reviews.author: ARLENE TOMASZEWSKA
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful place with absolutely fab views! Heaven on earth ğŸ’—ğŸ’—ğŸ’—ğŸ’—ğŸ’—ğŸ’—

recent_reviews.author: Alan Morr
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Nicky Currall
recent_reviews.text: First visit to the garden centre and we werenâ€™t disappointed.  A lovely shopping area which is light and bright.  It was that time of the day when food was needed!  A good variety of food for meat eaters and vegetarians however not sure on a vegan choice.  Fairly priced on the whole , a little disappointed by the number of wedges given for Â£6.95 however that would not deter us from eating there again.  The staff without exception were smart and friendly which is a definite plus.  This might sound silly but the toilets were spotless too although the restaurant had been full - so thatâ€™s another thumbs up! Well done to all.

recent_reviews.author: Diane Mackinnon
recent_reviews.text: Great variety of plants and some good offers on them! Enjoyed the steak pie as well!

recent_reviews.author: Michael Ball
recent_reviews.text: Bought some gifts and then on to the restaurant. It was very busy, as always at lunchtime, but we did not have to wait long for a table. Food was delicious, freshly prepared and served by friendly staff. Not the first time that we have eaten here and it wonâ€™t be the last. Personally, I would say it serves the best food out of all the garden centres in the area, good value too!

recent_reviews.author: Elaine Murdoch
recent_reviews.text:
Back for another lunch - love the salads here - well worth the one hour drive !!!

Had lunch with a friend here today - both opted for the Paradise Chicken special with salad and chips - well wow, what an amazing dish - the salad was huge, the chicken was delicious - both totally loved it. Great staff. Havenâ€™t been for a while (due to distance) but looks like the cafe has had a makeover - really comfy seats as well. Fantastic place.

pumpkin_patches.address: Dalpatrick Farm, Lanark Rd, Rosebank, Clyde Valley, Carluke ML8 5QA

recent_reviews.author: Helen Cowan
recent_reviews.text:
Had a wonderful time pumpkin picking today. They have grown lots of varieties and you can pick them from the plant! Lovely little photo booth for after too. A bit of spooky decor, my 3 year old loved it.
Will be back to get some nice fresh veg and noticed some sprouts growing in the neighbouring field so will be back for the Christmas dinner veg

recent_reviews.author: Liam Povey-Dunn
recent_reviews.text:
Our local farm shop. It's literally a walk through our woods. Often have a walk through with the dog or my son and buy some produce. Go every year to pick our own pumpkins.

Lovely little family run farm.

recent_reviews.author: Ruth Thomas
recent_reviews.text: I went to Vineyard farm for the first time today and was very pleasantly surprised at the choice, quality and price of the fruit and veg.  The two ladies were very helpful and I will definitely be going back.  Beats supermarket produce any day.

recent_reviews.author: Pamela Foulkes
recent_reviews.text: Lots of good quality pumpkins, and staff were absolutely lovely xx

pumpkin_patches.address: Poulton Rd, Bebington, Birkenhead, Wirral CH63 9LQ

recent_reviews.author: Joe T
recent_reviews.text:
Good fun for the kids. Dress appropriately and remember this is nature so don't start moaning when you're kids end up covered in mud.
What I will say is that the parking area is just a field. When it's waterlogged, I imagine it would be easy to get your car stuck. The biggest improvement for me would be to chuck some gravel down in between the rows of parking.

recent_reviews.author: SoaringHighChris
recent_reviews.text: At the end of a narrow rural road (be careful, some drivers don't care that you should CAUTIOUSLY drive down this road - which has blind corners), Sandy Lane Farm is a fun place to take the family for a few hours for some crop picking (in early October it is mostly Pumpkins). One major benefit of this farm (at least for Pumpkins) is NO need to book - unsurprising as the field is full of Pumpkins of all shapes & colours ! Parking spaces are plentiful too - although during wetter weather, be careful as there will be a lot of mud around ! As well as crop picking, a minature railway operates, kids face painting is sometimes available, & there is a small kids play area. The Hayloft is the site cafe, with friendly staff, nice food & drink ... but it is a little pricey (Â£3.00+ for a Tea).

recent_reviews.author: Ian Steadman
recent_reviews.text: We went for afternoon tea, which was delicious. We were able to tell them items we did not want on our sandwiches, which they were happy to oblige us. Staff were very friendly and all covid regulations were adhered to. We would certainly visit again.

recent_reviews.author: Sian Oldfield
recent_reviews.text: We went in the corn maze which was Â£2 each for adults and then went pumpkin picking. Its best to wear your wellys. Theres a little train ride up to the maze and pumkins. Which was Â£1.50 one way but works out cheaper if you got a return. If you want a massive pumkin its best to skip the train so you  an take a wheel barrow up to the field. It was a good day. Wouldn't be that good in the rain though. Massive pumpkins are 10pound. Theres wash stations to clean the pumkins off and your wellys.

pumpkin_patches.address: Sandy Ln, Great Sankey, Widnes WA8 3XP

recent_reviews.author: Aidan Q
recent_reviews.text: We visited the farm yesterday with our daughter (18m) and we all had a brilliant time! Theres plenty of animals and you can feed most of them, which our daughter loved. The facilities and great, and the train ride was brill. The staff are super friendly and helpful, especially Ryan who took the time to talk to us and introduced our daughter to plenty of animals and critters, he was very informative and was a real credit to the farm. The food from the cafe was lovely, especially the burger! Can't recommend this place enough, we look forward to returning.

recent_reviews.author: Maria Martin
recent_reviews.text:
Staff and animals were very friendly!
I went with my great Nephews both under 3 and sister.
We rode the train which they loved.
Hands on with the guinea pigs too.

recent_reviews.author: Lindsay Davies
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely great day out for the younger ones. Staff were really lovely and friendly, cafe was spot on, and lots to do all for a great price. Really enjoyed the day, deffo return â­ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Claire Chapple
recent_reviews.text: Great farm to take the kids to. Lots to see and do. The young guy who was on the rabbit and guinea pig area was really great and knowledgeable about all the animals. We sat and held the rabbits and guinea pigs and fed the baby lambs. Not just a day out for kids but great for adults too. Great little train ride around the farm.soft play area for kids. Cafe food expensive and not great so Iâ€™d advise take a packed lunch. Overall staff lovely welcoming, place is clean and really great fun, lots of free parking.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Sandhill Strawberry, Pumpkin & Christmas Tree Farm

recent_reviews.author: Alex Chong
recent_reviews.text:
My girlfriend, her family and I visited this hidden gem of a place last summer and what a delightful experience it turned out to be.

As a permanent city dweller, this was my first attempt at strawberry picking so naturally, novelty played a part in my excitement. Newness aside however, I have found Sandhill Farm to be a lovely place, run by warm, welcoming people. If you happen to be around and youâ€™re up for some family fun, I would not hesitate to recommend you check this place out.

Before you plan your visit however, I strongly suggest that you either check their website/ social media or give them a call to make sure that your produce of choice is currently in season. It does say on their website that they rotate between strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, pumpkins and Christmas trees.

recent_reviews.author: Jolanta JAKUBOWSKA
recent_reviews.text:
Visited this farm today in the sun. Very easy to find, literally just off junction of M62. Had a great time picking fresh strawberries out of a huge field. Beautiful, fresh tasting strawberries ğŸ“ and at a bargain price ğŸ˜‹.
I would definitely recommend anyone wanting a nice trip out with family.

recent_reviews.author: Donna Williams
recent_reviews.text: Such a cute day. I've never done strawberry picking before so didn't know what to expect. I would wear long trousers & enclosed shoes next time. We got a bit lost finding the strawberry fields but all part of the adventure ğŸ“

recent_reviews.author: Anam Raja
recent_reviews.text: We absolutely enjoyed strawberry picking however they werenâ€™t many leftğŸ˜­ maybe the time we went which was in June- but I kid you not theyâ€™re soo sweet and a lot better than the supermarkets. I would definitely recommend this as a family activity especially if you have younger ones. Old couple were soo nice and greeted us well â€¦ card payment is available however it goes by signal and that can be difficult- so just carry cash also. Our baskets total was around Â£11. My sister and I filled it to the very top so worth the money.

pumpkin_patches.address: Warrington Rd, Rainhill, Widnes, Prescot L35 6PG

recent_reviews.author: Jodie Blackwell
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place to visit. They have various events/activities running all year round. Currently strawberry/fruit pick your own. Good prices. There is a play area alongside a little cafe which serves light food, ice creams and milkshakes etc. Public toilets. A farm shop with lots of fresh food. They also have a Whole Moo World milkshake vending machine which is delicious!

recent_reviews.author: Sheila Joynes
recent_reviews.text: Good food and ice cream in the cafe. An excellent farm shop with a separate dairy section. Nice children's play area. Plenty of parking. Pleasant, helpful staff. A row of 6 EV chargers including CHAdeMO. And only a few minutes off Junction 11A on the M5. What's not to like?

recent_reviews.author: Paul O'Connell
recent_reviews.text:
I've driven past this PYO a few times when travelling to and from Gloucester, and although I live around 50 miles away, I thought on a weekend I'd pick up some PYO.

Arrived with my partner and 4-legged friend. The place was busy but managed to get parked. The PYO is in a separate hut to the cafe or shop. I asked for 2 punnets (1 for strawberries and raspberries). I went to walk in with my partner and dog and immediately told no dogs. I asked why and was told because that's the rule.. (no explanation, no signage, and nothing on the website).

I entered the strawberry bays and found a really poor quality of fruits. Some of the plants were overgrown with weeds, and much of the fruit was either small and withered or just small and hard. I ended up walking 4 bays to fill what was around a third of the punnet. So after negotiating the children picking and eating every berry they could lay their hands on, I decided to  head to the raspberry bays.

What a disappointment. The plants were in a poor state with quite a few dead, dried up and other with fruit already savaged by mites and other insects.

I walked back to pay for my strawberries. When I arrived back, they placed the strawberries in the punnet straight on the scales. There was no mention in the pricing per kg that the punnets' weight was included, which I do think should be stated. In the end, they cost me almost Â£6

Took them home and to be openly honest the quality was no better than supermarket. It was not a great experience.

recent_reviews.author: Nivesh Mangal
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm shop near Gloucester and Cheltenham and about 45 mins from Bristol, and a great place for PYO (pick your own) fruit outing, particularly strawberries, and raspberries during the month of June. You pay for the total weight including the weight of the punnet provided which can be taken home and then reused for free next time if we understood it correctly. Very helpful and kind staff as well. Ample spots for parking for both PYO and Farm shop visitors. Hoping to revisit this spot with friends again soon.

recent_reviews.author: Niki
recent_reviews.text:
The pick your own bouquet flower meadow is such a lovely idea, we visited on a Saturday and there were a steady flow of other visitors whilst we were there without it ever feeling crowded.
A safe space for little ones with some supervision, there's a well equipped mud kitchen with plenty of toys and pots and pans to go round, dogs are welcome too on lead.
The farm shop had a lovely selection of fruit and veg, we took some home and had it later the same day for dinner, everything was super fresh, tasty and delicious. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend and would definitely return for another visit.

recent_reviews.author: oliver cullen
recent_reviews.text: Perfection

pumpkin_patches.address: Five Acre Farm, Backwell, West Town, Bristol BS48 3BQ

recent_reviews.author: Kwang Sujinno
recent_reviews.text:
A lovely hidden gem in the heart of the city! The City Farm is a peaceful, welcoming space that offers a refreshing break from the urban hustle. Itâ€™s completely free to enter and you can get up close with a variety of friendly animals.

Thereâ€™s a cozy little cafÃ© on-site. They also sell plants and products, so you can support the farm while picking up something special.

recent_reviews.author: Leighanne Bailey
recent_reviews.text: You can pet and feed the sheep and goats easily. They have groups for adults with additional needs and children's clubs. They do lots of community programs, and you can rent spaces for parties. Great cafe and a pub across the street, too. They also sell farm-reared meat and fresh eggs. Lovely bit of outdoor space.

recent_reviews.author: Paul Southgate
recent_reviews.text:
What a wonderful place.  St Werburghâ€™s City Farm is the sort of place that makes you stop and thinkâ€”think about life, about community, about the sheer, unadulterated joy of doing something useful with your hands instead of hammering away at KPIs and ROI projections that will ultimately mean nothing when youâ€™re worm food.

We came here today as part of a work volunteering scheme. And this is, quite honestly, one of the best days of the year for me.

Our host for the day was the utterly brilliant Alex, the farmâ€™s site manager. You meet a lot of people in life, and some of them just get it. Alex gets it. He has the rare ability to be both welcoming and efficient, gently herding our corporate rabble into something resembling a useful workforce without once making us feel like we were in the way (which, letâ€™s be honest, we probably were).

We dug holes. We built fences. We did some plumbing. We even built benches. But more than anything, we took time out of our lives to be in nature, to be with people, to be part of something real.

Because thatâ€™s what this farm is: something real. Itâ€™s for the community, run by the community, benefitting the community. It reminds us that life isnâ€™t about boardrooms or spreadsheets, but about connection, about getting your hands dirty and actually doing something.

If you get the chance to visit, go. If you get the chance to volunteer, definitely go. Youâ€™ll do yourself some good. Youâ€™ll do the community some good. And, in the end, thatâ€™s what life is really about.

recent_reviews.author: Steve McGlynn
recent_reviews.text: A wonderful place  for a Saturday morning breakfast,  staff lovely,  food fantastic and the overall morning excellent. Recommended if you got kids, come, got a dog, come, got a craving for probably the best bacon sandwich in Bristol definitely come.

recent_reviews.author: Michael Darvill
recent_reviews.text: The shop has a good selection. Some of the staff however need better hygiene training and attitude. Went in to get a sandwich. Sign on the counter had a list of â€˜sandwichâ€™ fillings. Asked the young person behind the counter for a ham sandwich. After scratching her scalp with her blue hygiene gloves I was told a little abruptly by a more senior member that they didnâ€™t do sandwichâ€™s only rolls. I didnâ€™t buy a roll as I didnâ€™t want one made by someone who had just been scratching her head. We did buy some meat from the butcher, who was helpful and the person on the til was pleasant. It is just the counter staff need customer service and hygiene training.

recent_reviews.author: Ruth Revell
recent_reviews.text: Really good value freshly made to order rolls, perfect for a hike on Mendip :)

recent_reviews.author: Weekend Wildness
recent_reviews.text:
A cracking local farm shop on the A38 airport road.
This place has been here for years and never ceases to satisfy the local produce shoppers like me.
The range in here is quite extensive and the food is always of an excellent standard.
A butcher to sort you out the right size chop, cut to your liking, the same for the pies, pastry and quices. Fresh fruit and dairy, and a lovely selection of local ciders.
There is also a no packaging section where you can weigh your own produce. Nice touch.
The parking is plentiful and the access is easy. Plenty of room for wheelchair users too.

recent_reviews.author: Jolanta Bathe-Taylor
recent_reviews.text: Great farm shop to top up on quality farm products. Their butter is my favourite butter I have ever tasted. Meet is also of very good quality. It's not the cheapest of places, but it's well worth it.

pumpkin_patches.address: Lye Cross Rd, Redhill, Bristol BS40 5RH

recent_reviews.author: Sassy BB
recent_reviews.text: A lovely farm park.  We had a great day! The animal experiences are inexpensive, but unfortunately, we didn't book one this time. We definitely will do next time we go. The indoor play barn was great, as were all of the outdoor play areas. The dinosaur trail was good fun. The cafe was nice, will try the restaurant cafe next time. All in all, a great day out for adults and children.

recent_reviews.author: Marc Dyche
recent_reviews.text: A great place. Clean, tidy, cheap. Animals well looked after with ample space. Farmland animals, birds of prey, dinosaurs! Huge play areas indoor and out. Highly recommended

recent_reviews.author: Simon Space (Mr Space)
recent_reviews.text: Itâ€™s an amazing place, good family day out if you have younger children. Really kind & helpful staff. Toilets are clean. The food is good. Foam parties, animal petting & other animal events at certain times. Not a bad word can be said really. It is aimed at young families, say children up to 10 or 11 at a push. A sunny day is best as less is out on those grey rainy days. Play barn is nice & well equipped.

recent_reviews.author: Phil
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant place to take your kids lots to do ,from farm animals, birds of pray ,dinosaurs, and great play areas great value for money friendly staff good food restaurant well worth a visit

pumpkin_patches.address: Castle Hill, East Leake, Loughborough LE12 6LU

recent_reviews.author: Sandra Carty
recent_reviews.text: Great fruit and veg, lovely service. It's a shame the owner kerps selling land our village is loosing all it's beautiful farm land the very reason I moved here 6 years ago only to have the field at the back of my home turned into a housing estate. Farm shop sells lively food.

recent_reviews.author: Liam Richardson
recent_reviews.text: Friendly staff. Small farm shop with a great selection of high quality fruit, vegetables curds, pickles & meats. In addition sales of top soil, wood chip & fire wood are also available.

recent_reviews.author: bobby sharma
recent_reviews.text: Lovely experience today, brought some lovely fresh fruit& veg, plus some bags of manure for the garden. Nice lady at the farm shop, very friendly and polite.

recent_reviews.author: P J
recent_reviews.text: Have been buying fie logs from here for years, great choice and called for money. Plus as a treat I always  buy the unique Ginger drink they sell rhere too. (Full of flavour!!)

recent_reviews.author: Kayleigh
recent_reviews.text: Gorse Hill City Farm is such a great place to visit. I love seeing all the animals. There are some really interesting characters there. They also do delicious food, the menu has lots of options for breakfast and lunch.

recent_reviews.author: Rhea Louise
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little farm and very cheap for families. Lots of cute animals to see and the staff are very polite.

recent_reviews.author: Roaa Dawood
recent_reviews.text: The place was beautiful and I really enjoyed seeing the llama, which is my favorite. Unfortunately, the pigs were sleeping inside, so we couldnâ€™t see them. However, the ticket price didnâ€™t feel reasonable compared to the activities and the time we spent there (about 2â€“3 hours). The kids absolutely loved the play area that was definitely the highlight for them.

recent_reviews.author: iMaverick
recent_reviews.text: A relatively small yet well maintained farm. If you arrive early you can find parking up near entrance otherwise some more parking at the bottom of hill. The on site restaurant has some good options not particularly dine out type but some conventional take out like food. The selection of farm animals is small and the cows are scattered in fields so do get your wellies . onsite there is a children play park as well and outdoor sitting to have food. Overall a good experience and time well spent.

recent_reviews.author: Marisela Cabrera Umbria
recent_reviews.text: We purchased 4 fillet steaks, and they were absolutely delicious, perfect ğŸ‘Œ We also bought gluten-free burgers and mince meat.  Very good quality and super friendly stuff at the Primrose Hill stall.

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Addison
recent_reviews.text:
I came here with my son to have a look about as I drive past this farm quite regularly when I'm driving from Thurmaston Shopping, and I decide to take the country roads rather than the busy route home. The last time I came here was during Covid, so I didn't have a chance to look around due to the pandemic.

The staff were lovely. It was lovely to see a variety of farm animals, lovely dogs, and my son was able to feed the hens and goats, where you can buy the feed for Â£1.50 near the till.
I brought a glass bottle of milk, x6 eggs, onions, and garlic. Sadly, the butchers weren't open today, but on whole, it was a lovely visit, and I definitely will be returning.

recent_reviews.author: Laura Franks
recent_reviews.text: Currently at the horniman easter fair...worst hot dog ever. The sausage was a horrible texture and the skin tough as rubber. Just awful. Don't waste your time.

recent_reviews.author: Leigh Paling
recent_reviews.text:
I did an online order. A couple of things weren't in stock after ordering but I wasn't too fussed. I had received a call to let me know and the woman on the phone was really nice.
My order came when there were floods everywhere, so I was expecting my order to be cancelled. However, they drove through the floods via tractor to deliver the food to sub contract couriers so the customers could get their delivery. Top service if you ask me.
The fruits and vegetables that I received were all lovely and fresh.

pumpkin_patches.address: The Cottage, King St, Barkby Thorpe, Leicester LE7 3QF

recent_reviews.author: Lee in Lincolnshire
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant venue to take the family at anytime of the year. We attended the open farm day and the day was perfect, tractor rides, animal feeding, food/drink and activities for the kiddies.

recent_reviews.author: Craig Walker
recent_reviews.text: We enjoyed picking the pumpkins, walked up to the farm, got the kids some Halloween toys from the stalls they had food and drinks as well, next time I'm having a scotch egg for sure! Good hours out side on a nice autum day

recent_reviews.author: Paul Gilbert
recent_reviews.text: Always a lovely place to visit and pick pumpkins, and excellent refreshments on offer.

recent_reviews.author: Anita Truhane
recent_reviews.text: Nice farm

recent_reviews.author: Martin Mcdonnell
recent_reviews.text:
Great quality spuds and veg generally. Glad places like this still exist. They need supporting.
Owner loves a pop quiz  challenge while you're perusing.

recent_reviews.author: John Broome
recent_reviews.text: The vegetables etc were all good unfortunately they didn't sell milk. This was the reason for my visit

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Dunmore
recent_reviews.text: Was shut during its opening hours. Even said, open on the door, but was locked. Can't give it more than one star as couldn't get in.

recent_reviews.author: Elliot
recent_reviews.text:
First time using a farm shop, as itâ€™s local I thought Iâ€™d walk in there and have a look. I bought a tray of free range large eggs and some very nice jam for my partner. Will definitely be coming back!
please support your local farm shop if you can, itâ€™s great for the community.

recent_reviews.author: T M
recent_reviews.text:
Always a tasty and filling breakfast here.
Service can be quite slow at busy times but always with a smile. Love how dog friendly it is.
Sad to see the shop had reduced their food selection in favour of decor/homeware type items that you see everywhere. Much prefer the previous fuller selection of produce.

recent_reviews.author: Cate McNerney
recent_reviews.text:
A lovely welcome by the cafe staffâ€¦ even though it was towards the end of a very busy day!
Very good coffee and tea.
Choice of alternatives to cows milk (Served in a decent size jug!) with the tea.
Generous portion of gluten free coffee cake.
The chips are delicious. They are served with salt, vinegar, a variety of optional of sauces or a generous serving of mayonnaise.!
There  is a spacious play area for children and a beautiful view across the countryside from the terrace.
Everything is good quality andâ€¦ very reasonably priced!

recent_reviews.author: Sharon Birket
recent_reviews.text: Had a lovely time feeding the lambs, and meeting a few other animal residents. Lunch was good, and staff were really friendly.

recent_reviews.author: EvelinaM EvelinaM
recent_reviews.text: Great restaurant. We had lunch on Good Saturday and the atmosphere, and the food was great. Amazing Farm shop. Very friendly staff. Very nice Easter egg hunting for kids

pumpkin_patches.address: Fosse Wy., Hunningham, Leamington Spa CV33 9EL

recent_reviews.author: Andrea Scrutton
recent_reviews.text:
This is a fantastic location, myself and my colleagues have been visiting for a couple of years now.  From over 10+ visits we have never had a bad meal, it is always excellent.  The staff are friendly, the atmosphere is great, and importantly the food is amazing.

It is set in the countryside, the restaurant has lovely views, a wander down to the tepee lets you see the piglets, pigmy goats and the allotment.

The burgers are so good, and the steaks, all locally sourced food.  We have even had 2 work events hiring the tepee area and having a BBQ, it's the highlight of our work social calendar.  Oh, and the mocktails are fab!

recent_reviews.author: Tracie Roberts
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic setting outside in the garden. The tepee area was closed due to private function had just finished and the staff were cleaning up. Signage asked for you to order via the QR Code on the menu, this didnâ€™t work well as we couldnâ€™t add extras or omit food from the order. Had to order at the bar in the end, which was much easier.
I asked the server if I should take the cutlery and condiments and she said no they will be brought over with the food. When the food arrived around 40 minutes later with a different server she said you need to fetch your own cutlery and was a little rude. Salad was very large and very good. Would definitely return.

recent_reviews.author: E Hassan
recent_reviews.text: I always love visiting The Barn (Cafe) for their almond croissants ğŸ¥ since Iâ€™m a coffee and croissant lover. I've been to almost all the nice cafes in the UK, so I highly recommend this place. However, the only challenge is that they only make a few croissants, and whenever I've visitedâ€”whether in the early morning or the afternoonâ€”Iâ€™ve never managed to get two from the shelf. The coffee is nice, but the almond croissants ğŸ¥ are definitely worth trying!

recent_reviews.author: Blecyn
recent_reviews.text:
Really lovely place and nice view.
I have been here twice and each time I want to return with friends or family because I know they would love it.
