I love how they serve, gives a fine dine vibes.

The dessert ğŸ¨ is one of the best I have ever had! Twice now and I just want to try every dessert on their menu.
Surprisingly no service charge.
The person that brought our starter is so friendly, the same experience we had with him last time. I will definitely get to know his name next time.

Clean environment
Clean restroom ğŸš»

pumpkin_patches.address: Berryfields Farm, Berkswell Rd, Meriden, Coventry CV7 7LB

recent_reviews.author: Pam H
recent_reviews.text: We have been a few times when passing on our bikes - always had cake and coffee, or hot chocolate - which is the best my husband has ever had.  Cakes have always been delicious.  Never had lunch due to the times we've visited, but the menu always looks lovely.  The farm shop is also worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Charlie Dilk
recent_reviews.text: one of the best breakfasts that iv ever had. such fresh local food! and a very skilled chef.could not fault a single thing. great farm shop to, lots of amazing produce

recent_reviews.author: Sam Lloyd
recent_reviews.text:
Many thanks to Tracey and the team for making our friends 30th birthday afternoon tea so fantastic.
The sandwiches were lovely and fresh scones delicious.
Everyone made such an effort. Would highly recommend.
Thank you !

recent_reviews.author: Chris Thornthwaite
recent_reviews.text: Great wee place for breakfasts and lunch, butchers and fresh produce to buy local

recent_reviews.author: El. P.
recent_reviews.text:
Had a lovely breakfast here over the weekend!
Visited before a dog show and was very pleased both with the service and the food. Very nice ingredients, loved the bacon!
Absolutely wonderful selection of pastries as well!
Recommended.

Dog friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Mahgoub El-Badawi
recent_reviews.text:
Overall a really nice experience, friendly staff, with plenty of options for seating inside or outside. Dog friendly places, so feel free to bring them with you.

What I ordered:
Sunshine Fritters-
The salad was delicious, unfortunately they only gave us 2 fritters which was very disappointing- but flavour wise was great.
Iced Americano-
As you'd expect
Chocolate and cherry slice -
A good balance between tartness and sweetness, easy to recommend

recent_reviews.author: The RR Project (Athi)
recent_reviews.text:
Very convenient with online food order to the table, food were pretty nice and service were pretty quick too. Another plus that the place is dog friendly which for us is always a bonus.

Recommend the food there or a coffee and cake.  Price is not bad about Â£15 for main and Â£10 for food sandwiches.

If you enjoy reading this review, please give me a thumbs up and follow me for more contents. I would be gratefully appreciated ğŸ™ğŸ‘â¤ï¸

Thank you

recent_reviews.author: caroline flinn
recent_reviews.text: Opens at 0730 for the restaurant. A good menu, lots of choice, with many healthy dishes. Nice comfortable chairs, with seats front and back. A shop selling homeware goods and food/drink. Also, with outdoor seating.

pumpkin_patches.address: National Agricultural Centre, Stoneleigh, Kenilworth CV8 2LG

recent_reviews.author: Ellla LL
recent_reviews.text: Very nice service. Delicious potatoes and eggs. Affordable price. Every year I buy a Christmas tree for Christmas. I recommend

recent_reviews.author: deborah craner
recent_reviews.text:
Very good friendly service , fruit and veg nice and fresh , potatoes, always available .
And kindling ,logs for sale if you have a open fire or fire pit.
Recommended  friendly family run business

recent_reviews.author: John Rendall
recent_reviews.text: Great farm shop, great for eggs and potatoes....no dairy (milk, butter) but nice veggies, logs and kindling.

recent_reviews.author: Charmaine Thorneycroft
recent_reviews.text: Fresh veg good prices Sarah is friendly and helpful highly recommend

recent_reviews.author: Chris Cownden
recent_reviews.text: I've been volunteering at Five Acre Farm now since November and love everything about the place. I've made some great friends and learnt so much about tending the land. As an ex-chef, I've enjoyed getting closer to my food routes. If you are looking for a new place to volunteer or just want some peace and quiet or want to try some organic vegetables, then you'll be in the right place. No need to sign up, just come along on Saturday at 10am-1pm. See you there.

recent_reviews.author: Angela Martin
recent_reviews.text: I really enjoyed volunteering here this morning. It's peaceful and good to learn more about organic growing. â¤ï¸ğŸª´

recent_reviews.author: Ash
recent_reviews.text: They provide amazing vegtables, fruit and plants that are organic and fresh. Everything is top quality stuff and I would chose this seasonal food over the supermarket food

recent_reviews.author: Kent Rainey
recent_reviews.text: Great place we get a veg box from here every week

pumpkin_patches.address: C/o Ryton Gardens, Wolston Lane, Coventry, Ryton on Dunsmore CV8 3LG

recent_reviews.author: Billz Ali
recent_reviews.text: Could do with more lighting and cutting bushes so it looks even nicer

recent_reviews.author: emily
recent_reviews.text: What a GEM! Fabulous little spot in the prettiest location serving delicious food. A very warm welcome with staff being very friendly. I have a gluten allergy and they catered very well for me. Totally recommend visiting here!

recent_reviews.author: Peter Williams
recent_reviews.text: A most excellent find - incredibly friendly owner-staff, a warm welcome and really tasty food at excellent prices. This industrial chic deli/take-away/dine-in in the village centre has a wide selection of menu meals, cakes, snacks, and drinks.  The atmosphere is friendly, and the service quick and efficient - but you don't feel rushed. We went for a weekend breakfast and will definitely repeat the experience next time we are in the area (and even travel for it!).  The premises is easily accessible for people with limited mobility - although the toilet facilities are a bit of an adventure for anyone (obtain key-walk a few doors down the pavement - up a side alley and unlock!) and I suspect not easy for people with mobility issues, or children. But this one slight negative is vastly outweighed for me by the excellence in every other sense.

recent_reviews.author: Anne-Marie Goodwin
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little deli with delicious food, it was really hard to make a decision when ordering as so many items on the menu were tempting me! I went for the New Yorker Bagel (fantastic) and took a Biscoff Brownie home (divine). Friendly staff and cosy seats. Will definitely be back!

recent_reviews.author: Emma Wing
recent_reviews.text:
Just collected 2 beautiful Gyros from Pumpkins, was really busy as usual and we were glad we had called ahead to pre order our food. The staff were really busy but made sure they acknowledged the people waiting at the till.  Apologized for the wait, but the food was definitely worth waiting for.
Will definitely use again

recent_reviews.author: Maxine Baldwin
recent_reviews.text: Livery Yard on a working farm. Very knowledgeable owners who are down to earth,professional and lovely to deal with. Big airy stables, hay and straw available on site. Good facilities with reasonable rates. This is a fabulous environment for the horses to get use to cows and all types of machinery/vehicles. Nice location for hacking. Our horses settled quickly and are very happy which makes us very happy.

recent_reviews.author: Chris Woodfield
recent_reviews.text: I ordered and received a first class wooden sculpture of an owl, all contact with Rachel was good and the whole experience was easy and friendly and efficient.

pumpkin_patches.address: Birch Tree Farm, Wall Hill Rd, Allesley, Coventry CV5 9EN

recent_reviews.author: Mo
recent_reviews.text: It was a lovely day to go strawberry picking, parking was plenty and it was not too busy which made it all the more pleasant. Took our 3 year old with us, and he had a great time. The fruit was lovely and fresh, and the shop was a great place to take a break. Would definitely go again, when the raspberries are plentiful and prime.

recent_reviews.author: Scott Glaberman
recent_reviews.text: It is scandalous how good the strawberries are here. Under each bush is a treasure trove of perfectly coloured strawberries. The raspberries were good too, but peaked the week before. Definitely have to time the season right. Staff were friendly too. Plenty of parking.

recent_reviews.author: T G
recent_reviews.text: Discovered this place recently and had a lovely experience with the kids. There were plenty of strawberries, all fresh and juicy. The location was easy to access and perfect for a family outing

recent_reviews.author: YSW
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely day out. So many strawberries and they were so sweet and fresh. No admission fee and price of strawberries were unbeatable.  Lots of strawberries were rotten as they were over ripen. Quite in a Monday morning.
The coconut crunch biscuit in the farm shop was very tasty.

pumpkin_patches.address: Scaddows Farm, Scaddows Ln, Ticknall, Derby DE73 7JP
The Sunflower Place, Wolston, Coalpit Ln, Wolston, Coventry CV8 3GB

recent_reviews.author: bex berry
recent_reviews.text: Really nice food here! From whole free-range chicken and meats to veg, deserts and very good home frown products. A bit on the expensive side but well worth the extra few quid! Goats, kids play area, ponies and an Alpaca ğŸ¦™

recent_reviews.author: Sarah B
recent_reviews.text: Lovely location with plenty of parking. Great choice of fruits and vegetables. Lovely bread and other quality items. Ice cream to die for and super quality meat and deli from the butchers counter. Also get yourself one of their freshly made baps, cobs, tea cakes, rollsğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚depending on where youâ€™re fromğŸ™„ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ theyâ€™re fab!!ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ™‚ Thereâ€™s also a few animals the children can shout at!ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚

recent_reviews.author: M T
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely lovely farm shop, itâ€™s only small, but has a really good and well priced selection of stuff. The staff are friendly, Iâ€™d definitely recommend a visit.
We fed the donkeys some carrots, I think maybe with someone who comes regular or someone that works there, and my son loved it. Love seeing the animals happy. There was also a really lovely small kids play area. A great place, total hidden gem.

recent_reviews.author: Diane Robinson
recent_reviews.text:
First visit here was last Wednesday, on the strength of media report of an Award.
Purchased various items, one of which was a Sirloin Steak - all we can say is WOW, enjoyed this amazing tasty tender steak last evening.
We live the other side of Pennines, but worth the the 40 minute drive.
Will be back soon

pumpkin_patches.address: Lane End Farm, Tong Ln, Bradford BD4 0RY

recent_reviews.author: Chris Gill
recent_reviews.text: I visited here for the first time to get some ham and beef for Christmas. Wow, the meat is lovely. Plenty of flavour and great in sandwiches. Good value too

recent_reviews.author: Agnieszka WÃ³jcik
recent_reviews.text: Small farm shop but with a big amount of fresh food. You can buy here fresh eggs, different kind of meat, cheese and vegetable. Various jams are in an offert. Family atmosphere and reasonable prices. A small car park in a front of the shop.

recent_reviews.author: John Edwards
recent_reviews.text: Nice shop & produce, & learnt a bit about the farm from the staff. Nice experience.

recent_reviews.author: Elizabeth M. Flint
recent_reviews.text: I always try to buy local so this shop is a treasure of great home produced meat and many local grocery items including jams, sauces, sweet and savoury pies and fresh veg, they also do oak dried kindling for fires. They produced a delicious bbq pack for me in the summer and I look forward to the beef this Christmas. They are always happy to help in a friendly little shop.

recent_reviews.author: Parveen Shah
recent_reviews.text:
A Hidden Gem for Families!

This farm is absolutely beautiful, set against a stunning backdrop that adds to the charm. It's exceptionally clean and well-maintained, with a great variety of animals to see and interact with. The playground is thoughtfully designed, offering endless fun for children of all ages. There are plenty of picnic benches, making it perfect for a relaxed day out. Our visit was made even more special by the gorgeous sunshine â€” it really brought the whole place to life. Highly recommended for a family day trip!

recent_reviews.author: â€¢ Kristina â€¢
recent_reviews.text: The kids were absolutely buzzing to visit Hesketh Farm! They loved interacting with the animals, and it was such a joy to see their excitement. The place is spotless â€“ honestly, cleaner than many play gyms weâ€™ve been to. Prices are very reasonable, and the views around the farm are simply breathtaking! Weâ€™ll definitely be coming back and will happily recommend it to friends ğŸ‘ŒğŸ’¯

recent_reviews.author: Szabo Bettina
recent_reviews.text: One of our favourites for a day out with the kids. Reasonable ticket prices and you can bring your own picnic but you can also purchase food and drinks there too. The animals are well kept and there's programmes throughout the day, at least one every hour (calf feeding, goat feeding etc). Also, we went on the tractor ride which was so cool, we stopped to see a herd of cow in the middle of the field next to the farm and the farmer told us some very interesting facts about them. You can easily spend the while day here with the family, highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: L Wyatt
recent_reviews.text:
We had a truly wonderful experience on our school trip to Hesketh Farm in Skipton! From the moment we arrived, the staff were welcoming and friendly, creating a relaxed and enjoyable atmosphere for both children and adults alike.

The children were absolutely thrilled by the hands-on activities â€” from feeding the animals and holding the guinea pigs to riding on the tractor trailer and learning about life on the farm. Their excitement and curiosity were a joy to see, and it was clear they were learning while having fun.

The setting was beautiful, with stunning countryside views and well-kept facilities that made the day run smoothly. Even the adults found themselves immersed in the experience â€” petting animals, chatting with the farmers, and enjoying the peaceful surroundings.

It was a fantastic day full of smiles, laughter, and memorable moments. Weâ€™re already looking forward to visiting again!

recent_reviews.author: MaryAnn N.
recent_reviews.text:
Following the posting of my initial review, I was later contacted by the rightful shop manager. It was clarified that the first individual who had previously reached out to me was not, in fact, the manager. The genuine manager took the time to listen to my concerns, extended a sincere and unreserved apology for the poor experience I encountered, and assured me that this did not reflect the standards they strive to uphold as a business.

In an effort to rectify the situation, he kindly offered to provide me with a complimentary replacement order of the item I had originally purchased. To my amazement, the replacement was promptly arranged and delivered to me without delay. The quality of the order I received this time met my expectations and reflected the level of service I had initially hoped for.

This thoughtful gesture not only resolved the immediate issue but also demonstrated the companyâ€™s willingness to take accountability and place customer satisfaction at the forefront of their operations. Such responsiveness has helped to rebuild my trust and confidence in this butcher.

While my first experience was disappointing, I now feel reassured that the business is committed to addressing concerns when they arise and to ensuring customers leave satisfied. Based on this positive resolution, I am now able to recommend this establishment with confidence and look forward to continuing future orders with them.

recent_reviews.author: Ol Fa
recent_reviews.text:
I thought I would share this review/ rating about model farm shop. I am a regular customer but I hadnâ€™t reviewed the shop yet. However this week I bought some items and I had some little concern about one of the items. I rung the shop and my concern was dealt with by such professionalism. I was incredibly impressed with how the issue was handled. From the moment I reached out, the customer service person was responsive, attentive, and highly professional. They listened carefully to my concerns, provided clear explanations, and ensured that the matter was resolved promptly.

What stood out the most was their commitment to customer satisfaction. They went above and beyond to not only address the issue but also to ensure I was happy with the outcome. Their professionalism and efficiency made the entire experience smooth and stress-free.

I truly appreciate the excellent service and will not hesitate to purchase from them again. Highly recommended!

recent_reviews.author: JO
recent_reviews.text: I had a very disappointing experience today with Model Farm Shop in Bradford. When I called to place an order, the customer service was extremely poor. The staff member I spoke with was unhelpful and came across as very rude throughout the conversation. Instead of making me feel valued as a customer, I felt rushed and dismissed, and she even hung up the phone on me.

recent_reviews.author: Barbara Cooke
recent_reviews.text: A colleague told me about this place and how cheap it should be to buy meat. When I visited, it was crowded.  The line was so long from the entrance to the exit. It took about an 1hr to get through. They sell all kinds of meat and other things that are more specific to African food.  I didn't find this place any cheaper than Asda, in fact it was more expensive to buy pork and chicken. I checked the prices.  Fish, however, was much cheaper than at Asda and much larger cuts. Red meat, beef, ribs, lamb etc was marginally cheaper as well, except for minced beef. I was very disappointed to learn that the chicken was frozen. Made me think that it wasn't fresh.  This should be a farm, why is the chicken frozen? However, the size of the birds was slightly bigger than that of Asda or Tesco. But I still prefer to buy from Asda or Tesco because it's not frozen and cheaper.  Overall, I don't think I will go back. There are cheaper places in Bradford to shop.

pumpkin_patches.address: Model Farm, 193 Toftshaw Ln, Bradford BD4 6QR

recent_reviews.author: Paris Stevenson
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely love coming here every year multiple times. Prices are very good and the amount of different types of pumpkins ğŸƒ is so good. The hosts are so lovely ğŸ˜ and having the animals and dogs there aswel is a massive bonus. I love it all. I would definitely recommend and can't wait to go back again. Oh and they have tea coffee water drinks and chocolate cakes biscuits etc really is a wonderful few hours ğŸ™‚

recent_reviews.author: Darren Edwards
recent_reviews.text: Lovely afternoon pumpkin picking! The kids loved hunting for the different sizes and colours. There are photo opportunities and a swing which the kids loved!! Also the pigs and goats are a lovely touch! Very reasonably priced and a lovely local afternoon out!

recent_reviews.author: Wander â€œWanderlust78â€ wander 78
recent_reviews.text:
Its an ok patch. We enjoyed what was there, but its not the best around. A long way off compared to some down west wales. But it was a nice change to have to make up our own fun, with the wheelbarrow pics, climbing on bales ectâ€¦..

After we drove 2 hours, & the promise of a â€œcafeâ€ as advertised we expected some hot food & shelter. Its was just a gazebo with hot drinks & cakes. Â£5 to park next to a field, on top of overpriced pumpkins.
Nice little hour out if youâ€™re passing by or live local.

recent_reviews.author: Angeline Joseph
recent_reviews.text: We had such a fantastic time! I brought my daughter and her friend, and they absolutely loved every minute of it. Not only did they have a blast picking pumpkins, but there were so many other activities to enjoy. They especially loved visiting the farm animals â€“ it was such a joy to see their excitement, and they didnâ€™t want to leave! The whole experience was wonderfully organised and so much fun for kids and adults alike. Highly recommend for a memorable family outing!

pumpkin_patches.address: Dolau Ifan Ddu farm, Blackmill, Bridgend CF35 6EB

recent_reviews.author: T R
recent_reviews.text:
Always a lovely service here and the colours of the fruit and veg are amazing! Everything is so crisp and fresh.
We go every year to buy our amazing Christmas trees as they are beautiful and last throughout.

recent_reviews.author: Edward
recent_reviews.text: Great place for fresh vegetables and salad vegetables. Plenty of other produce for sale including eggs and packet goods

recent_reviews.author: Elle
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful selection of fresh fruit and vegetables, really good prices. Friendly staff. Wouldnâ€™t go anywhere else!

recent_reviews.author: Indy Turnbull
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant, l brought,hanging basket,they are out of this world absolutely  massive bargin at 19.99p. Numerous garden plants, reasonably.  Fruits, veg,  lovely. You could spend a fortune. Staff are lovely ,friendly.

pumpkin_patches.address: Backworth Ln, Backworth, Newcastle upon Tyne NE27 0BQ

recent_reviews.author: Roxana Riley
recent_reviews.text:
Visited today for the first time with my sister and her two young children. We all absolutely love it! Even though itâ€™s not huge we stayed for almost three hours as itâ€™s so relaxing and inviting. So much for the kids to do, sand pits, mud kitchens, feeding the animals. They had pigs, donkeys, rabbits, Guinea pigs, cows, sheep, bee hives. It was just awesome! We felt super safe to let the kids play while we had a catch up and we brought our own food and ate at one of the picnic tables.
Even though it was busy it somehow reminded calm and peaceful.
Theyâ€™d sold out of eggs in the shop so Iâ€™ll definitely be back for some of those. And the team who work there are the friendliest bunch of people, they made us feel really welcome.
One of the loveliest things is that itâ€™s free which means everyone can visit and take the opportunity to have a beautiful day out without it costing the earth. They have a donation box if you feel you can afford to give something.
All in all it was the perfect day and we canâ€™t wait to return.
Thanks for having us, there just be more of these around the city, people would be much happier  â˜ºï¸

recent_reviews.author: Nathan Pidd
recent_reviews.text:
Took our newborn son for a walk around the farm today and what a friendly place it is. We even picked up some eggs and can't wait to sample the honey.
Looks like there's lots to do for young kids so we'll definitely be back when he's old enough to play.

recent_reviews.author: Alice Robinson
recent_reviews.text: Had the most wonderful afternoon on the farm. All the staff were super helpful and friendly. The animals were adorable. The water play, sand pits and outside kitchen toys were so good for little ones. There was so much to do and we had so much fun. Highly recommend if you're in the area.

recent_reviews.author: Patricia Wrightson
recent_reviews.text: Had a fantastic day with the children they didnâ€™t want to leave. The sand and water play was lovely to watch, they children loved it. Itâ€™s all so reasonable priced an ice lolly for a Â£1 even the treats are so cheap. I would recommend it to everyone. Thanks for the memories x

pumpkin_patches.address: Next door to Andrew Marvell school, Barham Rd, Hull HU9 4EE

recent_reviews.author: Andrew H Hems
recent_reviews.text: A beautiful, charming place. So relaxed. A couple of wooded nature trails, for the kids. Toilet facilities. Honey, and apple juice for sale. Many varieties of apples, Â£2 a kilo. Lovely staff.

recent_reviews.author: andie cropper
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful tranquil place! Haven of wildlife., a multitude of apple varieties growing on site Open to the public on selected days throughout the year such as wassail , harvest and pick your own days.

recent_reviews.author: Mike Rouse-Deane
recent_reviews.text: To get here was quite a nightmare as the location placed made Google maps assume there was a road where one didn't exist. However if you drive along Pickering Road and go down one of the streets you'll get there. Not much parking available (as it's a normal housing estate) but once parked, the staff are very friendly, even telling you what apples go well with what, depending on if you're baking or eating etc. A great day out and some cool little mazes for the kids to do.

recent_reviews.author: Lin W
recent_reviews.text: Great to meet people and carry on the ancient tradition of wassail

recent_reviews.author: Ftse
recent_reviews.text:
A lovely day out at the farm for lunch, fruit picking then tea and cake. The restaurant is nicely decorated with outdoor play area and where nearly all tables outside had umbrellas. Lunch option is a little limited with no chips or fried food BUT the quality of their food is exceptional. They have a selection of sandwiches, sausage rolls, brunch items, and childrens menu. The cakes are good sized and perfectly baked. Coffees were also of high standard.

The fruit farm had a good selection of blueberries, raspberries, goosberries, blackberries and currants. They have strawberries but they stated no strawberry picking at the moment. There were loads of raspberry bushes but there was a large patch that had dried thick stalks poking from ground within each of the aisles making it slightly hazzardess to walk pass (not seen these in other farms) so giving 4 stars rather than 5. However, all in all, a pleasant spot for a day out. Note that is an entrance fee of Â£2 per person then to pay for the fruit afterwards. Thank you for a lovely day. :)

recent_reviews.author: kente cloth
recent_reviews.text: If youâ€™re searching for a truly exceptional farm shop experience, look no further than this absolute gem! A perfect blend of traditional charm and contemporary offerings, this shop stands out from the crowd, bringing together the kind of quality and variety you just donâ€™t find anywhere else these days. From the moment you step in, youâ€™re greeted by a warm, welcoming atmosphere and a team of knowledgeable, friendly staff who truly know their stuff. The new Christmas layout is nothing short of magicalâ€”it immediately swept me into the festive spirit! Inspired by the delightful display, we couldnâ€™t resist ordering a Christmas hamper packed with Durleighmarshâ€™s finest treats, and Iâ€™m confident itâ€™ll be the star of our celebrations. Huge thanks to Todd and the team for creating such an unforgettable shopping experienceâ€”this is a must-visit destination that I canâ€™t recommend highly enough!

recent_reviews.author: Pip Blackburn
recent_reviews.text:
Visited last year and forgot to leave a review.
Lovely place, tea and cake booked very last minute and happy to accommodate us. We were making memories with my terminally ill mum. She loved it as did we, so many cakes to choose from and the coffee and teas were delicious too. The dÃ©cor was a lovely trip down memory lane. Ample parking and a farm shop too. Will definitely recommend to others

recent_reviews.author: Suzi Smith
recent_reviews.text:
Save your time by heading across the road to the lovely, happy, inviting staff of Sky Park.

Staff charged me Â£2 for me and Â£2 for my 20 month child to pick our own. I didnâ€™t say a word until I was told that they now donâ€™t refund this when you pay for the produce youâ€™ve picked. I got told that â€˜times changeâ€™.

A very rude employee offered me plastic punnets and then a plastic bag. How is a farm still offering plastic? Backwards farm, that needs a facelift and polite staff.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Slade Farm Pumpkins and Asparagus. W.A & Davey & Son

recent_reviews.author: Angmering Village Greens
recent_reviews.text:
Wonderful freshly picked Asparagus that comes in to us twice a week, always friendly and helpful drivers, Excellent quality, highly recommend!
Thank you for working with us!

recent_reviews.author: Iain Skinner
recent_reviews.text: Well worth taking the children to for a seasonal fun day out.

recent_reviews.author: Benjamin Spiers
recent_reviews.text: Not too much though, gets a little sickly.

recent_reviews.author: Ğ­Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ°Ñ€Ğ° ĞĞ±Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°
recent_reviews.text: How do I get to your farm from Birmingham?

recent_reviews.author: Henry Faulkner
recent_reviews.text: Shop here for their bacon , their breakfast sausages and Sunday roasts . Fantastic meat and lovely seasonal veg . Weâ€™ve also had the lemon curd , garlic mayo and other local produce . Richard is always there with a smile and some banter . Great little farm shop . Support when you can

recent_reviews.author: Hilary Wood
recent_reviews.text: Shopped with Richard for many years. Never a problem. Good free range eggs from his own fields and lots of other locally sourced products. Always helpful and friendly. As usual we will be sourcing our Christmas free range chicken/turkey and other meats from him.

recent_reviews.author: Dale Roe
recent_reviews.text: Love this little shop. We have always ordered our Christmas duck through Richard. And we try and go for our Sunday roast meat every week. He always has seasonable veg and fruit and other local goodies too

recent_reviews.author: Barry Gribble
recent_reviews.text: Always great produce and friendly service. Love Hollam Hill farm shop!

pumpkin_patches.address: Hollam Hill Farm, Titchfield Rd, Fareham PO14 3ES

recent_reviews.author: Shajnin Islam Shorna
recent_reviews.text: Visiting Samâ€™s Sunflower was such a beautiful and refreshing experience. The field was full of vibrant sunflowers, creating the perfect peaceful atmosphere for a walk and photos. Everything was well-maintained, and the flowers looked stunning under the sunshine. Itâ€™s truly a place that lifts your mood and makes you appreciate the simple beauty of nature. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a calm, family-friendly, and Instagram-worthy spot. ğŸŒ»âœ¨

recent_reviews.author: Rose
recent_reviews.text:
Been many times but my first proper hoedown. Itâ€™s a beautiful location with so much going on from food to line dancing lessons, drinks and singing. Such a lovely evening.
I also want to say that every single person I interacted with was lovely. Very informative and smiley from the beginning to the end. Especially the brilliant lady on the gate who I spent a lot of time talking to!

recent_reviews.author: Paola Quercia
recent_reviews.text:
17th august 2025. Adult entrance fee is 7.5Â£ + chatity donation to rent a pair of rusty secateur without any safety hook (suggested donation 2 to 3Â£) not included in your entrance ticket (why?). You can pick up 3 sunflowers (included in the entrance fee) + extra sunflowers +1Â£ each.  There are not many more young nice sunflowers to pick up, most of them are ripe, faded.
Soft drinks, ice cream and food available at the entrance. Chemical toilets for visitors.

recent_reviews.author: Tony Bell
recent_reviews.text:
I went with my daughter.
We really enjoyed, walking in the fields. Choosing the sunflowers.
There was a dog show on,when we were there.
Had a lovely day.

pumpkin_patches.address: The Sunflower fields, St Peter's Rd, Hayling Island PO11 0RT

recent_reviews.author: Mark Deadman
recent_reviews.text: Visited on a Saturday morning for a light lunch after a visit to the nearby sunflower fields. Staff were welcoming and polite. Premises were clean, light and airy. Service was fairly quick. Ordered the cheese and pickle sandwich (always a good fallback option if you're not sure what you want, and there was plenty to choose from here). A generous sandwich with salad, coleslaw and crisps on the side went down very well. All level access and spacious interior so I would not imagine wheelchair access being a problem. High chair available for the little ones. Nice views out over fields from the outside seating area. If you're passing through and in need of a little refreshment try this one out.

recent_reviews.author: Paula Harrowing
recent_reviews.text: A total delightÂ° new to the area so a great find. Tasty fresh ploughman, gorgeous chunky chutney, just perfect. My bestie has cream tea with the best scone she's ever had. Beautiful setting and great staff. A total Joy to find

recent_reviews.author: Sonja Keenan
recent_reviews.text: Adjoining barn to dine in, nice varied menu with picturesque views if you wish to sit outside. Lovely friendly staff too!

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Nunn
recent_reviews.text:
I was at the tea rooms for the first time last Sunday for a private event. What fantastic staff who obviously wanted to do everything to make the day perfect! Delicious food and a beautiful venue!! I will definitely be going back!!
Thank youâ€¦

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Keeling
recent_reviews.text: Lovely food in a peaceful setting. Well worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: kirsty thompson
recent_reviews.text: Worth every penny .

recent_reviews.author: Michelle Harrison

recent_reviews.text: It was a lovely day and very sunny. Our 1st time as a family to pick a strawberry. Sweet stawberries and will be back for sure next year.

recent_reviews.author: Rahul Rajan K
recent_reviews.text: Good place to visit during summer. Superb strawberries and you can pick and love it.

recent_reviews.author: Hui zhao (Zoe)
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely farm,  shame that the raspberry was not ready when we were there, but it was still quite a lot of fun with kids picking up strawberry.
Recommend to family with kids,  encourage them to eat fruit with fun.
Â£12 for a big box, enough for the whole family!  ğŸ˜†

pumpkin_patches.address: Meon Bye Farm, Triangle Ln, Titchfield, Fareham PO14 4HB

recent_reviews.author: Lianne Yule
recent_reviews.text: We had a fantastic afternoon at here. The kids loved exploring the sunflowers but loved the maze even more! Great play area, nice picnic tables to get a drink and ice cream, we look forward to coming back another time!

recent_reviews.author: Summer
recent_reviews.text:
Great visit to the sunflowers. Had a great maze for the kids too and a lovely play area.
Look forward to going back for the pumpkins.

recent_reviews.author: Annabel Zammit
recent_reviews.text: A fantastic place to visit for sunflowerğŸŒ» or PumpkinğŸƒseason. Team are brilliant, and you can tell theyâ€™ve put so much thought and care into planning a great experience. Our most recent visit was last week to pick some sunflowers and they also had a great climbing frame, sandpit, maize maze and cafe to enjoy.

recent_reviews.author: Jessica Flynn
recent_reviews.text: Have been here for pumpkin picking and for their sunflower sunset evening. There was a great selection for both occasions along with ample parking, photo opportunities, drinks available for purchase and generally really good fun for adults and kids. Reasonable prices.

recent_reviews.author: Melanie MengÃ¼ÅŸ
recent_reviews.text:
First time doing a PYO strawberries farm. The experience was fun! When we arrived we picked free box and cardboard basket to put the fruits inside. They have strawberries but also cherries, raspberries and apparently blackcurrants but we couldn't find some.

The fruits were not all in good shape so you need to search for a while around the huge fields. We managed to find some good fruits easily though.

The pricing is a bit on the expensive side for the quality in my opinion. It was good but I was expecting more sweetness to be honest. But the experience was fun to try once.

recent_reviews.author: Priyanka D
recent_reviews.text: Such a beautiful farm , perfect for a day with kids to pick some strawberries . We went on a Monday and it was quiet, just us and we enjoyed the farm to ourselves . It was a hot day so we decided to have some ice-cream which they do sell in the little farm shop. A great way to get out with kids in summer.

recent_reviews.author: Peter Stubbs
recent_reviews.text: The fruits were the best tasting strawberries I've had in a long time. The lady at the shop was very helpful in telling g me how to get the best from my own plants.

recent_reviews.author: Tori Harrop
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little place, picked our own strawberries and they were beautiful! ğŸ¤© Nice little shop on site too. Definitely worth a visit, great quality and great price compared to supermarket ones.

pumpkin_patches.address: Goodalls PYO, S Baddesley Rd, Lymington SO41 5SD

recent_reviews.author: Miss Ty
recent_reviews.text: A lovely outdoor space. Plenty of free parking, sandpit area, bouncy area for older and younger children, tractor trial, zip wire, assault course and a few animals. You can buy animal feed for the donkeys, chickens, pigs, sheep and goats. Very clean outdoor areas. Itâ€™s all free except the animal feed and food which is too expensive- an ice lolly for Â£2.50â€¦.  I visited today - a Monday, not much on the menu,only three ice lollyâ€™s left and thatâ€™s it. The indoor eatery requires updating, The chairs have torn seat cushions, and some of the area around is torn, but itâ€™s free, and thereâ€™s always wear and tear. Also, they sell fresh meat produce - farm owned. I didnâ€™t find the staff friendly at all. Chef was very moody, the cashier man didnâ€™t have any customer skills - no hello or thanks, and the lady at the meat counter was harsh when speaking. Iâ€™d go back, but I wouldnâ€™t buy or eat there. There is a donation area, for contributions also, to show your appreciation for using the space.

recent_reviews.author: Peter de Courcy
recent_reviews.text: Annual lambing weekends are brilliantly organised without being over supervised. It's up to you how much you want to do and for now long around the lambing areas. And if you ever have had enough of cuddling young lambs and watching the new borns, then there's the farm play area and cafe ... and the tempting farm shop. A wonderful family time.

recent_reviews.author: Carol Sissons
recent_reviews.text: If you want concrete stands and flashy facilties this is not for you. However, if you want peace and quiet, plenty of space and basic clean toilets this is perfect. Owner was charming and a lovely shop/small cafe. Would definitely stay again if we were in the area with our campervan.

recent_reviews.author: Imogen
recent_reviews.text: Lovely food and wonderful venue for families. The lunch options are delicious and beyond what is usually provided in family focused cafes. They provide great food for milk allergies and also offer gluten free. Beautifully made pizzas and pasta as well as a full breakfast menu and more. Cafe lunch only open until 2.30pm but you can still buy ice cream and ice lollies all day. Free parking, calm animals to pet in surrounding fields with a really varied and large play area with so much. Play area suitable for babies through primary school ages and some preteens potentially. Safe and easy to relax and monitor your kids in the entire play area because of the layout. No dogs allowed

pumpkin_patches.address: Sindlesham Rd, Arborfield, Arborfield Cross, Reading RG2 9JH

recent_reviews.author: ã€‚ã‚¹ã‚­
recent_reviews.text: We visited today with our 2 year old and had nice time there. There are still lots of strawberries plum and sweetcorn available. Sweetcorn tastes really nice and love it. Very sad to see people throwing away and wasting corn, and strawberries in the field. If you dont want to take it home why do you pick them ğŸ˜¢

recent_reviews.author: R L
recent_reviews.text:
I had a gorgeous day at Copas. Sweetest strawberries and plums iâ€™ve had all year and the most delicious courgettes. I loved all the cute varieties they had. Nothing better than farm to table and a day in nature.

Note to visitors - the postcode on the website doesnâ€™t take you to the exact location on google maps so itâ€™s better to enter copas farms pyo and the entry fee is refundable against your purchases.

recent_reviews.author: Tim P
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely farm with a good selection of raspberries, strawberries, and spinach. Cost about Â£12 and got a tasty selection. ğŸ˜‹

Not a father but good for families

recent_reviews.author: Jawdat Tarawneh
recent_reviews.text: Total disappointment. The fruits, particularly the strawberries, look shiny and perfect on the outside but are rotten and tasteless inside. Clearly sprayed with wax/ chemicals. Expensive, poor quality, and a waste of time. Definitely not recommended.

pumpkin_patches.address: Off Long Ln., Cookham, Maidenhead SL6 9RF

recent_reviews.author: GARNETTOTHEGELATO
recent_reviews.text: AMAZING I WENT THERE TDY AND THE PEOPLE THERE IS SO NICE AND PROFESSIONAL!!  WE WERE holding the chicken ğŸ”ğŸ’—ğŸ’—ğŸ’—ğŸ’—

recent_reviews.author: Signature Moments
recent_reviews.text: We DJed here for Holly & Luke's wedding last weekend. The venue is absolutely beautiful and looked gorgeous with fairy lights across the wooden beams. We used our rustic DJ set up which fitted in just perfectly!

recent_reviews.author: Mario de Freitas

recent_reviews.author: joy bowsher

recent_reviews.author: Daniel Lund

recent_reviews.author: Matt Morris

recent_reviews.author: Karen Crook

Thankfully there werenâ€™t many ripe so I didnâ€™t pick many but they virtually all were inedible

recent_reviews.author: Tony Parkins

This is no ordinary farm shop! It offers such a wide range of quality, local products from fruits, vegetables, frozen goods, wines and preserves.
The prices were reasonable and the service was great, we will be returning for cheese and wine.

recent_reviews.author: Wayne Lowe
recent_reviews.text:
Great farm shop, lots of local produce
Popped in for takeaway coffee and one of their awesome cakes to go..
Been several times now, highly recommend a visit
Lovely staff, super friendly ğŸ˜€

recent_reviews.author: Katie Johnson

recent_reviews.author: Rob DeanZ3
recent_reviews.text:
Excellent quality selection of fruit & veg. There are plenty of other Norfolk things to choose like jams, teas, cakes, etc.
Great place to support as a local business, and does a great selection of Christmas Hampers for collection or delivery further afield.

recent_reviews.author: Kevin Smith
recent_reviews.text: Good looking cows

recent_reviews.author: Charlie Redbear
recent_reviews.text:
I went with some girlfriends for lunch.Â  Food was delicious...really lovely fresh ingredients, beautifully plated and honestly couldn't fault it.

The restaurant was large and airy, service was friendly.Â Â  The only gripe was that they brought our second drink order and didn't remove our dirty cups which i was a little surprised about.Â  We were there for 2 hrs and sat with two lots of empty cups in front of us...bit odd.

But the food was lovely and would defo go back.Â  We were there as they swapped to the lunch menu and the food coming out looked lush.

recent_reviews.author: pingu hk
recent_reviews.text:
I enjoyed a great relaxing lunch.
The place is very relaxing and the staff were friendly and helpful.
The food is very good and loved the triple-cooked chips
There is outdoor seating with a nice view and a small playground for kids to run around.
The farm shop is 1 of the best I have been to with loads of local foods, price is OK.

recent_reviews.author: Gisela Flowers
recent_reviews.text:
Never been to Goodies but heard lots of comments about it so as we were in that area decided to stop for a light lunch.
We sat outside as we had the dog with us, thought somebody may have come to table to bring a menu but ended having to go and fetch one. Decided on a small platter to share, a plain sausage roll and a fruit scone none of which was on display to see what you were getting. It all looked very nicely done on the plates but disappointed with the taste overall. The sausage roll had no flavour at all and the quiche was too wet. The scone however was good. Had a quick look round shop, lots to pick from so picked up a small packet of cheese straws, cheesy enough but not the best I have had.
All in all a bit disappointed.

recent_reviews.author: Deborah Young
recent_reviews.text: 1st time here and we will defo be coming back, The restaurant is amazing, fast service and great prices, the quality for me was 10/10, we had the chicken supreme, bacon wrapped chicken breast on a bed of bacon creamed cabbage with new hassleback potatoes & broccoli and for desert we had the creme brulee with chefs shortbread, staff very friendly and always to hand, cannot wait now to come back. Love the fact it has a large shop of local made & grown and artisan products and again great prices and again 10/10

recent_reviews.author: Life is beautiful
recent_reviews.text: Good

pumpkin_patches.address: Markshall Farm Rd, Markshall Ln, Caistor St Edmund, Norwich NR14 8QP

recent_reviews.author: Peter Wigglesworth
recent_reviews.text: Very good farm shop, a few animals, it says on a sign  2 times to help feed the animals, but no information, but people waiting, no one to help or show what happens. A little park by the car park kids loved .

recent_reviews.author: Peter Phelps
recent_reviews.text:
We came for the Easter at the Farm event. Very disappointing.
No Easter crafts or games (one game) in the Barn. No bottle feeding of the lambs.
The Easter Egg hunt takes place in a grassed field, a few wooden Easter characters and straw bales scattered about. The prize for finding the coloured Easter Eggs, was a small bag of cheap chocolate mice, probably worth about 50p. (The organisers could've bought Easter Eggs in Tesco for Â£1.50, much better value, than the cheap chocolate prize) This event is more suitable for younger children.

recent_reviews.author: BHC
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely little farm shop and cafe and the food was great. Very friendly atmosphere with smiley and happy staff.

Chloe and Millie  were great all around and the shops also worth a visit too! A hidden gem just off the A130

recent_reviews.author: Belinda Feltham
recent_reviews.text: We went to the Pumpkin picking event, no need to book can pay on arrival and we were able to take our dog (although this is not over run with dogs so ideal if you'renot fans). We had a tractor ride, met lots of lovely animals and the children had mini tractors to ride on. Pumpkin fields were amazing and wheelbarrows provided, it was a great place for our son to be free and enjoy himself. There's a farm shop and a little cafe/restaurant too. They currently also have a maize maze, which looked great but we didn't go in this time. Staff were lovely and friendly, we really enjoyed ourselves. There is also a small playground which made a nice touch, we will return at other times when there isn't an event to see the animals, have a play and some shopping/ lunch.

pumpkin_patches.address: North Benfleet Hall Fishery, Benfleet SS12 9JR

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Farmer Scott's Pumpkin Patch & Maize Maze

recent_reviews.author: Ell Eve
recent_reviews.text: Came for the pumpkin patch as a double date was given the option to either has fresh clean pumpkins or pick ur own pumpkins if u did want fresh pumpkins u could still walk around hot drinks were served had a little washing station for the dirty pumpkins but honestly such a good variety of pumpkins from big to small and cute little photo opportunities wouldnâ€™t recommend if ur a clean freak tho very muddyğŸ˜‚

recent_reviews.author: tacye hong
recent_reviews.text: went there today and had an absolutely lovely time â˜ºï¸ they had many pumpkins and the maize maze was super nice. the staff there was very friendly. wonderful experience esp given the price ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Garnham
recent_reviews.text: Would have been better if it hadnâ€™t been so wet as it was reasonably priced and across a huge space. Car park was flooded, with cars having to be pushed out. Field was so waterlogged I saw lots of people fall over. Basically no shelter at all there, and pumpkin patch and maze were so wet you couldnâ€™t really explore. Found the website quite misleading as to what facilities were there. Burger van selling hot drinks which werenâ€™t very nice and quite expensive, and a few portaloos. Due to proximity to a gun range, the entire experience is peppered with the very loud sound of gunshots.

recent_reviews.author: toby williams
recent_reviews.text:
Pretty cool maze. Luckily there's a map, checkpoints, and a smaller kids maze section.
Portaloos on site

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte Thomas
recent_reviews.text: Visited here with my friend & our 3 children. Very well organised with loads to do for the children. The pumpkin patch was well spaced out with loads to look at & they weren't overpriced!!!!!! Lovely coffee & bacon roll & a winner for the kids a Rossi ice cream stand!!!!! Definitely be back again next year x

recent_reviews.author: Abbalina B
recent_reviews.text: Lovely friendly, family run place. Been previous years but well organised for covid this year. Good selection of pumpkins and squashes with additional at till purchases such as carving tools and Halloween decor. The corn was let down by the weather this year but still nice for the younger kiddies to see how they grow. Well recommended!

recent_reviews.author: T S
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing experience here today. I picked a Norway spruce and was taken by a very kind older staff member who walked me and the family to a sealed off area. Everyone else was buying the Normand firs already cut. My tree is a beast and best i have ever seen, best part was it was cut right before my eyes.
Highly recommended indeed.

recent_reviews.author: Marc Rogers
recent_reviews.text:
I was struggling to find anywhere that sold quality Christmas trees yesterday.. usually go to Summerhill but they are not selling any real trees this year. Found this place online so took a ride over and was so glad I did! Literally spoiled for choice. All the trees are spaced apart so you can have a proper look and the staff there are more than happy to help you out.
A lovely friendly place and will definitely be my go to stop for Christmas trees from now on.

recent_reviews.author: Anith John
recent_reviews.text: Nice place to visit with family. We had visited around the Halloween week and it was a nice experience. All items were decently priced. There was a small cafe selling pastries/ bakery items and coffee. Recommend to wear boots specially when it is raining. There was ample space for car parking too.

recent_reviews.author: Lily Brown
recent_reviews.text: We went yesterday (25th Oct) and didn't have to look hard at all the find a good big pumpkin, lots of variety's of squash too. Free entry, decently priced pumpkins... Thumbs up!

recent_reviews.author: Indigo Sapphire Moon
recent_reviews.text: An authentic pumpkin patch with lots of space and a stunning lake beside it. They even have Halloween themed cakes and a little spooky shop. The pumpkins are reasonably priced too!

recent_reviews.author: Cristina Gaitens
recent_reviews.text: Visiting Cobbs Farm is something our family look forward to each year at Halloween. We love the friendly welcome, that we're supporting a local farm and business, that it's free to enter, no booking required and the choice of pumpkins is the widest I've seen anywhere. We wouldn't go anywhere else.

pumpkin_patches.address: Cobbs Farm, Maldon Rd, Goldhanger, Maldon CM9 8BQ

recent_reviews.author: S Bartlett
recent_reviews.text: Spent a lovely couple of hours here this afternoon. Mum who is wheelchair bound had asked to go. We started with lunch in the cafe. Really lovely food and menu . As a vegan Iâ€™d have liked a little more choice but what I had was fresh and tasty.  The shop was great too, bought the fruit and veg I would have bought from a supermarket this week and itâ€™s so much better in taste and quality . Will be back ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Digital Vampire
recent_reviews.text:
Great little farm shop, everything you could possibly want from a fresh perspective. Lots of local produce, friendly and helpful staff, reasonable prices and supporting local farmers. They also have a small freezer section with homemade pies, pasta and other goodies.

Parking is easy and away from the main road, highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: steve johns
recent_reviews.text: A superb farm shop, selling good quality produce. The butcherâ€™s shop is first class. Treated ourselves this week for a BBQ â€¦ steak & chicken; probably the best 28 day aged rib-eye on the bone Iâ€™ve had. It was just exceptional. If you want quality, this is a butchers worth visiting.

recent_reviews.author: Michelle Shanks
recent_reviews.text: Lovely selection of things, picked up some fresh peaches, amongst other fresh fruit. So delicious they didn't make it home. ğŸ˜‹ Already planning next visit.

pumpkin_patches.address: Calcott Hall Farm, Ongar Rd, Brentwood CM15 9HS

recent_reviews.author: Trinity
recent_reviews.text:
When we arrived the garden centre was absolutely beautiful and looked lovely set out.
At the restaurant the staff were very lovely and helpful. The falafel wrap was so nice and unique.
They cater well for vegans answering any questions.
We ordered the chips as a side which looked a small portion but was filling.
The ham, egg and chips was lovely presented. Definitely recommend as a place to treat your family or partner as a nice lunching.

recent_reviews.author: Maria
recent_reviews.text: Lovely garden centre which sells pretty much everything!!! Plenty of parking which is close to the entrance. Went for the afternoon tea which was lovely. The nut allergy was catered for in advance which was good and our waitress Jane was brilliant, she was friendly, chatty and helpful, a great employee! The afternoon tea was a bit pricey but was all good quality and gave you a take away box for the leftovers. It was also nice that you were able to swap the tea for either coffee or a fruit juice which is great for non tea drinkers. Will definitely visit again.

recent_reviews.author: g bailey
recent_reviews.text: Booked a birthday afternoon tea. Birthday girl is coeliac & was well catered for. We had a fantastic & relaxed afternoon & appreciated the boxes for the leftovers. Thank you.

recent_reviews.author: Scott Pigram
recent_reviews.text:
This is the perfect garden center with all that you need. The staff are very knowledgeable and will give you advice on anything in your garden.

Pottery painting is a great experience for adults to do together alone or with the kids.
The restaurant has an excellent food and drink menu with friendly staff.

There are themes events for the seasons and a very good farmers market held. Check the website for details and events.

recent_reviews.author: Tom Costello
recent_reviews.text: Great service and staff

pumpkin_patches.address: Oldbury Farm, Southend Rd, Southend-on-Sea SS3 0PS

recent_reviews.author: Kamil Pachalko
recent_reviews.text: A green oasis full of apple trees, black berries and wildlife at its best. I understand it is the remains of huge orchards covering this area so it is a heritage worth tending to. Thanks to Trust Links for keeping it accessible and improving it for the public.

recent_reviews.author: Ian Harris
recent_reviews.text: Another lovely day at the orchard wassailing and planting another ancient variety of Apple tree

recent_reviews.author: Matt Conway
recent_reviews.text: Lots of apples that are now in my homebrew Cider

recent_reviews.author: James Fouch
recent_reviews.text: Very interesting and informative

recent_reviews.author: Ana Martins
recent_reviews.text:
I recently visited Scottâ€™s Kitchen with a friend and her child for afternoon tea, and honestly, it was such a wonderful experience from start to finish. From the moment we walked in, the staff made us feel completely welcome â€“ friendly, attentive, and genuinely happy to help. Itâ€™s clear they care about their customers, which made the whole visit feel really special.

They even have a kidsâ€™ afternoon tea, which my friendâ€™s child absolutely adored! It was the perfect size for little ones, beautifully presented, and clearly made with care â€“ watching her enjoy it so much added an extra layer of joy to our day. I had the gluten-free afternoon tea, and I couldnâ€™t have been happier. Everything was fresh, flavorful, and perfectly made â€“ you wouldnâ€™t even know it was GF if you werenâ€™t told.

The atmosphere is so relaxed and welcoming, perfect for families or just a quiet catch-up with friends. I loved how thoughtful every detail felt, from the presentation of the food to the little touches that made the experience memorable. And the best part? Itâ€™s very affordable considering the quality, service, and care that goes into every aspect of the visit.

I genuinely canâ€™t recommend Scottâ€™s Kitchen enough. Between the delicious food, attentive staff, and the family-friendly touches, itâ€™s a true gem. We left feeling happy, full, and already planning our next visit â€“ itâ€™s that kind of place that sticks with you.

recent_reviews.author: Aly Achmeda
recent_reviews.text:
Perfect Sunday Roast â€“ Flavourful & Family-Friendly

We enjoyed a fantastic Sunday roast during the summer holidays â€” everything was perfectly cooked and packed with flavour. The roast was rich and satisfying, with tender meat, crispy potatoes, and delicious seasonal veg, all tied together with a smooth, well-balanced gravy.

The setting was lively yet relaxed, and truly children-friendly â€” our kids were made to feel welcome and enjoyed their meals just as much as we did.

A flawless Sunday experience for families looking for great food in a warm, inviting atmosphere. Highly recommended!

recent_reviews.author: Veronica Bianchi
recent_reviews.text: Had a lovely lunch with friends at *Scottâ€™s Kitchen*! The setting was relaxed and perfect for a summer catch-up. We shared a beautiful spread of dishes â€“ the watermelon and feta bites were fresh and fun, and the butter chicken with naan was full of flavour. The kids enjoyed their meals too, especially the crispy fish and fries. Everything was well presented and delicious. Great service, generous portions, and a welcoming vibe â€“ definitely a spot weâ€™ll return to!

recent_reviews.author: Thomas Robertson
recent_reviews.text: Have been having breakfast at Scott's for a few months, from having the most wonderful meal, for which l recommended it to everyone, It has steadily gone down hill, when you have the same meal every time it allows you to compare with the previous. The portions seem smaller the mushrooms are like shoe leather the eggs are awful however they're cooked,the majority of the items are cold  and what was once a great service with lovely friendly staff is now non existent.Today for example we waited ages to be sat down while the immediate member of staff was taking a booking on the phone, in front of us were two staff members chatting away and seemingly oblivious to our presence,when the phone went down the male member of staff who had previously ignored us then approached us to get sat down. After having a meal which was far from satisfactory ref the reasons given earlier in my overview the same member of staff who was on the phone passed us  and l tried to catch her attention that we might pay seeing as she had the mobile key pad payment machine in her hand on three occasions l was ignored as she was busy chatting to customers she seemed to know general small talk gossip this went on for about 10 mins then my friend said I'll go up to the counter and pay there were about three others waiting to pay seemingly fed up sitting waiting to settle up and indeed the lady sat next to us voiced her disappointment in the service saying it took ages to get sat and she was still waiting for her coffee with once again the majority of the staff standing around gossiping a  grinning at one another at approximately Â£35 for two breakfasts poor service and awful food l certainly won't be back or recommend again what a waste of a lovely setup the managers need to address this now

pumpkin_patches.address: Scott's of, Sutton Rd, Rochford, Southend-on-Sea SS4 1LQ

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Otto's Pumpkin Patch - Pumpkin Picking - Braintree

recent_reviews.author: Charli Leach
recent_reviews.text:
Our first visit to a pumpkin patch as a family of 3! Our little man is 7 months old & we think he loved it! Itâ€™s a great place to start a family tradition! The staff were all very friendly & clear with any instructions. The pumpkin patch itself was beautifully set out with lots of photo opportunities- because you need them! ğŸ˜œ
The price of the pumpkins was also very reasonable!
Will definitely come again!
Thank you! â˜ºï¸

recent_reviews.author: Katie Christie
recent_reviews.text: Perfect pumpkin patch! We were greeted by the owners who were absolutely lovely and very helpful. As 2 adults, there were plenty of cute photo opportunities and the pumpkins were beautiful! Extremely high quality. We had a lovely time and 100% recommend to all ages.

recent_reviews.author: S C
recent_reviews.text: A magical place to visit, Otto's Pumpkin Patch is full of delights for both children and adults alike. Trails to follow, secret hideaways to explore, warming drinks to consume, and amazing colourful pumpkins to pick from the fields or from the marquee. Highly recommended, and if you missed this year's event, make sure you go next year. And who knew that pumpkins also grow on trees! ğŸ˜‰ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Mickilee Lambell
recent_reviews.text:
3rd year of attending Ottoâ€™s pumpkin patch and again it did not disappoint. Staff are friendly and very welcoming, plenty of photo opportunities and not to forget a huge range of pumpkins and squash to choose from. Definitely a new yearly tradition for us at Ottoâ€™s.
Happy HalloweenğŸƒğŸ‘»

recent_reviews.author: Skyler Moulder
recent_reviews.text: We really enjoyed our day. The farm is big, the play area is brilliant and the staff were friendly. I appreciate that income from purchasing food is important, but for families trying to keep costs as low as possible, the no-picnic rule is a real negative. I appreciate ruling that picnics arenâ€™t allowed in the play area, but families should be allowed to eat their own food in other areas of the site. We were already paying for the tons of fruit our kids pick, ice creams, coffees etc.

recent_reviews.author: Renaud Bonnin
recent_reviews.text:
A great day out with the kids picking strawberries. They were delicious! We booked the last slot of the day and insight it was a bit of a mistake as by the time we got to the fields, most of the good ones were gone.

The place has plenty to keep everyone entertained. They have bars, cafeteria, a playground and loads of activities around. Definitely recommend as a day out.

recent_reviews.author: Sivatharjini Sivarajasingam
recent_reviews.text:
Always a fun day out for the family! This is our third, maybe even fourth time here and we love it. Reasonably priced and perfect place to tire the kids out.
Highly recommend the PYO fruit session!

recent_reviews.author: Charulatha Sanmathi
recent_reviews.text:
Great pick your own farm with yummy strawberries, blackberries, blueberries, black currant, sunflower, raspberries to pick.

Just Â£2 for entry, they have a cafe and pizza place with kids play area inside. Highly recommend

pumpkin_patches.address: Cammas Hall Farm Needham Green, Hatfield Broad Oak CM22 7JT

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Foxes Farm Produce - The Pumpkin Patch - Colchester, Essex

recent_reviews.author: Dayani Baiai
recent_reviews.text: Foxes Sunflower Farm is a wonderful place for a family day out! We loved the beautiful sunflower picking experience, it was well-organized and fun for all ages. The childrenâ€™s play area kept the kids entertained, and the photo props around the farm were a lovely touch for capturing special memories. Everything was thoughtfully set up, making the whole experience enjoyable and family-friendly. Highly recommended!

recent_reviews.author: Courtney Tag
recent_reviews.text:
Third visit in a row and just as amazing as ever and the pup was able to join âœ¨
The only reason for the missing star is that it wasnâ€™t as big as it has been on previous years but still a great day out for all. ğŸ’›

recent_reviews.author: Danielle Murray
recent_reviews.text: We had a brilliant day. Lots for the children to do. The bouncy pumpkin was great and my children loved the scarecrow, she really made it fun for them ğŸƒğŸ§¡

recent_reviews.author: Andrea Dinnen
recent_reviews.text:
Wonderful afternoon out, kids loved it and so did we great choice of pumpkins.
Everyone is so friendly. Can wait to go back for sunflowers next year. Definitely wear wellies tho â˜ºï¸

pumpkin_patches.address: Foxes Farm Produce, Halstead Rd, Colchester CO6 3PT

recent_reviews.author: Jack Gowlett
recent_reviews.text: Very muddy yet fun experience at Foxes Farm! Went for some pumpkin picking and grabbed some great quality pumpkins! - after grabbing our pumpkins and collecting 5kg of mud on our shoes, we had a lovely hot dog at the kiosks ğŸ˜ fun day out!

recent_reviews.author: Kate Thomas
recent_reviews.text: Myself and my 6 year old son went to Foxes Farm in Basildon today. I know people have committed on the lack of pumpkin selection, the price and also the mud...well we thought the sloppy mud made the whole experience so much better as we couldn't stop laughing as we slip and slide all over the place. The selection was great considering only 2 days before Halloween. My son loved all the activities. I didn't mind the price as not much different from the supermarket and don't forget you also get pumpkins with character. We will definitely be back next year (this time with spare clothes)!!

recent_reviews.author: Paul Field (WFP)
recent_reviews.text:
Weâ€™ve been coming here for quite a few years and I havenâ€™t been disappointed. The parking is well controlled and was even better this year. The price seems fair to me, the photo opportunities were plentiful.
Itâ€™s become a tradition in our family to spend time together and Foxes farm provide a great opportunity to do so. Wellies are essential, even though half of my family turned up in white trainersâ€¦

recent_reviews.author: Adrian I
recent_reviews.text:
Its ok to go and grab some pumpkins. Childrens have some activities to do, but not much really. Long queues for food, drinks and even face painting (Â£6.00) and for the price it is quite expensive really.
We did expect it to be quite muddy, but its like sticky muddy and definitely recommend boots without a doubt.

Its ok for a time out to grab pumpkins during Halloween, but only if the weather is nice and sunny. If its raining, well, its a farm so you will get soaked and full of mud...like..a lot.

All in all good time, but not much to do for a little one apart from taking some photos, picking some pumpkins and playing with some toy farm cars.

recent_reviews.author: Tom Nutter (Nutters In Cyprus)
recent_reviews.text:
Have been a few times since moving to the area in February.

I usually stock up on the large free range eggs, big sack of spuds and sometimes parsnips.

Keep wanting to purchase the full lamb, but don't currently have the freezer space.

recent_reviews.author: Jim Walters
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic service and brilliant quality we regularly purchase half a lamb beautiful beef joints so tender and very tasty good range of fresh veg only been shopping here a few months and found the very best of friendly service can't rate these high enough brilliant quality exceptional service

recent_reviews.author: John Hammerton
recent_reviews.text: Great farm shop, all the best quality veg you need, very knowledgeable staff ğŸ˜„ğŸ˜„ğŸ˜„

recent_reviews.author: Nick Cox
recent_reviews.text:
Oakenhayes farm shop easy to get to no problem in getting my potatoes and onions and anything else good quality
Very happy to shop there
Well done to you all ğŸ˜Š

pumpkin_patches.address: Farm, Oaken, Great Wyrley, Hayes WS6 6AG

recent_reviews.author: Simon Jones
recent_reviews.text: My 18 month and 2 and a half year old loved it. It's small enough for them to walk round and big enough for a couple of hours seeing and feeding animals. Incredibly reasonable pricing, Â£5 for adults and under 2's are free, a good size bucket of feed is Â£3. Plenty of parking. Decent range of animals and the planes from the airport are a bit of a novelty also.

recent_reviews.author: molly southern
recent_reviews.text: Used to be free with the optional Â£3 bucket of food. Which was nice to visit occasionally as a cheap, no thrills, trip out the house. It is now Â£5 an adult Â£2.50 for a child plus the optional Â£3 food bucket. Nothing has changed to justify the hike in admission price - I understand the increase in expenses of the farm but if your going to charge such admission the least you could do is tidy it up. The farm itself is a bit of a state - piles of manure, several derelict vehicles around, hazardous building equipment and materials lying around. 80% chickens, a couple of cows, pigs, donkeys goats and wallabyâ€™s. Oh and if youâ€™re lucky youâ€™ll see the rats too.

recent_reviews.author: Rhea Watkins
recent_reviews.text:
I visited oak tree farm for the first time today and I won't be coming again or reccomending it to anyone else. most of the water looks like it hasn't been changed in a while or topped up, i noticed some of the animals are underweight and the chicken pens had way too many in for how big the enclosures were there is no additional food in there enclosures only what visitors feed them so they was fighting. There are 2 parrots that had no enrichment what so ever no perches just 1 toy. It's very run down and they clearly have no knowledge how to take care of the animals or what enrichment is,
I could go on and on.

recent_reviews.author: Abi Cattermole
recent_reviews.text: I think this place is really good for younger children see some animals and have a little play as well ğŸ˜€ the manager is really nice to talk to ğŸ˜€ the price goes to feeding all the animals so Iâ€™m happy to pay  Â£5 to get in ğŸ‘ keep up the good work!

recent_reviews.author: Samantha
recent_reviews.text: We had flowers for my Nanâ€™s funeral and they were all perfect. We were so happy with them and we were able to give her the send off she deserved. Thank you!

recent_reviews.author: Mel Price
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little gem tucked away, not far from Aldridge town centre. They have everything you need in one place. The products are delicious and reasonably priced. Nice to have a local farm shop to be able to pick up fresh produce rather than having to go to the supermarkets. The staff are always welcoming and friendly

recent_reviews.author: Sharon
recent_reviews.text:
We had a couple of mince and onion pies from this shop, they are nice.

We went back and I brought some plants for the garden. They have a range of plants not overly pricey. It's not very big place as they sell pet food, plants, fruit, pies and other household goods.

I was expecting to see a wider range of plants, maybe it's the time of the year and they have sold a lot.

A couple of the staff are impatient and hygiene is clearly not the foremost, thought in a shop that sells food.

If a member of the staff coughs into their hand then serves you food or any other item you may be buying. Maybe they should wear a mask, wash their hand or at least use hand gel, before serving people.

I went back to buy another plant and was waiting to be served, I heard someone say woman over their needs serving! The tone of this person's voice! All I say is that a little customer service needs to be done here...

recent_reviews.author: S Jackson
recent_reviews.text: Lovely local shop with fresh produce, flowers. Pet food and accessories and gifts. Nice and clean, friendly staff and priced well. Well worth a visit x

pumpkin_patches.address: Mill Rd, Shelfield, Pelsall, Walsall WS4 1BT

pumpkin_patches.place_name: New Farm Produce Ltd - NOT OPEN FOR PICK YOUR OWN

recent_reviews.author: Christopher Stansbie
recent_reviews.text: Produce here is excellent.  Unfortunately when I go into the farm shop the lady that works there is extremely rude and abrupt. I get sneered at just for looking at the boxes of fruit when deciding which one I want to purchase. I won't be going there again for that reason and that reason alone.

recent_reviews.author: Iain Paterson
recent_reviews.text: Great place for trade, lovely ladies and great service and produce is quality

recent_reviews.author: GERALD MICHAEL HAMILTON
recent_reviews.text: I have bought asparagus and strawberries, raspberries for many years and I cannot fault the service that I have received and the products in my opinion are first class.

recent_reviews.author: Freelancer Freelancer
recent_reviews.text: I don't understand how anyone can work here,99% of the work and conditions are like  in a camp. Not to mention the products,I wouldn't want even my worst enemy to try it,how strong is the chemistry with which it is sprayed for 7 days,you can barely breathe,it burns your nose.

pumpkin_patches.address: Park View Farm, Elmhurst, Lichfield WS13 8EX

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Winston Farm Christmas trees and Pumpkins

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte Hemmingway
recent_reviews.text: What an amazing place. We drove an hour (past 2 other Christmas tree farms) and it was well worth it. Staff were lovely and offered hot drinks and mice pies on arrival (for free). Told us the layout so we could go to the size of tree we wanted and let us have a good cuddle of the reindeer too. Lads wrapping the trees could not have been more helpful and we're happy to carry our tree to the truck. Amazing place. Will be back every year

recent_reviews.author: Karen
recent_reviews.text: A lovely place to get our tree. Good selection of trees, two friendly reindeer, and some tasty mulled wine too. Very friendly and helpful team who made it a fun experience. Fair prices and great to  support a local business. We ended up buying two trees we had that much fun and the trees were so good!!!! We will definitely go back next year.

recent_reviews.author: Carol Aston
recent_reviews.text: Best Christmas tree we've ever had, still not dropping needles on the 5th of January so we've put it outside to brighten up the garden. Such a great place to visit, we will definitely go again next year ğŸ„

recent_reviews.author: L J
recent_reviews.text: Weâ€™ve come for a second year to get our pumpkins, we love the wonderfully weird variety of shapes, colours and sizes with good pricing. This year two young lads served us and they were incredibly polite. Their parents should very proud how polite they were. Great family farm who are lovely and welcoming! We intend on coming again next year for our pumpkins, and at Christmas to see their reindeer and get our Christmas tree. Thank you again.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: J R Clarke & Partners Manor Farm Fruits

recent_reviews.author: claire bennett
recent_reviews.text: All staff are lovely amazing staff. Especially Selena and Charlotte. Enjoyed our time picking the fabulous strawberries. Canâ€™t wait to come back.

recent_reviews.author: Underfloor Heating Supply
recent_reviews.text: I think the price is a tad on the steep side. Â£2 per person and Â£15 for a large punnetâ€¦ the small ones not worth having as itâ€™s tiny!

recent_reviews.author: Muhammad Rizwan
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful enjoyed

recent_reviews.author: Krzysztof N
recent_reviews.text: Delicious strawberries

recent_reviews.author: E
recent_reviews.text:
We visited Farmer Palmerâ€™s on a rainy Monday during the summer holidays. Although we had pre-booked online, it was surprisingly quietâ€”likely due to the weather. Despite the rain, we had a fantastic day! My 3-year-old and my friendâ€™s 4-year-old were absolutely in their element. There was so much for them to enjoy: they held guinea pigs, fed the deer and goats, and even my 1-year-old loved the bumpy tractor ride (an extra cost of Â£2.50 each and under 2s were free). The kids explored all the play areas and had a blast on the dinosaur trail. We stayed from 10am until 4:30pm and never once felt bored! Iâ€™d highly recommend it for a family day out. We brought a picnic for lunch and found plenty of spots to sit and eat. We ended the day with a cup of tea and an ice cream in the cafÃ©â€”great value at just Â£5.50 for both. The staff and animal care team were very friendly and polite!
Initially, I thought the Â£20 ticket price for anyone over 2 seemed a bit steep, but considering how much we did and how long we stayed, it turned out to be excellent value. There were still activities we didnâ€™t get to! Iâ€™d definitely return in the futureâ€”100% worth it.

(Updated from a 4 star review I made 6 months ago)

recent_reviews.author: Peter A
recent_reviews.text: Had a lovely few hours here in the sunshine. The place is quite small and definitely geared more towards younger children, probably best suited for those under 7. The animal feeding is free and a lot of fun â€” a real highlight! Staff were very friendly and helpful throughout. The dinosaur walk was pleasant, with a nice path around a pond. However, it does feel quite expensive for whatâ€™s on offer, considering the size and scope of the attractions.

recent_reviews.author: Amelia Spurin
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful place to visit with young children. A range of indoor and outdoor activities to keep them entertained including a soft play centre, and always a programme of activities going on throughout the day such as animal feeding, goat racing and milking demonstrations. We're lucky enough to have an annual pass which makes it pretty goof value for money.

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Nickerson
recent_reviews.text: Even in the rain, Farmer Palmer's was a great day out in which my kids enjoyed endless play, holding or feeding a number of animals, pig racing and a dinosaur trail. We were there from opening until mid afternoon in rainy weather, and can only imagine if the sun is shining this place is easily a full day out for any family with kids under 8. Loved it.

recent_reviews.author: Natasha Fairbrother
recent_reviews.text:
What a fantastic find!
After a disappointing pub lunch the day before, discovering Gulliver's was an absolute breath of fresh air. Beautifully and lovingly run, this place is incredibly family-friendly with a welcoming, relaxed atmosphere.

Thereâ€™s plenty of seating both indoors and outdoors, a great play area, and a spacious green area for the kids to enjoy. They even provide toys and books, which was such a thoughtful touch. The staff were all smiling, friendly, and genuinely seemed to enjoy being there â€” it made such a difference.

The food was on another level â€” absolutely delicious and incredible value, especially with their â€œkids eat for Â£1â€ offer. One of the best lunches weâ€™ve had in a long time!

We also loved the nature trail and were delighted to see pigs, chickens, and goats â€” the kids were in their element.

What really stood out to us is the ethos behind this place. We love that the establishment supports providing opportunities for adults with varying support needs â€” such a beautiful mission and clearly part of what makes this place so special.

Canâ€™t recommend it highly enough â€” weâ€™ll definitely be back!
