recent_reviews.author: Robynne Hammer
recent_reviews.text:
Excellent breakfast brunch, plenty of space for the kids to play and drive the tractors. The kids and adult breakfast was outstanding! Highly recommend for family breakfast and really good coffee for adults too. A very polite and professional team of adults with support needs. It all seems to work in perfect harmony. Weâ€™ll be back ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ»
Weâ€™ll check out the shop on the way out and be back before long no doubt!

recent_reviews.author: Countryside Traveller
recent_reviews.text:
Gullivers Farm Shop & Kitchen is a gem for families and the community! We thoroughly enjoyed the Christmas events for our little ones!

The food is fresh, delicious, and thoughtfully prepared, with superb coffee thatâ€™s hard to beat. The shop is full of organic, local produce, and the whole place has a warm, welcoming vibe.

We loved the family-friendly activities like meeting the farm animals and the play area for kids. What really stands out is the amazing work they do to support adults with varying support needs, creating opportunities and a real sense of community. Itâ€™s a fantastic place for great food, great coffee, and a meaningful experience!

recent_reviews.author: Kira Bourn
recent_reviews.text:
Weâ€™ve been here a few times and Iâ€™ve always loved what the shop stands for, itâ€™s inspiring how they choose their team, specifically supporting people with different support needs. The foodâ€™s usually great too, their breakfast is lovely and their sandwiches are super tasty. But this time we chose to have the burger and it was a bit disappointing. For Â£15.50, the burger only had pickles, and nothing else..not even sauce, causing it to be quite dry.

The salad didnâ€™t help much either, just plain leaves in a cup, no tomatoes or dressing. On the bright side, the fries and coleslaw were amazing! Iâ€™d definitely come back for the fries!

I really hope they rethink the burger, even just a nice homemade sauce would make a huge difference.

Iâ€™m giving it 4/5 as our other experiences have been really good.

pumpkin_patches.address: Station Rd, West Moors, Ferndown BH22 0JG

recent_reviews.author: Toby Muir
recent_reviews.text:
Such a great local shop packed with plenty of fresh local produce. I always come here for my fruit, vegetables, and granola - with a great variety of fruit & vegetables!

A friendly team on board to help any customers that always are always helpful and improve the experience. Even for a local university student myself, prices are at a good value for me to shop at regularly. I couldnâ€™t recommend more if youâ€™re looking for great quality, value, and service! ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸŒ¾

recent_reviews.author: Nix Smith
recent_reviews.text: Wonâ€™t be voting fruit here again. Â£3 for a medium watermelon which was 70% rotten inside. Managed to salvage a little but my weeks lunch is a fruit salad so I now only have 2 days worth of edible lunch

recent_reviews.author: aygÃ¼l zoroÄŸlu
recent_reviews.text: Always super fresh and great price. Love fruits a lot and this is to place to have em. ğŸ“ğŸ©·

recent_reviews.author: Oliver Reece
recent_reviews.text: I donâ€™t normally like to leave reviews, but I had to let other people know about it. I bought nectarines and peaches, as they looked very fresh and quite a big size. The chap I spoke to was very helpful with explaining the difference between nectarines and peaches, so had to get a mixture of both. Definitely coming back againğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Paula Street
recent_reviews.text: The market was open 9 till 1pm Saturday 26 July 2025. There were 3 stalls : 1 mainly local veg, 1 mainly local meats, 1 mainly homemade bakeware. There wasn't a wait as it was quiet on this occasion.

recent_reviews.author: Stephen Tegg
recent_reviews.text: Great little farmers market,  great products, and very friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Helen Fining
recent_reviews.text: I go there once a fortnight for the market. The market is held every Saturday between 9 am to 1 pm

recent_reviews.author: Brigitte Dowland
recent_reviews.text: We havenâ€™t seen vegetables look this fresh and mouthwatering in a very long time. Absolutely delicious. We will definitely be buying from you again. Thank you ğŸ˜ƒ

recent_reviews.author: Kirsty Hebditch
recent_reviews.text: So much choice for pumpkins ğŸƒ massive all the way down to little mini pumpkins, orange, white or green. Probably the best lamb burgers I've ever eaten from Dorset Lamb.

recent_reviews.author: Neill Wilson
recent_reviews.text: Still had a great time, selecting pumpkins despite the weather

recent_reviews.author: Julia Ford
recent_reviews.text: Great time pumpkin picking with my girls today. Lovely choice and great people!

recent_reviews.author: Dan Mitchell
recent_reviews.text: Amazing pumpkin picking and excellent friendly staff

pumpkin_patches.address: 2 Long Cl, Milton Abbas, Blandford Forum DT11 0BU

recent_reviews.author: T K
recent_reviews.text: I called in to see the sunflowers, around 9am. I didn't see anyone at all. I felt a bit guilty being there to be honest.  I promise I didn't take any flowers.  I didn't have anything to cut them with.  Â£1 per stem.

recent_reviews.author: Oliver Waplington
recent_reviews.text: Amazing farm the sunflowers are premium. Itâ€™s amazing to stand in the field at sunsetğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: Mrfuncake Gaming
recent_reviews.text: The sunflowers were amazing. Worth a visit..

recent_reviews.author: Michelle Penner
recent_reviews.text: The fields of sunflowers was a sight to be seen.  You can cut (tools supplied) sunflowers and take home for Â£1 each.  Picnic benches and plenty of parking

recent_reviews.author: Ivan Roberts
recent_reviews.text: Cracking little farm

recent_reviews.author: T S
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing shop with an amazing view, a weekly or daily must visit for anyone living in Huddersfield. An outdoor seating section with tables and chairs to enjoy the weather would be a great idea.
Great selection of pies, had a cheese and pickle pork pie and the meat was slightly tough, however also had the rhubarb and chilli jam pork pie and it was to die for.
Also sells dixons ice cream and ice cream for dogs

recent_reviews.author: Chloe Bell
recent_reviews.text:
Came Saturday lunch time, was busy had a little 5-10 minute wait for a table but was served quickly once seated. Had a widow seat with absolutely beautiful views. I had the Korean chicken sandwich minus the side salad (personal preference) mum had small fish and chips. Food was perfect, tasty, hot. Staff very friendly and efficient. Very reasonable priced will certainly be back for the cafe and the farm shop.

Bought a steak pie and almond slice tray bake from the farm shop again very reasonably priced very tasty food very friendly staff.

recent_reviews.author: Julie Martin
recent_reviews.text:
If you enjoy a hearty breakfast whilst admiring a great view, Brosters is a good place to go. It was a very grey day when we visited but we were lucky to get a table by the window and the view was still lovely.
There was a good choice on the breakfast menu and prices were very reasonable. We opted for a sausage and bacon sandwich with extra black pudding and eggs benedict. Both were very good and generous portions. The lunch menu also sounds very good, so we will definitely be returning soon.
The farm shop is next to the cafe and has a great selection of products, generally a bit cheaper than a lot of the bigger farm shops, so also worth a browse around.

recent_reviews.author: Sophie C
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely love this place. Could sit in the cafe on a nice sunny day looking out at the view an endless amount of time. The sandwiches are top tier. No stingy portions and the staff are more than happy to be accommodating if like me you are a slightly picky eater. I am always kindly given a doggy bag as I rarely make it through my whole sandwich but I enjoy the treat of having more later in the day at home. The shop is also great. Butchers in particular are top tier and the staff are really lovely and eager to help and advise with choices. I am very excited about stocking my fridge up from the shop this coming Christmas! Will make for a gorgeous roast!

recent_reviews.author: heather whitehead
recent_reviews.text:
What a lovely find!

We were welcomed with a smile and offered a choice of sitting inside or out. It was only 9am, but people were already arriving, always a good sign of a popular spot.

We chose to sit inside, which had a pleasant and relaxed atmosphere. Our order was taken promptly by Sophie, who was so personable and friendly.

When the food arrived, it was beautifully presented and absolutely delicious. Weâ€™ll definitely be back.

We also visited the farm shop and bought the mixed meat pack â€“ great value for money. We havenâ€™t tried the contents yet as they went straight into the freezer, but Iâ€™ll post another review at a later date once we have.

Thank you.

recent_reviews.author: jack donnell
recent_reviews.text: Ordered an ultimate breakfast sandwich which is Â£7.50 which is extortionate for a sandwich in the first place. Before the sandwich had good filling with four bacon, three sausage with a runny egg. This time there were only two sausage and bacon with hardly any mushrooms and a dry tea cake and egg. I explained to the woman in the cafe that I got more filling and not dry bread like last time, she argued that we have never put that much filling in the sandwich. In the end I asked for a refund wonâ€™t be going there again in the future, In the past end I got my refund hence my the two stars.

recent_reviews.author: Adrian Leech
recent_reviews.text: Me and my wife sometimes come here when weâ€™re on our dinner break as itâ€™s only 2 mins up the road from where we both work and every time weâ€™ve come weâ€™ve never had any issues whatsoever. Quite pricey but quality food, friendly staff and excellent service. Ideal for a treat

recent_reviews.author: David
recent_reviews.text: Chaos ! How not to run cafe seating and ordering â€¦ lovely staff but frankly they need training â€¦ left standing at the door whilst one staff member taking table orders and another having a personal chat with staff at the till â€¦ food very good quality although the bacon was considerably overcooked the black pudding has a peculiar taste I suspect trying to be fancy â€¦ Â£1.50 for fried bread really !!! If not for these issues it would be five stars Ps great cake selection ! Ignore the ranting idiot (NIMBY) about them selling land for housing I suspect they would have had they had it and we desperately need houses !!!!

pumpkin_patches.address: Bradley Villa Farm, Bradford Rd, Huddersfield HD2 2JX

recent_reviews.author: Robin Holness
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely morning out picking strawberries and raspberries with my son. He loved it so much and then drove round in a little car. Had a lovely breakfast in the cafe outside and the playground area was amazing! Been a while since weâ€™ve been to a nice outdoor one like that.
Definitely want to come back during pumpkin season!

recent_reviews.author: Defney Rodrigues
recent_reviews.text:
We visited Farmhouse yesterday, and overall it was a peaceful and relaxing spot. The farm itself was beautiful and serene, perfect for a quiet day out. Due to crop maintenance, we werenâ€™t able to pick strawberries, which was a bit disappointing â€” but understandable.

We sat outdoors and enjoyed the fresh air. While the drink served to us came in a cloudy-looking glass and the drink bottle was in the glass (which didnâ€™t feel very hygienic), the rest of the experience made up for it. The food was absolutely delicious! We had the fish gujouns, coronation  chicken burger, and the crispy chicken burger â€” all were full of flavor and generously portioned.

Despite the small hiccup, we enjoyed our time and the meal. Weâ€™re already looking forward to returning â€” especially to try the strawberry picking next time!

recent_reviews.author: Nekhel Sahay
recent_reviews.text: A good variety of organic stuffs with one of the best qualities of poultry and dairy you can get in UK. Have been here a couple of times and it has never ceased to disappoint me in any manner. Plucking the strawberries and strolling through the farm fields is cherry on the cake if you visit here. Jersey milkshake and cheesecakes are the match winners here always.

recent_reviews.author: Julie
recent_reviews.text: Came for the strawberry picking. No need to book in advance, which is very helpful. Â£2 entry per person. Plenty of parking spaces and lots of strawberries. Fruit was very juicy!

pumpkin_patches.address: Stamford Bridge Rd, Gate Helmsley, York YO41 1NB

recent_reviews.author: Julie Cotterell
recent_reviews.text:
I have visited BuryLane on a number of occasions. The food in the cafe is of good quality and the staff are polite and attentive.
This year we have been to the pick your own. The flowers are of excellent quality and are reasonably priced. We have picked delphiniums and dahlias recently.
All have been beautiful.

recent_reviews.author: Mark Davies
recent_reviews.text: Took our little one for the first time, was pleasantly surprised to keep him entertained for the whole day. Lots of things to bounce on, jump off, dig, and climb. We travelled an hour to get there and was not let down. Even came away with a lovely house plant for Â£6, which we thought was really reasonable, especially since the farm hop has one of these "posh" garden places vibe.

recent_reviews.author: Hussein
recent_reviews.text: Overall itâ€™s a nice farm with a nice farm shop. The PYO fruit section is a good size. We went during the prime season for strawberries and found them in great condition. The flowers that we picked out were also really nice. The price for strawberries was reasonable at Â£8 per kg. The farm shop was quite expensive.

recent_reviews.author: Peter
recent_reviews.text:
The best, never expected something big  inside here.

This tulip farm, is just an hour and half from London via public transport, no booking required and free entry!
If you want to cut tulips bring your scissors And start picking the ones you love
Prices start from Â£6.50 for ten stems!
There are so many varieties of tulips.
Come with basket ğŸ§º

recent_reviews.author: Eddie Walker
recent_reviews.text: Really nice bacon sandwich and good value coffee. Just a shame the service let down the experience a little: plates were too small, we had to hunt down some cutlery from other tables and there were no napkins to be seen anywhere. Would still visit again for the value though.

recent_reviews.author: David Forster
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely banging breakfast for the money. Very reasonable pricing, top quality ingredients from local suppliers too. Breakfast was delicious

recent_reviews.author: Howard Turner
recent_reviews.text: Called in today before a days fishing. Really good farm shop, good selection of  fresh goods, friendly staff. Decent cafe bacon sandwich and coffee on arrival. Good  menu good prices.

recent_reviews.author: Micheal Armistead
recent_reviews.text: Sandra and Micheal just love visiting the cafe and shop.Food always good.

pumpkin_patches.address: Bank End Rd, Blaxton, Finningley, Doncaster DN9 3NT

recent_reviews.author: David Wilson
recent_reviews.text:
Stumbled across this on the way to Markham Grange. Really good farm shop especially the butchers which sells a good range of quality meat cuts, sausages etc. Ended up buying quite a lot.
Very popular cafe which you really need to book to get a seat at lunch time. Sat outside and had a very nice sandwich. How busy it is tells you all you need to do about the menu and quality

recent_reviews.author: MML Reviews
recent_reviews.text:
April 2025 update
Still a excellent farm shop and little cafe
Atmosphere is buzzing
Friendly staff
Excellent produce
Bargain Victoria sponge cake and high quality produce.

Been meaning to come here a while now, but just couldn't find the time until today.

Farm shop looked great, prices not too expensive as a farm shop. Great friendly service and clean

Cafe... Again friendly service and the food, wow. You can certainly taste the quality of the produce which makes it even more exciting when I get home as we bought quite a few things

Highly recommend

recent_reviews.author: Jeffrey â€œJefmondâ€ Almond
recent_reviews.text: Had a nice cup of "Tea Pigs" everyday tea and a substantial toasted teacakes in the cafe. Also went to the farm shop, great selection of sausages and meats. Bought a good sized Rib eye ğŸ¥©, not cheap, but what is these days.

recent_reviews.author: Bohemian Life
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic produce in the shop at great prices and friendly helpful staff â­â­â­â­
However, we were a little disappointed by the cafe. Not a great ambience and whilst we were there, despite being quiet they couldn't get our order correct. They asked how we would like our eggs and I chose runny yokes and my wife requested hers hard yolk and flipped......mine came overcooked and my wife's was runny and not flipped. A minor hitch but what is the point of asking a customers preference if you can't delive. I did mention this to a member of staff but nothing was actually done. The other issue is the tea. I ordered Earl Grey but was given Darjeeling Earl Grey mix. Not the same at all.
Smallish issues but the cafe is just not good enough to make us want to return.

recent_reviews.author: Adele Norrie
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic day out, hours of fun for all age, there is so much to do here, my children love it and never seem to get bored. The summer pass is such a good purchase, includes a foam party at 3pm each day very exciting for the kids and a great way to finish off their play. Plenty of seating and benches scattered about to sit back and watch the kids play, It has a Lovely clean, indoor play area, and imaginary play, friendly staff, good food & prices. Yes there isnâ€™t lots of animals but thereâ€™s enough and the rest of the play & fun makes up for this I donâ€™t even bother visiting others now as they just donâ€™t compare!

recent_reviews.author: Cheryl Romano
recent_reviews.text:
Had a great day out at Pink Pig farm with  2 x six years old girls, an 18 month old and a 10 year child.The wooden rail carts and the foam party were the greatest ! The outdoor  space is always a bonus when you have kids and there were extra  activities on the field eg. badminton, hoop throwing, rope swing and zip line and moreâ€¦It was a very hot day yesterday  around 28 degrees?? The metal  slide in the park was hot under the sun therefore the  kids and unable to play on it, an open canopy or some kind of shade would have been useful also for the  large bouncing  pillows they were quite hot under the sun and unfortunately the kids soon give up on those. We would have liked more animals and more interaction with the all of the animals but understand this is difficult to safely provide.
We had a great day out, great facilities at the farm. Enjoyed our picnic ,Stayed for there for nearly 6 hours.

recent_reviews.author: Liz V.
recent_reviews.text: Looking after my great granddaughter  and wondered where to go. It was an hours journey to The Pink Pig Farm but I'm so pleased we went.  If you're looking for a fantastic day out with children that isn't going to cost an absolute fortune this is the place to go. Inside and outside activities, snack bar and cafe. And of course the foam party where all children was so excited.  Please, please give your kids a day to remember and go to Pink Pig Farm.

recent_reviews.author: Anastasia T
recent_reviews.text: Went with a 2 year old for the first time. Highly recommend. My toddler had a great time outdoors in the sand area (there are at least two), on the playground, slides, jumping pillow, seeing the animals, meeting the smaller critters. The indoor playground was also a big hit!

pumpkin_patches.address: Holme Hall, Holme Ln, Scunthorpe DN16 3RE

recent_reviews.author: J Goulden
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely fantastic nursery that I know provides an outstanding, caring, nurturing environment for my children to grow and develop.

Great out door space for the children to play and enjoy the benefits of being based so close to a working farm. The team are like a second family and genuinely care about the children they work with. Would 100% recommend Loversall Farm Nursery

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte Renham
recent_reviews.text: Kept my horse here for a while and they was noting book good to me

recent_reviews.author: Viktoriya Matthews
recent_reviews.text:
A wonderful FREE place for adults and children in the middle of London. An oasis of peace and calm. Loads of animals, many rescued or retired. Mostly runs on the support of volunteers and by applying for various funds. Started in 1978.
I really hope it will continue its good work and will not be given away for some high rise buildings.
We volunteered today and had so much fun!

recent_reviews.author: Kevin Dalton
recent_reviews.text: This place is a true Hidden Gem just a short walk from bustling Brick Lane and a stone's throw from the City you have this little exhibition farm in the middle of a lovely park. Clearly well loved by the all-volunteer staff and visitors alike, this place has plenty to entertain little ones for a good few hours. We went with 5 kids aged 2-8 and they all had a great time. Small animals we saw included ferrets, rabbits, ducks and rescued chickens and then larger animals were pigs, goats, sheep and donkeys. Lots of opportunity to see nature on the well laid out trail around the farm yards. Well maintained (nothing is new, it's very 'rustic' with lots of repurposed bits and pieces but clearly well looked after) with informative signage everywhere. Staff friendly and happy to talk to kids about the animals. Good play facilities in the farm and excellent playground outside in the park too. Will come back

recent_reviews.author: Willer Vascz
recent_reviews.text: It was amazing to visit the farm! The animals looked so happy and well taken care of. The whole place had a peaceful, welcoming vibe, and it was such a fun and relaxing experience. Highly recommend for families or anyone who loves animals!

recent_reviews.author: Kendall Peery
recent_reviews.text: What a special little spot in city. Staff was friendly and helpful. The animals were sweet. I enjoyed reading their stories and appreciate this kind space provided for them.

recent_reviews.author: MR A A
recent_reviews.text:
Went to Belmont Farm today â€” the farm and animals were absolutely amazing! Great variety, well-kept, and the kids loved the hands-on experience.

However, the soft play area really let the visit down. It was very dirty, especially the toddler section, which definitely needs a deep clean. For a place that welcomes so many young children, hygiene should be a bigger priority.

Still, the farm itself was great â€” if they improve the cleanliness of the play area, it would easily be a top family day out.

recent_reviews.author: Ionela Chiriceanu
recent_reviews.text:
We used to visit this animal farm regularly 7â€“8 years ago and always loved it. Despite being a small farm with a limited selection of animals, it had a peaceful charm. The green open space was perfect for children to run and play freely, and the food selection, though small, was always clean and pleasant.

When we heard about the addition of a soft play area, we were excited, thinking it would enhance the experience and offer even more activities for the kids. Unfortunately, our recent visit left us deeply disappointed.

Itâ€™s sad to see such a large area with so much potential being neglected. The outdoor space remains untouchedâ€”no new play areas, no upgrades. The animal enclosures seem poorly maintained. The area that once housed ducks and chickens now appears overrun by rats. The cow and donkey pens were dirty and unpleasant to be near.

The new soft play area is very small, with limited options for both small and older children. The cafe was another letdown. When I asked about food options, I was told they close at 4 PM, with last orders at 3. The choices were minimalâ€”just a few sandwiches, pizza, and not much else.

Itâ€™s such a shame. This is a beautiful location with a huge green space that could be turned into something truly wonderful for families. With some care and vision, they could offer clean facilities, a nice outdoor play area, a better cafe, and more variety of well-kept animals

recent_reviews.author: Steve Lazarus
recent_reviews.text:
Great place to take toddlers. Really well organised and super helpful staff.
The soft play area fun for kiddies followed by the farm animals which you can get really up close to and feed inside and outside.
There is a decent cafe, private party area and plenty of place to sit if you are not so inclined to get involved. Dogs not allowed in play or animal area but can stay in cafe or outside which is fine.
Also lovely rural setting.

recent_reviews.author: R H
recent_reviews.text:
Itâ€™s very quiet with a moderate number of animals.
The playground equipment requires a fee.
We went on a weekday during the Easter holidays, and it was fine to make a reservation right before going.
The entrance is located further down past the attached nursery.

My child accidentally entered while eating a piece of bread, but no one said anything.
However, there are signs asking not to eat food.

There are plenty of places to wash your hands.

recent_reviews.author: SY Kwong
recent_reviews.text: Recently visited a lovely city farm located in Islington, about 10 mins walk from the Underground station. Itâ€™s not very large, but it houses a variety of animals, including pigs, rabbits, and sheep. The farm is well-maintained and clean, creating a pleasant atmosphere. Itâ€™s a great place for both adults and children to enjoy.

recent_reviews.author: Tony Cheung
recent_reviews.text: Hidden farm in islington. Very peaceful place. Loads of little animals to see. Really enjoy it.

recent_reviews.author: Hibaq Iman
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm. Free entry but donations are welcomed. Small but enough for the children to enjoy themselves. The lad who delivered the school talks was amazing so patient with the with kids and made the talks so interesting. Worth the visit hope to back again soon.

recent_reviews.author: Elli Koutsougianni
recent_reviews.text: Nice farm ! Plenty of space, They could have more animals! We visited with my little one at lunchtime and it was not too busy just 2-3 families.

recent_reviews.author: Yin Panda
recent_reviews.text:
Stunning scenery, amazing service staff, delectable plates, truly every single bite was cooked to almost perfection.

My favourite bites -
mushrooms were cooked perfectly
Hash brown not soggy
Cheese and onion pie was something else
The milkshake and the coffee because of the fresh milk and fresh cream and ice cream made it thick and creamy, I would come all the way from city centre just for another shake.

The drive up was amazing

The antique fluff ball basking on the menu table is the best dining companion or distraction you could ever ask for

And again the staff are absolutely the kindest and most genuine people I've had the luck of being looked after by, both Ellen and Amy gave the best food and drink suggestions and also looked after us when ignorant comments were made by a random ignorant guy.

Will com back often.

recent_reviews.author: I H
recent_reviews.text:
Beautiful scenery, a lovely location, and very friendly staff make this a great place to visit. The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, with both indoor and outdoor seating availableâ€”perfect for families.

A quick note: if youâ€™re not a fan of strong cheese, the cheese and onion pie might not be for you. I found it a bit too much, but most of my family really enjoyed it, so it might just be a personal preference.

Prices are mid-range; two meals came to around Â£30, which felt fair given the overall experience. Beyond the food, thereâ€™s a lot to enjoy: sheep grazing nearby, benches to sit and take in the view, and a fresh farm shop you can explore after your meal.

Overall, a lovely spot thatâ€™s well worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: SinPin TV
recent_reviews.text: Amazing food and great shop for your meat and cheeseâ€¦Best Oreo Milkshake by far.

recent_reviews.author: DannyMk7gti
recent_reviews.text:
Just what youd expect from a good farm shop. We went late morning into lunch and grabbed a small breakfast, blue cow burger and chunky chips with 2 drinks. Of course you may pay that bit more than regular cafes etc but it shows, the sausages were simply amazing, crunchy hash browns, runny egg, crispy bacon, beans and soft buttery toast. The burger which was a  double patty with a strong and tangy blue cheese went well with the burgers, and the chunky chips....well you cant go wrong.
Into the farm shop had everything youd expect from cakes, crisps, drinks, meats and sauces.
Will definately return and was worth the 50 minute drive to get to.

recent_reviews.author: Michael Dean
recent_reviews.text: Nice little farm shop with cheese, vegetables, cakes and some good pork pies. Only been on a Saturday and there's usually a Whitby seafood van outside.

recent_reviews.author: Val Dutton
recent_reviews.text: I was looking for a nice farm shop and Tomlinsons had excellent reviews. I was not disappointed. It was clean and tidy. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the food was amazing with a good selection of  fresh fruit and veg. The steak burgers were the best burgers I've ever tasted. I was spoilt for choice on the butchers counter. They also had my favourite Yoghurt brand, Longley Farm. We will mist definitely be returning.

recent_reviews.author: A Jordan
recent_reviews.text: This farm shop is the best thing about Pudsey. The veg lasts way longer than supermarket veg and the variety is great. Butcher counter is brilliant and as I'm cooking for one, I love that I can ask for a smaller portion to avoid waste. Top quality produce and the staff are lovely. Highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Ashley
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely beautiful product never had such nice bacon and sweet treats definitely going again
Really kind staff

pumpkin_patches.place_name: The Rhubarb Triangle Farm Shop Limited

recent_reviews.author: Collette Martin
recent_reviews.text: Loved my ham salad sandwich and a tickle of the animals, but really missed seeing a highland cow?

recent_reviews.author: BOBBY
recent_reviews.text:
This is an excellent little farm shop with a whole range of produce and treats for you to purchase. The sausage roll and cornflakes tart I had were delicious.

There is even a few sheep and a alpaca to stroke.

recent_reviews.author: Abdul Wahab
recent_reviews.text: Iâ€™m very satisfied with my order! I had the egg mayo sandwich and it was absolutely amazing â€“ fresh, flavorful, and perfectly made. The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming, which made the experience even better. Iâ€™ll definitely be going back again. Highly recommended!

recent_reviews.author: Lydia Rogers
recent_reviews.text:
Farm shop and cafe. My grandson loves this place as do I and my husband.  It is a great little farm shop which can supply all your food and drink needs. But it also has 2 outside seating areas where you can eat and drink. One is in the quadrant the other opposite the field.
I had the salad tray, my husband the ploughman tray and my grandson brownie and sausage roll in that order. The food was fresh and delicious.
If you eat next to the field you will see sheep, goats and a very friendly alpaca.
You can buy food pellets for them and hand feed them. There is a sink to clean your hands following the feeding.
Left of the car park is another field with ducks, chickens and goats. Again you are welcome to feed them.
It feels far more casual than a petting farm and my grandson gets so much fun and joy feeding the animals, them and a brownie makes his afternoon.

recent_reviews.author: Lou Glasgals
recent_reviews.text: Loved it! A proper farm shop. Pricey, but nice to support local businesses. They have coffee & ice cream as well as other bits and bobs. A nice pit stop for some odds & ends, or if you are like me & love a farm shop, itâ€™s great for a browse to pick up some local produce.

recent_reviews.author: Anna Anning
recent_reviews.text: Like everyone else has already mentioned it was the ice cream that gets this place 5 stars.  Homemade with their milk,  adventurous flavours,  decent portion.  Mango & Lime a real winner.

recent_reviews.author: Christie G
recent_reviews.text: Incredible ice cream, made on the farm and lots of other goodies. Worth the trip! Glorious views and outdoor seats available.

recent_reviews.author: AMR
recent_reviews.text: Nice farm shop with variety of items, we bought the kids the animal shaped cookies (cow, horse, unicorn) and they were delicious. Nice seating area outside with cows in the field next to it. The ice creams looked delicious

recent_reviews.author: J W
recent_reviews.text: very good farm open day! enjoyed quite a lot! with considerate toddler play area and lots of interesting farm stories. Thank you John and team for such a great day! and lots of ot local food, amazing. will definitely come back

recent_reviews.author: Niko Sanguinetti
recent_reviews.text:
We love this place! They have a great menu with tons of daily specials and great traybakes. The food is always delicious and the staff are lovely.

There is a huge car park and clean toilets. There is even a play area for kids. Unfortunately, dogs are not allowed inside either the restaurant or the shop but can sit with you at the outdoor tables around the property if you want to eat some ice cream.

recent_reviews.author: E B
recent_reviews.text: Called in and ordered 2 ice creams. They mentioned it might be soft. Asked if we wanted sauce or sprinkles. On the board it stated 40 pence for sprinkles or flake. We asked for raspberry sauce. Only after we paid, we noticed we had been charged 80 pence for the most miserable/miniscule about of sauce. Outrageous. Bit sneaky not having the pricing on the board.

recent_reviews.author: Allan Marshall
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely place to visit at the weekend. Fresh milk in the shop is amazing. Food is very good and the outside catering is a great addition when the weather is good.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Kirk
recent_reviews.text: Cannot express enough what an enjoyable and fun event for all the family this place is ! Every visit has been fantastic and the children are so kindly encouraged to try new things . Great experience every single time ! Would highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Darren Smith
recent_reviews.text: Visited with friends and our kids to see the lambs and other animals, staff were fantastic all so lovely, animals were so child friendly, adults and kids had a great day!

recent_reviews.author: Alex McQuiggan
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful 1st birthday party for my daughter. The staff were brilliant and both kids and adults loved the animals and activities

recent_reviews.author: Margo Haughen
recent_reviews.text: Attended a children's event-what fun! Staff were great, venue so unusual, animals all child friendly, children were delightedğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Matt JP
recent_reviews.text:
I don't ever write bad reviews unless it's to ward people off from a bad experience.

The soup and sandwich deal is appaling, even by today's standards. The cost is Â£9.50, or if you just have bread, it's still a staggering Â£6.50. The size of the bowl is maybe just shy of 3/4 the size of a Costa Flat White mug. The soup itself looked and tasted low quality like something from a can, with no toppings or presentation. The sandwich is very plain as well with minimal filling in some cases. My friend (who is very unfussy) complained about the strange taste of their toastie.

We needed to check allergens for Gluten Free and were directed to the QR code (they were not able to check themselves). This was an inconvenience for a number of reasons, however on getting the website up.. the whole screen of the allergens list was covered in ads! You could not make this up. You can barely read it and we were unable to determine the allergens.

The staff were highly polite though!

recent_reviews.author: Jeanette McDowell
recent_reviews.text: My husband and I got a coffee , tea and two cakes.  We decided to go to the coffee and cake  cafe area which used to be reserved for afternoon teas.  Unfortunately the first seating area,  which had the comfy seats had 5 flies hovering and landing on the seats and table.  We went to other seats thinking it would be better but all the time we were in the cafe the flies kept appearing and landing on us and trying to get to the food and drinks. We spent our seating time there swatting them.  It was most uncomfortable and our time there was cut short.  I reported it to the staff and they said they knew about the problem and were trying to sort it.  The drinks and food were good , staff were  pleasant.  Hopefully the company will sort out this very soon.  Iâ€™m not keen to back any time soon.

recent_reviews.author: Bethany Reid
recent_reviews.text:
The restaurant in here is absolutely vile.

The amount of flies is insane - absolutely disgusting and i feel so sorry for the customer service staff made to work in these conditions.

Completely unacceptable and incredibly unsanitary.

Only eat here if you want to get some extra protein in by eating the millions of flies in their kitchen.

recent_reviews.author: dunduff
recent_reviews.text:
A rather disappointing visit today for lunch.

We took advantage of Dobbies dog friendly boast to bring our dog along inside out of the hot sun.

Unfortunately the dog friendly area in the rather large restaurant comprised 4 tables tucked away in a dark corner without windows.

Not that friendly â€¦ more like â€œdog friendly washingâ€.

pumpkin_patches.address: Braehead, 75 Kings Inch Dr, Renfrew, Glasgow G51 4FB

recent_reviews.author: Dustin Morgan
recent_reviews.text: We biked to this beautiful farm just outside of Edinburgh to see the highland cows. They had a few in a smaller fenced in area near the parking lot, but if you're willing to hike about a mile further, there were many more roaming in the pasture. They were very approachable, although we didn't try to pet them. This is a great place to see highland cows if you're visiting Edinburgh! There's also a cafe at the neighboring golf course for snacks or lunch.

recent_reviews.author: Alyssa Becker
recent_reviews.text: Swanston Farm was the perfect place to go to see the Highland Cowâ€™s in Edinburgh.  There is a public bus that goes here, though, because we were limited for time we took an Uber.  From the drop off point we walked less than 10 minutes to where we found them!  They are amazing to see and to watch and we were so glad we went!  The walk is up the road, not in the path on the golf course (we donâ€™t see the sign originally), and there is a longer walk to see more of them, though we didnâ€™t have time to enjoy that.  They have a great map with clear instructions on their website.  It was much easier to access than I originally anticipated.  A highlight for our trip for sure!!

recent_reviews.author: Daria Dubois
recent_reviews.text:
I cannot praise it enough!
Incredible hike with views of the city, of the water, Highlander cows are walking on the fields.. Please don't bother them much. I know people post pictures hugging them, but those are only cows behind the fence near the village. The ones on the hills might not be as welcoming. Bulls can attack if they feel like you are getting to close to their family.
We would approach keeping good 20 feet away from them.

recent_reviews.author: Suelen
recent_reviews.text: Such an amazing place to see the highland cows and it's one bus away from Edinburgh (just take bus 4 or 16 + a 15 min walk to the farm). Some part of the hills are very steep and there's no shadow along the way (if you go on a sunny day like I did) so be prepared, bring water, and enjoy the amazin scenery!

recent_reviews.author: P S
recent_reviews.text: Here is lovely, filled with fresh produce, fresh baked breads and pastries, cured meats, teas,  hand-made soaps, jams, and hand made crafts. I had a great time walking through here, chatting with the vendors and I also saw a cute dog. His owner kindly let me take his photo.

recent_reviews.author: Tania Mara
recent_reviews.text:
The view from there is insane, so pretty.
If you can, just go there, you are gonna see the a lot of food options. They usually accept card payment ğŸ™ğŸ»
We ate a haggis pie that was delicious. ğŸ¤¤

recent_reviews.author: Brielle Bernat
recent_reviews.text:
Great little farmers market to enjoy before your tour of the castle or city. There is a bus stop nearby making it easy to gather your items and hitch a ride. Fruit is not so easy to come by in Edinburgh but there was plenty here! I went to the produce stand and got blueberries and raspberries which were so delicious. Definitely a different flavor profile than the ones you buy in an U.S supermarket. I also stopped by the dairy market and got some delicious milk. It is pastureized unfortunately but had an amazing
flavor to it as well. Lastly I stopped by the soap market and got some nettle soap which is great for eczema and other skin conditions. There were other amazing stands like fish, coffee, and handmade hats/scarves however I did not purchase any. Take a stroll through as you'll never know what you will find.

recent_reviews.author: Yizhou Wu
recent_reviews.text:
The smoked hake was alright but very expensive, about 10pounds for 250g

The pulled pork was very tender and juicy, but rather expensive as well for 12. The crispy skin wasn't very good, it's very hard. Normally you have to request for it anyway so just dont

Strawberries were great from the grocery stall in the centre, could have been sweeter but were very juicy and  large. The only problem with that stall is the rather confusing promotion, there's many different signs saying different things and apparently all of the berries can be included in the 3 for 6.8Â£ deal, including some of the other fruits, but only 2 out of the 4 berries have the 4 for 8Â£ deal

The belted Galloway steak really was quite good, it's extremely tender (so much so that I overcooked the cap thinking it wasn't done yet) and full bodied. However there's also a pronounced bitterness, not sure if it's just my problem but that really affected the enjoyment

Kedar milk really was something. No wonder they have a perpetual queue,  come before 1030 for a shorter queue. One sip and you immediately can tell the difference between theirs and normal milk. It's got a very pleasant natural underlying sweetness, is full bodied, and creamy in a very gentle way. Absolutely delicious, high fat content but not off-putting in anyway.

pumpkin_patches.address: NCP Castle Terrace Car Park, Castle Terrace, Edinburgh EH1 2EN

recent_reviews.author: Don Skoy
recent_reviews.text:
Bit pricey as you might imagine. But the quality speaks for itself. Especially the bakery. Like no other. Literally.
Sure, there are some popular items that you may be able to source cheaper elsewhere. But you simply can't beat their pies and cakes etc. Making myself drool even thinking about it. Yum.
Staff are usually very welcoming and pleasant also. Definitely worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Di
recent_reviews.text: Lovely wee shop to drop in for a visit and unusual items from unusual places. Didn't go into cafe this visit as very busy which makes it very noisy, which mum and me wouldn't find relaxing. Have added some photos of some of the lovely wares they sell.

recent_reviews.author: Bekki Cochrane
recent_reviews.text:
The customer service from the staff here is incredible. Friendly and helpful and knowledgeable about the gin and other local produce they carry.
The butcher's is a little bit more expensive than the supermarket but the quality is far superior, and the selection is fantastic.
I would highly recommend visiting here to purchase some local produce and meat.

recent_reviews.author: FJ McGuire
recent_reviews.text:
Very nice farm shop. Great selection of food and includes butchers, baking, olives and more. Large selection of local Gin, Beer and other items such as chocolate, tea, coffees, juices, fresh steak pies and local Scottish brands.

Just be careful of the price. Some items are cheaper elsewhere.

recent_reviews.author: Tom Pearson
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little place.

recent_reviews.author: tearyghost
recent_reviews.text: i always liked this place. i went there to play some ukulele today and yeah it was cold but the orchard just has good vibes yo

recent_reviews.author: David Calder
recent_reviews.text: Lovely peaceful place. Good for a picnic in the summer. It was a pity that some selfish person stripped the apple trees in the autumn

recent_reviews.author: Zenbloke
recent_reviews.text: Nice place to come with kids it really chill and it's a lovely community thingy

recent_reviews.author: Kayleigh Price
recent_reviews.text: I had a nice afternoon and evening here. There were plenty of pumpkins to choose from. The staff were friendly and welcoming. You have to pay for the pumpkins, and they only accept card payments.

recent_reviews.author: Lucy
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic night out for the family! Great attractions and food stalls. I particularly liked all the different varieties of pumpkin for sale in the Pumpkin Market!
The pumpkin head performers went above and beyond to make everyone feel welcome and have fun ğŸ™‚

recent_reviews.author: Deb
recent_reviews.text:
Brilliant time today at the pumpkin patch, first time we've been pumpkin picking and the kids loved it (aged 6 mths, 13, 16 and 40 something). You can pick your own from the field, or there's lots of good size pumpkins already picked if you don't fancy walking around looking for one you like. Lot's of wheel barrows at the start too so you don't have to carry them around.
When you've finished pumpkin picking there's a small fairground, apple cannon, pumpkin throwing, pumpkin market with lots of different and strange pumpkins, marquee with bar and lots of picnic benches inside to sit and eat / relax, pizza stall, street food burger and chips stall and hot drinks cabin. Food stalls aren't cheap, but we had burger and chips which tasted good. All stalls took card, the bar was card only. Lots of porta-loos. Large car park. It was very muddy so I recommend wellies! But lot's of fun, look forward to going again next Halloween ğŸ¦‡

recent_reviews.author: Abbie Janes
recent_reviews.text: Went for the night time experience, was really good fun, staff were all kind and welcoming, picked 2 pumpkins ready to carve - decent prices.

recent_reviews.author: Emma Wright
recent_reviews.text:
Festival of Fun event!
Great farm for children with a range of animals, all very well looked after.
Different events going off around the farm from feeding and petting rabbits, Guinea pigs. Pony riding, pirate shows and a princess show too with a meet and greet after.
Play gym was clean and staff were very helpful. Kids loved the caterpillar ride, go karts aged 6-12. Great playground too.
Over all great day out ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Unique Valeting Services
recent_reviews.text:
ğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸ A Perfect Day Out for the Whole Family!

We had the most amazing time here and canâ€™t recommend it enough for families with young children! From the moment we arrived, the staff were friendly, welcoming, and clearly passionate about the animals and the visitor experience.

The farm is beautifully kept, and thereâ€™s so much to do. Our kids (ages 3 and 6) absolutely loved feeding the goats and meeting the baby lambs. The animal petting area was a huge hit, with opportunities to hold rabbits and guinea pigsâ€”such a gentle, hands-on experience that the children are still talking about.

Thereâ€™s also a fantastic adventure playground, tractor rides, and a soft play area indoors, which came in handy when the weather turned briefly. Everything was clean, safe, and thoughtfully set up for families.

We were really impressed with the cafÃ© tooâ€”great coffee, homemade cakes, and a decent kidsâ€™ menu with healthy options. Plenty of picnic areas as well if you prefer to bring your own food.

What really stood out was how interactive and educational everything was. The talks and feeding demonstrations were engaging without being too long, and the staff made sure the kids could ask questions and get involved.

We spent nearly the whole day there and could easily have stayed longer. A perfect mix of fun, learning, and fresh air. Weâ€™ll definitely be coming backâ€”and bringing friends next time!

recent_reviews.author: James Hobson
recent_reviews.text:
A Fantastic Farm Adventure!
We stumbled upon this gem the night before our visit, searching for a local outdoor activity to enjoy with my three-and-a-half-year-old daughter. What a find! We snagged a brilliant weekday deal for Â£8.95 for both of us, pre-school holidays, making it excellent value from the off.
We added a bag of animal feed for Â£2, which was well worth it for the interactive fun. My daughter absolutely adored the 'caterpillar ride' â€“ a charming journey snaking around a field, pulled by a quad bike.
The farm itself is easy to find with ample parking. The animals are incredibly well-kept and so friendly, happily interacting with the children who were petting and feeding them. Every member of staff we encountered was genuinely friendly and welcoming.
Beyond the animals, there's a lovely outdoor park and an indoor play area complete with a cafÃ©, offering plenty to keep little ones entertained. The views across the countryside are simply stunning too.
We also opted for the 'Farm Safari', led by a wonderfully entertaining gentleman. He took the time to stop at each animal enclosure, allowing us to get a closer look and plenty of photos â€“ a highly recommended extra!
All in all, it was a truly fantastic and great value day out. We'll definitely be returning!

recent_reviews.author: Deborah Wright
recent_reviews.text:
Great place for little ones and adults alike!
Not a massive farm but plenty to do and see.
We love that included in the price are some experiences such as the petting zone and the soft play.
The extra costs such as safari are not too expensive and worth paying for for the experience.
We have visited twice now and both times have seen a 'show' in the marquee as part of entrance fee.
The staff are LOVELY. Very knowledgeable about the area, farm and of course the animals.
They are happy to stand and talk to you about the farm.
So friendly and welcoming.
They have a little outdoor play area and bounce pillows and tractors to ride also.

recent_reviews.author: Kirsty Moore
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing day out with my 2 sons ... 4year old and 1 year old. Plenty of outdoor activities and play areas. Indoor soft play was massive and kept them entertained with separate area for my 1 year old.
Impressed with the indoor area for picnics just next to indoor soft play area... fab as it was a bit windy the day we were there. I would definitely recommend to anyone visiting the area. Scenery is lovely too ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Marius A
recent_reviews.text:
Was fantastic!!!
Negatives:
Please provide some coin machines around as some attractions cost Â£1 and if someone comes unprepared they will miss out.

I havenâ€™t seen any water fountains (free water) on site. Would definitely need some.

Proâ€™s - the place was fantastic!!!! Me and my family enjoyed all the places there. Our highlights were the tractor ride and the bird show, absolutely amazing, we tried to visit everything and by the time we got to the maze we were absolutely exhausted (thatâ€™s the goal in a place like this). Definitely recommend for a family day out.

recent_reviews.author: Mel Brown
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic day out! We arrived at 10am and left at 3pm and couldâ€™ve stayed longer were it not for tiredness kicking in.

Great place, lots of things to see and do on a warm day as well as indoor soft play. We enjoyed some food at the cafe which was good, a nice selection for adults and children.

Weâ€™ve enjoyed exploring the park and playing on the variety of equipment and rides that are available. Highlight was the dinosaur show, which was interactive and perfect for little ones.

We canâ€™t wait to come back!

recent_reviews.author: Jamie Moore
recent_reviews.text:
A really fantastic park! Huge outside area with a ton of things for the kids that should keep them entertained for hours. The indoor soft play was just as impressive with the wild west area hidden away to the left allowing plenty of room if its busy.

Picnics are allowed in a annex just beside the Softplay which is a nice touch if it's raining.

Plenty of picnic benches outside as well.

recent_reviews.author: Victoria McAdam
recent_reviews.text:
We had a fantastic afternoon at Tweddle Farm!
Thereâ€™s so much to do â€“ we only saw part of it, but weâ€™re already looking forward to coming back to see the rest! The tractor ride was great fun, we got to see what the rest of the farm had to offer, and though we missed the barrel ride, it looked brilliant (and both are free!). Lots of friendly animals to pet and feed, plus great play areas indoors and out â€“ including soft play and go-karting.
Food and drink were easy to find with a cafe on-site and a cool airstream food trailer near one of the play parks, which was really convenient. We visited during the Easter holidays, so there was an Easter egg hunt happening, along with some fairground rides and fun games at the bottom of the farm, adding even more excitement to the day.
A great day out for kids and adults alike!

recent_reviews.author: JF
recent_reviews.text: Brought our 1year 9 month ols Grandson here today. We all loved it. Friendly staff, lovely animals, soft play & outdoor park. Tractor rides & Barrel rides. Plenty to do for all ages. Next time we come we will do the full day.

recent_reviews.author: Hannah
recent_reviews.text: We visited the farm while on holiday at the caravan park and WOW. Probably the highlight of the holiday for the kids. We had the best day. The staff were amazing and so good with the kids at the handling and feeding sessions. It was the most â€˜hands onâ€™ farm weâ€™ve ever been to. Lots of cuddles and feeding. The parks & indoor play barn are also amazing. The barrel/tractor ride was a firm favourite! Excellent value for money. This farm has possibly swayed us to book crimdon dene again for a uk holiday.

recent_reviews.author: eddie ykko
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely place to visit with your kid to see and feed the farm animals and enjoy the playground areas and their daily activities like tractor ğŸšœ ride, feeding the baby cows, petting little animals, etc.
Will definitely recommend â€¦

pumpkin_patches.address: Filipoke Lane, Blackhall Colliery, Hartlepool TS27 4BT

recent_reviews.author: Pippa Brown
recent_reviews.text:
This is our third year visiting Brockwell farm garden nursery for their pumpkin picking and once again we had a lovely afternoon. The patch is free with no booking required; you just pay for what you pick. As well as a few pumpkins, toffee and chocolate apples; I purchased one of their mixed fruit, veg and salad boxes for Â£20 which was incredible value for money with really quality items!
This year we were pleased to also find a facepainter which my little boy was thrilled about. Weâ€™ll absolutely be back next year and Iâ€™ll be ordering the fruit, veg and salad box regularly from now on!

recent_reviews.author: Jennifer Hindmarch
recent_reviews.text: Always 100% happy with produce and service cannot find any negatives.

recent_reviews.author: Katja Sidley
recent_reviews.text: I'm a childminder and I took 6 children to pick pumpkins on half term Monday. The children all loved it. There weren't too many people there and plenty of pumpkins left to pick. The decorations were great and especially the door bell on the pumpkin patch entrance was a big hit! (Children on the photos are my own)

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Leese
recent_reviews.text:
Cracking place to visit to pick pumpkins at Halloween very reasonably priced and the produce is fantastic. Huge field full of different pumpkins ranging from teeny teeny to huge!
Produce in the shop is always great and you can find things here you wouldn't elsewhere.  Ice cream is amazing especially the blackcurrant liquorice flavour. Staff are always very friendly and helpful.

recent_reviews.author: Michaela NovÃ¡kovÃ¡
recent_reviews.text: Amazing pumpkin picking ğŸ‘»ğŸƒğŸ«¶ğŸ½

recent_reviews.author: Jeff
recent_reviews.text: Love this farm shop. Always a friendly welcome, and great fresh produce.

recent_reviews.author: J E
recent_reviews.text: Nice little farm shop with fresh produce and meat although on the expensive side. Other gift and clothing shops also on site. The cafe was a little disappointing, the food was very good but choice was limited and no full breakfast option.

recent_reviews.author: Wendy Coles
recent_reviews.text:
Very disappointed went to Cafe for a coffee and cake,  walked in and the staff behind counter didn't acknowledge us until we asked if we needed to be seated to get served at which we were told to find a table and then return to the counter to get served which we did and guess what? We were ignored yet again,  we left and won't be returning.
I am aware that it was 4.30pm and they close at 5PM and there was cleaning to do but surely customers money is very important for paying the wages,  etc. But it also reduces wasted food.

recent_reviews.author: david blinkhorn
recent_reviews.text:
Great stop off point from your journey north or south on A1 .   2 minds from junction.good cafe good fresh food.
Plus bonus of some great shops of quality to browse round.

recent_reviews.author: Jayne Gafa
recent_reviews.text:
Great little farm shop lots of wonderful goodies, the coffee shop serves good coffee , we came away with a few little treats, the cookware shop & gifts were a delight
We will definitely be back.

pumpkin_patches.address: 16-18, Milkhope Centre, BLAGDON, Newcastle upon Tyne NE13 6DA

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Jarrow Hall: Anglo-Saxon Farm, Village, and Bede Museum

recent_reviews.author: Lauren Grant
recent_reviews.text: Great place for kids, there's animals and plenty of outdoor space. Cafe on sight and loads of room for picnics. Play park on sight for kids aswell. You pay once and get an annual ticket, not expensive at all.

recent_reviews.author: shadesofmists
recent_reviews.text: Attended for the dragon parade and had a blast! The farm, village, and museum were enough to keep an 11 and 13 year old interested from 12-4, and they didn't want to leave. It was quite busy just after the parade, but we all enjoyed it!

recent_reviews.author: Liz Clark (Purpletwiglet)
recent_reviews.text: Disappointing although inexpensive visit. Everything appeared more shabby than last year. Access to various areas was limited. The cafe is ok but we sat outside & had a relatively long wait for 3 cups of coffee. Toilet facilities are adequate but not particularly pleasant. Staff were polite & helpful. There is access to a very nice public park.

recent_reviews.author: mike amos
recent_reviews.text: I wanted to like this place I'd planned the visit for a couple of months while I was in the area , on entering there was workman and scaffolding, through the main entrance the fountain wasn't working and had some dirty water still in it ,  wasn't as historic as I imagined, a few long house styled thatched  buildings , some ancient breeds of cow, sheep , goat , horse , pigs nothing much else I thought there would be reenactors explaining how it was to visitors , you've got to use your imagination it needs more information boards or interactive boards , discount for people on benefits and your ticket lasts a full year , I won't be rushing back

recent_reviews.author: Jean R
recent_reviews.text: Visited today after a recommendation from a friend. We sat outside, under cover, as we had our dogs. Good choice of quiche, pie and cakes on display. Opted for a scone and coffee which were really good. The farm shop is fab, lots of locally sourced items. I bought some delicious  black cherries and a ribeye steak. The staff were helpful, Becca was exceptional though, what a credit she is to the company. Made us so welcome and made a fuss of our dogs. A lovely outdoor area for sunny days and it looked like there was a special play area for children.

recent_reviews.author: Jason Clement
recent_reviews.text:
Nice little farm shop,I didn't buy anything in the butchers but it looks very clean and fresh.
Tea room a good selection of cakes and pies,quiches.
There's a few farm animals for children to see.
I would definitely call in again.

recent_reviews.author: Janette Gaunt
recent_reviews.text: A perfect stop, just off the A1 southbound. Farm shop was well stocked. Very reasonable prices in the cafe and breakfast rolls were tasty. It was extremely busy, but tables turned over quickly.

recent_reviews.author: Michael J Anderson
recent_reviews.text:
Been here a few times now, staff have always been friendly and food selection in the cafe is decent, personally I've had the pulled pork butty and a bacon sandwich, both have been very good.
Coffee was surprisingly really good too.

The farm shop has a good selection of products, the meat counter looks pretty good too. Well worth a visit if in the area.

10/04/23 Just been back and had a bacon sandwich with a flat white, whilst my other half had the beef, mushroom and onion roll, both were very good.
Also grabbed a pork and caramelised onion sausage roll and some local honey from the farm shop, the honey is literally just from along the road.from the shop.

11.02.24 Back again. Bacon sandwich still excellent. Coffee still decent.

recent_reviews.author: anne wild
recent_reviews.text: Car boot. Haven't been for years, still selling same stuff lol but a very enjoyable day

recent_reviews.author: stewart pringle
recent_reviews.text: Recommended a visit, nice coastal farm surrounded by corn fields

recent_reviews.author: Fred Martins
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful place and website ğŸ™‚

recent_reviews.author: Val Collins
recent_reviews.text: Good

recent_reviews.author: PF M
recent_reviews.text: Don't know where this is ğŸ

pumpkin_patches.address: Pelton East Farm Cottage, Pelton Ln, Pelton, Chester-le-Street DH2 1HZ

recent_reviews.author: The Smith
recent_reviews.text: Initially refused to assist my elderly relative who is recovering from surgery with loading his goods into his car. When told he would even pay for his purchases to be taken to the car he was told there is a barrow out front. He finally did get the attention of a member of staff who would assist and when he mentioned the attitude of the cashier he was told not to return. This is advice I would give to anyone hoping for a pleasant shopping experience. DO NOT SHOP HERE. There are other better shops available who do not mistreat the elderly and disabled.

recent_reviews.author: Daniel Vyhnanek
recent_reviews.text:
I highly recommend this place. The quality of the fruit and vegetables is outstandingâ€”so fresh that itâ€™s hard to choose what to buy first. The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. Thank you for such a warm and welcoming experience

Daniel

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Johnston
recent_reviews.text: Great quality products and fantastic prices. Nice and fresh. Great customer service.

recent_reviews.author: food fever
recent_reviews.text: Very nice little shop with local varieties.  We bought local bread, butter (Best butter i had after long time)

recent_reviews.author: Gemma Watson
recent_reviews.text: We chose Pontac Pumpkins for our first time pumpkin picking and weren't disappointed. Great choice of pumpkins, different colours and sizes, friendly staff and I even got some stunning sunflowers. Highly recommended!

recent_reviews.author: just1boronut
recent_reviews.text:
Halloween treat for the whole family.
What can be better than tramping round a huge muddy field with your kids, and grandkids picking your own pumpkins.
Absalutely loved it and the pumpkins we got.
I'm so grateful that someone locally had the idea to do this.
Lovely staff looked after us too.
Highly recommended...

recent_reviews.author: E Louise (Ez lou)
recent_reviews.text: Went for a day of pumpkin picking with the kids and we absolutely loved it. We went later in the day to avoid the crowd and when we arrived there was only a handful of other groups so we got to walk about the field as our own pace. The staff were lovley and even gave the kids mini pumpkins at the end. Will definitely be back next year

recent_reviews.author: hannah horsman
recent_reviews.text: First time going pumpkin picking. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Hand sanitizer was provided. There was  a nice little photo option at the end once you had picked your pumpkins. Took awhile to find some good ones but that's more to do with going later in the picking month but can still find plenty. It was decently priced and well planned out for how many people could be there due to covid. Will definitely be pumpkin picking next year because it sure beats just grabbing one in the supermarket.

recent_reviews.author: Mama Bear
recent_reviews.text: Popped in today as it was convenient to buy cake and quiche, both disappointing and expensive, don't mind paying extra if it's worth it but cheese and ham quiche was tastless and cake was dry definitely not the zesty lemon it promised to be. On a positive note meat is great so I will be back and staff are lovely !

recent_reviews.author: Emma
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely little farm shop selling local produce.
Veg is nice and fresh, you can really taste the difference from supermarket veg.
Got some lamb, the butcher I dealt with was lovely and the meat was beautiful.
Meat was really reasonably priced, other items such as fruit veg etc will be more expensive than maybe use to but well worth it. One of my new fave shops.

recent_reviews.author: Donald Brook
recent_reviews.text: First time today fantastic products. Got meat and a quiche. Iâ€™m a 76 widower and that is one off the very best quiches Iâ€™ve ever had over all my years

recent_reviews.author: James Thompson
recent_reviews.text: I'm not a big steak or meat eater, but my wife had been craving steak for weeks. so come Valentines day I thought I'd  give her a good meaty treat. I explained to the butcher I have no idea what I'm buying I just want some no fatty steaks, he advised I get a rump steak. the wife let it rest prior to Frying with some basic culinary seasoning with the obligatory garlic added and oh my lord, it was top quality and actually has made me look forward to steak again.

recent_reviews.author: emily
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous farm shop selling high quality produce! We brought our meat from here for our weekend away and it was delicious! For reference I have a gluten allergy and the burgers are gluten free! Would recommend a visit here!

recent_reviews.author: Joanna Spice
recent_reviews.text:
1st visit after a church friend recommended to me and will definitely be back.
The best farm shop I have found since moving from Kent.
The butchery section was a delight to discover,  everything was wonderfully displayed,  a chat with the lovely lady behind the counter assured me of the care and quality I could clearly see, that nothing is wasted is refreshing to hear.  I had a great chat about buying my Christmas meat here, looking forward to it.
The pie section was a joy to behold, and lead to great discussion on which flavour pork pies to try, they all looked so tempting  - the markings on top made sure I would remember whose was whose ğŸ˜‹

The tea room was very busy,  and it soon became apparent why, the choice of cakes, treats and meals was a delight.
Next time I will book a table.
Staff in every section were very kind, helpful and willing to assist my disabled friend.

My grateful thanks to all the staff here.

recent_reviews.author: H S
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely lunch,  good gluten free options
and adaptations, could do with a few gourmet sandwich options but nice place and good food. Service ok, dirty table we asked to be cleared. Staff were good considering the heat. Worth a second visit.

recent_reviews.author: Jonny Scott
recent_reviews.text: Worth travelling miles for! Kitson and sons going strong! Great job with this from the very beginning and going strong. Great for families lunch take away celebrations provisions from local and far away. A real treat, must visit. â¤ï¸ğŸŒ…

recent_reviews.author: Paul Collinson
recent_reviews.text: Best place for raw milk and eggs. I travel 45 mins each way every week for them. Way better than supermarket rubbish.

recent_reviews.author: Jenna Mclean
recent_reviews.text:
We came on the day before Halloween and they still had loads of pumpkins. We had an amazing time and it was so much fun mudding up.
Really easy to visit and good priced pumpkins. Hopefully will get to see it next year too!

recent_reviews.author: Lewis Taylor
recent_reviews.text: A must visit in the area if passing by or living locally. I come here regularly for milk. Great price, reusable glass bottles that aren't extortionate. Amazing milkshake flavours too. I love cream egg flavoured. Always well stocked with cheese and quality eggs.

recent_reviews.author: Aemeyra
recent_reviews.text:
Came here for pyo pumpkin. Worth the visit! No booking required and no entry fee.

Plenty of parking space, even has toilet and food truck.

There were many rows of pumpkins to pick from. You pickup a wheelbarrow and pyo pumpkin then pay at the end. According to its sizes.

recent_reviews.author: mike's
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm shop just off the main A road. Lots to look at and a wide choice of cooked and uncooked meats . The garden section was lovely to look around and a few good bargains to be had . We had a late lunch one day and the food was good quality. They are in the process of completing their orangery and this was a little haphazard. Will go back once completed. The upstairs homeware was my favourite area.

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte Goodman
recent_reviews.text: Liked it here. Good range of meals to choose from. Food was great. All the staff we spoke too were friendly and welcoming, the farm shop had a good range of stuff to buy. The meat was brilliant, only 4 stars simply because it's not completely dog friendly in the building, apart from in the heated marquee, understand why in the area where the meat and cheeses are but the rest could be dog friendly, dogs are cleaner and better behaved than children these daysğŸ˜ğŸ¤«ğŸ«£.

recent_reviews.author: Owen Tullan
recent_reviews.text: Magnificent products. Delicious steaks. Brilliant farm shop. Wonderful place to see some animals. A worthy place to visit. Extremely clean facilities and a phenomenal cafe with an amazing menu.

recent_reviews.author: Liz Burton-King
recent_reviews.text:
What a shop!
This place is enormous and very beautiful
There's a cafe, meat and cheese counter, extensive homeward and clothing sections, fresh fruit and plants, snacks and gifts
Two large camels and a llama in the field at the entrance too
Well worth a stop

recent_reviews.author: Crystal Brook
recent_reviews.text:
Visited with 2 children.
Crazy golf was Â£8.50 for the 3 of us with a Â£10 deposit that gets refunded when you take the golf clubs back. The course itself was ok although in my opinion could be rather difficult for younger children.
2 slices of cake and 3 soft drinks came to Â£16.15.
Plant range was ok, nothing special.

recent_reviews.author: TAS 1
recent_reviews.text: My daughter and I took her 22 month old son to see Santa and then to the indoor winter wonderland walk. From start to finish it was wonderful, every team member was chatty and full of festive cheer. The whole set up was perfect, very well organised and thought out. We got some amazing photos to capture the memories and will be back next year. Thank you for making the experience memorable

recent_reviews.author: Talal Mansy
recent_reviews.text: Came for lunch but they had a Halloween Event and it was truly amazing! The amount of detail and effort was top class. There were so many rooms. Both kids and adults were totally entertained! The panini's were 4 star but the Biscoff cake 5 star. Great day out for a couple of hours!

recent_reviews.author: Liquid Metalman
recent_reviews.text: Excellent garden centre, selling a wide range of plants and products. They always create themed events and displays around key times of the year, which are always worth a visit. The Christmas lights and pumpkin picking are noteworthy for those with little ones. The outdoor part of the centre is well laid out with fantastic ornaments on sale as well as beautiful shrubs, plants and trees. There is a mini golf course and a good cafe offering refreshments.

recent_reviews.author: Martin Smith
recent_reviews.text: Excellent holiday, very nice accommodation, would recommend for any large groups.

pumpkin_patches.address: Hangthorne Farm, Stockton Rd, Sadberge, Darlington DL2 1TE

recent_reviews.author: Tony Goose
recent_reviews.text: We just called in to Roots (by recommendation of Chris & Ali at Whorlton Pods). What a lovely place to browse and buy farm produce (vegetables and fresh meat). There's a book nook, outside and indoor eating cafe which is both reasonably priced and excellent quality. Well worth a visit!

recent_reviews.author: Graeme LearnSomethingNewEveryday
recent_reviews.text: Have not been here for quite a while. Glad to see that this is a great Cafe. We had a Rise & Shine with Poached eggs, smashed avocado on Sourdough toast and a Sausage Buttie. The poached egg was a bit overdone for me but still delicious and the bread roll with the bacon buttie was fantastic according to my wife. We also had a flat white and Decaf Americano. Highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Sara Rigby
recent_reviews.text: A lovely little stop for lunch. Service was brilliant and the staff were very friendly. Soup and bread was delicious, especially the bread! And my son thoroughly enjoyed his hot chocolate with all the trimmings ğŸ˜‹

recent_reviews.author: Chris Ayres
recent_reviews.text: Really nice people, great service and amazing food. Five of us got a table together, including a 2 year old, and they were very accommodating. All of us commented on how fanatic our food was. All very happy with our experience. I had the Strawboffee Pie for dessert, it was incredible.

pumpkin_patches.address: Home Farm, East Rounton, Northallerton DL6 2LE
Bettys Farm/Yarm Back La, Stockton-on-Tees TS21 1AY

recent_reviews.author: Sue Creek
recent_reviews.text: Went for the open farm Sunday, it was a really nice day out

recent_reviews.author: Samantha Garrod
recent_reviews.text: What a lovely little farm shop/cafe. Discovered this place a couple of months ago, I now shop regularly for all these fruit/veg and meat. I love their own produce itâ€™s always so fresh, the staff always makes me very welcome and are very friendly. They have lovely little huts outside to have coffee/cafe/lunch from the cafe. I would highly recommend this place itâ€™s become my new local favourite.

recent_reviews.author: David Stoneman
recent_reviews.text:
Delightful Farm shop breakfast

Aldis and Sons at Framingham Earl turned out to be a real treasure discovery!
We chose the smallest full English breakfast plus black pudding and that was definitely a filling meal, taken with a tea for my wife and a latte coffee for me;

Well, what a pleasant surprise!
Not only attentive and diplomatic table service (this is a small farm shop cafe/mini restaurant), but the food....
I was moved to go and congratulate the chef in person for the great cooking of the local foods:
- well-crispy smoked bacon
- lovely toasted corners on the hash browns
- pleasant rustic and pleasantly filling bronzed sausages
- thick cut marmalade for my toast

I said that in all the many different cafes, restaurants and hotels we have stayed in, none had excelled on all those fronts!

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte King
recent_reviews.text: Visited here for the first time the other day and was very impressed! Reasonably priced and all the sandwiches/baguettes/ciabattas come with salad, crisps and homemade coleslaw which is great value! I had the sausage and onion chutney sandwich and the sausages were amazing! Very full of flavour and cooked perfectly. The homemade coleslaw was also very nice! The cafe seems to get very busy so I would recommend booking as it's only a small place. Would definitely like to visit again in the future.

recent_reviews.author: Georgia Cheney
recent_reviews.text: Lovely breakfast and offered a gluten free option. Very friendly staff and reasonable prices! Would always recommend!

pumpkin_patches.address: 1 Church Farm Cottages, Framingham Earl, Norwich NR14 7PE

recent_reviews.author: Mark Eddy
recent_reviews.text: Great place to take the kids to get pumpkins for Halloween.  Pick up a wheelbarrow then head off to the fields and chose your own pumpkins or just buy one that's already picked and in the barn. There is also a nice little farm shop selling fresh veg and lovely homemade pies and cakes. We'll be going again next year.

recent_reviews.author: alex lewis
recent_reviews.text: Great hour out of the house, very seasonal as visits go there was a little bit of live stock we could see. I enjoyed so did my daughter picked a few pumpkins and cost about Â£3 for each one. There is a little farm shop there not the best I have been too and nothing in there you cant get online or in a super market.

recent_reviews.author: Jo Williams
recent_reviews.text: Was fun for the kids I think we went a little to late though as most of the pumpkins were rotting I would definitely take the kids again because they really enjoyed searching for the right pumpkin & it made carving them more special as they had search a whole field for tha pumpkin & it was much cheaper than buying them from ur local supermarket

recent_reviews.author: Paul Moore
recent_reviews.text: First experience really enjoyed it with my grand kids

recent_reviews.author: frances jackson
recent_reviews.text: I attended the SEN session with 2 of my grandchildren, absolutely brilliant. Staff were so friendly and helpful. Beautiful, clean atmosphere, loved being able to see the animals. Food was beautiful with a good choice and good value for money. Hope to see more of these sessions as they are so needed and valued in the SEN community. Thank you.

recent_reviews.author: jason tedford
recent_reviews.text: Wow wow wow. worth every penny. Breakfast served all day. little more than I would normally pay. 11.99 but amazing. will be back. Staff not to friendly. But service and food 100%

recent_reviews.author: Hannah Talbot
recent_reviews.text: Had such a good time, the play barn was so clean and fresh smelling, good selection of food available even for a 1 year old. The walk around the farm was lovely with lots to read and do along the way round.

recent_reviews.author: Stephen Dawson
recent_reviews.text: Great for the kids as a great play area but not many farm animals.

pumpkin_patches.address: Stowe by Chartley, Stafford, Staffordshire ST18 0LA

recent_reviews.author: Zolani Dlamini
