recent_reviews.text: I love their sausages and I find it as one of the tastiest sausages compared to others although this time around I bought the chakalaka sausages as usual and till now am not happy because I have been finding some bons in the sausages and I am very afraid I might crush my teeth while eating the sausages due to those bones.Please whoever is making those sausages have to be mindful of such things.I still have more in my freezer and am afraid of cooking them when i think of this

recent_reviews.author: Darlington Matyavira
recent_reviews.text:
Best Zim Shop or l can say African shop.
It is worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Edna Musekiwa
recent_reviews.text: The meat and beef sausages  are   tasty,  fresh and juice not too dry. You can grill or fry it taste the same no need to add any spices. The butcher man, Dean has excellent customer service ğŸ‘Œ

recent_reviews.author: Mary Clarke
recent_reviews.text: Excellent customer service from the lady that answers the phone. Drove up from Birmingham to purchase their own brand Maize flour which is organic and not stripped of its nutrients. It is exceptional quality. Service inside the show was good my online complaint was check out was extremely slow. I will be back up soon to purchase your millet flour.

pumpkin_patches.address: 1st Floor, Mwanaka Farm Supermarket, 19-20 Vicarage Pl, Walsall WS1 3NA

recent_reviews.author: Qamar Din (Cuezed)
recent_reviews.text: We stopped here after leaving the beach and honestly enjoyed it even more than the beach. It's a beautiful farm with a wide variety of animals, including adorable young ones. We fed the animals, and my kids even got to hold the bunnies and ducks. The staff were friendly and attentive, making our visit even better. So glad we came-thank you!

recent_reviews.author: Ekaterina Geeson
recent_reviews.text: We spent a cool two hours on the farm. It's a nice, small place away from the hustle and bustle. All the animals are very clean and well-groomed, it is clear that the farm workers take good care of them. We really enjoyed feeding the animals and even managed to hold some of them in our arms. We felt welcome. Thank you for your hospitality, we will come again!

recent_reviews.author: Chelsea Jeffery
recent_reviews.text:
What an incredible day!!

We can stress how amazing all staff at Nicks Farm are, they make you feel welcome and always so helpful ğŸ˜Š

My daughter was being cheeky and asking one lady what she was doing to which the lady let esmay do some planting - she was over the moon!! â¤ï¸

Great farm to explore with the children with all sorts of animals to see/pet/feed along with a little play area aswell. Definitely somewhere you need to visit!! :)

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Green
recent_reviews.text: Great little farm. Reasonable price and small enough to ensure access to all animals and a great chance of feeding/holding the little ones. Basic toilet and hand wash facilities but functional. Lots of variety of animals and really friendly and helpful staff. Small play area with benches too.

recent_reviews.author: Gillian Fabb
recent_reviews.text: Best farm shop ever, great products, great service.Great prices.

recent_reviews.author: Lee Dale
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant place fresh farm produce and much more, my daughter in law has bought me steaks from here before and they went down a treat at a bbq, so we decided to pop in, we could of bought loads which we nearly did, bacon chops fresh veg and bacon all at a very good price, finally got to the butchers and the gent did us 8 thick sirloin steaks, brilliant price and the quality is 10/10 never buying meat from a supermarket again, the gent who served me was a diamond and the lady on the till although there was a massive queue was so friendly 10/10 cannot recommend enough.

recent_reviews.author: MARK MATTHEWS
recent_reviews.text: An Excellent farm shop with an amazing selection of home made products. The butcher has very good cooked and uncooked meat. The fresh made cakes and especially the fresh made bread are well worth the drive out just make sure you have space in your freezer for a little of everything.

recent_reviews.author: Kevin Wilkinson
recent_reviews.text:
Asked for 2  sirloin steaks, they were delicious and melt in your mouth.
The cornish pasti was also very tasty.
Thank you.

pumpkin_patches.address: Elmgrove Farm, Far Common Rd, Mirfield WF14 0DQ

recent_reviews.author: James Murtagh
recent_reviews.text:
Love a farm shop! Stopped after a walk near Emley Moor Mast. Good quality meats and cheeses. All the staples you expect.
Cold counter had nice options. Donâ€™t try the restaurant but looked super busy.

recent_reviews.author: Neil Martland
recent_reviews.text:
We visited the tearoom around 3:25pm with my 88-year-old mother, hoping for a pleasant stop before closing. Unfortunately, the whole experience was dominated by the managementâ€™s strict 4pm cut-off, which created a rushed and uncomfortable atmosphere.

The service was disappointing from the start. My mother was first given tea in a takeaway-style paper cup â€“ the sort youâ€™d expect from a high-street coffee chain â€“ which felt totally inappropriate and out of place in what is otherwise a pleasant, traditional tearoom setting. For someone of her age and fragility, it was also impractical. I had to return it, and only then was it replaced with a proper teapot, cup, saucer and cutlery. That correction was welcome, but it should not take repeated back-and-forths to get something so basic right.

The food itself was acceptable: the sandwich and cake were fine, and the quiche was decent once warmed. But any enjoyment was undermined by the constant interruptions at our table. Staff came more than once while we were still eating to ask if we had finished and whether they could take things away. It gave the impression we were being hurried along, not welcomed to sit and enjoy our food.

This all tied back to the central problem: the fear of the 4pm curfew. Staff repeatedly reminded us the cafÃ© was closing, and it was clear they were under pressure to get everyone out on time. The added threat of the main gates being shut at 4pm sharp left us with the uncomfortable feeling that if we didnâ€™t leave immediately, we could actually be locked in. Watching staff and cars streaming out of the car park at 4:05pm only reinforced this absurdity.

Overall, while the food was reasonable, the service and atmosphere were inhospitable. A place that advertises being open until 4pm should offer full service until that time, not serve takeaway cups of tea in a sit-down tearoom, rush customers mid-meal, and create anxiety about being locked in. Be warned: if you arrive close to closing time, you are unlikely to have a good experience here.

recent_reviews.author: Mandy
recent_reviews.text:
I have shopped here many times and previously bought their lasagna, which used to be amazing! Slightly on the expensive side, but definitely worth it.
My Daughter mentioned a while ago that she'd purchased one after not having bought one for quite some time and remarked it wasn't a patch on how it used to be.
I'd not had one for a long time either but assumed it might have just been a one off, so I bought one today.
Wow, what a difference.
It used to to have so much flavour and the whole kitchen used to smell amazing when you cooked it.

What a let down it was.  My Daughter was right. Nothing like it used to be and nowhere near the same quality.

It had barely any flavour, you couldn't really taste any garlic and it was missing that slightly oily/garlic texture/taste that made it taste so fantastic previously.

It was, in my Husbands words....almost bland. I agree but it was also really stodgy, like a cheap supermarket brand.
Definitely won't be purchasing again.

recent_reviews.author: Michael Dean
recent_reviews.text: Good farmshop with ample parking, selection of freshly baked and frozen food available. Pleasant restaurant attached to it with a good range of food and great views if you can get the right table.

recent_reviews.author: Helen Hall
recent_reviews.text:
Stunning food, and a huge selection of food to take home. I had the best Manchester tart I have ever had in my life.
Thereâ€™s a butchers, bakery section, hot food to take away, local ales and fine wines.
Dining in is a fabulous experience as well. We had the ploughmanâ€™s and the fish tacos and were not disappointed. It was a roasting hot August weekend so we sat outside and enjoyed seeing all the other groups of people enjoying Sunday roasts (MASSIVE Yorkshires) and very generous afternoon teas.
There was also a pizza oven and a big playground for kids. A great way to spend an afternoon.
Also, more Longley farm yogurt, cream and cottage cheese than you can shake a stick at.

recent_reviews.author: Nathan Ball
recent_reviews.text:
I happened to come across this place, after some rerouting due to some dreadful motorway traffic.

Taking a more scenic route over the moors, my nephew and I called in on a spur of the moment ice cream break.

We happened to spot that it had a farm shop, with a whole host of locally sourced goods from sausage rolls to flavoured oils.

The best surprise was finding that it had its own little farm zoo at the back, behind the restaurant.

We arrived shortly before 5pm and as it closed at 5 and the smaller animals had been put away for the evening, they let us in for free. (I did offer a donation).

We got some lovely photos of the pigs and cows.

On the way out, we also picked up a few gifts for my sister-in-law, as the nephew was returning home after 4 days with his cousins.
Some beautiful chocolate cake, a cow themed short biscuit and some lovely rocky road style nibbles.

Also, I spotted what must be the largest vanilla slices I've ever seen in my life!!

We picked up a couple of ice creams before our journey back and left with a warm glow.

recent_reviews.author: K C
recent_reviews.text:
Great little farm and barn for toddlers.
It is now Â£3 each or Â£10 for a family of 4.
Worth the money.
Super friendly staff and you can get close and friendly with the animals.
Small play area with a sandpit and some peddle tractors within the farm.
Lots of grass to enjoy a picnic when the sunshine arrives :)

recent_reviews.author: Sarah
recent_reviews.text:
â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸
We recently had afternoon tea at Blacker Hallâ€™s restaurant for a group of 11 (though one person couldnâ€™t make it in the end), and the whole experience was fantastic. The staff were incredibly understanding about the change in numbers, which we really appreciated.

Ahead of time, I called to ask if we could have our afternoon tea earlier than their usual 1:30pm start, as we had to be somewhere later â€“ and they kindly agreed to serve it at 12 instead. We waited around 30 minutes, which was no issue, and ordered some iced coffees while we waited. To our surprise, these were included in the cost of the afternoon tea â€“ such a thoughtful touch!

We were given access to the upstairs area, which is closed off from the main space â€“ ideal so we didnâ€™t disturb other guests. They also let us decorate it how we liked, which made it feel extra special for the occasion.

A big thank you to Mel, the manager, who was absolutely amazing â€“ friendly, courteous, and made everything run so smoothly. We felt really well looked after and wouldnâ€™t hesitate to return. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a warm, welcoming place with great food and even better service!

pumpkin_patches.address: Branch Rd, Calder Grove, Wakefield WF4 3DN

recent_reviews.author: Brian King
recent_reviews.text:
Visit last week with friends, amazing quality meals and lovely venue. Really warm welcome from all the staff and so helpful. I was blown away with the best steak pie ever. And next door in the farm shop amazing pork pies and breads. I only wish I lived near by
its a 10 from Len x

recent_reviews.author: Summer Bucktrout
recent_reviews.text: I held my baby shower here on the 4th August and even from the planning stage, the staff and chefs were amazing. We had a special afternoon tea crafted which tasted amazing and everyone loved the food. The venue is stunning and the staff were very helpful with setting up, and catering to our table throughout the day. Cannot recommend enough, thank you for such a special day.

recent_reviews.author: Mark Millman
recent_reviews.text:
First time visiting and went for a coffee before the shop opened. Watching the food coming from the kitchen decided on a full English instead.
Cracking plate of food for what Ch was served quickly and piping hot.
Sausage was really tasty as was the black pudding.
Plenty of attentive staff busily clearing tables and keeping the dining room clean and tidy.
Tried the shop and got some great pickles to go with the " fidget" pie.
Curd tarts spot on and the pink iced  vanilla slice was devoured quickly by my son.
Wife bought another house plant to murder when she got it home.

recent_reviews.author: John Spence
recent_reviews.text: Popped in whilst visiting Huddersfield. Nice large carpark with cafe and farm shop. Cafe was excellent with food and drinks and attentive staff. Farm shop also excellent with plenty of local products. Would visit again.

pumpkin_patches.address: 1a Bolster Moor Rd, Golcar, Huddersfield HD7 4JU

recent_reviews.author: L H
recent_reviews.text:
Me and my toddler love this place, it's a hidden gem and really great value. I come here as you can feed the animals with no entry fee to pay, unlike many other nearby attractions. Feed is just Â£1.
There is a little play area, lots of picnic benches, a tractor, and a farm shop. The coffee is great quality and reasonably priced. I highly recommend the honey, especially the set one. The staff are all lovely!

recent_reviews.author: Debbie Walker
recent_reviews.text: Has to be one of my favourite farm shops I've visited. The vegetables taste amazing and stocked up on fresh eggs. The biggest cauliflower came home with me. Lots of happy animals and a real joy to stop off at.

recent_reviews.author: Sharron Field
recent_reviews.text:
Edit came out of our way to buy fresh veg and potatoes.  Just opened the bag and they are worse than the supermarkets . 12.5 kg of chitting potatoes,  waste of money and still have to go to the store now.
We are trying our hardest to support our local farms but with quality like this its just not worth it.
Lovely to see the animals and to be able to strok.e them.  Needed more veg available for us to come again.

recent_reviews.author: Tony S
recent_reviews.text: Great to see the animals! But for a farm shop,it had hardly any veg on display. We hoped to get a big haul of farm veg, but left with a token head of broccoli, which wasn't from the farm.

recent_reviews.author: regina silva
recent_reviews.text:
Such a lovely place! Wentworth Family Farm is the perfect countryside escape. I absolutely loved seeing all the animals,they're so sweet and well cared for. The gift shop is surprisingly big and full of beautiful little finds, from homeware to treats.

They also have a great selection of plants for sale, which made me want to take the whole garden home! Everything is just pretty pretty and full of charm. Canâ€™t wait to go back! ğŸğŸŒ¿ğŸ›ï¸ğŸ’•

recent_reviews.author: hairbyhuma
recent_reviews.text:
I have visited wentworth garden centre farm many times now and every time have been very impressed.

It is well kept, clean, fun and has everything to keep children entertained all at an affordable price.

The staff are friendly and helpful. Canâ€™t wait to visit again

recent_reviews.author: Ella Elly
recent_reviews.text: Great place to have fun with kids and the whole family

recent_reviews.author: Kevin Williams
recent_reviews.text:
Great place, so good for kids and adults lots to see and do for everyone.
Lovely coffee shop and the staff were so lovely.

I especially loved the house plant section,
I bought lots of air plants from there and the lady was so helpful...

A defo see place if your find yourself in Barnsley.

pumpkin_patches.address: Wentworth Garden Centre, Hague Ln, Rotherham S62 7TF

recent_reviews.author: Rashi Bansal
recent_reviews.text:
What a lovely day I had at Parkside â€˜Pick Your Ownâ€™ farms in Enfield! The farm is spacious, beautifully maintained, and full of fresh, delicious produce ready to be picked. Itâ€™s such a wholesome and fun experience â€” perfect for families, a day out with friends, or even a cute, casual date!

The prices are really reasonable, especially considering the quality and experience you get. Just make sure to check the weather before you go and dress accordingly â€” itâ€™s a proper farm, so comfy shoes are a must. Make to book your slots online in advance.

All in all, a refreshing and delightful escape from the city. Highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Charulatha Sanmathi
recent_reviews.text: Just truly amazing experience. Huge huge farm please bring water and snacks to go through the farm, two hours is not enough if you have kids and there is a lot of walk. They have the sweetest strawberries, raspberries and blueberries. Lovely collection of veggies too.

recent_reviews.author: Daddy Panda
recent_reviews.text:
We come here there, quite annually part of Parkside.

The place is amazing and great car parking space. Large place and best get their before weeks end etc because of the crops would be picked by then lol. Great for families.

recent_reviews.author: Vas K
recent_reviews.text: Welll organised place with plethora of fruits and veggies to pick on your own. A very good experience overall to spend the day. They could do better with the entry, cash out area as it feels dirty and tired. Prices were reasonable for what you get. For sure an excellent experience to bring kids along

pumpkin_patches.address: Parkside Farm, Hadley Rd, Enfield EN2 8LA

recent_reviews.author: Danielle Hatch
recent_reviews.text:
We go here every year to carefully pick out our pumpkins.
This year it seemed scaled down a little in comparison to past years however it certainly didn't stop the enjoyment. Loved the addition of the trail for the kids! Unfortunately alot of the pumpkins had started to rot which was the case for a few that we picked (due to the mud on them at the time we couldn't see the rotting) however we carved the good parts up and allowed our chickens to feast on the good bits so only a small amount went to waste!

Make sure you bring wellies but my best tip is NOT to leave it last minute like us so you can really enjoy every part of the experience!

We had a wonderful time and look forward to returning next year!

recent_reviews.author: s h a n n o n
recent_reviews.text: beautiful pumpkin patch, lots of space and i loved the service. there were lots of good photo spots and there was quite a few things to do, i loved the seasonal hot drinks stall especially. the wheelbarrows were easy and i loved the variety of pumpkins to choose from. i got 3 HUGE, perfect ones and a little white one for only Â£18. i do wish we couldâ€™ve stayed longer than only 30 minutes, but that was my only issue.

recent_reviews.author: abigail Fitzgerald
recent_reviews.text: Honestly so many pumpkins. Iâ€™ve only been to two other PYOP places and this one wasnâ€™t too bad. We heard from someone that they didnâ€™t have as much variety as they did last year. Personally for me it was great and I know due to certain weather conditions you canâ€™t always have it perfect every year. Will definitely go again next year to see how it differs! One thing I will say is I find Â£3.75 entry for an adult a bit steep but because itâ€™s only up the road weâ€™re saving on travel costs so either way I guess it evens out! Thanks pumpkin moon Maidstone! ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: S Jasper
recent_reviews.text: It's become a family tradition to go and pick our pumpkins at Pumpkin Moon. Whatever the weather.  Such a great place to go and we always have fun.

recent_reviews.author: Mike773 U
recent_reviews.text:
Lots of hard work, dedication and effort has gone into to transforming this area into a community garden and orchard.

Hidden in plain sight, located behind the Dower House, the orchard is made up of apple trees, plants and flowers. Still a work in progress. It could be an absolutely fantastic space as it is a quiet corner of the park, but still close to amenities like The Stables cafÃ© and Main Play area. The Dower House is the base of Manchester and District Beekeepers so the orchard is in the ideal place providing bees with the food they need to survive and they, in turn, pollinate the trees and plants so that they produce fruit.

The orchard isn't just be made up of fruit trees. There will be nut trees, fruit shrubs and herbs that are loved by bees. Brambles will be cultivated and controlled, so that they allow other plants to grow.

Blackthorn will be planted, to make Sloe Gin in the future. Updates to follow and the Team continues to nurture this area.......

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Cheshire Pick your Own Pumpkins Frodsham

recent_reviews.author: Elouise Hargreaves
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic variety of pumpkins and squashes to pick yourself along with pre picked options if you're not feeling up to going through the fields. Beautiful views from the field for pictures. Very friendly family who runs it â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Julia Puzey
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic place for pumpkins, great choice and quality, lovely people and great prices.

recent_reviews.author: Ben Woodward
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful location to pick some pumpkins! Great range of variety! Knowledgeable and friendly staff too, would definitely recommend a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Greg
recent_reviews.text: Excellent,very friendly and helpful service

recent_reviews.author: Epure Ioan
recent_reviews.text: a very beautiful, quiet place with a story, I especially recommend it for recreationğŸ«¶

recent_reviews.author: Nina Vearnals
recent_reviews.text: Favourite pumpkin patch, there's always a great choice, decent parking and nice places for photos. We usually go in a big group and the kids love all the space in the field running about looking for their perfect pumpkins. Never had any issues parking and there are toilets available. The field does get muddy if the weather's bad, but it's all part of the fun getting muddy and jumping in the puddles ğŸ˜„ enjoyed the snack areas this year, with seating, great addition.

recent_reviews.author: Warren Singleton
recent_reviews.text: The best place to go pumpking picking by far! Pumpkins are grown on site, there is a bar and burgers and best of all its dog friendly!

recent_reviews.author: Kayley Boden
recent_reviews.text:
We had an amazing time pumpkin picking!

Free entry and pumpkins were 3 for Â£12 which we thought was a bargain price compared to other places.

Lots of photo opportunities and the staff are so, so friendly!

They take cash or card payment too.

It was muddy as expected for a pumpkin patch so I definitely recommend wellies.

Thereâ€™s lots of pumpkins to choose from!

pumpkin_patches.address: Warrington Road Leigh End, Glazebury, Warrington WA3 5NX

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Libbyâ€™s Patch. The best place in Cheshire for PYO strawberries, pumpkins, sunflowers and Christmas tree

recent_reviews.author: Lou Lou
recent_reviews.text:
Libbyâ€™s Patch is a hidden gem for sunflower enthusiasts and nature lovers alike. The moment you arrive, you're greeted by a sea of vibrant yellow sunflowers stretching as far as the eye can see, creating a breathtaking and picturesque landscape. The flowers are tall, healthy, and perfectly aligned, making it an ideal spot for photography or just a peaceful stroll among the blooms.

The staff at Libbyâ€™s Patch are incredibly welcoming and knowledgeable, often sharing interesting facts about the sunflowers and the care that goes into maintaining the field. The atmosphere is serene and inviting, with plenty of spots to sit and take in the beauty around you.

Whether youâ€™re visiting for a photo session, a family outing, or simply to enjoy the splendor of sunflowers in full bloom, Libbyâ€™s Patch is a destination that will leave you with lasting memories. The attention to detail and the obvious care taken in cultivating the sunflowers make this a standout spot. It's definitely worth a visit if you're looking to experience the beauty of nature up close.

recent_reviews.author: Emmelia Booth-Boniface
recent_reviews.text:
Just returned for the 3rd year in a row and came away with some beautiful pumpkins...I think I counted 6 varieties in our barrow.

Last year we over-committed (17 pumpkins!) so this year we limited it to 11 (it was 10 but then we saw an adorable white one so had to have it).

Always a great experience, and well done to everyone at Libbys Patch for a great crop despite a truly shocking growing year. See you in 2025!

recent_reviews.author: Louise Williams
recent_reviews.text: Another great day out at Libbys! We have had so much fun over the years from Pumpkin Picking to Pick Your Own Sunflowers to the recent horror maize and big machinery event.

recent_reviews.author: L R
recent_reviews.text: Great place for pumpkin picking. Friendly people, far more reasonable prices than other places and a really good selection of different types of pumpkins. Good photo opportunities, there were hay bales with pumpkins around for pictures and a little stall. The kids loved it, and there is a little food and drinks hut, and covered area for eating. They had sold out of a lot of things but we visited at the end of a nice Saturday, so I understood this. Yes it is muddy so make sure you bring wellies, but a good chunk of the car park is hard standing. We went to a different place last year and it wasnâ€™t pleasant at all, really smelly and no wheelbarrows, very expensive, and no idea about prices. What I loved here was that they were upfront about the prices, plenty of wheelbarrows and clearly the people running it care. They spoke to everyone as they come out. We had a lovely hour and we could have stayed longer.

recent_reviews.author: olivia
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place! Very friendly staff and lots of activities for litte ones (toasting marshmallows, Pumpkin carving area, pumpkin washing station). Huge variety of pumpkins that are reasonably priced (considering entrance is free). Not extremely busy or crowded. Dog friendly. Plenty of parking and not extremely muddy like other places we've visited.

recent_reviews.author: leanne lever
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous morning picking Pumpkins, so many to choose from and the best Iâ€™ve ever seen. All different varieties and in a beautiful location. Staff are lovely and itâ€™s not overly crowded like some, so plenty of space to walk round and choose. Lots of parking on the road outside, and the most gorgeous coffee van, you can also toast marshmallows over the fire pit. Will definitely be back next year, if not again before Halloween this year for more fabulous Pumpkins.

recent_reviews.author: Zoe Poole
recent_reviews.text:
Brilliant pumpkin patch! We took the kids and they absolutely loved it!

They had little pumpkin games dotted all around the field (pumpkin noughts and crosses, ring toss onto the top of the pumpkin stalks etc..) and a Harry Potter quiz. The pumpkins are actually grown in the field not just cut and dotted around.

Amazing variety of pumpkins as well - my white one is a clear favourite! - and I particularly loved the â€œpumpkin spaâ€ where you could go and wash your pumpkins before leaving.

They did have a carving and decorating table which we didnâ€™t use this time but would definitely do if it were closer to Halloween.

Experience was topped off nicely by an amazing coffee from Tatton Perk!

Would definitely recommend

recent_reviews.author: Fujioka Yuko
recent_reviews.text: First time to do pumpkin picking and glad we went to this patch! Loved it. So lovely and welcoming. Bonus to find the â€˜Kabochaâ€™ pumpkin. Cooked right away, so yum. Will come back to buy them more!

pumpkin_patches.address: Wither's Ln, High Legh, Knutsford WA16 0SG

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Manor Farm Fruits Pick Your Own Experience - Pre-booking advised

recent_reviews.author: Stacey Lilley
recent_reviews.text:
We visited the flower field and PYO fruit fields

The flower field experience was lovely - especially if you are looking for photo opportunities - particularly the rows of dahlias The songs lyrics dotted around were a nice touch. The sunflower field was past its best when we were there - it would have been nice to be able to walk the perimeter to extend the stroll. Choosing a few stems at the end of the walk to take home was a really nice touch.
We were planning on picking a bucket of strawberries but sadly the last of the strawberries were covered in mildew so we didnâ€™t pick any at all. I understand that this is a result of the weather and can not be controlled, however making people aware before they come would be helpful. We did visit the raspberries and blackberries instead which were lovely and ripe and tasted great!

recent_reviews.author: Mo Ab
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely Day Out at Manor Farm ğŸ“
â­â­â­â­â­

My family and I had such a wonderful time at Manor Farm in Birmingham! It was the perfect day out â€“ peaceful, fun, and filled with fresh air and sweet fruit. The farm is well-kept, easy to get around, and very family-friendly.

We went for fruit picking, and the strawberries were absolutely delicious â€“ fresh, juicy, and sweet. There were plenty to choose from, and the staff were welcoming and helpful, giving us tips on the best spots to pick. The kids had a blast roaming around and filling their baskets.

Itâ€™s a lovely place to slow down and enjoy the simple pleasures. Weâ€™ll definitely be back again soon â€“ especially during berry season! ğŸ“

recent_reviews.author: Aisha Begum
recent_reviews.text: Took the kids here two weeks ago and they absolutely loved the experience. We visit once every year atleast and each time it's even more exciting for the kids. They love strawberry's. The staff are very friendly and always have a smile on there faces. They have a cafe for food and drinks, lots of parking and a play area with bouncy castles to. Also a flower field which costs Â£5 per person to enter.

recent_reviews.author: Bethany Freeman
recent_reviews.text: Overall great experience. Parking is right next to the location and all was in a reasonable walking distance. Fruit we picked was a good price and delicious! Slight downfall was there was no benches or anywhere to rest in the 30degree heat! We had to sit on the walkways which blocked passages for others. The cafe is also busy, slightly expensive(and 2 out of the 3 drinks ordered were incorrect!) Would visit again.

recent_reviews.author: Jon Schmidt
recent_reviews.text:
We just spent about four hours at Barnhill Farm â€” feeding the animals, bouncing on bouncy castles, playing mini golf, riding go-karts, and drawing with chalk on the floor. We also had a really tasty meal that consisted of all kinds of foods produced and farmed locally.

We paid just Â£5 for our son to access all the activities for as long as he wanted â€” excellent value. The service at the restaurant was nothing short of fantastic. Staff provided clear communication about short waiting times and made sure we had everything we needed. It was fairly busy, but they had great control thanks to their own booking system used as people arrived.

Prices were fair, and the quality of the food was excellent. I even spoke to the chef, who gave me insight into their food sourcing â€” which follows a brilliant farm-to-fork ethos.

The market stalls follow the same principles and offer farm-fresh foods of all kinds at equally fair prices for the quality. Everyone we met was friendly and welcoming.

We will most definitely be back again soon for another affordable, fun day out.

As for previous reviews complaining about waiting times, unfriendly staff, or cleanliness â€” first of all, itâ€™s a farm, not a five-star hotel. So grow up and get over yourself. Approach the place with kindness and patience, and you'll find itâ€™s a fantastic environment with an excellent atmosphere.

recent_reviews.author: oluwaseun omosehin
recent_reviews.text:
I had a lovely time out with the family at Barnhill Farmshop.
Starting with good parking. Welcoming, friendly, and helpful staff .
My wee one liked feeding the animals, including the cute rabbits.
There were also a few play areas , sand places, and soft play for the kinds.
We got some fresh juice and milk. The burgers and chips were really good.
I would definitely recommend a day with good weather.

recent_reviews.author: Sam B
recent_reviews.text: Massive admiration for this place. Really wholesome, cosy vibe inside. Good products, good milk, and beautiful to experience all the animals. Great for the kids too. Definitely a place to check out. we'll be back.

recent_reviews.author: Jeannie M
recent_reviews.text: Thank you to all the Barnhill team for a very happy family lunch to celebrate a special birthday.  The welcome and thoughtfulness was much appreciated. Our lunch was delicious, especially the burger and lasagne. Oh, and definitely those yummy cakes! Plenty to entertain the whole family - we loved the cheeky goats and very tiny piglets!

recent_reviews.author: C M
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant organic food shop with cafe. Fresh fruit and veg is competitively priced, with self service top up dry goods, household cleaning products, olive oil and vinegar. I don't like the lay out but otherwise it is all good. There is a wee cafe in the window. Excellent gentle coffee from Dear Green and their own kitchen baled goods.

recent_reviews.author: Vivienne Farris
recent_reviews.text: Really enjoyable lunch - vegan sausage roll with a generous portion of salad - Dear Green decaff with organic milk, top marks!

recent_reviews.author: Summer Stewart
recent_reviews.text:
All the veg was old and floppy, not to mention overpriced  & OMG!! tined goods are even more overpriced ,& you'd think the olive oil had gold in it & came from the moon with those prices ğŸ˜±.
The whole shop looks a bit grubby & tired, don't think I'd eat there.
Better off at fruit shops on Allison St or in lidl across the road.
Not for me, it's only for wealth suckers

recent_reviews.author: Morag McCluskey
recent_reviews.text: Locavore as a grocery shop has an amazing ethos but the fact that the owner refuses to heat the space for his staff, even in the depths of winter with the door opening constantly, is unacceptable! One look at all the staff bundled in jumpers and scarves and gloves, gripping a small space heater, says it all. Poor and disrespectful working conditions for an enterprise that talks so much about community, fairness and balance. You can do better!

recent_reviews.author: Lily Scott
recent_reviews.text:
I'm a regular customer at Strawberry Garden Cash and Carry and absolutely love their massive range of spices. The quality and variety are top-notch.
Previously, I had some issues with customer service. Staff sometimes didnâ€™t understand English well or were a bit rude when I asked about product availability.
But today was a completely different experience. A guy in the spice and lentil section was incredibly helpful, spoke excellent English, and had amazing energy. His customer service was outstanding!
Strawberry Garden should definitely hire more staff like him. Great job!

recent_reviews.author: Abu huraira
recent_reviews.text:
Best Place to buy your daily needs or day to day House hold things.
It's specifically best for the people from south Asian countries.
Where you can find almost everything of your country Goods ( Masala, pulses , flour, beverages rice and so on).
They have an in-house Non Veg shop for your Non Vegetarian as well Vegetable and fruits.
So, it's all under one roof.

recent_reviews.author: Hafiz Umer Iqbal
recent_reviews.text: I used to go shopping there, previously due to the experience with meat shop quality, had to leave, but then started again after some long time thought would be better, but was so disappointed  as it was same, had to discard the whole meat, was very smelly and not fresh, besides I confirmed from the guy and he assured it fresh. Rest everything is excellent and lot of variety, I would skip meat from there, rest is up to mark.

recent_reviews.author: N D
recent_reviews.text: We got 8 chicken leg pieces and the smell was absolutely awful. My auntie has also complained about this before so just goes to show nothing has changed. I will be speaking to management next time I am in.

recent_reviews.author: Lynn Russell
recent_reviews.text: In an ever changing world of commerce it is a comfort that there remains a constant in the Glasgow West End. Roots and Fruits was a pioneer in the services it brought to the consumer and has been a Glasgow institution for many years. I remember it as a humble veg shop when I was a student a few decades back and then a regular supplier when I was a chef. I was even privileged to have worked there for a while. It has grown into something rather impressive without letting go of it's 'roots'. A family I was overjoyed to see again, when I was able to pop in. I love these folk!

recent_reviews.author: Oliver Happy
recent_reviews.text: This is a must see part of tl any visit to Glasgow. The place is a real gem - full of flowers, an incredible assortment of healthy and wholesome foodstuffs, a lovely cafe and a takeaway area to die for. Try the mixed salad bowl. Especially the wild rice and tamarind. Wow. Excellent quiches, the cinnamon buns are like delicious clouds and appreciated the Suma kombucha range. Also the best sausage roll I've had in years.

recent_reviews.author: Perry Mason
recent_reviews.text:
WORTHY WEST END ADDITION
We had Brunch here and it was lovely. Nice fresh food, served by very friendly and capable staff in a smart, comfortable venue. Oh! The scones were fab too!

recent_reviews.author: Andy H
recent_reviews.text: Great double espresso sitting in the sun the other morning, right next to Kelvin riverside walk, great vegan sausage rolls as well, very well stocked with loads of healthy/ethical products

recent_reviews.author: Vaclav Buben
recent_reviews.text: What an amazing place!!! We hired kayaks and also booked for a boat trip. Chris was so friendly and knowledgeable about the islands and Loch Lomond. Recommend to anyone. Great family day out! Beautiful organic farm with unbelievable views.

recent_reviews.author: Kaspar Lee
recent_reviews.text:
Took the kayaks out for 2 hours and had a great time!
They were very responsive, there to greet us exactly on time with the kayaks all ready, and the kayaks were all in good condition. Highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Anna Anna
recent_reviews.text: Weâ€™ve had a fantastic time kayaking on loch Lomond. All the equipment, useful info and guidance was provided to us. Chris was very welcoming and accommodating. The lake is stunning. Keep in mind you will get muddy getting in/off the kayak. Other than that it was all perfect! There is a free parking, toilet and changing facilities. Hire place is located at a local farm.

recent_reviews.author: Claire French
recent_reviews.text:
Service & communication from Chris was excellent. Safety briefing great. Equipment & wetsuits were very good. Chris gave us good advice specific to the weather conditions on the day.

Lovely little private bay on the shores of Loch Loman - very pretty setting & views. Would recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Tonya Lockman
recent_reviews.text: Tiny store selling produce, natural foods, and some prepared to-go items and pastries. I stopped in at the end of my day for some quick dinner and found a lovely vegan hand pie which the clerk heated for me. Thereâ€™s no seating but I brought my food to eat on a bench at the lovely nearby Kelvingrove Park.

recent_reviews.author: Carly Overman
recent_reviews.text: Great little deli if you're looking for a cheap, yummy vegan lunch! My whole lunch was under  Â£5 and I had about 1.5 boxes of food!

recent_reviews.author: Oli Molton
recent_reviews.text: Love that the produce is presented without plastic wrap on everything and the variety of ingredients packed into such a small space.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Davidson
recent_reviews.text: I got a pain au chocolat here at the end of the day, and it was still so fresh and flakey. Great price, too! Canâ€™t wait to go back and get another.

recent_reviews.author: EMILY FLYN
recent_reviews.text: Great little place to go to as they have all kinds of farm animals and not a bad price either. What I loved most was how special needs friendly it was. Both sons are autistic and one is non verbal and high needs and he even enjoyed himself. Plenty of space for him to walk around in his own way. Youngest loved feeding the animals and the playground. Great place would definitely recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Richard Newberry
recent_reviews.text:
A nice place to go for an hour or so, particularly if you have young children. However, be prepared for lots of queues. Long wait to get in, and a long queue for cafe so probably worth coming with your own food.

One thing to note is that some of the main attractions like the horse riding can sell out if you arrive too late. At Â£4  per adult and Â£3 for children, it's not a bad way to spend family time.

recent_reviews.author: darren Clarke
recent_reviews.text: Family day out with animals feed sheep goat's kids play area and petting animals great place to visit would definitely recommend and all the staff are very helpful and polite cheers

recent_reviews.author: Marie Facey
recent_reviews.text: Reasonably priced and very friendly staff. Plenty of chickens, sheep, goats and pigs (plus a meerkat!) Additional tickets can be purchased for a small animal petting experience. Small cafe serving hot and cold food, some indoor seating, plenty outside. Small gift shop. Plenty of parking (there is a small car park plus overflow). We had a lovely day. My daughter particularly enjoyed the playground. We will visit again.

pumpkin_patches.address: Urban Farm, Acorn Venture, Depot Rd, Kirkby, Liverpool L33 3AR

recent_reviews.author: Dave Hickman
recent_reviews.text: A must visit

pumpkin_patches.address: East Ln, Homer Green, Liverpool L29 3EA

recent_reviews.author: Vahini Arun
recent_reviews.text:
What a wonderful farm! Kids will love it.
Lots of farm animals.. From cows, guinea pigs, chickens, ducks, pigs, cow, mighty horses, goats, sheep even alpacas and peacocks!
Get tickets and buckets of feed from entrance and enjoy the day feeding animals..
Oh.. thereâ€™s a cafe at the entrance and their chocolate cake was phenomenal!

recent_reviews.author: Joseph O'Rourke
recent_reviews.text: Had a fantastic time on our visit to the farm. It was around Â£30 for a family of five and was definitely value for money. There's a cafe which did a lunch box for the kids and a soft play area which was an extra Â£3.  Hand washing facilities weren't great but overall a great day.

recent_reviews.author: AMAL T RAJAN
recent_reviews.text:
I loved my visit to Croxteth Park Farm .The animals are cute and well cared for. The staff is friendly and happy to share all the details.
Â£6 for each ticket ..

recent_reviews.author: John R
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely little day out . Cheap and kids love it. Get to feed the animals, most of which are rare breeds. It has goats, sheep , pigs, cows , horses , donkeys , chickens , turkeys , ducks , alpacas , rabbits, guinea pigs.
Great little cafe on site , friendly staff , toilets and lots of hand wash stations.

recent_reviews.author: Gabriel Jarnea
recent_reviews.text:
We had a fantastic day at Tedâ€™s Farm! The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming, making us feel right at home from the start. The whole area was spotless and well-kept, which really added to the comfort of our visit. Itâ€™s a wonderful place for a family day out â€“ safe, clean, and full of activities that both kids and adults can enjoy.

The prices are very reasonable, especially considering everything included. I was really impressed with the number of handwashing points around the site â€“ it made things so convenient and reassuring, especially with little ones. The activities were not only fun but also very educational, giving us the chance to learn more about farming and animals in an engaging way.

Overall, it was a great experience, and weâ€™ll definitely be coming back. Highly recommended for families looking for an affordable, enjoyable, and educational day out!

recent_reviews.author: Charlie Neve
recent_reviews.text: It is a great place for children to interact with animals and get some good 'outside time'. We were there on a day with Disney & Marvel movie characters roaming for photo opportunities. The jurassic adventure dinosaurs were good with interesting commentary.  A big, warm, and quick counter service restaurant with a soft play area inside, too. The birds of prey collection are worthy of specual note. A very informative demonstration with these magnificent birds shows us all how beautiful they are! Lots to do. A good day out.

recent_reviews.author: Linda Martin
recent_reviews.text: Excellent day out. So much to do, we spent the entire day there. Highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Shanice Green
recent_reviews.text: It's a good day out for the kids lots of things to do, personally I was expecting more animals; animals didnt seem happy and living conditions pretty dirty compared to other farms ive been too. The foam party at the end was great and loved the birds of prey from Horus

pumpkin_patches.address: Worrall House Farm Larder, Flatman's Ln, Ormskirk L39 7HW

recent_reviews.author: THET AUNG
recent_reviews.text:
nice place.
adult - 5 bucks
kid - 3 bucks.
eat as much as you can too.

recent_reviews.author: Charlie Anderson
recent_reviews.text:
Do not recommend. Arrived at about 12 but most of the field had no strawberries.
Lots of people around all finding the dame.
Lots of crushed strawberries but most were not ripe, tiny or mouldy.
The ones we did get we had to dig through spikey weeds and they went off within a day or two of getting home.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Whitby
recent_reviews.text: We came on a Sunday lunchtime for strawberry picking and we found you certainly had to look for good strawberries. I bet Saturday morning would have been amazing, but it just added to the extra time we got to spend on the field. The kids were so excited when they found a good bunch of strawberries and the tractor ride back to the carpark was probably their highlight.

recent_reviews.author: Paul Langton
recent_reviews.text:
PYO strawberries shut !!!!

Despite the website announcing that the pick your own strawberries were open, it wasnâ€™t
Not happy

Travelled from Liverpool to come - not impressed

pumpkin_patches.address: Old Clatterbridge Rd, Birkenhead, Wirral CH63 4JD

recent_reviews.author: Paul Lumb (plod_dog)
recent_reviews.text:
Where do I start the website? Very easy to navigate, informative and up-to-date,
Concise directions from the website and easily found with Google maps,
The shop immaculate cleaned to within an inch of its life bright airy well displayed. When buying something, you're going to eat everything you want to see,
And then there's the food. The fruit vegetable and produce is fresh. Laid out. Easy to see. Clearly priced and very competitively, but the meat is where they really shine. Some of the freshest nicest prepared, pleasantly packaged and well priced. At first glance you think not much cheaper, but it's enough to make a difference and the quality is beyond anything you have tasted anywhere else. I've been a number of times now and have never been let down. This includes the prepared meals which I find perfect for a quick lunch or a lovely evening meal without having to do all the work myself.
Just outstanding all round.

recent_reviews.author: Phil
recent_reviews.text: Amazing food, quality, and choice. I wish I could buy everything!!! My only complaint is that a lot of products have a very short date on them, but you can still freeze most stuff.  You get what you pay for nowadays and this place proves just that. Amazing food, a bit more costly than the supermarket,  but OMG  is it worth it!!! Just wish I could shop here every day because I would with no questions asked. Brilliant job, well done Taylors farm, can't fault you ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Graham Knott
recent_reviews.text: Plenty of choice. Food looks quality. Just had one of their pork pies, which was delicious. Also, had a stir fry chicken dish, which was plentiful and tasty.

recent_reviews.author: Gill Duckworth
recent_reviews.text: Sites at 10.00am this morning, loads of choice and people in the shop were great - v helpful. However the cashier on the second till was so rude! Didnâ€™t acknowledge me at all, the whole time she was checking out my shopping she was talking to the cashier on the next till and after spending over Â£100 we didnâ€™t get a â€˜thank youâ€™ just a â€˜Do you want your receipt?â€™ Not impressed

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Googies Field Croxteth / Blue Bell Woods And Frogs Pond

recent_reviews.author: Mr Green
recent_reviews.text: Bradshaws feels like a proper rural farm shop. It sells fruit,veg,dairy and some meat products together with animal/pet supplies and a small plant garden centre. Prices compare with most farm shops. Did notice some of their vegetables are huge so good value. Good honest shop and the staff seem friendly enough too ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Roy Hutchinson
recent_reviews.text:
A great family run farm shop with lots on offer. Grand selection of garden furniture, great place for log store supplies, well stocked shop for foodstuffs and as expected, a decent array of plants for sale.
Always pop in when in area and always get a good response from all staff

recent_reviews.author: Chris Barnes
recent_reviews.text: Great place. Friendly staff. Fantastic choice. Highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Weng Shszu
recent_reviews.text:
Well-stocked and plentiful supply of farm produce, gardening supplies, equipment and chickens!

This place is fantastic! It is well organised and full of top quality products and farm related goods. For budding gardeners it has everything you could possibly need from plants to pots and great options to help keep your plants alive and thriving.

The farm shop stocks great quality food, ice cream, free-range eggs and other similarly related farm produce. The staff are welcoming, helpful and make your visit as hassle-free as possible.

I thoroughly recommend Bradshaws Farm Shop, your time there will not be wasted!

pumpkin_patches.address: Prospect Farm Garstang By Pass Road, Preston PR3 0LP

recent_reviews.author: Shay Howls
recent_reviews.text:
It has become a yearly tradition to take our kids to Spookyard, although it is a little pricey, it is well worth it. We usually spend a good half a day plodding around. There's plenty to see and do, including shows, arts&crafts, feeding animals and usually pizza trailers etc ...

We did attend pick your own strawberries this year, we attended early July and unfortunately there wasn't a lot to choose from, they were either gone over or not ripe at the time we went. However, the kids still really enjoyed it, so it wasn't a big deal for us.

Recommend for a fun day out ! Keep an eye out for events too !

recent_reviews.author: Paul Graham
recent_reviews.text: We went strawberry picking at over farm. Very good set up with proper cabin for paying, and helpful staff giving good advice. The strawberries are laid out with flags so you know where to go and we found plenty of lovely big red juicy sweet fruit take home with us. We also went into the farm shop which is very well stocked. Found a fantastic ostrich egg, some lovely ice cream and beautiful local milk.  Lots of free Parking. Would definitely come back here next year.

recent_reviews.author: Praveen Kumar
recent_reviews.text:
What an absolutely delightful day out at the strawberry farm! We went for a family picnic and had such a fun and entertaining time picking our own strawberries (PYO) â€” the fields were beautiful and full of sweet, juicy berries ğŸ“. It was a fantastic hands-on experience, especially for the kid, and made for some great family bonding.

The farm shop was a real treat too, offering a variety of fresh, local produce and goodies to take home. We also enjoyed a relaxing break at the on-site cafÃ©, which had a lovely atmosphere and served delicious food and drinks.

Highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a refreshing and wholesome day out with family or friends. Weâ€™ll definitely be coming back next year!

recent_reviews.author: Umair Vibes
recent_reviews.text: It was a great day with my family. We enjoyed a lot. Unfortunately it was a cloudy day but we captured some beautiful views inside the sunflower field. They were like calling us to come out to hug them. Itâ€™s an awesome place for all those people who loved nature. Donâ€™t miss it.

pumpkin_patches.address: Over Farm, Over, Highnam, Gloucester GL2 8DB

recent_reviews.author: JON BEDDIS
recent_reviews.text: Great place to go and pick some pumpkins and sweetcorn. Get a lovely warm welcome, pick up a wheelbarrow, take as long as you want wondering around finding your pumpkins. Nice family atmosphere, highly recommended

recent_reviews.author: Erin Brown
recent_reviews.text: We had a wonderful experience at Elm Farm this year. This was our second year visiting the farm to pick our pumpkins for Halloween. The hosts are so kind and helpful and the pumpkin patch is delightful for all ages. It can be muddy depending on the weather, so bring your wellies!

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Hillman
recent_reviews.text: This was our 2nd year visiting and was better than last year. My little girl loved choosing her pumpkins and always as warm welcome, weâ€™ll be back next year

recent_reviews.author: Natasha
recent_reviews.text:
We came here to take our IWS out to pick a pumpkin. She loved every bit of it and really enjoyed herself and so did we. The lady who helped was so friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this place and will definitely go back again.
Thank you so much for a lovely time.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Pick your own Sunflowers and Maize Maze Bristol

recent_reviews.author: Liz Wookey
recent_reviews.text:
Great place to spend a couple of hours, from the hand made games to the variety of sunflowers it kept 2, 10 year old entertained. We visited on a day where it was drizzly and windy, so didn't do all the games,  graffiti etc....but looked like good fun.
The maize maze was entertaining, trying to work out the puzzles and sunflowers very reasonably priced-6 stems for Â£5..

recent_reviews.author: Natlee G2B
recent_reviews.text: Loved our visit. Had an old-school summer fayre 'feel' about it. Staff were very friendly, helpful, and welcoming. Really 'cheery' atmosphere. Will spend longer there next time. Will make a day of it instead of arriving later on in the day. Look forward to the ğŸƒ patch soon.

recent_reviews.author: Tim Gregory
recent_reviews.text:
An amazing place to visit and pick sunflowers. They had thought of everything to make the visit a good one from sign posting to the venue, parking the car and entertaining children too.
Will definitely go again.

recent_reviews.author: Beatrix Bancroft
recent_reviews.text: Lovely day and a gorges sight , definitely recommend

pumpkin_patches.address: Glenavon Farm, Bath Rd, Saltford, Bristol BS31 3TJ

recent_reviews.author: amoi dejouer
recent_reviews.text: My daughter and I went on a private Highland Coo tour yesterday and it was wonderful. The guide was extremely lovely and knowledgeable with lots of detail about the cows. Wonderful to spend time with someone so passionate about her job. Highly recommended - would be perfect for a small group for a birthday or special treat.

recent_reviews.author: Stacey Edwards
recent_reviews.text: So we travelled two hours to get here. It's set in the most beautiful place. First we had our highland cows experience which was amazing then came into the barn, we where greeted by friendly staff and sat outside to take in the view. We had drinks, cake & scones and it was delicious! Highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Stephen Crossland
recent_reviews.text:
Visited on Fathers Day and what a fantastic experience. Booked a table in the Barn Cafe and the food and service was really good and friendly. Good to know that as we had booked a Highland Cows of The Peak Experiences that there was a 10% discount; which we then added as a tip at the end when we paid.
Then on to meeting the Highland Cows...WOW!! Richard our Guide was brilliant (knew his stuff and any question raised was answered with real insight). His driving was fantastic as he maneuvered through the field gates with aplomb, ably assisted by Paul.
Also hit the Shop with purchase of locally produced Honey, Jam, Rose Wine and Sausages - also got 10% discount when showing my Barn Cafe Receipt.
What more do you need?

recent_reviews.author: Grace Ficken
recent_reviews.text:
10/10 experience. Would highly recommend!!! Talking to the staff you can tell how committed and passionate they are, about the surroundings and animal wellbeing â˜ºï¸

We booked an experience (tour & visting the mini moos ğŸ®) and unfortunately there was a stand still traffice accident which made us late to our booking. But we inform the staff and they were very accommodating as others were also stuck and waited until everyone arrived.

Even if you don't book the tour you can walk around the fields and see the animals, vist the restaurant / cafÃ© which has amazing food and drinks, butches and small petting farm.

Can't wait to vist again!!

recent_reviews.author: Flat cap jhon Smith
recent_reviews.text: Donâ€™t feed your properly Smelly Sonia

recent_reviews.author: M Hussain
recent_reviews.text: Its such a nice farm

recent_reviews.author: Sana Khan
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little  local farm

recent_reviews.author: Hannah Threadgould
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place for a picnic or to walk through. Good views on clear days. Love the blossom in spring. You can see nature return in the hedge and unmown areas.

recent_reviews.author: Lynne
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little orchard, great benches where you can sit and enjoy the beautiful views, peaceful even though you are right next to the ring road.

recent_reviews.author: Bev T
recent_reviews.text: An uplifting place with young fruit tree and a developing hedgerow , benches to sit and enjoy the views - lovingly maintained by the community

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Foster
recent_reviews.text: A fantastic place to sit with beautiful views so peaceful ,

pumpkin_patches.address: 619 Ring Rd Farsley, Farsley, Pudsey LS28 5JY

recent_reviews.author: Olga Kittle
recent_reviews.text: Millbank coffee is THEE best around! Full, deep flavour and great strength! Best barista by far is Helen who makes a perfect cappuccino!

recent_reviews.author: James Mitchell
recent_reviews.text: What a fantastic place, the choice and quality is way above average for sure. For the moaners complaining about price, stick to Asda then and leave this home grown and local food for us. Quality costs and is well worth it. Thanks guys.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah-Jane Finch
recent_reviews.text:
I found this shop by chance on the way to the local National Trust property on day one of my holiday. I popped in to get some local produce as I like to do when Iâ€™m away. The ladies in the shop were lovely & friendly. I asked for recommendation for a local cheese and one lady showed me one produced â€œjust up the roadâ€. Itâ€™s a delicious blue cheese that made my mouth water!
I also bought a piece of fillet steak from the farm. Wowâ€¦. It was absolutely amazing. So full of flavour and SO tender.
I would highly recommend this shop and its produce.

recent_reviews.author: Will Megarry
recent_reviews.text: Come here often to get breakfast and fresh orange juice from their fresh orange juice machine. Amazing fresh supplies and great, healthy options. Probably the best shop in Saintfield.

recent_reviews.author: Colin K
recent_reviews.text: Really excellent garden centre. The restaurant is definitely 5 stars. Staff very friendly and helpful. Food cooked well and served piping hot. No long wait to get seated even though it was packed. No wait for food either. Fantastic

recent_reviews.author: Sharon Carson
recent_reviews.text:
Adam helped carry  my purchased items out to my car today .
He was polite , chatty and helpful .
Lovely wee staff member
Thank you Adam

recent_reviews.author: Mike Rider
recent_reviews.text:
Used to love the great Ulster Fry served here but was sorry to see they now serve the large fry with 2 very small sausages 2 very small eggs 1 spoonful of beans and a few very small pieces of soda & potatoe bread.
This is no longer a large fry, it's basically a small fry.
My wife ordered a small fry and it was extremely small.
It tasted very nice, the restaurant is beautiful,  staff are very friendly.
Most Men expect a large fry when they order, or simply add extra large fry for MEN.

recent_reviews.author: denise buckby
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful healthy plants  with a great variety and staff are very helpful  and knowledgeable.

recent_reviews.author: Carol Ann Collett
recent_reviews.text: Aldermoor Community Farm is welcomes visitors to their farm shop and cafe serving delicious home made cakes and savouries.You are welcome to walk round the small site to see what is growing and meet geese, ducks and chickens. There is a very friendly and peaceful atmosphere. Volunteers bring a vast range of skills and interests. It's a place of inclusivity, acceptance, team building, encouragement and more.

recent_reviews.author: Pat Wills
recent_reviews.text: Great little place shall go back for another visit. Lots to see for young children. Chickens, ducks and geese.

recent_reviews.author: Matthew Wellspring
recent_reviews.text:
This is a great community initiative, we love touring the farm, seeing the way they grow fruits and vegetables and saying hello to the chickens, ducks and geese.
They have a growing farm shop stocking all sorts of produce they have grown as well as things they have sourced locally.
Well worth a visit if you're in the area.

recent_reviews.author: Lil Iyam
recent_reviews.text: Very wonderful and welcoming with a super event for the community. The emporium and farm shop are fab, with gorgeous fresh produce. The animals were lovely and everything was lovely.

pumpkin_patches.address: Aldermoor Farm, Aldermoor Rd, Southampton SO16 5NN

recent_reviews.author: Kyrsty Angus
recent_reviews.text:
Really lovely little farm area of rescued animals including chickens, goats, sheep, a pony and guinea pigs and some repitles such as a skink and giant african land snails etc.

Its a small circuit route round and very knowledgeable staff and volunteers.
Lots of handling experinces and absolute bargain entrance price. Open afternoons in the holiday and weekends during term time. The centre also offers summer clubs, Alternative Provision and many more.

This fabulous

recent_reviews.author: Vie Portland
recent_reviews.text:
We visited the farm today and had a wonderful time! The staff are all lovely and knowledgeable, and the animals are gorgeous and obviously well looked after.
We got to feed some beautiful goats!
And the garden maze is full of fabulous fragrant flowers, with bees and butterflies in abundance.
We also really love that the animals are rescues.
A wonderful place to visit, and we'll be back!

recent_reviews.author: Chantelle Wood
recent_reviews.text:
Yesterday we attended the private Teddy Bear Picnic which was held for the toddler group, it was such a lovely morning.
We regularly attend the toddler group sessions which my son absolutely loves. It has really helped his confidence grow around animals and itâ€™s a great opportunity to meet new people too!
Weâ€™re really looking forward to coming again after the summer holidays â˜€ï¸
Thank you to all the team at City Farm and to those who provide funding to make it possible for our children to have these opportunities ğŸ™Œ

recent_reviews.author: Starly
recent_reviews.text:
Myself and friends recently did the Goat Experience at the farm and had an absolutely amazing time. We got to walk the goats around the farm and then give them lots of cuddles. We also got to meet the Pygmy goats and interact with them too. The staff where very nice and clearly cared a lot for the animals. They where happy to answer all our questions.

The rest of the farm was very nice to walk around. All the animals where very clearly happy and well cared for. The walkways are flat and easy to walk on and would be fine for pushchairs.

We also spent some time in the cafe. The tea and crumpets where lovely and there where vegan options available.

Overall a fantastic day out!

pumpkin_patches.address: City Farm, Green Ln, Southampton SO16 9FQ

recent_reviews.author: Keith Taylor
recent_reviews.text: Great location,easy and controlled access ,owners friendly and polite. Been here for 2 years and no issues.

recent_reviews.author: Mohammad Al Sheghri
recent_reviews.text: It is the good place to visit and to bring the kids

recent_reviews.author: Danielle Music
recent_reviews.text: Great farm. Keep our caravan on it. Plenty of security

recent_reviews.author: Polished Inside & Out
recent_reviews.text: Great place fir the kids, two pumpkin fields with a range of size and colourful pumpkins. A drinks, cake and sweets shall on site. Small wheelbarrow for the kids and a large one for the parents. Great morning or afternoon out with lovely friendly and helpful staff.

recent_reviews.author: Mimi
recent_reviews.text:
Took a quick trip to pick some sunflowers, about the same you pay at a supermarket if not cheaper at Â£1 a stem (and that's still if you pick 1 stem with 3 heads!) So definitely better than buying them at the shops. They're so big and bright, it's almost impossible to not smile when you see them in your home, was a genuinely lovely time and the people working the stand that day were so lovely and welcoming, would definitely go again
They also have seating and plenty of photo opportunities, great for Instagram or Facebook ;)

recent_reviews.author: Jan Jolly
recent_reviews.text: Reflecting on a wonderful trip to Pumpkin Corner last year. Getting excited for this year's pumpkin search! ğŸƒ So much fun ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Squigglehed
recent_reviews.text: Visited with my boyfriend last year and would highly recommend to anyone. We were able to pick as many pumpkins (which were reasonably priced based on sizing) and all pumpkins lasted for ages! The additional decorations the owners put around the field were great too for taking spooky photos with ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Jamie Platt
recent_reviews.text: Tucked away at the back of Eastwood. Bridal paths let you access many fields for fantastic walks. There is also a lake in one of the fields where you can fish.

recent_reviews.author: Paul King
recent_reviews.text: Great for walking along with or without dog and a good leisurely bike ride also. Wood and trails

recent_reviews.author: Martin Andrews
recent_reviews.text: Large open space, good for a long walk, very muddy in places, unsurprisingly!

recent_reviews.author: Bernard Dean
recent_reviews.text: Amazing walks whatever the weather.

recent_reviews.author: Lesley Butler
recent_reviews.text: I've been going every year since 2009. We travel from Luton.  The grandchildren come with us and love picking their own apples. Excellent variety of apples and some pears .. I absolutely love the Howgate Wonder apples. Great for cooking .no sugar needed, and they don't go mushy like some bramley apples do.. this is the only place I can get them !  Wrapped in newspaper and kept dry will store for  months... Beautiful scenic location with good old-fashioned family service . Make sure you  leave your address to get a  reminder each year.. I love getting the postcard through the door...

recent_reviews.author: Jonathan Wilson
recent_reviews.text:
A wonderful working orchard where you can buy apples, pears, quinces and medlars that smell and taste a milliion times better than anything shop bought.
They also sell pressed juices and seasonal vegetables too.
Apple season starts in late August with Discovery apples, with pick your own varieties from September.
Try a proper seasonal British grown apple and you won't be disappointed.

recent_reviews.author: Caroline Robertson
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place, great choice of fruit, pleasant staff. We enjoyed ourselves and will be back next year

recent_reviews.author: Gay Bourne
recent_reviews.text: Pick here every year ,so well laid out and easy to pick ,the most delicious apples in Essex ,itâ€™s worth a trip out ,people are very friendly and helpful ,canâ€™t wait to go and pick again .

pumpkin_patches.address: Daymens Hill Farm Nurseries, Brick House Rd, Maldon CM9 8JZ

recent_reviews.author: Grace White
recent_reviews.text:
Itâ€™s such a lovely place to spend time with your kids â€” peaceful, with a lovely atmosphere, and very clean. The children had a wonderful time, and we were all excited and happy while picking strawberries. It was a beautiful experience for everyone.
The only thing I didnâ€™t like was that there was no clear pricing sign for the fruits we're meart to pick. We were so caught up in the excitement of the experience that we didnâ€™t think to ask about the cost, and they turned out to be quite expensive. So, be careful not to fill too many punnets before checking the price, as we did. Be careful, make sure you have cash, no credit card.
Another downside was that the children werenâ€™t allowed to play with the toys unless we were having tea there which made my kids a littlebit sad. We had planned to, but after seeing how expensive the punnets were, we changed the plan.
There is a very clean public toilet on-site and a large parking area.
Overall, itâ€™s a lovely experience definitely a nice spot to visit and DELICIOUS strawberries. We would go again, but next time weâ€™d be more mindful about how many punnets we fill.

recent_reviews.author: Laura Gould
recent_reviews.text: We were fortunate enough to visit just before the end of the season for the strawberry crops and what a lovely experience we had. We enjoyed picking strawberries as well as plums. Afterwards, we went back to the tearoom for the tastiest slice of sticky toffee cake! Yas and Dan at the tearoom were so approachable and informative and the garden games were such a lovely added touch. Canâ€™t believe we didnâ€™t know about Blanton Fruit Farm before but we will definitely be back!

recent_reviews.author: Tina Hall
recent_reviews.text:
I'm so sorry you have had yet another blow to your week. (Someone tampering with water etc), I popped in yesterday with two young people and we had a fantastic morning picking strawberries. We picked so many in such a short time! And they were so delicious! Going to try and get to you earlier in the season next time!! Loved the Greengages from the shop too!
You and your family were so welcoming, we thoroughly enjoyed our tea and cake ğŸ‚. We look forward to coming back again soon and will continue recommending you ğŸ˜Š
Keep up the good, hard, work and keep your chin up! You're doing a fantastic job ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Martin Bottomley
recent_reviews.text:
We visited with our younger daughter on Saturday for the first time and absolutely loved this place!

We spent an hour wandering around the gardens picking plums, greengages and redcurrants and then had a lovely cream tea in the beautiful gardens whilst watching the chickens and ducks.

We'll be visiting again soon!

recent_reviews.author: Andrzej S
recent_reviews.text: â€‹Mead Open Farm has become a family favourite for us! No matter how many times we visit, we always find a new adventure. The hands on fun of petting and feeding the animals is a great. The number of activities is incredible, from the  silent disco and racing gokarts to the big inflatable ball that the kids can roll around in water. The new pirate themed splash park is a fantastic and welcome addition! Even the British weather can't spoil the fun, thanks to the massive indoor soft play centre with few nice slides. It's an action packed day out that we highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Emma Hull
recent_reviews.text:
We had a wonderful time visiting for the Dino week.
There were plenty of activities for the whole family, and our son especially enjoyed the "Time warp challenge" interactive show and the dino disco.
The dinosaurs and cavemen were very entertaining ğŸ¤£ Our son would have happily followed them all day if we had let him. Not once did they break character.
The play areas were a massive hit, both the indoor (which has a great selection of slides) and the outdoor.
The cafe was good, a decent price, and had a great selection of cakes (the lemon doughnut was particularly yummy!)
The animals all looked well cared for, and as with most farms, they offered lamb feeding and small animal petting, although we did not do this. There are plenty of handwashing stations if you do feed or touch the animals.
We would definitely return and will look at booking for the Christmas event!

recent_reviews.author: Cabrice Sinclair
recent_reviews.text: I donâ€™t know wheee to begin. This place is AMAZING!! Finally got to go with the whole family today and there was something for everyone. The kids really enjoyed it. Itâ€™s such a unique offering. With both the farm animals which are so well groomed and looked afterâ€¦ to so many posh and adventure options. Itâ€™s a full day. Itâ€™s great value of money. We were thinking of going to a theme park but with our one year old we felt it would have been too much with all the queues. We are so happy we chose Mead. Was a stress free day. No long queues. Good food. And so much to choose from. The foam party was definitely a hit at the end!!!! Just go!!!!!

recent_reviews.author: Olga W
recent_reviews.text:
Had a fantastic time at Mead Open Farm for a birthday party! The soft play area is a hit for all ages, featuring exhilarating slidesâ€”including one almost vertical for the older kidsâ€”and a giant climbing frame in the outdoor play area that kept everyone entertained. The farm itself is lively, with a great variety of animals adding to the charm. While itâ€™s an overall great experience, just keep an eye on the smallest ones as there are a few dodgy spots that could use extra supervision. Overall, itâ€™s a brilliant venue for a memorable day out!

The outside play area is a real highlightâ€”spacious and perfect for a day out. Thereâ€™s plenty of room for kids to explore and enjoy activities like the big climbing frame, making it a fantastic spot for active play. Plus, the picnic area is well laid out, offering a great spot to relax and enjoy a meal outdoors. With food options available on site, you can easily refuel without having to leave the fun behind. All in all, itâ€™s a well-rounded destination that makes for a delightful family outing!

Our second year attending the Halloween twilight trail. First you navigate a suitably spooky corn maze to find the clues with sound activated figures, to give you a little scare along the way. A sweet treat at the end if you complete the clues. Then grab a wheelbarrow and choose your pumpkin(s) from the fields they grow in. Huge choice of every size, so plenty for everyone.
For little ones who are doing the visit by day there is an activity/play area and farm animals as well as the maze to keep them amused.
The Tipi cafe has lovely home cooked food and hot drinks for young and old. There are picnic benches outside if you want to dare the cold and bring your own food.
Finally a well stocked Halloween shop full of all things Halloween. Not cheap, but to be expected and there were a fair few pocket money Halloween items.
The setting in the beautiful South Northants countryside and the sometimes misty drive down country roads to this family run farm adds to atmosphere.

The food was so good, the hot chocolate was yummy and all the staff were so nice over the whole farm. We'll definitely be returning as a family.

recent_reviews.author: Nigel Fletcher
recent_reviews.text: Nice family day spent at Ruffins Farm. Reasonable priced activities (tractor train and maze) plus the kids enjoyed feeding the animals and even got to see some newly born lambs. If itâ€™s been raining definitely recommend wellies for the whole family. Not sure if it is there all the time but there was a pizza stall making freshly baked pizzas that were some of the best tried in Suffolk.

pumpkin_patches.address: Ruffins Farm, Whepstead, Bury Saint Edmunds IP29 4UD

recent_reviews.author: Jillian Fyall
recent_reviews.text: Took my 7 year old grandson for a 12 oâ€™clock walk with an alpaca. We arrived early and spent 40 minutes chatting to the lovely staff and interacting with all the animals. Such a lovely, friendly and informative place. The walk with George the Alpaca gave us more time to chat with the lovely manager who gave us lots of info about all the animals in the fields. My grandson had lots of questions ğŸ¤£ We both had a fabulous time and came away with some delicious duck eggs and a free bag of alpaca fur with an information card.

recent_reviews.author: Helen Turpie
recent_reviews.text:
We booked on the Alpaca experience and the Alpaca walk.
We had the most amazing experience, from the start the staff were so friendly.
My family from Spain absolutely loved meeting all the animals on the experience and were so impressed by the staffâ€™s knowledge.
They got to hold or  stroke, rabbits , Guinea pigs, goats, sheep, ferrets, ducks , chickens horses, they walked the alpaca around in the areana and got some beautiful photos ,
Myself and my older daughters went on the most beautiful walk through the farm and down the fields all with our own alpaca, we had a break mid way so the alpacas could rest and have some grass before walking back, lots of great photos opportunities and the Alpacasâ€™s were a   joy to walk, we all came back feeling so relaxed after such an enjoyable experience.
Our guide was super informative and told us about farm life and even some history about the farm. He was on hand if we needed any help and went at a good pace for us to take photos and enjoy the views.
We all met back at the farm to enjoy an ice cream together.
Thank you to all at Lowlands  farm for a most gorgeous morning.ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Robert Taylor
recent_reviews.text:
Great day out - we did the farm experience, met tonnes of animals, and had a hilarious time.
The girls are very friendly and do an excellent job of guiding you round.

I will definitely return at some point with for a birthday treat

recent_reviews.author: Helen Ormrod
recent_reviews.text: Took my five year old on the alpaca walking. Lovely friendly guide call Mike. What a fantastic experience myself and my child had. The farm was great too. The baby chicks were adorable. Great set up and nice clean yard. Great afternoon out. Thank you lowlands

pumpkin_patches.address: Lowlands Farm, Peel Rd, Blackpool FY4 5JX

recent_reviews.author: Antonio Isaac de Abreu
recent_reviews.text:
With time, this orchard is going to be a lovely place for families and friends to come and visit and enjoy.
