For now itâ€™s a work in progress and a little bit of a hidden gem. When you visit please donâ€™t litter.

recent_reviews.author: Matt B
recent_reviews.text: Nice, secure place, to relax in nature, with the birds around.  4 stars as the guided bus go past occasionally.

recent_reviews.author: Nick Bailey
recent_reviews.text: I'm not quite sure why the fruit trees are still so small after so many years in the ground. Hopefully they'll grow one of these years to provide some shade and shelter as well as abundant fruit.

recent_reviews.author: Julian ChudziÅ„ski
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place to sit down and relax after hard day  . Best sunsets in whole Histon!

recent_reviews.author: jamie allingham
recent_reviews.text: Always a pleasure delivering to these guys ...friendly nice people ...wishing them luck this season and see you soon

recent_reviews.author: Damien McClarey
recent_reviews.text: These guys are brilliant but itâ€™s a very busy place

recent_reviews.author: Justus Vaati
recent_reviews.text: Best farms in u.k

recent_reviews.author: Ahmadov Husniddin
recent_reviews.text: Good

recent_reviews.author: oscar dewhurst
recent_reviews.text: Wow, what can I say? Top farm, great people, easy to talk to, I HIGHLY recommend. They also seem to be very ethical in their approach and I am thoroughly impressed.

recent_reviews.author: ĞĞ½Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ°ÑĞ¸Ñ Ğ’Ğ°Ğ»ĞµĞµĞ²Ğ°
recent_reviews.text: I've been here in 2005 as a student. very hard work - picking strawberry.  But very good memories of this edventure. I remember Andy and Phil

recent_reviews.author: Ralph Chivers
recent_reviews.text: heroes

pumpkin_patches.address: Victoria Farm, Main Street, Hardwick, Cambridge CB23 7QS

recent_reviews.author: Paul Cooke
recent_reviews.text: Lovely ,peaceful place,great view over open fields!! Fabulous selection of fresh home grown veg!! Lovely pet chickens going about their business!!

recent_reviews.author: L H
recent_reviews.text: Reasonably priced with lovely selection of clothes, gifts, plants and normal garden centre bits. There's a decent post office and restaurant with children's play area. The baby changing table/loo is well arranged though  a short walk from the restaurant.  The food hall is wonderful and includes an excellent butcher-  suggest the steak pies which are packed with lots of good cuts. Lovely place to potter with a pram and have a bite to eat.

recent_reviews.author: Sany
recent_reviews.text:
Oh, what a lovely place. It is always so busy and for a reason.
The ladies at the  check out were so lovely and helpful. We turned up with my elderly granny and they quickly supplied us with wheelchair.
The staff through the shop in all areas are lovely and they don't stop.
There is a great variety of products and sales as well. It's a must visit place ğŸ˜Œ

recent_reviews.author: Ken Spinoza Stone
recent_reviews.text: Really great place, they have a cool cafe and pretty much all plants you can think of.

recent_reviews.author: Maharukh Daruwalla
recent_reviews.text: Really nice garden centre which has expanded to include a lovely restaurant, deli, butchers, clothing store. Great ambience,  but the restaurant has very traditional meal choices, and  vegetarian/ vegan selection  of meals is lacking.

recent_reviews.author: A
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place with a variety of animals and a good coffee. dog friendly. Great for a day out. They also do very fun events and workshops so itâ€™s worth checking out whatâ€™s on! Also selling plants, manure, eggs etc

recent_reviews.author: hannah
recent_reviews.text: A lovely little farm giving back to the community in the best way possible. Itâ€™s great for families and small children and all animal lovers really. I always pass by the goats when I am walking my dog and I appear to have befriended them! They have all sorts of farm animals, small animals, and even the most majestic peacock!!

recent_reviews.author: K B
recent_reviews.text: I really love visiting this farm as it feels like a lovely community. The animals always seem really happy and well cared for which is lovely to see, plus it is free entry. The layout is really well designed

recent_reviews.author: Abigail Rachele Salifu
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm with different animals and a play area for kids. Toilets were ok, had a little fault with lights but we were still able to use it.

recent_reviews.author: nindy2k
recent_reviews.text: Itâ€™s a manor and a farm all in one. Looking for food then this farm helps make food for you

recent_reviews.author: Duncan Beaumont
recent_reviews.text: Awesome place

pumpkin_patches.address: Pithill Farm, Littleworth Lane, Rossington, Doncaster DN11 0HH

recent_reviews.author: Diane F
recent_reviews.text: We had a lovely time at the farm with our baby last Thursday. We really enjoyed feeding the animals, and the outdoor play areas were fantastic! The baby soft play could definitely use more balls in the ball pit, and the cafÃ© closed quite early, with no food options available later on. Still, itâ€™s a great spot for little ones and weâ€™d happily go back!

recent_reviews.author: Katyelloworld
recent_reviews.text:
âœ¨Spring magic, fluffy friends &
big smiles â€” that's what our Easter adventure at @oddsfarmpark was all about!
We fed adorable goats, cuddled lambs, explored the Easter trail and got crafty in the barn!
Plus: we zoomed around on mini tractors, played crazy golf, roasted marshmallows over the fire, splashed in water play, and ran wild on the massive playground!
A full day of laughter, fresh air, and proper childhood joy.

recent_reviews.author: Kelly
recent_reviews.text: Odds Farm is a fantastic place for a family day out. We went for a birthday party and the kids had a brilliant time! Thereâ€™s a great indoor play area, outdoor playgrounds, a sand zone, and lots of animals to feed like goats and sheep. The staff were friendly and everything was well organised. Highly recommended, especially for families with young children.

recent_reviews.author: Lily Rose
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely fantastic day out at Odds Farm! This place is a perfect mix of fun, learning, and fresh air â€” ideal for families with kids of all ages. From the hands-on animal encounters to the amazing indoor and outdoor play areas, everything is thoughtfully laid out and beautifully maintained. The animals are clearly well cared for, and thereâ€™s a genuine atmosphere of joy and engagement throughout the farm.

A special mention goes to the gift shop â€” not only is it filled with charming, very well-priced items, but the two ladies working there were absolutely lovely. They were warm, friendly, and genuinely helpful, making the end of our visit just as delightful as the rest. Their kindness added a personal touch that made the whole experience even more memorable.

Highly recommend a visit â€” weâ€™ll definitely be back!

pumpkin_patches.address: Wooburn Common, Odds Farm Park, Wooburn Common Rd, Wooburn Green, High Wycombe HP10 0LX

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Berkshire Farm Girl Pumpkin Patch Newbury M4 J13

recent_reviews.author: Sophie Jolley
recent_reviews.text: Really looking forward to 2025 Berkshire Farm Girlâ€™s pumpkin patch. Went the last 2 years and always something new. Excellent value for money and great for both grown ups and little ones. Grow pumpkins grow, S

recent_reviews.author: jonesyzk4
recent_reviews.text: My family and I attended this event last year and it was the best pumpkin patch weâ€™ve been to. Everyone making the event happen were extremely friendly and helpful and all the kids were made to feel special. The horse and cart ride was brilliant amongst the ploughing match that was underway in the next field. Plenty of refreshments at affordable prices for everyone. Looking forward to this years. â˜ºï¸â˜ºï¸

recent_reviews.author: Jason Smith
recent_reviews.text:
Honestly? 10/10 pumpkin chaos. Pulled off the M4 at J13 expecting a quiet afternoon. Left covered in mud, holding 3 pumpkins, and rethinking my life choices after getting ambushed by a witch with attitude.

The patch itself is amazing â€“ endless pumpkins in all shapes and sizes, like a speed-dating event for vegetables. Found one that looked like it had fought off a squirrel and won. Naturally, I bought it.

Thereâ€™s a corn maze where youâ€™ll either find inner peace or lose your family. I lost mine for 25 minutes. They came out emotionally different.

Great for:

Kids with energy

Adults pretending to be fine

Instagram mums with matching wellies

People who enjoy â€œmud as a lifestyleâ€

recent_reviews.author: Southern Counties Marble & Granite Ltd
recent_reviews.text: By far the best pumpkin patch around! Such a good set up with lots to do, a huge range of pumpkins and very well organised. Would highly recommend, very reasonable prices too!

pumpkin_patches.address: Long Ln, Cold Ash, RG189LS RG18 9LS

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte Joanna
recent_reviews.text: Had the best afternoon walking through the patch and choosing pumpkins, lots of variety and such a beautiful location!

recent_reviews.author: Robyn Hamilton
recent_reviews.text:
WOW. So much choice and so much fun. We had the most brilliant day picking our pumpkins from a selection of refreshingly quality(!) pumpkins - nothing like the rotting supermarket bunch - and the staff are so delightful.
Weâ€™ve even promised to take the kids back on Saturday when thereâ€™s going to be a farmers market pop up as well. Autumnal Heaven. Highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Arlene Longmate
recent_reviews.text: What a lovely pumpkin farm. Took the dogs, kids and mother and had a fantastic day.  The staff were so friendly and  great fun they couldn't do enough for us. Going back on the weekend just  to take mum for a coffee ğŸ˜€ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: andy-sara
recent_reviews.text: Lovely family day out. Staff extremely helpful. Great selection of pumpkins ğŸƒ Looking forward to going back for our Christmas tree in December

pumpkin_patches.address: Christmas Tree Farm, Bagnor Rd, Newbury RG20 8BN

recent_reviews.author: Ciara Corrigan
recent_reviews.text: Loved the variety here, Farm shop, plant and Gift shop, soon to have a new cheese and delicious section. A wonderful cafe, highly recommend the food. Contains lots of pop up markets and activities, yoga, sauna, hot tub, ice cream stall, venue areas for hire  to name but a few!!! Really well laid out

recent_reviews.author: Claire Jones
recent_reviews.text:
It's always a great place to shop, and now it's getting even better! Great bread, and now a deli & butchers on the way. I can't wait!
I love the cafe too, if you can get in there, as it's always busy, as the food & atmosphere is great.
PYO strawberries have always been a favourite, too, at this time of year.
Also carries a selection of gluten free products, which is great ğŸ‘
We are so lucky to have this innovative farm shop on our doorstep - thank you, Peterley Manor Farm

recent_reviews.author: Surjit Dhanjal
recent_reviews.text: It was early jn the morning and the cafe was nice and calming. I liked the interior and surroundings very much. The breakfast was beautifully presented and delicious. The service was great and nice to have a pot of tea where the tea i not not weak. It must be because it was a Two Teas tea bag in it.

recent_reviews.author: christiana meira
recent_reviews.text: Had a great time with friends. Lovely food and felt welcome. Polite staff and lovely walk to view Alpacas

pumpkin_patches.address: Peterley Ln, Prestwood, Great Missenden HP16 0HH

recent_reviews.author: Noureen Khan
recent_reviews.text: We enjoyed our picnic in the field and meandering through the sunflower maze. My 3 year old niece loved bouncing on the hay bales!

recent_reviews.author: Paul Kader
recent_reviews.text:
I love this place. This was our third visit, twice for the sunflowers and once for the pumpkins. For a small entrance charge for adults and no charge for kiddies.
There are literally thousands of beautiful sunflowers to wandering through and then there are some cut ones that you can purchase for a small amount of money.
There is also coffee and refreshments available to purchase.
I  really admire this farmer for providing a lovely attraction for people to enjoy and at the same time supplementing his income.
My 3 year old grandson absolutely loved his afternoon here.

recent_reviews.author: Zach Dills
recent_reviews.text: Great place for pumpkins. This is my first year going here as I'm new to the area and it was better than I could have hoped. Anyone looking for pumpkins for Halloween this is your spot.

recent_reviews.author: Jack Smith
recent_reviews.text:
Great place to go to get into the mood for Halloween. Weâ€™ve been a few times now and it is always nicely decorated and well organised.

Sadly this time one of our pumpkins rotted within 2 days of purchase. We made contact to request a refund and weâ€™re initially offered a replacement. However werenâ€™t able to collect the replacement pumpkin before halloween.

Asked for a refund instead and was then ignored. Frustrating for a Â£10 pumpkin that should last for a month or more

pumpkin_patches.address: Manor House Farm, Hardwick, Aylesbury HP22 4DZ

recent_reviews.author: Tim Miles
recent_reviews.text:
Iâ€™m almost hesitant to review this one as itâ€™s just such a hidden gem but the owners are warm and welcoming.

The cafe is a fun little spot with a couple of tractors out for the kids (one real) and a few dogs running around saying hello to all the customers.

Hot drinks are under Â£2 (Â£2.50 for the filter I think). Cakes are more than reasonable are really homemade.

They also have a freezer of beef for sale with a wide variety of cuts, from the cows in the field opposite. Itâ€™s quite delicious.

They always stock some interesting miscellaneous items from the community, honey, pumpkin plushies, crockery bird feeders.

They open once a month, on a Saturday and Sunday. You can tell when they do as they put a sign out in Weston Turville saying that they will be open. Love it.

recent_reviews.author: Tobin Chew
recent_reviews.text:
There is lamb and beef for sale which has been grown on the farm! Their meat is delicious and I only buy from here now. I find the cuts really flavoursome and high quality, and at excellent prices. There are other bits and bobs from local people like flowers, flour, and crafts. All the cakes are genuinely homemade, and occasionally they have home made liver cake which the dogs love.
In the winter they have fresh squashâ€™s and pumpkins from their own pumpkin patch!

recent_reviews.author: Joe Cummins
recent_reviews.text: Popped into Church Farm on the 3/2/25 to pick some meat as our freezer was running low. After hearing from friends who had already bought meat here we decided to give them a go and boy were we glad we did. The following day my wife cooked the lamb steaks in the Air Fryer and without a doubt they were the best steaks we ever had. Tasty , succulent and juicy and exactly how lamb steaks should be. The quality was what you would expect in a five star restaurant and looking forward to a return visit again at the end of the month and over the coming months as well.

recent_reviews.author: Kim Stock
recent_reviews.text:
Fabulous pop up shop and cafe! And lovely genuinely friendly people here! Cakes are brilliant, and today we got some of their lamb,  too!

Update 26/5/2024 We played with the kittens and got silverside of beef... mmm!

recent_reviews.author: Izzy S
recent_reviews.text: Fab day out with the kids over October half term. We loved it and we will definitely be back next year! The children loved that there was a scavenger hunt they could do as they went round picking pumpkins, and they loved the corn (maize) maze!! We took away 3 largish pumpkins for around Â£13 which is a bargain considering there was no entry fee. Lovely to know that any money raised will be going to a local school. Great job guys and real dedication from all volunteers involved in this project!

recent_reviews.author: peter j
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic way to occupy the children over half term. They really enjoyed hunting and choosing their best pumpkins, and there was so much else for them to do with Halloween themed activities.
With all the rain recently, bring your wellies.
Great fun. The kids want to go back again tomorrow!
Recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Kay Grant
recent_reviews.text: A brilliant day out spending time here with my two young grandchildren. We enjoyed finding the various Halloween displays; spiders, ghosts; skelton & more. Hay bales to climb & various toys to play with in a safe area. Tractor rides & hot chocolate. Go & visit. Muddy so wear your wellies. Can't rate it higher than 5 but certainly would do.

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Hodge
recent_reviews.text: I visited the patch with my nieces and nephew.  It was really good to see them collaborate on their scavenger hunt.  As a teacher, Iâ€™m really pleased to get some grounding activities in during the crazy Halloween celebrations.  Itâ€™s become very commercialised.  I supervised the carving and the childrenâ€™s designs look pretty good.  I wish their handwriting was the same!

recent_reviews.author: Joanna x
recent_reviews.text:
Came back again today with my grandchildren.
It was even better than last year, yet we loved it last year to!
There was more to do and upgrades, plus simple improvements that make a huge difference!
All the staff are super friendly and appear to enjoy interacting with all the very excitable children and very worn out grandmother's lol.
Obviously we will keep coming back again and again and again!

recent_reviews.author: Alina HODOR
recent_reviews.text: We had lots of fun there... foam party, swimming pool, lots of games to play freely without the needs of order, or silly rules. Nice parking lot, big, toilets on site, an amazing team that works there, food and drinks on site...

recent_reviews.author: Gail Wilson
recent_reviews.text: Sunflowers lovely, staff lovely, just very expensive a tenner each only 15 mins walk through sunflowers ğŸŒ»

recent_reviews.author: Doug Cullen
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic day at skylark. Tractor ride with water pistols, lunch, giant maize maze and lots of other activities. We all loved it.

recent_reviews.author: Where Today
recent_reviews.text:
We didnâ€™t eat here we went for the sunflower maze.
The maze was beautiful and the flowers were in full bloom. But it could be quite expensive for a family. Itâ€™s Â£5 per person to go in the maze and a Â£1 per stem if you pick the sunflowers.
Itâ€™s a gorgeous place with a cafe, animals and you can pay to go on a little train to take you to the start of the maze. (Itâ€™s only a short journey ).

recent_reviews.author: Chelsi Smiles
recent_reviews.text: We had the joy of having our wedding day at The Hayloft recently. We couldn't have asked for a more perfect day. The whole team are lovely, passionate and genuinely will go out of their way to give you the VIP feel! Lesley was our co-ordinator and we cannot sing her praises more! We feel very lucky to have had our wedding at The Hayloft. I think you have earned a fair few new customers out of it!

recent_reviews.author: Ruth O'Connor
recent_reviews.text:
I had a chicken and bacon mayo sandwich which was really fresh. The salad and coleslaw that came with it was amazing as well.
Loved the miniature railway and sunflower trail (seasonal).
My only criticism was the rabbits and guinea pig enclosure needed cleaning and had far too many flies which could cause fly strike. They need some fly repellent and fly catchers.

recent_reviews.author: Jaclin Lawton
recent_reviews.text: Had a works surprise hen do here and the staff were so accommodating. Really quick service the food was out no more than 5 minutes after ordered, great quality and the atmosphere inside is beautiful. Lots to do for kids also including the animals to see and you can buy feed for them also!

pumpkin_patches.address: Sandy Lane Bold Heath, Great Sankey, Widnes WA8 3XP

recent_reviews.author: Lauren Ridgway
recent_reviews.text:
Had a fantastic couple of hours at Bates Farm to do our annual pumpkin picking last Saturday. Great value for money as its only Â£12 per car to park and gain entrance to the farm and have a wonder around and meet the animals. They have a huge field with lots of different pumpkins, all shapes, sizes and colours....which my kids loved to the point our wheel barrow was too full so we had to try and decide which to keep at the end. Pumpkin prices reflect other pumpkin patches I have visited over the years but felt there was lots more variety and choice at bates farm. The farm isn't huge but I found it very family orientated, with face painting for the kids and lots of cute places to take photos whilst we enjoyed cookies and coffee from the coffee van which was also reasonably priced. Also it was really nice for one of the owners to take time out to have a chat with us and gave us some tips on how to grow our own pumpkins next year on our allotment. So thank you.
Overall a great day, weather was perfect and the farm was spot on. See you at the beginning of April for the lambing season. Can't wait to return. X

recent_reviews.author: Khira Lever
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing visit last weekend! The barn is gorgeous! Lots of places for photo opportunities! There were so many varieties of pumpkins to pick from. We picked some both from the barn and from the patch, some pumpkins were even still growing on the patchğŸƒ we also enjoyed some delicious hot chocolates from the hot drink van â˜•ï¸
It was very muddy (as expected) so donâ€™t forget your wellies!

recent_reviews.author: Alexandra Hilton
recent_reviews.text: I think this was our 3rd year pumpkin picking and itâ€™s been better every time! The staff are lovely - very knowledgeable, friendly and polite. Very well managed, great coffee & food, plenty of pumpkins to choose from both under shelter and from the patch, the kids loved seeing the animals and loved the addition of the pink tractor this year. Absolutely no complaints here, we will definitely be back! Thankyou ğŸƒâ¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: natalie shaw
recent_reviews.text: I donâ€™t see how you could negatively review Bates Farm. People complain about the price but they have to make a profit somehow! The barn and the whole experience was lovely and super fun. This is the first pumpkin patch Iâ€™ve seen that actually grows their own pumpkins! The coffee truck is fab and the staff are so lovely. This is a farm that is family run and they have to make a profit out for the event so to complain is ridiculous, when all pumpkin patches charge for entry and charge more than Tesco for a pumpkin.

pumpkin_patches.address: Warrington Rd, Risley, Croft, Warrington WA3 6BN

recent_reviews.author: Jenny
recent_reviews.text:
A lovely little farm, especially for younger children but still plenty to do as a family, the mini golf and feeding the animals is our favourite thing to do.
We come regularly and would recommend going.

recent_reviews.author: Natalie Brown
recent_reviews.text: Nice little farm with play areas. Animals seem well cared for and there were a good selection of animals. Paid Â£4.50 for adult entrance and Â£1 for a bag of animal feed. Under 2s were free. Some of the climbing frames were in need of a refresh. Toilets were clean (except for a few spiders but as it I a farm think this is to be expected). Overall a good day out with little ones!

recent_reviews.author: Carol Gough
recent_reviews.text: What a great place for everyone to enjoy, very reasonably priced family day out.. well kept farm animals , mini golf area, great children's play indoors & outdoors & a small cafe.

recent_reviews.author: Ellen Williams
recent_reviews.text: Only Â£4 each to get in and under 2s are free, cute little farm. You can feed the animals 50p a bag of feed. Play barn with a sand pit. Little nature walk with a den, picnic areas and outdoor play area. Mini golf included in the price. There's a cafe with fresh cooked meals drinks desserts and ice cream. We'll definitely be back it's beautiful for families.

recent_reviews.author: Nathan Eeles
recent_reviews.text: 100% the best pumpkin patch in the area. Amazingly great quality pumpkins for a great price. We'll definitely be returning in the future. The staff were also very helpful and friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Sophie Foley
recent_reviews.text:
â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸
Wild Meadow Pony Parties is a lovely, friendly business. The ponies are the cutest and there are so many activities to do.
The pumpkins are huge at the pumpkin patch and such cheap prices. Definitely exceeded my expectations! Would recommend to anyone.

recent_reviews.author: MJS
recent_reviews.text: A friendly family run business, had a fabulous experience in a peaceful rural setting in mid-Cheshire. Really cute ponies and great fun picking pumpkins ğŸƒ Would definitely recommend for a family and children day out.

recent_reviews.author: david cromar
recent_reviews.text: Great place to pick pumpkins.they had a giant spider called sally who is very photogenic and there were lots of fun games to play with faimly.Would recommend  5/5

pumpkin_patches.address: Wild meadow pony parties, Crewe CW1 4RD

recent_reviews.author: David Collins
recent_reviews.text: Having been to Cornwall a few times now, it's always quite difficult to find somewhere to go out and eat that isn't a pub or an Indian takeaway. A local suggested we try Trevaskis farm. Initially the menu felt quite confused with a mix of Asian foods, local fish dishes, and steak or burgers. We gave it a shot anyway and we were not disappointed. I opted for the burger, which was made to perfection. It wasn't one of these over stacked monstrosities, it was the perfect size with some amazing sauce on it. The rest of our table had the Sizzlers which looked and sounded good too. I had also heard of there being a reasonable selection of cakes. The selection is actually vast and with the option of going half and half for an extra Â£1, it felt rude not to - though actually I'm not entirely sure what a full size portion. It felt like we were being given an extra portion for Â£1, not half and half. The atmosphere was a bit odd, it felt like a cross between a canteen and a conservatory. It wasn't bad, it just had a slight garden centre vibe. Well recommend a visit if you're in Cornwall. I'd say it's worth a 35-40 minute drive if you're looking for good food and in the county

recent_reviews.author: Apusara Kaewviset
recent_reviews.text: Itâ€™s my first time visiting this place,and it absolutely amazing! I love the atmosphere! ,we booked it for breakfast and then picking strawberries after ,the service was really nice and easy,the staff was very helpful

recent_reviews.author: Jessica Canada
recent_reviews.text: We were very happy with our meal and our experience here! We were given generous portions and felt so clean and healthy after eating (important to me). I was very happy with my soup and gf bread. Portions were generous and reflected the price. At our table of 5, no favorite could be picked, especially with our group loving the pigs in blanket (kids), creamy squash mash, Yorkshire pudding, the turkey or beef, or the roasted squash, parsnip, and apple soup. Dessert was definitely taken to-go as we had no space in our stomaches but could not pass up the many wonderful options! Especially having so many GF options. We could not stay for dessert because we had to check-in to our hotel and put the kids to bed.

recent_reviews.author: Emily Farndon
recent_reviews.text:
Read reviews and thought we have to have Sunday lunch there, seeing as we had been in the week to pick their wonderful PYO fruits and vegetables, however we arrived and were shown to our table, drinks came quickly, Don't Order the Squash it's just coloured water, I mean yes staff probably been told not to use too much but at least make it so it tastes of orange or Blackcurrant, the waiting staff were absolutely amazing, food was served quickly and we were informed the Lamb for today was rolled lamb so had some fatty areas, in other words it was a cheaper rolled breast or shoulder, that didn't put off the hubby but my son who's autistic has a phobia of fat so opted for the chicken, myself and my youngest son had their rare breed pork now when the food arrived it looked lovely, but it was Luke warm, which meant my husbands lamb left a grease lining at the top of his mouth, then came the potatoes, if you don't have your own teeth don't try and eat them unless you have used fixer that day, they had a solid exterior which was disappointing as they were a nice potato, the swede mash and the pork was absolutely amazing I really can't fault that, the lop rare breed pork is so flavourful its absolutely lush, but I have to sadly admit that the rest of the veg was terrible, the carrots hadn't been peeled and some looked almost dirty still at least give them a good scrub, yes I get veg is better in skin but carrots are always the exception, they were hard, so hard I couldn't stick a fork in, the cauliflower cheese was exactly the same although the flavour was nice the rest was just inedible, and peas and cabbage well it must have been dipped in hot water and that was all, they too were hard and inedible, the Yorkshires looked great and the top half was brilliant until the stodgy bottoms that had half the oil still sitting in them ğŸ™„ overall the food was one of the most expensive, poorly cooked meals I've had, needless to say not one plate out of 4 were anywhere near clear, that really annoyed me as I hate waste but it was just terrible, after eating we sat there with our plates to the side and used napkins on top, yet 20 mins past and no one came to clear the plates, having a autistic child whom by this point wants to know where his dessert is and can he go home ğŸ¤¦â€â™€ï¸ so I made the decision to head to the dessert counter ask for dessert to go and pay the bill. Â£97.15 for 2 adults 2 kids 3 pints of squash Â½pt of Pepsi max and 2 childrens dessert and one adults, absolutely shocking for a meal that was wasted and to be brutally honest I've had better roasts off the too good to go app. I admit desserts were the best part and I was able to share mine it was that big, it was an awful lot of money to waste that's for sure.

Further to this When picking fruit the other day I brought some Judes chocolate custard that was reduced, it wasn't until I got home that day I had realised she had charged me full price, so today I took it back to the shop with the receipt to be basically called a liar by telling me that staff wouldn't have made that mistake if it was reduced they would have rung it up as so ğŸ˜¡ it's such a shame as I was so very impressed with them up until today, now I'll never visit again, even if their fruit is the most amazing, the way we've been treated today, is terrible. So annoyed

pumpkin_patches.address: Trevaskis Farm Restaurant, Gwinear Rd, Connor Downs, Hayle TR27 5JQ

pumpkin_patches.place_name: The Cornish Maize Maze and fun farm

recent_reviews.author: Tom Raffield
recent_reviews.text:
Thought we would try something new with the family today and headed for the Maize Maze and Fun Farm. For four adults and two children we were charged Â£60 when booking in advance. This felt quite expensive but we were willing to give it a go.

On arrival, it was fairly quiet which was a pleasant relief for a mid summer holiday afternoon. The 'farm' has a few animals to look at and feed (Â£1.50) including donkeys, llamas, geese, goats and cows. There was also a lot of open space with picnic tables, garden games, two trampolines, three bouncy castles and some other little bits. There is a very small cafe on site selling the usual things and an ice cream shack. I was disappointed to discover that the cafe would not refill water bottles for children nor were there any water points on the site. This seemed somewhat behind the times and not something I expect of a family attraction.

The main event was of course the maize maze which has two challenges. The first was very child friendly and not too long. The children had to find signs hidden in the maze and add stickers to their collection sheets. The whole family enjoyed this part.

The second challenge was much much harder and involved the same sticker process but I would not advise it for younger children. My two (6 and 4) found it very lengthy and got somewhat bored, very hot and a little grumpy. A solution map is available for Â£1.50 (refundable if not opened) and this became essential to completing the maze and indeed getting out! My children managed to escape with the grand parents before my wife and I completed the maze on their behalf! We enjoyed the challenge.

Also on site, is a slip and slide which claims to be the longest in the UK. This comes with an additional cost but we did not venture over or try that on this occasion. It was busy and did look good fun.

Overall, we managed to spend a pleasurable afternoon here but I can't help but feel that Â£60 is somewhat steep given what is on offer. If your children want to try a different kind of maze which actually is very challenging then perhaps this place is worth a visit.

@familydadventures

recent_reviews.author: Drew Simpson
recent_reviews.text:
The slip and slide was excellent! Great fun with a variety of inflatable rings (single and double) and bodyboards. The staff overseeing this were very helpful.
The maze is good too. Expect to need to use the map though (which I think is normal but it is given to you in an envelope and called a cheat sheet!) to find your way around and find all of the markers/activities for the children to find. The first part is simpler and the second a little more complex.
There are also picnic tables, animals and a play area with bouncy castles, swings and games.
We bought some drinks and food. The coffees were fairly standard and out of a machine but the pasties, sausage rolls and chips were good. All came out hot and the pasties were very tasty.
Overall, a good day out.

recent_reviews.author: Iuliana Cosma
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely loved it and i think it was the most entertaining clue finding trail ever! There are 2 parts to the maze- we definitely loved the 2nd part finding the animal houses. I am really bad at orienteering- especially in a field of corn where everything looks the same. But we tried the first half without map- 2h later took a break had lunch in cafe and returned to find more clues and 2nd trail. Cafe had amazing fresh cut chips- clean and spacious. There are also animals to feed - great for the little ones and even a slip and slide (extra fee) but it was cold and rainy on the day we visited so didn't have a go at that. A great day to be spent with family outdoor and you could get a family of 4 for Â£38. i will definitely return for the Haloween one

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Wood
recent_reviews.text: The maze was fun and not so long that the children get bored, food and drinks available at the cafe and a few photo opportunities too. Cheap food for feeding farm animals which the kids loved. Most the pumpkins at the patch were smashed or mouldy and we went the week before Halloween which was disappointing but we did still have a few to choose from and use!

recent_reviews.author: Jade Tsang
recent_reviews.text: Lovely day out. Can stroll the dog there.  Plenty to see.  This month was sun flowers field and strawberry picking.  We went in August.  Quite big indoor supermarket with great food choices and lots of freshly bake goods.

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Sullivan
recent_reviews.text: Fast EV CCS charger! With lots more coming soon too! Enterance is wheelchair accessible, with blue badge parking areas, but it doesn't look at the toilets. Lovely place, lots of choice for a farm shop. Plenty of teddies, toys, mugs, plant pots, and homeware, too, most (if not all), are eco conscious products. It was quite expensive, but it didn't stop me from buying afew bits while charging the car. No dogs (accept assistance dogs) in the shop or restaurant, but there's another area for "muddy boots and waggy tails" at the side. That section wasnt open at 5:30pm, but the grassy area with a play area and picknick benches looked lovely!We just missed a goat giving birth afew hours before, and could see them in the field by the car park. It's worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: A K
recent_reviews.text: Amazing place to visit, you can spend a few hours here just looking around and eating at the restaurant. All day breakfast was delicious, good sized portions and great gluten free options too. Lovely helpful and accommodating staff. Huge shop selling fresh produce made on the premises. Highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Paula Macleod
recent_reviews.text:
Visited the tulip fest.
What a glorious sight. Truly breathtaking displays.
Lots of families and very well behaved dogs made for a great atmosphere.
The tulips were spectacular and a trip to the Farm shop to take home a few goodies was the icing on the cake.
Will definitely be going back for some of their other events.

pumpkin_patches.address: Strawberry Fields Farm Shop, Lifton PL16 0DH

recent_reviews.author: Les Parnell
recent_reviews.text: Had a nice baked potato with tuna and salad in the cafe here. Very nice food delivered to our table very quickly. Will eat here again on our next visits to Heligan for certain. Highly recommend both the cafe and farm shop.

recent_reviews.author: JimiMac
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little farm shop with deli counter and butchers, and 1 hour free parking for customers. Deli had a nice selection of pies and salads, and a small but decent selection of local cheeses. Didn't buy anything from the butchers but had a good selection of meats and some pre marinated selections too. Looked very tasty! Prices for some of the items on the shelves is a little too expensive but this is to be expected in a place like this. There is a cafe to the left that serves the same items from the deli at inflated prices but seemed popular, and the pies we had from the deli were very nice. Would go back again if visiting the gardens

recent_reviews.author: Gavin Hodge
recent_reviews.text: Love this place!! Consistent wide range of fresh, top quality meat, veg and associated produce plus an excellent deli and cafe. Mostly reared on farm itself or from locally sourced suppliers so I know I'm supporting a sustainable,  ethical local business that respects both animals and the environment. All staff are friendly, well trained, with an in depth knowledge of their range and can even offer cooking tips if needed? I can ask for anything to be cut to the size I want, never a problem. I have n't bought supermarket meat for over 5 years, it's fresh, it's local and full of flavour. Looking forward to spring lamb joint for Easter!!

recent_reviews.author: YourEverydaySam !
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely little farm shop and cafe, unfortunately our breakfast was so yummy we couldn't get a picture! Affordable and good quality! Also spending over Â£10 gets you free parking making it even more necessary to stop in before visiting the Lost Gardens!
Would come again :)

pumpkin_patches.address: Heligan, B3273, Pentewan, Saint Austell PL26 6EN

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Naxton-Kiddle
recent_reviews.text: Been here a few times now, when I visit the area. This is a lovely farm shop, offering gifts and food items.  The food and drink from the restaurant is very nice. They offer tables inside and out. Lovely play area and animals. Plenty of parking.

recent_reviews.author: Emma Binning
recent_reviews.text:
Really lovely place. The cream tea was amazing, the jam is made with their own strawberries. We also had cheesy chips and cheesy garlic bread, both were delicious. My son had a brownie and we bought treacle tart and Bakewell tart to take home - canâ€™t wait to try them.
The shop is well stocked and there is a lovely outside space with a childrenâ€™s park and zip wire. There are also animals - we saw emuâ€™s, alpacas, sheep, goats and rabbits. The view is spectacular.
We were lucky enough to visit while the sunflowers were in bloom - they do 50p a stem, pick your own. They are such a stunning sight.

recent_reviews.author: Katie Tonkin
recent_reviews.text:
Had a great visit with my family.
Lovely cafe area & shop.
Great outdoor space for the kids to enjoy.

recent_reviews.author: Alan Morgan
recent_reviews.text: Excellent farm shop and restaurant set in well-kept grounds with beautiful views. Inside and outside seating with a real feeling of space. Fun play areas for children plus lots of animals to get close to. Very good restaurant food and selection of fresh produce plus some unique gifts. Friendly and helpful staff and easy parking, well worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Ashley
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic day out for the family with lots to see and do! The tractor tour was fantastic, the cider tasting (naturally) was very enjoyable.

Kids can pet animals, learn history and sample some delicious Cornish scones and ice cream

recent_reviews.author: Natalie Day
recent_reviews.text:
Our second visit and it was just as great as the first. Very relaxed, clean with friendly staff . Take things at your own pace,  we did the tour and tractor ride this time and the kids loved it. Having a spot the animal activity on the ride was a great touch.

The kids also loved being able to get involved with the tasting on the tour.

And of course we had to take some jams, drinks and souvenirs home too.

recent_reviews.author: Rick Marsden
recent_reviews.text: Nice little trip out. There are a few optional experiences to pay for: tractor rides, factory tours, tasting, car museum. All great stuff and worth doing, however if you just want to visit the shop, the restaurant/cafe and look round the small farm then it's free entry. We enjoyed our trip and the cream tea was really nice and was great value.

recent_reviews.author: Olly Heyes
recent_reviews.text:
We had such a wonderful time at Healeyâ€™s Cyder Farm! The tour was fascinating and gave us a real behind-the-scenes look at the cyder-making process, as well as the history of the farm. Walking around the grounds was a treat, especially with the beautiful peacocks roaming freely â€” such a unique and peaceful setting.

The highlight for us was the jam and cyder tasting, and thatâ€™s where Lucy truly made the experience shine. She was friendly, knowledgeable, and made everyone feel welcome. Her passion for the products really came through, and she guided us through the tasting with warmth and enthusiasm. Every jam was delicious (we couldnâ€™t pick a favorite!), and the cyders were outstanding â€” each one with its own unique flavor and character.

Lucyâ€™s hospitality elevated the whole experience and made the tasting feel personal and memorable.

recent_reviews.author: Terri Smith
recent_reviews.text: Lovely fresh salad bags and veg. Straight from the ground to plate in 1 day. You can definitely taste the difference.

recent_reviews.author: Carol Menhenick
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely a brilliant day out from start to finish arrived 11.30am and left 4pm. The pumpkin picking so much fun my grandsons loved it and so reasonably priced. Plenty of things to entertain the children and the food from Rockbox so good and the coffee. Can't wait for next time.

recent_reviews.author: Natasha Baldwin
recent_reviews.text: A great fun day out for all the family. A fantastic selection of different types and colour pumpkins. All good value. The fresh veg also grown on the farm was delicious and the Rose Farm pulled pork at the patch was beautiful.

recent_reviews.author: Dan alex
recent_reviews.text: Great place for kid's with pumpkin patch, but the rockbox food prices are a joke. Almost Â£13 for a buger. It a quick bite to eat, not a sit down restaurant.

recent_reviews.author: Alison & Graeme Moore
recent_reviews.text: Very good selection of pumpkins at a excellent price, can make a family day out, with good food on site. With the opportunity of buying lovely fresh veg.

recent_reviews.author: Driver Gary
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic view' working farm very helpful farmers delivery driver thank you

recent_reviews.author: Harry Polkinghorne
recent_reviews.text: Matt Lyne milks PCs more than cows

recent_reviews.author: Vince Andrews
recent_reviews.text: Best holiday accommodation I have come across with easy access to one of Cornwalls hidden gems of a beach

recent_reviews.author: John
recent_reviews.text: Another GREAT  place to stay well priced and really clean .

recent_reviews.author: William
recent_reviews.text: Great eating place, their own produce on the plate, friendly staff and great portions. Great farm shop on site.

recent_reviews.author: Craig Denny
recent_reviews.text: Wow wow wow. 30 years since I was last here, so not really a regular. But the next generation are doing a fantastic job of supplying great service, wonderful mains and low calorie low cholesterol and low fat desserts. Ok maybe not quite diet friendly but truly scrumptious and a real delight to be back after such a long break and find Trevaskis going from strength to strength. Keep it up and hope to be back sooner next time.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Tomblin
recent_reviews.text: Loved this place. Want to go back. Found my cornish tatos and my hubby was happy with his cornish milk. Cheap enough place. Plenty of car parking and opens till late.

recent_reviews.author: Kat Cole
recent_reviews.text: Visited yesterday. Had an absolutely amazing lunch. Will definitely be back. Loved it!

pumpkin_patches.address: Trevaskis Farm Restaurant, Gwinear Rd, Connor Downs, Hayle TR27 5JQ

recent_reviews.author: Rohit Dhaliwal
recent_reviews.text: Was in the area with family so decided to visit. Lovely patch, sandy soil (so no mud), great pumpkins and plenty of photo opportunities. Visited on 25/10, young farmer was very friendly and polite.

recent_reviews.author: Paula Obrien
recent_reviews.text: Friendly helpful staff made this a enjoyable family experience. Lots of pumpkins. loved the hidden props you find whilst exploring . Lots of fantastic photos opportunities.  The best one Iâ€™ve ever visited .

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Smeaton Farm Luxury Bed and Breakfast

recent_reviews.author: Mandie B
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely, spacious and comfortable room perfect for staying as a family  and the  farmhouse breakfasts are amazing!
We stayed as a family, 2 adults and one teen in the Wisteria room which was lovely & spacious for 3 of us.  We found Richard and Sarah to be very friendly and welcoming, nothing was too much trouble - from recommendations for places to go and finding us some board games one afternoon when the weather was horrendous. The breakfasts were amazing, fabulous quality and choice and truly set us up for the day. Our daughter was so pleased to be able to feed the lambs, donkeys and alpacas - it made her stay a memorable one. A rural location but very  easy to get to get to the coast, the moors, National Trust properties and lovely walks along the river at Calstock.

recent_reviews.author: Martin Davis
recent_reviews.text: We came to Smeaton Farm for a couple of nights away, and what a wonderful time we had. We really wanted to escape the city into the countryside. The views and the countryside were totally relaxing. Richard served brilliant English breakfast. We have already booked to come back!

recent_reviews.author: Harriet Jones
recent_reviews.text: What a gem! We spent a few weeks travelling in the UK and this was by far the best b&b we stayed in. Richard and Sarah were so accommodating, and the food was incredible. Sarah even made us a G&T to have in the garden which was extra special. We hope we can return one day!

recent_reviews.author: M B
recent_reviews.text:
SMEATON FARM DO NOT DELIVER WHAT THEY PROMISE

THE GOOD.
The farm itself was in a stunning location, and although the room was tired and needed updating, it was extremely clean and replenished daily with clean towels - tea/coffee facilities etc. And the breakfast was fantastic.
We had pre ordered dinner for 3 nights a week before arrival, to make sure my wifeâ€™s diabetic needs for wholesome farm food was catered for, due to AA DinnerAward with extensive menu advertised @ Smeaton (photo).
THE BAD
Although not their fault, they do not pre warn you about the narrow roads leading to their farm, with brambles & thick foliage, as we had a brand new Audi  Q7, large & particularly high value, the car is as wide as the roads (photo). You are in trouble with oncoming cars, and definitely a NO NO to go out at night or travel to find this place in the dark.
THE UGLY.
As we said, we had pre booked dinner.
For the first night, we were told pork would be served , so no choice, charging Â£30 pp- offering us the cheapest meat they could get away with on their menu, for more profit. We were agreeable, so as not to cause a fuss.
The second night  they had already informed us that they were off to a farm show, so no Dinner served, and we were directed to a local pub. this  they do on a regular basis (reviews) . And once again had no choice, but to agree.
On the 3rd night too we were told No Show for Dinner, leaving us in a predicament to try and find somewhere to eat in the afternoon, as we knew we could not venture out at night, leaving my wife vulnerable @ eating snacks we had carried.
We were only told about No Dinner once we had paid up, otherwise we would have not booked this place.
Whilst we were there, I emailed the owner to inform him that, the pubâ€™s around the area, were not suitable for my wife  and that we were struggling to find healthy food,  giving him the opportunity to redeem himself, but nothing phased him , instead directing us to a Michelin Restaurant which was condensing, as all we wanted was something healthy to eat as advertised by them.
We were not even offered a sandwich, which we would have paid for, or use of their kitchen facilities or fridge to store any food we may have purchased from outside.
The lack of Empathy and Care was shocking to say the least -see other negative reviews) as it clearly shows they have treated other guests badly going back years.
Our issue is: Stop enticing people into staying with you, using your AA Dinner Award and packed picnic , (photo) which you cannot be bothered to serve and proudly advertising it at your front door. Menu simply there to capture our interest.
Reviews (excerpts) from other guests:
The only thing that let us down, was the reception on arrival. I was greeted with no smile, and when asked about evening meal, i was directed to the local pub, despite the website advertising food..

We were not treated with a friendly smile . Worst place we have ever stayed for service.

Rest of the family rude.they never smiled, served us looking grumpy & clearly do not enjoy running the B & B .

And it goes on & on, other guests having similar experience as ourselves. Once money taken, they make you uncomfortable enough, that you want to leave as soon as possible. We did not have to be asked twice. We were out of that door first thing in the morning.

Since this review on Trip Advisor,  Owner Richard, has answered us back in a private email  calling us Liarâ€™s & the rest, knowing full well we had no right of reply on TA & threatening us with Litigation for simply giving an honest constructive review. He was quite happy to take the good part of our review but totally unable to handle the rest. At no time did he address, any of our concerns, simply stating that it would affect his business. If ours was the only bad review, we could simply put it down to the fact he was having a bad day. But this seems to be the norm for Smeaton Farm. Let us assure you, that you will not get a warm welcome at Smeaton farm, once your credit card details have been taken. Worst place we have ever stayed.

recent_reviews.author: ashley metcalfe
recent_reviews.text:
Sensational dining venue for couples or families and absolutely NOT limited to weddings / events.
I think of it like Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstallâ€™s farm-to-plate River Cottage Restaurant; they  raise their own cattle, grow their own vegetables & fruit, produce their own charcoal for cooking and make all their own products.
The menu is set but it was fantastic and they went an extra mile for my gluten free child.
I noticed afterwards there was no salt or pepper pots on any table; it is simply not needed because the meal is already perfection.
The vegetable plots, piggery and immediate grounds around the farm can be walked around and are lovely to walk around and great for keeping young kids occupied.
I canâ€™t return soon enough

recent_reviews.author: Jake Timms Photography
recent_reviews.text: What a beautiful wedding venue I had the opportunity to photograph at in April. The rustic charm of the barns, surrounded by wonderful Cornish countryside, creates the perfect backdrop for creating amazing memories. The team at Nancarrow is always warm, attentive, and genuinely passionate about making each coupleâ€™s day unforgettable. As a wedding photographer, I love how the natural light flows through the beautiful barn spaces, and the outdoor areas offer endless possibilities for stunning portraits. If youâ€™re dreaming of a relaxed, countryside wedding filled with character, Nancarrow Farm is a truly magical choice.

recent_reviews.author: Rachel
recent_reviews.text: A wonderful venue for an autumn wedding.  As soon as I arrived I was under the spell.  The staff were welcoming and I felt so relaxed.  The farm is in a beautiful spot and there is careful, thoughtful decor at every turn.  The  food is incredible!  The front of house team work together so well and everything runs so smoothly for the big day. Jobs get done without you noticing.  The team behind the scenes must very work hard and are to be much appreciated.  Iâ€™m sure theyâ€™re all Cornish Pixies!  One of the most special days for me and so many thanks to everyone at Nancarrow.  It simply a wonderful place which creates the most magical of memories.

recent_reviews.author: Noam Sarfati
recent_reviews.text: The best farm-to-table place in Cornwall! We loved it! The atmosphere, the surroundings, the great service,  and of course the fooddddd!!!!

recent_reviews.author: Nina H
recent_reviews.text:
A truly magical visit to Pennywall Farm!
We absolutely loved our time here and honestly donâ€™t know where to startâ€”it was just amazing. Spending time with the animals, feeding and cuddling them, was so refreshing not only for the kids but for us as parents too. My husband definitely enjoyed dance with piggy mascot as well as our kids did.

The atmosphere is incredibly warm and welcoming. Everyone we met was kind and helpful. A special mention to Chris, the ownerâ€”we think heâ€™s retired nowâ€”but he still shares stories about the farm with such pride and joy. He was genuinely inspiring.

Even though the farm was busy, there were no queues for anything, which made the whole experience relaxed and enjoyable.

Highly recommend this place for families with children, and honestly, for any adults who just want to reconnect with animals and nature. You can really take your time hereâ€”stroke, feed, cuddleâ€”itâ€™s just such a wholesome, lovely experience. Weâ€™ll definitely be back!

recent_reviews.author: Aggz Waywell
recent_reviews.text:
I took my 18 month old daughter to pennywell farm and she absolutely loved it. There's activities every 30 minutes, favourites of my daughters were the bottle feeding of baby goats and the goat walking.

There are lots of animals to walk around and meet, and you can buy some animal feed and can feed certain animals too. They are all clearly sign posted which animals you can and can't feed. My daughter loved feeding the sheep and goats, and meeting the ponies in their paddocks. The little train ride was good fun too!

There are plenty of play areas, including indoor bouncy castles and a toddler area outside. Both were a hit with my daughter. The bubble and bop area was really good fun too. There's another big outdoor play area, but that's for older children, but it looked really good and I will definitely bring my daughter back when she's bigger.

The staff were all really friendly.

We had a hot chocolate and sandwich from one of the cafes whilst we were there. They were a bit expensive, but that's expected at places like this.

recent_reviews.author: Wendy Peskett
recent_reviews.text:
This was a fantastic day out from start to finish. I suggest booking online as they are really busy at peak times.
There is a large barn where children can cuddle all sorts of animals: mice, rabbits, baby goats and miniature pigs. You have plenty of time in there and can return later in the day. You can bring your own blanket or buy a small one at the farm entrance for Â£3.

So many activities, see the photo showing then all. Pig racing was really fun to watch.

There's a tractor ride, a small train, pond dipping , go karts and so much more.

Highly recommend this place.

The goat feeding was funny to see as the children all line up around an enclosure fencing with the bottles ready and the goats are let out to excitedly find a bottle to feed from.

You can buy animal food to feed the alpaca, deer, goats etc.

Plenty of food stalls with a good range of food and drinks. Not too bad prices for an attraction. There is a fire pit so you can buy marshmallows on sticks to toast there.

There is free mini golf to play, nice climbing structures and a maze too. Make sure to go for the whole day as you need it to do everything.

We got a discount code that allowed us to visit again within a week.

recent_reviews.author: Megan Rose
recent_reviews.text: We just had the most amazing day at Pennywell Farm. Thereâ€™s no shortage of exciting activities to do. Our favourite experience had to be having cuddles with the animals! The team were incredibly helpful and enthusiastic and really contributed to our overall enjoyment during the day. Especially Lucy, who was super friendly and helpful, and amazing with the kids, and clearly has a love for all the animals- she went above and beyond throughout the entire day. As well as Evie who was in the pet cuddling area, she was attentive and friendly. Always prepared to ensure that everyone was happy and had a fair experience with the animals!

pumpkin_patches.address: Hillhead Farm Barn, Hillhead Rd, Falmouth TR11 5PE

recent_reviews.author: Joan Thomas
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant

pumpkin_patches.address: Burngullow Ln, High Street, Saint Austell PL26 7TQ

recent_reviews.author: Louise Trevelyan
recent_reviews.text:
Really lovely place, friendly people and raising money for a good cause. The sunflowers are amazing and really brightened up a rainy day - great facts to read as you walk round. NB wear old shoes or wellies if itâ€™s raining- the clay mud was orange and stuck fast!
Highly recommend

recent_reviews.author: Susan Dugmore (Sue)
recent_reviews.text: My granddaughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the Sunflower Maze. A lovely gentle stroll, interesting sunflower facts and little ceramic animals to find. We bought a couple of beautiful bunches of sunflowers to take home with us to brighten up our home...sunflowers always bring a smile to my face. Now looking forward to the Pumpkin Patch come October ğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: Matthew Chard
recent_reviews.text:
What an incredibly wonderful place this is, other than the fact it's quite magical, and walking around the sunflowers  seeing hundreds of bees actively collecting pollen, it is magical, it's well organised, welcoming, friendly and superbly organised. The tea and cake were delicious too.
We are so lucky to have these things on our doorstep, these are exactly the things we should be supporting.
Thank you, a wonderful afternoon out ğŸŒ»

recent_reviews.author: david mathews
recent_reviews.text: This is a well worth visit. Entrance fee is cheap and monies go to a worthwhile local charity, Little Harbour. I really enjoyed walking through the field of sunflowers. Every so often as you wind your way through tall sunflowers, signs saying Did you knowâ€¦..teach about the value of growing and  using parts of the sunflower. It is excellent value for money and I highly recommend it

pumpkin_patches.address: Higher Tregorrick Farm, Saint Austell PL26 7AG

recent_reviews.author: kyle laskey
recent_reviews.text:
A great way to spend a couple of hours, so many birds to look at as well as couple of other animals like red pandas and donkeys, plenty to keep kids entertained with various play areas.
Each member of staff we spoke to were either highly knowledgeable or very happy and easy to speak to. On the entry desk was a woman I think called Angie (I may be wrong) but she was incredibly happy and very funny. I'd highly recommend for any animal/ bird lovers or families with small kids

recent_reviews.author: White c
recent_reviews.text: What a sweet afternoon out at paradise park, we took advantage of the online offer and the journey was easy to get to by car with lots of signs.The staff were friendly at reception and my children were really excited throughout the afternoon.  The atmosphere was calm and we didnâ€™t feel rushed. We went on a busy day in August, even though the shows  had lots of spectators, the park seemed spacious for everyone and this did not distract from our day. The range of birds were magnificent and we especially loved the Red pandas. The keepers were very knowledgeable and you could see that the enclosures were clean and the animals were calm.  The play barn slides were a huge hit and great to cool off. There was a great range of toilets and open pathways for disabled access or pushchairs. We really enjoyed our visit and I would recommend visiting.

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Lowth Lowth
recent_reviews.text:
Really good. Thought it would be an hour walk around and a little boaring ,but was pleasantly surprised.
Was there for around 3/4 hours.
The birds of prey show was really impressive and very informative. The kids didn't t moan they got board whilst we were there either, which they usually do so it must of been good.
Cafe was a bit steep so we went to eat somewhere else but the whole experience was amazing. Would definitely go again. ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Anna Z
recent_reviews.text:
We had a fantastic time at Paradise Park! Itâ€™s a brilliant place for a family day out, with so much to see and do for all ages. The variety of birds and animals is impressive, and the park is beautifully maintained.

The indoor play area was a big hit with the kids, and the staff were friendly and helpful throughout our visit. Educational, entertaining, and full of charm â€” Paradise Park is a must-visit if you're in the area. Weâ€™ll definitely be coming back!

recent_reviews.author: Tom Green
recent_reviews.text:
Making Memories at Trevathan Farm Cottagesâ€”Again and Again
Our recent two-week stay at Trevathan Farm Cottages was, once again, nothing short of perfection. This was our fourth visit to this truly special place, and it speaks volumes that weâ€™re already planning our return.
Trevathan Farm Cottages has a unique charm that keeps families coming back year after year, and indeed, generation after generation. Itâ€™s a testament to the warmth and quality of this establishment that almost everyone you speak to here has been visiting for many years â€“ some even for over two decades! This sense of community and shared love for Trevathan truly adds to the welcoming atmosphere.
One of the absolute highlights for us and our children are the morning tractor rides. They offer a fantastic, hands-on opportunity to witness a working farm in action. Whether youâ€™re keen to get stuck in and experience farm life firsthand, or simply wish to sit back and soak in the breathtaking views of the surrounding countryside, these rides are an unforgettable experience.
Beyond the organised activities, the genuine welcome extends to every corner of the farm. Our walks around the beautiful grounds were always made even more joyful by the company of the friendly family dogs, who love to join in and truly make you feel at home.
To the entire family and all the dedicated staff at Trevathan Farm Cottages, thank you.

recent_reviews.author: James McBride
recent_reviews.text: We have stayed on the farm several times and always thoroughly enjoy it. Everyone, including the dogs, is very friendly and helpful. Thereâ€™s a morning tractor ride which the children love. A great place to visit and enjoy the fresh air and quiet surroundings

recent_reviews.author: Tracy Preston
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant week. Loved the morning rounds with farmer Mark. There is such a lovely atmosphere on the farm. Very relaxed. Lovely farm shop. Cottages are well equipped with great views of countryside. Lovely friendly farm dogs (even a litter of lab and spaniel puppies). I donâ€™t think it will be long until we come back again. Thanks to you all!

recent_reviews.author: Camilla Leggett
recent_reviews.text: Just finished a week here with my husband and 1 yr old and we are already planning when we can come back! We stayed in Bramble cottage which is perfect for a small family and has an amazing view and huge lawn. We all loved the morning tractor ride and tour of the farm and the playground on site was great. Everyone is very friendly (including the gorgeous dogs) and happy to help. Thank you so much!!!

recent_reviews.author: Phil Oldfield
recent_reviews.text: We had a great day out here. Very well kept, the animals were looked after, the maze was fantastic and lots of fun. Plenty to do. I was a little worried my 3 year old might not have much to play on but I was wrong, there's plenty of play for him and feeding animals. My older boy, 9, had a whale of a time on the slides as well, and we all loved the mazes. It was a really hot day and I'm the maze we felt like it was abroad due to the unusual tall corn field surroundings, felt great.

recent_reviews.author: Rani sawant
recent_reviews.text: Amazing experience. Worth the visit. Plenty of activities for kids. A day filled with fun and scenic views. Cafe on site, toilets and free parking. Farm shop has fresh eggs and lots of useful toys and stuff for kids. I highly recommend. Animal patting was my kids favourite

recent_reviews.author: R R
recent_reviews.text: Just went for the first time today. Wasn't expecting much but to my surprise it was a whole lot more than just a farm! They also had go karts bouncy castles and big slade type slides! My favourite was the tractor ride  the queue was a bit lengthy but it was so worth it! Beautiful scenery absolutely love this place! Staff were really nice and friendly. The only little downside were the sinks, which had really hot water in some places after you fed animals etc. Overall it was a brilliant 3 hours spent and i would definitely love to come back again!

recent_reviews.author: Hannah Dervisoglu
recent_reviews.text: Had the absolute time of our lives here in the may bank holiday. Me and my son were sharing our birthday and had so much fun. So many things to do. Lots of parking available, toilets, cafe and hand washing facilities and let's not forget the delicious ice cream shop. Outstanding value for money. All ages will enjoy this we went as a group and had age 2 as our youngest and age 80 as our oldest member and it put a smile on everyones face. We will for sure be back !

recent_reviews.author: Mike Naylor
recent_reviews.text: Happy to be yan of Santa Mawsons laal helpers !!

recent_reviews.author: Lorraine Harvey
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic choice of trees, lovely staff and at a great price too!

recent_reviews.author: Garyth Orton
recent_reviews.text: Great range of Xmas trees to view. Staff were really helpful and showed us a range of trees of different shapes, sizes and prices. The staff weren't pushy and they were very patient.

recent_reviews.author: Steve Benson
recent_reviews.text: Best Xmas trees and service around, I don't go anywhere else.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Low Sizergh Barn Farm Shop & CafÃ©

recent_reviews.author: Z Rose
recent_reviews.text: A great place to stop for food before reaching the lakes. I loved the shop and the farm food shop, everything was locally sourced and it looked great. The cafe was also lovely. The food had good generous portions - although the potatoes were very greasy and the coffee tasted burnt (perhaps the oat milk?) good toilets too.

recent_reviews.author: Mark Deadman
recent_reviews.text:
Pulled in here looking for some dinner options on the back of a Kendal shopping trip. The chilled counter was well stocked with all the usual suspects (pies, cheeses etc) and with a good selection of veggies available too. The rest of the shop was filled with everything you would expect from a good farm shop.
Upstairs for more crafts, gifts and a cafe rounded this one out nicely.
Plenty of free parking available on site.

recent_reviews.author: Mona PatzfuÃŸ
recent_reviews.text:
Went here on Thursday based on the great reviews, but it didnâ€™t quite live up to my hopes.

Let's start positive:
You have the unique opportunity to see where the cows are milked, and you can purchase raw milk right outside. There are also the absolute cutest little lambs nearby. Parking is easy, and thereâ€™s a lovely little nature walk to enjoy as well.

To the cafÃ©:
The staff werenâ€™t very attentiveâ€”more focused on chatting with each other, and I had to wait for them to finish their conversation before I could place my order. It wasnâ€™t a huge deal, but it did feel a bit like I was intruding.

The menu on our table was really worn and outdated. I ordered the cinnamon and apple pancakes, only to be told theyâ€™re not available anymore. I went with the berry pancakes instead. When I checked a different menu it indeed didnâ€™t list the apple option so my menu on the table was just old â€” this just felt like a lack of attention to detail.

As for the food, the berries were clearly defrosted (very cold and unsweetened), and the pancakes were also cold and a bit dry, even with the cream and berries. Not awful, just a letdown for almost Â£10.

Overall, the experience was just â€œnot that great.â€ That said, lots of others seem to have had a better time here, so maybe I just caught it on an off day.

recent_reviews.author: Paul Fearn
recent_reviews.text:
Great place to visit and also to stay overnight.
Stayed for 1 night with a campervan and enjoyed great food at the cafe whilst watching the cows being milked and also did the local walk which was very well sign posted.
Sizergh castle and Stricklands Arms pub are within easy walking distance too.

pumpkin_patches.address: Low Sizergh Farm, Sizergh, Kendal LA8 8AE

recent_reviews.author: Jax Wilson
recent_reviews.text: Loved it! So many pumpkins, all shapes, sizes and colours! Great for kids.. we didn't realise but you can also take dogs which will make it even better for us next year!

recent_reviews.author: Tracy Wells
recent_reviews.text: We did an amazing photoshoot here with my handmade porcelain headdress x Lovely place, lovely owners x

recent_reviews.author: Carollynn Porter
recent_reviews.text:
Just been last week with my daughter and grandkids.
Good afternoon out. Great for kids to learn where pumpkins come from & can pick their own. A farm style park for all the kids to let off steam.
Pumpkins are a little more expensive than supermarkets, but it's a fun time for kids.
A cafe sells cakes, snacks, hot & cold drinks and freshly baked to order pizza this year...

recent_reviews.author: Richard
recent_reviews.text: Free if you book online in advance. We didn't know this, so we were stung for Â£8 just to walk into a field to pick a pumpkin that we had to pay for anyway. It's absolutely ridiculous. The woman said, 'we have to charge if you haven't booked. Otherwise, it gets too busy.' How does that even make sense? The pumpkins are way more expensive than you would pay in a supermarket too. That said, I'd have gone year in year out with the kids as a family  tradition, but I won't ever go again due to the greed of charging if you haven't booked. When she said that it was advertised on Facebook, I said I don't use social media, and her reply was, 'Well, that's just the way of the world these days'. Shameful.

recent_reviews.author: KL
recent_reviews.text:
Terrible experience here, no closing times were given to us at all and as we were heading back to the tent at 5pm with the pumpkins we had picked, we noticed that the tent was all closed up, then we heard an extremely rude lady shouting at us to say they were closed and to hurry up inside the tent to pay for the pumpkins, she then told us that 3 x very small pumpkins would be Â£26, she then went on to say we would have to carry the pumpkins back to the car in a carrier bag as she wouldn't allow us to use a wheel barrow to get them back to the car!!
I think this place is an absolute rip off, to start there were hardly any pumpkins left and the pumpkins that we did find were absolutely overpriced at Â£26 for 3 x very small pumpkins!! I definitely think they need to notify customers of the time they close! I will not be recommending this place to anyone! It is not worth your time or money!

recent_reviews.author: Emma Stephenson
recent_reviews.text: Just got back from a fantastic day here, kids had a wonderful time, great seating area with lovely decorations, pizza was delicious, excellent choice of snacks and drinks!

recent_reviews.author: Jo Brown
recent_reviews.text: Great day out, great value for money. Staff friendly and helpful and yummy pizza ğŸ¥°

recent_reviews.author: Jen Brook
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant day, super helpful and friendly staff! Highly recommend, we will be back, thank you :)

pumpkin_patches.address: Page Bank Ln, Rampside Rd, Roose, Barrow-in-Furness LA13 0QR

recent_reviews.author: Diff-Ability CIC
recent_reviews.text:
Reds Pumpkin Patch.

Annual pumpkin patch, Langwathby.

Parking at farm.

Wear wellies as entrance can be muddy.

2024, there were alpacas & a maize maze.  The pumpkins are priced per weight at a reasonable cost.  This was lots of fun for the family.

There were snacks etc available to buy.

Porta loo available.

recent_reviews.author: Helen B
recent_reviews.text: Awesome day out! Free entry, free parking , plenty of food and drink choices from wood fired pizza to pumpkin spiced hot chocolate! 1000s of pumpkins all shapes, sizes and colours and extremely reasonable prices! Dog friendly too. We had a great few hours at the farm. Would highly recommend !

recent_reviews.author: Izzy Creative247
recent_reviews.text:
Very kind and friendly staff with an incredible location and lots of variety.

Fun for all ages, nice day out spot on route somewhere else.

They accept cash and card. Parking was in grass so bare that in mind if bad weather.

They offer wheelbarrows.

recent_reviews.author: Marc
recent_reviews.text: Great fun. Friendly people, easy to find, lots of parking available and a great selection of well grown pumpkins. COVID aware also.

recent_reviews.author: Symon Bacon
recent_reviews.text: Everything was great and dog friendly too! (Take wellies)

pumpkin_patches.address: Shirley Hall Farm, Derby Ln, Shirley, Ashbourne DE6 3AT

recent_reviews.author: Idony B-H
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful morning in the sunshine here today! We got to pick our own carrots, which we will enjoy on our Sunday dinner tomorrow. They also have potatoes and betroot to pick fresh from the field. The children enjoyed the maize and finding the golden acorn/pumpkin to win some yummy sweeties. Will be going back again next weekend for some more before Halloween! Lovely local place to support :)

recent_reviews.author: Pepper Onigiri
recent_reviews.text:
Wish I had taken my little Niece with me, she would have loved it as there is lots for kids to do, including their own little wheelbarrows.

Pumpkins ranged from Â£1.50 for small to different prices and then Â£8 for the big ones. There was so many pumpkins I was really surprised considering there is just over a week until Halloween (maybe they just opened?)

You can also buy potatoes (you can pick them yourselves - Â£3 for a bucket full), beetroots and other stuff too which was cool to see.

There is a stand for sausages and burgers.

I imagine you could spend a couple of hours here with kids, we spent a good 40 minutes and it was really nice.

Make sure to take wellies!! It is very very muddy especially between the car park and the entrance way, around the pumpkins themselves it isn't too bad regarding mud.

recent_reviews.author: Beth Collier
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic selection, lots to see and do for all ages. Fairly priced and loved being able to grab a sausage cob and hot chocolate ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

recent_reviews.author: Angelina Brassington
recent_reviews.text: Great day out, we got potatoes, ğŸƒ  and had lots of fun.

recent_reviews.author: Hayley Boland
recent_reviews.text:
We had so much fun pumpkin picking. Everything was so well organized. Parking was stress free & it was easy to grab our own wheel barrow. There was a huge selection of pumpkins & several cute props for photos.

There was very affordable hot drinks, sausage rolls & pumpkin soup to purchase with benches to sit on too.

No dogs are allowed which I was happy about for hygiene reasons.

It was easy to pay for our pumpkins & card was accepted.

We had such a wonderful experience, the atmosphere was lovely & the views were beautiful.

recent_reviews.author: Alison Irvine
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing day, staff are so friendly well organised parking which makes life easier. You have every type of pumpkin known to man to choose from. I love Halloween, any type of season. This has to be my favourite find for pumpkin picking. My little boy was overloaded with excitement. Please support this business they deserve it. Everyone who was at the farm, they were happy.
laughter and fun. Thank you Devon Pumpkin Picking ğŸƒğŸƒğŸƒğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Lara Hickman
recent_reviews.text: 3rd year in a row coming to the pumpkin patch and i'm never dissapointed. Always friendly and helpful staff and so many varieties of pumpkins to choose from. Always so impressed and happy to contribute to a local farm. Thank you! ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Graham Kidd
recent_reviews.text: Easy parking, grab a wheelbarrow and go find! 1000's of pumpkins of different types/shapes and sizes, loads of fun with a 4 year old in tow, thanks and look forward to next year.

pumpkin_patches.address: Stoneford Farm, Bickington, Newton Abbot TQ12 6LH

recent_reviews.author: mitch tunicliffe
recent_reviews.text: Loved the pumpkin picking, it was my first time going.  There were so many different types.  We picked up a blue one and a pink  coloured one (porcelain lady as we found out) as well as the normal orange one.  It was a fun afternoon and all I heard was laughing from parts of the field.  The staff were lovely.   There was a lovely little food truck for hot drinks and there were some very clean porter loos.    Definitely will be going next year

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Parrish
recent_reviews.text: Great place, there were lots of pumpkins, friendly staff and good value for money ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Kellie Cornish
recent_reviews.text: A wonderful day out! Fantastic set up, great variety of pumpkins & really friendly staff ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Benji Isaac
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful place

recent_reviews.author: Richard Webb
