recent_reviews.text: Wow! Excellent! We are visiting the area for a few days, so rather than eat out we treated ourselves to some good food from there. The staff are so friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The meat is fantastic (speaking as a former butcher), we will be visiting again for sure! Thank you.

recent_reviews.author: Kate
recent_reviews.text: What a lovely farm shop! We went to do something PYO strawberries and we got so many lovely ones. You can tell they really care about their produce. The price was really good! We managed to get some meet for lunch and breakfast and a bunch of veg and fruit and only paid Â£15 pound! Far better than supermarkets as you know the produce is fresh and good quality! Will be returning again!

recent_reviews.author: Simon Emslie
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely little farm shop with a great selection of veg, drinks and other delights.

What makes it stand out â€” not just from other farm shops but businesses in general â€” are the people who serve there.

Hereâ€™s an example:

One of the first times I ordered from the butcher counter, I asked for two portions of rump steak. With my steaks in hand, I then looked round the rest of the shop. A few minutes later, the lady who served me came up to me and said she wasnâ€™t happy with the steaks she had cut for me. So she took them back and cut me two new pieces. They were slightly larger but she charged me less â€¦ than before.

I asked her why she wanted to offer me different steaks. She said she couldnâ€™t stand the thought of me having a less than perfect steak for dinner.

recent_reviews.author: Masoud Tajamiri
recent_reviews.text: Fairly large farm shop and a cafe shop on the side. We went for a cream tea but unfortunately the clotted cream was not home made and was just a supermarket cream. On the other hand pick your own area was massive with delicious strawberries and raspberries

recent_reviews.author: Ian Fenn
recent_reviews.text: Great farm shop and pick your own site. Currently awash with great strawberries well worth the trip to get better than shop bought  strawberries. Also shop is good with good local produce. Small cafe area, great coffee and cakes, very good breakfast served until 11.45, after that has good selection of meals with smaller portions available for children or smaller appetites. Well worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Treborxps
recent_reviews.text: Loved the pick your own strawberries and raspberries! Really enjoyed it! Could do with some more parking but was a lovely day out! Food in the cafe was lovely as well! Will be back!!

recent_reviews.author: Dan B
recent_reviews.text: Lots of fruit, and a great farm shop. No cheaper than buying fruit at the supermarket, so depends if you see picking as a fun privilege or unpaid labour

recent_reviews.author: Zhandos Zhaxsybayev
recent_reviews.text: The nicest and very excellent farm. Friendly team. Cozy home environment. The owner of the farm is a great guy

pumpkin_patches.address: Hawthorn Gardens, Stockleigh Pomeroy, Crediton EX17 4BH

recent_reviews.author: Elaine Wickwar
recent_reviews.text:
A wonderful farm shop.
Very clean with friendly and helpful staff.
Some prices are a little high but overall a good experience.
Lots of produce available to buy, fresh and frozen.
Some animals in pens for the family to see, with hand washing facilities. Play area, and in the summer we had a maize maze, Â£2.
Huge teepee for shade.
Huge car park.

recent_reviews.author: Edward Bryan
recent_reviews.text: A have to visit establishment. Went for breakfast, which was excellent. Then, I wondered around the shops buying from various counters. The alcohol section had some amazing wines and gins. The meat section had a great array of quality produce. Staff are very friendly and professional. Highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Paul Richardson
recent_reviews.text:
A great selection of fresh food, including pastries, cheeses, meats, vegetables, ice-cream and chocolates.

Plus there is a Tesla Supercharger and a Cotswold Outdoor shop.

I only popped in to pick up a snack and charge my Tesla, but I would definitely visit again.

recent_reviews.author: Gareth Griffiths
recent_reviews.text: Popped in today on our way back to our campsite coming from Sidmouth. What a brilliant selection of produce. I could spend all day looking around and spend a small fortune on the beautiful products. The fresh meat counter helped empty my wallet today. Well, it's worth a visit if you're in the area. The fresh veg is gorgeous ğŸ˜

pumpkin_patches.address: Dart Farm Village, Topsham, Clyst St George, Exeter EX3 0QH

recent_reviews.author: Robert Moody
recent_reviews.text: We just enjoyed meeting Santa at Bincombe bumps. We've been to a few of these across Dorset over the years with our boys but this was on another level. The effort the team put in dispite the awful weather was remarkable. Thank you! A wonderful experience our boys are bursting with Christmas spirit :)

recent_reviews.author: rosie Latham
recent_reviews.text: We came here quite late for pumpkin picking, in the half term. it's free to attend which many places charge. They'd put on stalls for axe throwing and archery which you paid for, but was a lovely touch and we didn't mind paying aa the entrance was free. The Pumpkins are great quality (I still have one in good shape and we went 3 weeks ago). The added barn decorations were super to look around for Halloween and we had toasted marshmallows. was a lovely little visit, well organised with car park attendants.

recent_reviews.author: Faye Boyle
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely few hours spent here. A great thing to do for Halloween and not one sign of a rip off of any sort. Parking & entry were free, the cafe was very reasonably priced and it was very relaxed. A great way to spend some time.

recent_reviews.author: Kirsty Denning
recent_reviews.text: Loved the pumpkin picking, best prices of all the ones we've been to over the years and a great experience!

recent_reviews.author: Vivien Bostock
recent_reviews.text: What's an absolutely stunning place to stay. I stayed last year when I was pregnant and returned recently with my 6 month old. As this hut has electricity, it does mean that you have some of your home comforts. The kitchen is well equipped and the site is lovely. The host, Grace, is contactable and very helpful. She leaves for you a little treat in the kitchen. I will definitely be back again in the future. A firm favourite when I want that little bit of extra comfort.

recent_reviews.author: Courtney Arscott
recent_reviews.text:
We had our wedding a few weeks ago at West Town Farm. We first saw this venue online when searching for a DIY barn type wedding. As soon as we went to view it, we were taken aback by the beautiful views, the huge barn with ample space and the facilities we could use there.  We had our ceremony in the orchard which was simply beautiful, and adding a few hay bales we rented from the farm had the best country feel that we were wishing for!

Grace was amazing from our first meeting, keeping in touch, putting us at ease. We loved how relaxed she made us feel, and it is clear to see how much she loves the farm/barn and her job. She is ace â¤ï¸ on the day of our wedding, Grace was joined by Vicki who is equally lovely. They were such a fab team and kept everything running so smoothly for us!

Our guests stayed in the camping field (making use of the two bell tents on offer, and also bringing their own tents) they had a blast and said the bell tents were so lovely and homely! Myself and my husband (ahhh ğŸ¥°) stayed in the beautiful shepherds hut which to be honest felt like a little retreat! After such a busy day it was so nice to just be us two in this space! It is honestly so beautiful!

We had a DJ which there was so much space for, and also a hog roast for our evening catering. It was the most perfect day, I just wish we could do it all again! We canâ€™t wait to come back to the shepherds hut for our anniversary!

THANK YOU WEST TOWN FARM â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸ you absolutely exceeded all of our expectations and we cannot get over our wonderful wedding day!

You have a special place in our hearts, forever â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: J Taylor
recent_reviews.text:
We had our wedding at West Town Farm and it was magical.

Grace and the team were incredibly flexible and supportive. On the day they worked very very hard to keep things moving smoothly... So much so that the day ran almost perfectly to time :)

recent_reviews.author: Harry West
recent_reviews.text: We hired the Classroom at West Town Farm for a small event and it was absolutely perfect. The team was so friendly, welcoming, and accommodating, they went above and beyond to provide us with good local food, and the farm itself is just stunning. Will definitely be returning to visit the farm shop again!

recent_reviews.author: Oliver Allen
recent_reviews.text: It was a really fun maize maze, with a higher production value than expected, while still having a simplistic charm.

recent_reviews.author: jenny williams
recent_reviews.text:
Such fun at the Maize Maze.
And loved the piggies as an extra way out of the maze.
Extra fun with giant connect four.

recent_reviews.author: Peter Davies
recent_reviews.text: This was a truly wonderful experience for both adults and children. A beautiful setting with flowers and gardens and fascinating talks and interactive sessions. Our daughter loves bees and got to find out more about them, taste honey and get involved with candle rolling and planting seeds. The staff were wonderful from the moment we walked in. From the greeting through to the lovely ladies going through the talks. They went out of their way to make sure we had a great experience. We spent an afternoon on our way back from holiday but could have easily spent a day. We have factored this in for another visit next year.

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Kirtley
recent_reviews.text:
We had a fantastic day at Quince Honey Farmâ€¦it offers something for all ages. The bee demo, candle making, talks and honey tasting (all included in the entrance fee) were highlights. The cafÃ© deserves a special mention too; clean, very reasonably priced, speedy service and legendary cheese scones!

It would have been lovely to see a queen bee during the demo (sadly they didnâ€™t spot one that day) and perhaps a live hive link or glass observation hive would add even more to the experience. We also hoped to try the honeycomb, which wasnâ€™t available. That said, there was still so much to enjoy. Both the indoor play area and the spacious outdoor areas gave the children plenty to do, while the talks and tasting kept the adults engaged.

We visited with ages ranging from 7 to 83, and genuinely everyone found something to enjoy. A tip: plan for either the morning or afternoon session, as the talks run twice a day; check timings so you donâ€™t miss the ones you want.

Well worth a visit and one weâ€™d happily recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Steve Dent
recent_reviews.text: We spent a few hours here with two of our grandsons (aged 9 & 8). It's a delightful place to visit. The programme of sessions were highly interesting and we learned a lot about bees and honey. There is plenty to do for children and adults alike. I highly recommend Quince Honey Farm, it's a great place to visit

recent_reviews.author: James Howe
recent_reviews.text: Cafe food was good quality and value. The farm was really interesting. The staff were enthusiastic and helpful. Ideal place to go with children. My boys enjoyed the hands on with bugs and making candles.

recent_reviews.author: Eleanor Jardine
recent_reviews.text: We stopped by today and we're very disappointed by what we found. We arrived in a field with a caravan in it, with a sign saying "back in 10 minutes". We decided to look around while we waited for someone to return. There were many rows of blackberries but they weren't very well tended, there were also lots of bramble trimmings on the ground that made things a bit perilous. We came back to the caravan over 15 mins later and it was still empty so we gave up and left. It was also more expensive to pick your own than buy what they had picked ready. Overall it was a let down for something we were looking forward to.

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Shute
recent_reviews.text: A most definite worthwhile stop by when in the area! The guy who ran it was very polite and chatty. A great selection of preserves that I have never heard of before, he talked us through what they were and recommendations of what to eat them with. A local guy just allowing people to PYO, happily visit again.

recent_reviews.author: Deborah Box
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely beautiful  surrounding where you can pick your own fruit and vegetables, produce is sold at the little caravan, where you can also enjoy a glass of homemade elderflower  cordial.
I am a Childminder,  and the children live visiting Shute Farm, lovely place for a picnic and fruit picking. Bus service available number 22 Stagecoach . Bus stop just opposite to the farm.
Dogs are welcome but to be supervised. Check when they are open as only available  during various months of the year,and or if very wet and muddy ground conditions. Pumpkins can be seen in their fields. A beautiful Sunflower  field is also available,  where you can pick beautiful sunflowers to take back home with you.

recent_reviews.author: Gary Reich
recent_reviews.text: We've come all the way from Wisconsin to visit. Still able to buy preserves if you call to arrange.  Their strawberry preserves are wonderful on scones.  Of course on top of the clotted cream.

pumpkin_patches.address: Shute Farm, Newton Road, Bishopsteignton TQ14 9PN

recent_reviews.author: Jan West
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place to eat. Lovely large outside patio area. Lovely choices of food for vegetarians and vegans. Farm shop and indoor seating. Great service and very pleasant and helpful staff. Nice play area for kids and for Â£1.00 you can buy the kids a little bag of food to feed the sheep. We stopped for a break on the way home from our Cornwall holiday. So much nicer than a service station and lovely that my granddaughter could have a run around in a safe environment before continuing our journey home. Looks like they do music nights and weddings and much more Highly recommend

recent_reviews.author: matt carter
recent_reviews.text: Stopped for a spot of late lunch on the bank holiday. Have to say I wasn't prepared for the fabulous few hours we had here. The staff were amazing and friendly and very knowledgeable of the winery. The tapas food we shared was to die for, the chorizo was absolute knockout. Will definitely return for a full meal and a wine tasting tour. The place is amazing.

recent_reviews.author: Nikki Sibley
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place for brunch - food was fab and the service super-friendly. The outdoor space is beautiful if the weather is good. Make time to take some sheep food and feed the friendly sheep in the orchard. Even if you donâ€™t have kids ğŸ˜€

recent_reviews.author: Hugo Farne
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place, quiet, fast EV charging (x2), delicious food, could cater to gluten free (Coeliac), nice outdoor play area for kids.

recent_reviews.author: Samuel Chan
recent_reviews.text:
The food was just okay â€” not bad, but definitely not impressive for the price. I had the waffle, which came as a single, rather small piece. It looked more like a snack than a full dish, which was disappointing.

The all-day breakfast was decent. The hash brown and tomato were probably the best parts, but the rest was pretty forgettable.

What saved the experience a little was the chance to see some animals nearby. We happened to be there when a staff member was feeding them, which was unexpectedly fun.

Overall, it feels like the prices might be marked up because of the farm setting and the animal â€œexperienceâ€, but in terms of food and value, I personally found it lacking.

recent_reviews.author: Pete UK
recent_reviews.text:
A farm shop? Oh, it is so much more than that!

The farm shop itself is brilliant, the meat is as fresh as it comes and is perfect for BBQ'S. The baked goods are in a class of their own and the sausage tolls are to die for.

It has a fish and chips counter, cooked to order and a large selection of cider and beers, complimented by good wine. There is an attached restaurant and outside, a takeaway cabin called Oscar's named after the resident Ostrich.

Yes, Ostrich! They also have donkeys, pigs, very many birds. Alpaca's and Lama's, red deer and cows/bulls. At the moment, they have the largest inflatable area I have ever seen and a very long slip and slide.

It has to be worth a visit!

recent_reviews.author: Julieta Azevedo
recent_reviews.text: Great space and loved the shop with lots of fresh produce. The store it's open until late but if you want to get the butchers or fishmonger should go there before 6 pm. Lots of cute animals you can see and tables outside to eat.

recent_reviews.author: Joyce Mace
recent_reviews.text:
A great place to meet family and grandchildren who enjoy walking the trail, seeing all the animals and Oscar the Ostrich! The restaurant has expanded over the years. The fish and chips we reckon the best in Devon! Recent Sunday roast not as good as before because the potatoes were hard. We were offered replacement  new potatoes but took too long. We requested a discount as the quality did not reflect the increased menu price. They discounted the drinks instead.
An excellent choice of meats at the butcher's counter. Good fish counter too. The shop is fun to browse. Nice ice-creams at the ice-cream shed.
Hope the roast dinners and meals return to what they used to be.

recent_reviews.author: Jennifer Zsigo
recent_reviews.text:
Such a great experience! You checked the boxes for everyone in our group:
Me: Keen to find interesting and unique pumpkins and gourdes (with over 50 varieties and a huge area to hunt, I was in heaven)
My friend (influencer) and her family: lots of great photo opportunities, fun for the kid, picnic area to refuel

The pricing is very fair and due to the staggered entry it never felt crowded. Easy to find thanks to the signs. We spent about 2 hours there and Iâ€™ll probably be back for more!

recent_reviews.author: Stef Ilieva
recent_reviews.text:
We had a lovely family day out at the Jolly Pumpkin. Our son loved looking for pumpkins and splashing in the mud. The train ride was a great addition to the experience. Pumpkins are at affordable prices and there are plenty of refreshments when you finish with the pumpkin picking.
Highly recommend visiting The Jolly Pumpkin, but do not forget your wellies! It is quite muddy ğŸ˜„ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Gordon Stevens
recent_reviews.text:
My wife and I went on a Saturday morning and had great fun. It was well organised with plenty to do and a great selection of pumpkins squashes and gourds.
Itâ€™s worth noting we had an issue with one pumpkin (rotting from the inside out) as can easily happen with natural produce and Ross immediately refunded it with no issues at all. Great customer service.
They even had vegan options in the food offering.
We will go again and would highly recommend it.

recent_reviews.author: Teresa Sanders
recent_reviews.text: Had a brilliant afternoon at the Sunflower ğŸŒ»fields. Beautiful choice of sunflowers and wildflowers .Set out in a lovely way so can get around easily.Lot of great photo props to enhance your experience.My grandson loved the maze and barrel train. You can stop of and get pizza,drinks and ice creams .There are temporary toilets as well .All the staff very friendly .Looking forward to going for the pumpkin picking ğŸƒ

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Pumpkins & Fun on the Farm @ Dewflock
pumpkin_patches.address: Dewflock Farm, Winterborne Monkton, Dorchester DT2 8NP

recent_reviews.author: Paula Turner-Howarth
recent_reviews.text: We've been here a couple of times now. The fruit is fresh and very flavourful. The strawberries are raised up off the ground so saves your back when picking. With a range of soft fruits and homemade jams available what's not to like? Also pick your own pumpkins and sunflowers available during the season.

recent_reviews.author: Jestina Anderson
recent_reviews.text: This is our 4th year attending the farm to pick our own pumpkins. For the first time the kids are now old enough to realise the pumkins are no longer on the plant. Once we got over this hiccup they enjoyed themselves as always, finding and selecting the most suitable pumpkins.

recent_reviews.author: Natalie B
recent_reviews.text: Spotted a sign for Xmas trees earlier today and so glad we went to take a look. Lovely selection of Xmas trees and reasonably priced. Very happy with our 8ft tree. Would come back in the Warner months for fruit picking :)

recent_reviews.author: Dler Ibrahim
recent_reviews.text:
Lenctenbury FarmØŒØŒØŒØŒØŒ
It is a very nice and quiet place. All the fruits are fresh hereØŒ

pumpkin_patches.address: Soldiers Rd, Norden, Corfe Castle, Wareham BH20 5DU

pumpkin_patches.search_query: pumpkin patch East Riding of Yorkshire

recent_reviews.author: Denise Thompson
recent_reviews.text: Great place for pumpkin picking. They had so many to choose from and different variations. They also had hit drinks available, a little scare walk through as well as a pumpkin cleaning station.

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca McLernon
recent_reviews.text: We visited for pumpkin picking and were made to feel very welcome. We had a lovely chat with the lady who greeted us and told us about the wheelbarrows and the witchy walk. We will now visit every year as the pumpkin patch was lovely!

recent_reviews.author: Dean Burnell (StretchMusicUK)
recent_reviews.text: The pumpkin patch was amazing this year, thx ğŸ’›

recent_reviews.author: Diane Duffield
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous place for pumpkin picking, made two separate trips with grandchildren and will be returning next year thanks

pumpkin_patches.address: Lings Farm, Croxby Top, Market Rasen LN7 6BN

pumpkin_patches.search_query: pumpkin patch East Riding of Yorkshire

recent_reviews.author: Luke Smith
recent_reviews.text: This place has diversified alot. We go every year to the Christmas market which is always great, and recently we went in a family outing to the maize maze. It was brilliant and would highly recommend! We will be returning soon to pick our own pumpkin and then our own Christmas tree when Xmas arrives!!

recent_reviews.author: Chris Pinder
recent_reviews.text: We have been coming hear to stay for over 40 years with caravans and Motorhomes with our children and now with grandchildren and my sons now caravan and bring they children hear.we love cycling and this is great for the clean sea air a lovely ride to Cleethorpes and many other places.You can get fresh eggs and fruit during the season pick your own and wine as well.Rodney,Pete and Julie are great at running this farm/CL,you have a choice of grass and hardstanding pitch depending on weather.Chris and Elaine

recent_reviews.author: Martin Aitken
recent_reviews.text:
This was my first visit to Peaks Top Farm, and it most certainly will not be the last.
Rodney greeted me on arrival, and made me feel really welcome. He showed me the room, explained where all the facilities were, and asked me what time I would like breakfast. (Never had that experience before)!
The accommodation was first class.
A comfortable bed, the room was really cosy and warm considering it was November and the wind had a bite to it.
The breakfast was outstanding. The choice was really extensive and there was no pressure, as is often the case in other establishments.
I chose the full English, (with their own free-range eggs), and finished it off with toast and their own Gooseberry Preserve.... Absolutely Outstanding!
After breakfast Rodney outlined the various areas of their business, and encouraged me to have a walk around the farm.
Being November it is a quiet time as far as fruit production is concerned, so I took a stroll to see the Free-Range Hens. They are in huge paddocks with vast areas of room for them to live in. It was obvious that they were Happy Hens!
A visit to the Winery to see the extensive range of home produced fruit wines and preserves, was a delight.
I am really looking forward to my next visit.
Martin A
Kent

recent_reviews.author: Karen Clark
recent_reviews.text: Had a lovely time completing the Easter Egg hunt. Beautiful weather. Friendly staff. Scrumptious cake too. Sampled a couple of fruit wines. Looking forward to trying our bottle of slow wine

pumpkin_patches.address: Peaks Top Farm, Hewitts Ave, New Waltham, Grimsby DN36 4RS

pumpkin_patches.search_query: pumpkin patch East Riding of Yorkshire

recent_reviews.author: stuart waite
recent_reviews.text:
We only stopped because we saw the signs for food and doggy ice cream. And so glad we did.  Beautiful restaurant with extremely friendly staff and our dog can sit at the table with us.  A year ago I would have said the prices were a bit steep, but now I would say they were average, the food is excellent and you get very good portions, I was disappointed with the price  of a large rose!   Â£9â€¦..  we all know how much a bottle of wine costs at a wholesaler and we understand that you have to make a profit but  that is outrageous. Anyway the lovely girl that served us was cheery and bright and she told us she  loved her job, I can see why. The farm shop was amazing,  too much to list. Go and have a look for yourself.
Itâ€™s an hours ride for us, we will be back.

recent_reviews.author: Emma
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful Sunday lunch! The sharing platter was simply gorgeous. Perfect range of sides and beautiful meat. Staff were very attentive and helpful with fast service. Highly recommend and we will certainly be visiting again.

recent_reviews.author: Elisa Winstanley
recent_reviews.text: A fabulous afternoon having lunch here today. It was very busy, but they managed to fit us in. There was such a great choice of dishes that I couldnâ€™t decide!! The teas came first and then the food followed. We loved them! Then we had a browse in the farm shop and brought some garlic & herb sourdough, bread dipping oil, greetings card, and dog treats. Thereâ€™s a lovely selection of things to buy!! We canâ€™t wait to return to try the rest of the menu!!

recent_reviews.author: Liz
recent_reviews.text:
I always enjoy a meal here. The food is fresh and delicious. The ambience is friendly, professional, and bright. There is a large range of delicious foods to choose from, so everyone will find something they like.
Any allergies are inputted to the computer system and are highlighted to the chef's, brilliant!
The farm shop has delicious fresh farm produce and bakes to take home, along with a range of good quality items you can peruse.

pumpkin_patches.search_query: pumpkin patch East Riding of Yorkshire

recent_reviews.author: Colin Durrans (minisumo)
recent_reviews.text:
I only stopped off for coffee but it looked like they do great food.

Nice seating outside, looks like a lot of tractors and carts for kids to choose from.

Dog friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Jane Eardley
recent_reviews.text: Great food & very friendly staff. Shown straight to a table & there wasn't a long wait for our food. The farm shop is great too.

recent_reviews.author: Elaine Wainwright
recent_reviews.text:
Our food was fabulous, staff are very friendly, service quick and they even gave a song and dance made our day.
We had a sandwich and some amazing chunky chips!
Key Lime pie and white chocolate and raspberry cake to follow - fabulous.
We would recommend a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Dazneyland
recent_reviews.text:
I recently visited the farm shop in Cranswick and was thoroughly impressed! Their desserts and tray bakes are absolutely delightful â€“ a must-try for anyone with a sweet tooth. The chorizo stuffed chicken was another standout, bursting with flavor and perfectly cooked.

This shop is a treasure trove of farmer produce and local delicacies. From fresh vegetables to unique items like frozen dough and potato bites, there's something for everyone. The quality and variety are outstanding, making it a great spot for stocking up on local goods.

If you're lucky enough to visit on a sunny day, there's also a wonderful circular walk around the area. Itâ€™s the perfect way to enjoy the beautiful countryside and work up an appetite before indulging in the shopâ€™s treats. Highly recommended for both locals and visitors!

pumpkin_patches.address: 2 Beverley Rd, Hutton Cranswick, Driffield YO25 9PQ

recent_reviews.author: Galaxtic_ Aftxn
recent_reviews.text: Came a couple weeks ago, i loved the staff, they were really nice but i honestly expected more animals or a bit more to do. However there was plenty for the kids which is good, the location (way there) wasn't safe as i had to walk up a very long and curvy road with a baby. (Yes i could've waited for a bus but it only would've stopped in the middle of the road anyway). Overall 3/5.

recent_reviews.author: Liam Blakeston
recent_reviews.text: A 1-star rating for disabled amenities, we phoned prior to our visit and was assured wheelchair assess wasnâ€™t a issue, which in fairness to get around was fine but to get into the wooden shacks just stairs and no ramps I find it ridiculous. He was unable to access the cars at â€œvehicle valetâ€. We chose this place as it said it had a â€œsensory streetâ€. I wouldnâ€™t call it a street just a board. Nothing sensory about it, which was very disappointing. All In all of you have a great wheelchair bound child I would avoid.

recent_reviews.author: Louise Windham
recent_reviews.text: My toddler loves Sharnfold for a day out! There is so much to keep him entertained and such a variety too! The flower fields are absolutely gorgeous and great for those photo opportunities and he could spend ages in vehicle valley or playing the garden games! Really reasonably priced, especially the summer pass - we will be back every week throughout the summer holidays!

recent_reviews.author: J G
recent_reviews.text:
We used to visit frequently before the refurbishment as the farm shop breakfast was lovely, and great value.

Visited recently and they no longer have a functioning kitchen or a breakfast menu. Such a shame. We ended up going elsewhere with our group of 6.

pumpkin_patches.address: Hailsham Rd, Stone Cross, Pevensey BN24 5BU

recent_reviews.author: sue reed
recent_reviews.text: Â£6 per car not per person and lots of pumpkins ranging from tiny Â£1 to large Â£10 pyo pumpkins, they take card and cash. Easy fields to walk round, wheelbarrows supplied too

recent_reviews.author: Sophie Foster
recent_reviews.text: Loads of cool pumpkin and squashes to choose from! Not that busy either at 12pm on a Saturday.

recent_reviews.author: Andy L
recent_reviews.text: Very nice pumpkins in a large field. Some good photo opportunities. Reasonable price. Would be good if there was a portaloo there tho.

recent_reviews.author: Natasha Quinton Bridal
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm and family run business. Pumpkins  were very reasonable, the picking grounds and parking area was easy to navigate. Great fun had by the whole family. Thank you Birchden.

pumpkin_patches.address: Groombridge Hill, Groombridge, Tunbridge Wells TN3 9LZ

recent_reviews.author: Julie Wild
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely place! We had a wonderful day, doing the Easter egg trail. Me, my daughter and my grandchildren enjoyed it so much. The children, are aged 7, 4, 4 and 2 and each of them loved the trail and had a great time in the play barn. The little one particularly loved the tractor! We will try the cafe next time we visit. Thank you Goddenwick, we had a fantastic day!

recent_reviews.author: Danielle Easton
recent_reviews.text: First time going and had an amazing time. Our 3 year old had so much fun not only did you pick pumpkin's ğŸƒ, there was a lovely walk to go on with amazing Halloween decorations and what's even better it's dog friendly. Can't wait to go back for Christmas. You can also pick your Christmas ğŸ„ here too. Amazing place.

recent_reviews.author: Emma Brown
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely afternoon out with the kids. They had great fun picking the pumpkins and looking at the Halloween decorations. The woodland trail was great ğŸƒ
A great place to go with the family and doesnâ€™t cost a fortune which is rare these days!

recent_reviews.author: Sam Armstrong
recent_reviews.text: We visited Goddenwick farm for their Easter event and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The trail was so well done and a great amount of time. Each stop along the way was really fun for the kids. At the end of the trail the kids got some chocolates and played in the barn which was also great. We canâ€™t wait to return for another event soon. â­ï¸

pumpkin_patches.address: Ardingly Rd, Lindfield, Haywards Heath RH16 2QX

recent_reviews.author: Brent Haslett
recent_reviews.text: Huge field full of 20+ varieties of pumpkin all still growing - wear wellies!  The maise maze was fun, especially for the kids.  The maze isn't all that challenging, but the murder mystery clues you have to find and solve made it interesting.  Friendly staff, tea, coffee and choices of hot chocolate keep it good for adults too.

recent_reviews.author: shalma ip
recent_reviews.text: Such a brilliant day picking seasonal pumpkins at picking Patch lewes. Great variety of pumpkins to find, the staff were very friendly and happy. plenty of parking, food, drink & toilets on site . We went there and got lots of lovely pictures but thereâ€™s loads to do for families too including escape room, halloween maize maze, barrel train , toasted Marshmallow, and crafts . I love it!

recent_reviews.author: Jane Osborne
recent_reviews.text: We had a lovey day despite the copious amount of mud, actually it led to a lot of laughter as we continually got stuck. Staff were lovely,  my grandson enjoyed the maze and marshmallow toasting   My only gripe is the price of the pumpkins , they were expensive at Â£10 for large one which after only 3 days is a mass of rotting flesh with swarms of tiny flies. It was free to get in so Iâ€™m guessing this is where they make their profit from and thatâ€™s to be expected.  We would still definitely go again.

recent_reviews.author: Kaela Mills
recent_reviews.text: Hilariously bleak, the singular star is for making us laugh. A depressing field full of half eaten, rotting, foul smelling pumpkins. Not a single photo point didnâ€™t look utterly joyless and dismal. So bad it was almost good.

pumpkin_patches.address: Picking Patch, Littledene Ln, Glynde, Lewes BN8 6LB

recent_reviews.author: Peter Dennett
recent_reviews.text: Campsite large field but was fairly empty midweek in August. Toilets: no mirrors handdrier doesn't work. Lights over wash up area don't work. Toilet blocked for two days. Dogs should be on lead but when we complained about a labradorite roaming free were told "it's OK he belongs to farmworker" it's NOT ok dog came into tent licked our food and knocked our 5 Yr old with cerebral palsy over. Activities for children expensive , Â£80 a day for 30 mins on golf 40 mins in play barn, 45 mins on bouncing inflatables. Neither of two coin operated excavator ride ons worked. Ice cream good but long queues and pricey. Didn't use water slide. No evening food (apparently there's pizza Friday nights. Gave impression they are interested in taking money but not providing decent service.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Pearce
recent_reviews.text: We camped here in the family camping field for the weekend. It is a lovely area and the pitches are well spaced out. The facilities are basic but clean. There is lots to do on the site, crazy golf, maize maze etc but unfortunately these are at extra costs which we didn't realise before arriving and these things are quite costly, especially with a group of 6 people. The only thing included with the camping is the bluebell walk which was nice (even out of bluebell session) and the wallabiesare soooo cute. It would have been great if campers got a discount on the extras. The kids loved having the chicken wondering free and the ice creams. Service was slow at the pantry and all the staff we encountered seemed unsure about everything. Unfortunately on the Saturday night there was loud music playing until about 4.30am. We don't believe this was coming from the site but it was very loud so probably local which puts me off wanting to return.

recent_reviews.author: Rod Bews
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely setting and parking was easy with several disabled parking bays. We had a coffee and a BLT for a late lunch. The service was slow, only seemed to be one member of staff. The coffee was on the cold side so we drank it quickly. The BLT at Â£9 was also disappointing there was no choice of bread offered. When it arrived the bread was white shop bought bread. With a name such as Butlers pantry, we would have at least expected a choice of white or brown and at least a sliced Bloomer that at least looked a bit more home made. The fillings were good but the presentation was let down by the poor choice of bread. Beginning of the season and the decking and unplanted planters looked tired and unloved. With a few minor tweeks, freshen up the decking and outside of the barn with a bit of stain. If youâ€™re going to have planters, they are only a good addition if you have them planted and cared for. Other wise remove them and make the most of your space.
Latchettâ€™s dairy the gelato was delightful and well worth a trip out, it is worth noting they do not accept cash, card & mobile payments only.

recent_reviews.author: Graham Reed
recent_reviews.text:
Parking free, but you have to pay for everything else individually & some of it is very expensive.

Children enjoyed the play barn & wanted to go on the nature trail & in the Maze but they would have cost to much money. Found the crazy golf to long. Redeeming feature was the ice cream shop which was very nice.
Won't go back.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Lower Ladysden PYO and Maize Maze.

recent_reviews.author: Navdeep Dhillon
recent_reviews.text:
Strawberry picking- excellent experience.
Book tickets if you plan to visit on weekends. The tickets are free- and you pay for what you pick- its ~5-7Â£ per bucket of strawberry (weighed).
The farm is huge, parking is spacious, and staff is very kind and cheerful.
There is no time limit on picking strawberries or raspberries.
They have a lovely cafe with plenty outdoor seating . Definitely recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Nadia Fahim
recent_reviews.text:
I had an unforgettable day at Lower Ladysden PYO! The strawberry picking was a highlightâ€”the fields were bursting with perfectly ripe, juicy strawberries, and it was so fun filling our baskets with the sweetest ones. Taking in the beautiful countryside while picking made the experience even better.

Afterward, we stopped by their lovely cafÃ©, which had great coffee, sweet treats, and other organic goodies. It was the perfect way to end the day, relaxing with a cup of coffee and enjoying some delicious local snacks. The friendly staff made everything easy and enjoyable, and Iâ€™m already excited to go back!

recent_reviews.author: Jim Potter
recent_reviews.text:
First time here. Next nearest PYO to us. Raspberries strawberries blackberries and runner bean on offer. Get a punnet from the shop first. Reasonably busy and staff didn't seem to have a break
Good basic lunch food. Shop a bit Waitrosey but some different products. Will visit again as the dog loved it!

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Davis
recent_reviews.text:
we visited for breakfast this morning , it was absolutely delicious, everything was perfectly cooked.
yummy good quality  sausage, bacon, hash brown , cherry Tom's on the vine, mushrooms , fried eggs , cooked just the way I asked and the most delicious toast , buttered to perfection.
the staff were great , and attentive , despite it being busy
also lovely fresh fruit for sale   the nicest strawberries I've ever had.
we will be returning very soon!

recent_reviews.author: alessiaTN barile
recent_reviews.text: I love this shop. Staff is very helpful.

recent_reviews.author: Rosemary Leworthy
recent_reviews.text: Pumpkin Patch is a real find! Julie has been so helpful in getting me started, resurrecting a 36 year old knitting project and generally advising me. Thank you so much.

recent_reviews.author: Liz Denison
recent_reviews.text: This is a delightful haberdashery shop. The staff are extremely friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. I strongly recommend this shop for high quality wools, fabric, knitting and crochet patterns etc.

recent_reviews.author: Angela Poole
recent_reviews.text: I buy all my threads, cording, fabrics, buttons, zips from these very patient ladies. I would like on this day, 06/05/2020 to send lots of love to you all. I have been making masks for people using the denim legs from my trousers with a 23 inch piece of elastic top and bottom. Does any one think denim workwear fabric is sufficient to protect people? I might run out of fine 5mm X 3 metres which works nicely. Any ideas?

recent_reviews.author: Kay Al-Ghani
recent_reviews.text: Looking for a local farm shop and came across this one. A good variety of seasonal fresh fruits and veg and helpful staff.

recent_reviews.author: Jeff Ashcroft
recent_reviews.text:
Great selection of plants. Really helpful and friendly.
Bread pudding in the shop is outstanding.

recent_reviews.author: Jacqueline Young
recent_reviews.text: So many plants and flowers i havent seen before everything neatly stacked and a well stocked farm shop.

recent_reviews.author: Samia Steele
recent_reviews.text: A lovely little farm shop with an excellent variety of plants for sale and the freshly baked bread tastes amazing!

recent_reviews.author: Alex KA
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful breakfast,  made with high quality fresh ingredients.  Even baked beans were home made. The staff were helpful and friendly and Tibbs farm is set in beautiful location. It's dog friendly and nice to walk around and see friendly animals. Highly recommend and we enjoyed chat with Jane

recent_reviews.author: Catherine (Cat)
recent_reviews.text: Really lovely place - beautiful views, excellent veggie breakfast with fresh ingredients, and a pick your own farm. The loos are in a cabin round the back but are kept very clean and tidy. Nice big car park for drivers.

recent_reviews.author: Sam Charlesworth
recent_reviews.text:
Visited here over the Easter hols for the duck hunt challenge! Kids had great fun looking for various ducks to earn a free chocolate egg.
Great day for all, very tiring with all the walking searching for ducks. Fantastic place, highly recommend to all.

recent_reviews.author: Critter Sitters
recent_reviews.text: Came upon this cafe while on holiday. Lovely views and the cafe is in a lovely airy barn building.  Customer service could be improved. We did choose a table by the window which hadn't been cleared. Went to order and asked if the table could be cleared but unfortunately it wasn't cleared until they came out with the food and they put our cutlery down on a dirty table. Somehow they managed to get our order wrong, despite being very clear at time of ordering.  They did rectify it, but then I had nearly finished my food before the other meal returned. The food itself was nice. Prices are on the higher side for a cafe but in keeping with similar type cafes down south.

recent_reviews.author: Theresa Dee
recent_reviews.text: We loved walking around the pumpkin farm, and the  owner was so friendly and welcoming to all. Lots of added creativeness as you walk around, and LOTS of varieties and shapes of pumpkins and gourds. I hope they keep their stance on no booking needed, free entry and free parking as this is THE place to get your pumpkins ğŸƒğŸƒ also a farm shop to get seasonal veg and fruit ğŸğŸğŸ

recent_reviews.author: NÃºria Romero
recent_reviews.text: We had the pleasure of visiting this charming pumpkin farm, and it was an absolute delight! Not only were the pumpkins fresh and vibrant, but the warmth of the family who runs the place made the experience truly special.

recent_reviews.author: Maaike Lilian
recent_reviews.text: We had wonderful time at Lime Tree Farm looking at all the wonderful pumpkins and displays! There were so many people having a great time. Lots of parking spots and photo ops.

recent_reviews.author: Mo Redford'giles
recent_reviews.text: Came today and what a fantastic variety of homegrown pumpkins/ gourds at fantastic low prices, great displays too, have posted on our village site too, as highly recommend , thanks to Dave and familyâ€¦ from mo(red potatoe ladyğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ˜œ)

pumpkin_patches.address: Lime Tree farm, Straight Ln, Brookland, Romney Marsh TN29 9QS

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Tibbs Farm Pick Your Own Fruit

recent_reviews.author: Luke Evans
recent_reviews.text:
Took the kids here for a different day out on an school inset day. A colleague at work recommended it a week earlier, so i thought we would give it a try. The cafe and farm are located in a beautiful valley a stones throw from Rye. We visted in late June and were not dissappointed with the amount of variety. We checked the blackboard for in season fruits, brushed up on the rules and grabbed four punnets and set off.

The orchards are spaced out nicely and on the day we visited it wasnt too busy so we were able to roam and pick at our own leisure, finding some decent fruits. We managed to fill three full punnets, one of strawberries, one raspberries and one of blackcurrants.

We got lost in the maze, which needed a little TLC, some of the passageways were a little overgrown and some nettles got the better of our kids shins, but thats what child hood is about exploration! The kids loved seeing the goats and playing on the old tractor

As is to be expected not everyone follows the rules and guidance and it was a shame to see people picking and then discarding fruit, but how can you police such a thing, ive seen some reviews that have marked this place down because others have moaned at them for not following the guidelines which i think is unfair on Tibbs Farm.

All in all we had a great day out and came home with some great tasting fresh fruit, some bottles of Tibbs Farm Apple juice. I would throughly reccommend Tibbs Pick your own as a day out

recent_reviews.author: Sophie Watson
recent_reviews.text: Love this farm, such good value! We have been here a few times as there is always something to do no matter what the season. We love Halloween as the spooky maze is amazing, despite the fact we always end up muddy and lost! ğŸ˜‚ in the summer they have such a wide range of fruit to pick as well sheep and pigs to feed too. The tractor ride is always worthwhile but very very bumpy!

recent_reviews.author: Anushka Perera
recent_reviews.text: A beautiful fruit farm, filled with stunning scenery, was visited by three families, including 6 children. We all enjoyed our time although there weren't many fruits. However, a complaint arose when another visitor made what seemed like a racist remark about our consumption. Furthermore, a white lady approached my son and threatened him, saying, "you better pay for this." We purchased a few items, and we all felt utterly disappointed and upset by the experience. As a result, we will not be returning and will not recommend this place to any friends.

recent_reviews.author: Stuart Eade
recent_reviews.text: Spent a morning here while on holiday in Rye. The staff were friendly and helpful. We had a fun time fruit picking, and my son enjoyed seeing the pigs. We ended up picking seven punnets of various fruits for a very reasonable price. Will definitely be visiting again.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Beau and Bell at South Farm

recent_reviews.author: Kristin Crenshaw Harding
recent_reviews.text:
We loved our stay in the Glamping tents. The beds were comfortable with warm duvets and there was plenty of space for our family of 4.

The views of the farm are beautiful, and itâ€™s nicely located so that you can hike on one of the South Downs paths, walk through the farm to a pub, or you can also drive down to the coast. We did a half day in Brighton, which gave us a nice mix of activities. There was also a corn maze on site, but we didnâ€™t get around to doing it.

The location feels private and remote, but with young kids, we were reassured that our car was only a 5 minute walk away if needed and also cell phone service could be found again within a few minutes drive.

The toilets and shower and sink were all nicely maintained. Overall it was a really relaxing and peaceful experience sitting by our campfire, and cooking and sleeping outside. Our kids also loved seeing the sheep and cows nearby.

We had a great time and were really reassured given it was our first time taking our kids camping, and weâ€™re not big campers ourselves. It was a perfect mix of nature whilst having some amenities on site.  Thank you!

recent_reviews.author: Dot Ward
recent_reviews.text: First time I've  picked pumpkins ğŸƒ  from a field!!!   It was great fun..and since then I've  made a pumpkin cake...large pot of pumpkin soup..tasty...and carved three of them ready for Halloween  ğŸƒ..I'll  definitely be  back next year .thank you.

recent_reviews.author: Nathalia Paquiela
recent_reviews.text: Great place for Pumpkin picking! A big field, food and rides for children during this season! They accept cash and card, itâ€™s brilliant! Iâ€™m so happy I got to go there :)

recent_reviews.author: Josie Higgins
recent_reviews.text: Had a nice time picking pumpkins with some friends and the staff were nice and helpful.

recent_reviews.author: Sharmila Smith
recent_reviews.text: Great crop of strawberries and cherries. Enjoyed picking our own and plan to come again for another punnet load! Easy to park and plenty of space. One can have a picnic too, which is a lovely idea.

recent_reviews.author: Roger Tamzar
recent_reviews.text:
Went fruit picking at Maynards two days ago. The farm has a variety of fruit. The location is lovely. We picked plums, black berries, pears and apples. The kids loved it. Would highly recommend.

Weâ€™re not giving 5 stars as your staff need training.
When asked repeatedly about how to best navigate the farm/ which fruit was in which section- the tall worker replied with â€œdonâ€™t know, just pickâ€ in a dismissive way.
When we asked for a basket for picking we were met with another dismissive remark.

recent_reviews.author: Ion Zakon
recent_reviews.text: It is a perfect place for a family day, the fruits are amazing, very tasty and everything is organic

recent_reviews.author: Mahmudur Rahman Akhanjee
recent_reviews.text: Thanks to Maynards. My daughter really enjoyed the farm tour. Fresh fruit lovely environment & Friendly People.

pumpkin_patches.address: Windmill Hill/Cross La, Ticehurst, Wadhurst TN5 7HQ

recent_reviews.author: Nur P
recent_reviews.text:
Great place to pick strawberries and asparagus . Not too crowded even when busy.

Vegetarian options at the cafe very limited (one option of an asparagus toastie) . All ciabattas contained a pork ingredient. These could be altered to be pork free but not ideal.

recent_reviews.author: THE WALL LIGHTING COMPANY LTD
recent_reviews.text:
A wonderful farm shop with fabulous pick your own strawberries and raspberries amongst other things.
Have bought some very good alternative produce from there.
Coffee and croissants outside in the sunshine was perfect.

recent_reviews.author: Gemma Curd
recent_reviews.text: Made a visit for one of the monthly car shows. Lovely location just very busy and no vegetarian option on the outdoor cooked food station. We were going to buy breakfast from inside in the hope of a vegetarian option but put off by the very long queues.

recent_reviews.author: Patrick Kudzai Pondai
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm for an outing with children. Nice maize Maze ğŸŒ½, blooming sunflowers ğŸŒ» pick your own Strawberries ğŸ“, pumpkin ğŸƒ plants... lovely cafÃ© as well.

recent_reviews.author: Tina Crowley Psychic & Reiki Master
recent_reviews.text:
Our first time here! Its amazing we had the best day.
The staff were lovely. We did pet handling, tractor ride, crazy golf, pony riding, indoor soft play,outside huge play areas, loads of picnic areas, the farm was wonderful and clean. All the toilets were clean too.
Lovely big cafe, ice cream shop. Lots of talks on, and other activities sooo much to do. 100% reccomend to all.

recent_reviews.author: Cain
recent_reviews.text: A really excellent farm and fun park for the kids. Our children age 4 and 2 bad a fantastic day and I would say this age group and a little older it is perfect for. Staff were all great and helpful the toilets were nice and clean and drinking water taps available near the main cafe. We spent over 5 overs here as there was a lot to see and do.

recent_reviews.author: Rosie vizulis
recent_reviews.text: Me and my disabled son loved visiting this place the staff were so understanding,  we enjoyed seeing the pigs, alpacas,  baby goats and horses there outside play area was amazing there was so much for my little boy to do and he was so happy .. they also have a soft play but we were unable to visit it as my son got really tired and overwhelmed due to his mobility condition x

recent_reviews.author: Benry TV
recent_reviews.text:
A very lovely space to walk around and see the beautiful animals they have there. The Tractor ride is not only fun, but it helps your little one see how much fun there is to be had around the farm.
Great day or half day out ğŸ™.

recent_reviews.author: Suraiya Thakor
recent_reviews.text:
We visited Old MacDonaldâ€™s Farm with our two children (aged 4 and 2), and it was such a fantastic day out! The last time we came was just before my son turned one, and he was a little too young to appreciate the full experience, so I can honestly say the experience this time was so much better.

Both kids absolutely loved the rides â€“ which I think is one of the best things about this farm. You donâ€™t just get to see and interact with the animals (which they also enjoyed), but there are so many rides (some of which are even suitable for babies) and outdoor play areas that kept them fully engaged. It really does offer something for everyone.

There were plenty of opportunities to meet the animals (we did the rabbit encounter), and we were lucky to catch the summer circus too â€“ my children really enjoyed that. The staff stood out as well; everyone we met was so kind and friendly, which made the experience even nicer.

On top of that, there are indoor soft play areas for rainy days, but we had sunny, warm weather so the kids made the most of the outdoor climbing frames and slides. We visited from 10am until 3pm, but honestly, you could easily spend the whole day here until closing. My tip would be to arrive early: start with the animals and then move on to the rides once they open at 11am.

A brilliant family day out â€“ weâ€™ll definitely be back!

recent_reviews.author: Chris McClain
recent_reviews.text: This is a fantastic place to bring your child! My little one is under 2 years old, so the free admission is a big plus. Everything is well organized, and there's the convenience of being able to eat inside. As expected from places like this, the food is more on the quick side, but it's surprisingly tasty. I've visited twice already and will definitely be coming back. One of the standout attractions is the circus â€“ itâ€™s a wonderful source of entertainment for both kids and adults alike. I recommend this place !

recent_reviews.author: Ropita Rammya
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic day out with toddlers. If you can on a weekday in term time you can go on all the rides multiple times as practically no queues! The set up is also very walkable with animals and rides and playgrounds interspersed ergonomically. They have a great variety of animals who seem happy and healthy. It's a little pricey, but it feels worth it to give money to a nice farm. I wish their food options were healthier - especially the snacks (having some fruit on offer for the kids would be helpful!)

recent_reviews.author: Astaire Ambrose
recent_reviews.text:
Incredible place
Got there at 10:30am and received an informative welcome from reception
I was happily surprised that it was not very busy .
I was apprehensive about how many rides my daughter who is nearly two could go on
and yet out of everything available she only missed out on 5 attractions.
I love how detailed the park was and that there was just so many things to keep kids entertained for hours .
Cafe was really good with large portions of food that was not salty but full of flavour.
Staff loved interacting with the kids ,were really polite ,enthusiastic and took pride in their jobs.
Overall
Very very good value for the money and 100% worth it
Will be definitely visiting again hopefully with a party of family members.

recent_reviews.author: Kat Sackett
recent_reviews.text:
Paid Â£45 for a family of three. We went during the Bubble and Pop event, and we had to rush from activity to activity, as there was a very limited window for each activity. The Beast (giant inflatable castle) shut down at 4pm (it was open for a couple of hours and was the best thing there). After that, the whole farm seemed deserted and not much else to do. Funfair rides were shut when we walked through but one was open so we did manage one at least. Donâ€™t know why theyâ€™re not always open? Not really unlimited, is it?

Food and drinks expensive, Â£2.40 for a can of drink! At these prices, and not much going on, I donâ€™t think weâ€™ll be returning.

Marsh Farm - clean up your act!!!

recent_reviews.author: Jeffrey Soley
recent_reviews.text: Cool new dinosaur feature - Visited on Wednesday, 16th April 2025, on a day out with my sister and her 7-year-old granddaughter. Have visited twice in the past ( since Partyman operators took over) and find it's better to visit on quieter days if possible, as the site can get a bit overwhelmed when it has full occupancy, visitor-wise. As it is given, this was April HT rather than the 6-week holiday. Some of the things you can expect to see (Bubble & Pop Tent, Open swim/paddle area and grass-based LEGO/soft toy play area) in high summer were absent, but on this visit, the new Dinosaur attraction was open, and that made up for these omissions. This dinosaur attraction is obviously a big investment from the park, but a bit random as to the point of its inclusion, though it does have some cool features I have not seen at similar bolt-on attractions at other parks. If you take your time in truth, there is almost too much to see and do in a day, so my suggestion is to come early and take your time. We ate in the cafe, and it is a bit of a madhouse in there, in part due to the inclusion of the soft play area next to the cafe, but it does mean there is somewhere parents can safely eat and not have to watch 100% what their kids are doing. All the staff I've encountered on each visit have been lovely, and the only negative on this visit was that the mini train broke down just before we were to ride on it, and there were several areas closed off due to non-existent maintenance being listed as taking place (i.e. Mini Golf and the Maze).

recent_reviews.author: Gemma Crouchman
recent_reviews.text: Took my Brownie group for a visit, we had an amazing staff member who was with us the whole day. The girls got to hold and feed the animals and watched a magic show. Only down side was that the site was closing early for a private event which we were not told of in advance so paid for whole day tickets and lost out 2 hours.. but a nice visit if you want something to do with the kids..

recent_reviews.author: Martin Denham
recent_reviews.text:
3rd birthday bash for my grandson,
Lots to do for this age group. I enjoyed the nice picnic tables, and the time went quickly.
Good choice of food and drink,expensive but not extortionate good fish and chips offering and  coffee and drinks available.

pumpkin_patches.address: Marsh Farm, Marsh Farm Rd, South Woodham Ferrers CM3 5WP

recent_reviews.author: Donna Garnham
recent_reviews.text: We all took a visit to this lovely farm yesterday. My 3 children had a brilliant time. They liked all the animals there and liked to play on the go karts and playing in the sand. They all had a ice cream after playing. All had a nap on way home. This is one lovely place to come.

recent_reviews.author: Pamela Walsh
recent_reviews.text:
We had a lovely day at Hastyâ€™s, we were completely unaware the farm existed! My 3 year old grandson throughly enjoyed himself he loved the water feature on the sand pit, the hill ride! and the soft play area but most of all he loved feeding the animals which were super friendly.  Itâ€™s great to find a place where once youâ€™re in everything is included in the price.  I was impressed by the toilets which were clean and easily accessible, I was also impressed by the amount of hand washing water stations.
We done some blackberry picking and had lunch in the reasonably priced on-site cafe.  All staff were polite. We will definitely be back.

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte Turner
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant day out, perfect for a family with children. So much to do at such a reasonable price as well. It has everything you need. Very friendly and calm animals, I loved the Alpacas! My almost 3 year old absolutely loved it here, he loved the animals, sand pit and the pedal karts. Will be returning again very soon!

recent_reviews.author: M_R_MAYHEM
recent_reviews.text: Amazing little gem found in clacton hasty's adventure farm. took our daughter there and she loved the animals. i think from 2/3 up would benefit from a lot of other things they have to do there. Wellie throwing, basketball hoops, go carts, outdoor playing areas, swimgs, carts to go down a hill, softplay, plenty of seating areas both outside and undercover, a huge outdoor adventure climbing area thats also undercover. could spend quite a few hours here having lunch amd keeping the kids amused. Very well maintained with the animals looking in great condition and well kept.

recent_reviews.author: Carmel Bentham nee Abi-Aad
recent_reviews.text:
We had a brilliant time and could have easily spent over 5 hours here. Perfect for the summer holidays! I'd recommend booking online in advance to save around 15%. They also accept Blue Peter badges with a paying adult, which is a great bonus.
There were loads of activities included â€“ barrel rides, soft play, sand area, bounce pillow, play area, and more. We also got to enjoy a surprise foam party, which was an unexpected highlight. Great value and loads of fun for the whole family!

recent_reviews.author: Chandra Bhanu Singh
recent_reviews.text:
A Truly Inclusive and Enjoyable Day Out

We had a great time at Barleylands Farm Park and easily spent over 5 hours enjoying everything on offer. The accessibility features were excellentâ€”free parking, disabled toilets, 2 accessible changing facilities with a hoist, and an accessible tractor ride.

The activities were a real highlight: the foam party was brilliant, and the foam party crew were superbâ€”friendly and full of energy. Skittleman had everyone laughing, and the magic show was a real treat. The UV party was just as much fun for parents as it was for children, and the Birds of Prey show was both informative and engaging.

Barleylands clearly puts thought into making the experience inclusive and enjoyable for all. A fantastic day out for families!

recent_reviews.author: Lee Sear
recent_reviews.text: What a lovely place to take little ones! Our 1st visit to the farm and wasn't disappointed. It really caters well for little ones. When it was too hot we got out of the sun in the play area and the animals that were inside,also the sandpit. Couple of places to eat, drinks, ice creams. A little tractor track for a small fee. Well worth the admission price.

recent_reviews.author: Emily Kapllani
recent_reviews.text:
Had a wonderful day visiting the animals at Barleylands!
We were lucky enough to visit during the Easter period this time, so we got to stroke some chicks, which were so cute and tiny!
We also attended the small animal stroking which we loved because we have Guinea Pigs of our own, so always jump at the chance to meet other ones.
There was also a bird flying show and a tractor & trailer ride which we enjoyed.
All in all a lovely day out, and we will be returning in the future for sure!

pumpkin_patches.address: Barleylands Farm Office, Barleylands Rd, Billericay CM11 2UD

recent_reviews.author: Sue Spiller
recent_reviews.text:
Farm Fest was a wonderful experience completely run by volunteers.
When festival not on volunteers grow and distribute food to local community

recent_reviews.author: James Clark
recent_reviews.text: A fantastic community space. Open to all. They have volunteer days several times a month and the annual Farm Fest is great!

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte Tew
recent_reviews.text: Amazing morning with the lovely farm family! ğŸ˜ƒ the best place in the world ğŸ—º

recent_reviews.author: JÃ¡nos Gyurcsics
recent_reviews.text: Public farm with amazing organised events throughout the year. Great fun for family.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: The Pumpkin Patch At Sarah Greens

recent_reviews.author: Colin Campbell-Austin
recent_reviews.text:
Looking for a perfect autumn day out? Sarah Greenâ€™s Pumpkin Patch in Tillingham, Essex, is your boarding pass to seasonal fun! I took the family â€“ all 10 of us â€“ for a visit, and we had an absolute blast. From the moment we grabbed our wheelbarrows, it felt like a First Class experience â€“ minus the champagne but with all the charm.

The field is brimming with pumpkins of all shapes, sizes, and colours, and as you meander through, there are games and activities (all free â€“ unheard of these days!) to keep everyone entertained. The kids loved posing at the photo boards, and Iâ€™ll admit, the adults did too. Who doesnâ€™t want a picture with their head poking through a giant pumpkin cut-out?

The cafÃ© is the perfect pit stop for refueling. They serve up tea, coffee, hot chocolate, and freshly made cakes and biscuits. We grabbed a few slices and settled down on hay bales while watching the little ones play. It was a cosy touch, very much like sipping tea in the galley during a peaceful mid-flight moment.

And the pumpkins? An absolute bargain. We managed to fill two wheelbarrows to the brim for just Â£35! If only luggage allowance were that generous. The surrounding countryside is beautiful, and thereâ€™s plenty of free parking, so no need to worry about squeezing into tight spaces like at Heathrow.

All in all, a perfect afternoon â€“ family fun, fresh air, and a boot full of pumpkins. Iâ€™d say Sarah Greenâ€™s Patch definitely gets a â€˜well done, cabin crewâ€™ from me!

pumpkin_patches.address: Mark Farm Cottage, Bradwell Rd, Tillingham, Southminster CM0 7SP

recent_reviews.author: Gill Jones
recent_reviews.text: Good quality produce and competitively priced. Large range of items, including plants, cleaning products, tinned goods, spices, eggs, bread as well as a good range of fresh fruit and veg.  Often some great special offers available too.

recent_reviews.author: vis padayachee
recent_reviews.text: Lots of parking. Fresh fruit, vegtables, freshly baked bread and pastries and meats. A variety of very reasonable  price place plants that we bought from the farm shop today. Love going there as you always come back smiling ğŸ˜ƒ ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca O'Hara
recent_reviews.text: Great range of fresh fruit and veg, baked goods and meat. Always have great deals running so be sure to check their social media to see what bargains you can grab when you go. They also stock cheap compost and lots of plants in spring if you're into gardening.

recent_reviews.author: Tony Higgins
recent_reviews.text:
It is with a real sad heart I leave this review
I have been using this place for many years and always loved going there to see all the great bargains available but since covid I have noticed a steady decline.
Shelves are half empty and prices are no longer competitive, I'm sure they are doing the best they can in a very difficult market
The staff are excellent always very cheerful and upbeat
I will continue to support them against the bigger shops
I wish them all the best for the future

recent_reviews.author: Mark Hainsby
recent_reviews.text: Pumpkin oil is not as well established in the UK as many European countries which is where I have sourced my oil from previously. I have tried many over the years and Frinton Farms is definitely up there with the best. Try it with vanilla ice cream and roasted, crushed pumpkin seeds on top - may sound strange but you wonâ€™t go back to chocolate sauce !

recent_reviews.author: Laura Libricz
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic products. Iâ€™m so happy I can get this fantastic oil in England. The protein powder is an added bonus and tastes great in yogurt and porridge along with pumpkin seed oil and the lovely toasted seeds on top ğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: Trevor Rieck
recent_reviews.text:
I have had an excellent ongoing experience with Frinton Farms pumpkin seed oil.
I have taken a half-teaspoon twice a day for just under a year now to assist with an enlarged prostate.
My medication for this condition was a cognitive burden on my system and it was recommended to find an alternative chemical medication, which I chose not to do. Pumpkin seed oil has been reported to have benefits so I started with this and it has had positive results; it has worked for me. Also, buying from a British farm with its principles of sustainability and care for the environment is another positive.

recent_reviews.author: Simon Willis
recent_reviews.text: The kids had a great time at the pumpkin patch and maize maze! We also purchased some pumpkin oil, which is a great addition to the pantry!

pumpkin_patches.address: Hall/Church La, Great Holland, Frinton-on-Sea CO13 0JS

recent_reviews.author: Charlene Kitchener
recent_reviews.text:
ğŸ’€Land of the dead ğŸ’€
We visited land of the dead today. The aestethics are well executed. It looks amazing and there are multiple photo opportunities.
For full disclosure, we purchased our tickets through groupon at a highly discounted rate, which felt like great value for money. I would not have been pleased with paying the prices on the website. Our tickets included unlimited rides on the fairground, which in all was only 8 rides. With the space they had, there could have been a lot more rides. The fun house was filthy inside and had multiple parts missing.  The haunted house was good, and the dodgems are always a hit.
The arts and craft tent is good fun albeit at firther cost. My children loved the sand art and getting their faces painted.
The food was a highlight for me, plenty of options, and I loved the under cover area. The theme ran throughout the whole event, which made transitioning between areas enjoyable.  The maze is basic but still good fun for the younger ones.
There are plenty of add-on bits to do at an extra cost, such as a circus, pony rides, and games.
I was dubious about attending as I had heard that last year was not very good but they seemed to have improved and it was very busy.
We look forward to coming back next year and will aim to go in the evening as it seems to come alive after dark! ğŸ’€

recent_reviews.author: Manjeet Kaur
recent_reviews.text: Amazing land of the dead halloween day out with kids! Circus was brilliant, lots of kid friendly rides and great choice of pumpkins!

recent_reviews.author: JAMES HAYDEN
recent_reviews.text: Great Value for money, lots to do, plenty of photo opportunities, the circus was brilliant and worth the money for that alone. Highly recommend for anyone who loves Halloween.

recent_reviews.author: anthony booth
recent_reviews.text: Great place wouldâ€™ve been more fun if it wasnâ€™t for the rain

recent_reviews.author: Sophie Louise
recent_reviews.text: We visited on a lovely sunny Friday and it was so nice. The food was delicious. I asked for the waitressâ€™ favourite meal and choose that. It was the lasagne and I would definitely come back. We also visited the bakery for some sweet treats and got a very cute plant plant and pansies too

recent_reviews.author: Sharron Smith
recent_reviews.text: So disappointed. I bought carrot cake and bakewell slice. Not that good. As for large "steak" pie. Don't bother. Strawberry lovely but a fiver punnet never again. Was looking to go in cafe with my mates next week looks real nice. Not sure now. Sorry guys.

recent_reviews.author: Jackie Phillips
recent_reviews.text:
Not what I was expecting.  I visited as I wanted to buy fresh,tasty produce.  The farm shop was smaller than I expected and their fresh produce looked fresh and appealing. The price ,however, was not. I expected that I would have to pay more for fresh fruit and veg but these prices were out of my price range. Some of the shop was your run of the mill grocery foods which, for me, spoilt the experience.
I also had a late breakfast. I sat outside (mistake) and was constantly attacked by flies and wasps.  The food was excellent. I had the 53 breakfast. There was lots of it and it was all really tasty. The staff were very polite and when I asked for a bowl of cold water to cool down a baby bottle they were only too happy to help. Again though, the prices were high.

recent_reviews.author: Lolly
recent_reviews.text:
Visited fobbing farm Christmas grotto today with my 11year (yes she still believes) from the very start it was amazing.
Clear instructions on what to expect and very welcoming.
So much to do from arts and crafts to making reindeer food.
We also played tin can alley and hook a duck.
Most enjoyable of it all was the Naughty Elf, he made the whole experience magical, Firstly with his magic trick then he had a reindeer food fight with my daughter.
It's hard to keep the magic alive with an 11year but fobbing did just that.
We spent over an hour in the main area and was laughing the whole time.
The photos that were taken are definitely value for money and santa knew just how to talk to the kids.
From start to finish it was amazing.
Thank you all so much for all the hard work you do every year and a massive shout out to (mark) the naughty elf for showing my daughter that you are never to old to have fun
Merry Christmas

recent_reviews.author: Jimmy Harding
recent_reviews.text:
Very Disappointing Experience â€“ Unprofessional and Rude Staff

I donâ€™t usually leave negative reviews, but I felt compelled to after our experience at Cotswold Farm Park. From start to finish, the level of customer service was shockingly poor. The staff were not only unhelpful, but downright rude on multiple occasion and so many lies told!

We approached a few different staff members for assistance with what should have been simple questions, and were met with  dismissive attitudes, and an overall sense that they simply couldnâ€™t care less. There was absolutely no effort made to be understanding of our situation and why we could no longer visit.

Whatâ€™s most disappointing is that this is a place marketed as a family-friendly attraction â€“ somewhere meant to educate and inspire children. Instead, we were made to feel unheard. It was clear that several staff members had no interest.

This experience completely shocked us and being told our number is being blocked and no correspondence from email even though we are still owed Â£238 of our money we tried to meet in the middle and ask for a partial refund or alternative booking when was more suitable for our situation but there was no compromise accept in the winter but even that was a lie because they close for certain months too so they made it completely impossible for us. They even told us that they wouldnâ€™t tell there customers if there animals were to catch TB like local farms very close so who knows if this is a safe place to visit and take your family. Which was my very own concern. I would strongly recommend management take a hard look at their customer service standards, because this was unacceptable. There social media is full of false advertisement but yet they canâ€™t even reply to help already paid customers. We will not be returning and will keep fighting for our refund!!!

recent_reviews.author: Alexa Morris
recent_reviews.text:
A wonderful place for all the family. Plenty of parking. Easy ticketing system, signposted well. Very well l laid out. Great picnic areas for families, you can bring your own or buy there. Loads of play spaces for the children of all ages (up to 10 years)

They have a great discovery area where you can pet the rabbits and chicks. Learn about how to take care of them.

I loved how the fields were laid out in a time line. So you can see hope the breeds developed over time. It is wonderful that you can feed them as you go around. There are plenty of opportunities for you to was your hands and to keep the animals safe. The walk ways are a great touch. If you run out of food you can get more half way round. The tractor ride of a great touch.

We finished our day with a lovely ice cream and a walk round the woods then the field of flowers.

I would come here again.

recent_reviews.author: Josiah Carron
recent_reviews.text: We visited the Farm Park during the summer holidays and so the place was understandably busy. We had an enjoyable day and the children appreciated the various pieces of play equipment, sand pits, petting animals and other attractions. There were lots of interesting animals (many eager to be fed!) too. The main downside we encountered was the long queues for special activities, particularly bottle feeding and the tractor ride, both would have been at least an hour wait so we decided to do other things.

recent_reviews.author: Louise Clee
recent_reviews.text: This place is so good! The goats are absolutely hilarious! We are a 37F and 41M couple with no kids and enjoyed ourselves immensely. It was the highlight of our holiday in the Cotswolds. If you have a choice between this or the wildlife park, choose the farm park, itâ€™s so much better!

recent_reviews.author: Kim Roberts
recent_reviews.text: A wonderfully tranquil experience. Staff were very friendly and welcoming. Delicious pizza and ice cold drinks on a hot day .. absolutely perfect. Flowers are still going strong and looking beautiful in my house!

recent_reviews.author: Kim Poulter
recent_reviews.text: We went flower picking this morning, perfect for a sunny sunday.  Very welcoming when we arrived, flowers were beautiful and colours amazing.  Ended our visit with a cup of tea and a brownie.  Staff were lovely.  More people were arriving as we left,  all ready to experience The Farm Patch

recent_reviews.author: Laura Cullen
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely fabulous! Had a great time picking our pumpkins. We had a hot choc and a brownie too and sat on some straw bales. They have lots of recipes for you to try, we made the soup and pie and it was devine!!! Must go this autumn!

recent_reviews.author: Holly Bourne
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful and gets better each year! Great value for money and would highly recommend both the pumpkins and the sunflowers!

recent_reviews.author: Max Daley
