recent_reviews.text: Parking 1 pound an hour on top of ticket price. The best soft play I have seen. The best playground equipment your kids will play on. The water works and sand mining areas are amazing. Hobbledown are taking the woods and parks to a whole new unique level. A great place to take your 2 to 10 year olds too . On the same site as a dinosaur pitch, put and golf driving range. Gripped is also here, included in the grounds but is extra to use. The animals and displays were incredible and match that of a zoo. Activities on throughout day, with shows and dance parties. Not to mention the massive pillows! Well done whoever created this.

recent_reviews.author: Sadie Miller
recent_reviews.text: Hobbledown Heath is an amazing activity place for all ages to visit. We had a fantastic time exploring all the play areas and done an added activity of the net bounce. The foam party was great fun too. I wouldnâ€™t recommend getting the meal deal online for a family because they limit your options to the bare minimum and the price difference does make it worth it but the food was lovely the pizzas looked delicious we were gutted they werenâ€™t part of the options. The staff members look like theyâ€™ve had enough of their jobs and were very miserable except the performing staff who were a delight. Overall a great day out highly recommend just a shame about the staff friendliness and food options.

recent_reviews.author: Asslinn Abbott
recent_reviews.text: My son had a great day out here, he loved the animals and they all looked well cared for. The play areas were all set out over the whole place was wasn't busy. Even during the summer holiday break. He loved climbing high. The water pillows were fun. Although a lot of adults used them as sun beds. The had a paint run and foam party event which was also enjoyed. My only gripe was that you had to book for under or over 5s yet over 5s were allowed in with there under 5 siblings. So it got a little busy and pushy towards the younger ones, as everyone wanted to get closer to where the foam was coming from. The inside soft play was huge and thoroughly enjoyed. Over all was a great day and would likely return.

recent_reviews.author: Raluca Baghdisar
recent_reviews.text: We got there at 1 and left at 6 pm because they were closing. I didn't expect my son to enjoy it so much (he's 10) and we were 4 adults too. It was a great, relaxing day for the whole family, we definitely think it was worth it!

recent_reviews.author: Barbara Sawyer
recent_reviews.text: I always love a trip to Forty Hall Farm on market day. Lots of lovely hand made food and goodies and there were lots of lambs, piglets and other farm animals to see at this time of year too. It's also such a lovely setting so there are lots of dog walkers enjoying it as well.

recent_reviews.author: Julie Griffith
recent_reviews.text: Took my neighbour's grandchildren to the farm. Sunday morning visit, got there just after it opened at 11am. Children under 16 go free, Â£3 for adults. It was a lovely walk around the farm and vineyard. The children loved it. Saw goats, pigs and their piglets, horses and sheep. There is a small tractor for climbing and a toy tractor en route. Walked through the vineyards, grapes just coming through now.

recent_reviews.author: Brim Zeze
recent_reviews.text:
The farm was okay, but I've seen bigger and better ones in London which are free to enter (this one is Â£3). There aren't a lot of animals to see, mainly pigs, horses, sheep and cows.

There was a nice vegetable patch with pumpkin and corn growing (though I'm not sure if they're able to harvest and purchase). The shop had interesting food and drink I bought a jar of unpasteurised Sauerkraut one can usually find in specific food markets.

The location is quite pleasant, right next to the Forty Hall Estate, and the park with a duck pond.

recent_reviews.author: Ezgi Turan
recent_reviews.text: Amazing farm.ğŸ˜ It's a pleasure to be here. ğŸ˜ŠEspecially Farm Shop days are my favourite. ğŸ˜ŠClean, tidy and exactly as it should be. It's one of the local places we like to spend time with my family. ğŸ˜It's a peaceful place. I love this place and our animal friendsâ¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Claire Mendonca-Yeboah
recent_reviews.text: We went today and LOVED it. It's quite small but so family friendly. The pumpkins are set out in patches, there's a Scavenger Hunt for hidden objects for the kids(complete it and you get a lolly!) free face painting and a free carousel ride. Hot drinks ( loved the Halloween themed hot chocolate with cream!!), pizza and tacos - all reasonably priced. We'll definitely go again next year.

recent_reviews.author: Kim Saunders
recent_reviews.text:
Â£2 entry
Lots of pumpkins placed around.
Price Â£3. Â£6 and Â£8
Free carosel
Free face painting
Drinks available to purchase.
Treasure trail type available for children to play.
Photo opportunities with tractors,  cart. Pumpkin patches.
Colouring area.
Picnic area
Stayed 20 minutes. Looks nice but a bit boring.
Nice idea to walk around and pick a Pumpkin of your choice

recent_reviews.author: Tina S
recent_reviews.text: Been there two years in a row and this year, they had made it even better with rides and more treats. Love going there for a couple of hours to eat and my son loves all the Halloween activities! Canâ€™t wait for next year!

recent_reviews.author: Angela Dhembi
recent_reviews.text: It was amazing...Â£5 per person...but the children were given many small gifts at the entrance...and the price included face painting...and a carousel...the face painting lady was very kind and made my children excellent designs... the little ones enjoyed it a lot..thank you!!!

recent_reviews.author: Assia Khench
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic Day out! There is so much to do and see! We loved the shows with the cow and the sheep. The sheep race was so entertaining! The mini golf was great fun! Welcoming staff and loads of toilets with disabled access! The children will love it. Lits of tables to eat your picnic. All the rides are free! I definitely recommend this venue for a great day out!

recent_reviews.author: Johnson Chong
recent_reviews.text: Tulleys Tulip Festival is there. The weather was very nice. Better visit by car. I took bus 602. The walk path wasnâ€™t very nice. Definitely, the field was well kept and the staff was friendly.

recent_reviews.author: A C
recent_reviews.text: Really nice and plenty of things to do for kids, but not so many animals to see in my opinion for the size and price compared to other farms. It's more of a giant playground than a farm which is still perfect to have a nice day but way too expensive. Friendly staff!

recent_reviews.author: Esra D
recent_reviews.text:
UNWELCOMING PLACE IF THERE WAS 0 stars I would give. Discriminatary behaviour was demonstrated towards us by staff. Unwelcoming. No understanding towards children. My son who was over 90cm was denied access to areas that he was actually eligible for. Do not waste your money here. Also on weekdays majority areas are shut with one staff working and the shows do not run.

I forgot to take photos on the day due to stress caused but attached photos of some closed attractions including â€œadventure playgroundâ€ â€œcarasoulsâ€ and â€œplayground slidesâ€

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Copas Farms PYO The Fruit Fields Online booking for entry

recent_reviews.author: London Jaffna Boy
recent_reviews.text:
We had such a fantastic day out at Copas Farms in Iver! Just 20 minutes from Windsor Castle, itâ€™s the perfect family activity. The kids absolutely loved picking their own strawberries and vegetables straight from the fieldsâ€”it was both fun and educational.

The farm is well organised, with plenty of choice depending on the season, and the produce is fresh and delicious. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the farm shop has a lovely selection of extras like jams and honey.

Itâ€™s a brilliant place for a relaxed day outdoors with children, surrounded by beautiful countryside. Highly recommend for families, tourists, or anyone looking for a wholesome activity near Windsor.

recent_reviews.author: Anushka Muthutantri
recent_reviews.text: We visit the farms every week in summer for the fresh produce. We find that the pick your own produce is cheaper and fresher with minimal pesticides, than the super markets, as we buy in bulk for the week. Love the natural pest control methods, fresh air and easy picking. The policies are fair and the website / boards at the entrance clearly advertise prices + pay for what you pick. Produce within the farm shop is slightly more pricey but quality is excellent. What we found most impressive is the customer service when we realised we were missing a few eggs from our boxes and had  paid for what was not in the box. We emailed the support team as we could not get through over the phone. Response was prompt and the farm over compensated us for the missing eggs. We were pleasantly surprised and very happy! We will definitely continue to buy our fresh produce at the farms. Thank you for being amazing!

recent_reviews.author: Megan Stevens
recent_reviews.text:
Omg I've been here twice now and LOVE IT!

Picking strawberries is my favourite, aswell as my boy Joshua, he loves helping me pick.
He loves the open fresh air and just ends up running around the open fields of fruit.

The price is very reasonable for entry, however I feel the shop is a little over price, also when asking advice of the products the young women couldn't answer, maybe a bit of training or some knowledge of fruits and vegetables somewhere in the shop.

Signs around the fields were very good as I could easily get lost or confused, so when looking for certain fruits it was easy to find.

A very enjoyable good few hours spent here. Look forward more pick your own days here, especially October for your Pumpkins ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Kajana Ranganayagam
recent_reviews.text: A peaceful and enjoyable day picking sweet strawberries and cherries straight from the fields. The farm is clean and well-organized, with fair prices and a lovely picnic area. A perfect outdoor activity for all ages!

pumpkin_patches.address: Calves Lane Farm, Billet Ln, Iver SL0 0LU

recent_reviews.author: sumal kodippili
recent_reviews.text: Great place for a family day out with your little ones!! They have various activities for all the family including feeding the animals, pig race, tractor rides etc. Kids have many play areas to choose from including indoor and outdoor areas. Good washroom facilities and baby changing areas, cafes and dining areas for all the family to enjoy the day!!

recent_reviews.author: A C Thomas
recent_reviews.text:
Nice place to spend day with kids. Lot of Animals and Activities. Kids really enjoyed.
Price is bit high but if you spend whole day its good deal.
They have shops where you can get Coffee tea snacks and drink. Only few thing :
First one staff could do more to engage public looked like they leave them to explore them self and everyone is walking around clueless.
Second toilet is not maintained properly.
Third one is had to pay extra for ride and things inside. I think it would be better if it was all included pay.

In general its good place to visit with kids they can see farm and learn a lot of new things.

recent_reviews.author: Gosia Londonerka
recent_reviews.text:
I visited this farm with my 4.5 year old son and we had lovely day out!
The tickets are quite pricey, it was about Â£45 for both of us but it was worth it. Bear in mind that some activities like tractor rides of riding a ponny are not included in the price.
There are lots of activities for kids of different ages.
We enjoyed seeing and feeding all the animals.
My son really liked the playground, trampoline and the tractor rides. This weekend Bluey was on the site and my son was excited to take picture with him.
I recommend to come early, we arrived before 10.00 and parking was pretty full.
There are few places to eat, we enjoyed the pizza.
We will definitely be back one day :)

recent_reviews.author: Nicola Dutton
recent_reviews.text: First time we have been today but wish I had known about this sooner. Only found it as was looking for something in between where my grandchildren live and I do. Itâ€™s a great farm with so much to do. Lots that is inside if the weather turns bad and lots of things that are differentiated for younger/older children. You can buy animal food for Â£1.50 a bag. There are tractor and pony rides that cost extra but we didnâ€™t do this as the grandchildren were having so much fun with everything else. Will definitely come back again we all had a great day.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Compton Down Pumpkin Patch & Farm Shop

recent_reviews.author: Helen House
recent_reviews.text: Took my grandson as a last minute surprise, it was Â£10 for a tractor ride, entry to the maze and two huge pumpkins. The staff are so lovely and even help deliver the pumpkins you choose to their barn where you can wash them before leaving. Great little drinks shelter and the toilets were really clean. Thanks for a lovely couple of hours ğŸ™ŒğŸ»

recent_reviews.author: Mark Mact
recent_reviews.text: We went during sunflower season and got lost in the maize maze it took a while to find our way out (we thought we were good at these mazes!) and got some large sunflower heads. Admission includes 3 sunflowers per person and the maze. They also have dairy free ice cream (a rare find).

recent_reviews.author: Arran X
recent_reviews.text: Great pumpkin patch, and maize maze with lots of small to medium pumpkins in the week running up to Halloween. Reasonably priced âœŒï¸

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Richardson
recent_reviews.text: Lovely new little pick your own pumpkins, just getting started on its feet and we had a lovely time, thank you and look forward to watching your business grow

recent_reviews.author: Dean Cardey (FlyingMower)
recent_reviews.text: Rural Herefordshire location farm with conference facilities. Easy drive from Hereford, Worcester, Ledbury, Malvern. Ample parking.

recent_reviews.author: Nigel Winters
recent_reviews.text: Great place, brilliant entrepreneurs.

recent_reviews.author: Kelly Short
recent_reviews.text: We came here during half term and were slightly disappointed. Not much in the way of things to do for the kids, the barn was full of wasps so you couldn't sit down without being swarmed by them. I came with my vegan friend and her children and found there was nothing for them to eat. The lady selling brownies had one option which was good and the coffee stand had oat milk but just nothing in the way of us being able to have lunch there and make more of a day of it. On the other hand we managed to get some fab pumpkins, had a laugh at the skeletons dotted around and met some nice people.

recent_reviews.author: Geoff Watts
recent_reviews.text: Great fun and well organised. Good value pumpkins and some great activities for the kids

recent_reviews.author: J M
recent_reviews.text:
Nice place for pumpkin picking but unfortunately we had a slight issue, accidentally booked too many car parking tickets, explained to a lady that claimed to be the owner and she point blank refused to give us any sort of refund and was fairly rude.
It was our mistake and we weren't expecting to get completely refunded but something would have been nice as a gesture of good will. Such a shame as we found the rest of the staff to be very welcoming.

recent_reviews.author: Yvonne Brown
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant afternoon out. Lots for the kids to do and massive pumpkin patch to pick your pumpkins

pumpkin_patches.address: Moor Court Farm, Stretton Grandison, Ledbury HR8 2TP

recent_reviews.author: Rhiannon Hughes
recent_reviews.text: We love coming here, seeing all the animals, climbing the bale castle, the walk up to the pumpkin sign, wheel barrow races and picking as many pumpkins as we can carry in the barrow. Hot choc and cake is a must too while the kids explore the barn. We love it so much we came twice this year!

recent_reviews.author: chloe jones
recent_reviews.text: Excellent family fun day so much to do and see always something new each year with so much choice. So well planned everything is thought of. Excellent addition this year with hot food available on certain dates if needed and to finish off the homemade cakes and hot/cold drinks are amazing! X

recent_reviews.author: Faye Carter
recent_reviews.text: Amazing place so much more than just pumpkins it's a full day out of fun. Lots of animals to see and pet and loads of themed games. Lots of choice of pumpkins ğŸƒ will be going again for sure!

recent_reviews.author: Lucy
recent_reviews.text:
What a fantastic place too visit. We had a wonderful time and could of stayed for hours. The time and effort that gets put in by the Powell family is top notch.

Will definitely visit again next year! Thank you

recent_reviews.author: Debby Lewis-Harrison
recent_reviews.text: Barney and Jenny are very friendly and helpful. The shop is really well stocked with lots of homemade produce as well as eggs and bread. The pumpkins are wonderful, many different varieties and very pretty. Well worth a visit all year but especially in pumpkin season.

recent_reviews.author: Rae L
recent_reviews.text: I would like to HEAVILY compliment whoever makes the Victorian sponge cakes here they are wonderful, heavenly ğŸ¤¤ğŸ’—, never been to this farm shop before and I HIGHLY recommend ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ» fresh farm honey, farm made jams, homemade cakes and cookies, loads of small gifts HOMEMADE HOME PRESSED APPLE JUICE!!! Incredible. They sell homemade pizza doughs/ goats cheese pastries with olive oil as well which you can tell are handcrafted. Truly wonderful little store, beautiful, again thank you whoever made those heavenly cakes ğŸ¥°

recent_reviews.author: Rickey Shaw
recent_reviews.text: Visited shop yesterday. Took awhile to work out the payment system. From London not use to honesty payments. Food looks brilliant and had everything l needed. will be back when in area.

recent_reviews.author: D J
recent_reviews.text: We love going to Rumblers Farm Shop. Everybody is very friendly and helpful. The pumpkins ğŸƒ are very good quality and very fairly priced. The shop is excellent with a large range of quality products. We particularly like the homemade cakes and cold drinks. All my family would highly recommend Rumblers Farm Shop to all. It is great to support a local business.

pumpkin_patches.address: Potten End Hill, Water End, Hemel Hempstead HP1 3BN

recent_reviews.author: James Matthews
recent_reviews.text:
I cant speak highly enough of this farm.
I, along with some friends have camped here for the second year in a row, and we love it. The farm is so well kept with such detail on the experience of both the animals, and the public. The animals are clearly very well looked after, and the staff are very friendly and they also hire people with special needs to help with the animals, which just tops it off for me.

Will be coming back yearly!

recent_reviews.author: Joel Burman
recent_reviews.text: Mixed experience camping at Ardley with my family. It's a very densely packed camping field, and the guidance about no amplified music or loud noise late into the night are sadly not respected. Lots of large groups, some loudly using foul language late into the night soiled our first night. After decamping and moving away from the noisier group, we had a pleasant second night. Other notes: Compost toilets are well maintained, the woodland play area is tired and small, staff were generally friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Shaun Lundy
recent_reviews.text: We always love camping at Church Ardeley Farm. The staff and facilities are brilliant. Super helpful when our inflatable mattress sprung a leak and they kindly loaned us one. You can have a real fire which is rare these days. The cafe and shop are wonderful. Thoroughly recommend it.

recent_reviews.author: gemcart
recent_reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at their Easter event.  We did the Easter egg hunt, fairy trail and lamb bottle feeding. We hadn't been before but my daughter loved it and so did I.  We will definitely be back.  All of the staff were so friendly and helpful and had loads of time and patience for the children.  Animals were clearly very well looked after and super friendly which makes the experience for the children even better.  We shall definitely be back!

recent_reviews.author: Fotoulla Pantazis
recent_reviews.text: I visited a wonderful small farm where the animals are lovely and well cared for. Thereâ€™s a charming little farm shop as well. I bought some mint-flavored lamb chops, which were amazingâ€”good-sized and thick, making them incredibly tasty. I highly recommend visiting and supporting local farms, especially this one. The staff, particularly Sadie, are fantastic; they are friendly and willing to talk to you about the animals. My sons had a great time holding the rabbits, guinea pigs, and even a tortoise.friendly and willing to talk to you about the animals. My sons had a great time holding the rabbits, guinea pigs, and even a tortoise.

recent_reviews.author: Jennifer Morrison
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing little place.  It isn't very big but we managed to spend 2 hours here! The staff are so friendly and helpful.  We saw goats, donkeys, horses, sheep, pigs, chickens, guinea pigs and bunnies.

The little shop is very cute and if you are lucky they'll be hot sausage rolls :)
It is Â£4 per person and that includes a cup of goat feed each.

Lovely little collection of small tractors and diggers for little ones to play on.

There is a porta loo and a place to wash your hands but not a real toilet. Just a heads up for anyone taking smaller children who need nappy changes.

recent_reviews.author: Kelly A
recent_reviews.text: This is a lovely place to visit. As it's local, we go quite often. We love going to see the various animals, buy some delicious items from their shop, and attend the various events Farmer Liv puts on. Olivia has worked very hard to make this an educational and fun place for children. The Farm offers Home Ed day trips as well as lots of other exciting events. I think it's wonderful that Farmer Liv and her family have decided to share their home with all of us, you can see just how much they all love it ğŸ˜€

recent_reviews.author: Georgina Waterhouse
recent_reviews.text: This farm is amazing, we had our daughterâ€™s joint party on Saturday, great value for money. We are based in Enfield town only an 20mins drive door to door plenty of parking.  All the children had an amazing time all the parents really enjoyed themselves. We have visited the farm prior for mini farmer experience and pony grooming and they really are the most educational and interesting experiences. Thank you Amanda and Sadie we canâ€™t wait to see you soon.

pumpkin_patches.address: Appleby Street Farm, Cheshunt, Waltham Cross EN7 6QT

recent_reviews.author: HSS TruthSeeker
recent_reviews.text: What an absolutely lovely afternoon we had with yourselves. Your staff were very nice and very polite. Lots of parking. The different lavenders were lovely to see, smell  and pick. The benches strategically placed at the top of the lavender lanes was an excellent resting stop. My only complaint was paying Â£10 for four cans of coke and Â£6 for a tea & coffee was a little steep but otherwise, a great time was had by all.

recent_reviews.author: Bibi TM
recent_reviews.text: Hitchin Lavender is such a beautiful place to visit. The fields are stunning, filled with rows of vibrant lavender that make the perfect setting for a peaceful walk and lovely photos. The atmosphere is calm and relaxing, and the scent of lavender everywhere is just amazing. The cafÃ© is a nice touch too, offering tasty treats and drinks. Itâ€™s a wonderful day out for families, couples, or anyone who enjoys nature.

recent_reviews.author: Julie Vickers
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely ğŸ’¯ beautiful experience. Wonderful atmosphere. Gorgeous place and definitely worth a visit. Our second visit and itâ€™s better than the last. The Weather was hot â˜€ï¸ and nice ğŸ˜Š All staff were nice and friendly. The Lavender Fields was vibrant with colour and the smells were amazing. Food was delicious ğŸ˜‹ and delightful. The lavender ice cream ğŸ¦ was amazing. Lavender lemonade was delicious and very refreshing. Overall we had a fantastic experience. Everyone should visit Hitchin Lavender. Iâ€™ve come with my family from Manchester.

recent_reviews.author: Karthik Raj Dara
recent_reviews.text:
I went to Hitchin Lavender Farm yesterday and honestly, it was such a lovely experience. The moment you arrive, youâ€™re welcomed by the calming fragrance of lavender floating through the air. The fields are absolutely stunning, rows and rows of purple stretching as far as you can see. Itâ€™s peaceful, beautiful, and just a great place to slow down and enjoy nature.

The food was a pleasant surprise too! I had a lavender ice cream cone (delicious), some lavender lemonade, and even lavender chips â€“ which were way better than I expected. Thereâ€™s also plenty of other food and drink options if lavender isnâ€™t your thing, but if youâ€™re up for trying something different, this is the place. Also, thereâ€™s a vegan options available.

I picked up a small bag of lavender to take home for Â£4/- and my room smells like a spa now. We ended up chilling under the tents with a cold beer, just soaking in the vibe. The people around were super friendly and interesting, everyone seemed to be enjoying the day, and the atmosphere felt very relaxed and welcoming.

One little disappointment was that I didnâ€™t get to enjoy the sunset, because the farm closes at 8 PM, and it wouldâ€™ve been amazing to see the sun go down over those purple fields. Hopefully theyâ€™ll consider staying open a bit later during peak season.

On the practical side, the toilets were very neat and clean, which I always appreciate when youâ€™re spending a whole day outdoors.

All in all, I had a great time and would definitely go back. Itâ€™s the kind of place that makes you want to return year after year. If youâ€™re looking for a peaceful escape not too far, Iâ€™d definitely recommend it.

pumpkin_patches.address: Cadwell farm, Arlesey Rd, Ickleford, Hitchin SG5 3UA

recent_reviews.author: Mark
recent_reviews.text: We had a brilliant family day out at Tapnell Farm on the Isle of Wight! As two adults and two children, we found there was so much to keep everyone happy. The kids loved meeting the animals, racing around the adventure play areas, and splashing about at the fantastic Aqua Park â€“ definitely a highlight of the day! We also enjoyed a lovely meal at The Cow restaurant, which had delicious food and a really friendly, relaxed atmosphere. Everything was clean, well organised, and set in such a beautiful location. A perfect mix of fun, food, and fresh air â€“ we canâ€™t wait to come back!

recent_reviews.author: Kat Howard
recent_reviews.text: We visited here when we were on holiday. It is a fantastic place to take your children. We have a 1 and 3 year old and they had the best time. The indoor soft play was fantastic and clean. As it was a hot day there was plenty of things to do while keeping out of the sun. Especially the shaded picnic area which was outside. My toddler loved the go karts and the inflatable obstacle course. Lots to do and see. Would totally recommend coming here!

recent_reviews.author: Emily Horsey
recent_reviews.text: What a brilliant place. We started the day with the toddler group, Thursday 10am. Leonie was super friendly and let our girls play, sing, paint and make music. The farm itself is in excellent surroundings, the animals all look so well cared for. We enjoyed the sandpit, trampolines, play area, bouncy pillow and all the animals. My nearly 2 year old adored brushing the guinea pigs. Thanks for a super day! Highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Tom Duggan
recent_reviews.text: Great place for the kids. Went with a toddler and plenty to do and enjoy. Was very clean and everything looked extremely well kept. Animals were happy, selection of animals inside and out. Inside and outside play areas so would be good in all weathers. Didnâ€™t go in the soft play as the weather was lovely but this also looked great. We went in March so was quiet and brilliant that we got to use everything without any waits. Meant we didnâ€™t have to book either but it is slightly cheaper buying online, Â£1. Also very good that there were no extra charges for some of the play equipment unlike some park farms. Shop and cafe and plenty of parking.

pumpkin_patches.address: Tapnell Farm House, Newport Rd, Yarmouth PO41 0YJ

recent_reviews.author: Ross Taylor
recent_reviews.text:
What a fantastic experience we had today! Our first time of visiting and we couldnâ€™t believe how much we enjoyed ourselves, the kids had a great time running through the pumpkin patches and gathering clues at the same time as finding the biggest pumpkins they could!

We managed to fill a barrel load, enjoy a cup of tea and then bring the pumpkins home ready for carving next week.

Would definitely recommend this rather than buying you pumpkins from the super market, supporting local is better and in this case so much more fun too!

recent_reviews.author: Leif Marriner
recent_reviews.text: Great time with the little pumpkins picking their own Pumpkins. How wonderful to see a real Pumpkin Patch and getting the kids to experience and  explore.

recent_reviews.author: shelley williams
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing experience. The staff are really helpful and friendly and the children are able to choose their pumpkins in a relaxed and enjoyable environment.

recent_reviews.author: Jamie Adams
recent_reviews.text:
The BEST pumpkin picking we have done by far!
So much to choose from, just help yourself or ask for pumpkins to be cut for you.
There was a little challenge for the kids to find letters. Find them all to spell a word and win a prize!

Huge site, plenty of space for parking. Would go just for a walk around the patches.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: The Garlic Farm Shop And Restaurant

recent_reviews.author: Michael Kwan
recent_reviews.text:
ğŸŒŸThe Garlic Farm â€“ Sandown, Isle of WightğŸŒŸ

A lovely stop! The shop is nicely kept â€“ clean, well presented, and everything is laid out in a way thatâ€™s really appealing. Thereâ€™s a great range of garlic-themed goodies, perfect for gifts or personal treats.

I also bought a bottle of Cold Garlic Beer to try â€“ an interesting one! To me, it tasted a bit like a watery Guinness. Not really to my taste, but I can see how some people might enjoy it for the novelty.

Plenty of free parking made the visit easy and stress-free. Definitely worth a stop if youâ€™re nearby!

recent_reviews.author: Jia Chuan Khong
recent_reviews.text:
Definitely worth visiting this farm that you could easily spend your whole afternoon there. The place is well kept and all the staff were really friendly. Highly recommended!! The farm shop is really nice (in both look and smell) and the products looked really good in quality. We definitely loaded ourselves with lots of garlics ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£
The restaurant is packed during lunch. Unfortunately we didn't make a booking so we ended up just having some scones, cheese board and ice cream after lunch time. The lunch menu looks really nice though!
Oh yes, the staff at the restaurant also treat our pet tortoise Mochi a proper served free strawberry =)
We will definitely revisit again in the future!!

recent_reviews.author: Abhijeet Roy
recent_reviews.text: A highly recommended place to go for the nature enthusiasts. The farm is huge and presents a detailed history of garlic. Their shop is very nice and have huge collection of garlic based products. Overall, it was a nice place to visit.

recent_reviews.author: Grant Challifour
recent_reviews.text: Came here after finding this place on Google and oh my it didn't disappoint. There is soo much to do here with the family and has a wide variety of products that are just soo tasty. We also went for breakfast here and it was lovely, wonderfully presented and came rather fast after we ordered, and was served with their own 2 kinds of ketchup (the black garlic ketchup was amazing but the garlic ketchup was too vinegary in my opinion) it was a good breakfast however my criticism of this is that it would be better with chargrilled bacon rather than having hot held bacon (could definitely tell it was hot held bacon as it was starting to turn a bit leathery) also maybe having the addition of a hash brown or black/white pudding. The servers were lovely and helpful people and the coffees that we got were amazing quality. If your in the IOW then definitely take a detour here as it will be worth your time.

recent_reviews.author: Paul Cocker
recent_reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay in eco-pod 2. The pods come with everything you need and there were no less than three towel animals waiting for us! Tapnell farm have thought of everything to make your stay easy and my son loved playing at the farm park during the day.

recent_reviews.author: Steven Flynn
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely loved our stay at Tapnell Farm, we stayed in lovely cabin just on the edge of the farm, it had wonderful views and was very quiet, with its own terrace and small garden area. Was very comfortable for 4 adults, 2 children, and a baby. We were able to book with a special offer that included ferry travel and farm entry making it good value,  in high season though its a bit on the pricey side. That said, the accommodation is great, we'll kitted out (even WiFi!), everything is clean, and works!  There was charcoal provided for the BBQ and you can get free eggs from the Farm shop. I would recommend the place to everyone, if your budget can stretch to it!

recent_reviews.author: Duncan Higgs
recent_reviews.text: Good accommodation and tasty food in The Cow cafe.

recent_reviews.author: Fajer Fawaz
recent_reviews.text: Our favorite vacation spot in the UK ğŸ¤©

pumpkin_patches.address: â’ Tapnell Farm House, Newport Rd, Yarmouth PO41 0YJ

recent_reviews.author: Lucy Warwick
recent_reviews.text:
Just back from a few days stay here and honestly cannot fault anything about our stay. As a family we've stayed in many places which claim to cater for families ( including some of the best 5* ones but this is by far the best yet ). They have thought of everything especially for little ones (including the toilet seats!) and for parents it is these little details - plus the fact the setting is so very beautiful and super safe - which make a holiday SO enjoyable & relaxing (not something you can often say with a toddler in tow!)

It is the perfect destination not just for families, I'd happily return just with my husband or with a group of friends for an escape or special occasion  - it is so well located for local restaurants, activities (Tapnell Farm Park is brilliant!) and great beaches plus only 10 minutes from the Ferry port.

A particular shout out to both Chloe & Amanda who ensured the everything was perfect and responded to any of our needs day or night before & during our stay - THANK YOU! We will be returning.

recent_reviews.author: Si Man (The Si-Man)
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful, Peaceful Eco Cabin. It was a lovely location and a cute little cabin. The booking process was amazing, really friendly and so helpful! It was really easy with them to book. I had a great time there. The little outside fire pit was great with unlimited wood & bits you needed. Amazing presentation on arrival. I would have given it 5 stars but a few small things let it down. The cutlery and utensils were all dirty and we had to rewash them before they could be used. There was a funky smell in the bath room but that did leave after we run the shower. All in all a great time. We would 100% go again.

recent_reviews.author: Sophie Forster
recent_reviews.text: We had such a wonderful time here last weekend. We are a family with two very high energy young children aged 2 and 5 so it is nothing short of a miracle that we both actually felt relaxed after our stay here! The place was perfect for kids, they had so much fun running around, visiting the play farm. Family meals at the outdoor table, whether it was breakfast or a BBQ, was really special with the view over the hills to the sea. And the evenings in the hot tub after kids in bed were wonderful. We had a meal in the cow pub, sitting at an outdoor table and being able to relax and enjoy our meal while kids ran around the colourful cow sculptures. I hesitated to book because it is more than I would usually spend but it was worth every penny. The local area has family friendly and beautiful beaches nearby. I would highly recommend to families with young children, it is really the first holiday with them where we actually got to relax!

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Richardson
recent_reviews.text: We had the most AMAZING AMAZING stay.  We recently rented one of the new dome tents and just had the best time.  Everything was so easy from start to finish.  We called up and booked directly with the lovely team at the lodge.  They even informed us of a special offer running the week we wanted to go.  They arranged everything for us from the bike hire to the breakfast hamper and they were so accommodating.  When we arrived the tent was spotless and warm and cosy and so welcoming.  We used the bbq and sat and watched the sunsets and took advantage of the on site restaurant which serves delicious food and there is a great happy hour in the bar!  I will definitely be booking a return trip and I highly recommend the farm and itâ€™s perfect location.  We donâ€™t have children but there were loads of facilities to entertain young ones and the bathrooms were so clean and well kept up. A truly magical stay and I hope itâ€™s not too long before I return.  Thank you to all the team at Toms Eco Lodge it was wonderful xx

pumpkin_patches.address: Tom's Eco, â’ Tapnell Farm House, Newport Rd, Yarmouth PO41 0YJ

recent_reviews.author: Leah Z
recent_reviews.text:
I was intrigued by the onion tower at the table next to us, so I decided to order one ğŸ§… Unfortunately, it was a big disappointmentâ€”the coating was far too hard (maybe too much flour in the batter?) and the texture was unpleasant. It should have been light and crispy, but instead felt heavy.

The burger came with chips and the portion size was decent. I tried The Big Smoke, which was fine but not particularly memorable. What really let the dish down were the chips. They didnâ€™t taste fresh or good qualityâ€”when you bit into them, they had hollow gaps inside instead of a fluffy, mashed potato filling.
On the positive side, the service was excellent. The staff were friendly, attentive, and quick to provide tap water. The restaurant itself has a cool, unique vibe, and even though it wasnâ€™t lunchtime, I noticed people coming in to eatâ€”so I imagine it gets lively during dinner hours.

recent_reviews.author: Jerome Meadows
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous dining here at the cow. The service was fantastic the food was full of flavour and presented perfectly the dirty fries were awesome. The burgers were juicy and full of flavour by far the best burger I've had on the island. The whole table thoroughly enjoyed their food and deserts. Free table water aswell is a fantastic touch even the lemon and lime slices were put in the correct drinks as an ex bartender this was a very nice touch that gets forgotten far to much in my opinion. I would highly recommend a meal here for the family if your looking for a nice place to eat with some amazing deals.

recent_reviews.author: Vishnu Vallathparambil
recent_reviews.text:
If youâ€™re on the Isle of Wight and craving a seriously good burger, The Cow should be high on your list. As they proudly advertise, they serve one of the tastiest burgers on the islandâ€”and they certainly live up to the claim. Juicy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection, the burgers here are a standout.

The atmosphere is welcoming and casual, complemented by a team of friendly and attentive staff who make you feel right at home. Prices are reasonable, especially considering the quality of the food, and itâ€™s a great spot for families or groups of friends looking for a satisfying meal.

The venue is clean and well-kept, with spotless toilets that reflect their attention to detail. While the food is well-priced, the cocktails are on the pricier side, which may be a small downside for those looking to pair their meal with a few drinks.

Note: The Cow is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays, so plan your visit accordingly.

recent_reviews.author: Fazlollah Sadeghi
recent_reviews.text:
An amazing restaurant in the fields offering the best locally made burgers from their own grown cows.
The experience is unforgettable.
It's just like my old memories of visiting Jeju Island in South Korea.

pumpkin_patches.address: â’ Tapnell Farm House, Newport Rd, Yarmouth PO41 0YJ

recent_reviews.author: Klijn Evert
recent_reviews.text: Nice place to go to

recent_reviews.author: Jordan Fairweather
recent_reviews.text:
We had the most incredible experience at East Afton Farmhouse â€“ it truly was the perfect wedding venue from start to finish. From the moment we started planning, the team made everything feel so easy and stress-free. Chloe was absolutely amazing in the lead-up to the big day â€“ so helpful, responsive, and calm, which made such a difference.

On the day itself, Mel and Lisa went above and beyond to make sure everything ran smoothly. We honestly canâ€™t thank them enough â€“ they were fantastic. Every single detail was taken care of, and we felt so supported throughout. The whole team was so organised, professional, and kind.

The venue itself is absolutely beautiful â€“ so many of our guests commented on how stunning it was. Getting to stay in the farmhouse for three days made the celebrations feel even more special and gave us time to really soak it all in. It felt like a dream from beginning to end.

Thank you, East Afton, for helping to make our day so unforgettable. Weâ€™re beyond grateful.

recent_reviews.author: Megan Andrews
recent_reviews.text:
A Truly Exceptional and Personal Wedding Experience at East Afton Farmhouse!

We are beyond grateful to East Afton Farmhouse for making our wedding weekend absolutely perfect! From the moment we rented the venue for the long weekend, we were made to feel right at home. Chloe, the venue coordinator, was incredibly attentive and helpful throughout the entire planning process. She went above and beyond, ensuring every detail was covered and offering guidance whenever we needed it. We felt completely supported and in safe hands.

On the day of the wedding, Mel and her amazing team took over as the on-the-day coordinators. They truly made us feel at ease with their warm personalities, jokes, and laughter. Not only did they make us feel comfortable, but they were also incredibly professional and on top of everything. Every last-minute detail that we thought we might forget, they were there to handle, making sure everything ran smoothly without us having to worry. Their attention to detail was outstanding.

What really stood out was the personal touch and genuine care that Chloe, Mel, and the whole team provided. They didnâ€™t just coordinate the wedding; they became a part of it, offering heartfelt support that made us feel like we were surrounded by friends rather than just vendors. Their dedication and love for what they do were clear in every aspect of our experience.

We also have to mention the outstanding catering team, Seasoned Kitchen. The food was nothing short of exceptional, and the execution was flawless. From the presentation to the flavors, every dish was perfect. Our guests couldnâ€™t stop raving about the meal, and it truly added to the overall experience, making our day even more memorable.

If youâ€™re looking for a venue that will not only provide a stunning setting but also a team that makes you feel truly valued and cared for, East Afton Farmhouse and Seasoned Kitchen are the places to choose. Their attention to detail, professionalism, and genuine care will make your wedding day unforgettable. We cannot thank them enough for making our day so magical and special. East Afton Farmhouse, Seasoned Kitchen, and the entire teamâ€”thank you, thank you, thank you!

recent_reviews.author: Steve Rogers
recent_reviews.text:
What a stunning weekend! Such a beautiful bride Megan Andrews and an excellent venue at East Afton Farmhouse, thank you everyone for making such a memorable day
And sorry for any confusion over the rating posted earlier - I have no idea where Google got the 3 stars from, but youâ€™re definitely a 5 star venue!

recent_reviews.author: Miguel Equina
recent_reviews.text: Great venue and amazing wait staff! Went to wedding here from the US and was amazing on the venue and how pretty it was.

recent_reviews.author: Clinton Foot
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful farm lovely owners.

recent_reviews.author: Ben Jayston
recent_reviews.text: Picked up a dog for a friend. Nice farm cats and the cows were amusing.

recent_reviews.author: Lee Croysdale
recent_reviews.text: this is definitely one of the most old school looking honest little farm with bags of character and run by the nicest people if you got lost and ended up in the court yard looking for some help or just turned up to look around and take some photos you couldn't ask for a better bunch of people than this farm hard honest and run like a farm from back in the day I wish all farms were a bit more like this a bit off the beaten track... but well worth a day finding it great scenery around it as well... get out there and have an adventure...

recent_reviews.author: Joshua Gardiner
recent_reviews.text: Really nice place

recent_reviews.author: harrison wadhams
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing afternoon at Erriotwood Pumkins! My partner & I took our 2 year old daughter there today and we all loved it.
Very easy to find, plenty of parking and very family friendly. Huge variety of pumpkins to find and choose from, with a scarecrow hunt too! Pizza, ice cream, & coffee all available to buy when there. Just big enough for the family, but not too large to get lost in. The family were very friendly and helpful and even created a spooky shack for pictures and a laugh. Will definitely be back next year! Thanks guys!

recent_reviews.author: lucy brown
recent_reviews.text:
I visited Erriot Wood pumpkins last weekend and had the most wholesome and spooky day out!

They had a range of activities such as their spooky scarecrow hunt which can I say was highly unique and creative particularly as they were all homemade! Additionally the pizza stand they had was delicious!

For a new pumpkin business I was highly impressed by the organisation of the patch and the dedication of the staff working. They made our day very special and weâ€™re all very friendly and welcoming.

I found that they had a super pumpkins selection and was all such a reasonable price in comparison to other patchâ€™s I have visited in previous years.

Overall I would highly recommend Erriot wood pumpkins for a spooky and wholesome day out!

recent_reviews.author: Lloyd Hewitt
recent_reviews.text: Had a great time pumpkin picking with family, plenty to choose from all different types. Will be back next year ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Harvey
recent_reviews.text: Had a great time at the pumpkin patch last year. Lots of photo opportunities. My niece absolutely loved finding all the scarecrows! Canâ€™t wait for this year!

recent_reviews.author: Lana S
recent_reviews.text: What an amazing place, so much fun for the entire family! Beautiful pumpkins and decorations ğŸƒğŸ‚ğŸ THE best place in UK for pumpkin picking.

recent_reviews.author: Kaye Travers
recent_reviews.text: Best place for pumpkins, such lovely people greeting you and thanking you for supporting them. Stunning views, tea, coffee and food available at reasonable prices. Got some fabulous pumpkins and the all important photos of the nephew at the purpose built staging areas

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Goddard
recent_reviews.text: Great place for pumpkin picking! Organised car park, food and drinks on site, cash or card payment accepted. Pumpkins already picked and in boxes or a walk round the field to pick your own with a wheelbarrow provided. Fabulous family fun!

recent_reviews.author: Pete Fortvilelse
recent_reviews.text:
Stunning farm, lovely views and surroundings and the best place to get pumpkins around Halloween
At the moment it is a private farm and only open to the public during the week before halloween.
There is a bridal path that runs through and is a lovely walk over to selling church.

pumpkin_patches.address: saffery farm nr faversham, Selling, Faversham ME13 9QN

recent_reviews.author: Isabella
recent_reviews.text:
The food always looks fresh and the staff are extremely friendly And cheerful and also haven't seen such huge parsnips in my life! Plus the russet apple juice is absolutely AMAZING!!
Highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Liam Stone
recent_reviews.text:
Great farm shop which has a large selection of fresh fruit, vegetables and meats.

Large variety here and was highly recommend. Itâ€™s very clean and clear.

recent_reviews.author: Lynne Thomas
recent_reviews.text: Now living in Cambridge I knew there was only one farm shop for me when I wanted to stock up and travelled down to get some fabulous rolls, bread, meat pies, fruit pies, sausages, cakes, crisps, fruit and veg and not forgetting biscuits.  I'll be back for mugs! Fabulous Farm Shop in a beautiful setting.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah O'Connor
recent_reviews.text: A hidden gem with a great range of farm and local produce. Pet food and supplies. Not the cheapest but you get what you pay for. Last visit I bought fresh honey comb and freshly made Easter cakes

pumpkin_patches.address: Manor Farm, New Barn Rd, Gravesend DA13 9PU

recent_reviews.author: Gemma Skinner
recent_reviews.text:
We visited on the 9th of August and had a brilliant time getting lost in the maze, we got out eventually after many failed attempts and a lot of laughs. Treated ourselves to a lovely icecream and then strolled and picked some sunflowers which lasted a good week at home.

Staff were welcoming and friendly, they had two different places to pay depending if you was paying cash or card. Plenty of places to park.

Would recommend and will be coming back

recent_reviews.author: Kerrie Marchington
recent_reviews.text: Great for kids (and adults) of all ages.    A little fun thing to do if you only have a couple of hours to spare. There is a mobile cafe selling hot and cold drinks. As well as an ice-cream van selling a large selection of ice-cream. I had a biscoff sundae which was amazing.

recent_reviews.author: Joanna Brunt
recent_reviews.text:
Fab maze in maize! They've made a great effort with the treasure hunt. My nieces and nephew love it. The maze isn't open all year round, hence people moaning that it's closed. 2024 dates are:

Friday, August 2, to Sunday, August 4; Thursday, August 8 to Sunday, August 11; and Thursday, August 15 to Sunday, August 18 from 10am to 4pm.

recent_reviews.author: Emi Kay
recent_reviews.text: Personally loved it. Got lost in the maze and spend 1 hour walking around. Small lids got bored because it is only maze. 12 year olds got into navigating and following map. They  have set up a lovely game for finding letters etc. I would not go back but I liked the experience.

recent_reviews.author: Nichola Leon
recent_reviews.text:
The event is well organised, and the kids enjoyed it, however the prices are astronomical. I can't see how they can justify Â£4 for a tiny pumpkin, some were as much as Â£60! I picked up what I would say is not a very large pumpkin at all and it was Â£14.
If all my children picked a pumpkin this size I would have paid Â£42 for 3 medium size pumpkins!
Seeing the prices really put a dampener on the event, I had to tell the kids go put the pumpkins back and we just got one. I understand that it is for charity but I got 3 monster pumpkins at lidl for Â£9 total.

The photos are of a pumpkin that cost Â£14, I have put my hand in for size reference.
Please consider the prices before you have disappointed kids.

recent_reviews.author: Katie Calder
recent_reviews.text:
I visited this pumpkin patch with a class for a school trip and was pleasantly surprised - so I returned with my own children the next weekend.
It is only a small patch, but was full of many pumpkins of different shapes, sizes, colours and other marrows/squashes too. There are little wooden props and photo opportunities too, which my kids enjoyed. Good parking facilities and of reasonable value.

I felt, in comparison to other large branded pumpkin patches, the value was decent and the staff were willing to measure the pumpkins fairly to get the fairest price. Of course, you can get bigger pumpkins for cheaper in supermarkets, but it's the experience and tradition that we go for.
We got 4 small-medium pumpkins, which will look great on our doorstep, for Â£14 and felt this was fine. If you're struggling for price, our tip would be to go for slimmer pumpkins over wide  flat ones. They are measured on width. But there is a guide price section at the entrance which was really helpful.

Most of the pumpkins in the patch were of good quality. The second time I went, it had rained so the ground was slightly soggy but controlled well so it wasn't very muddy at all (this is the first place we've not needed wellies and puddlesuits!), and the staff were wonderful! So chatty, helpful and fair. No pushing for products but happy to discuss. It's got a wholesome and family feel to it, which would certainly make me return next year.

Additionally, we explored the garden centre which was lovely and surprisingly large, the farm shop which is well stocked, and the cafe which was beautiful (we didn't buy anything this time, but it all looked delicious, freshly made  and wa super busy meaning it's clearly a hit with the locals!).

Overall we were really happy with the trip and the service received.

recent_reviews.author: Chris Jinks
recent_reviews.text:
Took our two boys to Pumpkin picking, unlike loads I've been before they actually priced Pumpkins are a reasonable price, got 3 good sized Pumpkins for a tenner.

Stopped at the cafe and read about the charity, seems like a lovely place, will definitely be returning, the whole place seems excellently run.

recent_reviews.author: Veronica S
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little patch! My kids had great fun picking their pumpkin. We purchased 3 smallish pumkins for Â£3 each which was reasonable given its a charity! Would definitely recommend

pumpkin_patches.address: Spadework Charity PYO Pumpkin Garden Spadework, Teston Rd, Offham, West Malling ME19 5NA

recent_reviews.author: Saadia Arshad
recent_reviews.text: I have been a regular visitor and each one has been a lovely experience! The staff at farm are friendly and welcoming. We enjoyed tea and cake in the cafe. Came back with buckets of apples and pears. Will certainly be back again soon. Thank you team!

recent_reviews.author: Clare-louise Turner
recent_reviews.text: My family and I love visiting every year for pumpkin picking. Free parking, no booking required, great selection of pumpkins. The food is great, and you can pay by card in all areas.

recent_reviews.author: Venti Lana
recent_reviews.text: The best day ! We went to visit the farm for some Apple pears and pumpkin picking. We came back with our bags full of squashes, and lovely fruits we handpicked ourselves, and had a lovely day. People were so friendly and helpful. We saw many visitors coming back with beautiful sunflowers as well. We will come back for the Christmas season as well. It really makes a perfect day out of London for families and couples. Thank you !

recent_reviews.author: Tochai Kabs
recent_reviews.text:
Not a bad experience.
However, directions into the farm were inadequate & there wasn't much fruits  to pick at the time we got there, so we made our way back out almost immediately.
We bought a bottle each of fresh apple & pear juice - so refreshing and natural.

recent_reviews.author: Ğ¡Ğ½Ñ–Ğ¶Ğ°Ğ½Ğ° Ğ‘Ğ»Ğ°Ğ¶ĞµĞ²ÑÑŒĞºĞ°
recent_reviews.text: The sunflower field at Castle Farm is a true wonder of nature that captivates you at first sight. Endless rows of tall golden sunflowers make you feel as if youâ€™ve stepped into a sea of sunshine and warmth. The atmosphere is both peaceful and majestic â€“ the flowers seem to smile at you, filling the soul with joy and harmony. Itâ€™s a perfect place to spend a relaxing weekend in peace and quiet, enjoy the beauty around you, sip a delicious coffee, and escape the hustle and bustle of the city. An ideal spot for a walk, stunning photos, and a real recharge. The impressions are so vivid that youâ€™ll want to return again and again. ğŸŒğŸŒ»

recent_reviews.author: Caroline Zentbando
recent_reviews.text:
Castle Farm is a true lavender dream nestled in the Kent countryside. The views are absolutely breathtaking, rows and rows of fragrant purple stretching as far as the eye can see. Itâ€™s a peaceful and soul soothing place, perfect for a summer escape or a dreamy photo session.
The staff were kind and the whole experience felt very well organized. I especially loved the little farm shop where you can buy lavender oil, local honey, and handmade gifts.
The only downside is that youâ€™re allowed only one hour in the field, which feels a bit rushed when you just want to relax and enjoy the moment. Thatâ€™s the reason for my 4 star rating.
Still, I truly recommend visiting during peak bloom, it's a magical experience that stays with you. ğŸ’œ

recent_reviews.author: Sam Lonsdale
recent_reviews.text: My partner and I came here in late July for a lavendar field walk and distillery tour. It was well set up and very pleasant despite the weather taking a turn. They have the number 1 farm shop in the UK as of this year and was overall very enjoyable, however if you intend to visit this farm while it is in full bloom unfortunately you are too late to do so this year, as they have now harvested the fields.

recent_reviews.author: MS.PUNNAPATS TTWSW
recent_reviews.text:
I heard that the farm would open ticket sales before the lavender blooms, so I rushed to book on the very first day, just in case it sold out! It was my first time visiting a lavender field, so I chose the Guided Lavender Field & Distillery Tour, hoping to learn something new.

The field was beautiful and felt quite private for photos, but the time allowed for taking pictures was a bit too short.

After the tour, we bought another tickets to walk around the other lavender field, different type of ticket, just to take more photos, we hadn't had enough yet! Andhe flowers are only in bloom for just over a month.

I tried the lavender latte, but it didn't smell like lavender at all. However, the lavender ice cream was absolutely amazing! So fragrant and delicious, we were truly impressed!

ğŸ’œWe all had a lovely day.ğŸ’œ

recent_reviews.author: Joe Livsley
recent_reviews.text: Really impressed overall. Entry is reasonably priced considering the range of activities included. There's a great mix for kids â€“ indoor soft play, multiple outdoor areas, and the dinosaur section was a big hit, actually better than I expected! Food is a bit on the pricey side (as it is most places these days), but there are loads of picnic spots if you want to bring your own. Definitely worth a visit with young ones.

recent_reviews.author: Chris Meekin
recent_reviews.text:
Brilliant little farm that has so much to do. Great for both adults and little ones, with a large play area, great variety of animals to see and interact with, a shop, food van and ice cream parlour. We went on an Easter event weekend as we were able to feed the lambs as part of the entry fee. They even had an egg hunt activity for the kids which allowed them to meet the Easter bunny at the end of it! A special mention to the actors involved in it because they made the day so much more fun. All of them really put everything into making it an enjoyable experience for both the kids and adults.
Fun day out, lots to do and definitely recommend the ice cream!

recent_reviews.author: Michael Issler
recent_reviews.text:
Visited last week my my family on the bank holiday Monday, had a fantastic afternoon, the farm is clean and organised and well signed, there are lots to do for kids and plenty for adults to.
Best part was the feeding the lambs.
Was a great afternoon all round.
Thank you and we are looking forward to come back to feed the calves next month.

recent_reviews.author: Geegee
recent_reviews.text:
It's alright, had a good time with the family feeding the animals, we went during the lambing event.
We have been to other events to see the ewes and lambs but this was very different, the lambs are not born on the farm but bought from other farms and put it pens in the barn.
We asked a member of staff about this and they confirmed that the lambs were not born there, so I feel it should not be advertised as live lambing instead they just buy them and put them on show.

It was a good day out feeding the animals but we only really wanted to view the lambing event.

It was an OK day but probably just a one time visit. Also the piglets were absolutely adorable.

pumpkin_patches.address: Hawkshaw Fold, Longsight Rd, Blackburn BB2 7JA

recent_reviews.author: Roxy Duncan
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely loved this pumpkin patch. You do need wellies but it gave an authentic version of pumpkin picking. Rooting through the fields for the pumpkins we wanted. Kids enjoyed the fair ground too. We also came for the fireworks they was brilliant too. Will be back next year

recent_reviews.author: Ashleigh Wrennall
recent_reviews.text: Fab pumpkin patch! Thousands of quality home grown pumpkins of all sizes! Brilliant fairground, excellent food options, staff are all lovely and helpful. An all round lovely atmosphere and family day out

recent_reviews.author: Francesco De Santis
recent_reviews.text: Nice day out for the kids.  Lots of pumpkins to pick. My son was happy with everything.

pumpkin_patches.address: Culshaws Farm, Holker Ln, Leyland PR26 8LL

recent_reviews.author: Abigail Charters
recent_reviews.text:
We had a lovely morning at the farm pumpkin picking!

The family have worked really hard to make it a fun experience for kids and adults alike. Lots of varietyâ€™s of pumpkins to choose from and plenty of them at reasonable prices. Lots of visitors when we arrived but it never felt crowded. Big clean wheelbarrows that my daughter enjoyed having a ride in ğŸ˜†

Serving refreshments and good seating inside the barn, and bonus of a few free games for the kids - only asking for a charity donation which we thought was a lovely touch.

Canâ€™t wait to make this an annual tradition!thankyou Clarkâ€™s Farm ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Russ Flynn
recent_reviews.text: Great place. Lovely people.

recent_reviews.author: Amy Reid
recent_reviews.text: Amazing place, friendly staff, fantastic setting, excellent set up for the kids (and adults) to begin the Halloween celebrations

recent_reviews.author: Steve Johnson
recent_reviews.text: We had great fun picking pumpkins today and the owners were really welcoming. Much better than the other more commercial farms we've been to in the past. Thank you!

pumpkin_patches.address: Spar House Farm, Lewth Ln, Woodplumpton, Preston PR4 0TD

recent_reviews.author: Stacey Riches
recent_reviews.text: It was our first time here with my husband, daughter (5), kids Grandparents, Sister in-law and Nephew (5) and I must say we were pleasantly surprised. The layout was good, it had a great outdoor play park and an indoor inflatable play area. An onsite museum that's larger than it looks. A good range of animal and feed. Everywhere was easily accessible. It was a lovely little farm and enjoyment was had by all.

recent_reviews.author: Paige Adams
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing!!! Farm was a good size with lots of animals to see and they where all so friendly, tractor ride is good fun for everyone and lots of indoor and outdoor play areas for the children. All the staff where lovely but a special shout out to the two gentlemen in the museum part one who built his own penny farthing that was on show and the other who has worked in many mueseums this being his favourite, they where absolute gems, they went out of their way to make us feel welcome and not only teach us about things we never knew but had amazing conversations about everything there if I could have I'd have taken them home with me their stories and information went above and beyond what you would get anywhere else. It gave us so much more of a better experience as they had lived and worked with some of the things teaching us how everything worked and some of it still did. They made this experience the best it was such a heartwarming experience!!!

recent_reviews.author: Danielle Stevenson
recent_reviews.text: We love it here, always visit when we're staying at Cala Gran down the road. Reasonably priced, very open, lots of animals to see and play parks/areas dotted around for the kids. Great place to spend a few hours. The food in the tractor shed restaurant is lovely as well.

recent_reviews.author: Lisa Connor
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant farm for a family day out, lots of animals for the children to pet and hand feed, indoor play area with bouncy castle and ball park, outside playground with trampoline. Picnic area outside and cafe which sells delicious ice creams and hot/cold foods. Lots of different animals all happy to let you pet them. Museum on site and clean toilets available. Easy to get to and from the farm the farm with bus stop right at the entrance. Highly recommend â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Carole Morris
recent_reviews.text:
Excellent place to visit. Great for everyone adults and children of all ages and abilities all are welcome. Lots of things to do and see. Friendly helpful staff make your visit so much better. The animals appear well cared for and are friendly and enjoy the attention of the visitors. Lots of different animals to see and interact with including pigs, sheep and goats to snakes, emus and donkeys. Cuddling goats, stroking lots of animals and feeding them bliss, such a wonderful experience. There is a cafe on site if you want or a picnic area for those who want to bring a packed lunch. There are various activities available on site such as laser tag and mini golf, unfortunately the laser tag was unavailable when we visited. There are plenty of free parking spaces and an overflow car park. Very reasonable entry price 27.50 for three adults and a child with a tub of feed for the animals. There are refills of feed available at Â£1 a time....laser tag and golf etc cost extra and pay for as and if you use them but there is so much to do that you don't have to if you don't want to. There is a bouncy castle and bounce pillow, sand pit, nerf guns, giant darts and axe throwing.
They have toilets available and plenty of hand washing sites for after touching the animals. They would benefit from having more toilets available....as there was a slight wait and this was Easter holidays I feel this would be a longer wait in the height of summer. Highly recommend visiting.

recent_reviews.author: Simona English
recent_reviews.text:
Visited yesterday (Thursday) as a family of 8 (4 generations) and we all thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff were really friendly and every time we asked if we could hold an animal nothing was too much trouble. The young girl who worked there (didnâ€™t catch her name) who has been with you for about a year from doing her work experience, was exceptionally lovely and answered all our questions. Credit to your farm park !!
The kids really enjoyed the outdoor play area with the inflatables and they loved the zip line inside the barn.
We were on holiday from North Wales and would definitely return here if we visited again.

recent_reviews.author: Dan Pearson
recent_reviews.text: We paid Â£18 for two adults and two tubs of animal feed which was quite expensive but there was not much at all there to see or do. No one gave us any guidance on what or where to go or do. Just felt like we were walking round someone's back garden at times. There was a few cool animals but not worth the price.

recent_reviews.author: Michaela Roberts
recent_reviews.text: I would highly recommend greenland farm village,  it's aimed at children of all ages and plenty to do down to animal feeding and handling, quad biking, roller skating, hill sliding, crazy golf, laser tag and play barn and in hot weather a paddling pool so kids can cool off

pumpkin_patches.address: Greenlands Farm Village, Tewitfield, Carnforth LA6 1JH

recent_reviews.author: Jessica Dickson
recent_reviews.text: Lovely stop along the M1, so glad we came here instead of a service station for a break from driving. Really appreciated the smaller â€œchildâ€ portion Sunday roast for those with a smaller appetite. Tasted like home cooked food. A cute farm shop and cafe, great for local produce. Bought some local eggs, local honey, and pork scratching too. Will definitely come again next time weâ€™re driving along the M1! (Only thing that could be changed is to please refill the hand sanitiser station near the shop entrance)

recent_reviews.author: Paul Richardson
recent_reviews.text:
The cafe looks nice, but nobody told me they're would be a 1 hour wait for food when I was seated or when I was handed my drink out when I went inside to ask if there was any seating inside as it was raining outside.

I asked a waitress who then told me the pancakes would be another 30 mins (after the 30 mins I had waited). So I asked for a refund - she had to get her manager to do this.

I got a refund for the pancakes, but it would have been nice if they had offered a refund for my milkshake as well.

The shop next door is very good, I bought a funny metal statue. The lady there is friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Lisa Fusedale
recent_reviews.text: Lovely food (as always).  Great higher table given to us which accommodated my mum's wheelchair.  Helpful and attentive service and yummy food.  Really well stocked shop.  I also like to support local independents and these guys work really hard at what they do.

recent_reviews.author: Naoko Palmer
recent_reviews.text:
Our favorite place! â¤ï¸ My 6-year-old son is a picky eater, but he always eats a lot here.
Everything on the menu is exceptionally delicious, and the staff are all so friendly.
The selection in the farm shop is amazing, and weâ€™ve visited many times.
Itâ€™s quite popular, and tables fill up quickly, so I recommend making a reservation if youâ€™re coming on the weekend.

recent_reviews.author: Lainey Welham
recent_reviews.text: Had a fantastic time, best one I've been too in years

recent_reviews.author: Stuart Williams
recent_reviews.text: Pumpkin picking perfection. Just along the road from the farm shop this is the perfect Halloween treat for the pumpkin carving community. There are several fields of the orange fruit of all shapes and sizes to choose from. Alongside this are well placed opportunities to take a photo alongside old farm vehicles, giant caterpillars and amusing cutouts. Great family fun.

recent_reviews.author: Jo Chambers
recent_reviews.text: Great fun for all the family!

recent_reviews.author: Chiara â€œKiaâ€
recent_reviews.text: Not sure I can justify Â£8 at the door ticket and then you have to pay for pumpkins as well. I understand they need to pay people to stay at the cash points but really, a rip off. Won't be going again.

pumpkin_patches.address: The Farm at Farndon Fields, Lubenham Rd, Market Harborough LE16 9TR

recent_reviews.author: mohammad khan
recent_reviews.text: This place has existed for 21 years now and I even went live locally, weâ€™ve never visited. Finally got the chance to do and it was a brilliant experience. The maze itself is an amazing and they have a play area with many games and a picnic area. Shops and toilets across the road. The maze design changes every year so deffo will be going back. I would highly recommend it to everyone with children.

recent_reviews.author: Muhammad Novsarka
recent_reviews.text: The maze was fun, the toilets weren't too dirty and there was even a play area! The maze theme changes every year so will be coming again. To top it off there was a wonderful garden centre across the road (part of the attraction) with excellent staff and a model village with a small train. 10/10 experience!

recent_reviews.author: sarah bowden
recent_reviews.text: Wow what a little gem this place is, the Maze was fantastic and really well set out! We walked around for an hour in the maze ( until the 6 year old was saying they were tired) and then came out. In the field next to the Maze is some really fun old fashioned family games to play. Splat the rat, giant connect 4, and many more that we all enjoyed playing for a good couple of hours. Across the road is a gorgeous cafe and a lovely range of shops to browse round. A lovely day out was had by all - ages 6 -80 years were in our group!

recent_reviews.author: Elaine Wright
recent_reviews.text: A special mention to Diana whose enthusiasm, helpfulness and interaction with all visitors old and young certainly enhanced our enjoyment of the day. A great day out not just the maze but the other activities, the retail shops, the garden centre and the Bistro makes it a day out for everyone. We will definitely be back.

recent_reviews.author: Adam Clarke
recent_reviews.text:
The perfect place to go pumpkin picking. The pumpkins are grown here, so you can pick them off the plant directly.

Coffee and food vans were on site when I visited but I don't know if they are there all the time.

Really friendly staff on site and pumpkins were cheaper than other places offering worse experiences such as Doddington Hall.

Please note, dogs are not allowed.

recent_reviews.author: Daisy Ball
recent_reviews.text: Always a pleasurable experience visiting here. Pumpkins are very affordable, staff are super friendly and welcoming, a few lovely food stalls as well with vegan options. Make sure to bring your wellies!

recent_reviews.author: Nathan Edge
recent_reviews.text: We had a super day here yesterday. Free entry which is great, food and attractions available and reasonably priced pumpkins

recent_reviews.author: Michele fields
recent_reviews.text: Pumpkins are actually grown in the field and you pick them off the vine, nice for the kids to see how they grow. Easy parking, lovely owners, great food trailers. Also free entry so not an expensive day out! Would highly recommend

recent_reviews.author: david brewster
recent_reviews.text: Church farm maize maze,great fun for the kids ,made out of a corn ğŸŒ½ field shaped as a tractor, when you arrive you get a map to help if needed and a treasure hunt to look for some animals to add to the fun,photo opportunities aswell.drinks for sale ,dog play area ,cut your own wildflowers or sunflowersğŸŒ» ,also have pumpkins ğŸƒ when its there time ğŸ•¸ğŸ‘»â˜ ï¸.well worth a trip ,friendly staff,price of entry in photos,toilets aswell and plenty of parking.

recent_reviews.author: Charlee Griffith
recent_reviews.text: I came to this pumpkin patch on Monday with my toddler and we had such a lovely time. From the first interaction, the staff were so engaging and really made us feel comfortable in explaining how the patch works and where things were. My little boy loved the tractor and roaming around the pumpkin patch and picking some pumpkins to buy. We ended with a delicious slice of banana bread and I had a coffee. Would definitely reccomend for fun (and good photos too of course) ğŸƒğŸ‘ğŸ¼

recent_reviews.author: Kirsty Hulley
recent_reviews.text: Our 2nd year visiting Church Farm PYO pumpkins and we cant wait to go back for many more years to come. A huge variety of pumpkins of all different shapes, colours and sizes. So many wonderful photo opportunities. Great facilities including toilets, seating areas, yummy hot drinks and cakes..and the best thing? DOG FRIENDLY ğŸƒğŸ¾ğŸƒ cash and card payments taken which is fab too

recent_reviews.author: Stuart Dowle
recent_reviews.text:
The Pumpkin patch is a great place to wile away a few hours, having fun, searching for that perfect Jack oâ€™lantern. They have a maze and a tractor to amuse the little ones, plus The Nest food truck that will supply all your sustenance needs (the cakes are lovely and I recommend the pumpkin spiced latte!)

Even though itâ€™s right by the main Lynn to Hunstanton Road, itâ€™s very calm and has an air of peacefulness about the field.

Donâ€™t forget to have a photo taken by the pumpkin heart and the pumpkin swing! ğŸƒ

pumpkin_patches.address: Ringstead Rd, Heacham, King's Lynn PE31 7JA

recent_reviews.author: Gavin Beamon
recent_reviews.text: For our daughterâ€™s actual fourth birthday we took her and our two and a half year old. We spent from approx midday on a Monday until five fifteen, a good afternoonâ€™s activity in the blistering 30 degree sun. Getting there would be difficult if not by car, parking was plenty for us on a quiet school time Monday and meant we had easy access to all activities. Not all the boutique stalls were open but understandably as it was very quiet. We started with the fun park and the kids enjoyed the train ride and the other limited spinning rides. Older kids might get a bit bored of the spinning rides but there is also crazy golf and giant bouncy pillows which  may entertain for a little while. The fun park would definitely benefit from some carefully placed trees providing some shade as well as enhancing the nature. The soft play was a good size for allowing kids to roam without the need for us to run around after them. Being amongst the farm yard though, there were lots of flies and whilst we saw the cleaning team go in after we left at kick out time, the matting seemed a little grubby and like it could all do with a thorough washing, . Cool enough in the shade but no air-con, the kids didnâ€™t want to leave. Onto the farm yard, the kids werenâ€™t super interested, tired by this point and have seen the usual suspects quite a few times already.  Cafe was fairly average garden centre style food, tasty enough with decent portions and so reasonable value. Overall cost of tickets for the whole family was about right, again reasonable value and a good day out for our aged kids. Potential for growth there i think in all areas and especially the fun park.

recent_reviews.author: James Malin
recent_reviews.text:
A great place for kids/toddlers to interact with animals and play outside.

Small rides to do on as well as sand park and grassy area park.

Feed/Pet the animals throughout the day. Indoor soft play, a lovely cafe with inside/outside dining.

A selection of small shops with a brilliant childrenâ€™s charity shop!

All the staff were helpful and friendly with everything being reasonably priced.

recent_reviews.author: Victoria A
recent_reviews.text:
We visited the Handmade Market.  Some nice stalls with lovely handmade items.
The delicatessen is extremely expensive compared to others I have visited.
