We ate at one of their food vans.  We had hot dogs and fries.  Both were very disappointing.  The bread for the hot dog was so stale you couldn't eat it.  The fillings I chose looked nothing like the picture on the menu board, with only half a serving of the toppings.  The loaded fries were definitely not loaded, and the taste was bland.
There were so many wasps you could not eat without them getting in your good.  I know there isn't much they could have fine however the bins were full and there were no wasp/fly traps.  This would have helped.

recent_reviews.author: Paula Wiggins
recent_reviews.text: Myself and my friend had afternoon tea in the cafe. We were both problem customers with me being gluten-free and my friend being extremely fussy. The staff were absolutely amazing and handled both our situations extremely well. They were kind, interested and explained our choices extremely well. My expectations are usually far too much but they ticked every single box and their customers service skills were amazing . Well done and thank you

recent_reviews.author: Sindy Hart
recent_reviews.text: We had a lovely afternoon getting lost in  the maze.   The flowers were so pretty. Will come again

pumpkin_patches.address: Church Ln, East Winch, King's Lynn PE32 1NH

recent_reviews.author: Katy Beck
recent_reviews.text: Cait makes some of the most beautiful cakes and sausage rolls and what's better is she delivers them!!! Reasonably priced and lovely quality.

recent_reviews.author: Simon Clarke
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely superb!

pumpkin_patches.address: poplar farm, nr293el, Church Ln, Runham, Great Yarmouth NR29 3EL

recent_reviews.author: Armandas NarutaviÄius
recent_reviews.text: Good boys working here. Always sorting you out. Not leaving you on a hang ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Veselin Dobrev
recent_reviews.text: 11 yars ago was very miserable to live there , but was fun and useful!!!

recent_reviews.author: Chris Terrell
recent_reviews.text: Great staff. Super knowledgeable grower

recent_reviews.author: Stuart Moore
recent_reviews.text: Very efficient and looks a happy place to work

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Delamores, Moat Road, Terrington St. Clement, Norfolk, PE34 4PN
pumpkin_patches.address: Moat Rd, Terrington St Clement, King's Lynn PE34 4PN

recent_reviews.author: Kirsty M
recent_reviews.text: I came alone to see the sunflowers, staff were really friendly and helpful putting me at ease. Sunflowers are stunning and huge but so worth a visit. Will definitely be back again.

recent_reviews.author: Trace Lawson
recent_reviews.text:
Sunflowers are my favourite, I'm really pleased that I was in luck to visit the last day the sunflowers were available.
Easy to book online.
Walked through the sunflowers and got some great photos, cut some sunflowers down to purchase for myself.
I had to walk through the maze, and some pictures on the haystack etc. then got ourselves a nice lovely as it was roasting hot.
The stuff were really friendly, especially the young lad in the refreshments.

recent_reviews.author: Karen Elliott
recent_reviews.text:
We went to view the sunflowers (August) but took a sneak peak at the pumpkins due to be fully ready in October...
Would be great for youngsters and better on a dry day.  Lots of outdoor games for kiddies. Fields of sunflowers, maze of maize and pumpkin fields very uneven ground.

Coffee and Ice cream van very welcome.

recent_reviews.author: Elina M
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful place with lots of activities for kids. Fair price for the entry and the sunflower field was everything i was expecting and more. Great atmosphere and big area to walk around and enjoy the nature. I told all my friends about it because i loved it so much. Definitely coming back. Thank you for making place like this!

pumpkin_patches.address: Overstone Grange Farm, Moulton, Kettering Rd, Northampton NN3 7XA

recent_reviews.author: Adam Squires
recent_reviews.text: Great place to visit, took my 11 & 14 yo daughters who both really enjoyed meeting and feeding the various animals, especially the guinea pigs and rabbits. The staff there were really friendly and helpful.  There is a well equipped outdoor play area, and also an indoor one. There's a walking trail to take in the surrounding countryside, and also plenty of picnic benches for re-fueling. There are also baby changing facilities and good clean toilets, and plenty of hand washing stations around the site. Will definitely be going back.

recent_reviews.author: Ryan Hobday
recent_reviews.text:
A fantastic family farm park with so much to see and do at a very justified price. The animals all looked so healthy and happy with plenty of food and space, lots available to feed by hand and stroke. We got to feed the lambs their bottles, stroke the rabbits and guinea pigs. There's so much to keep the kids and adults happy with a maze, crazy golf course, huge outdoor play, huge indoor play, sensory garden, walks through the woods and even a barrel ride. Would highly recommend this farm for the price you pay and everything that is included. Also want to note the staff were all lovely and friendly and very informative.
What a great day out.

recent_reviews.author: Harmony-Pearl Dorey
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely lovely farm
It had fun activities throughout the day to go see and do. I love the nature walks at the park aswell such gorgeous views. The staff were all really nice. The food is really nice and didn't take too long even though they were very busy.

recent_reviews.author: Julie Lee
recent_reviews.text: West Lodge provides lots of activities that are fun. Animals are obviously looked after, and their living areas are well sized. Animal talks are informative, and staff are friendly, professional, and very caring towards the animals. The farm provides lots of opportunities for longer walks, where you can explore the land and see the conservation work going on, as well as animal encounters all based nearer to the farm hub. The indoor play area and eating facilities are great for those wetter days. The tractor ride around the farm is a must to hear some amazing stats about the farms' work. Toilets are in good working order, and there are lots of hand washing facilities fitted around the animal encounter pens. The timetable of activities is provided on the way in, which is varied and well spaced out, to allow you to be able to participate in everything you want to do. All in all, a great working farm, who have diversified to bring lots of knowledge to people, young and old, and also provide lots of fun and enjoyment of animals at the same time.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Grange Farm Harpole PYO and Maize Maze

recent_reviews.author: Pavan Kumar KP
recent_reviews.text:
" A Berry Delight at Grange Farm Harpole! "

I recently visited Grange Farm in Harpole, Northampton, and itâ€™s hands down one of the best strawberry farms Iâ€™ve ever experienced. The place is vast, and walking through the lanes of juicy red berries was pure joy. Thereâ€™s something magical about picking your own fruitâ€”itâ€™s fun, relaxing, and surprisingly therapeutic.

I brought my parents along, and they absolutely loved it too. The farm doesnâ€™t just offer strawberriesâ€”youâ€™ll also find blackberries and raspberries, all ripe for the picking. You simply pluck what you want, weigh it at the end, and pay. While the prices might seem a bit on the higher side, the experience is priceless. Honestly, the joy of hand-picking fresh berries with loved ones is something money canâ€™t measure.

ğŸš— Plenty of free parking makes it super convenient if youâ€™re driving. You can easily spend 1â€“2 hours here soaking in the countryside vibes.
ğŸ° Thereâ€™s a charming little cafÃ© on-site too, selling delicious cookies and cakesâ€”perfect for a post-picking treat.

I wholeheartedly recommend a visit to Grange Farm. Whether youâ€™re with family or friends, itâ€™s a wholesome outing that leaves you smiling and sticky-fingered from all the sweet berries!

recent_reviews.author: Casey
recent_reviews.text: We had a great time here in August. The fruit is priced reasonably (especially considering some others we have been to!) and they regularly update their facebook when they are picked out which makes it easy to plan a trip knowing there will be lots of fruit! We picked strawberries, blackberries and raspberries and they were all delicious. We also got some bits from the cafe - there is a few tables which were nice to enjoy lunch on.

recent_reviews.author: Dennis K Bijo
recent_reviews.text: Great place to pick your own Strawberries. Family and kid friendly summer fun. Plenty of parking. Friendly staff.

recent_reviews.author: Ephila Rose Joly
recent_reviews.text:
This spot is truly excellent for indulging in the pleasures of a farmland escape. It's an ideal destination for families with children, offering a wonderful opportunity for a day of outdoor enjoyment. The attractions of the place include an assortment of blackberries, strawberries, and raspberries, providing a delightful experience of picking your own fresh fruits.

We chose to visit on a serene Sunday, which worked out perfectly as the crowd was minimal. Before embarking on our berry-picking adventure, we treated ourselves to a cup of coffee and a delectable brownie from the establishment itself. The combination of the warm beverage and sweet treat set the right tone for the day ahead.

One noteworthy tip for anyone planning a visit is to be mindful of sun protection. If the weather is sunny, it's advisable to wear sunscreen to ensure a comfortable and sunburn-free experience. Additionally, it's a good idea to have a jacket stashed in your car. The area can get quite chilly if the wind picks up, and having a jacket handy will ensure you're well-prepared for any unexpected weather changes.

Overall, this destination is a haven for those seeking a taste of the countryside and a leisurely day outdoors. With the opportunity to pick your own berries, it's not only a fun activity but also a chance to connect with nature and savor the freshest produce. While enjoying the tranquility and natural beauty, make sure to take precautions against the elements â€“ a dab of sunscreen and a jacket will go a long way in enhancing your experience. Whether you're looking for a family-friendly outing or a peaceful escape, this place has something wonderful to offer.

recent_reviews.author: Agnieszka Krawczyk
recent_reviews.text: My kids love this place and we like visiting from time to time as it is not far from where we leave. They had upgraded a bit of the play area for kids and it is even better than was before. Baskets with food for animals are great as kids love to feed animals ;-)

recent_reviews.author: Svetla Guzhgulova
recent_reviews.text: We absolutely love this farm! Itâ€™s the perfect place for a family outing. My little one had so much fun interacting with the animals â€” from feeding the goats to petting the bunnies, thereâ€™s so much to see and do. The playground is fantastic too, with plenty of space for kids to run around and enjoy themselves. The farm is clean, well-maintained, and the staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming. Itâ€™s such a great, safe environment for children to explore and learn. We canâ€™t wait to come back again! Highly recommend this place for a fun and memorable day out!

recent_reviews.author: Rute Jekabsone
recent_reviews.text: Had a great time with family. Just a few things to know, definitely wear wellies and do not take strollers for outside walk as it's super muddy, so you won't be able to push it. Also, you can't walk around. You will need to turn around and walk all the way back. Even though it was a bit difficult, my daughter was amazing, and my daughter absolutely loved feeding all the animals, and she really enjoyed the play area inside after.

recent_reviews.author: Irfy P
recent_reviews.text: Very nice place to spend the afternoon, took our daughter and she really enjoyed it. They had a good variety of animal's and they do meet and greet sessions. Also, have a couple of childrens play areas to keep the kids entertained. Overall, I would definitely recommend visiting Mini Meadows Farm!

recent_reviews.author: Giles Batchelor
recent_reviews.text: Went for a Cidery Tour, stayed for the fantastic cider, chilled out place to have a selection of ciders and enjoy the sunshine on a Saturday afternoon.  All the staff welcoming and friendly and prices reasonable.  Don't forget to check out their special events for tours and other interesting things.

recent_reviews.author: steve walker
recent_reviews.text: Our first time visiting. We walked up for the classic car and bike meet. Not many classics as a yellow weather warning. The bar staff were very pleasant and friendly. Nice cider too. Will definitely go again. Hopefully more classics next time.

recent_reviews.author: Natalie M
recent_reviews.text: Myself and my partner had a lovely afternoon yesterday tasting the different ciders and going on the tractor tour ride around the orchards learning about how the ciders are made. We would 100% recommend coming here. A wonderful afternoon, great atmosphere and the owners and staff are lovely too.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Allen
recent_reviews.text: Had a lovely experience today having the cider tour. The ciders were lovely and it was great to see how it was all made! Great little business ğŸ˜„ will be coming back to the events throughout the year.

recent_reviews.author: Katie Lowden
recent_reviews.text: Visited Sunshine farm this weekend, what a treat to find this place while out on our errands. We spotted the line of beautiful Acer's, and had to go in and purchase one. Polite staff, very easy to navigate around, A sign with the prices, a few animals to look at including peacocks, ducks and pygmy goats. There is an adult LD centre on site who looks after all the trees. We purchased a princess Crimson, which looks absolutely stunning in our garden already. 10% off this weekend too for the coronation ğŸ‘‘

We wernt planning a visit, just passed by on the way to Market Harborough. So glad we did.

Everyone was friendly, saw a horse and a goat, got some pumpkins and had a nice little walk around the farm.
Fun times had by all

recent_reviews.author: Faye Cantle

Always a lovely day out for kids and adults. Well run in general with helpful, polite staff and events well managed.
I wish they were still open to the public all the time!

recent_reviews.text: Just wanted to say how amazing this place is. We went there today for their pumpkin picking, we fed the animals, the children all had a play with the equipment and we had some delicious food. This place is a day centre for adults with learning disabilities during the week and the staff are amazing with everybody but especially my nephew Jack that has learning disabilities. We all love it here.

recent_reviews.author: Rafal Nycz

Think about a Christmas tree think about this Farm!
But not just for a tree, there are also lovely shops and cafes!
Plenty of room for car park.

I must say I used to be a bit of a scrooge when it came to Christmas but now visiting Welford starts my Christmas off lovely. Picking our tree, some amazing food, face painting and seeing the animals. Such an amazing day made possible by all the wonderful staff. Would definitely recommend.

recent_reviews.text:
Great cafe. Quick service, even though we went on a weekend. Tables were full inside, however it was sunny enough to eat out.
Good menu options. Big meals, light bites, snacks and cakes. Recommend the ploughmanâ€™s.
Farm shop next door has all the usual produce. Nothing special.

recent_reviews.author: Alan Smith
recent_reviews.text: Always a nice airfield to fly into with only a Â£10 landing fee and no PPR required. Been there for breakfasts and Sunday lunch. Always good.

Lovely farm shop and cafe, plenty of choices.

We also had lunch, Bacon sandwich on gluten free bread, toasted Teacake, latte and woke cappuccino (decaff made with soya milk) beautiful.

My only observation would be that they need another checkout for the Cafe.

Very nice farm shop. Well-stocked, nicely presented fresh produce as well as many other sections, such as bakery, butchers, store-cupboard ingredients, frozen foods and gifts. I bought lots of fresh vegetables and a loaf of sourdough bread. Good prices and friendly staff. I'll definitely shop here again.

recent_reviews.author: Shelley F
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful time at Hadsham farm lambing! Lots of lovely sheep and lambs to see, plus goats, pigs, chickens, and chicks! Holding the lambs was so lovely, my one year old loved it! Lovely outdoor space to play and a wonderful sensory walk on the grounds. There is a small cafe where you can get tea, coffee, drinks and cakes. All in all a wonderful time!

recent_reviews.author: Heather Noble
recent_reviews.text: We fell in love with this venue as soon as we arrived for our first viewing. The landscape is beautiful and the vibe of the place is spot on. Charlie has been absolutely incredible from start to finish - keeping in touch with us and answering all of our questions. On the set up day, the handover was very simple and relaxed. Itâ€™s very much a leave it as you found it and respect the area. We always wanted to do more of a DIY wedding with a festival vibe but didnâ€™t want to have the hassle of sorting the â€˜boringâ€™ stuff like hiring tables, chairs, toilets and bins etc. All the basics are there and they are an excellent quality - once you close the door to the toilets and showers you would not believe you are in a cabin in a field. So many nice little touches like the fire pit, fairy lights and festoon lighting that provide a great backdrop for you to put your own decor with. The optional extras like the prop shop were great as well - takes the faff out of hiring things to be delivered and returned. The whole site is as eco friendly as possible which just makes the whole package even more appealing to us. We had the most wonderful day celebrating our wedding and will be forever grateful to Charlie and the team at Hadsham Farm who made it a reality for us. Thank you so much! Heather & Lewis â¤ï¸ (17/07/2024)

recent_reviews.author: Lucy Empringham-Green
recent_reviews.text:
BEST. DAY. EVER. -GROOM

Hadsham Farm Weddings, was our dream wedding venue, and on the day it exceeded our dreams.

From the start, weâ€™ve had so much communication with Charlie, always super helpful, kind and responsive to any form of communication (text or email).

On the day of, he was super chilled (which is what we needed) showed us everything weâ€™d need for the big day. Everything was perfect.

I just want to say, this venue is so stunning that if you didnâ€™t have the ability or finances to decorate it, it would still look beyond perfect!

The tents are super comfy, and the wedding cabin was lovely.

Everything was designed so well! Itâ€™s more than just glamping to be honest.

Our guests were absolutely taken back by our venue choice, and they all complimented us on it.

Sitting outside on the little porch in the morning after the wedding taking in the beauty of the venue will be a cherished memory.

The security guard, Paul was super helpful and kind, always there if you needed anything.

If youâ€™re looking for your dream outdoor wedding venue, this is the place for you!

I honestly couldnâ€™t recommend it enough. Itâ€™ll be the best decision you make for your wedding âœ¨

recent_reviews.author: James Robertson (J S Robertson Photography)
recent_reviews.text: I was so lucky to photograph Sam and Ben's wedding at Hadsham Farm.  This venue is on another level!  The location is stunning and there are so many options for how you can plan and configure your special day.  Hadsham Farm were such great hosts, always there to help if needed.  The bell tent accommodation is fantastic as well - clean, warm and lovely facilities.  I also love the personal touch of being able to set the tipi up to your own style.  I can't speak more highly of this place and it was an honour to be able to photograph there.

recent_reviews.author: danny taylor
recent_reviews.text: Second time we've been here. Kids absolutely love it. Kev and his family have done brilliant with the farm this year! Even in the terrible weather! Brilliant pumpkins. The maze is a great laugh, abit muddy but it's only mud and it washes off! Yums also have the van too.amazing coffee and toasties.

recent_reviews.author: Tia Hayes
recent_reviews.text: A great place for all ages! Very reasonable prices too ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Sunaina Kamal
recent_reviews.text: A great day out for families with children. There are fun activities both free and paid for. There is free parking, across the farm. Activities were scattered around various areas, use the site map to help navigate.

recent_reviews.author: Ross M
recent_reviews.text: We went there today for the meerkat experience and had a lovely time. Going to zoos or other places where wild animals are kept captive is always a difficult ethical dilemma for me, as a strict vegan. I always have to balance the costs against benefits and zoos do have an important role in conservation and non-threatened animals can encourage visitor numbers to generate income and resources towards supporting threatened species. Further, I do feel that people seeing live animals provides a valuable opportunity for education and by understanding the animals better, people can respect animals more in the broad sense. Anyway, the young lady from Kazakhstan was so passionate about the animals she cares for and so very knowledgeable about the meerkats - a credit to her profession and just the kind of person that should be advocating for these animals. They have one meerkat being kept alone, which isn't ideal as they are a highly social species. However, she provided a clear rationale for how this is in the animal's best interest, given she was being ostracized by other group members. The birds of prey talk was also really interesting and the keeper also seemed passionate about the animals in his care. Ultimately, the animals seemed well cared for and by people that are passionate about their welfare, which made me feel somewhat better about my decision to contribute financially to what is being done there.

recent_reviews.author: Jason Hodgkinson
recent_reviews.text:
Lots to do, cafÃ© ordering and drinks system,  not very well thought out  queuing twice was extremely annoying..
Lots to see and do...

Visited for a great Italian car day..

recent_reviews.author: Maruk Miah
recent_reviews.text: Great variety of plants available but expensive.some items not priced unable figure out the price.  Great day out for kids. Plenty to do and shop. Great cafes

recent_reviews.text: I went last week and cherries were delicious but they didnâ€™t have strawberries

recent_reviews.text: One (and probably the only) of PYO farms in Oxfordshire that has cherries. There are strawberry and rapsberry too. Overall very nice place and great for family activity. The fruits are delicious. Donâ€™t forget to check their website before visiting the farm for updates.

recent_reviews.text: Wonderful food and good prices for Oxfordshire. I had a lamb and mint pastie for lunch which was stuffed tight with meat and was utterly delicious. Their coffee machine could be improved on though.

recent_reviews.author: Coco
recent_reviews.text: Love their homemade ice cream!! â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Jennifer Mowforth
recent_reviews.text:
Nice friendly pleasant atmosphere. Good selection of home make cakes, however they need to list all the ingredients. I chose the apple cinnamon caramel cake. I was disappointed to find they had put lemon in it, can't do lemon or orange in a cake. If this have been listed and I would have chosen something else. They were happy to replace it, but they wouldn't have needed to do that if the had disclosed all the ingredients. I love apple and cinnamon but I knew as soon as I had a mouth full it had citrus in it.
Please list all your cake ingredients.
Date of visit: August 2025

recent_reviews.author: Patrick William Renehan
recent_reviews.text:
went with my wife and granddaughter on 10th July both are gluten free and had the cream teas which was lovely that good we all asked for goodie boxes as we could not Finnish would recommend to book a table if you want to eat inside but there also a cover area outside
Patrick

recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm shop with garlic and shallots from Normandy. Also locally produced produce, including apple juice from local farms and a cute cafe selling soup & bread, toasties, breakfast and burgers. Delightful experience

We stayed in the camper/caravan site which was very good, flat ground, toilets and shower very clean.

Lovely strawberries

recent_reviews.text: Great farm shop with very fresh veg. Cafe very good with a quick friendly service. Easy access and parking.

recent_reviews.author: Jp Withers
recent_reviews.text: Wouldn't recommend as a dog friendly place ive got a 8 month baby husky who has just found his voice who hawled twice when I went to place a order at the till when the young cheeky chap said can I control my dog from speaking  'mate he's a dog , how can I contol if he speaks 'maybe this place should no longer accept dogs as he was very rude towards me , walked straight out maybe management of this nice farm should look at not being dog friendly

recent_reviews.text: It's the best farm shop I've ever been to. Huge selection of local produce. Stop on route to our little holiday. As with farm shops, it's a little pricey but so worth it. Will definitely stop here again when in the area. Loved it.

Volunteer sessions Friday and Saturday, cafe and produce Saturday mornings. Yoga in the yurt on a weds evening. LOTS to love.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Pinchbeck
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely the best morning out with a toddler! Animals â¤ï¸ good coffee â¤ï¸ sit on toys and a sandpit ğŸ’• loved it!

recent_reviews.author: Daniela Coarda
recent_reviews.text:
Fabulous place for children and adults.
My 1 year old had a fantastic day.
So nice to have the farm so close to us.

recent_reviews.author: Muna Fares
recent_reviews.text: Good day out with the kids , wish it has more things for kids to play with and I wish the cafe was open to get my coffee â˜•ï¸ while kids playing.

recent_reviews.author: Buddy C
recent_reviews.text:
I would give the other two stars if the entry fee was lower than it is, which is Â£10.50 each for two 70 yr olds.
Very few animals no real interaction or someone to guide you around the house.
A good cause but definitely needs something to occupy all who arrive.

Parking set away from the farm but a pleasant off road walk, to gain access.
The parish council also needs to ensure signage is free from overgrown hedges/trees as car park not easy to find, due to signage being covered.

The talk given to us in the sitting room was excellent and what we expected, for the monies charged.  But unfortunately that was it downstairs. Up stairs had a couple of recordings. The one in the office was excellent.
Maybe an old fashion maid calling system in the rooms to pull , push to set off a recorded talk or a type of hand held radio to carry,  to hear the history.. Or activities to participate in.
The cafÃ© was ok and reasonably priced. A good mug of tea!
Canâ€™t say we didnâ€™t enjoy it as we are both enthusiastic about keeping history alive. We also realise the cost of upkeep is difficult. But sometimes, making it more affordable or more enticing, could encourage more paying visitors..Speculating to accumulate.
We wish you all well, hoping for more success for the future

recent_reviews.author: Katie Neal
recent_reviews.text:
Superb little farm Manor House tucked away. Visited here with my mum as we were camping near by and had heard of the farm through the Downton Abbey connection. The grounds are a good size and easily adaptable for a short stroll around the kitchen garden or can be made longer to cover the orchards and meadows. There are chickens and geese freely roaming as well as sheep and goats in the paddocks. The house itself is amazing and every room had the wow factor. This is certainly one of the best dressed homes we have visited. The reception staff were friendly and thereâ€™s a nice little shop. There were sadly no staff in the house which meant we couldnâ€™t ask questions, however plenty of informative signage.

Free parking as well!

recent_reviews.author: Travel_UK
recent_reviews.text: Nice little farm for kids to experience farm life. The small shop has lovely cotswold products. Staff are friendly and welcoming. Cafe does good quality food. Good parking nearby for disabled. Check website for instructions for public parking. Can be a little tricky.

recent_reviews.author: Paul Davis
recent_reviews.text:
Fascinating farm. Lots of history. Nice seeing different breeds of chickens running around free.
Baby turkeys now out and about.

recent_reviews.author: Simply Honest
recent_reviews.text:
This farm shop offered lovely variety however the prices were in some cases ridiculous. Probably the most expensive farm shop Iâ€™ve come across, and Iâ€™ve shopped at a few. The cafe onsite was also pretty steep. Sandwiches and a coke cost over Â£50! cans alone were Â£2:50!!! Itâ€™s a nice place
To go if you donâ€™t have any limit to your spending but for the average familyâ€¦ itâ€™s a little out our price range! sad really as we would have spent more had the prices been lower

recent_reviews.author: Niki Bartoszewska
recent_reviews.text: I visited a couple of weeks ago with my daughter and unfortunately the bad slightly outweighed the good. I have been to the farm and shop a couple of times before but a couple of issues this time mean we probably won't return. We did enjoy an ice cream while we wandered round the animals and garden centre. The farm shop left us disappointed overall, the ham we had was wonderful as was the cheesecake pot, other items such as the sticky toffee pudding (dry and lacking sauce) and onion bhaji were far less impressive. The main issue for us was the cheese we purchased from the deli. I chose a few items that were 50% off as we intended to have them for dinner that evening. The cheeses still seemed relatively expensive (despite us being regulars as Paxton and Whitfield and knowing what a good cheese should cost). When I questioned the price, I was reassured that the discount has been applied however when I weighed a couple of the cheeses at home it was evident this was not the case. The cheeses were very good but cost me considerably more than they should have. Millets has a lot to offer but unfortunately our shoppkng experience would not encourage us to return.

recent_reviews.author: Robert Rusu
recent_reviews.text:
Milets Farm all together is a great place to visit. I usually take my 2 children here, and on summer months, we all go for "pick your own" and after we make the booking for soft play. Now recently thy have opened the maze as well, which is a nice touch to the Farm. It takes us all day therefore sometimes we stop to the restaurant and have lunch or a picnic outside. Great day out all together, and my family loves it.
We have also visited the falconry and as you can see from the pictures is a very interesting place to go.

recent_reviews.author: Gary Mchugh (Gam)
recent_reviews.text:
I like visiting here, lots of produce to choose from, though it is expensive, but products are fresh and unique, so that is why.

They do a very tasty Cornish pastyğŸ˜‹

It was busy here, but it was a Sunday.

There are loads of car parking spaces and it is free to park as wellğŸ‘Œwhich is a fantastic thing nowadays.

recent_reviews.author: Carol West
recent_reviews.text: We spent time at Roves Farm, at the end of July, for my granddaughterâ€™s first birthday party. We had a fabulous time. Lovely farm, soft play area and cafe. A farm shop thatâ€™s a must to visit and an outdoor play area too. Animal petting and a real connection with nature for the kids. Itâ€™s set back, private and it feels like itâ€™s in the middle of nowhere. An amazing spot. I had five grandchildren there and they all had the best time. The food was amazing, really good portions and lovely coffee. The entry prices are pleasantly surprising compared to other petting farms and the biggest plus is that the staff are all absolutely lovely. Theyâ€™re a credit. Iâ€™m really looking forward to getting back there soon.

recent_reviews.author: Nigel Bird
recent_reviews.text:
We were travelling to a Swindon destination, and wanted somewhere for a coffee, not a chain,  as we were a bit early. Excellent cup of coffee, plus the bonus of a farm shop, and you should follow signs for farm shop parking, as the other parking is for the visitors who are attending the children's attractions of which there were many, and I was amazed by the number of things they could do. Have to pay an entrance fee to use the attractions, but particularly the tractor tour, when I was there looked very popular.
Coffee shop and restaurant had lots of seating and a variety of food to choose from and an indoor play area at the end. The farm shop was small but perfectly formed and was a bonus as it had some items I've not seen in other similar establishments, and so purchased a couple of items to take home. Sadly, their own home made pies, which were good value and looked very tasty were frozen, and would have defrosted by time we got home, but if passing through the area on way home would definitely stop and get some.
Definitely Recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Tamsin Baker
recent_reviews.text: I love Roves for me and my two young kids. Outdoors and under cover of the barns there are always so many animals to see whatever the season, with tons of hands-on opportunities any kid would enjoy. Goats, pigs, sheep, cows, chickens are year round residents plus the babies! So cute. Plus a big outdoor play ground. Indoors thereâ€™s loads too for when itâ€™s cold. The baby soft play area is great and the bigger kids soft play is so well padded with slides that keep even my adventurous 5yo entertained . Plus the rabbit warren is a unique adventure for all ages, something really different and the cafe sells good food and drink with the farm shop just off it for something to take home.

recent_reviews.author: Molly Mae
recent_reviews.text: First time going, probably the last time too. Was sweet seeing the animals but the conditions they were kept in not so much, the pigs laying in their own urine while their piglets wonder around, the donkey stuck in a small circle pen all day on his own, looking rather sad. Baby animals forced to interact with young children some of which do not know how to treat animals. Cows stuck in concrete pens with their own poo and wee. Not what you expect to see.

pumpkin_patches.address: Roves Farm & Visitor Centre, Sevenhampton, Swindon SN6 7QG

recent_reviews.author: Ellen M
recent_reviews.text: We had the most amazing experience having our wedding reception at Earth Trust! After just one visit, we could see that the beautiful rustic charm that Fison Barn offers would be the perfect setting for our reception. The team are absolutely wonderful in communicating and making sure everything goes smoothly, being able to set up with plenty of time makes the process so much easier, and having it all support such a worthwhile cause in the local area is really icing on the cake! We highly highly recommend the team and the venue.

recent_reviews.author: Mark Johnson
recent_reviews.text:
The Earth Trust is an outstanding organisation dedicated to conserving and enhancing the natural environment while fostering community engagement and education. Their commitment to protecting wildlife habitats and promoting sustainable land management is truly inspiring.

Visiting Earth Trustâ€™s nature reserves is a refreshing experience; the landscapes are beautifully maintained, offering peaceful trails, diverse flora and fauna, and plenty of opportunities to connect with nature. Their educational programmes are particularly impressive, providing hands-on learning for schools and families that encourage environmental awareness from a young age.

Moreover, Earth Trustâ€™s efforts in supporting biodiversity through practical conservation projects demonstrate their deep understanding of the ecological challenges we face today. The staff and volunteers are knowledgeable, welcoming, and passionate, creating a warm and inclusive atmosphere for visitors.

Overall, Earth Trust is a vital resource for anyone interested in nature, conservation, and community involvement. Whether youâ€™re seeking a tranquil walk, an educational day out, or a way to support environmental causes, Earth Trust is definitely worth exploring.

recent_reviews.author: Cameron Barker
recent_reviews.text:
We had an absolutely stunning wedding at the Earth Trust! Matt and his team were incredibly helpful and accommodating which allowed us to craft a unique day that expressed who were are. The Fison Barn is a gorgeous space for dining and dancing and the kitchen facilities in the adjoining barn were great for our self catering nibbles and bar.

The courtyard has a lovely stretch tent which we were expecting to use in case of rain but in the end provided much needed shade during a heatwave and allowed us to have our ceremony outside.

All in all we couldnâ€™t recommend the Earth Trust any more for a wedding venue!

recent_reviews.author: Janet James
recent_reviews.text:
We had the most wonderful wedding at Fison Barn. The setting is beautiful and the barn amazing. The hire included all day Friday setting up, all day Saturday and as long as we needed on the Sunday to take things down.
The staff are wonderful, especially Matthew and Colin. They have been so helpful and friendly and I cannot recommend this venue highly enough. Thankyou all so very much .

recent_reviews.author: Rafi

recent_reviews.author: yvonne taylor

The food was absolutely delicious as always and the staff are super friendly and approachable.

We spent hours here as there's lots to do and lots of fun for the kids to burn off some energy.

recent_reviews.author: Melanie MengÃ¼ÅŸ

We also did the trail even though we donâ€™t have any kids and it was fun. There was toilets on site and tables to picnic or buy some food. The pumpkins were not expensive at all around Â£3-10 I would say depending on the size. Will definitely come again in the future.
