pumpkin_patches.address: Lodge Farm, Manton Rd, Oakham LE15 8HB

recent_reviews.author: Kerry Walters
recent_reviews.text: Incredible experience this year at Northwood Pumpkin Patch. My 17 month old toddler absolutely loved the witches trail, and there were hundreds of pumpkins to choose from, of all different colours, sizes and varieties. Pricing was excellent, and staff were extremely helpful with helping me transfer and load the pumpkins into the car when my son decided he didn't want to go in the wheelbarrow! Will definitely be coming again next year.

recent_reviews.author: Val Bagnall
recent_reviews.text: Fab trip here this morning. Loads of pumpkins available all sizes and colours and a scary witches wood to explore. Wellies advised ğŸ˜…. Lots of plants available too.  Friendly staff.

recent_reviews.author: Elizabeth Bradley
recent_reviews.text: We've been to Northwood 3 years in a row for our pumpkin picking now. Always a wonderful experience, the kids absolutely love being able to wander around the fields and choose from the wide range of different coloured pumpkins. We always choose a few different varieties and leave happy with a good amount, that are so fairly priced! I don't think we've ever spent more than around Â£20 and have had a good pile of pumpkins outside our door each year. Took our friends with us last year and they loved the patch too, and we picked up a couple for them this year as they were too busy to make it themselves. It's a 40 minute trip for us each way, but we think it's well worth it for the experience, not to mention that if you go on the right day they have market stalls set up from lots of small businesses so it's the ideal time to get some gift shopping done! (Photo is from our pumpkin haul 2 years ago)

recent_reviews.author: Lisel J
recent_reviews.text: We thought we'd come a bit late in the season but still loads of gorgeous pumpkins available at a fantastic price if you're quick (we bought five they were that cheap). Great little witches village for the kids (who am I kidding I loved it too!) and lovely friendly atmosphere, definitely be back next year and would highly recommend!

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Apley Farm Shop, Food Hall, Kitchen Cafe & Playbarn

recent_reviews.author: Janis Jackson
recent_reviews.text:
We hired the dog paddock for Mabel our Shitzu. After she ran off on a beach when she was 1 - we have kept her on her lead at all time out the security of our garden.

It was an absolute joy to remind ourselves that she is well trained and will listen - mostly - definitely for chicken anyway.

I had a sneak peak in the shop swags and tails and a little nose around the garden centre. They've got this place spot on - for a luxe rural afternoon - or a dog park! Mabel gives it 6 *s and says she will be back soon, to run free.

recent_reviews.author: Lee_a _Donaldson
recent_reviews.text: I love a farm shop and this one really does have it all, shop . full of produce, a play barn for soft play, pottery painting, doggy gift shop, garden centre, gift shop (this was Christmas themed when we visited) and a cafÃ© with on site bakers. Along with walks and a maze you could spend a whole day here entertaining the family. We loved exploring the shops and picking up little nick nacks to take home and then enjoyed some award winning lemon drizzle and a cuppa to warm us up. Staff in all areas that we visit were lovely, the courtyard is immaculate and there is plenty of parking. Lovely farm shop and worth a visit if you are in the area.

recent_reviews.author: Caz Norgrove
recent_reviews.text:
Called in for car show - lovely place to visit with enclosed field for dog walkers
Only down side was the awful weather!!

recent_reviews.author: Kevin Walker
recent_reviews.text:
Beautiful place, resonably priced, not as dog friendly ( claimed the majority was via phone by Dan but the eatery was outdoor only) We arrived around midday,  2 adults, 1 small dog. Grabbed a table outside in the courtyard and ordered food. A few tables down had a plague of wasps enjoying a left over drink, as soon as I opened my drink we were also being buzzed around. I suggested the waitress boil the kettle and pour it into the wasp soup to try and solves or help the problem. She decided to just pic and glass of wasps up and move it to a different position and then pour cold water into the glass which sent the wasps into a frenzy. We requested if as a 1 off could we go inside with our dog which was granted on this occasion.  The food and service was really good and a decent price.
We then wanted to visit the farm shop.. no dogs allowed unless its a service dog..
Shame tbf, and baffling as so many other garden centres allow dogs on leads anywhere within their establishments. Purely on that basis we wont be returning as the establishment is not dog friendly but is happy to offer a 45 minute use of and enclosed field for Â£8. Real shame and bizarre for a farm where generally all of gods creatures should be welcome.

recent_reviews.author: Jonathan Cox
recent_reviews.text: Fun place to pick up locally grown pumpkins. They have different colours and friendly staff. There are cows there too!

recent_reviews.author: kerry davies
recent_reviews.text:
We attending last nights cinema event and it was truly amazing experience! Jen and Sam are so welcoming and it was a lovely atmosphere.
Claybrook Farm is highly recommended to all!
We will be back x

recent_reviews.author: Alex Blythe
recent_reviews.text: Great fun, amazing cake

recent_reviews.author: Jenny Hartley
recent_reviews.text: A family run pumpkin patch

pumpkin_patches.address: Wall under Heywood, Church Stretton SY6 7DP

recent_reviews.author: Alan Newland
recent_reviews.text: Excellent place for families with lots to do related to farming and birds of prey. The exhibition rooms about the history of the battle and English history are absolutely fantastic - I was totally fascinated. Good farm shop too.

recent_reviews.author: Janine
recent_reviews.text:
What a fabulous place. The food in the cafe is amazing, the menu is very varied and it was a struggle to make a choice.

Something for everyone there's a lovely farm shop, plenty for the children to do, there are birds of prey and a historic exhibition. Well worth a revisit.

recent_reviews.author: Jason Johnson
recent_reviews.text:
Always excellent fresh produce to choose from at the Farm Shop.
Great place to pick up a few treats!
An enjoyable walk to nearby Battlefield Church is also worthwhile.

recent_reviews.author: Paul Owens
recent_reviews.text: Genuinely lovely little place to come and visit. The farm shop has loads of different produce on offer and the staff were friendly and helpful. The little museum about the battle of Shrewsbury is great. I imagine in the summer months it would be very pleasant to sit outside and enjoy something to eat from the cafe.

recent_reviews.author: Laura Roch
recent_reviews.text: We had a fantastic time visiting with our toddler. The animals are well looked after and are friendly enough for kids to feed them. As well as the animals there is a play area and also a sensory type walk. There is also a cafe on site which serves a range of drinks and snacks and also different types of sandwiches, pastries and cakes. Some of the paths we struggled with our pram as they were a bit rocky but we could have coped without it as our toddler loves walking around as nothing was a massive distance away.

recent_reviews.author: Zoe S
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely little farm trip with the kids!

We spent a couple of hours at Home Farm at Attingham and had a great time. Staff were super friendlyâ€”farm workers even stopped to chat and tell us about the equipment and the peacocks, which the kids loved.

The tea room was fab: fresh cakes, scones, sandwiches, snacks, and even farm sausages. Thereâ€™s a small gift shop too, which was a nice touch.

Lots for younger kidsâ€”ride-on tractors, a little park, and a nature walk with tree and bird info. Our teens enjoyed it too! You can buy a tub of food (Â£1.50) to feed most of the animals (just not ponies or donkeys).

Clean, well signposted, and plenty of handwashing stations. You get a map when you arrive which helps.

Only downside was finding itâ€”sat nav took us the wrong way. Tip: go through Attingham House car park, head for the exit, and the farm is about 100 yards to the left.

Â£20 for a family of fiveâ€”great value for a relaxed afternoon out.

recent_reviews.author: Laura Gilmour
recent_reviews.text:
My little one loves going here. They have a wonderful mix of farm animals, which you can feed (the animal food to cheap here compared to other places). They also offer lamb milk feeding which is so cute.
They have a barn with cars and bits in, a lovely park and a woods to walk through which help to provide variety and extend you visit.
The food and drink is good quality (they have a variety of home baked goods) and for low prices.

recent_reviews.author: Helen Jones
recent_reviews.text: For a Saturday it wasn't busy, which was amazing, I have an autistic daughter who doesn't like too much noise / crowds and she loved it. Plenty of animals to feed, nice nature walks and a little area for a picnic. We will be back as I have found the perfect place to take my daughter to see farm yard animals ğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: Sam Bull
recent_reviews.text: Very good quality poultry farm with friendly staff and a perfect clean yard. Excellent entry off the main road. Quality Moy Park site

recent_reviews.author: James Lawrie
recent_reviews.text: Friendly, warm attentive service from very sweet staff. Best full English in Shropshire if not the world. Plus some excellent sculptures to whet youâ€™re appetite. Plus, a supermarket with an art gallery upstairs. Whatâ€™s not to like? Excellent stuff. Enjoy your 5-stars. â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Sarah
recent_reviews.text: What a fabulous find!  This place has it all.  It has a fantastic cheese counter (very knowledgeable staff), award winning butter, awesome meat counter, good selection of veg, locally made biscuits, jams, other condiments, sweets, bread etc.  Also on site is a very well organised cafe, along with a gift shop and also a gin distillery!  We went mid-week and parking was no problem, although I'm sure it gets very busy at weekends.  We've just signed up to their loyalty program as we shall certainly be back.

recent_reviews.author: Paul Bird
recent_reviews.text: Well worth a visit 5 minutes out of Ludlow. Food in the restaurant was very well proportioned and reasonably priced. This was a ploughman's sandwich which was a full meal! There's a gift shop. Brewery/ distillery, and the food selection in the farm shop catered for everyone.

recent_reviews.author: Carries Shoes
recent_reviews.text: Great farm shop, good selection, fair prices, bought delicious steaks here.

recent_reviews.author: Chrissie Richards
recent_reviews.text:
We cannot recommend Paul and Rachel at Pallet & Pasture highly enough! As long-term customers, we knew it was only right to have them at our wedding â€“ we already trusted the quality and variety of their gelato and it was absolutely perfect. They even had personalised wafers made for us, which really topped everything off beautifully. Every single guest commented on how delicious it was, and we loved it too. Paul was so accommodating to both us and our guests, making everything run seamlessly.

Thank you for adding such a special touch to our day â€“ we canâ€™t wait to try more flavours soon! ğŸ¦ğŸ’•

recent_reviews.author: Chris topher
recent_reviews.text: Just outside frome is a lovely is a small holding. Were you can feed animals. Pick wild corn flowers. fun and games for the children and have lovely ice cream ğŸ¨ğŸ¦ğŸ¨

recent_reviews.author: Philippa Kelly
recent_reviews.text:
We had a fantastic family day out here on Sunday. My granddaughter is still talking about Santa and growing a candy cane from seed! There were lots of fun, imaginative activities to enjoy & animals to pet. When I finally managed to tear my granddaughter away from the activities we enjoyed superb gelato with great friendly service.
Update; visited again for Easter egg trail and had a blast. The activity included finding the numbered eggs and bunnyâ€™s with different flavoured ice creams hidden about the farm. It includes Easter themed gifts and animal feed to treat the goats/ pigs.

recent_reviews.author: Alexandra Scrivens
recent_reviews.text: Delicious variety of icecream, including vegan. Super friendly staff. Gorgeous outdoor setting - and despite what they might tell you at the showground (!!) these guys do take cards! Give the flea market a miss and come here. Thereâ€™s even a cute little track for toy tractors and cars!

recent_reviews.author: Tony Streams
recent_reviews.text: A lovely one lap parkrun round the outskirts of the farm - on a hard packed mud and gravel path - great views from the top - great bunch of volunteers as well - nice pop up cafe doing tea& coffee plus bacon rolls and cakes - well worth a visit ğŸƒâ€â™€ï¸ğŸƒğŸ»ğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Owen Towner
recent_reviews.text: A really lovely place with a short but beautiful walk around a small lake with a beautiful fountain. Lots of open areas for kids to run free and burn off some energy. Then pop back to the cafe for some proper good food and heart warming drinks with or without your pets. The wedding venue also looks stunning as we had a little peek.

recent_reviews.author: Stephen M Goldsmith
recent_reviews.text:
Brilliant place to visit for all the family including your dog's, loads of parking ğŸ…¿
Beautiful walks around the Lake and beyond. I spotted wild orchids, the gardens are awesome.
The Restaurant is just right for a wedding or just pop in for a special lunch.

recent_reviews.author: Di Bell
recent_reviews.text:
Something for everyone!!

What a truly wonderful place.
I can't thing of anything that's not here! ğŸ¤”

From the idyllic countryside walks of which I have much more to explore.
To the many species of Trees, flowers & grasses to.

Children's play area which is enclosed & very safe. I do not know whether these are booked play session's, so you would have to enquire.

The cafe now that's one place I had to sample, as expected good quality throughout.

Holly the florest was very friendly & even thoe she was exsepsully busy was more than happy to let me browse her exquisite blooms!

Also on site was a spa "Moondown" which one day I would love to have an indulgent spoil as life is just much to busy, to relax, unwind & rejuvenate would be very much welcome.

A Wedding venue as well & a working farm.

Incredible place!!

recent_reviews.author: Sean Wright
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely farm shop great for Pumpkins!

An array of really lovely fresh fruit for sale. I tried the strawberries and figs and they were great.

Also has great views around Draycott and some picnic tables to relax, eat and take in the views.

Convenient car park on site.

recent_reviews.author: Hayley Bignold
recent_reviews.text: We stopped here randomly a couple of years ago. Of course brought some fruit & veg, it was the nicest. Over time did pick your own & discovered the strawberries. These strawberries arenâ€™t just nice, theyâ€™re STUNNING in taste, natural full proper tasting strawberries. BEST WEâ€™VE EVER TASTED!!!!!!

recent_reviews.author: Stefanie Civit
recent_reviews.text: Lovely shop with variety of fruit and vegetables. Strawberries ğŸ“ were delicious

recent_reviews.author: Lord Parker
recent_reviews.text:
A spontaneous detour to Warren's Farm Shop became one of the sweetest decisions I've made recently, warranting a hearty 5-star review for their superb offerings and the charming encounter at the checkout.

As an aficionado of fresh produce, I've long known that the celebrated "Cheddar" strawberry stands unrivaled in flavor and quality. It was with this knowledge that I happily invested Â£30 in a sizable bounty of these local delights. Each strawberry was a ruby red jewel, plump and fragrant, promising the taste of English summer at its peak.

The service matched the excellence of the produce. The lady who assisted us was not only proficient in her role but also attuned to the nuances of customer service. With a knowing smile, she interpreted the silent request for clotted cream, a perfect companion to our strawberry feast. Her discretion and understanding of this unspoken â€˜codeâ€™ added a layer of personal touch and humor to our shopping experience.

Her jovial nature made our visit not just a transaction, but a joyous exchange. It's encounters like these â€“ full of warmth and shared smiles â€“ that transform routine stops into memorable highlights of one's day.

Warren's Farm Shop, with its quality produce and amiable staff, has earned my utmost recommendation. Whether you're passing through or a local in search of the finest fruits of the land, do not bypass the chance to visit. You'll leave not just with bags full of the best Cheddar strawberries but also with a lingering sense of delight from the service received.

recent_reviews.author: Tony Peters
recent_reviews.text:
Arrived at this overpriced pumpkin patch. I get that most of them are abit on the expensive side. Immediately the lady took a dislike to me as I had arrived on a motorbike as there was too many of us to fit in one car. The gentleman was nice and told me where to park the on hard standing. The lady didnâ€™t like that her husband had told me to go through the car park signs.

There is a golden pumpkin and if you find it youâ€™ll win a prize. When one of our children found the golden pumpkin we were told to leave site.

Avoid this place. Not family friendly at all.

recent_reviews.author: Clare Symes
recent_reviews.text: Hi had a amazing time first time coming here my daughter had a amazing time seeing the animals amazing area to play in great area to pick your own pumpkins  lovely and friendly farmers well done you have done amazing job we will be back again ğŸ˜€ thanks clare and Sofia Dalton

recent_reviews.author: Kirsty Plece
recent_reviews.text: Best pumpkin patch around by far. Friendly staff, lots of activities, fairly priced. Real chilled out family vibe. Lovely to see farm animals too

recent_reviews.author: Izzy Cox
recent_reviews.text: Went for a family fun day with 2 year old and it was a really lovely day even though it was wet. Thank you

recent_reviews.author: Alice Pugsley
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic day out!!! Team were all super helpful and had a delicious hot chocolate, would defiantly be visiting again, I love my pumpkin! ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Colin Sexton
recent_reviews.text: Great fun. Bring wellies!!

recent_reviews.author: Marlena Gula
recent_reviews.text: Very nice place for familiesğŸ˜„ğŸƒ and dogs  .ğŸƒğŸ˜€Beautiful pumpkins ğŸƒand tasty cakes ğŸ°ğŸªğŸ©â˜•

pumpkin_patches.address: Frome Rd, Wingfield, Southwick, Trowbridge BA14 9LS

recent_reviews.author: Lowri Roberts
recent_reviews.text: The most delicious veg Iâ€™ve ever eaten. Itâ€™s obvious how much love goes into making every veg box at Moonacre Farm. Highly reccomend.

recent_reviews.author: Andy Williams
recent_reviews.text: Great place, lovely people.

pumpkin_patches.address: Babington Stables, Lowerfield Farm, Hoare's Ln, Kilmersdon, Frome BA11 3RP

recent_reviews.author: SzidÃ³nia BogÃ¡nyi
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing for a little walk in the colorful gardens with full of beautiful big variety of flowers where you can choose  from and enjoy their pleasant parfume and soak a bit in the sunshine for more energy ğŸŒºğŸŒ¹ then enjoying lunch with this massive plate of fish and chips, i can say it's the best I had in Uk, not too salty, and not many condiments, also home made buttered very healthy fish.
And of course dessert can not be missed neither, a selection of cakes are amazing, I wish I could find the Honey slice which is my favourite cake, but there are carrot cakes, merengue, millionaire slice and many more.
Today was so many great discounts at the clothing side, I found great bargains, my favourite were the scarfs 3-4Â£ great value.
There are many more charming things to check out or to buy, in my point of view great idea for gifs, card shopping, cooking books, puzzles, there's an animal shop for our loved ones and fish shop as well with many colourful fishes.

recent_reviews.author: Tom Jasper
recent_reviews.text:
Rather lovely staff and products but marred by interior layout.

Firstly, this makes for a good trip out of you fancy ambling around a garden centre and it must be said the plants are excellent.

Alas, the centre is laid out in such a way that you feel like you are being channeled passed every indoor product section before feel the relief of arriving at the till area.

Horribly, you will find this isn't true, for you well eventually spot the till signs before being channeled away to see more product until you finally reach the tube-like path to the tills.

Budget for between five and ten minutes to get through the indoor areas, depending on how busy it is.

Once you've learnt about the store layout, consider  entering through the exit as, whilst contrary, this may be expedient .

recent_reviews.author: Alison Moore
recent_reviews.text: Been going to Saunders for many years never had any complaints but today the food was awful my friend has faggots which was solid at the bottom not good I had omelette which had whole mushrooms in the omelette so strange the chips were cold had to wait 45 mins asked a waitress after 25 min  how long our meal would be she checked and said chef was on it then still took another 25min other people who placed orders after us I can honestly say 5 other tables had their food before just unacceptable neither of us ate the food

recent_reviews.author: Robert Penny
recent_reviews.text: This garden centre has it all - everything you ever wanted to buy, even things you don't want to buy! The staff are friendly and courteous and the restaurant serves some lovely food and drink. Unfortunately having 3 elderly ladies with rolator walkers we had to negotiate every aisle to see all the items for sale before we could get to the restaurant. This meant that a nice day out for a drink with cake was ruined by a marathon walking exercise for the ladies! Apparently there are wheelchairs available but when I looked for them they couldn't be found near the front door or even in the shop. Disappointed to say the least.

recent_reviews.author: Antoinette
recent_reviews.text:
I loved that they were selling refreshments and lovely little decorative pumpkins.
The maze was a huge hit with the kids.

Thank you x

recent_reviews.author: Baiju K. Antony
recent_reviews.text: Dear Friends, it's is worth visiting Summerhill Sunflowers...Nice people to talk with...a lovely blakie to play with...lot of sunnies to see....two beautiful hours in a farm scene...

recent_reviews.author: Matty McCormack
recent_reviews.text: Great little place, play equipment for kids to enjoy and barn with cows in to see. Barn sells drinks and cakes too which are amazing and really reasonable prices.

recent_reviews.author: Kalum Dayson
recent_reviews.text: Great PYO pumpkin patch! The barn has cakes and drinks too.

recent_reviews.author: Margo Kwapis
recent_reviews.text: Friendly staff, delicious cakes and nice sunflowers.

recent_reviews.author: Lee G
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely family day out with our 2 year old daughter.
Lots of things to do from picking pumpkins to walking the alpacas.
A nice little barn with baby farm animals to feed.
Lots of refreshments available.
The pizza van they had on site served some of the best pizza I've tried!
Lots of parking on the fields, fortunately it hadn't rained in a long time so there was no issue getting in/out.
Will definitely return in years to come.

recent_reviews.author: Jessica Southall
recent_reviews.text: A fun, informative and all round fantastic learning experience for children, visited today on a trip from school with Year 2. The 'farm safari' style tractor ride was fantastic, learning lots and having fun. A superb day to spend in the countryside, Farmer Rob and Paul you are great! Would love to visit with my own children maybe for some pumpkin picking when October comes.

recent_reviews.author: Faye Allen
recent_reviews.text: This is my second time coming here for pumpkins. Itâ€™s an amazing place! My kids loved all of it- the hay bales, ghost tractor, watching the trains, wheelbarrows and the pumpkins! We had cake and it was amazing! Such a lovely place. Next year we will be back!

recent_reviews.author: Marianne Cairns
recent_reviews.text:
Visited today with our family for pumpkin picking as randomly found while searching for somewhere that didnâ€™t cost the earth before you even bought a pumpkin!

Really lovely place, loads of pumpkins that you actually pick yourself from the field. Free hay bales to climb/tunnel /tractor rides and extras for photos e.g tractor to sit etc. reasonably priced food (Â£4 baked potatoâ€™s, Â£2 homemade cake). Lots of benches, stay as long as you like. Really lovely afternoon ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Yasumy V
recent_reviews.text: What a fantastic place! We came to the pumpkin patch, but stayed for the baked potatoes and cakes. Lovely staff. Super family friendly and reasonably priced. Will be back next year! 10/10

recent_reviews.author: Andrea
recent_reviews.text:
Easy to spend a few hours here, soaking up fun and adventure.

There is so much poo to do... The entry fee provides a pumpkin for everyone... and there's the option to purchase more.

Once you've chosen your pumpkin there's a special area where you can paint it, carve it, it both.

On top of all that, there's loads of animals. An area where you can see cows and sheep. The goats can also be fed. Within the pumpkin fields there are alpaca- which for a small fee can be walked.

A refreshment area is situated with benches close by and there's toilets available including one with disabled access.

A little play area with pedal tractors and a sand pit will entertain the kids whilst you enjoy a rest.

Don't miss out on all the photo opportunities dotted around.

recent_reviews.author: Rachael Lowton
recent_reviews.text: Had the best day out on this farm! It was a great experience for my little boy (and we adults also enjoyed it just as much!) the alpacas were really well cared for, well behaved and the staff were very knowledgable and friendly. Wonderful pumpkins too, we will be back, thank you! A great day out 10/10 canâ€™t wait for some pumpkin pie and pumpkin soup!

recent_reviews.author: Anastasia Dunne
recent_reviews.text:
I recently visited Pumpkins & Alpacas at Tunstall Farm Park, and it was an absolutely delightful experience! The combination of adorable alpacas and a picturesque pumpkin patch made it the perfect family day out. The staff were incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, giving us interesting insights about the alpacas and making us feel welcome from the moment we arrived.

The farm itself is well-maintained, and thereâ€™s plenty of space for kids to explore and enjoy the animals up close. You can go for a alpaca walk and the pumpkin patch was full of vibrant, beautiful pumpkins, perfect for picking.

Overall, Tunstall farm park is a hidden gemâ€”whether youâ€™re there for the animals, the pumpkins, or just a relaxing day outdoors, itâ€™s a wonderful spot to make lasting memories. Highly recommended for families and anyone who loves nature and animals!

recent_reviews.author: Fay Plant
recent_reviews.text: What a lovely time weâ€™ve had today - many varieties of pumpkin. Great carving and painting area - lovely hot chocolate and cakes.   Everyone there very polite and friendly - lovely experience.   Oh I didnâ€™t mention the lovely alpaca walk - thank you

pumpkin_patches.address: Tunstall Hall Farm, Woodseaves, Stafford ST20 0NH

recent_reviews.author: Sally-Ann Thorley
recent_reviews.text: Such a fabulous experience, have visited a few times this season, purchasing some delightful unusual pumpkins for friends and family. Staff are very friendly and knowledgeable, explaining the growing process etc....lots of car park space, on site toilet and plants on sale too ğŸ˜€  an plenty of photo opportunities ğŸ¥°

recent_reviews.author: Spencer Arnold
recent_reviews.text: Had an amazing afternoon out picking pumpkins ready for Halloween. Love what the team have done to the place to make it really look the part! The staff are always really friendly, and have clearly been working really hard to make the experience the best for everyone. Would recommend it to anybody!

recent_reviews.author: John Cope
recent_reviews.text: Great day out. Free to go and just pay for the pumpkins. They also have the Staffordshire's largest pumpkin.

recent_reviews.author: L.E Wilson
recent_reviews.text: Great fun for kids and adults.

pumpkin_patches.address: Proctors Production Site, Roaches View, Leek Rd, Endon, Leek ST9 9AR

recent_reviews.author: Juliette McDaniel
recent_reviews.text:
A fantastic day out for the whole family - a great selection of activities in the play park, including zip lines and bouncy pillows. This year's design is challenging and fun, and the mini maze is the perfect level of complexity for little ones. They loved finding and filling in the cupcake finger stamps for the birthday design!

Good value, enough fun to last the day, and the tea hut in the play park serves great coffee and a nice selection of snacks. Would recommend for the summer holidays! â˜€ï¸ğŸŒ½

recent_reviews.author: Tansie Harper
recent_reviews.text: Enough parking. AMAZING VALUE. For under a tenner you could spend all day here unlike some attractions, plenty for the kids to do. Sandpit, go karts, zip line, park, bounce pillows, 2 mazes. Small maze great for younger kids, large maze very challenging great for older kids and adults. Took us 35 mins small maze and 50 mins large maze. You can collect stamps across both mazes to keep kids engaged and there is a small prize at the end. BEAUTIFUL cafe at the entrance, reasonable priced. Good looks incredible. Amazing views from the cafe looking out to the walks. All in a great value day out.

recent_reviews.author: louis Tylka-Simms
recent_reviews.text:
We were too self assured thinking we didn't need a map to get around..... We were wrong!
Use the map! Was great fun!

recent_reviews.author: Louise Metcalfe
recent_reviews.text: Excellent balance of activities, ( mazes, jumping pillows, play equipment) lots of space, no queues on a bank holiday weekend! Spent most of the day there with a very happy 4 year old. We will certainly be back next year.

pumpkin_patches.address: Old Hall Farm,, Halesworth Rd, Reydon, Southwold IP18 6SG

recent_reviews.author: gareth ricketts
recent_reviews.text:
Highly recommended. Good clean fun, seemingly thousands of pumpkins and squash in different varieties to choose from.
Traditional orange, ghost, a spooky pink variety that I dubbed the "brain pumpkin" and a huge range of smaller acorn, turban and other squashes.
We spent a short while choosing "our" pitch and were spoiled for choice.
One wheelbarrow and a surprisingly reasonable price later, we were loading our loot into the car to use some for decorating the house and the rest for cooking.

recent_reviews.author: Sam Pyramid
recent_reviews.text: Great place, but be careful with sat nav not to take a wrong turn up towards the nearby house. An absolutely psychopathic, angry little man lives there, claiming to own the whole land surrounding (including the public museum), and he will likely come out threatening to call the police for tresspassing (which is a civil matter), all the while holding you hostage so that he can insult you

recent_reviews.author: Thamasha Samarasinghe
recent_reviews.text: Really amazing . The sunflowers are awesome. However the transportation to the estate is a bit tricky. I took a taxi to visit there since the public transportation is not that much available in the area

recent_reviews.author: Chris Osman
recent_reviews.text: Great Pumpkin picking experience as usual with plenty of choice and good prices

pumpkin_patches.address: Rougham Estate Office/Ipswich Rd, Rougham, Bury St Edmunds IP30 9LZ

recent_reviews.author: Oakley Miller
recent_reviews.text:
A beautiful piece of land which well accommodates its residents! It is evident that the animals welfare is the top priority of this farm and you can clearly see how well looked after they all are. The animals look genuinely happy and relaxed and will approach you because they want to (especially if you have snacks (animals feed)).

Great day out!

recent_reviews.author: Denise St Clair
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely little farm with plenty of activities for children from feeding and meeting the animals to sheep shearing displays.
Cafe and picnic areas are provided separately from animal areas.
Safety and hygiene instructions are implemented with plenty of hot water and soap areas.
Small play area with slide, swings, tunnel and climbing.
Friendly, helpful staff.
Childrenâ€™s Party options available.

recent_reviews.author: Justyna Kapera
recent_reviews.text:
We had a lovely time.
Please note, it's not a large farm.
There is one play area, sufficient number of picnic tables. You can buy hot drinks,  ice cream etc.
We did pony grooming, played with baby goats and fed animals.
Staff were lovely.

recent_reviews.author: Rob Coats
recent_reviews.text: We came here on the 15th of August 2025. We had a lovely time at the farm feeding the baby goats and smoothing the lovely cows. We also took part in the Highland Cow experience which we thoroughly recommend. Massive shoutout to Bethany who walked us through the experience but also chatted to us throughout the day, giving us all kinds of interesting facts about the animals. Recommend to anyone but especially those with young children who want a hands on experience with animals.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Friday Street Farm Shop, Butchery, Cheese Room, Deli & Kitchen

recent_reviews.author: Paul Hardingham
recent_reviews.text: One of our favourite tea rooms/restaurants. Quite pricey. Recently refurbished, along with the shop across the car park.

recent_reviews.author: Stuart Cousins
recent_reviews.text:
Have been here a number of times, quality and choice always excellent, with pricing appropriate for this.
However I have been compelled to review immediately after receiving the greatest
Sausage rolls in my 52 years on the planet.
Bought 3 flavours and each one was an absolute stoater, and well worth the trip for this alone.
My wife says the Hog roast one was the best, and I would not disagree with her.
Give it a goğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Chris Greenfield
recent_reviews.text: The Friday Street Kitchen is perfect for a pit stop when visiting OrfordNess. Whilst the car gets a charge from the InstaVolt charger, you can enjoy a cooked meal or a snack and bottle of posh pop! The â€˜snackâ€™ in this case was Tiffin. Earned after spending the morning on the (â€œIslands of Secrets tourâ€)

recent_reviews.author: Kevin Lovell
recent_reviews.text: Visited the kitchen cafe for a busy lunchtime. Food was good quality and fast service. Dietary requirements poor as no gluten free options and limited vegetarian. However staff did all they could to find alternatives and were friendly and helpful to assist. Personally I found the acoustics loud from noisy chair legs. Would visit again.

recent_reviews.author: Veyaro Tow
recent_reviews.text: We love it. We been there 1st time. It was very lovely place to family day out. We are really enjoying. But one problem out side the garden sitting area many wasps around. One wasps bite the my wife one finger. When you going to sit down outside sitting area, be careful.

recent_reviews.author: Chris Boyce
recent_reviews.text: Great place for lunch with good food, or just a coffee in the Cafe. The shop has an amazing selection of fresh food, the meat selection looks so fresh and vegetables are so colorfull. You definitely won't find fresh food in your local supermarket like this. But it does come at a price, but well worth a visit. Highly recommend 5starsâ­â­â­â­â­

recent_reviews.author: Lora Dimitrova-Watson
recent_reviews.text:
Tucked away, and yet well-signed and easily accessible, this farm shop became a treasured by my whole family place for regular visits. Apart from the wonderful extensive farm shop, it has a Cafe/restaurant with two gardens (one with picnic wooden tables, the other- a quiet cosy corner), with inner dining space, beautifully decorated and maintained, comfortable and welcoming, well-supplied with great food and even greater cakes! Perfect for a lonely visit, or for a big family get together, this is truly a happy place.
But â€œthe diamonds on the crownâ€ here are the farm shop and the butchers. The high quality and freshness of the products can be easily seen and is indisputable. There is a huge variety of locally produced vegetables and fruits, dairy, delicatessen, different selection at every visit. There is a bakery, producing marvellous breads, croissants, etc. There is a ready-cooked meals counter, selling meals prepared on the premisses. At the weekends a fishmongers opens, too, with excellent choices of fresh and prepared fish.
And there is the Butchers - one of the best around! The selections of meats is mind-blowing, fresh or semi-prepared, as well as the delicatessen, the enormous choice of condiments - it is a magic land for everyone connoisseur and every cook! And there is always a helpful advice given by the staff, if one is bothered to ask.
All the staff at the Flower farm shop is friendly and welcoming, creating a wonderful atmosphere of relaxation, of escape from the daily noise, of good friendship, homely cosiness, of high quality food.
Plenty of car parking spaces. Accessible.

recent_reviews.author: Jo
recent_reviews.text: Great visit each time. So glad they have a coffee machine now. Meat, eggs itâ€™s all fab. Now fresh bread and fish. Everything that you need is here . Love it there

recent_reviews.author: Jan West
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely place to visit. Lovely plants. Lots I haven't seen before. Really lovely looking restaurant. I didn't use myself, but I could see it was very busy. Lovely large outside seating area. Large selection of beautiful items which would make lovely gifts. Well worth a visit

recent_reviews.author: Joanna McInnes
recent_reviews.text:
A lovely setting for a fun day of exploration for children. This place is a great antidote to screens, theme parks and computer games where my grandchildren had a lovely time  exploring the many adorable tree houses, fairy homes and playgrounds not to mention the castle, all made of wood.
We fed the ducks and fish, followed the trail and enjoyed an ice cream in the cafÃ© at the end.
Well worth a visit and the children lived every minute!

recent_reviews.author: David Peat
recent_reviews.text: Great place this. Farm shop has some incredible food.  Not the cheapest of places but outstanding.  Cafe worth a visit and the pet supply shop abundant with goodies for all animals. Activities in this place for young and old.

recent_reviews.author: linus mellumnav
recent_reviews.text: Great value at Â£5 per person for this amazing 2 hr outdoor sculpture trail geared at younger children. Not a bored kid in sight and just as enjoyable for adults with spectacular views over the Surrey hills area of outstanding natural beauty. Plus a lovely cafe, farmshop and nursery at the end of the walk. Amazing and well worth the trip.

pumpkin_patches.address: Priory Farm Sandy Lane, South Nutfield, Redhill RH1 4EJ

recent_reviews.author: Caroline
recent_reviews.text:
Great day out with my 18 month old grandson and family! Lots for him to do and rides to go on. Loved the Barrel Bug Safari! The Splash Pad was a brilliant way to cool down on a hot day. We all enjoyed the Farm Show and Trailer & Tractor ride.
All the staff were friendly, cheerful and helpful.

recent_reviews.author: Courtney Skading
recent_reviews.text: I only bother to do reviews if itâ€™s worth raving about and this place certainly is! We didnâ€™t actually anticipate how big Fishers Farm was going to be so we didnâ€™t actually manage to do half the activities/ facilities  available. We were here for 4 hours and it wasnâ€™t enough! The food outlets are brilliant, the staff are extremely friendly and appear to actually enjoy their job which is rare to see nowadays. All ages can appreciate this farm. If youâ€™re thinking about it, do it! My daughter had the time of her life, as did mum and dad ğŸ™ˆ

recent_reviews.author: Sharon
recent_reviews.text: Fisher Farm for the Grandchildren was fantastic today.. We celebrated my Granddaughterâ€™s 4th birthday.. Booked in advance of the day so got a Â£4 discount and reserved table of 9 in The Saddle Room restaurant.. Meals were timely and enjoyable and a server went out her way to speak to my Granddaughter saying as her birthday she would do extra sprinkles on her ice cream and she delivered thanks to Neve you are outstandingâ€¦ Also a mention to Gemma who was doing the pony rides she made them feel great I loved her line .. asking their name introduced herself and asked there age and she said me too! oh my goodness how much i loved that.. Well done Fisher Farm great day had by all 9 of us.. Bravo

recent_reviews.author: Relle E
recent_reviews.text:
We had a great time at Fishers Farm Adventure Park â€” itâ€™s a brilliant day out with lots to do and really well suited for younger children. The activities, rides, and play areas are perfect for under 12s, and my preschooler absolutely loved it.

That said, itâ€™s not ideal for teens, as there isnâ€™t much to keep older kids entertained for long. Also, the pricing felt a bit unfair â€” my preschooler had to pay the same price as an adult, which was the only real downside of the visit.

Other than that, it was a lovely day, the park is well maintained, and weâ€™d definitely go again!

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Naturally Thinking Little Woodcote Estate Farm

recent_reviews.author: Natalie Clare
recent_reviews.text: Gorgeous gorgeous new cafe/refill centre. Amazing drinks, cake and lunch bits. Amazing vegan food which is much appreciated (!!!). The setting is also stunning - feels like you're in the French countryside.  We refilled with the lavender and spearmint shower gel and it is SO nice. Makes you feel so fresh and its vegan/cruelty free. Amazing place for families, couples, friends etc. Simply lovely, please pay a visit!

recent_reviews.author: Pete Little
recent_reviews.text:
I'm loathe to recommend this place, not because it's bad, but quite the opposite actually, but because it's such an out-of-the-way place it feels like a secret for us locals  ;)

It's not well signposted from the main roads so I wouldn't be surprised if you've driven past it and never realised it was there. However,  you'd be rewarded for tracking it down.

Stunning views over cultivated land growing Lavender, Mint, Rosemary, Sage etc, accompanied by fine cakes,  cream teas, and hot & cold drinks.

The shop also stocks an impressive range of natural personal care products from their own essential oils.

recent_reviews.author: Miriam C Zaccarelli
recent_reviews.text:
Such a lovely afternoon. The guys didn't stop smiling, always friendly and accommodating even though it was so busy. Excellent coffee, cakes and paninis - with extra special lavender scones! - with gorgeous seating areas inside or outside with complementary blankets!
Finished off with a perfectly outdoorsy adventure for the kids to choose a couple of pumpkins from the patch. Just wonderful. Thank you.

recent_reviews.author: Denise G.Harper
recent_reviews.text: This lavender farm is absolutely stunning. It is free to visit and they have pick your own lavender. They use all the herbs to make their own essential oils and products.  They also have a cafe. They were a little busy and the young men who were working seemed a little overwhelmed and ran out of cream pretty early on. I think paninis are an easy and delicious choice as well as the coffee of any kind.

pumpkin_patches.address: Little Woodcote Estate, 38A Telegraph Track, Carshalton, Wallington SM6 0SH

recent_reviews.author: Stacey Struthers
recent_reviews.text: We usually visit the garden centre and cafe quite often as it's only a 5 min drive away, unfortunately with current circumstances we haven't been since February and jumped at the chance at booking a place for their Santa's Enchanted forest event, we usually go each year anyway to the Christmas events, but with limited availability this time round we were really lucky to get tickets! It didn't disappoint and I actually quite enjoyed being alone in the rooms with just me and my children, especially as it's my youngest son's first Christmas this year, it just made it a bit more personal and special, Santa was great and really took the time to get to know the kids and spend a bit time with us and all children came away with a gift suitable for their age. It added a little bit of magic to the end of this awful year, just what we needed!

recent_reviews.author: brett davey
recent_reviews.text:
Horrible experience.Spent over Â£50 and had bedding plants in a tray for convenience. As I went to pay the women at the counter said â€œYou canâ€™t have that trayâ€.
Just spent over Â£50 and treated like a criminal. Awful customer service.

recent_reviews.author: Sheila Grier
recent_reviews.text: Don't go here. Disgusting tea cake and overcharged at shop. Shop assistant eating her lunch while serving thought all pots were the same size ( see photographs they do not look the same size at all, she must be short sighted) so charged me the same price when one was 99p not Â£1.99 obviously could not be bothered. Brought 2 reduced items to the till where the label said Â£1 assistant said these have been moved they are not a pound. However she did not say she would check for me just that she might look later. So did not purchase these. Will never go back even if they paid me. Overpriced plants just a joke.

recent_reviews.author: Joanne Blackwood
recent_reviews.text: Lovely small relaxed garden centre, Friendly staff. Shame you can only see Narnia now if you pay to see Santa. Coffee shop nice but very expensive. Was quite shocked today to see one of the coffee shop staff eating there own lunch behind counter and then not washing their hands and going to serve the public, not very professional and very unhygienic. Also then seeing them picking up cakes with their hands and not using tongs or gloves. I think the management should have a talk to them about this.

recent_reviews.author: Anne â€œWildflowerâ€ Smith
recent_reviews.text:
First time at this farm shop today in Houghton le Spring and greeted well by the staff. Great customer service.  Nice clean shop.
I spent just over Â£18 , initially going in for just eggs, chicken pie & Cappuccino.
I also got a scotch egg yummy ğŸ˜‹ marinated chicken skewers,  treacle tart, and a pork pie.
Prices aren't too bad, especially with better quality of meat & sweet treats.
Has a cafe, in which I will go in another time.
5 disabled parking bays outside of the shop; & a huge car park.
Has a lot of seating area, I can imagine it is nice in the summer & has a play park.
I will definitely be back again soon.

recent_reviews.author: Vishaal Ekbote
recent_reviews.text:
Good for a quick stop, good menu with a wide range menu for everyone
Dog friendly !

recent_reviews.author: Dan McCarthy
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic, home cooked food - from farm to plate.
You can taste the freshness and, with huge portions (such as an Everest of scrambled eggs), you'll definitely not go away hungry!
The farm shop is excellent, with a wide range of exciting products  and the butchers is the icing on the already-very-sweet cake.
Love this place, it's absolutely one for the foodies ğŸ‘ğŸ¼

recent_reviews.author: Lesley Woolcock
recent_reviews.text: This was our first visit, and we were all impressed with the farm shop, looking around before going in for food. The food we got was exceptional, we had the hot beef sandwich with triple fried chips, very tasty and the bread was so light. There was that much on the plate I couldn't eat all of mine. I asked for a carton to put my half sandwich in, as I was full. To be told I could have tin foil to put it in or pay a Â£1 for a carton. I opted for the foil, as at other garden centres we have been to, have been given a carton free of charge. This is the only reason I havnt given 5 stars. We will return, as was a luvly place, but will take my own carton with me.

pumpkin_patches.address: Pittington Rd, West Rainton, Houghton le Spring, Gate DH5 9RG

recent_reviews.author: Jamie lee Mann
recent_reviews.text: Brillant morning in the sunflower fields ğŸŒ» ğŸŒ» ğŸŒ» reasonable priced, nice number of people there. We petted the horses would recommend and will definitely come back

recent_reviews.author: andrei iulian
recent_reviews.text: Top quality products at very decent price, fast delivery also. Bonus of that, Chris and his wife seem to be so nice, willing to help you anytime. Me and my pigeons, we highly recommend them!

recent_reviews.author: Scott Dawson
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic selection of bird seed and dog food all at a good price the birds go crazy for the sunflower hearts

recent_reviews.author: cyril greenacre
recent_reviews.text:
Been purchasing our bird food from them for years after a recommendation and as a business owner I prefer and value a recommendation way above any advert.
It's really nice when we visit as they always remember our names and ask how things are, it's not just for the sake of asking its genuine.
Prices are competitive and quality is far superior than we used to purchase from nationwide pet food suppliers.
The quantity of birds we get at our table is testament to than.
Keep up the good work.â¤ï¸ğŸ™

recent_reviews.author: Courtney Turner
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little flower picking farm. Great for the family

recent_reviews.author: Emma Calver
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant place, amazing for family and friends to be under one roof. Outside is very well kept with seating area and hot tub and more. Will defo be returning.

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Jenkins
recent_reviews.text: You show a picture of cows yet you have removed the cows in order to build. All the animals have gone. There was all animals including lambs at one point on this beautiful park.

recent_reviews.author: Kevin Cummings
recent_reviews.text: Lots of space local youth club provides activities on certain nights check YAP site

recent_reviews.author: SCI VIDEOS
recent_reviews.text: Lots of open space, ideal for dog walking

recent_reviews.author: ann johnson
recent_reviews.text: Lovely park to take my granddaughter to she loved the slide the most

pumpkin_patches.address: Herrington Rd, Middle Herrington, Sunderland SR3 3TE

recent_reviews.author: Marie Rhodes-Brown
recent_reviews.text: Always happy to support local farm shops. Picked up some vegetables,  and plants all look in good health! Friendly staff

recent_reviews.author: Kerry Pugh
recent_reviews.text:
Me and my family visited to do some Pumpkin Picking! We were pleasantly surprised when we got there and was told about the spooky trail - I honestly don't know the last time I laughed so much!! ğŸ¤­

This is definitely something we want to do every year ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Sian Temple
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely beautiful views. Staff are all friendly and helpful and have put a great effort in putting the fields together and setting up.
The spooky trail was fun with the kids and they really enjoyed running around in the fresh air, wheeling their pumpkins around and eating hot doughnuts!
Granted, they are not the cheapest pumpkins around.. Especially if you go for big ones... But it really is great to give the kids time outdoors and to support a local farming business.
Loads of pumpkins to choose from, all shapes and sizes and colours. The kids will have great mentors of coming here for their pumpkins.

recent_reviews.author: Andrea Cain
recent_reviews.text: Picked our Christmas tree last night. Loads of choices, friendly staff. We bought our hard wood for log burner also this was reasonably priced. Lots of decorations & well stocked farm shop produce is top quality. Highly recommended a visit

pumpkin_patches.address: Ashwoodfield House Farm, Kidderminster Rd, Stourbridge, Kingswinford DY6 0AA

recent_reviews.author: Haylee Cahill
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing place and the staff are so lovely! We had such a great day here with friends â€” honestly the best place in Worcestershire and Birmingham, hands down. My kids were entertained for hours and never got bored with so much to do: sand play, animals, trampoline, soft play, feeding the animals, and a lovely lunch too.

On top of that, when I had a bee sting, the staff were incredible â€” they stayed with me, and were so kind throughout. Even though it happened right at the end of the day and wasnâ€™t their fault, they still offered me a free return visit. That level of care and kindness really makes this place stand out.

Canâ€™t recommend it enough â€” both for the fun and the amazing people who work here!

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Eaton
recent_reviews.text: Lovely day out with lots to do. Really reasonable admission fee with access to everything including regular opportunities to interact and stroke the animals (rabbits, guinea pigs, range of bugs). Great amount of tables avaliable at both the indoor soft play and outside. Ear defenders provided on arrival for my son which was extremely helpful as we had forgotten ours and could have resulted in the trip being cut short due to his sensory differences. All members of staff were welcoming and friendly. Overall a really positive day.

recent_reviews.author: Helen Coles
recent_reviews.text:
We were extremely impressed with Attwell Farm Park when we took our four year old grandaughter. There was so much to do there that we could have easily spent another hour or so longer than the five hours we had already been there. Apart from the animals,  there is a huge soft play area for children of all ages and a large sand area where the children could enjoy themselves supervised.
The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The food was reasonably priced, which we were pleasantly surprised at as unlike some we didn't take our own packed lunch.
We would highly recommend this for all ages.

recent_reviews.author: Trudy Male
recent_reviews.text: We visited 28/5/25. I asked my 5 yr old to rate from 1-10, 10 being the best day ever and he rated it 1000!!! We had to contend with on/off heavy rain, but at least 50% is under cover. Reasonably priced, very clean and lots to do.We interacted with all the demos and he loved stroking the bugs and bunnies. An amazing day was had. Thank you

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Kinver Edge Farm Shop & Country Cafe

recent_reviews.author: Louise Clarke
recent_reviews.text:
We came here as a family of six plus 2 grandparents primarily for the maize Maze. We did not eat or drink.
We could find very little information online so here are  some pointers.
It cost Â£42.  I think this equates to Â£7 per person over the age of 3.
Service gets 3* because we waited such a long time with young children at the start and then again when we came back into the shop at the end.
Kids get a clipboard to tick off the farmer's monthly jobs as they find the pictures going round. On completion they get a lolly and badge.
The terrain is very rough and totally unsuitable for pushchairs or elderly people.
There are a couple of tunnels for the kids to pass through and raised platforms with steps and lovely views across the hills.
Cash is the preferred method of payment.
There is a small free play area near the shop. You pay extra for the bouncer.
Adjacent to the carpark are useful picnic tables.

recent_reviews.author: Modelangel
recent_reviews.text:
Popped in the farm shop for a coffee.
Coffee was weak, we ordered americano and latte, so I do not recommend it.
Little fresh produce was available for purchase but the prices were quite high.
No high chairs available. No baby changing facility available.

recent_reviews.author: Robert Chapman
recent_reviews.text: We had a coffee and cake it was lovely in the sun just before you start a walk around the edge. we had a great day in kinver and went to the vine for a drink after

recent_reviews.author: Nadia Taylor
recent_reviews.text: We were passing through the area and saw the signs for the farm shop and thought we'd stop for a cup of tea. There were a few people about sitting outside in the nice weather. We ordered some tea and two slices of cake and picked a table outside. The tables weren't clean and clearly hadn't been wiped down in a long time and my tea was served in a mug with multiple chips around the edge. We then received the tiniest slices of cake which really didn't warrant the price charged. We left quite disappointed with the whole experience.....

pumpkin_patches.address: Hill Farm House, Sandy Lane, Kinver, Stourbridge DY7 6HX

recent_reviews.author: EH21
recent_reviews.text: Lovely pick your own; some great picture opportunities aswell as some fab bits for my toddler to play with however the strawberries weren't as delicious as I had hoped for the price I paid!

recent_reviews.author: Lidia Nikolova Gjorgjieva
recent_reviews.text: The strawberries here are so delicious, they actually taste like strawberries ğŸ¤¤, not like the ones bought from the store. I like how the pots are high above the ground so you don't need to bend and kneel down to pick the fruit. There are tunnels that are covered so even when the weather is not so great you can enjoy picking up strawberries and raspberries without getting soaking wet. There are raspberry tunnels as well with massive plants and very tasty fruit. The cafe serves delicious cakes, and also scone, jam, clothed cream and a pot of tea for just Â£5.50.

recent_reviews.author: Kelsie Tune
recent_reviews.text: Visited last year to pick pumpkins and wasnâ€™t that impressed to be honest. However we returned today to pick strawberries and raspberries which was much better. Had a drink in the cafe and let the kids play on the tractors and other available bits. We were worried about how many berries we would be able to pick as the Instagram page said limited fruit however we were pleasantly surprised

recent_reviews.author: Andy K
recent_reviews.text: Delicious strawberries! Enjoyable visit with a toddler to pick strawberries. All under cover and raised plants for easy picking. There were plenty of strawberries dangling low enough for a 2.5 year old to pick. Plenty of parking and free to enter - just pay for the amount of strawberries picked. Covered seating and drinks / cakes served. Some simple outdoor children's games and toy ride on tractors for small children. Also toilets by the entrance. Worth a visit.

pumpkin_patches.address: Crouchers Farm, Birdham Rd, Chichester PO20 7EQ

recent_reviews.author: Megan H
recent_reviews.text:
Very good variety of pumpkins and gourds, lots of photo opportunities. Coffee, bru and bar available as well as doughnuts and pizza, both were amazing!
Face painting and carving available at cost. But means you can spend an hour or two there.

recent_reviews.author: Matthew Tester
recent_reviews.text: I visited with my family and 3 grandsons, we had the best time, lots of small activities on site and places for pictures, my oldest grandson especially loved the muddy puddles ğŸ¤£

recent_reviews.author: Clare Marchant
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place, well run, reasonably priced. Hope they come back next year!

recent_reviews.author: Sammy
recent_reviews.text: Great place for pumpkin picking. Single lane track to get there but plenty of parking (extra in an overflow field), plenty of pumpkins to choose from and crafts to do as well for a little extra. Definitely will be coming back here again next year

recent_reviews.author: lauren perkins
recent_reviews.text: reasonable prices, friendly staff and plenty of pumpkins! free entry (2024) would definitely return and recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Heather
recent_reviews.text: Lovely variety of pumpkins and gourds to pick, at very reasonable prices. Mini wheelbarrows for kids are a nice touch! We loved the bale maze and tractor/trailer rides too. A fun morning out. Bring your wellies!! ğŸ˜ŠğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Louise K
recent_reviews.text: We went for the first time this year and it was fab. Reasonably priced pumpkins which you actually pick off yourself. We came home with a white one, a bobbly one and 2 yellow ones. There are lots of photo opportunities and the staff are very friendly. We will definitely be back next year!

pumpkin_patches.address: Tan Hill Farm, Gunsite Rd, West Kennett, Marlborough SN8 1QF

recent_reviews.author: Becky barrett-mead
recent_reviews.text: Lovely setting, amazing views and covered seating allowed us to enjoy being outside whilst avoiding the occasional rain shower! Delicious food in the cafe and wonderful produce in the farm shop.

recent_reviews.author: Grant Woodhouse
recent_reviews.text: Nice little farm shop with some really interesting produce. Staff were really friendly and helpful, it just wasnâ€™t quite as big as Iâ€™d expected (thatâ€™s on me to be honest). Well worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: The Bases Project
recent_reviews.text: Went there originally to find a crop circle,  a bit late...it was in 2016. Pick your own fruit. It is absolutely wonderful,  so it's good to get out into a different part of Wiltshire.  There are so many different berries to buy. A really good place to visit,

recent_reviews.author: Ade
recent_reviews.text:
Ansty has become a yearly tradition for us since we discovered it in 2020 and we always look forward to the yearly ritual of picking some fresh strawberries.

The staff are warm and friendly and there is always something fun for the whole family to do. There is a mini climbing frame for the kids and a big picnic tent to relax and grab something to eat after a hard day's work of picking produce.

recent_reviews.author: henry lavery
recent_reviews.text: Relaxing environment to have some food and a coffee. There are comfy sofas to relax by a log burning fire, outdoor seating or formal tables and chairs. The coffee was very nice and the tea pot is recommended too. There is a selection of home baked cakes and local produce at the farm shop next door. The cafÃ© is linked to the farm shop which sells local produce to support local farms. It is all very high quality especially the butchers here the meat is very tasty ğŸ˜‹. I really enjoyed my walk here through the fields as well, the kids loved the pigs and cows which are roaming about near the cafÃ©! 10 out of 10

recent_reviews.author: Anna Enright
recent_reviews.text:
Nice little farm shop and cafe. It's a farm, pigs outside the cafeğŸ–ğŸ·ğŸ½ and great produce in the shop, including plants and also there's a pet shop.

Sorry pics look a bit grey (English summer!) it will be lovely on a fine day, plenty of parking, clean loos, (though not completely finished decorating in the loos), lovely decoration in the cafe, loads of character, chalk board and piano outside.

This is a great place to have tea and  cake.

Hot food was good, I had panini my partner a breakfast. Seemed a little over priced compared to nearby places, but there was a lot of food on the plate.
Maybe there could be a space on the menu for a small breakfast option with a few less items? No GF offer.

Looking forward to coming back next time ğŸ‘â˜•â˜•

recent_reviews.author: Jessica Crump
recent_reviews.text:
Pumpkin patch was lovely, free to go to, just walk around and pick whichever pumpkins you fancy and pay in the shop. Very reasonable in price, we got 2 very large (big enough to fit by 2 months in) and 2 medium pumpkins for Â£20. Had wheelbarrows and a pumpkin washing station.

We did leave it a bit late this year and went only 2 days before Halloween so there wasn't loads of pumpkins left but still very good.

recent_reviews.author: Debby M
recent_reviews.text:
Took my 3 year old grandson on his first pumpkin picking trip to Pound Farm Lyneham and what a lovely place! We had a great time wandering from row to row looking for our perfect pumpkin. We saw some of the animals which was a bonus. A visit to the farm shop resulted in a lovely pot of cherry yoghurt and we spent ages perusing meats, preserves, fresh veg and eggs. Halloween display for photo ops. Some rides and a bouncy castle for the little ones. 3 nice size pumpkins for Â£2 each, absolute bargain!

Lovely people, very welcoming, a really nice morning out.

recent_reviews.author: Lyndon S. Smith
recent_reviews.text:
We popped in for a treat and were happy with the experience. We ordered the falafel vegetarian burger and a classic burgerâ€”both arrived promptly, were freshly made, and full of flavour. The staff were attentive and friendly, and the service was efficient throughout.
The place is clean, welcoming, and has a lovely atmosphere, with a tempting display of cakes that caught our eye. Thereâ€™s also a specials board, so weâ€™ll definitely be back to try more.  There is certainly an extensive option for lunch es and baguettes through to burgers etc and lots of choice for vegetarians.
It obviously gets busy and we understand that sometimes there is a little wait but it is worth it.
The adjoining farm shop is full of high-quality treatsâ€”on the pricier side though.
All in all, a great spot for lunch or dinner, and highly recommended.
Warm wishes, Lyndon S.

recent_reviews.author: Sandra D
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place. Parsnip & coconut soup was perfect. Lovely bread & butter with it. Large choice of teas. Easy access from Chippenham bypass. Very quick service.

recent_reviews.author: Steve Oram
recent_reviews.text:
The produce here is incredible. The range of quality goods is endless. It's not cheap, but that's not what you're signing up for at farm shops. Some things are exceptionally expensive (is Â£3.85 for a can of flavoured kambucha normal? Hand-crafted artisan chocolates @ Â£1 per bite ğŸ˜±), but the selection from proper english apple juice and locally baked cakes to a butchers, fresh baked bread and impressive selection of fruit and veg will be appreciated by any foodie.
The little garden centre part is also good, with a small selection of interesting plants and an eclectic little shop with a jumble of new and second hand bits and pieces.

recent_reviews.author: ì‹ í¬ì •
recent_reviews.text:
I was surprised to see the place almost full and quite busy around 11 am on a Saturday. The service was good and the food was decent, but it was more expensive than I expected. Itâ€™s a decent spot to stop by for brunch or a meal if you're passing through, but I wouldnâ€™t recommend it.

recent_reviews.author: Becky Hughes
recent_reviews.text: Good relaxing farm, lovely animals and great interactions. Lovely grounds, can feed all the animals when you purchase the food. Indoor softplay, trampolines and play structures. Nice woodland walk and fairy trail forest. Only point would be the Wooden play structure is starting to look tired and could do with a refresh. Food on site but didn't try as bought a picnic a d lots of benches to sit at. Chilled atmosphere and good price point.

recent_reviews.author: Cristina Romanova
recent_reviews.text:
Excellent Family Day Out!
We had a fantastic time at Cholderton Rare Breeds Farm â€” a perfect day for the whole family! The kids absolutely loved the trampolines and the soft play area inside the barn, which was a great way to burn off energy. Feeding the animals was a highlight for all of us â€” especially the lambs, goats, sheep, donkeys, and even alpacas! The staff were friendly, and everything was well-organized. A truly wonderful experience that weâ€™d happily repeat. Highly recommended!

recent_reviews.author: Hannah Strachan
recent_reviews.text: Super visit for 3 or so hours. Loved all the animals who were friendly. Lots of activities for kids including safe and study trampolines in several places and indoor soft play. Wine samples a plus and we did take a bottle home too. Would recommend to people travelling around for young kids especially.

recent_reviews.author: Sasha Tanner
recent_reviews.text: beautiful setting! We had such a lovely day there and all the staff we interacted with were lovely! This was such a great place for us to meet our friends as it's right in the middle for us. We will definitely be back for another visit! I think it's very reasonably priced for the entrance fees and also for the bucket of feed which you keep the bucket to refill next time, great way of saving waste on paper bags. Plenty of space for outdoor picnics and great play areas too, including a soft play and trampoline's for the kids to use. We had a lovely walk on the woodland and our kids enjoyed hunting for all the fairy doors! It's also great because it's not a huge place you can actually do all the stuff in one day and not feel rushed of you want to see it all.

recent_reviews.author: Marie Moss
recent_reviews.text: Try and meet up with friends here, if you want to eat best get a table reserved. Food always freshly cooked and delicious.

recent_reviews.author: Phil Hurkett
recent_reviews.text: Lush coffee and walnut cake!

recent_reviews.author: Susannah Raby-Cox
recent_reviews.text: We walked all the way from Devizes to come to have a good walk. We were greeted very friendly and went to select our pumpkin. They had a good selection of all colours and sizes, which would then be priced once you had chosen. I think mine was around Â£3. They had a welly wanging and some ohoto opportunity's avaliable. For children, there was some area for some play. They had a little cafe area where you could get a nice hot chocolate or a snack! I got myself a luxury hot chocolate, which was delicious!

recent_reviews.author: Bernard Lund
recent_reviews.text:
I regularly used Chris Collett, now his son James as my supplier. Logs cut to the required length to suit your fire. Good wood - burns well and good calorific output.
Speedy delivery, to your requirements.

recent_reviews.author: Candida Barnard
recent_reviews.text: Great Service from James.  Logs cut to the size we needed for our woodburner.  48 hours from initial enquiry to delivery, and the logs look great!

recent_reviews.author: Ian Potter
recent_reviews.text: picked up 1 ton of logs in my van they put the bag out for me, the yard was clean took about 15 mins to load nice people good logs will go again ğŸ‘

pumpkin_patches.address: Horse Lane Farm, Rowde, Devizes SN10 2QJ

recent_reviews.author: Paula Wroblewicz
recent_reviews.text: Highly recommended, fun maze for whole family. Food and drinks served on site. Very friendly with some kids activities to keep them occupied while you have coffee and cake :) maze itself is well done and definitely keeps kids on task :)

recent_reviews.author: hawran1212
recent_reviews.text: Great place and fun for whole family! Super friendly staff welcoming you with big warm smile! You can have a coffee, snacks and homemade cake ( Â£4 for 2 coffee, pack of crisps and fredo chocolate) you can bring your own snacks/ lunch as big picnic area. Clean and tidy.  Highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Beth Powell
recent_reviews.text: Just got back from our first ever visit to the maize maze, it was absolutely brilliant, our 2 (almost 3) year old loved it and was engaged in all 3 mazes to different extents, they are also challenging enough to keep the adults entertained. Dogs are welcome and there is toys and games and a large picnic area, food served on site and cold drinks. We loved it and will definitely be back next year!

recent_reviews.author: Faye Griffin
recent_reviews.text: We had a great day out at the Maize, party of six with two children (3 & 5) and two grandparents. Everyone enjoyed both the maizes and the cafe/   play space. Owners were lovely.

recent_reviews.author: Matt Rolfe
recent_reviews.text:
Wonderful little farm, particularly targeting toddlers for toddler time, which our 16 month old absolutely loved!!
Great range of animals to see, and activities for them to enjoy! â€˜Bubbles partyâ€™ and sitting up on the tractor and milk float were a hit too!

recent_reviews.author: Rhiannon Williams
recent_reviews.text:
A good place for families to visit, the playground is shaped like a tractor and great for kids, there is also a small soft play for under 5s.

I was expecting the area where they keep the animals to see to be bigger, it's not much bigger than a standard field with mid sized pens for the goats, cows and sheep.

There is a fairy trail and a few peddle for carts for older kids. There is nothing wrong with the place, everything there was very good - but for the ticket price I was just expecting a bit more and left feeling a little disappointed at the size of the place.

Maybe I would have felt better if we'd manage to to the walking trail to salwarpe but as this appears to be mainly on public footpaths I could do this anytime without having to pay for entry

recent_reviews.author: Chloe Skilbeck
recent_reviews.text:
Not many animals, the animals didnâ€™t seem well cared for, with just a empty fenced field with a water bowl and one hut, no enrichment, highland cows were matted and the sheep looked so overheated as seems they missed a shear. The chickens enclosure was a small shed and too hot.
Mainly just play equipment for kids and ice cream

recent_reviews.author: Elly Harrison
recent_reviews.text:
My first visit to your farm with my 4 year old grandson. What a find. Feeding the lovely animals was a delight. The play areas are amazing. The maize maze was just fab â€¦. Thank goodness for a mapâ€¦ Iâ€™m glad I had a pen to track our routesâ€¦ surprisingly disorientingâ€¦ maybe the loan of a pencil at start would be a good idea
Lunch was perfect. Kids lunch bag ideal
All staff were delightful attentive and very smiley  and engaged beautifully with my grandson who is a little shy !
What a find. Weâ€™ll be back. Well done to the whole team

recent_reviews.author: Rauf Shah
recent_reviews.text:
Great place for a one-day family outing, especially on a sunny day! ğŸŒ
Thereâ€™s a mix of indoor and outdoor play areas for children, which kept our kids busy and happy all day. It really is a â€œFull Day â€“ Fun Day!â€ ğŸ‰
Food is available on-site, but Iâ€™d recommend bringing your own snacks or lunch for a picnic-style break.
Overall, a very enjoyable family experience â€“ would love to visit again!

recent_reviews.author: Simon Caddick
recent_reviews.text: Well worth the visit. Plenty for the little one to do, lots of animals. Food from the canteen was good quality, although for the portion sizes I would suggest ordering 2x child's portion as adults portion is barely bigger for 1 1/2x price

recent_reviews.author: Stacey Miles
recent_reviews.text: I've been wanting to visit here for a while. Wow it didnt disappoint. When you first enter it feels quite small but there is lots to do. We spent the whole day here & were one of the few family's left at the end of the day & we still hadn't seen everything.  There are both indoor and outdoor play areas, the animals to see and feed and the animal sessions are communicated on arrival,(we missed all of these as we were off exploring) the cafe is reasonably priced (and nice food) but there are benches for picnics too. The kids had an absolute blast & were sad to leave at the end of the day. We definitely will be back.

recent_reviews.author: William Lloyd
recent_reviews.text: An absolute gem! A sprawling farm with so much to do / see. If youâ€™ve got a young family youâ€™d easily sustain a 4+ hour long visit here with whatâ€™s on offer. The team here have really thought of everything from feeding/petting farm animals to displays similar to what youâ€™d get at wildlife park settings, plus soft play areas (one of which is absolutely elite) across both indoor and outdoor areas. Iâ€™m too heavy now but wouldâ€™ve definitely had a go on the sleigh ramps otherwise! Great day out.

pumpkin_patches.address: Owl Hill Lane, Dunhampton, Stourport-on-Severn DY13 9SS

recent_reviews.author: Cindy Bell
recent_reviews.text:
I go here regularly with my 2yr old grandson it is just such a lovely farm the shop is great lots of lovely bits to choose from especially the Duck eggs & they serve good coffee
Everyone is polite & friendly & we love it there.  We are following the journey of the Piglets & today more have arrived just a great experience to take  my grandson to & I love it as well . There are a good selection of plants as well to buy its our go to place .
Well Done Top Barn ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Steve Hanna
recent_reviews.text: Me and the missus and my 5 year old loved it! Crazy golf, a big hit, other half loved cutting sunflowers and i loved the food. Well done.

recent_reviews.author: Chloe Aubrey
recent_reviews.text:
We visit here quite regularly. The breakfast baps, sausage rolls and scotch eggs that they make are amazing and well worth a try! You can sit in the garden area and enjoy the views and farm animals nearby.
The staff are friendly.
They stock loads of local produce and fresh fruit and veg. The plum jam that they sell is my favourite jam - would highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Ann Nutting
recent_reviews.text: On holiday in the area and it was recommended to us for which we are thankful. The Farm shop itself has a great variety of quality products and we did indulge ourselves. Outside we then had coffee and sausage bap before  walking around to see the animals. Well done to all at Top Barn.

pumpkin_patches.address: Top Barn Farm, Worcester Rd, Holt Heath, Worcester WR6 6NH

recent_reviews.author: Natasha â€œBaggie Babbiâ€ Parker
recent_reviews.text: Nice little farm free to walk round . Got goats chickens pigs alpacas rabbits guinea pigs . the shop is nice and big with plenty of choice of food and drinks plus fresh products aswell . had fun pumpkin picking also ad a go at the angry veg game . They also do a tractor ride and have trampolines and little tea cup ride also got a sand pit which is under cover and a kids play area . good day out for all

recent_reviews.author: Jessica M
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely little farm to walk around. Itâ€™s free (amazing!) so facilities can be a bit basic but I actually think that it is all perfectly fine and reflective of the experience. Not somewhere to spend a full day, but easily a few hours. The coffee cabin is lovely and has good service. Animal food is generous and an easy way to add extra entertainment for the children! Most toy equipment is coin operated so remember your Â£1s.

recent_reviews.author: farrah pajri / zahra sofea
recent_reviews.text: It was a great experience for us. My daughter really love feeding the animals around the farm. There were Goats, Chickens, Donkeys, Ponies, Pigs, and also Sheeps. You can buy the feeding bucket for the animals at the Food Cart in front of the shop. Very clean place. There were also a lot pumpkin that for sale preparation for Halloween Deco. On top of that young kids will definitely have a blast as they can also enjoy playing at the playground provided by them.

recent_reviews.author: Ken Sheridan-Irwin
recent_reviews.text: Really good camping ground well drained and quiet the farm shop is superb only a short drive to Worcester where we went to the Christmas market
