pumpkin_patches.address: Top Barn Farm, Worcester Rd, Holt Heath, Worcester WR6 6NH

recent_reviews.author: Simon
recent_reviews.text: Lovely selection of meat and veg in the farm shop. Lovely menu to choose from in the cafe, but they could have put the heating on. There was an icey draft every time anyone came through the door.

recent_reviews.author: Steve Webb
recent_reviews.text:
We had a birthday Sunday lunch for 8 people.
Lots of parking.
A good area for the kids to play.
I had the roast beef.
All the roasts and burgers our party had, were reported as being very tasty good portion sizes with lovely side veggies as well.
No desserts were eaten by us.
I had a cappuccino, reasonably prices and was a nice refreshing taste.
All the staff were very friendly and accommodating to our tables needs.
We would visit again.

recent_reviews.author: Victoria
recent_reviews.text:
I wish we could have experienced what most reviews say.
Plenty of parking and easy to find.
Saturday 19th July we arrived at 4:30pm to buy some shop produce, everywhere said it was open 30 minutes more, til 5pm. We did think it was odd as there no cars, and it looked very dark/shut inside. My partner got out to check with staff, it was open, â€˜greatâ€™ I thought.
I walked in to all lights off (thank goodness for daylight) there was a slim, dark haired man with glasses, as I entered I say â€œhelloâ€, to which he just stared back, straight faced then turned and walked away. Everything fresh had been cleared away. We only chose 2 items and stayed for less than 4 minutes as we didnâ€™t feel welcome. I understand you may wish to close early but there is no need for the attitude we received. We wonâ€™t be coming again or recommending Cliveâ€™s.

recent_reviews.author: Melody May Sheppard
recent_reviews.text: This was both super people and dog friendly! The cafe has delicious cakes with both indoor and outdoor seating. And the farm shop has loads of fresh produce including a butchers.

pumpkin_patches.address: Clive's Of Cropthorne, The Heath, Cropthorne WR10 3NE

recent_reviews.author: Jackie Banks
recent_reviews.text: We had a buffet lunch for 32 people after a funeral (May 2025). The food and service were excellent. Even though we had 4 more people turn up than expected Karen and her staff managed this very well, bringing out extra food with no fuss. They also catered for our gluten intolerant and vegetarian guests perfectly. The cakes were yummy and there were endless supplies of tea and coffee. Would definitely recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Marc Farmer
recent_reviews.text:
We'd heard good things about Chadbury Farm Shop in terms of grabbing a nice breakfast and were pleased to find they were absolutely right. There was plenty of parking and although there were lots of tables reserved for bookings we were able to find a table for the four of us. I would advise booking a table to be sure!
The staff were friendly, helpful and very efficient. The food arrived very quickly after we ordered and was very good indeed. Everyone was very happy with their food and nothing was left at the end. Highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Rob Appleby
recent_reviews.text: Not great food tbh. A nice enough farm shop and the staff in the shop and the restaurant were very nice and polite. Unfortunately the food in the cafe wasnâ€™t brilliant. The black pudding didnâ€™t seem to have been cooked, the toast was all over the place (one piece burnt one piece barely browned. The poached egg had shell in it. All little things and it was still worth trying but we wonâ€™t be coming back.

recent_reviews.author: Richard the Plumber
recent_reviews.text:
Very nice food, a little on the expanse side, but very good quality.

Nice fruit and veg and lots of other stuff for sale. All reasonably priced.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Harper Farming - Top Barn - Farm in Worcester

recent_reviews.author: Nermin Jagodic
recent_reviews.text: Nice  people

pumpkin_patches.address: Woodside Farm/Top Barn, Holt Heath, Worcester WR6 6NH

recent_reviews.author: Tram La Bich
recent_reviews.text: Piddle Brook Farm is a lovely place to visit with children, especially for picking pumpkins. The staff are friendly and welcoming, making the experience enjoyable for families. There are many large, fresh pumpkins to choose from, perfect for fall activities. It's also a great spot for taking photos, with plenty of picturesque scenes for children and families to capture special moments. A perfect day out for the whole family!

recent_reviews.author: Patricia Butler
recent_reviews.text: So cute. Very affordable and fun. Cale & coffee. Suitable for dogs :)

recent_reviews.author: Natalie Tallis Dykes
recent_reviews.text: Great pumpkin picking spot!

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Mills
recent_reviews.text: We had my daughter's 6th birthday party today at the farm in glorious sunshine. A superb birthday party; the children were enthralled interacting with the animals and thoroughly enjoyed the campfire surrounded by nosey chickens. Amy was brilliant with the children and everyone really enjoyed the occasion. Thank you ğŸ™‚

recent_reviews.author: joe baldwin
recent_reviews.text: Well worth a vist, super friendly family owned business, a great family activity and great selection of pumpkins

pumpkin_patches.address: Oversley Hill Farm, Oversley Green, Alcester B49 6LR

recent_reviews.author: Carol Parker
recent_reviews.text: This is an excellent place for seasonal vegetables.  They sell all sorts of foods in the shop, including pies and cheeses. The plants are excellent and are a lot cheaper than a garden centre and the staff are helpful and friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Maureen Moruzzi
recent_reviews.text: Healthy, varied choice of plants at very reasonable prices. Fresh produce in shop. Will visit again.

recent_reviews.author: Keith Smith
recent_reviews.text: Amazing place. The staff are super friendly and helpful. The food is fantastic. Weekly veg is in many cases cheaper than the shops. Meats are quite expensive but high quality. They do everything here including meats, dairy, bread, cakes, seeds, anything for the garden and growing, sacks of potatoes, you name it. Even the customers are lovely and friendly. Nobody leaves disappointed

recent_reviews.author: Helen Hinchliffe
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place , great guy who owns , lovely home feel , good prices , great shop local produceâ€¦. Deserves a visit !! Plants hardy and good value

pumpkin_patches.address: Farm, Southend, Renhold Rd, Bedford MK44 2PT

recent_reviews.author: Louise Robinson
recent_reviews.text: Followed the signs to this secret farm and upon arrival was sooo excited! Lovely entrance and things to get kids excited, bouncy castles, sand pit, tables under shelter for picnic and other tables scattered around too! Loos and washing facilities. Shop with sweets & drinks. All PYO items are priced so reasonably I couldn't believe I hadn't come here sooner. A fantastic day out and the owners are so friendly! Cannot wait for our next trip for Halloween! We went for Sunflowers and also came out with Roses, Dahlia's and Sweetcorn! Amazing!!

recent_reviews.author: Christine Chenery
recent_reviews.text:
Had a fabulous time packing the perfect pumpkins today.  Even though there were a lot of people there it didn't feel crowded, so much space.
Already planning next years visit.

recent_reviews.author: Chris
recent_reviews.text:
"Secret Pumpkin" picking at Anderson Farm, was the best pumpkin picking we've ever been too. They actually grow the pumpkins in the field, with most of them being pre-cut for you. Amazing day out, lots of free attractions on offer, hay-bale maze, spookey trail. Plus actual cost of pumpkins is cheaper than Tescos or Sainsburys.

Plus there is a pumpkin CANNON!!!

Will definitely be back next year!!!

recent_reviews.author: Jenni Kay
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant! Well organised and the kids loved it. Going earlier is better as it was getting a bit hectic when we left at half 11.

recent_reviews.author: Naila Ahmed
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic family day out! It was fun for all ages.

It was our first time going here last week and it was a very pleasant experience. We had our kids there, aged three and six as well as their grandparents and Iâ€™m happy to say that we all enjoyed our time there.

There were small clear baskets for free to pick fruits and vegetables and then there were these sturdier baskets for only a pound each that we could take home. There was a huge field, and each area had its designated produce.

After picking your own berries, you go to the little barn and pay for what you picked. The prices were really reasonable, and everything we picked was amazing. We got potatoes, spinach, Carrots, and of course, strawberries. And honestly, they are like 100 times better than the store-bought ones.

I would highly recommend this place for picking your own/excellent quality produce. Do not miss the strawberries and donâ€™t forget your hats and sunscreen.

Ample free parking.

recent_reviews.author: Sisa Tonkinson
recent_reviews.text: Such a beautiful little farm with so much organic produce! I went strawberry and raspberry picking and there were so many ripe and sweet raspberryâ€™s. However we did not come at the right time for the strawberryâ€™s. Nonetheless it was such a wonderful experience and would highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Michael J
recent_reviews.text: It's a gorgeous fruit and veggie picking experience, a must-do for the whole family! The fruits are delicious and reasonably priced. So peaceful! We will be back. ğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: Magdalena Wasiewska
recent_reviews.text:
Everything was just perfect except the service . Have been first time.
We got the basket... lovely ....pick up the fruits and vegetables. We pick up 3 small corns and 3 onions and was charged double price..... is not about money just about respect . I do not mind  to pay 80 p instead 40 p the quality is perfect. Prices ok . We had a lovely day and on the end of just  ruined because we should not get the onion and corns that day. Really understand her way but how she treat the clients was just not right.

recent_reviews.author: George.GR_UK Original
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely place. Every day fresh eggs. You can pay cash or card .
ğŸ‘ŒğŸ‘ŒğŸ‘ŒğŸ‘Œâ™¥ï¸â™¥ï¸â™¥ï¸

recent_reviews.author: John Vallance
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely place. Wonderful for the children to see the animals and great farm shop with super fresh produce.

recent_reviews.author: Lai Yi Chiu
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely animals , such as pigs, chickens,  ducks , deers & goats.
All are happy and free.
There is peaceful in the small farm.

Remember to bring cash if you intend to buy some fresh eggs and fresh fruits . No contactness,  please ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Nicola J
recent_reviews.text: A lovely  place ,family business,  fresh free range eggs.  Glad to support a local business and know that the eggs I use come from well looked after chickens . Just bought some lovely shrubs and tomato plants . Lots to choose from great prices too. (April 2024)

pumpkin_patches.address: New Bath Rd, Twyford, Reading RG10 9RY

recent_reviews.author: Daniel Palmer
recent_reviews.text: Jam-packed full of quality local produce. The deli counters were mouthwatering and it was hard to not drop a small fortune. Really appreciate a place that promotes local produce so will always give a 5 star. Lovely grounds for the kids to run around as well. Nice little touch offering boxes to take your groceries home.

recent_reviews.author: Larisa Day
recent_reviews.text:
Cobbs is a great place to stop off for lunch with seating inside and outside, dogs ğŸ• welcome.
Cafe is open from 10 am, with a fixed menu, depending on the season.  Sunday is roast dinner day.
Weekends are busy, so it's best to go online and book a table.

Fancy afternoon tea, then this the place to treat yourself or your mum, sister. Bookings taken in advance

The farm shop has excellent fresh produce, fresh meat, cheese, and a small selection of wines. The prices are reflected in the quality of their product.

You can buy plants ğŸª´ and flowers at Sarah's florist, which is by the entrance
Parking available, including some electric charging points.

Highly recommend and a hidden gem just off the A4 heading out of Hungerford towards Marlborough.

Frequently visited by us and to take friends.
Cobbs can accommodate group bookings of around 30 guests but must arrange in advance.

Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.
.

recent_reviews.author: Nicole Nix
recent_reviews.text:
One of the best farm shops Iâ€™ve seen on my trip to England. Wonderful range of produce both local and region as well as a few choice imported goods.  (Banghoek chilli oil from South Africa is superb).
The cheeses were my best.

recent_reviews.author: Nigel Woodman
recent_reviews.text:
Great place for lunch or breakfast. Service a little slow but the staff are helpful and friendly.
The butchery and cheese/pastry counters are very good, all with a good range of quality products. A good selection of fish is also available from the chiller cabinets.
Veggie display does not have the same commendation; some very tired vegetables (shrivelled mushrooms ought to be on display) and expensive as well compared to Waitrose and - well  -OK, Salisbury Market. The latter's perhaps not a fair comparison...
We'll keep visiting to eat and buy meat but will buy our veg elsewhere.

recent_reviews.author: Nadya O
recent_reviews.text: Arrived at the last hour on the last picking day of the year and still managed to pick up quite the haul at Â£8.50 a kilo! No rhubarb though, presumably because we came late in the season? They also sold both soft set and runny local honey out of a little caravan, which we're excited to try. Looking forward to returning next year.

recent_reviews.author: Larisa
recent_reviews.text: Loads of strawberries and red currants, very easy to pick

recent_reviews.author: Shaikh Sultan
recent_reviews.text:
It was an awesome experience.
I went there with my friends and family. We had a great time after such a long time. The strawberry very tasty and sweet. The best part was the freshness of it.

recent_reviews.author: SJ G
recent_reviews.text: Still a great PYO. Sadly, no strawberries any more. Veg only, fantastic asparagus and rhubarb

recent_reviews.author: K D
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful property with lush fruit! I don't even eat fruit much anymore because the mass produced stuff from the supermarket is dull and flavourless. The plums, apples, and raspberries from here were soooo good. A total hidden gem in Iver. Take your kids here and have them pick some fruit to have with their movie night instead of the candy junk from the shops!

recent_reviews.author: Rithu Johnson
recent_reviews.text:
Our family went here 2 years back and we had a sterling time there. We could pick our own fruits, whatever we need. They do have variety of apples & plums, blackberries etc., worth visit â­ï¸
I would highly recommend this fruit farm âœ¨

recent_reviews.author: Burcu Aksoy
recent_reviews.text: It was a great farm just 5 min away from us. I have picked some blackberries and plums and bought an apple juices. Lovely ownersâ™¥ï¸ highly recommended ğŸŒ¸

recent_reviews.author: Madie leostar
recent_reviews.text: Oh my goodness this place is soooo beautiful. I was looking for a place for fruit picking to celebrate the autumn equinox and this place showed up. Its so beautiful, the fruit is delicious and it was an amazing day out for me my mum, dad and sister. 100% recommend

recent_reviews.author: Matt Wallace
recent_reviews.text:
Wonderful farm shop and cafe. The farm shop is small but very well stocked. Prices are expensive but not excessive. The cafe is wonderful.
Amazingly friendly customer service with a wide range of freshly cooked locally sourced products.
Coffee, bacon roll and soup is great. Thereâ€™s loads of fabulous picnic tables. Ideal on a dry day. Less pleasant when itâ€™s raining. The toilet facilities are ok but nothing special. In summary the perfect pit stop if youâ€™re walking Coombe Hill or Chequers

recent_reviews.author: Lee P
recent_reviews.text:
Have been coming here for about two years to purchase meat, pies and veg. Quality has never dropped at all, good pricing and helpful staff. It's about a 50mile round trip but I don't mind at all.
Steaks, chicken and lamb is out of this world tasty!

It's very important we support our farmers!

recent_reviews.author: Sam Jeffs
recent_reviews.text: Very tasty take away food and drink, I had a Halloumi burger, iced latte and a cherry Bakewell.

recent_reviews.author: Vikram Reddy
recent_reviews.text: This farm shop is very good, Unique products like handmade soaps, fresh apple juice, and ciders caught my eye. But the real highlight is the food served right next to the farm fields - it's amazing! The fresh produce and scenic views make it a must-visit. Highly recommend for a farm-to-table experience!

pumpkin_patches.address: Buckmoorend Farm, Butler's Cross, Aylesbury HP17 0UT

recent_reviews.author: Kinga P
recent_reviews.text:
Highly recommend this farm to everyone!
Clean and spacious â€” no crowds, everyone has their own space. The animals are well cared for and have everything they need. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The food is absolutely delicious!
There are bins everywhere, the toilets are clean, and the farm is well thought out for both sunny and rainy days.
Everything 10/10 â€” bravo! ğŸ˜ŠğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Fayth Drysdale
recent_reviews.text:
Wow this farm is a hidden gem. Went for the first time yesterday. The staff offer a warm welcome, the site is clean and tidy, and the animals are amazing. The staff offer lots of information about all the animals. The deer meadow was wonderful, the tractor ride was really sweet you go around a track on a field hunting for animals, the owl display was a highlight (Lottie was fabulous at teaching us all about barn owls as they fly around your heads!!), the barn furry friends feeding was fun, grooming the donkeys was a treat (the two young staff members were super kind & chatty too) and all the various play areas are genuinely fantastic (soft play, sand pit, straw bay obstacle course, jumping pillows, and a great outdoor park).
But the most amazing part was that we accidentally dropped â€œfoxyâ€, my daughters precious jelly cat Teddy from birth, itâ€™s a comforter for her to help regulate her emotions (she is AuDHD) and the staff found him for us and kept him safe so we could come back and collect him. some parents will understand how grateful I am for that!!

recent_reviews.author: Jamie Bruton
recent_reviews.text:
Visited on a school holiday weekday with two adults and my 3 year old daughter, had an absolutely great time.

I think the price is very fair and a great day out  the animals themselves were great, a really good variety to see including birds of prey, creepy crawlies, wolves, foxes and your more traditional farmyard animals.

The indoor play area was great and the outdoor play areas were brilliant very varied and plenty of seating for us as well as lots of things to keep our little one happy and entertained!

Would definitely recommend to anyone!

recent_reviews.author: Jess S
recent_reviews.text: We had a lovely experience today at Hogshaw Farm. 2 adults. 2 chdn under 10. There is so much to do and to see. For Â£15 pp there's 2 sand pits, multiple play areas, water play area (within one sand area), farm animals and some wildlife animals. We pre booked the bird show (free) and the woman who presented really knew her info and made it really interesting! She spent some time answering my sons questions too. We didn't eat there but the cafe was huge and had a massive soft play inside. Toilets situated at the beginning. Loads of places to sit and eat. Small train ride and bouncy pillows x 2 for under 5s and 5 plus. All the staff were really really friendly and I can't fault them at all! Would highly recommend for a day out in the sun as it's all outdoors apart from cafe n shop.

recent_reviews.author: Emma James
recent_reviews.text: Sadly I don't live locally any more because it used to be a regular haunt but when I'm in Buckinghamshire visiting friends, I stop by for produce. Try the scotch eggs, they're delicious!  Also a good range of flours if you enjoy baking like me

recent_reviews.author: Jo Tocci
recent_reviews.text: Delicious coffee, great shop and always a warm welcome. A little gem to be discovered.

recent_reviews.author: S Emmanuel
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely setting, beautiful land
Nice little shop with an array of chutneys, meat rubs & nibbles.
Got some lovely eggs but there wasn't loads of choice on the meat front.
Will definitely go back.

recent_reviews.author: Funky Ninja
recent_reviews.text: They sell amazing produce. I requested two racks of ribs and they were huge and very meaty with great flavour. Their eggs are excellent too. Highly recommend.

pumpkin_patches.address: Red Barn Farm Beaconsfield Road, Amersham HP7 0JY

recent_reviews.author: Nessa Langford
recent_reviews.text: The new shop is fantastic. Loads of treats & fruit & veg. It's nice to have a decent farm shop close by with plenty of parking too.

recent_reviews.author: Alison Chappell
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm shop with high quality fruit and veg, friendly staff and great selection of local, small-batch products such as apple juice, bread and preserves.

recent_reviews.author: Neil Axtell
recent_reviews.text:
A real find. Excellent value for money and you can buy exactly what you need generally without any excess plastic packaging. Really nice to see that they prioritise getting F&V from local producers thereby reducing food miles. I cannot remember the last time I went into a grocers shop and they could tell me exactly where the veg has come from.
Looking forward to seeing the new shop when they have finished building it.

recent_reviews.author: Ashleigh Wright
recent_reviews.text: Always get our fruit, veg and eggs from here where we can. Lovely produce and staff always friendly.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Cuckoo Bridge Nursery and Farm Shop

recent_reviews.author: Catherine Darler-Ballard
recent_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little nursery. Great plants and great prices. All of the ladies working here are really helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. The only downside is it's very easy to spend all your money! I quite often fill my boot, which isn't that hard as it's quite small.

recent_reviews.author: Gemma Annies
recent_reviews.text: Visited today for pyo pumpkin. Had a really good time. Friendly staff. Was expecting to pay more than Â£10 for these so very happy. Brilliant for kids.

recent_reviews.author: Rosie Nicholls
recent_reviews.text: I took my 2 year old here last week and we both had a great time, she loved the soft play with frozen on and the mini tractors and of course the bouncy castles! Mum also happy with lots of lovely photo opportunities, well worth the entrance fee, very good morning or afternoon out!

recent_reviews.author: paul adams
recent_reviews.text: Also half barrels which are also handy for planting  displays or a large plant that you don't want to put in the ground. Bulbs are available. A large amount of compost is for sale. You can now get a coffee. Bedding plants are available.  Christmas trees are now for sale.

pumpkin_patches.address: Cuckoo Bridge Nursery & Farmshop, St Ives Rd, Somersham, Huntingdon PE28 3ET

recent_reviews.author: Isabella Gottardi
recent_reviews.text:
Great place to spend a few hours with kids.
Animals, cafÃ©, very friendly staff, a really good experience.
The annual and the seasonal pass aren't expensive.

recent_reviews.author: SHARON HOLMES
recent_reviews.text: I thoroughly enjoyed meeting all the animals and getting to feed and pet them. I was given the opportunity to bottle feed the lambs, what a truly wonderful experience!! The farm is absolutely perfect for families with young children, as there are lots of activities for children.

recent_reviews.author: laura rooke
recent_reviews.text: We ended up getting an annual pass here as we just love it! The staff here love each and every one of the animals and it's clear that their number one priority is caring for the animals and educating others all about all of the animals so that they can go on to care for all living things! Each time you visit there has been a new addition or an upgrade and you can see the passion that they put into making this farm and amazing place to visit! Every day there are numerous animal feeds or talks and all of these are interactive and educational. Eva, who often does these talks when I visit has a wealth of knowledge and clearly knows these animals on a very personal level, telling us quirks of each animals personality. There's a lovely little cafe there with reasonably priced food and regular events through the school holidays as well! Their annual tickets are very reasonably priced and we even found out today that for Â£8.60 on top of your standard entry, you can get a summer pass, allowed unlimited free entry through the summer holidays!!

recent_reviews.author: Nguyá»…n VÄƒn Hiáº¿u
recent_reviews.text: Lovely staff, amazingly spacious and friendly for family. Animals all look very happy and well taken care of. Only downside is the road in is a bit too small, but it's worth the trip.

recent_reviews.author: Andy N
recent_reviews.text: We've eaten at the cafe here twice, as well as shopped in the farm shop and bought meat from the butcher. We have one of their plant pots in our garden and some of their meat on our barbecue. They're excellent - well worth the visit, not the largest garden centre (like a Van Have perhaps), but they focus on great, high quality food and a small amount of useful additions. The cafÃ© is lovely too - we had afternoon tea for the adults, and some duck salad and a pasta for our teens. Everything was great - we sat on the terrace, enjoying the view as well as the food. There were three generations at our table and we were all very happy with our experience - lots of space to park and easy access to the tables; helpful staff; and a lovely view to enjoy our wonderful sweet and savoury treats. We then picked up some steaks and sausages for the barbecue which I'm cooking now, and I can tell they'll be delicious (I've bought some before) - high quality meat. We travel especially to come out here and it's worth it!

recent_reviews.author: Liz Hirji
recent_reviews.text: Had lunch here today 26/06/25 with my daughter (our first time). Everything was fabulous. From the welcome to the quick efficient service to amazingly tasty food. I can't fault it at all. It's even in a beautiful countryside setting. Well done. I will definitely be back again.

recent_reviews.author: Sophia S
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful afternoon tea!! Great selection of food as I believe itâ€™s a new menu. Also the farm shop is lovely, amazing selection of fruit and veg. Will definitely return!

recent_reviews.author: Elena Ng
recent_reviews.text:
Comfortable sittings and good breakfast options. The food quality is good. Coffee is serving hot and fast, but the taste is average. I recommend the breakfast, and they provide gluten-free toast.
There are many vegetable options and own brand pale ale.

Came back second time for early dinner with kids, the food is good. I enjoyed my burger and fish and chips - gluten free option is great too. Few options for gluten free dessert such as the toffee pudding is great.

recent_reviews.author: Bo Nus
recent_reviews.text:
Some staff are friendly and warm welcome!
Big space for car park and sitting area.

Inside the farm, there are absolutely many choices and sections for your cooking meal.
But in some sections, the price is not what I am expecting.

Check properly before you buy!

recent_reviews.author: Anat Orgad
recent_reviews.text: We accidentally arrived at this place on Friday on our way from Cambridge. It turns out you need to purchase tickets for the event in advance. They were so kind  to let us in, and we paid for the entrance Â£10 per person. This place is amazingâ€”it's a huge farm converted into various dining spots and food stations, including asado, pizzas, crabs, sardines, alcohol, and more. In the background, there's a DJ playing fun music. Great place for family and friends. The crowd is great, and the atmosphere is perfect.

recent_reviews.author: Victor Escorcia
recent_reviews.text: Great spot after a walk, bike ride in the park/area. On Sunday, you might find a good truck to complement the snacks serve in the bar.

recent_reviews.author: Jenna Govier
recent_reviews.text:
The Sundowner Session is not worth Â£12.50. Seating was either the standard outdoor seating benches, or on the field behind the Shack, either on the grass, a couple of benches or a couple of haybales.

Food on offer was very limited: two vans, HitWrap and one that was making either a meat burger or a veggie burger, I think from the farm shop produce. It was a huge shame more local produce was not available for purchase. This was clearly falsely advertised, as the advert states "Guests can indulge in a variety of offerings, a BBQ serving up fire-cooked seasonal delights, and a selection of local food trucks."

The shops closed at their normal hours, so it was not possible to browse through these. The Shack was abysmal. A sign pointed towards it offering "Dessert and Ice Cream," but all that was on offer was a nearly Â£10 "sundae" or small slices of flapjack/brownie costing Â£3.70. The person serving was not particularly happy to see customers.

There was a jazz type band playing when we arrived around 5pm. When they ended it was a DJ. Both were nice, but just background music rather than entertainment.

The most ironic thing of all was that the portaloos were placed exactly where the sun was setting! Not an ideal location for an evening literally named the "Sundowner"!!

To be honest, I'm not really sure what we paid Â£12.50 per person for.

pumpkin_patches.address: Heath Farm, Babraham Rd, Stapleford, Cambridge CB22 3AD

recent_reviews.author: Sinead Murphy
recent_reviews.text: Visited The Hollies Farm Shop a week ago and itâ€™s fab! Spent a small fortune of a variety of foods from the Farm Shop, some Tallow & Ash from The Barn Shop and then into The Hollies Takeaway for a delicious breakfast bap for my husband, latte and then a still cloudy lemonade for myself which was the best still lemonade Iâ€™ve ever had. We sat outside under the shade because even though it was only 10am (we arrived just after 8.30am on a Sunday morning) it was beautiful and warm. Ideal day out if youâ€™re into farm shops and produce. We drove down from Liverpool , and the drive is great. Afterwards we took a scenic route home. Will definitely have a drive over again soon â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: victoria harper
recent_reviews.text:
We used to stop here for breakfast on our way to Manchester when they had the restaurant, after stopping for lunch on Saturday we can see why the concept had changed-to accommodate the volume of people.

Food slightly on the pricier side, but very tasty! Was so good that we ended up stopping off again on Sunday on our return journey for milkshakes and cake. Was a lot quieter at around 3.30pm on Sunday in comparison to the queues out of the door for food on Saturday around 1pm.

Will most definitely visit again when passing.

recent_reviews.author: Barry McGrath
recent_reviews.text: The Hollies Farm Shop is a real treat to visit. In summer, the outdoor eating area is perfect â€” plenty of space to relax and enjoy delicious food in the sunshine. Thereâ€™s ample parking, which makes popping in stress-free, and the staff are always warm, welcoming, and helpful. A lovely spot for quality local produce and a great atmosphere!

recent_reviews.author: Molly Bufton
recent_reviews.text:
Actual shop and gift shop lovely with great produce and nice staff!

We popped into the takeaway to grab a drink and cake and when it was our turn to be served, the young man just stared at us, no welcome just blankly stared at us. It made us feel really awkward and upset; it ruined the whole experience for me even though the coffee and cake were amazing!

pumpkin_patches.address: Tarporley Rd, Little Budworth, Tarporley CW6 9ES

recent_reviews.author: Ali Newsome
recent_reviews.text:
My second visit to Pye Ash Farm for the Sheepdog training experience.
James , Jane and Martha are so knowledgeable and welcoming. The experience is fantastic and I would highly recommend!!
Pye Ash Farm also hosts seasonal events and I have brought the family to the Pumpkins, Lambing and Christmas, they love this place. All in all a must visit !!

recent_reviews.author: Nina Vearnals
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm, small and compact so perfect for smaller kids. Staff were all so lovely, pumpkins were average price for places like this. The sheepdog demonstrations were brill. A bit muddy, which is obviously to be expected. We'll definitely come back next year!

recent_reviews.author: Beth O'Doherty
recent_reviews.text: The Sheepdog training day was an absolutely wonderful experience. The welcome to the farm was so warm and we were looked after so well my partner and I didn't want to leave. The families knowledge of the craft is encyclopedic and their commitment to the dogs is so sweet. Got to bask in the cleverness of some really beautiful Collies. Perfect day

recent_reviews.author: Paulina Cakalli
recent_reviews.text: Great farm to go. 10 min from Macclesfield. I went today to pick some pumpkins and had a lovely time. There were pumpkins in different colours. The farmers were really friendly. I was inspired by the story of teaching dogs how to guide sheeps. Great experience which I highly recommend.

pumpkin_patches.address: Pye Ash Farm, Bosley, Macclesfield SK11 0PN

recent_reviews.author: Craig Betts
recent_reviews.text: We visited twice in a week for lunch and it was excellent. Iâ€™d recommend booking at peak times if you want to eat. We also bought some bits for a BBQ and they were great as well. Everything is homemade and all tastes amazing. Even a plain old ham sandwich takes a different dimension with fresh bread and locally reared pigs. Oh and the views are pretty special as well. Next time weâ€™re in the area weâ€™ll be sure to visit again.

recent_reviews.author: Sara Lewis
recent_reviews.text: The food here is incredibly tasty and fresh. Quality ingredients and generous portions, beautiful views and friendly, helpful staff. Our table of 3 all enjoyed our experience and meals equally. Highly recommend the Beef roast ğŸ¤¤

recent_reviews.author: C-Reviews
recent_reviews.text: I loved this farm shop! The choices and quality of products were amazing. Views also sublime from the tea rooms and the cakes .. wow! Service wasnâ€™t the friendliest. But I would return in a heartbeat to spend some more money on local goods!

recent_reviews.author: Rob
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic place with beautiful scenery. Perfect place for the "pit stop". Delicious coffee and more. Love it!!
The shop also offers many products from Cornwall.

recent_reviews.author: Phil Smith
recent_reviews.text:
Loads of fresh fruit and veg at reasonable prices, especially for the area. Among other things we bought 2 fresh large chicken breasts (Â£6) and a Cajun rub (99p), would definitely recommend LOVELY!!
Will return for the cooked breakfast

recent_reviews.author: Neil Lewis
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic fresh produce, and really lovely staff. The bacon we purchased for breakfast sandwiches was amazing, and much better quality than your usual local shop experience.
We managed to pick up some other needed items in the shop too, so really impressed overall.
The restaurant food smelled incredible, I just wish we had eaten there!

recent_reviews.author: Lesley Andrew
recent_reviews.text: Stumbled across Tredinnick Farm Shop when travelling home from a short-break in the area.  Called in for a few goodies, then decided to use the cafe for lunch.  Both ordered the special - sausages, mash and peas in a large yorkshire pud.  Delicious local butcher sausages - 3 of them!, with creamy mash, and onion gravy, all for under a tenner each.  Thoroughly enjoyed and will definitely call in again when we are next in the area.  Farm shop itself, is well stocked, more like a mini-supermarket, with great quality fresh fruit and veg, meat and groceries, and very reasonably priced.  Hot pasties to take away, and even offer Evri parcel collection and drop off.  Must be a real asset to this rural spot to save a longer trip into one of the larger towns.

recent_reviews.author: Emma Fletcher
recent_reviews.text: Great little farm shop with an excellent cafe!  We had one small and one large breakfast, both tasted fantastic, and the service was nice and friendly. Thank you!

recent_reviews.author: Gaby Armstrong
recent_reviews.text: Great community orchard. I went to the wassail which was really fun

recent_reviews.author: Becky Stone
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place to come and enjoy the experience and learn about apples so peaceful and beautiful,  well done to all that make it happen

recent_reviews.author: simon barclay (Babu)
recent_reviews.text: What an amazing venue, a little hidden gem of tranquility à¤¸à¤šà¥à¤šà¤¿à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨à¤‚à¤¦ â˜®ï¸â˜¯ï¸ğŸ•‰ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡¾X

recent_reviews.author: Charlie
recent_reviews.text: Went there on a school trip awesome community and people

recent_reviews.author: Calum L
recent_reviews.text:
Beautiful â€” even in the rain!
We arrived on a rainy day and still had an amazing experience. The food was absolutely delicious, with a huge variety to choose from. Definitely worth a stop if youâ€™re in the area.

recent_reviews.author: Martina (Hami)
recent_reviews.text:
We visited this small farm shop on our Cornwall road trip, and oh my goodness, why doesn't anyone talk about this place? Everything inside looks so good, and the people in the shop and deli are very kind and friendly. We have only just had a chance to try the bread and jam. So good. The best jam we have ever eaten. Can't believe we almost missed the deli shop. We have tried from there the steak pasty, apple sauce roll, and carrot cake! And oh my! I can't decide what was better! Just loved it all! Sausage roll amazing, tastes like no other. Pasty, the best in Cornwall...and we have tried lots on our Cornwall road trip. ğŸ¤­ğŸ˜… And next the carrot cake...never ate something so tasty and full of flavor! Almost went there again for another food! ğŸ˜†ğŸ˜± Must visit if you are around! We are still talking about it weeks later. Such amazing food!!!
#travelwithtentbox

recent_reviews.author: Karen Elliott
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely selection of local produce.  'Padstow porkers' sausages were tasty but we were disappointed with the
pork steaks but for us they were quite fatty and lacked flavour and shrunk a lot when cooked.

Enjoyed some local Marmalade whilst away.

recent_reviews.author: Selwyn Mundy
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic local produce, lovely deli, selection of wine and beer. Fresh meat and veg. Local cheese. Very nice staff. Did i say the pasty was amazing. Well it is. Stunning. Move over all the 'award winning' ones you pay a fortune for, these are the ones to beat.

recent_reviews.author: Becky Fox
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful rustic shop and cafe. Lovely coffee and cake. Lots of good quality, organic products. Gorgeous setting with friendly staff (inc Tia the dog). A good find.

recent_reviews.author: Andreas Grote
recent_reviews.text: Different than weâ€™re used to in Germany and quite small with a reduced range of offers but everything 100% organic and the fresh vegetables even seems local grown in a greenhouse, especially the minced beef made of only grass fed Angus. Awesome even for pasta alla Ragout bolognese.

recent_reviews.author: William
recent_reviews.text:
Well worth the trip, great selection of fresh veg, cheese, meat, bread and general groceries almost all Organic. Their home reared Organic Beef is without doubt the best I have ever eaten!
Freshly made organic coffee and tea often with home baked delicacies . Warm and friendly service from the family and staff.

recent_reviews.author: Emily Sharp
recent_reviews.text:
What a wonderful shop. A brilliant selection of organic produce, fresh breads, fruit and vegetables, eggs, meat, dairy, fish, vegan products, chocolate, wines etc.  If you like to eat real foods you could do your weekly shop here. The long opening hours are very convenient.

The staff were very friendly, they answered all of the questions I had about their hens, and they very kindly let me go and see them.  The eggs were absolutely delicious.

I feel very fortunate to live so close by, thank you for creating such a great shop.

recent_reviews.author: Sieve Sommer
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic local produce, very tasty strawberries plums tomatoes and apples!

recent_reviews.author: Jules Robinson
recent_reviews.text:
A very well stocked shop. Spent far too much on local or Cornish produce.
Really enjoyed wandering and looking at the foods available.

recent_reviews.author: Sharon Duffy
recent_reviews.text: Farm shop have visited twice while on holiday more than happy to recommend very well stocked for all your food needs plus lovely staff please support shop local their home grown strawberries are far better than any supermarket ! And they promote local produce

recent_reviews.author: Giles Hutchings
recent_reviews.text:
Conveniently located off the A30, this is a well-stocked deli providing a large range of fresh vegetables, cheese, meats, teas, coffee and fudge.

The decor inside is wooden and cosy, and the staff are friendly too. Some of the items are a little pricy, such as Â£1.50 for a single card and envelope!

recent_reviews.author: Suzie Pendragon
recent_reviews.text: I'm very lucky to work here, people love this farm shop with its own farm reared beef, home baking, an array of cornish delights and some treats bought in from a little further afield. There is now a new addition of a wonderful cafÃ©, The Trough. Serving breakfast from 8.30 7 days a week, lunches from 12.30, and lovely cakes and drinks all-day until around 3.30. Dogs are welcome. Inside and outside seating!

recent_reviews.author: Yolanthe
recent_reviews.text: My husband and I love this farm shop! The pasties with their own local beef are absolutely delicious and the best ones we've had, can highly recommend. The coffee is amazing as well.

recent_reviews.author: Jo Thompson
recent_reviews.text: Yummy beef pie lots if chunky beef inside and peanut butter is the texture and taste im looking for.

recent_reviews.author: margaret bird
recent_reviews.text: Lovely clean cafe, with nice welcoming staff,  nice food,  but there are too many tables, too close together, very cramped. Kitchen service slow, and coffee very weak.  1st week, so things can only get better, hope so.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Baileyâ€™s Country Store and Farm Shop

recent_reviews.author: Keith Mellors
recent_reviews.text: Great place for all  your supplies, plenty of Fresh and Local produce the veg and meat is top quality especially Keith's poultry nice selection of wines and beers gardening etc . Friendly and helpful staff

recent_reviews.author: Wendy Allen
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic store and so lovely even though I flew in as they were about to close.

recent_reviews.author: Caroline Hall
recent_reviews.text: I have just bought a chicken from here and it was so so good. As you say how chicken should taste. I will never get one from anywhere else now. All meats are good including Primrose herd products. Interesting that they are not inflating those prices either

recent_reviews.author: Vanessa Bavington
recent_reviews.text: Great place for compost, hardware and all sorts of things.  Staff are lovely too.  Just had my second lot of compost delivered.  Driver put it exactly where I asked.  Could not have been more helpful.

pumpkin_patches.address: 2, Eastwood Park, Eastwood Rd, Penryn TR10 8LA

recent_reviews.author: David Home
recent_reviews.text: Low stanger farm holiday lett was a wonderfull piecefull experience. Well equiped hol lett set in buetifull surroundings with lovely walks and well situated to visit the lakes other areas. We were made very welcome and we highly recomend this place. Shall definately visit again.

recent_reviews.author: Helen Newham
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful cottage and organic food - highly recommended ğŸ˜€ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Joy OfLife (JoyOfLifeinYorkshire)
recent_reviews.text: Organic ,tasty vegetables and 17 variety of apples!

recent_reviews.author: Felix Barnes
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic local organic produce.

pumpkin_patches.address: Low Stanger Farm Stanger, Cockermouth CA13 9TS

recent_reviews.author: ellie jones
recent_reviews.text: Hidden beauty spot. Very friendly residents. Girls in the cottage very good looking.

recent_reviews.author: Michael Grainger
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic Cafe that servers great food at a decent price, you get top quality ingredients. Area inside for visitors with dogs and for those without, as well as the outside.

The actual farmshop is amazingly well stick, with some f the nicest cuts of meat and sublime cake selections you could think of.

All of this to an amazing backdrop, onsite camping, and a small army of Alpacas for you to enjoy in and around the wild areas, lake, and flower garden.

recent_reviews.author: Suzanne Ling
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful cafe with wonderful view and great food! We had pies for light lunch and they were all so delicious. We also got to see alpacas and llamas which was perfect for kids. Clean toilets available too. Thanks for a lovely time!

recent_reviews.author: Robyn Meagan
recent_reviews.text: We visited today for my grans 89th birthday and we had a beautiful visit. The staff are brilliant and I wanted to shout out to the waiter that brought out my grans cake with a lit candle and sang along with us to â€˜happy birthdayâ€™ - even asking her name before hand. I didnâ€™t catch his name but I hope this reaches him.

recent_reviews.author: faye alexander
recent_reviews.text: Gorgeous shop with lots of goodies, including local skincare products, candles, knitted accessories and food and drink. We visited many times during our holiday, including having a wonderful breakfast at The Mess Hall. I had the full veggie breakfast and my partner had the full northern and both were brilliant. We will definitely go back next time we are up that way!

pumpkin_patches.address: Cocklakes House Lake District, Penrith CA11 0SG

recent_reviews.author: Faridah H
recent_reviews.text: I absolutely love this farm shop! They have such a fantastic variety of fresh produce and unique items that you can't find anywhere else. It's a real pleasure to shop here.

recent_reviews.author: Cheryl Cordier
recent_reviews.text: Great shop with loads of cool items to buy. Restaurant and fast food choices available and free wifi. Lots of clean toilet facilities.

recent_reviews.author: Eric von Nida
recent_reviews.text: Such a refreshing change to find a Services stop that is not dominated by multinationals and mediocre food chains. This is a charming and welcome change (as opposed to â€˜Breakâ€™!. Lovely fresh produce and even a wonderful farm shop selling delicatessen goods and genuine local gifts.

recent_reviews.author: The Cads
recent_reviews.text: Got bacon and egg with a tea cost Â£10.10 (extremely pricey). No butter on roll, bacon was cold, egg looks like it has survived a nuclear war, absolute disgrace especially for the price

recent_reviews.author: George Moss
recent_reviews.text: Address incorrect

recent_reviews.author: Coral Andrews
recent_reviews.text: Really nice food. Probably the best chips I've ever had ğŸ¤¤ will be constantly craving these from now on!! Would've liked my Panini a bit warmer but was still tasty. Nice coffee and friendly staff. Large seating area outside, comfy chairs and all topped off by a gorgeous view. Will be back ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Heather Oates
recent_reviews.text:
What a gem of a place. The outside seating is first class and the views are stunning. It's so peaceful. A place to unwind and rest and drink and eat good quality food.
The staff are extremely pleasant and helpful  and nothing is too  much trouble.
They cater for every palette - a coffee served with cake through to jacket potatoes, Panini and meat pies.
Dogs are welcome which is so good.

I popped into the farm shop expecting it to be  like Diddly Squat but I was a bit disappointed. There was no meat counter and not many pies either. There was a small selection of cheese and cakes with greeting cards and cute socks and numerous jars of  preserves and  pickles.

I can't wait until my next visit - it's definitely  my new go to place.
Well done to the owners and excellent staff

recent_reviews.author: Oliver Gambling
recent_reviews.text:
A great find.......
A small cafe with very idyllic views across the valley.
The food is great, the service is friendly and the prices are fair.
I would recommend this to anyone in the area who likes a spot of brunch or an early lunch.

I believe they also do bistro nights which I can imagine are great.

recent_reviews.author: Sue Sherwin
recent_reviews.text: We have been coming here regularly and have always enjoyed the really lovely food and drinks.  There is a very good choice on the menu and specials board. The cafe is nice and clean and has a lovely atmosphere.  The staff are all very welcoming and really helpful.  There are several outdoor seating areas with amazing views over the countryside.  A wonderful place to visit.

pumpkin_patches.address: Stretton Hall Farm, Newmarket Ln, Clay Cross S45 9AP

recent_reviews.author: Becca Gibson
recent_reviews.text: Such a fun day out! We were able to go round the farm and feed lots of the animals including goats, sheep, cows and alpacas. There are loads of activities for kids, most included in the entrance fee, with a few extras that you can pay more for. A great summer holiday activity!

recent_reviews.author: Deen â€œDeen123â€ Overdunya
recent_reviews.text:
Really enjoyed our trip today with our toddler, there was lots to do and we planned what we wanted to do and we all had a wonderful time. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the ice cream is incredible!
Our toddler loved all the different things and got involved with the interactive animal care, which was nice! We left a little early for our little oneâ€™s nap, however we would have stayed all day if we could!
We will definitely revisit and would absolutely recommend - itâ€™s such a great day out!

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Smith
recent_reviews.text: We visited today for highland cow week. Wow! Such a great place and getting to cuddle Jessie the highland cow calf just made my day! All staff we met were very friendly. Lots of different animals to see and feed. Plenty of fun things for kids to do too. Ice cream was delicious. Go visit you wonâ€™t be disappointed!

recent_reviews.author: Mihaela C
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely beautiful place. Small but will keep your kids busy for at least 5 hours. All the animals look well taken care of and the entire place is clean. We brought a picnic so can't really say anything about the local food but the ice-cream was deliciousğŸ˜
Many activities for kids,lamb feeding,calf feeding,you can see how the cows are milked and much more. Will definitely be back next time. Will done to the hard working team ğŸ’ª

recent_reviews.author: Katherine Smith
recent_reviews.text: We had an absolutely amazing time here last year. Brilliant set up, great location, plenty of parking. The atmosphere was so lovely and we felt very relaxed and welcome. There was plenty of things to do for the children and adults. Great facilities and refreshments. Best Pumpkin patch around. My children can't wait to return again!!

recent_reviews.author: Ed Ed
recent_reviews.text:
You need a 4x4 to get there and road is not paved with tons of potholes and only single lane at times so you endup standing while 40 other cars pass. Only two toilets on the whole site. Two working tills to pay so you endup 20-30 min sitting in a queue. And then you have to queue to get out with your car.
Why would anyone pick this over Darts farm is beyond me.

recent_reviews.author: Naomi hay
recent_reviews.text: We had a lovely morning. Lots of of pumpkins left. Prices for pumpkins are ok. Prices for the activities are very reasonable. No ques for any activities and no ques to get in or out of the car park. You don't need a 4Ã—4 to get here I managed it in my small honda civic. A few pot holes but it's to be expected when ur visiting these places. All the staff were really friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Debbie Harris
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic day last year. Really well organised, kids loved it with lots of activities and things to do, we spent the whole day there! Food  was lovely and staff really friendly. So easy to get to with lots of parking cant wait for this year ğŸƒğŸ‘ğŸ•

recent_reviews.author: Paige Denning
recent_reviews.text:
Such a fun inexpensive activity for all!
Walked around the farm with every shape and size pumpkin you could imagine! All the staff were friendly and helpful, visiting the farm will be a new tradition of ours ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Rosanna Silverlight
recent_reviews.text: We had an absolutely wonderful afternoon at Pitt Farm and we're already planning to go back next year! We had a lovely time wandering up and down the vast pumpkin field, where there were many different varieties of squash and pumpkin to choose from. The maize maze was fun and challenging (wellies are an absolute must for this!) and the kids loved climbing on the hay bale pyramid afterwards while we enjoyed a coffee. The perfect Sunday afternoon out, with the added bonus of amazing weather.

recent_reviews.author: Lynne Porter
recent_reviews.text: Although it rained, it didnâ€™t dampen our spirits as we went round picking pumpkins. Excellent set up, loads of pumpkins and photo opportunities for insta worthy pics. Great atmosphere, lovely people and friendly farmer. Our 2nd year of making wonderful memories. Thank you Pitt Farm, you didnâ€™t disappoint. See you next year

recent_reviews.author: Abbie Munt
recent_reviews.text: We had a fabulous time visiting yesterday. Everyone was friendly and very helpful. Hard standing car park. Lots of photo opportunities with little ones and the best pumpkin spice latte.

pumpkin_patches.address: Pitt Farm Patch, West Buckland, Wellington TA21 9HX

recent_reviews.author: zoe papadakos
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely little farm. Went pumpkin picking with colleagues and our clients of which were in wheelchairs.  It was fun seeing the animals. A bit difficult getting around, but it is a farm!

recent_reviews.author: Orlanda Harvey
recent_reviews.text: Dropped by their community shop, lovely veggies and free range eggs, with book exchange

recent_reviews.author: Catherine Wood
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic day out at the farm for the pumpkin picking event. Staff were so friendly and kind, the cakes were amazing and sausages of premium quality. Will definitely be returning!!!!

recent_reviews.author: Michael Coslett
recent_reviews.text: It is a fantastic place and meet more people in the community but the distance is too far and traffic can be really bad some days. I love the animals they are cute and stunning. I donâ€™t like the weather as much when working they can get hot or cold

recent_reviews.author: Jefrin Figarado
recent_reviews.text:
Visited the Thurloxton farm last week with my family and friends, and it was a lovely day out! The atmosphere was peaceful and perfect for spending quality time together outdoors. While there werenâ€™t many strawberries or other berries available for picking at the time, we still really enjoyed walking around the farm and taking in the fresh air.

The staff were friendly, and the overall experience was relaxing and fun, especially for the kids. Itâ€™s a great spot for a casual day out with loved ones. Hopefully next time there will be more fruit in season â€” weâ€™d definitely love to come back!

recent_reviews.author: Will McAlister
recent_reviews.text: Great Berries. The strawberries are fantastic this year, sadly the raspberries are not so good but still very tasty.

recent_reviews.author: Diana Bebrisa
recent_reviews.text: Perfect for family time. Easy to find and access. Quite secure so with a toddler we didn't have to worry of him running off anywhere. Great selection of delicious fruit for amazing prices. Friendly staff. Perfect place for a picnic plus they sell ice cream for after.

recent_reviews.author: Amanda Mafa
recent_reviews.text: Very fun and exciting to go to every summer,went at the end of the season but they still had good stock of strawberry's.Also enjoyed the ice cream there as it was flavourful and very delicious ğŸ˜‹,Overall l enjoyed the experience greatly

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Cedarbarn Farm Shop, Cafe & Miniature Railway
pumpkin_patches.search_query: pumpkin picking East Riding of Yorkshire

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte Hunt
recent_reviews.text:
Great place to stop, especially for a family. They have plants, miniature railway, playground with a little food van which does breakfast rolls and pizza later on.
We had a wander around the farm shop, we couldn't buy too much unfortunately as we are staying in a hotel. The meat looks lovely, so much choice. Lots of baked goods too, I brought a cherry and apricot flapjack.
We decided to have brunch so we went to the cafe, they were busy inside so we had a choice to sit outside (a little windy summers day) or wait for a table to come free. We were pressed for time so we decided to brave the wind. It was quick service, again a good choice of food.  I had a fab hot chocolate and the hot buttery cinnamon toast, I'll be honest I wasn't expecting much. When it came out It looked so good, two doorstop sized multi grain toast covered in a sweet cinnamon butter. It was delicious, even my other half who wouldn't go near multi grain bread said he would have eaten that. It's definitely for someone with a sweet tooth. My other half had the lighter breakfast which he enjoyed, bacon was his favourite.
I would have loved to come back for a Sunday roast or a pizza but I'm at the end of my holiday now so will save it in my maps for next time.

recent_reviews.author: Tammy King
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous cafe and shop, we have sampled the wonderful wares here many times, as well as home baked goods and cakes the shop boasts local honey, jam, mayonnaise, chutneys, cheeses and a butchers and bakery in store. They also have a brilliant secure dog field which at Â£5 for half an hour is a bargain for our three. There is also a miniature railway. We will return again amd again, we love Cedar Barn!

recent_reviews.author: Lisa
recent_reviews.text: Love it here. Breakfast delicious. Farm shop. Pick your own flower and strawberries. Kids play area and mini train ride

recent_reviews.author: Fellawise
recent_reviews.text:
2/8/25
Calderbarn Farm shop was unknown to us on our journey. We stopped by for a quick lunch. First stop was the cafe which at peak times can get busy and reservations are not needed, however there can be a significant wait time and for that they give you a buzzer for when your table will be ready.The site has other things to do such as the farm shop with some freshly made food from the farm. I had the black pudding sausage roll and it was bloody delicious. Prices amongst the shop can be a reach but considering the freshness and effort, it's worth it in the end.Calderbarn also has a miniature train ride, small park for kids and a doggy park (bookings only). Plenty of parking and seating available. If you're in the area or passing by, it's definitely a stop to add. Wouldn't recommend it for a full day out but as a lunch stop, highly recommended.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Roundstone Farm Shop and Garden Centre

recent_reviews.author: shyama thushari
recent_reviews.text: Had the sweetest day at the farm ğŸ‚ğŸ‘ Picked fresh plums, pumpkins, beans & more everything tasted so much better straight from the fields. Such a cozy, wholesome experience, definitely recommend if you want a little countryside escape!

recent_reviews.author: Jyoti
recent_reviews.text: Really good place for picking your own fruit and veg, or just to go on the tractor ride.

recent_reviews.author: Mark Matthews
recent_reviews.text: We keep coming back to Roundstone as the staff are so knowledgeable and happy to help you. I would estimate that 90% of our plants have come from here. The front garden has come a long way since our first visit. A huge variety of everything you would want in your garden can be found here. There is also a dedicated indoor plants building for those with a conservatory or such. They also have a farm shop which has a good selection of fresh fruit and vegetables along with other treats. Thanks to all of the staff for all of their help. See you on our next visit. The back garden looks bare compared to the front!

recent_reviews.author: Craig Florence
recent_reviews.text:
Really fun picking strawberries and other berries and vegetables. It was quite windy so donâ€™t be fooled by the sun!
There was a tractor to make getting around easier but we just wandered around. It was really well priced, too!

recent_reviews.author: Ben Sulston
recent_reviews.text: Great farm shop with a wide range of local produce including locally roasted coffee, an abundance of fresh fruit and vegetables plus a wonderful selection of local meat from Block butchery.

recent_reviews.author: Warren Tsoi
recent_reviews.text: This restaurant/cafe used to be lovely but really sad to see a big hike in prices and really disappointing value for money. It took an age for food to arrive and while the wait staff are friendly and attentive, it  couldn't make up for the average food and small portions. The flies and wasps in the dining area were also annoying and overall just a real shame as we really wanted to like it.

recent_reviews.author: Josie Gilbert
recent_reviews.text: I left a glowing review of this place a year ago but unfortunately it has all changed since then. We used to love this little farm cafÃ©, it was always such a quaint spot with lovely friendly staff. Sadly, it seems to have expanded (possibly changed hands) and has lost its charm. The atmosphere felt cold, staff werenâ€™t friendly or helpful, and our order was wrong. We had to ask multiple times just to return our incorrect drinks, werenâ€™t given any cutlery, and the menu had very few options. On top of that, it was surprisingly expensive for what we got. They claim to be dog friendly but only had a few umbrellas outside in the hot weather and didnâ€™t appear to have any water for them. Really disappointed, especially as it used to be one of our favourite places and we were excited to make it our regular now weâ€™re back in the area. Unfortunately we wonâ€™t be returning.

recent_reviews.author: Geoff Harry
recent_reviews.text: Big car park with good views and picnic tables.  Good for snacks and walking.  Shop itself is reasonable but limited with a mixture of high quality items, not cheap.  Food served, looked popular.

pumpkin_patches.address: Taywell Farm Shop, Cranbrook Rd, Goudhurst, Cranbrook TN17 1DY

recent_reviews.author: solutionaire
recent_reviews.text:
Latchetts Farm genuinely deserves the recognition.

We visited on a sunny afternoon and were met with friendly, welcoming staff and a peaceful setting that felt both relaxed and well cared for. The childrenâ€™s play area is a brilliant touch â€” thoughtful, clean, and ideal for families looking for somewhere wholesome to enjoy.

The real standout, though, was the ice cream. Itâ€™s honestly the best Iâ€™ve ever had. You can taste the difference â€” fresh, rich in flavour, and clearly made with quality ingredients. Nothing artificial, just proper, real ice cream the way itâ€™s meant to be.

If you value good service and authentic food, Latchetts Farm is absolutely worth the visit.

recent_reviews.author: samantha gray
recent_reviews.text: Had a really lovely afternoon at the slip and slide it looked well orgainsed and felt safe. We enjoyed delicious gelato and brownies. We have previously used the indoor play area, never had a bad experience so far highly recommended

recent_reviews.author: Naomi H
recent_reviews.text: A huge range of ice cream flavours and different ways for them to be served. They were busy but service was good. However, the ice creams were expensive for what they were. They tasted good, but definitely tasted better.

recent_reviews.author: Josh T
recent_reviews.text:
Itâ€™s a nice place. Worth a visit with family (especially kids) there isnâ€™t too much for adults to do. This is one for the kids.

One star less as the Ice Cream was very expensive for what you get. I canâ€™t fault the flavour though. I tried the Bueno and Mango Sorbet ice cream. Real nice ğŸ˜‹

recent_reviews.author: Mellissa Clark
recent_reviews.text: Hidden Gem!  beautiful location for a coffee or breakfast with outdoor seating,  very peaceful! Staff were very friendly! Coffee was lovely, free parking! Nice lake next to car park. Will be back to look in farm shop

recent_reviews.author: Gail H
recent_reviews.text: Nice, well stocked small farm shop next to their cafe and fishing lake.  Plenty of parking.  I bought some excellent apricots and a slice of pretty authentic Spanish omelette.  Recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Bob Laughton (R)
recent_reviews.text: Run by two local families who live on the orchard/farm, the cafe has a very local feel, serves a great bacon sandwich and is both friendly & warm. The right choice for locals for coffee, cake or lunch

recent_reviews.author: The AAMan
recent_reviews.text: Very helpful with food cooked to order. The menu was limited but the food we had (sausage sandwich and ham croissant) was very tasty. Good place for a refreshment stop.

pumpkin_patches.address: Oast Farm Lephams Bridge, Uckfield TN22 4AU

recent_reviews.author: Aaron Molloy
recent_reviews.text:
Really good place to go fruit picking, there's alot of different fruits to pick (depending on time of year)

Today we enjoyed strawberries, raspberries, black currants, red currants and blackberries. You can see they have lots of other fruits growing which aren't ready just yet !

On the site next door there is a really decent cafÃ© (breakfast was amazing) there's also a huge farm shop, crazy golf, goats and an outdoor play area for the kids !

These strawberries and raspberries are miles better than the supermarket rubbish we normally buy, they taste so much nicer, very juicy and taste super fresh as they've just been picked :-) haha

We paid Â£13 for the medium sized bucket and filled it with plenty of fruit, much cheaper than the supermarket aswell as we've got tonnes of good quality yummy fresh fruit !!

We would happily go again and would defo recommend it to other people :-)

recent_reviews.author: Gareth Shears
recent_reviews.text: Went in for a look and came out with a box of bit for a Sunday roast. Will definitely be back again nice variety of foods which was really nice

recent_reviews.author: sylvia thorogood
recent_reviews.text:
We hadn't been to the coffee shop since it changed hands. We were very pleased that it was still as good as ever. Local produce, nicely presented. I had Sufflok ham in granary bread. It was very tasty. My husband had very tasty cheese and tomatoes sandwich.
It would help if there was an up to date website for.  the coffee shop. I. am sure it would bring even more trade.

recent_reviews.author: Doug Regan
recent_reviews.text:
Superb farm shop with excellent fruit and veg some being grown on site. Great range of produce and lovely tea room to the side.
If you like local fruit and veg etc have a ride out buy your produce and have a nice snack etc at the same time. Great polite professional service!

pumpkin_patches.address: Park Rd, Wickham St Paul, Halstead CO9 2PX

recent_reviews.author: Scott Jackson
recent_reviews.text:
Unfortunately very disappointing this year, we have been nearly every year for the last 7 years.
This year the strawberryâ€™s have not been looked after at all, over run by weeds, rotting and what looks genuinely awful displays.
Both of my children were stung by stinging nettles resulting in one of them crying, not great for a Fatherâ€™s Day outing.
Seems like a lot of people were just walking in as well rather than paying.
Probably wonâ€™t be going again, unfortunately another place gone to the dogs.

recent_reviews.author: Gemma Ebbage
recent_reviews.text:
We had a lovely visit here this morning.  They make a lovely breakfast and the service was great.  The kids loved it as they have a play area which is accessible from the cafe.
There are also little tractors to ride on and a mini golf course available (costs extra).
We picked some strawberries and raspberries while we were there.
We'll definitely be back!

recent_reviews.author: Jade Hughes
recent_reviews.text:
Sorry to say we diddint have the best experience.
We went into the garden to enjoy the weather. There was no wheel chair accsess.
Had to pull the umbrella from the shed in couple of parts and put it up ourself.

Children played on very unsafe and wonkey play equipment while mysf and dad tryed to have a chat. Was impossible with sand pit was being built. Would have thought they would do that before summer holidays.

Orderd food. 3 jackets Nd a sandwich, 4 softdrinks. OverÂ£60!

Came out with a stingy amount of fillings. Prawn sandwige bread toasted from being sat under hot plate. Jacket potato hard in places. No butter. Shop bourt sloppy cowslaw, cucumber looked like it been taken of a previous customer plate. Served in cardboard /polistirine box. Ate with wooden folks. Whole place looked unkeeped.
Won't be returning. Blue egg in great Bardfield Much Better.!!!

recent_reviews.author: Angela Emmerson
recent_reviews.text: The scones were light as a feather. They were served warm. The best scones I have ever tasted ( apart from my own lol). The farm shop sold beautiful fruit and veg. I bought a casserole kit, some tangerines and passion fruit. I was very impressed with the quality of the food on offer. They also have a play and picnic area. Sadly, I am too late for the fruit picking, which was why I had come across Soencer's farm in the first place, as I was looking for somewhere to take my grandchildren. Maybe next year.  Besides this, the farm shop and restaurant was well worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte Hull
recent_reviews.text:
Visited today for the first time since we moved back to Winstanley and will be back!
We got some chicken kievs which were so tasty, very good quality chicken. We got some lovely carrots & some fruits & also some eggs which are lovely.
The shop has so much delicious looking produce and everyone we spoke to was very friendly and helpful - we canâ€™t wait to come back!

recent_reviews.author: Tim Tam
recent_reviews.text: Great vegetable bit pricy but better choice. Only negative fresh egg were not very fresh just like water when cracked. Baldys pies outside are lovely.

recent_reviews.author: Louis Hunt
recent_reviews.text:
I have become very jaded with trying to find simple, good quality produce/ ingredients however...
Windy Arbour Farm Shop really has 'come up trumps'.
A very clean, well laid out shop reflects the care /attention and  obvious pride that has gone into the display of a fantastic range of fresh meat and vegetables.
I am a bit of a 'Cumberland Sausage' aficionado and Windy Arbours 'Bangers' are spot on!
Please pay a visit and experience a fantastic shopping experience.
P.s. The staff will make you smile..

recent_reviews.author: Neil
recent_reviews.text: Lovely selection of very fresh fruit and veg -sadly one of the fridges was leaking-a slippery floor sign -doesn't help mop it up -humans do ! Big puddle !  Bakery was virtually sold out too .

pumpkin_patches.address: Windy Arbour Farm, Ashton Rd, Wigan WN5 7XX

recent_reviews.author: Paul Smith
recent_reviews.text: So expensive not impressed. Sent my partner to buy a steak Â£23 later with 900g of food is a joke. Will not be coming back dont be fooled by this so called farm food may aswell go to Tesco.

recent_reviews.author: Lillian Little
recent_reviews.text: Very good service. Evie was sweet. The staff all friendly and efficient.  Keep hold of your cheft the food was beautiful and hot and tasty. Had to bring half of my fish and chips back home. And the hot chocolate was the best yet. Well done everyone.

recent_reviews.author: Coral Smith
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm shop, lovely cakes, breads and seasonal veg. The fresh sandwiches from the deli are really good, a good selection of filling to choose from. The butcher is also great, the sausages are the best around. Outside there is a green with benches. Lovely spot to enjoy your sandwich and cake.

recent_reviews.author: Daniel Wood
recent_reviews.text:
ğŸŒ³ Great Farm Shop Breakfast ğŸ³ ğŸšœ

Runcton Farm Shop Cafe offers a wide variety of fresh farm produce on its spectacular menu. Whether you are in search of a spot for coffee and a cake, or somewhere that will serve a hearty, flavoursome meal, Runcton is a must visit!

Our visit for brunch was fantastic! Speedy Service with a smile was partnered with fantastic farm shop food! English breakfast was great but the avocado was the star of the show ğŸŒŸ Great coffee and hot chocolate too! â˜•ï¸

The Must Visit Farm Shop in the area! ğŸŒ³

ğŸŒŸ Recommendations: English Breakfast, Avocado Toast ğŸ¥‘

â›”ï¸ Drawbacks: Very Busy!

ğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸ / 5 Stars

recent_reviews.author: Richard Beard
recent_reviews.text: Fun for all the family - great service, lovely food, Christmas carols and drinks around the open fires. The family run business is an annual treat. It is lovely to be greated, select our tree and see the Christmas shop. We will look out for the summer open-air theatre too.

recent_reviews.author: Anna Goodman
recent_reviews.text: Amazing!! The food stalls were delicious the bar had amazing drinks, there was music being performed and face painting for kids and the tree itself is perfect and such a reasonable price. We had a perfect day!

recent_reviews.author: Terri Horn
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely love Wylds farm, its the most amazing beautiful Christmases place EVER! We've been going for the last four years and will never go anywhere else for ours trees.
The stuff are super friendly and so accommodating.
See you next year!!
Terri xx

recent_reviews.author: Andrea Redwood
recent_reviews.text: What a magical place. If you're looking for a real Christmas tree you can't go wrong with Wylds Farm. Our tree is beautiful, everyone was so helpful and friendly. Definitely made a new Xmas tradition ğŸ„

recent_reviews.author: Sana Fathima
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely enjoyed the strawberry picking. Kids under 10 yrs would love the outdoor play area. Thereâ€™s spacious parking, cafe, wash rooms!! Had a good time! No Entry fee! No worries about parkingâ€¦ !

recent_reviews.author: Naomi M
recent_reviews.text: We went on Sunday at 10:20 and it wasnâ€™t too crowded yet. But by noon, it got quite crowded. The strawberries were so sweet and we truly enjoyed picking them. The kids had fun playing outside as well. We will definitely visit again next year.

recent_reviews.author: azim shaikh
recent_reviews.text: Nice place if you want to go strawberry picking without having to book, looks like there's a range of activities for children.

recent_reviews.author: Sana
recent_reviews.text: Lovely services. A nice cafe with a sitting area, a sandpit, a playground, golf, go karts. Endless activities. The fruits even better. The strawberries were so sweet. We really enjoyed our day at Gravely fruit farm. Thank you

recent_reviews.author: Lala
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely wonderful weekend in one of the Glamping pods, the chicken coop. Catherine and Charlotte were both very welcoming and couldnâ€™t do enough for us. The pod was beautiful, clean, well stocked with everything we needed including an air fryer. My daughter loved the hot tub and visiting the farm. The farm shop has some delicious food for us to cook in our pod.
We live locally but wanted a peaceful weekend and we got it. I would recommend the pods to anyone who needs some time out in their own or as a couple for some relaxation or just to unwind with the children.
We will definitely be back again soon.

recent_reviews.author: Laura Hadley-Charter
recent_reviews.text: Had the most amazing relaxing night in â€œthe coopâ€. Peaceful, beautiful and the hot hub ğŸ˜! I would definitely recommend if you need some R&R.

recent_reviews.author: Ganesh Mahalingam
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful day out, not a lot of animals. Kids had fun feeding the pigs & sheep. Some alpacas and donkeys too.

recent_reviews.author: Harry Gordon
recent_reviews.text: Good value and lots of animals to see and feed. Great play equipment also!

recent_reviews.author: Hiraa Ali
recent_reviews.text:
Drove past this place a few times. Looked promising, signs did say local produce. Honey, fruit and veg etc.
But unfortunately lot of the items didn't seem local at all. That was a little disappointing.

Kids wanted to see the alpacas. But we were told to book it to see them.

Woman behind the counter, didn't seem to be bothered at all.

It took us an 1hr to get to the farm. Still tried to find things to spend some money for local business. Yet the response seemed we were not welcomed.

If the customer service was a little better. We definitely would have booked the alpacas for next time.

recent_reviews.author: Sonja Hoeben
recent_reviews.text: We did the Alpaca experience for my birthday. I absolutely loved it. I learned more about these funny fluffy animals. Itâ€™s also great the group is only 6 people. Thank you guys for making this an amazing birthday. I alpaca ğŸ¦™you â¤ï¸.

recent_reviews.author: Ross Malickis
recent_reviews.text:
We visited this farm shop especially, to buy fresh farm eggs. The selection of eggs is impressive, however the prices are impressive also. In my opinion the shop is a bit overpriced.

As we live not far from here, we will be coming back to buy eggs in the future, but might look for alternatives options if prices stay the same.

Itâ€™s a good little farm shop that worth a visit if you want, or looking to buy fresh eggs, meat, fruits and vegetables.

recent_reviews.author: Dkp333 Ping
recent_reviews.text:
Lots of lovely produce to choose from! Including fruit and veg, eggs, meats, cheeses, cakes and more!

We did the 'meet the alpacas' experience today and it was fantastic! Andrew was very knowledgeable and got to learn so much. Will be booking the Trek next!

recent_reviews.author: Kevin Coaker
recent_reviews.text:
We have a high ceiling Georgian house so have used Dane End for 6-7 years to deliver a 10-foot Nordmann Fir.
Every first Saturday in December they deliver to us and every year we receive a beautiful tree of the highest quality.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Gaskin
recent_reviews.text: Great service with a smile! Delivery to the door of an amazing tree! Shared a way to collect tree after Christmas with fee going to the air ambulance charity! Very happy with quality and shape of tree! Thank you.

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Hills
