recent_reviews.text: Have got our Christmas tree from here for the last few years but this year, we got it a couple of weeks earlier due to diaries - it has been the most stunning tree! Smells amazing, and with plenty of watering, has lasted so well ğŸ„ğŸ„

recent_reviews.author: Kian Pearce
recent_reviews.text:
Nice place and good prices, get to look around and choose which tree you want, also a nice cafe and small Christmas shop

They have massive trees to small tiny trees

pumpkin_patches.address: High View, Farm Green End Lane, Dane End, Ware SG12 0FF

recent_reviews.author: Christine Gale
recent_reviews.text: Came here with a large Walking Group and we were all quickly provided with extra chairs and tea and coffee that was very enjoyable. A lovely find!

recent_reviews.author: alan Hearche
recent_reviews.text: Tea garden A hidden gem, nice tea and scones,  on the walkiing paths nice and quite

recent_reviews.author: Nicki Read
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely lovely place to go and have cream tea or savory tea. It is run by the loveliest people in superb setting with homemade food. I will definitely be back !

recent_reviews.author: Celia Williams
recent_reviews.text: It is a beautiful place run by a lovely family and their cream teas and fresh eggs are delicious!

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Farmhouse Fayre Newport Isle of Wight

recent_reviews.author: John Hacker
recent_reviews.text: Great shop with an abundance of fresh fruit and veg including some unusual and exotic oddities, along with a good range of preserves and pickles. Lovely staff who are always very friendly and helpful. It's a regular destination for Mrs H and I.

recent_reviews.author: Pablo
recent_reviews.text: Great customer service and amazing produce! Ordered online and it was delivered to my door within 48 hours. Driver was very polite and helpful. Produce lasts very well and much better quality than local supermarkets. Will be using regularly!

recent_reviews.author: Noel Derek Hillier
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely produce on offer including many local products from across the Island, including many farms here on the Island.
Prices are competitive & extremely fresh which is very good, especially @ Christmas time.

recent_reviews.author: Dave P
recent_reviews.text: Like it. Good selection of fruit and veg, some things you'll def' not see in a supermarket. I think it's great to have local veg, independent shops etc.

recent_reviews.author: Ann Goswell
recent_reviews.text: Delightful stay in this lovely cottage. Well equipped,  spotless, peaceful,wonderful garden and a very warm welcome from the owners. A week here isn't long enough!

recent_reviews.author: Jeannie Hodkinson
recent_reviews.text:
What a fantastic self contained holiday home.  It was so very peaceful and the beautiful cottage had absolutely everything we could have needed and more.  It was spotlessly clean and just gorgeous.
Beautiful walks if you liked to walk through meadow and woods and we loved the Runner Ducks in the pond.  Owners were non invasive but there to help if necessary.
One of the very best places we have stayed in both UK and abroad. You just can't go wrong if you book this place.

recent_reviews.author: Pamela Lamb
recent_reviews.text: Great place to stay, lovely cottage with 33 acres of land, very nice couple live next door the owners, very quiet location, x

recent_reviews.author: Carolyn Cocker
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful fresh free range eggs and the most luxurious honey all made at the farm from their own bee hives.

recent_reviews.author: Sufia Tailor
recent_reviews.text: Amazing tomatoes. I didnâ€™t think the ordinary person could get delicious tomatoes in the UK. Great tasting tomatoes are either from your own allotment or eaten on holiday. Supermarket tomatoes look great but have no taste. Supermarket tomatoes might even last longer, but with the Isle of Wight tomatoes thatâ€™s not a problem. Theyâ€™re gone so fast because theyâ€™re so yummy.

recent_reviews.author: Toby Oxford
recent_reviews.text: All the varieties we have had from here have been excellent, we haven't even got tired of tomato salad yet! There will definitely be many more orders from here, and soon too! Delicious ğŸ˜‹

recent_reviews.author: A B
recent_reviews.text:
I never liked cherry tomatoes, chewy tastless things. I bought some IOW cherry toms and omg, I ate the whole punnet like grapes in a day! Soooo  full of taste and each type tastes different. They're not bland and nothing, they are delicious.
I've had my first box delivered today including cucumber and aubergines instead of picking them up in M&S. I wish I'd discovered these sooner as they're seasonal. I'm on the IOW so they were delivered to my door by a really friendly guy.
I've ordered my mum a box of the mixed tomatoes. She doesn't like cherry toms either. I know she's going to be another convert! She's on the mainland so they're arriving by Royal Mail. Can't wait to hear what she thinks.

recent_reviews.author: paul togneri
recent_reviews.text:
Amazing Condiment. 100% UK produce, at it's best.
The best Tomato Ketchup I have ever tried.
Thank you.

recent_reviews.author: Andrea Lane
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little honesty shop - not just cherries but also plums, tomatoes, juices and more. Very delicious plums; all were eaten right there in the car and we went back for more! You got our vote in the red funnel award!!

recent_reviews.author: Hastings
recent_reviews.text: I bought a bottle of cherry juice while on the Island in May; it has been stored in a cool larder.  When I opened the bottle (with best buy date 03 06 26) it was foaming and clearly off. Disappointing.

recent_reviews.author: Andrew â€œAbrahamâ€ O'Leary
recent_reviews.text: Excellent experience here while I was camping locally. Fair price , local produce. Open 24/7

recent_reviews.author: Elizabeth Albury
recent_reviews.text:
Weâ€™ve just bought some Honey from the apricot orchard, plus some cherries and plums. Havenâ€™t tasted produce like this in years â€˜wonderfullâ€.
We will be back.
Liz & John

pumpkin_patches.address: Godshill Cherry Orchard, Hollow Ln, Godshill, Ventnor PO38 3JA

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Briddlesford Lodge Farm dairy, shop and cafe

recent_reviews.author: Grant Challifour
recent_reviews.text: Came here while out on a drive with my fiancÃ©e and it was a lovely gem of a find. The farm shop had a good variety of items and produce and had lovely staff. The cafe looked lovely however we didn't go in, seeing as we had just eaten. It also had an area to pet baby calfs and go on farm tours. I'd very much recommend taking a little trip to this gem of a place.

recent_reviews.author: Paul Nicholas
recent_reviews.text:
We stopped by for breakfast, we were seated and greated quickly, and everything we ordered came out reeasonly fast, and everything was lovely, I had the farmers breakfast, which I struggled to finish.. eyes bigger than belly. Lovely place and would recommend and come back.
Plus got to fuss baby cows

recent_reviews.author: Tucker Marsano
recent_reviews.text: Lovely dairy farm with amazing milk, cheese, and meats, plus local fruit and veg. My son loved to watch the cows get milked (3:30pm to 5pm) and to see some baby cows up close near the cafe. Highly recommend a visit!

recent_reviews.author: Sean O'Neill
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely farm shop.

Plenty of parking.

Full of local produce including their own milk and cheese, IOW tomatoes, beer, Adgestone vineyard wines, bread, butchery and greetings cards with their own dairy cows on.

Lovely friendly staff who are happy to chat.

Outdoor seating and a coffee shop complete this lovely place.

pumpkin_patches.address: Briddlesford Rd, Wootton Bridge, Ryde PO33 4RY

recent_reviews.author: AB
recent_reviews.text: A really lovely addition to the island, especially with the pond outside that you can walk around. The space is bright and welcoming, perfect on a summerâ€™s day. We have not eaten here yet but the food always looks delicious and we cannot wait to try it. The store is great too, especially the cheese and deli section. I do wish there were some fish and more vegetarian options, but they carry some wonderful local brands which I love to see. The more local the better, and it would be nice to see an even bigger local selection, especially with drinks. Prices for local produce like Isle of Wight tomatoes and garlic farm goods seem very reasonable, although some of the other items are a bit expensive. All in all, a really great place.

recent_reviews.author: Grant Challifour
recent_reviews.text: Came here after finding it while out on a drive, I must say it was a good find. They have a good variety of products from fresh fruit and veg, deli products and meat products. There is also a cafe here that unfortunately we didn't get to check out but looked lovely from what we saw, the staff were lovely and very helpful, as far as farm shops go this one is definitely one of the better ones, if your in the IOW then definitely check out this gem of a place as it is the size of a warehouse.

recent_reviews.author: Mirela
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely Little Spot
Stopped by Harvey Browns and really liked it. Picked up some stuffed peppers (delicious), a lotus white chocolate bar (definitely a treat), and spotted loads of tempting Italian pastries too. The place has a nice relaxed vibe, and you can tell the foodâ€™s been chosen with care. Worth a visit if youâ€™re nearby and fancy something a bit special.

recent_reviews.author: Troy Woods
recent_reviews.text:
Brilliant good place to come and get some decent breakfast on the isle of wight.

This cafe area was lovely. Nice clean restaurant area. food was great using local produce. The portion size was plenty. And good price for what you are getting.

Also if you like local produce they have a on site farm shop.

I would advise anyone look for breakfast to go try it. Well worth it

recent_reviews.author: Ultimate Squid Gaming
recent_reviews.text: I walked through here to get to the Shipwreck museum but it looks like a very interesting place filled with a pub, maker shops and various other independent outlets. I would have stayed longer but it was raining heavily.  Also has a wide selection of stationary engines; although these require restoration.

recent_reviews.author: simon b
recent_reviews.text: Great place if you like crafts, there's a glass makers, wood work, traditional sweet shop, silver jewellery. And my personal favourite, a Prop makers exhibit. With the prop maker there selling little models and some books he wrote. Very friendly man who used to make things for the BBC, blue Peter etc.

recent_reviews.author: Adam Pierrepont
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely place with diferent cabins containing various craft , photo,glass blowing,souvenir shops. With a pub serving a variety of food.
Was quite highly priced though , that was the only downside. But it's a quirky interesting place with a bit of something for everyone.

recent_reviews.author: Claire Goodwin
recent_reviews.text: Lots of little quirky shops and a nice duck pond. However, the penny arcade wasn't great as most machines that we put money into didn't actually work. They were only 10p a go so wasn't the end of the world but would have been nice to see them all working!

recent_reviews.author: Abhijeet Roy
recent_reviews.text: A very nice and very well maintained  vineyard. A very calm and soothing place with great views and huge plantation. They have a very nice gift shop where souvineers can be bought. Their open bar is very nice and the day we visited they had live music going on which was very nice. The food we had was also very good and very tasty. The presentation was awesome. A must visit place to spend time.

recent_reviews.author: Heather Scott
recent_reviews.text:
Excellent day out.
Audio vineyard tour including wine knowledge and local history.
Wine tasting informative including the famous blue fizz.
Live music afternoons daily throughout the summer.
Menu to complement the extensive drinks menu.
Even supply suntan Lotion in the toilets.
Beautiful setting and great vibe.
Goats and chickens too.
Recommend a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Fiona Richardson
recent_reviews.text: Visited Adgestone on Saturday afternoon to enjoy some live music and a glass of wine. Tasted the blue bubbly and had a couple of platters which were SO good. Lovely setting and the little chickens are very entertaining!!!

recent_reviews.author: John Board
recent_reviews.text: Visited while on a short holiday to Sandown. Adgestone has a beautiful setting with views of the coast, and the audio tour was very interesting, whilst not being too long or heavy on information. The wine tasting was great and done with a very friendly and informative member of staff (sorry didnâ€™t catch a name). Well worth a visit if youâ€™re in the area and canâ€™t wait to come back / buy more wine!

recent_reviews.author: Ğ¡Ğ½Ñ–Ğ¶Ğ°Ğ½Ğ° Ğ‘Ğ»Ğ°Ğ¶ĞµĞ²ÑÑŒĞºĞ°
recent_reviews.text:
I visited Castle Farm on Wednesday, July 9th, and it was an absolutely wonderful experience! ğŸ’œ
The place is simply magical â€” endless lavender fields, the soothing scent in the air, and an overall peaceful atmosphere. I spent a beautiful day there, completely disconnecting from work and everyday stress.
It truly felt like a reset â€” surrounded by nature, beauty, and calm. I'm so grateful for this experience and already dreaming of coming back. If you're looking for inspiration and relaxation, Castle Farm is the perfect place. ğŸŒ¿âœ¨

recent_reviews.author: George Brown
recent_reviews.text: A great place to visit for a day out with my wife. The lavender fields had bloomed and were stunning (honestly, you could smell them before you saw them!). The little farm shop was nice, and full of great lavender-based gifts. The people were helpful, and it had a nice atmosphere. It really was a beautiful place, and worth seeing, but Â£7 per person to walk in a field for an hour seemed expensive...

recent_reviews.author: Ivy Lin
recent_reviews.text: Visited on Sunday. Entrance ticket is Â£7 for walking in the lavender farm, no picking. Thereâ€™s a separate area for picnic. The farm shop has quite a few goods. Nice place to visit and enjoy the lavender during the summer.

recent_reviews.author: mc smarto
recent_reviews.text: We took the tour and our guide was great. She was very knowledgeable. She took us to two different fields. At the end you get a snack and she goes over some of their products and answers more questions. Their is a separate fee to enter the lavender fields.

pumpkin_patches.address: Castle Farm, Redmans Ln, Shoreham, Sevenoaks TN14 7UB

recent_reviews.author: Simon Mohr
recent_reviews.text:
Superb experience for older kids as well.

The literature definitely had us worried that this was heavily geared towards families with smaller kids. We had two older teenagers and one younger as well as four adults and we had a great day.

The animals were clearly very well cared for and plenty of staff were working to keep them cleaned out and looked after.

The facilities were clean and well kept including a LOT of adventure play equipment. If bringing smaller ones I recommend allowing plenty of time for your visit as you will likely be spending plenty of time here!

Highly advise booking in advance as a premium is charged for paying on the door!

recent_reviews.author: Tammy Ryan
recent_reviews.text: This is a superb day out if you have children. There's so much to do and activities are both indoors and outdoors. We took a picnic but there are two places to buy food if you didnt want to eat outside. My only gripe is how the prices change depending on when you go. If you want to entertain your children here during school holidays then expect to pay pretty much double the price of non school holidays.

recent_reviews.author: Kate Sturmey
recent_reviews.text:
Stopped off on the way home from holiday and wasn't disappointed ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼
The farm is huge and there is so much to do, you can purchase animal food with your ticket and feed the animals. There are; Chickens, Cows, Sheep, Donkeys, Guinea pigs, Rabbits, Pigs and lots more!
We did a tractor ride with Amy which was fun and held the small animals - Guinea pigs were so lovely. We also saw the milking demonstration which was informative.
There are lots of outdoor parks, swings, tractors to play on. But also an indoor soft play, which is large but be cautious the area is split by age but the small ones can get to the older area.
We are sad this farm is far away from us but will definitely be returning if we head out that way.
Thanks Rand Farm

recent_reviews.author: Sharon Biron
recent_reviews.text: Great, first day after the new year and had a great time with the animals. Children loved the rides. Staff were great, and Nathan in particular was extremely informative and helpful when we met him in the rabbit feeding section. Many different rides. Toys and books on sale and a great little coffee shop. Really wonderful day out.

recent_reviews.author: Ryan Pearcy
recent_reviews.text: Was a great day out. The staff were polite and friendly. The maize maze was great fun. Lots of variety of pumpkins and at a good price. The cafe was nice and reasonably priced. All in all will be visiting again next year for sure.

recent_reviews.author: Abi White
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous range of pumpkins and very friendly staff. We enjoyed the maze too. The pumpkins were also excellent value for money. Will definitely be choosing Coleby PYO Pumpkins from now on!

recent_reviews.author: Vikki Clinkscales
recent_reviews.text: It was brilliant, the kids loved it, we kept getting turned around in the maze, but when you are following a 6 year old through it you are bond too. Was a great day for all of us.

recent_reviews.author: Tanya Trice
recent_reviews.text: Lovely family place, not a lot of activities to over stimulate the children.

pumpkin_patches.address: Coleby Lodge Farm, Heath Rd, Coleby, Lincoln LN5 0AR

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Dodgson
recent_reviews.text:
It is an amazing historical place to go and visit. There is so much history in this place. Artefacts that have been collected from 1600 through to present day. It's definitely worth a visit, you won't be disappointed.
Also, fantastic food in the cafe and an extensive gift shop too.

recent_reviews.author: Mark E Le Sage
recent_reviews.text:
We had a fabulous visit to the cafe, farm shop and grounds.

Lovely, helpful and friendly staff.

Food was delicious,  well presented and decent portions

Great surroundings,  very clean and well looked after

Thoroughly recommended

We will be back,  thank you for a great time

Five big stars from us

ğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸ

recent_reviews.author: Joanne Astle
recent_reviews.text:
Had a wonderful day at Doddington.
The house was very interesting and no to big to get overwhelmed, fabulous gardens. Just coming into there own with all the spring foliage and flowers. So beautiful.
To top it all had the best Sunday lunch ever in the Grain Store
Well worth a visit

recent_reviews.author: Mike Campbell
recent_reviews.text: We visited on our way home from a short holiday in the Lincolnshire Wolds, primarily for the Sculpture Exhibition in the gardens, but after some serious traffic hold-ups, by the time we arrived all we wanted was lunch, so dived into the Farm Shop Cafe. Excellent - pretty busy, but we got a table straight away, the food was very good, service extremely efficient. Refreshed, we walked off our lunch around the sculpture gardens. Including an indoor exhibition there are some 300 works exhibited - we probably saw them all (took photos of about 100 or so!). There is something about seeing sculpture in the outdoors, the way it is juxtaposed against the natural world, which enhances most works, and this was a very impressive collection. (And there is a wealth of information on the website, it has been extremely well put together.) To conclude our visit we spent more than we should have done in the impressive and high-end farm shop - the locally-produced apple juice and the little yellow Mirabel plums grown in the gardens definitely recommended. Couple of things to note: the sculpture exhibition is only on until 7 September, and the RHS and Gardener's World discounts which are usually valid do not apply as normal during the exhibition (apparently there have been ructions at the ticket desk, so this is an advance warning!) We didn't visit the hall, so can't comment on that (looks impressive though) and without the sculpture exhibition - which is only there for a few weeks - the grounds would be a different type of experience. So we may well come back to see how it all works!

recent_reviews.author: laura basham
recent_reviews.text: What an absolute gem! We kept driving past and it was always really busy so we figured it must be good. And wow so glad we stopped the selection of fruit and veg available at such reasonable prices was fantastic. The strawberries were big, juicy and had the best taste. The jacket spuds were lovely as a light evening meal with a side salad and a healthy 70p each! Will definitely be back if in the area again and 100% recommend ğŸ‘Œ

recent_reviews.author: Jacqui Lucas
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely place. Brought the kids and they had a fab time. Wish there was more places like this

recent_reviews.author: Jane Mason
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful place to visit. Itâ€™s the place I can find fresh runner beans broad beans peas & beetroot. Outstanding quality. Beautiful potatoes cabbages sweetcorn carrots top quality. Nectarines peaches strawberries cherries gooseberries tayberries onions. Tomatoes lettuce cucumbers. If you like fresh ingredients this is the place to go.

recent_reviews.author: Vanessa Hague
recent_reviews.text: Lovely fresh and local veg and fruit â€¦friendly staff and well priced ..amazing ğŸ“ğŸ“ğŸ“

pumpkin_patches.address: Skegness Rd, Chapel St Leonards, Skegness PE24 5UB

recent_reviews.author: David Peel
recent_reviews.text:
!AVOID BUYING LOGS!
I had a delivery of logs last week . Absolutely dreadful! Poor quality and argumentative man on the phone . Quick to take your money and doesnâ€™t resolve my issue. My chimney sweep said these logs will ruin my chimney if I burn them because of the moisture content. Donâ€™t waste your money with this farm shop.

recent_reviews.author: Stephen Beane
recent_reviews.text: Good selection of farm produce, staff always helpful and give freely give advice on produce.

recent_reviews.author: Nicci Fleshbourne
recent_reviews.text: Went today to pick strawberries and raspberries. Amazing quality fruit and lots of it too. Raspberries are huge! Very helpful staff. Good produce shop. Highly recommend

recent_reviews.author: Dee Lovelock
recent_reviews.text: Local produce and Bridget is such a lovely genuine person. Go there a lot for eggs, fruit and veg and honey. The selection is always very high standard and very reasonably priced

recent_reviews.author: Elisa Winstanley
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic farm shop! Absolutely love the apple juice menu! We struggled to choose one as could have brought them all!  We took the sausage roll on our day trip with other goodies and loved it! Then we marinated our lamb with the smoked garlic oil and other spices! Will definitely return before we leave Norfolk!

recent_reviews.author: Eva S.
recent_reviews.text: We are very happy that we stumbled upon this shop on our way to Holkham Beach. North Norfolk is quite quaint and picturesque as it is but experiences like this make it very memorable. We picked up fresh fruit, bread and cheese, and also purchased locally made honey, preserves, cakes, etc. It was heaven and the staff were extremely nice. There's a bit of everything here and the cute retail park it is in allows you to visit several other shops/restaurants that all looked wonderful.

recent_reviews.author: Kirsten Fenwick
recent_reviews.text: Friendly staff with a nice selection of foods and drinks, especially impressive is the selection of apple juices from the orchard

recent_reviews.author: Ian
recent_reviews.text: Nice farm shop lovely apples that actually taste like apples unlike the supermarket varieties, bought some russets ,two bottles of apples juice and some bread thanks to the ladies for advice on the juice

recent_reviews.author: Anthony Jones
recent_reviews.text:
Weâ€™ve been buying from Colemans Farm for a few years, especially around Christmas time. Itâ€™s our go-to place for all our festive vegetables, cheeses, and deli items. The quality is consistently excellent, prices are really good, and we really appreciate the range of local products they stock.

What we like most is the friendly, family-run feel â€” welcoming and helpful, and itâ€™s nice to support a business that clearly takes pride in what they do.

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Thomas
recent_reviews.text: I popped in for a couple of veg boxes, they were made up for me straight away. Good quality local produce, lovely people, we will be back

recent_reviews.author: William Salter
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little farm shop manned by a very lovely old gentleman who's probably lived on the farm his entire life. A true local.

recent_reviews.author: Maxine Flaxman
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic farm shop.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Excellent quality produce and gifts.  Highly recommend.

pumpkin_patches.address: Colmans Farm A149 Main Road, Great Yarmouth NR29 3LN

recent_reviews.author: Ruel Sinon
recent_reviews.text: My first Blueberry Picking and it was a nice experienced so far. I do have a great time picking fresh and sweet blueberries. Highly recommended for families with kids and for sure they'll gonna enjoyed it so much. Will definitely gonna go back next year ğŸ«ğŸ«ğŸ«

recent_reviews.author: Eric F
recent_reviews.text:
An amazing experience enjoyed by my wife, son, and I.

The area to pick blueberries is far back the road from the entrance off the main road. Follow the signs and you will eventually make it there.

When you arrive at the area, there is plenty of parking. Go to the small shop and pick up a bucket and they will also let you know where to pick.

For the picking itself, there were so many fresh blueberries. My family was able to pick to their hearts desire and didnâ€™t even make a dent.

The shop was run by a very friendly worker that weighed the blueberries for the price. We also purchased blueberry juice and local honey. The blueberry juice was refreshing. I havenâ€™t tried the honey yet.

It is a well run farm and my son already wants to go back. Highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Nigel Thorpe
recent_reviews.text: Good fun for the kids. Soon filled our containers. Whatever you do for heavenâ€™s sake donâ€™t buy the blueberry wine. Undrinkable - we really shouldâ€™ve known better.

recent_reviews.author: Patricia J
recent_reviews.text: Yummy Blueberries to pick or buy in many forms. I highly recommend as end of summer activity

recent_reviews.author: Lisa Fry
recent_reviews.text:
â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

We held our wedding reception at the Dovecote Buttery in Newton on 12th July 2025, and from start to finish the whole experience was absolutely wonderful.

From the very beginning, communication with James and his team was excellent. They were always quick to respond to our questions, extremely helpful with planning details, and nothing ever felt like too much trouble. In the months leading up to the wedding, they gave us such confidence that everything would run smoothly, and on the day itself they went above and beyond to make sure it did.

The venue itself is simply beautiful â€“ the perfect setting for a summer wedding. It felt both elegant and relaxed, with a warm and welcoming atmosphere that our guests loved. We had many comments from family and friends about how lovely the venue was and how well everything was organised.

One of the things I appreciated most was how accommodating the team were with our personal touches. I had made lots of decorations myself, and the staff were more than happy to take them and set everything up on the day. It meant I didnâ€™t have to worry about a thing â€“ I could just enjoy the morning knowing everything was being taken care of. When we arrived, the room looked stunning and exactly how weâ€™d pictured it.

On the day, James and his staff worked tirelessly to make sure everything ran seamlessly. Their attention to detail, professionalism, and hard work really stood out. They managed the timings perfectly, looked after our guests so well, and created a relaxed, stress-free atmosphere for us as a couple. It honestly felt like we were in such safe hands the entire time.

We are so grateful to everyone at the Dovecote Buttery for giving us such a perfect reception. It was everything weâ€™d hoped for and more. If youâ€™re looking for a wedding venue that combines excellent organisation, a beautiful setting, and a truly dedicated team, we couldnâ€™t recommend them highly enough.

recent_reviews.author: Adam Konstanciak
recent_reviews.text: Lovely tea room and cafe and delicious cakes and food. They also have a playground outside and are happy to bring drinks to the outdoor or indoor areas to suit guests. Lovely peaceful scenery and very accommodating staff.

recent_reviews.author: Elainejoy Baker
recent_reviews.text: Nice, quirk place. Wanted a light lunch but my salad was huge. Very tasty. Not cheap.

recent_reviews.author: john Yeoman
recent_reviews.text: Went for lunch with my mum for her birthday, I was very impressed.  The staff are very friendly and helpful and always ready to assist.  We ordered some excellent items from the menu, a jacket potato and some excellent toasted sandwiches.  I probably the best cup of tea Iâ€™ve had and the coffees are also great.  There is a good range of meals and an excellent selection of desserts available.  Around the restaurant there are items for sale and if the weather is good there is a nice childrenâ€™s playground all in all itâ€™s a good day out.

recent_reviews.author: N B
recent_reviews.text:
What an absolutely thrilling adventure we had at the most enchanting tree farm! Our first visit had us feeling a bit let down because we didnâ€™t know we needed to book the reindeer walk online, but the fantastic family owners went above and beyond to accommodate us. They invited us back during the week for a magical reindeer experience, and let me tell you, it did not disappoint!

The farm is transformed into a Christmas wonderland with a charming shop stocked with delightful holiday decorations, and there's a food and drink cart with tasty snacks and delicious hot chocolate. They had an impressive selection of Christmas trees in all shapes and sizes at fantastic prices, plus some exotic trees that reminded us of the tropical trees back home.

On the day of our much-anticipated reindeer walk, we faced a little hiccup when the tour guide had to handle a family obligation, but we made the most of it by running errands and grabbing a late lunch before heading back. When we finally embarked on the reindeer tour, we were met by a friendly and enthusiastic male guide who captivated us with fascinating stories about the reindeer, the farm animals, and the joys of farm life.

Meeting the reindeer, Storm, and Blizzard was incredible! Feeding them was an unforgettable experience, and we were delighted to have a cute little hen join in on the fun. We couldn't believe how quickly she approached us, eager for attention! Storm and Blizzard were at first a bit more reserved. Seeing the fur on their antlers and marveling at their mass was fascinating. The reindeer walking path was beautifully illuminated to include a beautiful moonlighting at the time, making our stroll through the farm a magical experience.

Our family had an absolute blast interacting with all the animals, and we're already counting down the days until we can visit again next year, hopefully with some exciting new additions! Thank you to the Perry family for their warm hospitality and for creating such a memorable experience. Wishing Perry Tree Farm a spectacular future filled with thrilling adventures in 2025 and beyond. Happy Christmas/Felis Pasgua! From our family to yours.

recent_reviews.author: DaniÃ«l Rood
recent_reviews.text: Amazing pumpkin picking and decorating experience - best one weâ€™ve been to so far! And very spooky Halloween Forrest walk ğŸƒğŸ‘»

recent_reviews.author: claire bonham
recent_reviews.text: We have been for pumpkin picking 2 years running and today went to see Santa and meet the reindeers, absolutely amazing! Such lovely staff and the effort they put in is amazing! Highly recommend visiting, the grandchildren and adults had the best time â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Oliver Bran
recent_reviews.text: Just been to Perry Tree Farm to pick pumpkinâ€™s and it was absolutely brilliant. Lovely staff and an abundance of pumpkins. Highly recommended.

pumpkin_patches.address: Perry Tree Farm, Milton Rd, Adderbury, Banbury OX17 3HN

recent_reviews.author: Ekaterina Brown
recent_reviews.text:
Bad experience â€“ ignored and disappointed
I tried to book a day for strawberry picking through WhatsApp. The first reply I got was just one word, which already felt a bit off. After that, I asked a couple of times to book a visit for my family with kids, but was completely ignored. No response at all.
Very disappointing and honestly, quite rude. Not recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Julio Romero
recent_reviews.text: Great experience, very simple, affordable and looks like a good place to take young children for a bit of fun. Strawberrys are very sweet and tasty as they are hand-picked by yourself from the vine. You can choose the kind you like and take your time.

recent_reviews.author: Unicorn crafts
recent_reviews.text:
I went with my teen age kids today, he told off my daughter for going at the very end, though he opened the whole new aisle for other people. Not a good experience for teenager, she is still very upset.
I think he is racist. Then we tried to ask him something whileche was talking to some lady. My husband said excuse me but he ignored. My husband repeated that several times and approached very close to him to ensure he is seen and heard well but he completely ignored. Even me and my kids shouted out aloud but he ignored until he finished talking. This was so embarrassing. I wonder how can people do so and they don't even regret or feel bad especially when it comes to customers who are your source of income.
I visit every year, but don't think will do again!

recent_reviews.author: Dorothy Pease
recent_reviews.text: Visited Rutland Water farm recently to pick your own strawberries. Found via Google, sadly there are not many places left so happy to support this one. Lots of strawberries, easy to pick and had 2 punnets in a short space of time. Lovely lad serving and very helpful. It costs more than the local supermarket but they taste much better, like strawberries used too. Would definitely go again.

recent_reviews.author: Lauren B
recent_reviews.text:
My friends and I visited on the 16th August and we had an absolutely wonderful time! The animals were very friendly and happy to see you (especially the sheep and goats when they saw the feed bucket). The highlight for me were the horses and they were absolutely beautiful. Iâ€™ve seen comments regarding the welfare and condition of the animals but I didnâ€™t see a single animal I was concerned about. The horses were in great condition and the CPL of one mare was being managed well and the sweet itch (which is very common) of a pony gelding was immediately picked up on. Similarly, the other animals such as the cattle were also kept in great condition and plenty of hay and clean water was in the paddocks. Even animals I donâ€™t know much about such as the rabbits and guinea pigs all had fresh food, water and bedding alongside looking clean and healthy themselves.

The staff were very friendly and talkative and included us in a number of activities. One we particularly enjoyed was feeding the cows jam sandwiches!
One of my friends also lost her favourite cardigan which they very kindly found for her and we were able to retrieve it.

As for the other facilities, I cannot complain at all and we enjoyed an ice cream outside at the end of our day. Thank you so much again for a wonderful day!

recent_reviews.author: Lyndsay Barron
recent_reviews.text:
Was so much more than I expected.  The animals were all so friendly and looked well taken care of and loved.  Exception to the rule was the goose.. the cobra chickens woke up choosing violence - as a Canadian, I expected.. so no harm, no fowl..

The bucket of feed was well priced, and the animals were very food motivated - they loved saying hi!  There were a vast variety of farm animals. It is a proper working farm.

The staff were kind and delightful! There is a small cafe in the building and the food was DELICIOUS!

There is no negative thing I could say about it.  Had an amazing experience here. I went for the highland cow and fell in love with the whole excursion and all the animals!

recent_reviews.author: Samantha Kettle
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely place to wonder around.
Great to be able to feed some of the animals with the food provided in the shop.
Attentive & friendly staff.
Lovely tea room with indoor & outdoor seating.
We will return.

We did return in August with a friend in a wheelchair. The ground is unsuitable for a wheelchair with narrow wheels due to the stones on the tracks and the totally unsuitable ramps going in/out of the cafe/entrance.
We couldn't use the disabled loo either, because a workers van had blocked the gate entrance.
Other than that we still had a lovely time there.
We all considered that the entrance fee rather high for a small farm and will go elsewhere in the future.

recent_reviews.author: Samantha Kettle
recent_reviews.text:
Second visit here.
Took a wheelchair friend this time - never again!!
Getting into the shop/cafe means lifting the wheelchair over the big gap at the top of the ramp.
Pushing the wheelchair along the stony paths was next to impossible as the scattered big stones kept stopping the front wheels from turning.
When the stones made the wheelchair stop suddenly, it became a very uncomfortable ride for the passenger.
The path downhill to the llamas was next to impossible, and the only way to go back uphill was to drag the chair backwards.
The slope by the hand wash sinks was scary for my friend as the wheelchair kept tipping sideways.
Then it was another fight with the wheelchair and ramps to get back inside the cafe/shop.
My disabled friend had to get out of the wheelchair to shakely stagger slowly inside because she felt it was too dangerous to stay in the wheelchair.

Otherwise, the farm was interesting and we found it fun to feed the animals.
Entrance fee rather expensive for such a small farm with rough unfriendly paths, so we will not return.

recent_reviews.author: Hadron Cyberunner
recent_reviews.text: Great farm to visit. Large and beautiful sunflowers field, highland cows and a great place to drink a tea or a cold drink after a walk.

recent_reviews.author: Harvey Cheung
recent_reviews.text:
A quiet and peaceful place to visit.
Sunflower field is amazing

recent_reviews.author: Linz Grainger
recent_reviews.text: We had the best time! Â£2.50 entry is such a bargain and getting to pick your own sunflowers is the cutest touch! We had an amazing time and our little pup thoroughly enjoyed his visit! Absolutely beautiful farm, would highly recommend to all! And we look forward to visiting again! ğŸŒ»ğŸ–¤

recent_reviews.author: Abigail Bellett
recent_reviews.text: Such a beautiful place to spend an afternoon! We came home with armfulls of sunflowers, at 50p a stem I couldn't resist. Great little cafe on site too, lovely cup of tea in proper china cups. All staff were so friendly and welcoming. We can't wait to head back when the pumpkin patch is ready!

pumpkin_patches.address: Little Wytheford Farm, Little Wytheford, Shrewsbury SY4 4JW

recent_reviews.author: kavinda supun
recent_reviews.text: Its good plplace to visit and good experience you can get. And also calm quite place. Wonderful !!

recent_reviews.author: L T
recent_reviews.text: Great place to go fruit picking, you will get some super photos of the kids. You will enjoy your day.

recent_reviews.author: Sue Miller
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely fruit farm,plenty of easy strawberry picking as plants are in troughs off the floor. Kids had great fun (4yr ).
Plenty of parking.
I think that the prices are a bit on the expensive side, which is the only downside.which is why i didn't leave  5 *
Fruit soon went off even though the ones i picked were on the firm side as i was making  jam .

recent_reviews.author: Simon Hill
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant Halloween display and pumpkin picking in Halloween season. Fruit picking is wonderful with great pricing and superb quality fruit. Good produce in store too. Did I mention it also has a cafe?!!! ğŸ˜ Keep up the great work WFF!

recent_reviews.author: Desire Esprit
recent_reviews.text: Really enjoyed our day out at the farm.  Picked lots of strawberries, raspberries, red and white gooseberries. We got there a bit late in the season so missed out on the vegetables.  Great place for a day out !

recent_reviews.author: Mrs. Gursoy
recent_reviews.text: Itâ€™s really great that there is a variety of fruits and that they are very delicious. The small cafÃ©, the scenic garden seating area, and the fairly large parking lot are all very nice features. However, the layout of the fields seemed a bit disorganized and careless to me. You canâ€™t tell which fruit is where without walking around a lot, which can be tiring. There should be signs between the fields to help with directions. Also, I found it a bit expensive. Another thing is, while picking fruits, you naturally end up eating some, but apparently eating while picking is not allowed. Still, we mentioned the ones we had eaten at the checkout, and they responded kindly by saying â€œThatâ€™s fine.â€ Thank you for your efforts and service and kidness. ğŸ“ğŸ“ğŸ“ğŸ“

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Brammer
recent_reviews.text: Great place.  We visited near the end of fruit season but an abundance of raspberries and sunflowers.  My Grandson loved picking his own (aged 4)  great prices too.

recent_reviews.author: J BM
recent_reviews.text: We came late in the season and so glad we didn't wait for next year. We came away with lots of blackberries and raspberries plus a sack of potatoes. Now we're at home making jam and smoothies. A great day out and in comparison a cheap one too! Came back for pumpkin picking and it was just as good as fruit picking. Again we picked up a bag of spuds and this time picked up sweet corn ğŸŒ½ delicious produce and discovered you can roast pumpkin! Once again we are back for strawberries, gooseberries and blackcurrants. Made a fruit crumble which was delicious.

pumpkin_patches.address: Bearstone Fruit Farm, Knighton, Market Drayton TF9 4HJ

recent_reviews.author: JR _17
recent_reviews.text:
I shared a review yesterday after visiting and then looking online again at past reviews and photo's. This was my review;
Visited today and everywhere was untidy, dirty and I've never seen so many plants with weeds growing in the pots. The amount of plants there and the condition of a lot of them looks like whoever manages them are out of their depth being able to look after them properly which is a shame as there is a huge variety.
The owners response was that my review was hurtful and untrue.
It was neither, it was from someone who loves plants, visits a lot of nurseries and garden centres, as both part of my job but also as a long time gardener.
Yesterday I didn't add any photo's but after reading the response I've decided to include them and I hope a little more care will now be given to the nursery and all the plants that are for sale

recent_reviews.author: Yew Tree House Berrow
recent_reviews.text: Westcroft is my local farm shop and garden centre. I get a lot of my fruit, veg, dairy products, eggs, bread and meat here. The food is good quality and value and much of it comes from local producers. I get most of my plants, pots, compost etc here good selection at excellent prices. Always friendly and helpful.

recent_reviews.author: mike warland
recent_reviews.text: So many lovely plants at a very reasonable price. The shop is great I spent ages in there looking around and loads on product. Well worth a visit

recent_reviews.author: Angela Westgate
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm shop with nursery..packed full with many plants and flowers..Great display, residential cat came over and demanded tickles and strokes ğŸ˜€ prices were so good..I could of brought loads but as we were on holiday I couldn't..but definitely going back here..all.local grown produce in the shop plus more more to look at as well ..prices were very good in here .definitely a place you must visit

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Foster
recent_reviews.text:
A little hidden gem!
We were staying just 5 minutes away and absolutely loved coming here for lunch and a hot drink or two. There's a beautiful garden and also private little shed/pods for you to sit in too- great if you have your dog with you!
The staff are so lovely and the food and baked treats were great! I'd also recommend the hot chocolate.
Will hopefully visit again!

recent_reviews.author: Lauren Pritchard
recent_reviews.text:
We didn't stay at the b&b but popped to the farm shop and cafe for lunch on a Sunday. Loved the quirky table names for the outdoor tables, although there didn't seem to be enough chairs around!
Food was great, was a small menu to choose from but everyone enjoyed what they had!

recent_reviews.author: Katie Wilson
recent_reviews.text: We called here in a panic at 8am one morning needing a place to stay as the Air bnb we had booked had fallen through and we had a wedding to attend that day at 1pm at Quantock Lakes.  We spoke to Ian who sorted us out with one of the cottages straight away.  He allowed us to check in early so we could get sorted before the wedding without hesitation.  Normally they do breakfast in the main house early but as we were at the wedding he offered us breakfast in the farm shop instead up until 11.30 which was great so we could lie in.  He was also easy with our check out time which was helpful.  The cottage had stunning views and all the amenities we needed as well as parking.  It was spacious, had a King Size bed and a fully equipped kitchen with cooker and hob.  The breakfast was lovely and the Farm Shop was well stocked so if youâ€™re staying there a bit longer it would have been useful, especially the homemade ready meals.  Really great owners who are kind and helpful and work on common sense.

recent_reviews.author: Jake
recent_reviews.text:
*Based on lunch service*
We had a lovely lunch here today. Great service by the team, the kitchen was a bit behind, but we didn't mind and at least they told us.

The Welsh Rarebit was incredible, the Cheese & Ham Panini was very nice, as was the Ham, Egg & SautÃ©ed Potatoes. One of the best Welsh Rarebits ive ever had to be honest.

Only downside was the men's toilet cubicle, where the lock had been broken and replaced with a stick...which had also broken.

pumpkin_patches.address: Somerset, Blackmore Ln, Cannington, Bridgwater TA5 2ND

recent_reviews.author: Judith Richards
recent_reviews.text: Very nice place to go for a short walk or a longer walk. Very popular with dog walkers, some of which spoil the area by not picking up after their dogs. Shame. However, still nice to have such a nice open space. Even better if you don't have to clean dog mess off your shoes when you get home!

recent_reviews.author: Lucy Jenkyns
recent_reviews.text: Great walk for humans and dogs. Some not so friendly neighbours living in the area so watch out for them walking around. They will certainly try to ruin your day ğŸ˜‰ğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: Darren Chamberlain
recent_reviews.text: Nice place to go and find yourself!!

recent_reviews.author: CRAIGS CAMPERS Craig Manning
recent_reviews.text: Lovely dog walk 5x all the way dogs love it

recent_reviews.author: Ryan Hobday
recent_reviews.text: What a fantastic family farm. Huge variety of animals all looking healthy and happy. This farm is free entry with donations welcomed what an amazing thing for Sheffield council to do. The staff were all so friendly. The farm is really well set out. There was lamb feeding and the option to buy feed for the other animals, the Highland cow was extremely gentle when eating out of my hand. The farm is a real asset set in a beautiful park. Please make sure you donate when you visit to help It to continue operating

recent_reviews.author: Laws C
recent_reviews.text:
Beautiful animals...particularly majestic was the horse (tempted to land on a groomed/rescued(?) Cob as the breed due to the hands)...
Saw it stand proud as I returned but too many bad vibes around to take a clear shot while there today!

This particularly beautiful specimen lives in the shed/enclosure just past the main shed (upon entry to the Animal Farm)!

Wonderful service today at the gift shop...bought some lovely toys for my fur baby that I know he'll love!

recent_reviews.author: kerry elliott
recent_reviews.text: This is a local park for me, so I'm  very lucky. This animal park is free to visit, but there is a sum up to tap to donate Â£3.00 to help run this. I would like to see a choice of what to donate like Â£1 or Â£2. Some families may not be able to afford the suggested donation. There is a churn inside that you can drop cash in if you have it on you. This park is huge. I only visited the animal and play parks with my grandchildren. There are picnics seating tables inside the animal park. The animal feed is Â£1.50 to buy and signs around, saying which animals can be fed. You can visit the Rose garden cafe for food/drink.  You can make this day as cheap or expensive as you like. The park also hosts events.

recent_reviews.author: A AlAjmi
recent_reviews.text: My kids had a great time at this farm. There were lots of animals to see and play with, including some adorable lambs. Be prepared to pay a small fee to feed them, but it's worth it. The farm was clean and well maintained, and the animals seemed happy and healthy. Plenty of space for kids to run around and play. A great day out!

recent_reviews.author: Elizabeth Guinan
recent_reviews.text: We came for lunch and to look around the garden centre. We had a lovely meal and the staff were particularly pleasant and helpful. We also managed to get a nice gift from the garden centre. Had a really good visit. Thank you

recent_reviews.author: Caitlin
recent_reviews.text: Really helpful staff and a great selection of garden tools, materials and plants. Much better than going to the big chain stores in town that have garden sections. The plants we bought have done well and we will certainly use the garden centre again.

recent_reviews.author: Charlie And pops
recent_reviews.text:
I went here with my friend for breakfast today and we wonâ€™t be going back. Was extremely overpriced for what you got and the food looked like it had just been slapped on the plate. However after us ordering separately and the person cooking screaming out that we wouldnâ€™t get our food brought out together and if we wanted that then we shouldâ€™ve ordered together (for the record we didnâ€™t ask or expect it to come out together, nor were we bothered, it was just the lady taking the orders saying that we were sat together)  she then proceeded to throw things around the kitchen and bang about clearly making the other staff uncomfortable. We could see this as there are two doors into the kitchen, this would also explain the lack of care when making the food and it looking like it had been thrown on the plate. Now I had my 1 year old with me, she should not have experienced this. This lady needs some re-training or a job where she is away from people and her temper cannot affect anyone. Her collegue told us to â€˜just ignore herâ€™ so she is clearly like this regularly and the other staff member looked very nervous being around her and kept out of her way. Extremely unprofessional even though she calmed down after something was mentioned. If she was a member of my staff sheâ€™d have to receive disciplinary action.
The two stars are for the other member of staff who took our orders and that it seems like a quaint little garden centre.

recent_reviews.author: L
recent_reviews.text: Went to Bramshall Farm for breakfast.  An experience which wont be repeated. Overpriced at Â£11.95 (not including a drink).  No mushrooms and no black pudding.  The food wasnt very nice either.  I ate the beans toast and 1 rasher of poor quality bacon. Sachet condiments. Â£2 for a small glass of orange squash!!! Friendliness in short supply.

recent_reviews.author: Gerald Begley
recent_reviews.text: Great site with easy access. Elsan point is quite hidden, you will find it under a circular metal cap in front of fenced off wild plant area near non drinking water outlet.

recent_reviews.author: Inga Alijosiene
recent_reviews.text: Terrible owners!! We come to pick berries and they said go away its private and we will call police!! Terrible!! My little one was shocked!! They have website and tel number so its written what this farm is for all people to pick berries.. Please be aware of this place!!

recent_reviews.author: Jane Pallister
recent_reviews.text: Been ordering turkeys from Tim for years. Absolutely top quality and brilliant service. Delicious, succulent meat.  Perfect for Christmas and special occasions.  Home pressed apple juice and other products are exceptional too. Support your local business.

recent_reviews.author: Nick Tucker
recent_reviews.text: Best turkey that money can buy. Had Tim's turkeys for over 15 years and every single one has been tasty and succulent. Guests for Christmas lunch are always very complimentary.

recent_reviews.author: Graham Johnson
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant day out thanks x

recent_reviews.author: Paul Wood
recent_reviews.text: Measured

recent_reviews.author: Rachael Stanley
recent_reviews.text: My favourite place in the area to get all my animal feed. Unlike other local places, Karen and the team are super helpful and friendly and if they don't have something, they will try to get it for you. Go early on the mornings they are open and treat yourself to a cupcake if they have them!

recent_reviews.author: Lisa
recent_reviews.text: The staff go above and beyond to help! Such a wide selection of not only food but supplements and tools for my horse. Definitely wouldn't go anywhere else!

recent_reviews.author: Kate Burns
recent_reviews.text:
Lots of great local products, fresh and frozen produce and a little gift section. There's also plants for sale.
The staff have always been friendly and helpful

recent_reviews.author: tina utting
recent_reviews.text: Loads of different animal feeds under one roof. I always buy my horse products from here. Prices are excellent and staff are extremely helpful. Big thumbs up for this place.

recent_reviews.author: Sabu Alex
recent_reviews.text: Weâ€™ve been volunteering at Sutton Community Farm for the past couple of months and absolutely love it! From crop production and harvesting to packing veg boxes, every activity has been fun and rewarding. Itâ€™s a great workout, really calming for the mind, and a lovely way to meet new people. Such a welcoming community â€“ highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Caroline
recent_reviews.text: I have regular veg bags from Sutton and am very happy with them.  The quality of the vegetables is good, quantities are generous and I like being able to opt out of those I donâ€™t want.  Having different organic veg to cook with each week has made my cooking more interesting and Iâ€™d highly recommend them.

recent_reviews.author: Lewis Clark
recent_reviews.text:
I've been volunteering here for several months now and I love it. I've struggled with depression and anxiety for many years now, but I've found the time I've spent there enormously rewarding, and that has been incredible for instilling a sense of well being and purpose, as well as bringing me out of me out of my shell and got me socialising. The staff and volunteers are all so friendly, welcoming and encouraging, and you really don't need to know a thing.
If you have have any interest in growing food, and have half as little as half a day a week to spare, you should definitely get in touch and come down to help out.

recent_reviews.author: Edwin Lyons
recent_reviews.text:
Weâ€™ve been regular customers of the farm for the last 9 months. We came across in while randomly scrolling around google maps and was surprised to see a farm in Sutton. Weâ€™ve since had weekly deliveries where we pick our own items - we prefer this to the boxes as we like to know what weâ€™re getting. Deliveries are reliable and friendly, though having to think what youâ€™re going to want to have almost a week ahead is a bit of a challenge! Itâ€™s not the cheapest place to buy from but the quality is always good and we like supporting the ethos and the farm.

Weâ€™ve since visited the farm a couple of times on their open days and itâ€™s a fun place to visit - good food available everyone is super friendly and informative. An amazing farm that is worth supporting.

recent_reviews.author: Ben and Bee Brace
recent_reviews.text: Lovely cafÃ© with outdoor terrace overlooking fields. Reasonably priced lunches, drinks and cakes. Dog and child friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Indhu C
recent_reviews.text: I had the pleasure of visiting the Strawberry PYO Farm, and it was an absolutely delightful experience. The farm is bathed in sunshine during the summer, making it a perfect spot to enjoy the outdoors. The ambiance was fantastic, providing a serene and picturesque setting that added to the overall enjoyment

recent_reviews.author: Hazel Wicks
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely farm shop with a wonderful cafe.
Set in beautiful scenery and extremely quiet area.
Well worth a visit.
Will go back again.

recent_reviews.author: John Martin
recent_reviews.text: Very pleasant outdoor seating area including grassed bank. Large car park and easy access. Large selection of Quality locally sourced and made food and also artisan products but quite pricey.

pumpkin_patches.address: Old Crawley Rd, Faygate, Horsham RH12 4RU

recent_reviews.author: Mike
recent_reviews.text:
THE place to shop. Noel and his team are incredibly and most importantly, genuinely friendly and there for you. In fact, Noel does have extensive knowledge about the items he sells from how these were made, what they are good with etc.

Also great to see how the place is getting popular among locals, which speaks for itself.

We're customers for some time now and sure will stay.

Thank you Noel, Lucia and the team!

recent_reviews.author: Nick Glynn
recent_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Expected a Farm Shop to sell locally grown/picked produce. Absolutely nothing locally grown/produced, except maybe breads or jams. All pre-packed or frozen. No prices. No country of origin. Fruit and veg supplied by  BOZ at ridiculous prices. This is NOT a Farm Shop it's a convenience store/grocer at hugely inflated prices.

recent_reviews.author: G Man
recent_reviews.text: Great shop, full of nice produce, Nice layout, Friendly staff, good range of products, some interesting products and seasonal stuff of course too. Prices maybe a little on the high side but not extortionate, pretty standard for a farm shop but not as cheap as buying directly from the farm! Lots of interesting things around the shop too, it's tucked away in the garden centre!

recent_reviews.author: Carla MRG Curado
recent_reviews.text: Love to make my fruit shop there easy to park and the people extremely gentle and kind always a good spot to see some flowers have a excellent Saturday/Sunday morning coffee and buy my organic fruit and good quality veggies and bakery bread eggs straight from the farms to my house.

pumpkin_patches.address: Sutton Green Garden Centre, Whitmoor Lane, Off Woking, 7QB, Guildford Rd, Guildford

recent_reviews.author: K W (KW)
recent_reviews.text:
Very clean, well stocked store.

Cafe had plenty of seating with a good selection of seasonal drinks.

Smoothies were Â£5.

recent_reviews.author: Sachintha Hasaranga
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely day at Garsons Farm! Picked the freshest seasonal fruits in the sunshine â€” fun, relaxing, and perfect for all ages. ğŸ“â˜€ï¸ğŸ«

recent_reviews.author: Tony Karim
recent_reviews.text:
ğŸŒ¿âœ¨ Tucked away from the hustle and bustle, Garsons in Esher is a hidden gem thatâ€™s so much more than a garden store! ğŸŒ¸ğŸƒ Start your day right with a delicious breakfast ğŸ¥“â˜• and explore their culinary delights thatâ€™ll remind you of Whole Foods! ğŸ›ï¸ğŸ´Good service and so much in one store including clothing, children's toys, housewares, and lots of indoor and outdoor gardening products.

Plenty of parking, highly recommended for bikers passing through the area looking for a pit stop and a hot drink, or just for a cozy weekend vibe. My wife and I had the perfect start to ours! ğŸ‘«ğŸ’«

recent_reviews.author: N B
recent_reviews.text: We had a fantastic time at Garsons Garden Centre! The staff was friendly, and the fields were well-maintained. The strawberries were incredibly sweet and freshâ€”definitely some of the best Iâ€™ve ever tasted! I highly recommend this garden for a fun day out. Canâ€™t wait to come back next season!

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Dalton Moor Farm - Vegan Fruit Farm and School of Sustainable Living & Wellbeing

recent_reviews.author: Elizabeth Crewe
recent_reviews.text: Jenny was the perfect guide to the bountiful world that surrounds us. Within a few meters of hedgerow, her gentle hands pointed out half a dozen amazing plants. Some tasted as sweet as vanilla, others stunk like cat pee. From the tree needles down to the mushrooms, Jenny expertly told us the history of all these plants and opened to us their many benefits. Itâ€™s a treat to see how Jennyâ€™s caring of this land for 30 years has supported a wild abundance that is difficult to find elsewhere. Thank you for sharing your knowledge with us, Jenny!

recent_reviews.author: Trish Wilkinson
recent_reviews.text:
A fabulous day making a willow basket with Jenny. Though a complete novice, I was delighted with my end product which is sturdy and useful.
Jenny made our small group very welcome and comfortable in her barn where all we needed was provided. With her knowledge and expertise Jenny patiently taught many different skills to create our baskets and was there all along to support and advise.
I might even have a go weaving stuff from my garden now!
Thanks for a lovely day Jenny.

recent_reviews.author: Fell's Angels
recent_reviews.text: Had a lovely day foraging with Jenny and the WI girls.  The weather was fantastic and we had a very pleasant walk around the farm where Jenny taught us about foraging and what we could and couldn't eat, as well as all the benefits etc.  It was friendly, peaceful and very relaxing.  It's a wonderful setting and a lovely day out.

recent_reviews.author: Bella Alegre
recent_reviews.text: I had a thoroughly enjoying morning at the farm on the foraging course and left feeling informed and inspired! Jenny is very knowledgeable and I was made to feel comfortable and relaxed throughout the morning. Youâ€™ll be surprised to learn about all the plants we consider â€œweedsâ€, itâ€™s such a shame humans have become so detached from wild food, but after spending the morning with Jenny I am determined to compliment my meals with goodies from natureâ€™s store.

pumpkin_patches.address: Dalton Moor Farm, Dalton Moor Lane, Off, Truro Ave, Murton, Dalton-le-Dale, Seaham SR7 9JY

recent_reviews.author: Pippa Dredge
recent_reviews.text:
A beautiful breakfast after a climb up Penshaw to start the morning. Very dog friendly.

Service is quick and produce is fresh and locally sourced. Well worth the money.

Plenty of out door seating if you have dogs.

Definitely worth a visit and well worth the money.

recent_reviews.author: Sandra Hoy
recent_reviews.text: First time I've been and couldnt fault at all. Food was fabulous, earned by walking up to the monument to a fantastic view! Couldn't decide on cake so one whilst there and one to bring home. Will definitely return!

recent_reviews.author: Ben
recent_reviews.text:
This is one of those places you donâ€™t realize exists until someone tells you about itâ€”and what a hidden gem it is!

We visited around midday and found that there was already a queue, but it was extremely well managed by a lovely lady with glasses. Donâ€™t let the queue put you off; itâ€™s well worth the 10-15 minute wait.

All the food is fresh, locally sourced, and of fantastic quality. It isnâ€™t cheap, but you should expect to pay a premium when the produce is this excellent.

Eventually, once they had a table for us, we ordered. We initially wanted four lamb and mint sandwiches, but when they couldnâ€™t accommodate that, we changed our order to one lamb, two beef, and one prawn sandwich. They apologized and even gave us four free scones as a lovely gesture.

Not long after we were seated, our food arrivedâ€”about 10 minutes laterâ€”and it was delightful. Each sandwich came with its own salad and crisps. The tea was lovely too, with each of us getting our own pot.

The place is a real gemâ€”the carrot cake and caramel tart were incredible.

The only downside was the toilets; they could use a refresh, but everywhere else is excellent. The on-site bakery and butcher are also worth a visit, and the butcherâ€™s prices are slightly cheaper since thereâ€™s no VAT.

The car park is massive, though I imagine it gets packed easily.

The bottom line is that you need to visitâ€”itâ€™s brilliant!

recent_reviews.author: So. K.
recent_reviews.text: The best breakfast and the most delicious cake in the world. The staff are soooo friendly and helpful. Thank you for the lovely morning. Best wishes to the especially nice cashier. Our dog loved it too.

pumpkin_patches.address: East Barnwell Farm, Chester Rd, Houghton le Spring DH4 7NJ

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Red road garden centre and pyo farm

recent_reviews.author: Emily Evans
recent_reviews.text: We had such a lovely morning at red road garden centre, picking the blackcurrants, tayberries and a few strawberries that have made it this season as crops were low due to the low rainfall. Mick was so friendly and helpful right from the start of our visit,  my daughter loved picking all the wonderful blackcurrants there were so many!! They also had a lovely selection of plants to purchase and also fruit plants too. Mick also showed us where the bee hives were and we bought some honey made right on the farm from the very same bees that were buzzing about the farm. Mick recommended blending the blackcurrants and having them on ice cream and we did just this this evening, and it was amazing!! My daughter loved it too. Thank you so much for the recommendation and a brilliant day! We canâ€™t wait to visit again!!

recent_reviews.author: Rob Wingate
recent_reviews.text: A lovely, independently-run place with a great range of fruit to pick - strawberries, tayberries, raspberries, and even pumpkins in autumn. Staff are really friendly, prices are fair, and there's a nice selection of drinks too. Great spot for a relaxed day out!

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Hassall
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful hour with the children picking a great range of pumpkins. The children got a small bag of sweets each (free) and got to do some Halloween colouring in. The staff are super friendly with a warm family feel. Highly recommended and we shall be back. Thank you ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Amy Hartshorn
recent_reviews.text: We had a lovely time here today! No entry fee. Set in the pretty village of Kineton.There is a prize for children if they find a knitted worm amongst the pumpkins! Very child friendly with an activity tunnel for them to do arts and crafts for free! Good value for money on produce too! We will be back in the spring for the fruit picking!!

recent_reviews.author: Sue Platt
recent_reviews.text: We brought our 8 year old grandson to Hatton Adventure Farm yesterday and we all had such a fun time.  We loved the sheep race, so funny.  We both played laser combat which was brilliant and the foam party was sensational, our grandson had such a good time getting covered in so much foam.  The girls playing the music at the snow party were brilliant too, so much energy.  There was so much to do for the kids we felt it was excellent value for money and look forward to returning.

recent_reviews.author: Chelsea Collins
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVED our visit to Hatton adventure world. Loads to do and see, wonderful, Well looked after animals and areas. The tractor tour was fantastic. Lovely driver, educational,fun and wasn't expensive at all. Really good day out for the kids mine aged 8 and 9.

recent_reviews.author: Loredana Maria
recent_reviews.text:
This is such a wonderful place where you can easily spend 3â€“4 hours â€” if not more! Itâ€™s packed with engaging experiences for children, with both indoor fun and, most importantly, a fantastic outdoor area to explore.

One of the highlights is the variety of farm animals, which the kids absolutely loved. They even had the chance to pet some of the guinea pigs and rabbits â€” such a sweet, hands-on experience.

We purchased a summer ticket, so weâ€™re planning to visit at least once every weekend. Itâ€™s one of the best ways weâ€™ve found to keep the kids entertained, active, and happy.

Our children especially enjoy the outdoor soft play area and the toddler rides, which run until 4 PM and are always a big hit. The tractor ride was an unexpected treat â€” the driverâ€™s storytelling was captivating, and the pass through the â€œswampâ€ added a fun little thrill to the journey

recent_reviews.author: Sandra Atkinson
recent_reviews.text: Had an amazing day with both my children (aged 6 & 8), from start to finish, there was so much to do. With the summer foam party and Maize Maze being a new addition since our previous visit 2 years ago was a bonus, they absolutely loved it and were more than ready to fall asleep in the car on the way home!

recent_reviews.author: abid mahmood
recent_reviews.text:
What a lovely place
Nice shop with great variety. Lovely cafe area. Nice play area for kids and a nice garden leading up to the pigs. Nice outdoor plant area that leads to the chickens and Goats. Overall lovely scenic place to visit.

recent_reviews.author: T P
recent_reviews.text:
We haven't been here for a while and it's certainly extended the cafe. The farm shop part is lovely with lots of treats to choose from. The shop is always tidy and a clean open space to explore.

Their cafe, although busy and low on staff were able to deliver our food and drinks within 10mins, even though the lady at the till said it would be delayed. The food was tasty, I had the Korean BBQ chicken with chips and coleslaw at around Â£15. We always come away happy. There is an area outside for the children to play and you can eat outside too. A good stop by for a coffee and cake.

recent_reviews.author: Colin Hall
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful farm shop, great selection but I knocked off a star due to the price. Fantastic selection of produce that you wouldn't necessarily find in other farm shops so they clearly spend a lot of time sourcing quality goods, but their prices also reflect that. If cost isn't a concern then this place is 5 stars for sure. Popular restaurant too, with plenty of parking.

recent_reviews.author: Natasha P
recent_reviews.text:
Took almost 2 hours to get our brunch.

We were a group of 12 who had pre-ordered days before the meal, and it was for brunch (so, simple food like avocado on toast).

Booked for 10.30am, arrived at 10.30. Asked about food at 11.30, got told it would be 10 more minutes. Asked about food again at 11.50, got told it would be 10 more minutes. Food arrived at 12.10pm. Saw other tables come, be fed, and leave in that time. As I said, weâ€™d done a preorder to make it easier and they still got 1 meal wrong, 1 meal which was burnt with a cold fried egg on top, and 1 meal that just wasnâ€™t made and was missing.

Staff were polite and helped with what they could. They mentioned they were a chef down, however all the tables were full. If there is a chef down, tables should be limited so that a good quality of service can still be given. Itâ€™s better to have half a cafe leave happy, than have an entire cafe be irritated, ask for refunds due to poor timing and food, and go away with a negative experience.

The farm shop was lovely and had a great selection of gluten free food, which was great

recent_reviews.author: clelia Hatchard
recent_reviews.text: We love pick-your-own days here! The tractor ride is so much fun, especially for the kids. The produce is always fresh and lovely. Itâ€™s the perfect way to spend a great afternoon, finished off with some delicious ice cream. Highly recommend for a family outing!

recent_reviews.author: sidath wijesekera
recent_reviews.text: This farm offers a great experience for strawberry plucking and a few other fruits and vegetables. Entry is free of charge, and baskets are available at a small price. A tractor takes visitors to the plucking area, and the atmosphere is relaxed with no rush at all. Thereâ€™s plenty of open space for kids , and a designated area where you can sit back and enjoy your freshly picked produce. The prices of fruits and vegetables are quite reasonable, and there is ample parking space. However, it's worth noting that no toilet facilities were visible during the visit.

recent_reviews.author: veera rajput
recent_reviews.text:
ğŸŒ¾ Roundstone Farm (near Worthing, West Sussex)
Fruit & veg selection
Massive selection: strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, currants, gooseberries, plus veg like courgettes, pumpkins, sweetcorn and more
Onâ€‘site support
Tractorâ€‘tram to shuttle visitors, ecoâ€‘friendly punnets, and a refreshment kiosk
localfoodbrita
Ambience & suitability
Spacious and wellâ€‘set for families; staff are helpful, fields are cleanâ€”lots of sense of scale

*Excellent for variety loversâ€”berries and vegetables under one roof, with a large farm feel and family-friendly facilities.

recent_reviews.author: Amelie Doyonnard
recent_reviews.text: Love going there, great for solo/couples or family. Make sure you go at the right time and enjoy your pick! I got so many raspberries and strawberries this year, it was delicious.

recent_reviews.author: Nichola Ryan
recent_reviews.text:
We had a lovely time visiting here for the first time this week. Whilst the animal element is more limited than we are used to when visiting a 'farm', the vast play areas certainly provided more than enough entertainment. The pedal area is amazing, my girls would have stayed in there for hours exploring all the different modes of transport. The offering of animals were small but we still enjoyed visiting them all, especially the baby animals in the indoor section. Parking was plentiful and whilst we didn't eat at the cafe, the coffee was good and the menu looked varied. I would definitely recommend this place to others.

Finally, my one gripe when it comes to pricing (and many many places do it) is why is it the same cost for adults to enter the farm as it is a child? As much as I enjoyed the day, I definitely didn't get to interact with everything like my children did!

recent_reviews.author: Monica H
recent_reviews.text:
Wonderful place for children, perfect to fill days during the summer holidays and a good price compared to other farms with childrenâ€™s activities in the south east.  Weâ€™ll definitely be back this summer!

Itâ€™s basically loads of playgrounds, sand play, a soft play, a trampoline park and ride-on toys all in one place plus animals and a beautiful natural setting.  We packed a picnic and spent 6 hours here with an 8yo, 5yo and 2yo.  Thereâ€™s loads of picnic tables in the sun and in the shade.

The barn was a huge draw for my children who loved looking at the animals multiple times throughout the day.  The kids (baby goats) and piglets were super cute and the farm staff working in the barn was happy to chat and give us some more info.  On a hot day (28 degrees) the barn and soft play felt quite cool.

We stopped at the tea room for ice cream and coffee, and I thought it was lovely that they had toys you could bring to the table and colouring.

All the staff we encountered were lovely, the other families were lovely and children were just enjoying themselvesâ€” running, jumping, climbing and getting sandy! Definitely child friendly and Autistic friendly, as there is so much to do it doesnâ€™t feel overcrowded even on a busy day.  Lots of parking, although only two blue badge spaces I noticed, but we still managed to park close.

recent_reviews.author: Katie S
recent_reviews.text:
-Friendly staff -loads to do for toddlers and up -great food. -more adventure park than farm.

We've wanted to give this place a go for ages, and despite the bad reviews my 3 yr old really enjoyed herself. Every staff member we encountered was so polite and helpful, we were given a very warm welcome from the guy at the ticket box. We took a packed lunch so didnt eat the hot foods, but the cafe section was great with loads of choice. The biscoff cookie slice was amazing and it was refreshing to be given a huge slab of sweet treat for Â£3.90 rather a small finger slice like most places.
Do agree the soft play could do with a wash and a revamp. The baby section wasn't very engaging. The animals were all inside when we went which meant we saw them well but wasn't really sure why this was foe thw middle of a dry day.
Huge play area outside with tons to choose from. Would definitely say this dominates over the animals so if you have a child who loves to climb balance and jump this is the great place to choose.

recent_reviews.author: Prathima M
recent_reviews.text:
It was okay farm. Small farm animals like goat, sheep , kid, lambs, ducks and chickens

Donkeys too

But large outdoor and indoor play area.  Good for bit older kids from age 4/5..

recent_reviews.author: Carly Legon
recent_reviews.text: This gorgeous family run farm was set in the most beautiful surroundings. The plants were all very high quality and extremely well maintained. The fruit was exceedingly great value for money. And the family who run the place were so kind, friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend going along to pick your own fruit; we will definitely be returning!

recent_reviews.author: Leah Murphy Brettell
recent_reviews.text: Myself and three friends and all our kids had a brilliant afternoon at Stonehill Farm today! The raspberries are delicious and we had a lot if fun picking them. All of the people working at Stonehill were lovely. We will definitely be back. Thank you!

recent_reviews.author: alfred parker
recent_reviews.text: I'm so very pleased to have been introduced to Stonehill. The gooseberries are just incredible and have made masses of wonderful jam for my charity. So reasonably priced and such helpful people in a unique beautiful setting

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Thornton
