recent_reviews.text: Great place for the kids to quietly pick all kinds of fruit. Well priced. Very quiet secluded spot. Easilly pass a couple of hours  picking. Raspberries are fantastic.

pumpkin_patches.address: Horam to, Stonehill Farm, Chiddingly Rd, Horam, Heathfield TN21 0JN

recent_reviews.author: Maria Sousamli
recent_reviews.text: A good place to eat. Some British staples on the menu cooked well. I had a cake that was huge. Â£5.25 for a salted caramel cake. The frosting was good. The cake sponge was dense (like a store bought one) but was tasty! Will go back!

recent_reviews.author: Peter Barratt
recent_reviews.text: Nice cafe with an open plan North American country bar feel to it in terms of the decor. Great big wood burner for a winter day! Lovely selection of cakes. Good coffee. A friendly welcome too. We had pasties as the lunch menu had stopped, but they were fine. Lots of nice walking in and around the village too. Worth a visit if you need some sustainance in nice surroundings.

recent_reviews.author: Ruby Baker
recent_reviews.text: Atmosphere of this place is lovely especially in summer, I love the canopy outside with the benches. I think it provides a lovely bit of shade with the option of some sun as well. You can watch the animals and eat your food at the same time which i think is genius. The food was tasty, nicely cooked and crispy. Flavours were there and the portions were good sizes. There's a water station inside for you to fill your cups up whenever you like which is good to save you having to ask. Menu has a wide range of options, including vegan and vegetarian. Kid friendly as well with options for them too.

recent_reviews.author: Andrea Rota
recent_reviews.text:
A real farm in the middle of the English country and well served by a lot of parking places.
The place is very clean, full of details and cozy.
Weâ€™ve been there last week and was fully decorated for Halloweenâ€¦wonderful!
The staff is very friendly and ready to help.
The food is unbelievable!
There is also a corner where you can buy their products and other stuff.
Super recommended!
Unmissable!

pumpkin_patches.address: Burton Farm Shop, Burton, Chippenham SN14 7LU

recent_reviews.author: Roisin O'Dubhlaoidh
recent_reviews.text: Meg put together the most beautiful bouquet of flowers for my friend who has just passed a very challenging qualification. The aim was to treat her to something to make her feel special and this bunch more than met that objective. She said theyâ€™re the most beautiful flowers sheâ€™s ever received, and I think they must be the most beautiful flowers Iâ€™ve ever given too! Thank you so much, Meg!

recent_reviews.author: Naomi Awre
recent_reviews.text: Flowers by Meg at Roots helped us source flowers for our wedding reception venue very last minute. We had been hoping to pick our own but were just out of season, but the helpful staff in the farm shop contacted Meg and she picked a wonderful selection for us. They went above and beyond! The flowers really enhanced our reception venue and the smell was glorious!

recent_reviews.author: hde He
recent_reviews.text: This is a great farm shop, it's close to where we live, the owners are exceptionally friendly, we bought our Christmas tree from them for the past three years and these are sustainable trees, they come in a very large pot and you rent them for the Christmas period. You can either take them back yourself or they can be picked up in January by Roots. The organic veg is excellent and we have also ordered an organic chicken for a Christmas Eve dinner. It's a great place but only open for a specific number of days per week so check on their website when that is.

recent_reviews.author: Tanitha Reddy
recent_reviews.text: Found this farm shop via the cook website as I urgently needed to deliver some food to a family member who tested positive 2 days before Christmas. The staff member I spoke to was extremely accommodating and walked around the store whilst on the phone to help describe what options they had. He suggested a few additional treats such as wine and fresh bread and delivered the package in less than 2hours of me placing the order. Big thank to you for helping us and highly recommend them for truly great service.

recent_reviews.author: Graham Stowe
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic place to be. ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Di Speirs
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful country farm which is professionally run.

recent_reviews.author: Mark Lester
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place Lovely people

recent_reviews.author: Nuts
recent_reviews.text: Great place. We came away with bottles of local ales, chutney, meat and cheese. There are several different shops including clothing and camping. We'll worth visiting for all that alone but on top of it all there's the animals which our granddaughter loved seeing and feeding with the Â£1 bags of feed. Then having a tractor trailer ride around the fields, a play in the play area and an ice cream. Plenty of parking. Something for everyone.

recent_reviews.author: Tara Lee Grocott
recent_reviews.text: It was lovely to see the animals, my girls especially loved the donkeys and the ponys. The Â£1 bucket of feed is well worth doing. It's a lovely little place and will definitely be back in the future.

recent_reviews.author: Richard Simpson
recent_reviews.text: My son and myself found Glebe Farm by accident as we were having a look at Saint Mary's Church. It's a super place where you can see (and feed!) several, different types of animals including donkeys, llamas and goats. There is also, surprisingly, a small shopping area with lots of different, niche-type workshops. We spent some time in the children's play area and considered to take the Tractor Ride which is very reasonably priced at Â£1.00 per person. I was, personally, delighted with Glebe Farm and I fully intend to visit again perhaps in the May Day event on 17th May.

recent_reviews.author: Allan Jones
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous experience from 1 to 99 years old and it's free!! Donkeys Alpacas sheep pigs Shetland pony peacocks  and many more animals to pet and feed. An aviary with parrots budgies golden pheasant and others.. Meerkats, small playground 1-10. Wash hands stations.. Farm shop with excellent range of food. Cafe.. Ice cream.. Arty shops and others. Great place to spend a couple of hours with little ones. And maybe spend some money too. Been loads kids always love it.

recent_reviews.author: Judy
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic location. Has everything. Fed the pigs. Views and the food is phenomenal. Toastie sourdough to die for and savoury scone fabulous.10/10 loads of local choice.

recent_reviews.author: littleskiesYT
recent_reviews.text: Visited twice over the last week, as we are holidaying near by. Delicious food, good menu - more extensive than expected. Staff were quite miserable looking and not attentive which really let's it down. Also bought some beer and shortbread for gifts which was nice. Dog friendly too.

recent_reviews.author: Christopher Parker
recent_reviews.text: Lovely view over Bodmin Moor. Had jacket pototo with coronation chicken and locally sourced can of apple and rhubarb. Reasonably priced.

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Neish
recent_reviews.text:
Really lovely little farm shop!

Stopped here for lunch and the sandwiches were really yummy! The avocado with wild garlic pesto was so tasty we even bought a pot of the pesto to take home with us!

The shop itself was nice too, a nice range of artisanal goods. Bought some Cornish gin as a present, as well as the aforementioned pesto and some quail eggs which was a nice little treat too.

Dog friendly with some very nice ladies serving us. For a lovely farm shop on the Moor, didn't think it was too expensive.

Would definitely recommend and will hopefully be back! ğŸ’œ

recent_reviews.author: Terrie Nichola Mayo
recent_reviews.text:
Arrived early today for breakfast and was not disappointed.

Only thing before I get into the review is the price, I went only to check and it was cheaper on the online menu so couldn't understand that!

Ordered 2 breakfast, well done meat, no beans and soft egg. Cuppa tea and orange juice.

Everything on our plates was tasty, fresh and made me want to eat more.  I was pleasantly surprised by the way it looked and tasted.

Well done and hopefully we will be back in the area again.

recent_reviews.author: Laura Brown
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely little place! Very quirky. The staff were lovely. The things sold were beautifully packaged and it was overall a lovely experience. Thanks so much.

recent_reviews.author: Jemima
recent_reviews.text:
Highly recommend!!! Absolutely gorgeous breakfast (clearly locally sourced as the taste was fabulous!) wonderful atmosphere and excellent staff!!

After we had breakfast, we popped into the shop and discovered lots of delightful Hilltop Farm made jam, chutney and sauces. Lots on offer! Especially the selection of beachwood + glass creations !! - lots of chic items for sale!!

We will certainly be a regular now!

Thank you to the whole team for making our Saturday morning special! I donâ€™t usually write reviews but after our experience I wanted others to  experience too! â­ï¸ â­ï¸ â­ï¸ â­ï¸ â­ï¸

recent_reviews.author: tara edmunds
recent_reviews.text: Most a amazing food and hot drinks and also the little shop is lovely.

recent_reviews.author: Philip Wright
recent_reviews.text:
Great, great place for a cream tea and cakes! A lovely tea shop/ barn. Fabulous staff with wonderful home made jams, cakes and other treats. If you have dogs this is a great place, so dog friendly and fabulous for your four legged friend to have a sniff about and get in some off lead time. A treat for us and and new experience for them was to see the ferrets. The also got to play with Chocâ€™s the lovely spaniel.

If youâ€™re passing by call in, if youâ€™re not, detour and treat yourself.

recent_reviews.author: Roger Smitham
recent_reviews.text:
We had a lovely visit to Cows and Sows for some lovely food and drinks - perfect weather to a lovely relaxing quirky venue.  Theresa was a perfect host - will definitely revisit - it was the perfect time out from a very stressful few weeks.  An unexpected  surprise was to meet Moonshine the Owl.
I highly recommend to anyone.

recent_reviews.author: Jennifer Ridgley
recent_reviews.text:
An absolute gem of a find! We had an absolutely scrumptious cream tea here on Wednesday and it was absolutely gorgeous. The staff were so friendly and welcoming to both us and our two children. We had a good chat to the lady who makes beautiful silver jewellery and the geologist next door (apologies I didn't get your names). We definitely want to try washing rocks now! ğŸ˜ And our children were completely enamoured with their pirate glass and the story behind it. Thank you.

The produce was delicious too.

100% recommend to anyone. Fabulous place.

recent_reviews.author: Aston Eva
recent_reviews.text:
Perfect for a cream tea.
Was very quiet with just us there. Was lovely to have a walk round and meet the ferrets. The food was lovely and the hosts were very hospitable.
Lovely private little space. Felt like Alice in wonderland

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Alvis
recent_reviews.text: We've visited three times over the last couple of months and each time we have been impressed by the extremely friendly, welcoming staff and the high quality of food and drink on offer. Never had a sausage roll so good! Best sirloin steak for a long time. See you again soon!

recent_reviews.author: Sarah
recent_reviews.text:
Probably the best pasty I've had! They do not scrimp on the portions - very tasty ingredients, freshly baked and worth every penny. Friendly service too.

Indoor and outdoor seating available for the cafe and a good amount of parking.

recent_reviews.author: Guy Thomas
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant place with fabulous local produce. We bought a couple of pork chops, cut to size (about an inch and a quarter thick) with fresh local new potatoes, carrots and purple sprouting broccoli. All utterly tasty!  Do yourselves a favour and try the pork chops! Yum.

recent_reviews.author: Julien
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm shop and cafÃ© with a wide variety of fresh local products. Perfect for stopping by for a coffee or picking up a few groceries on the way home. The staff are friendly and welcoming too.

pumpkin_patches.address: Shop, St Buryan Farm, St Buryan, Penzance TR19 6EL

recent_reviews.author: E Johnson
recent_reviews.text: We stayed in the Cherry pod for 5 nights and loved every minute of it. Upon arrival, the pod was immaculate. We loved the fact that itâ€™s a working farm too so thereâ€™s animals all around. Carol and Ian were very friendly and welcoming, informative too, telling us where the local walks are and things to do. We loved spending time in the hot tub, especially on a clear night being able to relax and stargaze. Itâ€™s a lovely quiet area, the pod itself is pretty much soundproof. Weâ€™re light sleepers and never heard a thing!

recent_reviews.author: Ashlee Grainger
recent_reviews.text:
My husband and I stayed in the Oak lodge for 3 nights for our honeymoon, it was lovely! The lodge was very clean and tidy upon arrival and everything was in good working order.
The grounds are very well kept and the owners, Carol and Ian, are very helpful. They let us know about nearby walks and things to do.
We had a lovely time being able to watch the sunset and then stargaze in the hot tub each night. Definitely recommend staying here!

recent_reviews.author: hannah dennon
recent_reviews.text:
We stayed in the OAK cabin for three nights with our two daughtersâ€¦
Hosts are amazing & welcomed us on the farm, let us know of local walks and also let our girls go and see the animals on the farm, the girls got to feed the donkeys and meet an hour old baby lamb!
Gorgeous cabin, the views are amazing and the hot tub topped it off -weâ€™ve all had an amazing time! We 100% recommend and will definitely be back!

recent_reviews.author: T-J Lopez
recent_reviews.text:
Me and my partner stayed from Friday 19th - 26th July 2024 and well what can we say...
Except we was greeted by Ian the farmer and Carol who where more than helpful and so kind and bubbly. Have gone above and beyond to help us with our stay, even sell fresh eggs and the views are beautiful. And the pods are well kept and so clean and upkept daily. And we fell in love with the farm dog "Meg" who is now our best friend. This is definitely one place we would love to come and stay again.

pumpkin_patches.address: The Farm House, Aglionby, Wheelbarrow Hall, Carlisle CA4 8AD

recent_reviews.author: Stephen Taylor
recent_reviews.text: Lovely gardens in a woodland setting, beside a Limestone cragg.

recent_reviews.author: Diane Robbins
recent_reviews.text:
We spent a wonderful afternoon with our grandchildren at Dove Fields. We took our own picnic and used the lovely picnic seating,, enjoyed the adventure of following the Maze route and the children not only got exercise with fun out in the fresh air but it was also very educational for them.
Once they had finished exploring the Maze they thoroughly enjoyed playing on many of the activities laid out in the spacious play area.
Portaloos were spotless by the way!
The afternoon was concluded with a lovely locally made ice cream from the Dove Fields shop.
PS not a bit of technology in sight (oops except for Nannyâ€™s camera clicking on her phone)ğŸ‘ğŸ»

recent_reviews.author: Kirsty Rogers
recent_reviews.text: We had a fantastic morning here yesterday! Managed to complete both Mazeâ€™s and enjoy the other activities available. In all a great couple of hours, would thoroughly recommend ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: lilly owen
recent_reviews.text: We had an absolutely lovely afternoon! Learning facts about hedgehogs and keep the younger siblings brains working they worked together brilliantly to guide us through both mazes. The play area was great aimed more for younger children but my siblings 13&11 found stuff to keep them busy in the play area and especially loved climbing the bale tower. The owners were so friendly and welcoming. An added bonus was didnâ€™t get lost, but if we did we were given a contract number and flag just incase. We visited when it was very quiet but that didnâ€™t stop us from having fun. Mazes, sunflower picking and a great outside space. And according to my siblings â€œI do have some good ideas for days outâ€ Thank you for a lovely afternoon and I would definitely recommend it to anyone and everyone especially if they want something a little different to do for a day â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Lyndsey Allen
recent_reviews.text: A fantastic family day out and great value for money. A little and big maze with a follow along game that kept all ages entertained. My daughter loved the play tent and chalkboard., alongside a warm welcome and delicious ice-cream, whatâ€™s not to love?

pumpkin_patches.address: Dove Fields, Draycott in the Clay, Ashbourne DE6 5GX

recent_reviews.author: Glyn Goold
recent_reviews.text: Very popular well-stocked farm shop with plenty of top quality food on sale, especially their own-made pies and pastries. There is a good selection on their cafe menu from coffee and cake to a proper meal. Service is very good with plenty of helpful staff on hand. Prices are a tiny bit high but you get what you pay for. The milkshakes are great! There is plenty of indoor seating and an outdoor picnic area with a large cabin but be warned, this is a working farm and the air can be a bit rich ğŸ˜€

recent_reviews.author: David Wright
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful place to visit, especially if you have a four legged friend. We had lunch in the outside area, which is dog friendly. They even have a indoor space for days it's not pleasant to sit outside for dog owners. The food and drink is lovely, especially the scones. The service is exemplary, they couldn't be any more friendly and courteous. A must visit in my opinion.

recent_reviews.author: Jason K
recent_reviews.text: I received a Â£20 gift voucher for afternoon tea for two at Denstone Hall Farm Cafe. My wife and I booked a table and went a few days later. Our three tiered plate of sandwiches, quiche, cakes and a pot of tea for two arrived and it was truly delicious. However, unlike the many other places we've enjoyed afternoon tea at, that was it. Nothing was replenished, no extra sandwiches or anything, not even the advertised refillable pot of tea was offered as it turned out. We are not greedy people, we had enjoyed what we were given and thought it was excellent value for money. Unfortunately though, when I went to pay the bill and I handed my voucher over I was shocked to be asked for a further Â£19.90 on top. I didn't make a fuss, I just paid up and left. When we got home, I did something I should have done and that was to check things out on the Denstone Hall Farm Shop website. Sure enough, there is a lovely picture of what we'd had but, that picture shows not what one person will be served, that is what two people get for Â£39.90. So, look carefully at the picture, divide it by two and judge for yourself if that is good value for money.

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Appling
recent_reviews.text: I had fond memories of afternoon tea at this place, so made sure to return on my next visit. Besides delicious food & drink, they have a lovely outdoor area and playground for kids. Dogs are welcome, and there is seating indoor & outdoor. There is produce is available, and the shop inside is growing as well with something for everyone.

recent_reviews.author: Laura Curry
recent_reviews.text: The review of 3.5 is not in the sunflower field, itâ€™s a picture of fodder beat and was taken before we were open! Hopefully this picture gives a good idea of what weâ€™re about.

recent_reviews.author: Hannah L
recent_reviews.text: Great place to pick sunflowers in the late summer ğŸŒ»ğŸŒ»

recent_reviews.author: Samantha Hancock
recent_reviews.text: Just love visiting here. Stunning at sunset. Love family business.

recent_reviews.author: Rob Ireland
recent_reviews.text: Lovely.

recent_reviews.author: michael norwell
recent_reviews.text: Visited the farm shop for the first time during there 2025 Open Farm Sunday just for something to do and it really impressed. There was such a wide range of food and the staff were very knowledgeable about where all the products came from. No wonder they have won awards the meat counter was stunning alpng with such a variety of local produce at prices I would say to be worth every penny. Well worth a visit we will definitely be visiting again.

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Wood
recent_reviews.text: We visited on open day. Good provision for blue badge parking. Lots to see and do without spending money. It was busy and although there were toilets inside the farm shop, they could have done with more outside. Great to meet Harriet from Clarkson's Farm too! We will be back.

recent_reviews.author: Andy Savage
recent_reviews.text:
I've been going to Croots for many years now but not been recently so popped along this morning. All there stuff is so tasty. Friendly staff. Their award winning sausages are really good in a toad in the hole. So much lovely stuff in their deli section.
Highly recommended

Also its a unique shopping experience often having to wait for sheep to move off the road on your drive up to the farm shop, you don't get that at your supermarket LOL.

recent_reviews.author: C Johnson
recent_reviews.text: Awesome farm shop and cafe. The food was lovely and tasty. I was the first one to try their strawberry milkshake, which was deliciously refreshing. The lady serving the meats in the butchers was really friendly.  The horses in the farm are so friendly and warm. Great place with great views.

pumpkin_patches.address: Farnah House, Farm Wirksworth Rd, Duffield, Belper DE56 4AQ

recent_reviews.author: Ani Syed
recent_reviews.text:
â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸ Lovely Family Day Out at Willow Tree Farm

We had a fantastic family day out at Willow Tree Farm! We did the 1-hour alpaca walk, which was such a fun and unique experience â€“ my child absolutely loved it. The alpacas were gentle and well looked after, and the staff were friendly and helpful throughout.

After the walk, we stayed for lunch, which was delicious and great quality. Itâ€™s a lovely place for all ages â€“ perfect for both young kids and older generations. A great way to spend the day together as a family. Highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Daryl Sharpe
recent_reviews.text:
I booked the alpaca trekking for my mums birthday. We had lots of fun. It was well organised and our guide knew everything there was to know about alpacas. We stayed to have a look around the rest of the farm after. I definitely recommend as a family day out - whether it's just for a look around, or if you're booking one of the experience packs. There's play areas for the kids, plus a really cool bouncy castle/trampoline kind of area (if only I was still a child!), and a cafe to grab a drink/bite to eat.

As others have pointed out, the car park could be better signed. Just to make it more obvious that the car park is specifically for willow tree farm, and not the seemingly abandoned school. Once parked, we didn't have any issues finding where to go.

I would definitely go again!

recent_reviews.author: Shelley Parker
recent_reviews.text:
The meerkat experience was fab!!! The young man who did the talk was very knowledgeable, we really loved spending time feeding and enjoying the meerkats.
On the down side I do think the cafe needs some improvement as in the lady was run off her feet. Another staff member or two might help things run more smoothly.

recent_reviews.author: Amber
recent_reviews.text:
We have just came back from our visit at the willow tree farm and feel a tad disappointed.

After reviewing their website to see how colourful and informative it was we (3x adults) were really excited to visit. Upon visiting we were a little confused over car parking as there was no signs directing you to their car park and instead looks like an abandoned school car park. When we entered the farm we were a little lost on where to start and go as there was no directions and no map given (which may be useful for the future). After walking down we noticed the event tent and was confused to find 4 sheep randomly sat but came along running for food, we headed back to the cafe (which was the entrance and exit to the farm) to ask about food to be informed â€œwe have ran out of food and donâ€™t know when it will be deliveredâ€ we headed back out to continue on our trek round. We found an empty pig pen, one goat throwing around an empty food bucket trying to get food to then move on to chew what was of little grass, whilst the other goats were looking at people for food, we noticed a few visitors feeding them grass. We found a lot of animals didnâ€™t seem used to human contact whereas some only looked at you for food. We then entered the reptile room and found what we thought was a cupboard that was labelled â€œplease shut behind youâ€ which was left opened when visitors were in and out to find a few further animals in there. The medical area/sheep pen next door we found to be dirty and lonely.

It seemed to me personally the care and attention was focused on all the play areas for children rather than the hospitality and care for the animals. The shame was also there was no information on the animals no signs to say whether the animals had names or any information about them for example was there llamas or alpacas or both? ğŸ˜‚

recent_reviews.author: Deborah Baggaley
recent_reviews.text: Lovely,  friendly family run business.   Great facilities and flowers/ pumpkins.  Lots of parking.

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte Goodman
recent_reviews.text: We love it here. So beautiful

recent_reviews.author: Lauren Unwin
recent_reviews.text:
Nice day out, but expensive compared to other places to go pumpkin picking (Wymeswold Fruit Farm, K. Mills & Son).

Â£28 for a few pumpkins just seems steep and you don't get no carving kit with it. Not much to do for the kids. Just a stack of hay to play on. A few places to take photos, but that's more for the adults to make themselves feel better about spending silly amount on pumpkins, ice-cream and Â£2.50 for a can of fizzy pop (I took my own).

Facilities were bad too. Not hose to wash down pumpkins. No loo roll for toilet. Heard a kid having to go home early as couldn't go without. Nowhere to wash hands. Pretty grim to be honest.

recent_reviews.author: Inez Lee
recent_reviews.text: Great place near home for pumpkin picking! ğŸƒ

pumpkin_patches.address: Eastwood Hall Farm/Eastwood La, Chesterfield S45 0BW

recent_reviews.author: Neil Baldwin
recent_reviews.text:
This is a good nursery with a good variety of plants available. The garden furniture was on sale so keenly priced at present. The plants looked in good condition.
The restaurant served typical garden centre food which was tasty and hot. The restaurant was very light and airy.
The car park was very busy but I found a space

recent_reviews.author: Isobelle A
recent_reviews.text:
Another lovely lunch at Swarkestone Garden Centre. Two of us had the roast beef & pork with a lovely selection of potatoes and vegetables. Our third member had Coronation Chicken with a large and varied salad. All meals were delicious, freshly prepared and well presented. Order at the counter and the meals are brought to your table by friendly and efficient staff.
Recommended ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Lorna Walker
recent_reviews.text: Pulling into the car park there were 3 people who pulled in front of us as we were trying to park but we  eventually found a spot. By the time we got into the centre we were running late for the pumpkin picking event. However the staff were lovely, understanding and helpful. I did expect to be picking pumpkins off the vines themselves tbh but I've never attended a pumpkin picking event before. The kids did enjoy they activities and sitting on the tractor and wagon too. A few of the little gourds were broken so they couldn't play the gourd and spoon race but they enjoyed the rest of the activities and had fun. Lots of different sized pumpkins for everyone. The scary tunnel was fun and the displays were awesome. We liked the scarecrows made by local school children and voting for them too. Only thing I might add for next year is maybe a petting zoo for the kids as my children were excited to see a sheep over the fence. It would definitely be the icing on the cake but overall we enjoyed the whole event. Definitely reasonably priced too.

recent_reviews.author: Fay walker
recent_reviews.text: Took 3of our grandchildren to the pumpkin festival here today.. we were very impressed. Â£4 admission.. which includes all the outdoor activities and an indoor spooky trail ( pumpkins extra to purchase) all the boys (12..9..8..) thought it was great fun.. then went for food in the cafÃ© afterwards.

recent_reviews.author: Darren â€œDazzaâ€ Boss
recent_reviews.text:
My wife and I had breakfast here as we were staying nearby. The menu was excellent as there was plenty of choice. I had the bacon and sausage cob with extra black pudding and my wife had pancakes. For what you pay you get a lot and it's amazing quality. The staff are very friendly too. Definitely returning.

Secondly my sister and brother in law used the butchers and got some pies which they recommend too.

recent_reviews.author: John Lloyd
recent_reviews.text: Marked down as prices to me were extremely expensive Â£4 for 2 slices of toast! A fiver for tea for 2, 12 quid for a small breakfast, if money is no object then it wonâ€™t bother you and the food is very delicious you will be happy.

recent_reviews.author: Steve Darken
recent_reviews.text: Went here for a last minute afternoon tea for my 60th birthday. Very accommodating with booking a table. Quite small inside but very cosy. Afternoon tea included farm made pork pie & ham/Brie quiche plus usual sandwiches, scones & Bakewell Tart which was more to my taste as I prefer savoury to sweet. Staff incredibly welcoming and nothing seemed too much trouble. Our two dogs were made to feel welcome as well. Overall, not a Michelin starred experience but tasty & good value. Would certainly visit again!

recent_reviews.author: Robert Lumby
recent_reviews.text:
Really excellent breakfast. Full works Inc black pudding. Proper tea, served in a pot with loose leaf and a tea strainer. Lots of tea flavours to choose from and full coffee choice with decaf.
Fantastic farm shop. Had a steak and stilton pie to take out. Great chunks of steak and really flavoursome withe the stilton. Bought some plain flour and wholemeal flour from a local supplier.
Staff are very helpful and polite, both in the shop and cafe. Definitely worth the drive from Sheffield.

recent_reviews.author: jenna Louise
recent_reviews.text: A family farm which really brings the magic. Our best ever Christmas trees have been chosen there but today we experienced the sunflower trail for the first time. We spent 4 hours and could have been there longer! Incredible attention to detail and fun for all ages at such a reasonable price point. If thereâ€™s tickets left be quick and book- you wonâ€™t be disappointed. Thank you for an afternoon weâ€™ll treasure forever!

recent_reviews.author: Ahya Hernandez Cruz
recent_reviews.text:
Had an amazing and surprisingly fun time with my husband!

We've never been to a sunflower field and I'm so glad we decided to take a spur of the moment day trip to see this place!

Arranging it was easily done - they have a website where you can book tickets to participate in the activities of the day. You have to mind the dates of availability though and arrive within the time slot assigned. Advanced booking is definitely a plus!

We came about 45 minutes early for our booking, but the staff at the entrance kindly allowed us in.

We don't own a car, and have googled maps the bus route for getting to the place but the easiest solution was an Uber from the city centre which didn't break the bank as well!

When you get to the place, they have a huge parking lot and an entry area where they had inflatable play spaces for kids of all ages and a teacup ride for the littler guests. Porta potties were also made available, and that made me feel really at ease.

Coming into the open space before the sunflower field, there was a recreational and picnic area where there were food trucks that served burgers, and ones that sold ice cream and hot drinks! They had a tent at the end as well with booths that offered burgers, cookies and pastries, and even a magic show!

Opposite to the picnic area, there were booths for facepainting and caricature drawings, and a reaaaaalllly big beach chair you can sit on for a gigantic photo op!

Before you entered the field premises there was a booth that allowed parents to take photos of their tiny tots as a precaution in case they got lost (which can easily happen - the field is huuuuge!). Children must come accompanied by adults!

They also offered to lend shears for cutting thr sunflowers incase you wanted to bring some with you - they only cost Â£1 per piece, which is a bargain as they are soooo freakin' huge!

Definitely one of the highlights of my summer! Hope to come again next year!! ğŸ¥°

Thank you! We've had an awesome time!!

recent_reviews.author: Dean Henderson
recent_reviews.text:
Not much to do at all. If it rains be prepared. The rain never bothers us as a family but it rained when we were here went in tent to have dinner nowhere near enough seats /tables for everyone. No play park for the kids. Won't be back. Sunflower trail was OK but again nothing special at all definitely over advertised for what it is. What a shame
,  Feel like I've been totally ripped off paying nearly Â£40 for 6 people. Avoid if you can find something else to do

recent_reviews.author: Michelle Hammond
recent_reviews.text: Lovely sunflowers and seeing the owls and stalls of cakes x worth the money. Get to cut own sunflowers to take home

pumpkin_patches.address: East, Grange Farm, High Shincliffe, Durham DH1 2TB

recent_reviews.author: Leigh Fairbrother
recent_reviews.text:
Went camping at Roundhill by Woodfire. Visited Middle Farm daily for a) incredible beer & cider collection, b) brilliant petting zoo & playground, c) fabulous Farm shop, and d) cake from the tea room!

It was so popular Bank Holiday Monday was a struggle for food orders, but otherwise faultless. Super friendly and helpful staff

recent_reviews.author: Julia Beckett
recent_reviews.text:
Had a great time with my Grandaughter... Slightly confusing and a animals were quite sparse, although lots of chickens!!
However, we enjoyed the afternoon out with cake. The staff were lovely!!

recent_reviews.author: Margaret Ying
recent_reviews.text:
The last time I went to this farm was 8 years ago when I was visiting the UK, so it was a must stop on this trip. So glad that it was just as good an experience as last time, if not better! There was a big bouncy castle assault course that the kids LOVED, and they enjoyed the different "meet the animals" events throughout the day. The animals are all so gentle and sweet, and very obviously well taken care of. They even got to see a donkey getting his hooves trimmed! It was a perfect experience.
I'm also glad we went early at opening time to have breakfast. The cream tea did not disappoint!

recent_reviews.author: Rosie
recent_reviews.text:
We had the best time at Middle farm, great children's play area and small selection of farm yard animals. We would take a picnic next time as there is a lovely space to get out ypur picnic bits and space for the kids to run around (freedom), there are a few benches but not many.
Hay barn was the biggest hit for my 6 Yr old and I thought it was pretty epic too. We will definitely visit again.
The cafe was nice and the wholefood shop and plant area was a real treat.

recent_reviews.author: Wei Hoang
recent_reviews.text: Great selection and range of high quality products sold here which is well and clearly presented. Foodie delight. Medium size cafe with outdoor seating. There are vegan and gluten free choices but limited when you go to the cafe which is a shame. 2 disabled parking bays available but no official place to park bicycles outside which again is great shame. There's a good florist attached to the farm shop. Small selection of indoor and outdoor plants but depleted over time. Great choice of cheeses and pies. Like to the fact they offer samples and great size butchers at the back of the shop. Great selection of locally sourced produce.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Martin
recent_reviews.text:
Arrived at lunchtime and went to the cafe. We sat down outside and had to wait almost 15 mins before we have up and went inside and ordered ourselves. We ordered two sandwiches and two drinks. The drinks arrived very quickly but the sandwiches took over an hour to come out and when they did they were fine but the wedges on the side were so dry, there was very little potato in the centre and I almost chipped a tooth on them. It was as if they had been left on the warmer all day to dry out. Considering the wait for sandwiches I would have thought the staff would have apologised for the delay or at least forewarned us. I would have also assumed considering the +30Â°C temperatures they would have tried to upsell some more drinks to us but they didn't come near us until the food arrived.

We then went into the shop and bought something at the butchers and some  bread rolls. We had heard good things about the shop and cafe, so I assume we caught them on a bad day.  But overall this was a very disappointing visit. I've been to so many similar shops and cafes who do a really great job so this just wasn't up to par for me. The women at the till in the shop was super friendly and chatty and gave some advice on things to do in the area though. Can't fault her.

recent_reviews.author: Sharon Such
recent_reviews.text: Stunning afternoon tea all freshly made delicious sandwiches ,home baked sausage rolls and quiche .Hot out of the oven scones and delicious selection of cakes will definelty book again

recent_reviews.author: Steve Holland
recent_reviews.text:
Really nice farm shop and cafe.  Seating inside and out. Lovely place to be on a sunny day like today.  Food nice and vety good quality. Not the cheapest place i have ever been but well worth the price.  I had the Eggs Benedict and my son went for his favourite, which is waffles with bacon.  Luckily he couldnt eat it all ao I had to help out.   I must say the bacon is amazing.

Its based at a garden centre with a lovely farm shop where you can get some really nice food to take home with you.

Another 5 star review.  One more to add to the list of "i'll be back!"

xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

pumpkin_patches.address: Springvale Rd, Headbourne Worthy, Winchester SO23 7LD

recent_reviews.author: Jason Clarke
recent_reviews.text:
This is a very nice garden centre,  with a large variety of plants, homeware and local produce. It is very wheelchair accessible and I was impressed with the ramping from the upper level down to the outside plant area.
The food in the restaurant did seem a little pricey, but other places appear the same. Seeing as I have not been to a shop for a few years, I am probably a bit out of touch with the way that prices have gone up.

Apart from that, an excellent store.

recent_reviews.author: Cheryl Robinson
recent_reviews.text: I am writing this review about the Restaurant ONLY not the garden centre.  We had a meal in the restaurant today which was totally abysmal.  I had scampi and chips and my husband had fish cakes.  Both of our dinners had chips which were barely warm, peas which I would say were like bullets, salad which looked sad and limp, plates were stone cold.  The fishcakes were acceptable but the scampi was overcooked, so for the pleasure of 2 edible fishcakes and 2 milkshakes we paid just short of Â£50.00.  I complained to one of the staff who spoke to a manager who basically said because I had eaten the scampi, which I hasten to add was a real challenge, that I should have complained in the beginning.  How do you do that before you have tasted the food?  It was obvious from the whole plateful of food which was left that there was an issue.  DISMISSED entirely with a conversation of when you come back maybe we can do better.  Really!!!!  Would I ever want to go back.   NO

recent_reviews.author: Jody
recent_reviews.text: Went to the garden centre today to pick up some plants and have a look around the homeware section, only to find out dogs arenâ€™t allowed. Surprising, considering places like Whiteley, Gunwharf, and even John Lewis welcome them. Management might want to rethink this policy â€” itâ€™s likely putting customers off.

recent_reviews.author: David East
recent_reviews.text:
Good range of garden and non-garden items, including toys and clothes. Small play area for tots.
At the time of our visit, sign explained coffee machine not working, so unable to purchase coffee and hot chocolate.
A wide selection of cakes, although  I wished I'd gone for the scone rather than the sticky ginger marble cake. Neither sticky nor gingery. Similar comment about flavour of the red velvet cake from another in our party.

recent_reviews.author: Taylor Smith
recent_reviews.text:
Seeing and feeding the deer was great fun! One bag of feed cost Â£1.25 - I recommend buying a couple of bags as the deer are very charming and managed to convince me to let them have a good feast from my hand.

Great for kids and good fun for adults too.

Souvenir/gift shop on site.

recent_reviews.author: Sian Davison
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely little place to visit to get up close and feed the deer ğŸ¦Œ great for little ones too.
The playground is amazing! Staff are friendly and polite. Very well priced for entry. The farm shop is one of the best we've been too and always buy meat there which tastes amazing!

recent_reviews.author: Sam
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place to be up close to deer and feed them. They are so gentle. Staff were very friendly and polite. Not expensive to get in canâ€™t comment on restaurant as I never had food there. Overall a great place for small children there is also a play area there.

recent_reviews.author: gilly crossley
recent_reviews.text: Great experience, my nephew loved feeding the deer and the play area is excellent. We had coffee first, very good, and lunch which although a bit of a wait, was very good indeed. It's a great way to introduce kids, hands on,  to appreciating wildlife.

recent_reviews.author: Beth Corby
recent_reviews.text: Great day out, loads for the kids to do. I enjoyed feeding the goats and cows! Unfortunately the drinks kiosk was closed and the train was only running in the morning. The kids loved the play area and the pedal tractors. Nice food in the cafe and plenty of space to go for a walk round the fields and see the animals. Iâ€™ll definitely be going again!

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Beard
recent_reviews.text:
Generally such an amazing experience, we paid for 2 adults and we had 2 under 2â€™s. Entry fee was good value for money.
Love the fact that you could go on a tractor ride around the field, included in the price. the gift shop was affordable, and not sky high pricing like you see at most attractions. Nice cafe, although we didnâ€™t try the food. I love that you are encouraged to bring a picnic! Play park was massive, couldâ€™ve spent the whole afternoon in there alone! The animals were lovely, clearly well fed as they didnâ€™t want to eat the pellets we boughtğŸ¤£
The only things I would say it that please can you cut the donkey hedge down, our little ones couldnâ€™t see them even when we picked them up, and I had to go on tiptoes!

recent_reviews.author: Diane Catania
recent_reviews.text: Had a lovely morning here with my Grandson, although we felt this was more for under 5's than over. He enjoyed the playground which is well appointed and the little stream with hand pump. The cafe was very noisy and we couldn't find a table, so didn't eat there.

recent_reviews.author: Jill Digby
recent_reviews.text: I've visited the farm with my grandchildren for few years now. As well as the animals and the well equipped playground, there is always an interesting activity/show on during school hollidays. This year we went to the excellent Dog and Duck show, where a sheepdog gently herded ducks around the audience. I would highly recommend.

pumpkin_patches.address: Wilbury Rd, Letchworth Garden City SG6 4JN

recent_reviews.author: Jon W
recent_reviews.text: Wow what a difference , canâ€™t believe itâ€™s the same place , lovely atmosphere and cake to die for .  Bought some great local produce and a joint for our Sunday roast . Already planning the next coffee meet with friends .

recent_reviews.author: Helen Young
recent_reviews.text:
Oh my gosh! The cakes are all homemade and wonderful. I had the Bakewell berry cake. It was gorgeous, and the coffee is good too. A
A delightful place hidden up a track from Briddlesford Road. Blink and tou will miss it as the signposting is subtle. I would strongly suggest turning back and going in.
The emporium is good for a wander around, too.

recent_reviews.author: Fergus Carr
recent_reviews.text: Have always loved the antique hunting here. Just tried the biscoff hot chocolate, absolutely delicious. And lovely friendly staff. Highly recommend a visit

recent_reviews.author: Sasha Williams
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic fresh cakes including a vegan & gluten free option. Kind and attentive staff. Great antiques for sale including a few shelves that are all Â£5. Lots of local produce  in the farm shop, including their own meat.

pumpkin_patches.address: Great Briddlesford Farm, Wootton Bridge, Ryde PO33 4SA

recent_reviews.author: Ellie Wait
recent_reviews.text: Had the best day at Hirstys Fun Farm with my niece (2.5) and nephew (1.5)! The tractor ride, jumping pillows, maize maze, arts & crafts, and seeing the farm animals were all big highlights. The cafÃ© is great, tasty food, local ice creams, and we even took home some chocolate oatey. You can pretty much sit anywhere and still see your children from a distance, making it safe while allowing them some independence. We arrived at 10am and stayed until 4:30pm, you can easily spend a whole day here. Itâ€™s very well priced, especially compared to other attractions in Norfolk, and the staff are super friendly. A must-visit!

recent_reviews.author: loopylou1179
recent_reviews.text: What a hidden gem. Been coming to Great Yarmouth for years but didnt know about this place til now. A really lovely family friendly (and dog friendly) day out. Our little ones loved it. Not overpriced and just a nice way to spend a few hours and let the kids run free and have fun ğŸ˜€

recent_reviews.author: James Thorp
recent_reviews.text: Great for a day out. We spend an afternoon here. There are lots for kids to play on from air cushions to climbing frame. Could spend the day "just let the kids play and relax in the large field". Staff friendly and great setup.  Also have a round of "wellie golf was fun to"

recent_reviews.author: Robert Robertson
recent_reviews.text: Wasn't expecting too much, however the boys aged 7 & 9 loved it. Ended up staying for nearly 5 hours. There are clean toilets on site. Food, drinks & ice cream available. Lots and lots of picnic benches. Felt the price was good for the amount of time we spent there and how much the kids enjoyed it.

recent_reviews.author: Andy Ashton
recent_reviews.text: Great farm shop with lots of local produce, we also paid a visit to the cafe for a coffee and a treat,  the Manchester tart was brilliant, but we also bought a couple of steak and ale pies which were top notch. Really nice, full if meat and very tasty. Plus the bike shop attached was handy to have bike repairs and to buy spares.  Definitely visit again

recent_reviews.author: Geldrith Draco
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely lovely place. Full English was amazing, Eggs Royal done to perfection.
Doreens Black pudding too, who could ask for more.
The Staff were really lovely and nothing was too much trouble for them.
Quiet, peaceful Saturday Breakfast.
The shop is way bigger than I imagined with a great choice from Meat, Preserves, veg, etc
Well worth a visit, I know we will be back as its just around the corner.

recent_reviews.author: laurajean walton
recent_reviews.text: We stayed in the beautiful camping site next store to this shop and thought we would pop in and pay a visit to see if the shop was as nice as it looked outside, however that is not the case! Walking into the shop after less than a minute flies was visible and on the fresh products in the fridges, when we brought this up to the staff they said that itâ€™s that time of the year which is unfortunate however seeing the amount of flies on the products put us off purchasing anything for the bbq we planned on having ğŸ˜• hopefully next time we visit it might be improved with a solution

recent_reviews.author: John Grant
recent_reviews.text:
Situated off the main road out to Bridlington from Scarborough, Redcliffe Farm Shop is the one place where you can buy everything a farm can produce . Baked items are also available here. The shop also has a cafÃ© that serves excellent coffee. Cakes and desserts are also on offer for those with a sweet tooth. Carnivores like me will love this butchers shop, and you can catch sight of your future dinner just across the car park behind the fence.

Thanks to Eric, the resident butcher, the quality of the meat is of a higher standard than the supermarket. Like all proper butchers, he will cut your meat according to your needs and vacuum pack it for freshness.

This business also runs its own loyalty card scheme that exceeds the expectation of supermarket shoppers.

recent_reviews.author: Dawn Froom
recent_reviews.text: First time here and would recommend to any age group. Animals are well cared for and there is a good range of activities for children to take part. The have a pig race during the day which was fun to watch as the pigs seemed to be the ones in charge. There's a lovely woodland walk too.

recent_reviews.author: Tod Howard
recent_reviews.text: We visited for the adults only date night on a Friday. Overall enjoyable experience with a range of activities throughout the night including pig racing, meeting the animals and tractor rides. There was various food and drink vans and a live singer which added to the experience. Only downside was there was no sheltered areas for when it began to rain. Definitely worth the Â£12 per person entry for a different night out.

recent_reviews.author: kristie Steele
recent_reviews.text: We visit every year, love this place. Real value for money. There was  so much for the kids to do , a packed programme. The new barn is outstanding, beautifully cared for animals. The employees were brilliant at chatting with excited kids and answering their questions. Shout out to Megan who really knows her stuff, lovely lady who clearly loves her role at Monk Park farm. The farm has grown and the new wallaby way was a real treat. We have enjoyed the Monkfest and loads of free activities including archery, loom bands, the bug hut (Gary the happy snail is a star) then finishing with a foam party! Take a picnic and stay all day, this spot is fabulous for family days out x

recent_reviews.author: Phil Jackson
recent_reviews.text: Great place for a day out with the kids. Probably up to 10 years old. Our 5 and 8 year old grandchildren loved it. Price is very reasonable for a family ticket. Food in the cafe was good, and not actually that expensive compared to similar places. Lots of activities in a beautiful setting. Only negative would be the lack of places to cool off on a very hot sunny day. We survived though.

recent_reviews.author: Ian Jones
recent_reviews.text:
What a gem of a place!
On holiday for a week and needed some snacks and refreshments so we decided to call in.
Very warm friendly welcome on arrival.
We chose the Oxford Platter which consisted of the below listed items:

Large pot of tea for 2 with a pot of extra water
We chose the cheese scone each with butter
You get a little pot of chutney each and a generous finger slice of lemon drizzle cake each.

Cheese scone was lovely and fresh, same with the cake and chutney and cup of tea was lovely.

The whole platter was absolutely delicious! ğŸ˜‹ and for Â£5.60 per person Â£11.20 in total which we thought was amazing value for what you got!

We also purchased some Jam and biscuits from the shop ğŸ˜Š

Thank you so much for a wonderful afternoon.

recent_reviews.author: Neil Marsden Snr
recent_reviews.text: We called in on spec only to be told it is not dog friendly which I find very strange considering it's rural location. A group of 6 arrived as we were leaving and asked if it was dog friendly, when we said no they also left. I feel that the owners are missing out big time with their no dog policy considering there was no one in the cafe when we were there.

recent_reviews.author: Donna Greaves
recent_reviews.text:
Extremely disappointed drove 20 mins  to get there , This is no farm shop very misleading quality sign on the road . Oxford farm shop only Served cheese /fruits scones , soup , tea coffee . Few items to buy e.g biscuits and cakes pre packed . The tea room was not up to much but felt obliged to stay for a drink and scone
Felt very awkward as the person serving hardly spoke . A little bit of interaction was lacking wouldn't go again wish I'd gone straight to Berwick shire garden center instead of wasting my time here .

recent_reviews.author: Piers Lesser
recent_reviews.text: We stopped whilst on a cycle ride. What a lovely place. Home made food and biscuits. Delicious and filling. Good selection of home made biscuits etc. In the shop.

recent_reviews.author: emma killeen
recent_reviews.text: Amazing 1st time visiting brockbushes with my little boy. We booked in for an animal experience he loved being hands on with the goats, and feeding them. Then went onto the soft play for "little brocks" great area with a good selection to do. We then had a good look around the farm shop and ordered his a chocolate milkshake from the milk vending machine. Love day out!.

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Todd
recent_reviews.text:
5* for customer service - since my little girl was born we have enjoyed strawberry picking trips - this year it fell on my birthday- she picks the strawberries and I get to enjoy a strawberry tart after - thatâ€™s the deal. For days Iâ€™d been looking forward to that strawberry tart and I was momentarily disappointed when there were none on display.

Holly and Eleanor went the extra mile when they found a strawberry tart for me in the play barn cafe whilst I enjoyed a coffee with our new addition and my husband played with the kids in the softplay - birthday bliss! ğŸ“ğŸ°

It was a really kind thing to do - thank you girls! X

recent_reviews.author: Kelly Loy
recent_reviews.text: My daughter played in the barn she is 8 and loved it. It's safe and well priced. The food options were good. My kids had the family pizza and fries. There was a lot and we took our unfinished meal away with us.

recent_reviews.author: Katherine Ayres
recent_reviews.text:
My kids love brocksbushes whether that be the play barn or when the fun zones are on.
My son decided he wanted his 6th birthday party in the play barn yesterday and it was fab. Lovely separate area for the party decorated beautifully. Teas and coffees for the parents and juice for the kids. Food was really nice quality and came out in an organised and timely manner. Little gift bag for the birthday boy is a nice little extra touch. Thank you all!

recent_reviews.author: Mariusz Leganowicz
recent_reviews.text: Amazing helpful guys, ğŸ‘Œ and very quick , lovely place

recent_reviews.author: PÃ¼ski Henrietta
recent_reviews.text:
2020.12.08. is the date of my loading. I arrived with doubts in my heart, because I can already feel the edge of Christmas. You can't get lost! The place is easy to find. Although the entrance is bad for about a truck's length, the concrete road is good after that. I also saw a few nice agricultural machines that caught my eye. I would be happy to return here if they order me to load here. It seemed like a quiet, peaceful area. There are birds chirping nicely in the landscape. Unfortunately, the weather was not favorable, but this is typical in England. I had to wait for the goods. However, they were willing to meet me on time. They showed me the restroom and the dining room themselves. There is a nice gentleman in the office. His handwriting is extremely neat. His voice and intonation are pleasant to my ears, like that of a dubbing actor. They offered me coffee, while he turned to the technology without agonizing over the difference between the languages. Waiting in my truck, they knock once. The boss asks me to open the curtain, the show begins. The forklift drivers are skilled and helpful.
Then, after loading, the boss looked for a way to fix the fixing and did so.

Thank you again for everything!
See you later

recent_reviews.author: Gold
recent_reviews.text: The cakes are fabulous and packed with flavour they have to be the best cakes I have every had.ğŸ°

recent_reviews.author: Simon Herbert
recent_reviews.text: Bought some cakes for lunch while visiting Stanton Hall Plant Nursery. So nice we purchased more for tea time. Ended up spending more on cakes than plants. Excellent addition to Stanton Hall facilities.

recent_reviews.author: Lynis Byford
recent_reviews.text: Great tasking bakes, on time posting, well wrapped, value for money , ingredients and allergies labelled .

recent_reviews.author: Lesley Kinchin
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely place, visited after a visit to family.  We are not from the area but thought the shop was well presented.  The lady on the meat counter was not friendly and too busy talking to colleagues.  The steak we bought looked lovely but honestly it was terrible and not worth buying.
Sorry we support local and non supermarket but there needs to be a difference.

recent_reviews.author: thomas bosworth
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely love this place, Staff are brilliant and welcoming. They have great choices of all different things in there and all at fantastic prices. Highly highly recommend ğŸ‘Œ

recent_reviews.author: abigail hollingsworth
recent_reviews.text:
Spring Lane Farm Shop brought our wedding cheese cake vision to life. We cannot thank Sarah & the team enough for helping us with our wedding cheese cake. All of our guests loved it and I would highly recommend.
Thanks so much for helping us

recent_reviews.author: Ruth Findlay
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely place, always very clean and the produce is beautiful. The fresh orange juice is to die for ğŸ¤¤
Me and my partner often go here on motorbike and always end up coming away with more than we go for.

pumpkin_patches.address: Spring Ln, Mapperley Plains, Nottingham NG3 5RQ

recent_reviews.author: Jemimah Gillespie
recent_reviews.text: Great day out for the kids. Lots of things to do, theres an outside park and obstacle course, indoor soft play area with sandpit and wooden climbing structure, indoor bouncy castle with ride on tractors and death drop slide. There is also animals that you can feed and a tractor trailer ride to do. Food and drinks are available from their cafe and everything is easy accessible with ramps instead of steps.

recent_reviews.author: Jenna
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant place to go for the whole family. So much entertainment for children you would struggle fitting everything in. Also a museum. Petting zoo. Rides. Loads of soft play and interactive science area. You will want to return.

recent_reviews.author: Great British Map
recent_reviews.text:
Really good Farm Park.
Signage could be better.
Lovely staff.

Relatively small farm park, probably better for young children up to 6ish yrs.
Home to Welsh guards museum and a Second World War trenches set up.

The indoor areas; bouncy castle (unsupervised), basic baby soft play areas, ride on tractors all around cafe tables.

In the sheep barn; soft play with brick building area, sand and water play, archaeological dig, slides. Other wee entertainment bits like an Alice in wonderland theme walk through scenesâ€¦bit creepy imo but there for Easter as far as I could tell.

Rabbits, Guinea pigs, tortoises, sheep, goats, pigs.
Music room and a sort of science room which our toddler didnâ€™t engage with much - better for the older children with those interests.

Tractor trailer ride, barrel train all running v smoothly!

Outside assault course, play park, diggers x2 (Â£1), electric tractors (Â£1), shed/small house play bits, space hopper field, Iron Age roundhouse, pig racing, staff put on a fun rabbit (fancy dress) race for entertainment.

We didnâ€™t use the cafe much but we did get a hot chocolate, cake and ice creams - service was ok. Didnâ€™t really want to stay or go back for that tbh.

The staff with the tractor rides and the animals were lovely, couldnâ€™t have been happier to help and chat - working hard!

Found the layout a bit confusing and all seemed a bit â€˜add onâ€™, we were given a map on arrival which helped to a degree but in reality we went where we could around other people rather than studying the map. Youâ€™re sent through the museum to get in which is a long hallway in effect into the small animal handling area - an old cow shed with multiple doors off to various things but you couldnâ€™t really choose (it wasnâ€™t a v busy afternoon as it was wet) and just had to go where you could with a buggy.

Happy with pricing for one adult, concession and 2 x under 2. Might get pricey with older kids.

Seemed like a good shop at reception but you have to walk through it to get out (as always)!

recent_reviews.author: Betty Sioux
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic day out for all three kids. 8 year old and two 4 year olds loved everything about this place. So many things to do outside and inside. Food hall and play area were clean and tidy. Petting areas have sinks to wash your hands. Recommend this is a day out for all the family.

recent_reviews.author: steve
recent_reviews.text: Great little farm shop with a surprisingly wide range of produce. Fresh meat, veg, cakes and lots of drinks to be had. Restaurant attached with a nicely varied menu. Located in a quiet part of Shropshire. When I visited there was a polo match happening in the next field.

recent_reviews.author: Glenn
recent_reviews.text:
Called this morning with my son for a BIG breakfast and we wasn't disappointed.
I've got to say it was one of the best breakfast's I've had. I can't fault the produce, bacon was nice thick slices and the sausage were spot on. It wasn't the cheapest, but you pay for what you get ğŸ‘Œ.
The staff were polite and efficient.
Well recommendâ­â­â­â­â­

recent_reviews.author: Jamie Knight
recent_reviews.text: Visited here by chance as a member of britt stops and stayed the night around the back of the shop on arival we was met by Hazle and was told where to park up our camper. Unfortunately the shop was closed the next day as it was a Sunday, however the cafe was open so decided to stop and have breakfast before we departed. So review on the cafe, what a lovely experience indoor and outdoor seating with kids play toys on the grass area outside. Kids review 9/10. When entering we was greeted by a very friendly girl called Laura, who took our order with a smile and also offered to bring it out to us as we took the outdoor seating for the kids to play. Not cheap, but you can see why when our order arrived, it has only the best ingredients used, I have to say one of the best breakfasts I have had and was well worth the money. sitting outside with lovely views and a very peacefull setting, very little road noise and next to a polo field. Was a pleasure to be here for the night, and for breakfast could not rate this place higher. The food was so lovely we also brought some cakes for our travels and were served but 2 equally lovely girls called Grace and Sarah. They were fantastic with the children and we Will defiantly be returning when next this way. This is also very wheelchair friendly for the people that need this access Thanks

recent_reviews.author: daviesad77
recent_reviews.text: Lovely food, reasonable prices....try the butter buns.

recent_reviews.author: Peter Roberts
recent_reviews.text: Went on Saturday afternoon to see what the farm shop was like as we had been to one while on holiday in Devon. Well it's an absolutely amazing place and the quality of products are good. We bought several different meat products and had some burgers for tea and what an amazing taste. Looking forward to eating more of the products that we bought and will definitely be back to shop some more. We went into the cafe and had a bite to eat and we think this might be our new go to place. Fantastic quality and quantity, wish it was a bit more local to us. Many thanks for being a super special place to go.

recent_reviews.author: Kupo Kupo
recent_reviews.text:
Unplanned stop on our drive home. Very pleasant and reasonably priced farm shop. Friendly and non intrusive shopping experience. The quality of meat from the counter was high, while being very moderately priced (on par or cheaper than supermarkets). We purchased lamb breast (Â£5.50) and large beef marrow bones for making soup (Â£1 each). Good selection of baked and prepackaged items.

The cafe/restaurant serves excellent coffee with fast and friendly service. We had the steak and chips for lunch for approximately Â£15. Perfectly cooked. Great quality steak and large portion size. If we pass by the area, weâ€™d stop by again!

recent_reviews.author: Alan Drinkwater
recent_reviews.text: Just called in here for Sunday Lunch and it was stunning. Had a main and desert, both were large portions, very high quality and cooked perfectly. Staff were great too and the farm shop is well stocked with all that you would expect but with great butchers and cheese counters.

recent_reviews.author: Paul Passant
recent_reviews.text: We were told to visit by the Bike business down the road. At first we tried a beef joint that was delicious and tender. We live in Bridgnorth so thought we would fill the freezer for the month. The sirloin steaks were amazing. The chicken was so tasty. Today I have cooked the pork. It's succulent tender and tasty. I am so happy I tried you. See you soon.

recent_reviews.author: Diana L
recent_reviews.text: Loved this Organic Farm CafÃ©. Friendly team served us delicious freshly made soup and moreish Welsh Rarebit. Love the ethos of the business, only wish we were local to support the shop and cafÃ© on a regular basis. Thank you, we hope to return one day!

recent_reviews.author: Katy Plant
recent_reviews.text:
Omg I love this place. Our lil one is only young and he still loves it. The open space is just amazing and the cafe and butcher's on site is just lovely, I would visit everyday if I could.

Today we have returned again due to loving it so much, Today we did Ben's walk and I was brave and took the pram, we have an out and about one and it was amazing the only small problem I came across was the small style just at the end of the walk, but it was no problem as it was easy to lift the pram across.
It's such a beautiful walk, we also were so happy to see the little piglets.
We will be returning again soon.

recent_reviews.author: Esta-Jane Middling
recent_reviews.text:
We came here to do one of the walks and really enjoyed it. At the start you could see which walks were accessible and which were closed off, so we picked the longest available walk. There were no printed maps so we took a photo as reference (which as they said saved them money :) ) We enjoyed a slow walk around whilst geocaching, and found a lovely spot to enjoy a picnic too. The weather was overcast and showery so it was a pleasant quiet walk too! The walk was really well sign posted and we will definitely be back to do some more! Enjoyed an ice cream at the cafe when we got back to the car :)
Unfortunately most my photos I took on my dslr but here are a couple I took on my phone. My youngest enjoyed this area as we ate lunch!

recent_reviews.author: Cara Lougher
recent_reviews.text: Called in here on route to colehurst lake. Such a lovely range of organic produce (fruit, veg, snacks, drinks, pastries).  The staff were also super kind, offering to make us some burgers and koftas as they'd run out. These were both delicious, as were the pork and leek sausage and the Shropshire blue cheese! ğŸ˜ Would highly recommend! Thanks team!!

pumpkin_patches.address: Tern Hill Roundabout, Market Drayton TF9 3PS

recent_reviews.author: Abigail C
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful farm! The fruits tasted juicy and fresh unlike some other farms Iâ€™ve been too where it was hard to find ripe ones. Staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable and you can tell they take pride in the farm. I canâ€™t wait to return in the fall and bring more people. Such a lovely day trip.

recent_reviews.author: Elenka San
recent_reviews.text:
A nice farm! We visited in May for strawberry picking. Although the strawberries werenâ€™t very red due to the rainy weather, they were still really good. The farm also had a play area for kids, where we spent the whole day.
They had two sheep ğŸ.
Overall, we enjoyed our experience there.

recent_reviews.author: Inna Ğ¢Ğ¾k
recent_reviews.text: A beautiful and cozy farm, an hour's drive from Brooklyn.  Lots of fun for children.  Here you can buy food, ice cream, smoothies.  There are outdoor tables.  We were picking strawberries.  Very tasty.  Admission is $5, children's activities are $7

recent_reviews.author: Mohamed Nametalla
recent_reviews.text: Visited for the 1st time on 5/21/2023. On entry, a nice older man directed us to the parking area at which another man assigned us a parking spot. We bought tickets for the strawberry picking and waited briefly for the tractor to pick us up to the picking fields. Pricing was great and the fruit was delicious. All the strawberries were ripe, sweet and juicy. After that, we took a ride back to the main area where we bought tickets for the kids activity area. They had a bunch of awesome attractions and fun activities for them. By the time it was closing time, the kids still didn't want to leave, so that says it all. Overall a great experience and I will definitely be going back with my family again.

pumpkin_patches.address: 586 S Middlebush Rd, Somerset, NJ 08873, United States

recent_reviews.author: Nathan
recent_reviews.text: Impossible to come out empty handed! Thereâ€™s always something new to try at this fabulous farm shop. The range of stock is truly amazing; from the outside you have no idea just what awaits you, from the extraordinary gin selection, to local beers and ciders, snacks, cheeses, chocolates, every day essentials like locally baked bread, butter, flour and tinned goods, salads grown on site, sausage rolls and scotch eggs, a fabulous selection of locally made traybakes and cakes (you must visit the cake table!) and then on to the seasonal marquee stocked with wonderful gifts. And the staff are all so friendly and helpful. Donâ€™t pass up the opportunity to pop in to the Trading Post.

recent_reviews.author: Dan Goddard
recent_reviews.text: If you're a foodie like me and my husband then this is the place for you!  Such a great selection of interesting ingredients,  fresh food and alcohol.  Definitely worth a visit plus the staff are so friendly and knowledgeable

recent_reviews.author: Bev C
recent_reviews.text:
Had a simple but lovely lunch in the bus - which included a trip down a sensory memory lane with the 'Vietnamese iced coffee' or 'kopi peng' as it's called in Malaysia.
Always a great selection in the shop - was sad not to be there on the day the sourdough comes in though.

recent_reviews.author: Simon
recent_reviews.text: Great selection of just about everything. Lots of great local products and produce. The cheeses meat and veg looked good. Lots of cakes and pasties to cheese from too. As well as a refillable area of your kitchen cupboard essentials. Staff were really friendly and helpful

pumpkin_patches.address: Trading Post Farm Shop, Lopenhead, South Petherton TA13 5JH

recent_reviews.author: Paul Bartlett
recent_reviews.text:
Visited for Breakfast not a bad choice of food on the menu however it was quite expensive.
Our breakfast was almost Â£50 for the two of us, we only had one coffee one orange juice and a fizzy drink and the rest was food.
There is argument that youâ€™re paying for quality but you really arenâ€™t. The English breakfast is definitely not worth over Â£16.
The staff were very polite and we had a warm welcome.

recent_reviews.author: Carol Tassell
recent_reviews.text:
Excellent breakfast here.
Not the cheapest but worth it.
First time for me not the last.
Staff excellent and very friendly

Once again another fantastic visit and fabulous meal today. I had the Trough breakfast so very tasty.
Well done.

recent_reviews.author: Liam Mander
recent_reviews.text:
The Trough is a beautiful looking restaurant with unmatched views all around!

Unfortunately the food didnâ€™t match up to the reputation for my family and I.

We all ordered the aged beef with Sunday trimmings. The veg was cooked lovely but the meat came out extremely raw, even though we werenâ€™t asked how we wanted it cooked, and one member of my familyâ€™s food was so under cooked the staff even took it off the bill (after previously saying it couldnâ€™t be done. Maybe they noticed how under cooked it really was?).

Dessert on the other hand was amazing and definitely worth mentioning. I would 100% recommended trying them as they all looked great and tasted even better.

As for service, we werenâ€™t offered any water for the table, even though everyone else had a bottle on the tables around us. When we were brought dessert, which as I  mentioned was great, we werenâ€™t given any spoons to eat it with.

That being said all the staff were friendly and welcoming and were working hard.

Overall I just expected more. Everything from the restaurantâ€™s reputation, to how it looked just didnâ€™t match up to the food we had.

Iâ€™ve had better for less, and I think thatâ€™s a real shame.

recent_reviews.author: Tiffany Ng
recent_reviews.text: Lovely ambience. Food was well portioned. Food was average. Wings could be seasoned better. The fish batter was crispy. Pulled pork sandwich was good.

recent_reviews.author: David Morgan
recent_reviews.text: Enjoyable little farm, large play areas and tractor rides which were a massive hit. Not much going on with the animals on the day we were there but it was so hot that is understandable. My daughter had a go at feeding the lambs in the show which she loved. Good value entry, and reasonable prices in the cafeWould definitely return if back in the area

recent_reviews.author: Anna Z
recent_reviews.text:
We had a lovely time visiting Court Farm Country Park â€” itâ€™s a fantastic place to visit with children! Thereâ€™s plenty of fun activities and things to do, and the overall atmosphere is really family-friendly.

The only downside was the cleanliness of the toilets, which could definitely use more attention. Itâ€™s a small thing, but it does make a difference to the overall experience. Hopefully this can be improved, as everything else was wonderful!

recent_reviews.author: Pam Hill
recent_reviews.text: Always enjoy a trip to this delightful farm. Children watched the milking of Jodie and met two week old calves. Goats, pigs, sheep, emu. And a lovely play in the different play areas. Well worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Marta Skorubska
recent_reviews.text: Amazing place , not really bothered animals,  great tractor ride .Big play ground for kids

recent_reviews.author: jozzelynne Hughes
recent_reviews.text: Amazing place to take the kids! Theres something for everyone to do. You'll never do it all in one visit but its so worth coming back time and time again. The pictures don't say much but out of all the pictures I took these were the only 2 that didnt show my kids having the best time. All the staff are great, friendly, professional, kind, helpful and honest. The meals are lovely, flavorful, good value for money with decent portion sizes and more than just chicken nuggets and chips for the kids. Allergies are well labeled and staff understood dietary requirements, anything they weren't sure on they double checked with the chef. The site is clean and tidy with staff checking throughout the day. The events that are held there are always great fun for the kids and don't seem like they are thrown together like a lot of places do. Almost everything is included in the price. You won't regret visiting.

recent_reviews.author: Kim Ebbern
recent_reviews.text: We've been going to National Forest Adventure Farm for a nber of years & still love it as much as the first visit. We've been for various events; Easter, Halloween, Xmas & they always exceed our expectations. The play areas are fantastic & well spaced out so it doesn't seem overly busy. There is plenty for kids to do with outdoor bounce pillows, climbing frames, sandpit, go karts & and indoor soft play area. There's a big indoor animal barn as well as an area outside to walk around to see the bigger animals. There is also a tractor ride & barrel rides for the kids. Plenty of food & drink outlets with prices not too expensive. All in all a great family day out.

recent_reviews.author: Stacey Nagi
recent_reviews.text: family friendly fun day out! Took my 6 year old there and he really enjoyed it as did the adults! Getting to feed the baby sheep was nice and also petting the gerbils , feeding the goats and seeing all the animals was lovely! Car parking on site which is handy , lots of play activities to enjoy! Nice to see the animals food was well priced at just Â£1 per pot! Good range of food to offer and a fairly big inside play area for the kids too! For the price I definitely recommend!! The farm isnâ€™t too far from the train station either! About 5 mins in a car or taxi.

recent_reviews.author: A T
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant family day, loads to do included within entry price, safe and friendly environment, great staff really tell they enjoy there job especially the lady in with the lambing sheep today 26/4/25 what a really lovely person full of facts massive thank you to her just sorry we didn't get her name. Feeding the lambs was amazing for the children they loved it and great play area's around the farm, loads of animals. Well worth a visit. ğŸ˜ƒğŸ˜ƒ

recent_reviews.author: Colin S
recent_reviews.text: Wow!! Really impressed with this cafÃ©. Good selection of foods, reasonable prices, veggie options, great tea and coffees.  Lovely sitting areas inside and out. Cycle parking right by the seating. Appears a happy place well managed. Lot's to do for little ones, with an adventure forest, mini tractors, etc etc. Really enjoyed our food, well cooked and presented. Best cafÃ© we have come on in a week of exploring the area. Farm shop next door. Wish I could give 6 stars!!Definitely recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Forster
