recent_reviews.text: Beautiful gem of a farm, woodland adventure, sheep, pigs, ducks etc. Massive play area for the kids and the big kids too. Lovely cafe using local products, with homemade foods to be eaten or taken away. Lovely staff, very friendly and nothing was a bother. Picnic area outside with benches, seating or bring a picnic blanket and chill out on the grass, taking in the beautiful surroundings. Water bowls inside/outside for our furry family members too. The farm shop is visually stunning, well stocked with produce and it makes it almost impossible for you not to purchase produce. Farm shop staff really friendly and knowledgeable about their products. Excellent place for all, we will definitely be going back. Thank you everyone.

recent_reviews.author: James
recent_reviews.text: Our first visit to the farm shop and all I can say is what a fantastic experience. I went to the butcher for specific cuts of meat and the staff were extremely accommodating and went out of their way to help. A big thank you to Vincent and his team. Iâ€™m looking forward to my next visit. Highly recommended!!

recent_reviews.author: Tony
recent_reviews.text:
Shop had a wide range of local products and meat from the farm. Local beers/wine/gin, 3 for 2 on sausages. We think the meat was cheaper than at the farmers market so worth the drive if you buy a larger quantity. The coffee shop was excellent, breakfast meals until 12 then a lunch time menu. Range of all days meals, bacon roll for example. Bacon roll was outstanding, 3 large thick slices of flavoursome bacon in a soft roll. Childrens meals good value.
Lovely atmosphere,  busy but food only took 5 mins to arrive. Coffee good quality.
Definitely recommend a visit. Lambs, piglets, some goats and a forest adventure area which you need to book tickets for. Closed on my visit but will come back. Bring wellies!

recent_reviews.author: Rohan Marshall
recent_reviews.text: Said it is for pumpkin picking but turned up and all ofices donâ€™t come here pumpkin picking

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Dannatt
recent_reviews.text: A lovely stop for coffee and cake on my cycle about the lovely sunny Wiltshire countryside. The staff were a delight and the choice on offer was just what a hungry cyclist needed - thank you Planks Cafe team!!

recent_reviews.author: Neil Marshall
recent_reviews.text: This is a lovely little well stocked farm shop full of amazing goodies which all looked amazing. We were particularly impressed with the number of gluten free options. Definitely well worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Nicholas Green
recent_reviews.text: Lots of tempting foods. Excellent bread and baked goods and very good meat and frozen foods as well as interesting dry goods and prepared meals. Wide range of veg, though not always the freshest, maybe turnover not as fast as needed sometimes.

recent_reviews.author: Michael
recent_reviews.text: My partner loved this place! She wanted to buy everything! Quality well stocked produce and great coffee and cake from a lovely coffee shop! Lots of other little shops attached to mooch around too. Will definitely be going back!

pumpkin_patches.address: The Old Potato Yard, Lydeway, Devizes SN10 3PU

recent_reviews.author: Ivor Humphries
recent_reviews.text: We popped in here again to get some fruit and a few other bits,the shop is not very big but has a good selection of produce,from bread,cakes,meats and all sorts you donâ€™t normally see in a normal supermarket,and of course all the fruit and veg is organic,a lot of it is grown in the surrounding area,as Bromham is well known for its growing of its potatoes and vegetables,so if your passing pop in and have a look,there will be lots to tempt you especially the bread they sell you have a good choice....ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Kevin Pottle
recent_reviews.text: A small but friendly local farm shop. Always has plenty of pumpkins in autumn.

recent_reviews.author: Liam Pearson
recent_reviews.text: Lovely staff ,awesome customer service and very kind and always happy to help

recent_reviews.author: Khedara à¶†à¶»à·’à¶ºà¶»à¶­à·Šà¶± (é¾™)
recent_reviews.text:
Bought frozen chicken to find out theyâ€™ve gone off once defrosted.
Fresh vegetables and eggs were ok.

recent_reviews.author: alfie l
recent_reviews.text: Hottest day of the year, we run to the shop, which is meant to shut at either 5:00pm or 5:30pm, we arrive at 4:53pm and are told it is shut for the day, we can't buy drinks and die of dehydration! Really good guys ğŸ¤—

recent_reviews.author: Ivor Humphries
recent_reviews.text: This is a lovely little farm shop at the Lowden Garden Centre....It is well stocked with all the farm shop favourites,with a great selection of fresh fruit and vegetables plus a cheese and savoury counter with your sausage rolls ect,also a butchery department with all your meats on display.....There is along with the gifts,a drinks area with all the wines and other alcoholic drinks.....overall itâ€™s a nice little place to visit....ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Jameson Sugarman
recent_reviews.text: Peaceful and beautiful,  great food, either onsite or to take home.  We get lost in this great space for hours.

recent_reviews.author: James Currant
recent_reviews.text: Very poor service today, disappointing as we shop here regularly, today literally ignored at the deli counter, even when the staff member looked at me, I had to force interaction, however still very poor service, I returned all my purchases and left - how easy it is to lose a customer.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Rowdey Cow Farm Cafe & Ice Cream Parlour

recent_reviews.author: Johnny Clingham
recent_reviews.text:
Iâ€™ve heard so much about the Rowdey Cow, and it definitely lived up to the hype! They serve the best ice cream in Wiltshire, it was so good that I went back the very next day after arriving too late the first time.

Despite the queue for the generous portions, the staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming. The atmosphere is fantastic, especially for families. The surrounding area offers a lovely farmyard setting for kids to enjoy, completely free of charge.

There arenâ€™t many places like this that offer such a great experience without an entry fee. I highly recommend the Rowdey Cow for kids and families â€“ itâ€™s a must-visit!

recent_reviews.author: Jordan Yates
recent_reviews.text:
Now been here twice and I just love it here, itâ€™s such a cute little farm with a lovely little cafe. Ice cream definitely seems to be their speciality with the biscoff sundae I had being sublime.
I will say however the second time I went I decided to have some food and found the price was extortionate for the quantity of food and although it was nice will most likely stick to ice cream and milkshakes next time.

recent_reviews.author: Anne Woods
recent_reviews.text:
Very popular spot that is family orientated.
We enjoyed our lunch!
Staff are pleasant, and helpful. Our food arrived promptly, and was hot and tasty.
Was hoping to order Maccaroni Cheese that I had enjoyed on a previous visit, but sadly it is no longer on the menu.
Lovely place,with Peacocks round about, and other animals to visit.

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Lapworth
recent_reviews.text:
This was a meeting point for us for a family get together and having on site parking made it convenient.  The food was reasonable but the sun room was noisy. Service was ok but not great (we had to ask twice for the table to be cleaned and we almost went without paying because we were forgotten) although we did receive a warm welcome.

It was fun to look at the animals and walk around.   It's close to Caen Locks which is worth a visit if you're already in the area.

pumpkin_patches.address: Lower Farm, Devizes Rd, Rowde, Devizes SN10 2LX

recent_reviews.author: Eric F
recent_reviews.text:
My son and I had a lot of fun picking apples and plums today. There were ladders and baskets available. There were so many plums and apples to pick. We will definitely be back.

When you enter the property, follow the arrows on the signs until you reach the bottom of the hill.

recent_reviews.author: Matthew C
recent_reviews.text:
This is a real hidden gem. I was told that it was a big place but I still wasnâ€™t expecting it to be this big!
There are hundreds and hundreds of trees with a very wide selection of apples and plums to PYO.
It uses an honesty box system and the prices are really good value. Make sure you take cash as you cannot pay electronically.
There is a lovely area with a few benches that you can picnic at. The whole family are welcome as well as the dog.
You will find lovely views from one of the few high places in the area and you will look towards Cottenham and around. Itâ€™s great at sunset.
It is starting to show signs of overgrown-ness in areas, I think it must be a very difficult place to maintain.

recent_reviews.author: Eugene Krasnikov
recent_reviews.text:
We wanted to do PYO plums and found this farm on Internet. Could not reach anyone to tell us more about this farm. Decided just to drive there and it was right decision. Posting this review to help others to navigate here and what is farm about. We followed Google to the entrance but there was no clear sings. Just drive down the end of the orchard and you'll find a table with prices, collection box and also signs with name of the plums and apples at each row(see photos). There will be loads of punnets and baskets for you to collect but they are Â£1.5 so better to bring your own. While picking we met loads of lovely locals with dogs. Then we met the son of the owner Stuart who told us more about orchard. They have different varieties of plums and apples that ripen one by one starting from July till late of Autumn. We had plums "Victoria", "Yellow Eggs", "Avalon", "Pershore", "Greengages". Also we had "Discovery" apples. You can come to the farm even outside of hours so don't be afraid to drive there even if you are not sure.
Overall we had great experience! Lovely local PYO farm that is jus 30 min from Cambridge.

recent_reviews.author: Drazen Vulovic
recent_reviews.text:
* A Bounty of Fresh Fruit: As a working fruit farm, The Bushel Box boasts an impressive selection of apples and plums, with numerous varieties available as they come into season. Depending on the time of year, you may also find pears and other freshly picked fruits.

* Pick-Your-Own Experiences: While availability can vary depending on the season and crop readiness, the opportunity to pick your own fruit is a major draw for families and individuals alike. It offers an authentic connection to the food and the land.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Orchard Farm Pick Your Own Strawberries

recent_reviews.author: Ivita Aizbalte
recent_reviews.text: Juicy, sweet and very clean strawberries. I feel welcomed there.

recent_reviews.author: Raju Kochu

There  is no name board at the entrance .
so how can we find the farm?.if someone comes it is very difficult  to find entrance. Because  last week I'm came there. I was  struggled  to find the entrance.

recent_reviews.author: Omer E.
recent_reviews.text: Nice place. Definitely succeeded

recent_reviews.author: Lee Papworth-Boston
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely strawberries ğŸ“  and friendly staff. 5 stars â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸
Visited last year and gave 5 stars.
Visited today and there are none left and will be closing. Gutted!

recent_reviews.author: Nada Mourad
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm that we visited in August which had great produce and a super friendly owner. We picked raspberries and red currant and bought some jam as well which tasted amazing! The farm has a little seating area and some basic drinks that you can buy. Thereâ€™s also 2 dogs accompanying the owner and one is a great football player! Highly recommend if youâ€™re looking for a nice activity to do with your family.

recent_reviews.author: Carolina Seredenco
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful experience for day out in nature. Great location, very friendly service and amazing views. Gooseberries and rubharb it's in season now. Prices are great considering you can never get gooseberries in supermarkets in the first place. I would definitely recommend this great picking farm for families with kids and not only. Great wildlife too. ğŸğŸ¦‹

recent_reviews.author: sophie ridyard
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little place to go with your children !  The lady there was very friendly and helpful ahe also had two lovely dogs that my little girl loved. There was gooseberries, raspberries, rhubarb and blackcurrants. She loved her first exsperance of picking her own will definitely be doing this again :)

recent_reviews.author: Chelsea Ramsbottom
recent_reviews.text: Myself and 2 children thoroughly enjoyed the experience of picking your own fruit. We could spend hours here out because we love fruit and nature. Wonderful, kind and helpful staff.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Greenway Fruit Farm -- NOT PICK YOU OWN FARM !!!!!

recent_reviews.author: Steph G
recent_reviews.text: Graham and Arthur run one of the best fruit farms in the south! Find them at most farmers markets in Sussex for fruity treats

recent_reviews.author: Natkanya Pooratcharoenchai
recent_reviews.text: Fresh fruits

recent_reviews.author: Angie O
recent_reviews.text: As a family we got to enjoy our strawberries and raspberries from this amazing farm, which we have enjoyed making smoothies and ice lollies afterwards. Staff were amazing and friendly and there was a great selection of other fruits in the farm shop. Thank you for a great day out.

recent_reviews.author: Anna Roitburg
recent_reviews.text:
We are the loyal customers of this this family running beautiful pyo farm. There are plenty of berries varieties, season starts quite early. The stuff is very friendly and helpful.
Its wonderful place to visit with children.

recent_reviews.author: Jade Jeffery
recent_reviews.text:
I have 3 children with asd, mclauchlans were a very friendly polite and accommodating to our needs. We paid extra as we know our boys ate more strawberries. But they allowed that. There not many places we can alone our children to be themselves.

I may me more positive as I used to work for Angela back in the day picking raspberries while listening to my iPod nano. Very good memories xx

recent_reviews.author: Samiah SAM
recent_reviews.text: Today I visited your farm, and I was truly impressed. I tasted the best strawberries and red berries Iâ€™ve ever had. Iâ€™m visiting from the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and had a wonderful time. I also tried the homemade ice cream â€” it was absolutely delicious. I really enjoyed chatting with the ice cream seller as well. You have a fantastic team, which plays a big role in your continued success. I wish you even more progress and prosperity.

recent_reviews.text: Really nice place to go for a walk. A little bit of countryside right in the city.

Nice walk along the Grand Union Canal. With enjoyable views.
Perfect dog walking location

recent_reviews.author: Bernd Gauweiler
recent_reviews.text: A rough diamond in the rough, emerging thanks to many local volunteers raising funds and muscle power to transform part of the neglected River Brent island into a public fruit orchard and meadows for everyone to enjoy.

recent_reviews.author: Marcus Wolf
recent_reviews.text: Lovely peaceful place. Easy to forget you are in London, close to Heathrow airport!

pumpkin_patches.search_query: pick your own pumpkins Greater London

recent_reviews.text:
They grow fruits and vegetables in the orchard.

It is run by volunteers.

Not much to see in the autumn/winter.

Check for opening times.

Follow here and the IG link in profile for more travel and food and drink tips, ideas and reviews!

recent_reviews.author: Bartesque
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little vegetable garden with vegetables fit for a queen, ponds with bamboo shoots, lilies and loads of gorgeous flora including lavender and Allium. Definitely worth a visit. Run by volunteers, I think.

recent_reviews.author: Kitty Kitty
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful little garden with hidden gems in every corner. Visited in early June.

recent_reviews.author: Jill Zucca
recent_reviews.text:
This must be the most delightful garden in all of England. Itâ€™s run by volunteers who take great care in the upkeep and maintenance of the property.
I should mention, it most definitely is not a pick-your-own establishment. The fruits and veg are not for picking by the public. But I found there to be delightful surprises to entice the senses at every turn.

pumpkin_patches.address: Queen's Orchard, Greenwich Park, London SE10 9XQ

recent_reviews.author: Michael Pryor
recent_reviews.text: A lot of work has gone into transforming this old farm into lots of business units.

pumpkin_patches.search_query: pick your own pumpkins Isle of Wight

recent_reviews.author: Heather Macdougall
recent_reviews.text: Could be a lovely  location but itâ€™s not a poor attempt at a cafe , scruffy outside , no atmosphere, no comfort in the cafe , run out of products , track in and out not suitable for cars to pass and im use to country roads . I got the feeling the owners have jumped on the cafe cake bandwagon with no skills and no originality .

recent_reviews.author: Carmen Venn
recent_reviews.text: Amazing coffee, best on island,  lovely staff and owners, relaxing place and new restaurant opening soon.

pumpkin_patches.address: Great Briddlesford Farm, Wootton Bridge, Ryde PO33 4SA

recent_reviews.author: Stephanie John-Baptiste
recent_reviews.text: Good fun for all the family. It was a little muddy today, but that was to be expected with the recent wet weather. Plenty of pumpkins to choose from, all kinds of colours and shapes. Refreshments and portaloos were available on site and there were plenty of friendly staff members to help with parking and any other concerns. All in all a very enjoyable couple of hours.

recent_reviews.author: Chelsey L
recent_reviews.text: We visited a week before Halloween to pick some pumpkins for our baby's 1st Halloween, this was also our first experience. We will be returning next year! Plenty of parking and a huge selection of pumpkins! Plenty of photo opportunities, fair prices and friendly staff, food & drink available- making it a nice morning or afternoon out! As its a farm/ field Im glad we visited on a dry day!

recent_reviews.author: Alan Bull
recent_reviews.text: Great place to pickup some pumpkins direct from the field. Well organised, reasonably priced and even has a place to get a coffee. Great to support the local farmers and makes for a fun experience for the kids.

recent_reviews.author: Renata Nikolova
recent_reviews.text: Good experience - weather was pouring but heyğŸ˜š - staff were brilliant and helpful- pumpkins are best variety!! Overall 5 star ğŸŒŸ

recent_reviews.author: David Simkins
recent_reviews.text:
A lovely, family-run farm shop.  Great fresh produce, much better than you will find at supermarkets, and itâ€™s important to support local producers.

I always buy my eggs from here when visiting the area; great tasting and reasonably priced.  Really nice, friendly, helpful people too.  Definitely worth dropping in if youâ€™re passing by.

recent_reviews.author: Derek Gardner
recent_reviews.text: Top prices for veg that wasn't in the best condition,went in for home made ice cream and came out with Cheshire farm ice-cream which is very good but I don't think the farm had made it,the pace was quite busy and felt a bit rushed.

recent_reviews.author: Karen Pierce
recent_reviews.text: Great farm shop with lovely fresh produce and other ingredients cooking etc

recent_reviews.author: Matthew Wright
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant farm that my family have been using for around 20-30 years. This is the place to go if you want quality, locally produced food. Total respect for our local farmers and the great work they do!

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Pumpkin patch at shearon and sons
pumpkin_patches.address: shearon and sons, Coppull, Chorley PR7 5JB

recent_reviews.author: Gemma Sullivan
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic place to get your pumpkins! Not overpriced! We found some HUGEEEE pumpkins and had a great time too!

recent_reviews.author: Stella Nuttall
recent_reviews.text: Just got back from The Pumpkin Farm, we all thoroughly enjoyed it. 6 adults and two 2 year olds, all dressed ready for the heavy rain. The sun came out as we picked our pumpkins and the children played on the tractors and looked at the farm animals. The Pie, Peas and gravy was delicious and ideal for an autumn afternoon. After a lot of heavy rain the field is very muddy but we all had our wellies on so it wasn't a problem.

recent_reviews.author: Jane Armitage
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant well run event. There was lots of other things to do and see as well as the pumpkin picking. Great setting. Delicious coffee and brownies too.

recent_reviews.author: Jen Fish
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place, very friendly.Would definitely recommend a visit :)

recent_reviews.author: Katie Dunn
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic sunflower event, bouncy castle, straw pyramid, food & drink even a bar ! Craft stalls & an old tractor to sit on! Fantastic views .. fantastic day!  Canâ€™t wait for the pumpkins !

pumpkin_patches.address: GJV6+93, Barnetby le Wold, Barnetby DN38 6EX
Wood Lodge, Ermine St, Ancaster, Grantham NG32 3PY

recent_reviews.author: Wouter HAAIJMAN
recent_reviews.text:
Best strawberries we've had in years.
Lovely ice cream. Only comment: ice cream was frozen solid so we had to wait approx 10 minutes before we could eat some of it. However ..... it was worth the wait. Delicious.

recent_reviews.author: Krista Fitzsimmons
recent_reviews.text: We came here for a well organised. Pick your own strawberry event. It was fairly pricey. We paid 21 lb for a basket and two and a bit kilos of strawberries. However parking was good and I was still go again for the experience just maybe not as many strawberries But I think it still works out cheaper than the shops I canâ€™t remember

recent_reviews.author: Alex Templeman
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant experience going strawberry and raspberry picking at Sharrington. We decided to call in whilst holidaying in the area and the quality was much better than our local PYO! And the fresh fruit and veg on offer (along with other delights) looked equally as yummy. Thanks for staying open until 6pm to allow our son to enjoy some strawberry picking in the late afternoon sun :)

recent_reviews.author: The Peanut Travel
recent_reviews.text:
Small PYO farm with covered strawberry field.

You pay Â£2 to enter per person and then it's Â£5.99 per KG you pick. If you don't have a basket they will still you as many as you need for Â£1 each. If you buy more than Â£10 worth of fruit you get the basket (s) for free.
There is also a selection of pre pick fruit and vegetables at the shop near the gate where you pay.

CASH ONLY. No cashless option.

You can do bank transfers on your phone, which is what we ended up having to do as we didn't have any cash on us.

A little bit pricey for what it is, but the strawberries were very very tasty. Treat it as a novelty trip out and it's all good fun.

recent_reviews.author: Dale Smith
recent_reviews.text: We stayed at the CL caravan site for a week at Â£20 per night . Fantastic site with friendly staff .The orchard is open 10:00 to17:30 where you can pick apples and plums. The orchard has a bar where you can purchase beer, cider, coffee. Great walks from the site and prof wildlife

recent_reviews.author: Helen Laidlaw
recent_reviews.text: The plum picking was easy and not inexpensive either! Lovely woman served us and even offered to have the little rascal although I'm pretty sure she was joking haha!! Kids loved the experience and the ice cream, I enjoyed the quiet coffee while they swing on the swing chair! Pure bliss, not too busy carpark and toilets too...also had some stuff to keep the kids happy too! Thanks!

recent_reviews.author: Sharon Craven
recent_reviews.text: Loved this place. Stopped off by chance after following road signage, itâ€™s off the beaten track and well worth a visit. Leith house orchard is full of rustic charm, great coffee, and beers for those who prefer. Really friendly and caring staff.  Oh, and the fruitâ€¦.amazing how the same variety tasted different per tree! Weâ€™re definitely going to be back, now enjoying making plum crumble!

recent_reviews.author: Margaret
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely place, relax in one the comfy seats / hammocks, have a coffee, eat delicious plums and buy your holiday gifts (honey, chutney, jam etc) all in one stop! Oh itâ€™s so lovely!!

pumpkin_patches.address: Leith Orchard, Burnham Overy Town, King's Lynn PE31 8JL

recent_reviews.author: Ruth Crick
recent_reviews.text:
I absolutely love this farm shop! It's so much more than just your typical farm shop. I visit regularly to enjoy their delicious local produce and the extensive variety they offer.

Recently, we had a great time strawberry picking ğŸ“. The strawberry bushes are elevated on stands, which is perfect if you prefer not to bend down while picking your fruit. A.G. Meales & Sons farm shop also provides a selection of seasonal fruits and vegetables to pick, depending on the time of year. For instance, in autumn, they have a stunning array of pumpkins available for picking.

On several occasions, we've treated ourselves to a visit to Vera's, their fantastic cafe. The food is exceptional and all made on-site. I've also savoured their delightful afternoon teas, which are truly fit for a queen ğŸ‘¸.

They have a beautiful selection of flowers and plants in their garden centre, along with a variety of garden tools and features.

It's a free outing for the kids to enjoy the amenities, although we often end up purchasing something because their produce is hard to resist. Dogs are welcome in the outdoor area of the farm shop, which I think is wonderful.

All the staff are incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about everything they sell. This is my favourite farm shop, and I find immense joy even in just wandering around, admiring the beautiful plants, or enjoying a coffee at Vera's cafe.

recent_reviews.author: Helen Cunnington
recent_reviews.text:
Just had the most wonderful few hours with our grandchildren picking strawberries ğŸ“ raspberries and runner beans.  Followed by a great lunch outside but under cover!
Great staff and great fun...definitely worth a visit and the grandchildren loved every bit of it! ğŸ“ğŸ“ğŸ“

recent_reviews.author: dale budd
recent_reviews.text: This is a very nice farm shop, has all nice products in it, fresh strawberries, plums etc. You can even pick you own strawberries, plums etc too. Lovely cafe, clean facilities (toilet). Very nice staff too, 1st time I have been and will go again when I pass that way. Worth having a look in

recent_reviews.author: Tatiana Belousova
recent_reviews.text:
A very good place to come to spend time with children, to eat delicious food. Lovely kitchen and shop.
But I didn't want to pick strawberries, and I picked a little raspberries. I was a little disappointed, because the raspberries, although large, but without a pronounced flavour, sour even when ripe. Most likely this is because it grows in vases, not in the ground.

recent_reviews.author: Blazej Kozdron
recent_reviews.text: Nice place and beautiful surroundings

pumpkin_patches.address: Whilton Rd, Great Brington, Northampton NN7 4HU

recent_reviews.author: Aimee Van-Asten
recent_reviews.text: It's a small and open space, tucked behind houses and the A45. It's a natures haven. Birds, bats visit and there is 2 poads, and apple trees. It's a beautiful quite space. Not busy as the local park. A great space to wander, sit and visit wildlife.

recent_reviews.author: Paul Bainger
recent_reviews.text: Lovely spot, nicely tucked away - you may need someone to show you where it is!

recent_reviews.author: Ant
recent_reviews.text: Lovely visit

recent_reviews.author: Victor Frade
recent_reviews.text: Not to bad

recent_reviews.author: Chloe harvey
recent_reviews.text: Came here due to our usual yearly farm being sold out and this one was allowing walk-ins. Cheap entry price. Small farm but plenty of pumpkins to pick from with different varieties. Lots of small activities, fun for the kids and a place to get drinks on site. Wheelbarrows provided to put your pumpkins in. Fun for the kids. The only reason I gave 3 stars is because of the price of the pumpkins you pick at the end. Double the prize of what we would normally pay at (Malt Kiln Farm) for the same size pumpkins. Would have happily returned but for the total at the end to be quite high I was quite disappointed.

recent_reviews.author: Claire P
recent_reviews.text:
I absolutely love this place
I made my own wedding bouquet and after failing to grow my own I picked sunflowers from here
The staff made my experience they were so friendly and welcoming and spent loads of time with me talking about my up coming wedding
The sunflowers were absolutely stunning and so many
A big thank you again

recent_reviews.author: Ashley Pearce
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely love Sunnies and Spooks - itâ€™s turned into a yearly tradition. The play equipment is great for kids of all ages, our 18 month old and our 5 year old can keep themselves entertained for a morning - and thatâ€™s not even mentioning the entertainment of trudging through the Pumpkin field picking up every pumpkin as we go!
Great educational opportunity for the kids to see the massive pumpkins growing right in the ground - itâ€™s more than 50% of the fun of creating our perfectly carved pumpkins in time for Halloween.
Cafe offers decent coffee and cakes - and the picnic area is encircled by fun stuff for the kids to explore - the old tractors are great.

recent_reviews.author: Guy Marshall
recent_reviews.text: Took my grandson. It was grate. I think he enjoyed it as well. Staff friendly and helpful. Nothing pushy about it at all. Glad we wnt.

recent_reviews.author: Tom Shepherd
recent_reviews.text: We went picking strawberries, they were perfect, ripe and juicy. We have been to a few fruit farms over the years but this is the best so far. The field was well tended and the plants really healthy. There was also raspberries, gooseberries, blackcurrants and redcurrants ready.

recent_reviews.author: Reema Varghese
recent_reviews.text: Loved the place , best place to have family time. Fresh fruits and the place gives a basket to collect the fruits and we loved the time spend there. The couple were so friendly and shared their story . Parking and entry are free.

recent_reviews.author: Darcy Webb
recent_reviews.text: Great fun! We really enjoyed our visit here, the strawberries were great and really tasteful. They accept both card and cash and there are 2 sizes of containers you can pick from. We went at the start of august and there was still plenty of fruit left to be picked!

recent_reviews.author: Nataliia Sikora
recent_reviews.text:
Weâ€™ve been in the first days of July and there were strawberries, gooseberries (but still sour) and redcurrant and blackcurrant.
Strawberry- delicious ğŸ¤¤.
Price 6.75Â£ for kilo for everything.
Worth to visit!

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Holly Farm Garden Centre, Nursery & Cafe

recent_reviews.author: Neil Walker
recent_reviews.text:
First vist; planning to go back today for more!

If you are looking for a hidden garden centre gem; Holly Farm is it.  An extensive mix of plants to choose from; knowledgeble and helpful staff.  Prices are competative; certainly cheaper than the national chains!!  Took a break in the cafe, the cheese, tomato and chutney sandwich was lovely.

Our overall experience was wonderful and relaxing.

recent_reviews.author: Vivien Christina Pitcairn
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely delightful, so many choices and really good quality items.

recent_reviews.author: Sangeetha Priya Deepan
recent_reviews.text: Fresh Fresh and Fresh ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°stunned by their way of organizing stuffs. ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°

recent_reviews.author: MG Savage
recent_reviews.text: Review for the cafe: I'm sure the staff were trying their best but the service was horribly inefficient. Long waits for food and drink.

recent_reviews.author: Pamela Smith
recent_reviews.text:
Fabulous quality food and vegetables.
Gr8 service
They even stock potatoes from Cyprus so tasty.
Pickled onions in balsamic amazing taste
Good value.
Double up walk the dog across the road after the shopping

recent_reviews.author: Stephen o'dowd
recent_reviews.text: Very fresh produce but a bit pricey.well laid out.

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Woodward
recent_reviews.text: I paid my first ever visit to this farm shop at lunchtime on Good Friday 'on spec', and was impressed with the fare on offer and the prices too. A good selection of veg and fruit, all fresh looking and well displayed. If I lived nearer I'd certainly call again.

recent_reviews.author: Gavin Dooley
recent_reviews.text: I went for a can of pop but all they had was water.about over priced, I was thirsty and needed it

recent_reviews.author: Dani Hurst
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little place, loads of cute animals, good cafe with lots of dinner options

recent_reviews.author: N Banks
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely little farm! Much cheaper than a lot of others and you actually get to stroke and feed the animals. Our sons also enjoyed the little park, sand pit and an area they had set out with hay bales and various outdoor toys.
Food in the cafe was lovely and staff were very helpful. Will be visiting again soon.

recent_reviews.author: Vikki Hyde
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic little farm to visit with children- I paid just Â£2.50 to visit during the week as my daughter is under 2 so she was free. Also paid Â£1 for a bag of food for the animals which provided more than enough to feed them!
The animals you can feed are so friendly, everything is clean and there is also a huge sandpit with loads of toys, a park area, tricycles and a little play area inside the cafe so plenty to do! My daughter has barely stopped talking about it since and we can't wait to return ğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: Ryan Walker
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely  love this place, our go to place for a nice family farm experience. Perfect for little ones as its not too big that their legs get tired but it's big.enough to get a good range of animals in.
We saw the cutest piglets last week

pumpkin_patches.search_query: pick your own pumpkins Tyne and Wear

recent_reviews.author: Lucy Philipson
recent_reviews.text: I absolutely love this beautiful family run garden centre. I went in search of a pretty scented rose plant and they didnâ€™t disappoint. My beautiful roses have just come out and smell devine. Such a welcoming place with an array of plants, helpful and friendly staff and a fab farm shop with delicious double yolker eggs ğŸ’

recent_reviews.author: angela robson
recent_reviews.text: We haven't been to the garden centre for years. It appeared on my Facebook advertising a summer market so we decided to go. While I was looking at the market my husband looked round the plants. What a change from out last visit. The plant side as doubled in size and well stocked. On the way out we popped into the small shop and purchased fresh potatoes and double yolk eggs. All the staff we met were very friendly and helpful. We will definitely visit again.

recent_reviews.author: Amy
recent_reviews.text:
Great little gem, really enjoyed our first visit. Staff were super friendly and very knowledgeable. Didn't feel pressured to buy stuff either, which is refreshing! There was a craft fair on too at the time, which was really well managed. Lots of people and children, yet it was all set out and spaced out well, so it didn't feel crowded.

While we were looking at the flowers, a lady came over and gave us loads of awesome advice for our gardening.

Farm shop is lovely too. We picked up a few pieces from there to try, and we got some lovely plants. The young lady at the shop sorted us with a box to make it easier to carry home, as we walked there.

We took our dog along, and everywhere is dog friendly. Water bowls for the pups are available too, which is always nice to see. Everyone was very patient and welcoming.

Wrapped up the day with a cheeky hot dog from the stand out front and a sit at the picnic benches. Very good food!

We will definitely be back!

recent_reviews.author: Adrian Marston
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful garden centre, run by a lovely, welcoming family.  Only been twice so far but on my first visit I was given a personal tour of the grounds.  Loved throwing the ball for the resident dog!  Returned today with my wife and whilst resisting the urge to buy images today, we couldnâ€™t resist supporting this local business by buying some garden ornaments.  This will definitely be our â€˜go toâ€™ place for plants in future. Highly recommend people visit.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Jack and Jo's Plant Nurseries\ Fed & Watered Cafe
pumpkin_patches.search_query: pick your own pumpkins Tyne and Wear

recent_reviews.author: Sharon Kinninmonth
recent_reviews.text:
First visit on Sunday and it was fabulous.  The lady was very friendly and attentive, in fact all the staff were fantastic.

The breakfasts were incredible and the sausages were by far the tastiest and the most succulent sausages Iâ€™ve ever tasted.

We were made to feel like regulars despite it being our first time to Fed and Watered.

Dog friendly which was great too.

recent_reviews.author: Toby Collman
recent_reviews.text: Great customer service, was unsure on prices but upon purchase my daughter was gifted a free plant which really made her day and a discount when returning. Kindness goes far.

recent_reviews.author: Richard Hannam
recent_reviews.text: Conveniently located with plenty of parking. A small independent garden centre with a big selection to browse. Plenty of expert, friendly help available & prices are more than competitive with the big boys. Well worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Janice Kost
recent_reviews.text: Great place and tasty breakfast.   Lovely cheery staff.  Very busy and buzzing atmosphere.  Hidden gem.  Would highly recommend.

pumpkin_patches.address: Middle Hedgefield Farm Behind St Hilldas Church on, Stella Rd, Ryton, Blaydon NE21 4NN

recent_reviews.author: S&P G

They also have early eating apples to pick and will have other apples and damsons later on. Do check their Facebook page as they don't seem to maintain their website or Google listing very well.

recent_reviews.author: Heather Begley
recent_reviews.text: Wonderfully friendly farm with easy picking apples. The owner was so kind to let my little son play on the vehicles, it absolutely made his  day. Delicious cox apples!

recent_reviews.author: Lidochka R
recent_reviews.text: Nice cosy farm with lots of apples

recent_reviews.author: SFA SFA
recent_reviews.text: Very beautiful experience especially with kids!

recent_reviews.author: Pamela Brooker
recent_reviews.text: Amazing! Would highly recommend the pumpkin picking to everyone. First time we went and will 100% be returning

recent_reviews.author: James Davis
recent_reviews.text:
A wonderful place for family pumpkin picking, we have been going every year since 2021 and every year they is more added. The cost of the ticket to reserve your place is deducted from the pumpkin purchases. This year there was a coffee and cake truck which will likely to be a permanent addition.

Lots of fun for the kids with assorted live animals, a tracker to go in and hay bail climbing mound.

That staff are very friendly and welcoming, I couldn't recommend it enough.

recent_reviews.author: Steven Aley
recent_reviews.text:
We go here every year, a very well oiled place, cheap as chips and very friendly. Pushchair accessible (we have an OutNAbout so it's good on the rough) loads of pumpkins to choose from and cheap too! They have a stall selling hot drinks and snacks and hay bails for the kids to climb on.

One of our kids is autistic and this was a great place for her to run about and be herself.

100% be back next year!

recent_reviews.author: Josh Coatesy
recent_reviews.text: Every single year since this place has started they have gone out of their way to make sure we are looked after you guys are fantastic than you so much

recent_reviews.author: gaybrielle hastings
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm shop with fresh vegetables and fruit. Also, meats and a dairy case. Great stop near the Millhouse camping site to avoid the drive into the city.

recent_reviews.author: matthew burgess
recent_reviews.text: Visted yesterday and wasn't disappointed very nice fresh food a good selection and dog friendly will vist again soon

recent_reviews.author: Joyce James
recent_reviews.text:
What a lovely farm shop the young lady who was there was very polite and friendly.
Really good fresh produce we purchased a lot of fruit including strawberries, raspberries, nectarines, bananas plus bread & eggs.
Everything smelled so good.
Will definitely be returning when we're back in the area

recent_reviews.author: Alan Ford
recent_reviews.text:
Gwillams Farm shop is closed permanently and has been taken over by new people.
My experience and reports I have heard would suggest that it is now a very different place.
I went once and have not returned.

recent_reviews.author: S M
recent_reviews.text: Quality grown pumpkins right from the spot theyâ€™re grown. Low prices. Hot food and drink, hot chocolate delicious

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Farmer Fletcher's Pumpkin Patch @ Hatton Country Store

recent_reviews.author: Rhona Smith
recent_reviews.text: It went at a weekend with my husband and baby. Its ok, not much to do apart from pumpkin picking, have a hot drink/snack and take some photos with few props. Â£5 ticket for parking and activity however if your child is young then they won't be able to participate in the activities, so Â£5 for parking really. I purchased a pumpkin and was charged Â£12 , the extra large pumpkin price but to me this pumpkin was not extra large, it was medium/large. Can get a bigger pumpkin in the supermarkets for cheaper

recent_reviews.author: Carlota M
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic day out! Our toddler had the best time running across the field , jumping in a real tractor and playing around the barn!  Also, the donuts were amazing. We definitely coming back next year!

recent_reviews.author: Garry Weir

pumpkin_patches.address: Hatton Country Store, Old Greenock Rd, Bishopton PA7 5PB

recent_reviews.author: Rosangela
recent_reviews.text: Family atmosphere, polite and friendly staff. Great variety of farm products and delicious coffee. I recommend it.

recent_reviews.author: S Allan
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm shop and garden centre. There was no room so the lovely girl gave us a table outside the cafe. She was really helpful, friendly and attentive. Food was great. It's a lovely location and has a big children's play park too. Would definitely return if we were up that way.

recent_reviews.author: Dennis Smalley
recent_reviews.text:
I visited the Farm shop and restaurant  yesterday for the first time in years A really marvellous restaurant with a great menu. Cakes and traybakes are first class. Its not cheap but well worth it for the quality on offer in all aspects. There is a lovely terrace, perfect for good weather days overlooking a beautiful, working Dolphin sculpture Fountain. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Really great girls
I look forward to my next visit.3/11/24. Had coffee and cake selection. No changes, just  as good as ever. Well worth a visit.ğŸ¤—

recent_reviews.author: Jr Jr
recent_reviews.text: Would definitely recommend it.  We went pumpkin picking so much to see and do. Kids loved it . Done the tractor ride seen the Estate & animals.  After collecting pumpkins from Woods, kids went to the place to carve them. Lots of activities outdoors and soft play indoors was great.

recent_reviews.author: Cheryl Mcgarry
recent_reviews.text: Was here last Monday very pleasantly surprised...Very picturesque, staff really friendly... got a shot of the master blaster and 10 pumpkins all different shapes and sizes for a very good price, will be back next year :)

recent_reviews.author: jd
recent_reviews.text: This was such a cute and fun day out at St Abbs. Make sure and check it out when Halloween rolls around. I love how much they love the whole Thor thing. Long Live New Asgard.

recent_reviews.author: M M
recent_reviews.text: Amazing attraction for entire range of ages. Cute wee town of St Abbs beside.

recent_reviews.author: Blaine walton
recent_reviews.text:
Best pumpkin patch around!

The variety of pumpkins is second to none and staff are lovely too!

pumpkin_patches.address: Northfield farm, St Abbs, Eyemouth TD14 5QF

recent_reviews.author: Jasmin R
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely magical experience! The highland cow farm tour led by Queenie was truly the highlight of my trip. Queenie is such a warm, kind, and engaging person - instantly making you feel at home. Sheâ€™s full of incredible stories and deep knowledge about the land, the cows, and the history of the area, and listening to her felt like chatting with an old friend.

The Highland cows were, of course, the stars of the show - so majestic and gentle, and we were even lucky enough to see a baby! Just being in their presence was special, but to see them against the stunning backdrop of the Scottish Highlands was honestly breathtaking. The scenery alone is worth the visit, but adding in the cows and the warmth of our host made it unforgettable.

I left feeling full of joy and gratitude to have experienced such a unique and beautiful place. If youâ€™re anywhere nearby, do not miss this. Itâ€™s more than just a farm tour - itâ€™s a truly memorable experience.

recent_reviews.author: Lynn Mason
recent_reviews.text:
â­ï¸ Unforgettable Highland Cow Experience!

Visiting Cladich  was the highlight of our daughterâ€™s Scottish holiday! Meeting the gorgeous Highland cows and learning from Queenieâ€”whoâ€™s an absolute expertâ€”was amazing. It was fun, educational, and truly authentic. Weâ€™ll never forget it! Highly recommend this experience to anyone wanting a true taste of farm life in Scottish Highlands . Thank you, Queenie!

recent_reviews.author: Steve Brown
recent_reviews.text: Went on a Highland cow tour with the lovely Queenie. Very informative, she really does know her coos ğŸ¤£ Amazing views from the pastures and we're able to comb the cows and get close to the calves. Lovely cup of tea and a piece of cake at the end. Worth every penny.

recent_reviews.author: Cindy Young
recent_reviews.text: Wasnâ€™t open when I was there. I drove from Montrose only to find he was away. I did meet a lovely highland coo at his fence. Super friendly. I learned that highland coos all used to be black many years ago

recent_reviews.author: Vikas Jain
recent_reviews.text:
Beautiful place for a day out with kids, not so far from glasgow, they have huge parking, very different kinda of kids play and entertainment like bouncy castles, toy train rides, boat ride, mini tractors , bike ride , big slides, zip lines etc. Also animals like llama, deer, kangaroo are the main attractions.
Although it has the fee around 17 pounds, but worth it.
Point to be noted that, many of the rides like train , boat, truck etc are not free or included in entry fee, need to pay separately.

recent_reviews.author: Ben Hanson
recent_reviews.text:
Nice collection of kid-friendly animals (no big safari-style animals it's a bit smaller-scale than that). Some of the cages looked like they could have been a bit bigger but the animals looked in good condition at least.
Plenty of indoor and outdoor play options and good cafes.
Friendly staff and atmosphere all round.

recent_reviews.author: Laura Fleming
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely love this place for a day out. Go for opening so you can get the most of the day. Entry is expensive. I think we where around Â£60 for 2 adults and 2 children. It is well worth it though. There are so many animals to see and you can buy feed for Â£2 a bag. The goats are my favourite but there are so many cuties (including alpacas which are actually at a field at the end of the car park outside so if you haven't used your animal food at closing you can go up and feed them when you leave). There are multiple different play parks for kids as well as a softplay area indoors and a shooting game thing. We always pack a lunch so we don't need to stop to go in to eat and usually eat on the wee benches next to the big slides and bouncy things. There are go karts too although we've never been on them since kids are too wee right now.

recent_reviews.author: Marcus Strudwick
recent_reviews.text: A fantastic day out for the whole family! Hand feed animals, and there's plenty of them! Cheaper to book in advance online. I would recommend going as close to opening as possible as the afternoon got really busy. Not just animals there's plenty of activities for the kids like trampolines and adventure playgrounds

pumpkin_patches.address: Dunure Rd, Alloway by Ayr, Ayr KA7 4LD

recent_reviews.author: Ian Strachan
recent_reviews.text: Fresh farm eggs. See Brian for a good deal!!

recent_reviews.author: Laura Stirling
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic place to visit, bring the whole family, have a pizza, coffee and cake and go and hunt & gather your own Christmas tree. ğŸ˜ğŸ‘
Not recommended for indecisive people
.. you may be there a while ğŸ˜†
They have pre-cut trees - ready to take away - as well as gorgeous wreaths and tree stands.
It's a new tradition ğŸ˜ğŸŒ²

recent_reviews.author: Charlotte
recent_reviews.text: This year was the third year in a row we went to Duff Christmas Tree Farm to cut our own tree. Weâ€™ve loved it every year but this year theyâ€™ve really pulled out all the stops! The atmosphere is always really lovely but the stalls with coffees, pizza and ice cream as well as the little fire pit have really added to it this year. Everything is really well organised and signposted, so itâ€™s clear where you need to go to get your tree wrapped up and paid for so itâ€™s easy to enjoy the festivities as the practical aspects are all well thought through. Canâ€™t wait to come back next year!

recent_reviews.author: James Clark
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic place. All the staff were friendly, happy and very helpful. It was the first time our family have been to cut our own tree and we will definitely be going back again next year. An enormous selection of trees to choose from and the stalls selling coffee and cakes were great! Plus, the â€œquick standâ€ tree base is an absolute revelation! And thanks for the cheeky lift!!

recent_reviews.author: Marcin
recent_reviews.text: Amazing experience and fun to cut your own Christmas Tree and get help from wonderful staff! Excellent coffee and hot pizza as well!! Great day out!! Thank you very much!

pumpkin_patches.address: Wester Auchentroig, Buchlyvie, Farm, Stirling FK8 3PB

recent_reviews.author: Pots Cholent
recent_reviews.text:
Great park,  plenty parking and fair priced.
Kids absolutly shattered on the way home,  just way i like it to be. Guess it was the outdoor activities and dragging the seats to the top of the slides repeatedly.

Disappointed boat pond closed due to lack of water
And quad bikes also closed. But my kids still had a blast without so 5*

recent_reviews.author: ZoÃ« Neill
recent_reviews.text:
Honestly, one of, if not, THE best open farm we have ever visited across Ireland and Scotland!

Loads of space, amazing cafe, plenty of opportunities to get up close and personal with the animals and loads of activities for the kids.

We loved it and highly recommend a visit for young and old!

recent_reviews.author: Chris Pritchard
recent_reviews.text: Feed the animals, hold rabbits.and guinea pigs. Lots to keep young and older kids occupied. Plenty of benches for picnic use. We had an excellent day

recent_reviews.author: Sharon Thirlwell
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic place for both kids and adults. Much cheaper than most similar places. Staff are very friendly and always seem to be happy to answer any questions. Amazing scenery, fun things to do, could easily spend the whole day here! Lots of slides, tobogins, play park, bouncy pillows, go carts, hay barn, trampolines and a little train ride which you can go on more than once.
Fed lots of animals, there was a petting session with guinea pigs, rabbits and ferrets and then kids fed milk to the baby lambs. They loved it! Just be aware that some animals, (a goat in our case) are very clever, and whilst you feed another animal they grab the feed bag out of your hands ğŸ¤£ All very funny though. Oh and there's a lovely cafe and delicious ice cream to end your day off. Perfect day, thanks we will be back again when next in Scotland! ğŸ˜ğŸ‘

pumpkin_patches.address: The Glen Farm, Gatehouse of Fleet DG7 2HG

recent_reviews.author: Billy King
recent_reviews.text: I was delivering animal feed

recent_reviews.author: Genevieve Matthews
recent_reviews.text: Stouslie farm shop is wonderful, very cute set up with picnic booths and fabulous produce. You can refill your bottle with home made milkshakes, sit and have coffee, cake and ice-cream, then come away with some proper food! Only about a mile and a half from Hawick town centre with a beautiful walk and plenty of parking. Staff are extremely friendly and polite. A great place to stop and have lunch.

recent_reviews.author: Mary Webster
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm shop.

recent_reviews.author: Gillian Campbell
recent_reviews.text: Great little day out at Stouslie Farm! Staff were fantastic and you can tell how much effort has been put in to this.

recent_reviews.author: Marcel Doornbos
recent_reviews.text: Excellent family-friendly day out, great facilities, good fun and high quality farm produce available to buy

recent_reviews.author: David Shepherd
recent_reviews.text: Awesome. Best dairy farm in the country.

recent_reviews.author: Orra Clyesdale
recent_reviews.text: What a fantastic place took me back in time.

recent_reviews.author: Suebo Hemmings
recent_reviews.text:
What a beautiful place, with a wonderful manager and staff. Accommodating, friendly, helpful and polite.. .
Excellent views from the cafe,  very accessible and FREE PARKING

recent_reviews.author: Shane McDonald
recent_reviews.text: This is a must stop location, we saw it on the road as we were approaching and we stopped over and we enjoyed a lovely cheese going and a cup of tea and it was the ideal of stuff of point for a long journey. Also, we got some products in the farm shop as well and these fruits were really top quality. We had the best raspberries is the best strawberries. I highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: A4A art for architecture
recent_reviews.text:
I had not been to the Dowhill restaurant, very local to me, for a while because it was not a great place since Covid times.

I was invited to the restaurant for a quick lunch 3 weeks ago by a pal. I had a simple toasted coronation chicken sandwich and salad - amazing tasting coronation sauce and a fantastic dressed salad. A lovely lunch so I was recommending the place to friends for such good, simple food.

BUT I return 3 weeks later, there were no toasted sandwiches on the menu under a new chef. I went for the new coronation chicken. It was completely different to the previous version, sliced chicken and very little coronation sauce, a dry â€˜rubâ€™ type of sauce, I was very disappointed. My wife also,  as no paniniâ€™s on the menu for her. We heard another customer asking where were the paniniâ€™s - they were no longer on the new menu.

I can not recommend the restaurant with its new menu choices. If I had seen a photo of the meal I was going to be served I would not have ordered it.

More positively the staff were pleasant and the surroundings lovely.

Not sure when I will return again to sample this current menu, a shame as this handy little restaurant is so close by to me.

recent_reviews.author: Barbara Martin
recent_reviews.text: I can't speak for the food as I didn't buy any. What I did buy was a bottle  of their fresh milk. It was delicious. It has been a long time since I have tasted milk as delicious as this (probably 'back in the day' (the 70s) when milk was delivered fresh every day. Highly recommended

Itâ€™s a working farm with over sheep, cows, rabbits, goats, hamsters, lamas and more!! a charming shop selling local meats, veg, and seasonal goods. Whether youâ€™re local or visiting the Highlands, itâ€™s a perfect stop for fresh air, fun, and a touch of rustic magic.

recent_reviews.author: jade montgomery
recent_reviews.text: Cracking place. Milk is lovely and fresh just like the other tasty treats available. We have been a few times now and like to bring our bottles back for refills when we remember. The collies are beautiful, the lady who we see around is always helpful. I've seen a review commenting on it being dirty....its a farm, don't go to a farm if you are worried about dirt. It's as clean as a working farm can be and we have never once thought otherwise. Please remember this is a farm, providing fresh product...of course it will look like a farm. I've also seen a review about the lack of paper towels and the unsatisfaction about the towel provided to clean up. I personally have never spilled anything, neither has my partner or friends when visiting. It's not hard to not be messy and it's actually nice that the woman has provided a towel for those who do make a mess. I've seen one review on the price... it's very hard to "accidentally" spend Â£20... very hard to accidentally spend money. Its very simple to operate and even has signs with very clear instructions if you do get confused. This place is a hidden gem. The products are lovely and well priced for the quality thats provided. Great wee place that is well worth the visit.

recent_reviews.author: col M
recent_reviews.text:
A Fresh Taste of the Countryside at Paul's Farm Shop, Leyland

If youâ€™re looking for an authentic farm shop experience that offers both quality and variety, Paul's Farm in Leyland is a must-visit. Known for its superb fresh produce, this charming locale brings the essence of the countryside right to your basket.

Walking into Paul's Farm, you are immediately greeted by the rich aromas of freshly baked pies, among which the steak pie stands out. These pies are crammed full of flavour, promising a hearty meal with every bite. The shelves and bins brim with an assortment of fresh fruits and vegetables like crisp apples and earthy potatoes, all sourced locally to ensure you take home the freshest fare.

But Paulâ€™s Farm offers more than just fruits and veggies. An on-site butchers presents high-quality meats, ensuring that you have access to cuts that are both fresh and flavorful. Next to this, a fishmongers offers a variety of seafood, providing everything you need for a gourmet meal at home.

Cheese enthusiasts will be delighted by the selection of succulent cheeses available. Each variety offers a unique taste of the region, perfect for pairing with fruit or enjoying on a platter.

The staff at Paul's Farm are as delightful as the produce. Their helpfulness extends beyond mere service; during my visit, they cheerfully carried my box of goodies to my car, which was much appreciated. This level of service is indicative of their commitment to customer satisfaction.

Paul's Farm can get busy, and itâ€™s easy to see why. It has become a beacon for those who value supporting local farms and enjoying high-quality produce at reasonable prices. For anyone looking to enrich their kitchen with the freshest ingredients and most delightful culinary delights, a visit to Paul's Farm is highly recommended. Try it once, and see for yourself the difference that fresh, locally sourced food can make.

On the plus side, the shop is reasonably good and reasonably priced, but the poor customer service is an absolute letdown. â˜¹ï¸

recent_reviews.author: francesca murray
recent_reviews.text: Gorgeous place, amazing food, family friendly as it has its own little play park in the bark. Beautiful scenery and there is always a family favourite with auchenblay park close by, as it has a beautiful park & waterfall. Fresh berries & fruit grown next by which taste delicious. Massive eating area with beautiful decorations & arches.

recent_reviews.author: Savana Sparks
recent_reviews.text: Nice setting, nice atmosphere on this special day, as always everything is uniquely delicious. This time I decided to treat myself to a cheesecake, which was divine, as always decorated with a lot of attention and love with the fresh fruits of Castleton farm ğŸ‘ŒğŸ’—

recent_reviews.author: Roger Dunham
recent_reviews.text:
We only went to the cafe. Lots of staff, who seem a happy lot, but no-one seemed very keen to serve us. We almost walked out.
Eventually we were able to order lattes, which looked great (probably most NZ like that we had seen in the UK), but which were so hot that the flavour, and enjoyment, was lost.
The idea of a dog-friendly cafe is great though.

pumpkin_patches.address: Castleton Farm Cottage, Fordoun, Laurencekirk AB30 1JX

recent_reviews.author: Lana Armstrong
recent_reviews.text: My ASN son loved attending Marieâ€™s sessions and gained so much confidence and knowledge with animals thanks to her passion for her animals. Unlike other farm activity places Marie actually teaches animal care and encourages independence where appropriate. Highly recommend for any ASN children and young adults.

recent_reviews.author: Amelia Birch
recent_reviews.text:
Went for farming in the field education with my 4.5 year old and 16 month old.  They enjoyed feeding the donkeys and pot bellied pigs.  We then went to the garden to dig up produce, and eat some peas off the vine.

Marie was so friendly and wonderful to chat with.  The 75 mins or so that we were there flew by, and we came home with more fresh produce than we can consume before we go back home to canada.

It was an â€œoff the beaten pathâ€ experience, but laid back, and lovely.  Thank you!

recent_reviews.author: Imogen
recent_reviews.text:
Found this place by chance and it did not disappoint! I have been on the look out for a locally sourced "green grocer" type shop this end of Scotland and was over the moon when we stumbled across Whats for Tea Tonight. Everything I could have hoped for and more!
The owner was more than friendly and welcoming; helping with anything we needed. We even stayed a little extra for the chat. Such a lovely gem of a shop and very much worth a visit. Will definitely return.

Currently making leek and potato soup with the fresh veg we purchased, for our tea. Smells amazing.

recent_reviews.author: Andreas Welz
recent_reviews.text: This place is simply brilliant if you are looking for fresh food sourced from this part of Scotland. The owner is a mine of helpful information, and most of the fresh vegetables seem to be grown by her. The provenance of pretty much everything else is well known to her, and the fridges and shelves are full of exciting goodies. Aside from local produce by the shelf-load, there are plenty of non-perishable delicacies (olive oils, cordials, jams, pasta etc.). We are on holiday in the area and have been in four times in the last week! We've had little need to look for the usual big supermarkets, being lucky enough to be staying in the vicinity of this shop, and it's open 6 days a week.  Among many things we found artisan cheeses, fresh bread, peas in the pod, Swiss chard, earth-covered potatoes, local dairy products, vine-ripe tomatoes, sausages, and even buffalo meat from Kircaldy! This type of shop is something all local food producers would be lucky to have nearby. The owner is a passionate advocate for and provider of the best locally farmed and produced goods that this part of Scotland has to offer. Oh, and you can pay by card - Brilliant!

pumpkin_patches.address: Burn of Balmakelly Cottage, Laurencekirk AB30 1UQ

recent_reviews.author: Brenda Blair
recent_reviews.text: Do not do strawberry picking.

recent_reviews.author: Lj Murray
recent_reviews.text: Lovely quality food and drinks.  Lovely staff, very helpful and kind.  Dogs can go to the decked area but you need two people,  one to wait at the decking while the other goes through the shop then assist the dog onto the decking.

recent_reviews.author: Trela MichaÅ‚
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic quality food ,served by lovely, very friendly ladies. I only popped in to buy some water, but I ended up staying for a coffee and cakes. The selection is very nice, everything looks and tastes just amazing.
A +++

recent_reviews.author: Julee Gray (JG)
recent_reviews.text:
Iâ€™ve been to this cafÃ© several times and itâ€™s always been pleasant enough, which is why this visit really surprised me.

We paid Â£36 for a small curry, a sandwich, chips, and two coffees â€” and I left genuinely hungry. The curry came in a shallow ramekin with clumped rice and barely any meat (one piece was just fat). I asked for gluten-free and was given toast instead of pitta â€” not exactly ideal with curry!

When I politely mentioned how much curry was in the ramekin, I could see the white under the curry  I got a shrug and â€œwell, you ate it.â€

What really stood out was the complete lack of goodwill â€” no effort to make things right. Most places at least try.

And for context? I live in Mayfair, where cafÃ© prices are not  this steep â€” but at least the service matched the cost. Out here, that balance is completely off. The coffee was good so a star for that, the sandwich not bad, but crisps (not salad and chips for example). You have to buy these separate.

recent_reviews.author: Emma B
recent_reviews.text: Visited here after a walk. Staff were really friendly. Really good with kids. Food was lovely. Toilets were clean. The furniture shop and food shop both had really interesting things in and good for gifts. Worth a visit

recent_reviews.author: Laura M
recent_reviews.text: Nice experience, we went to feed the lambs to the farm.  You have to book online, and you pay cash at the farm Â£5. It last 30 minutes. They explain you a bit about the lambs, what they eat etc and then you can feed them and pet them . It was very nice for the kids ğŸ¤—

recent_reviews.author: Carrie Malone
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic service, really great selection of veg and fruit and always so fresh. Had some queries about my account recently and it was handled quickly, easily and with kindness. Can't recommend enough if you want to support local business and eat healthier.

recent_reviews.author: Michael Smith
recent_reviews.text: Dont respond to emails or calls - had to raise disputes with paypal for refunds. Shame really as wanted to support a local business.

recent_reviews.author: D B
recent_reviews.text: This  farm shop was recommended to me because I wanted to eat seasonal fruit and vegetables. You can go to the farm itself  to purchase your fruit  and vegetables or they can deliver to your home. They provide an excellent quality of produce, which seems to  last longer. The vegetable boxes contain standard items and a selection of seasonal items, which means there's an opportunity to try something new-genius idea!

pumpkin_patches.address: Balquhatstone Mains, Station Rd, Slamannan FK1 3BQ

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Simpson
recent_reviews.text: We had a lovely family stay, accommodation was perfect for us, along with the quiet of the countryside and some lovely walks.

recent_reviews.author: Aziz MW
recent_reviews.text: I donâ€™t know what is this

recent_reviews.author: Johnny Nugent
recent_reviews.text: Friendly owners

recent_reviews.author: Thomas Mark Johnston
recent_reviews.text: Excellent farm that once belonged to Black Christie Irvine, his son John, and grandsons, Christopher and John Irvine. The latter Christopher founded Castle Irvine and Irvinestown in Fermanagh.

recent_reviews.author: sarah russell
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant loved it x

recent_reviews.author: Norrie Ritchie
recent_reviews.text: Spot on

recent_reviews.author: Coila McKechan
recent_reviews.text: I stopped in and bought a dozen eggs at the end of your road last week whilst in Ayrshire. I'm sad to say they've now all been eaten but they were absolutely gorgeous with such deep yellow yolks. Such a shame I live in Glasgow as I would quite happily eat these eggs every day. My supermarket eggs are no comparison!

recent_reviews.author: Allan Sandford
recent_reviews.text: I always buy your eggs from my local shop in Patna,  Delicious and proper eggs! ( nice hard shells) , Definitely not the intensive farmed eggs from mainstream supermarkets, ( which are tasteless,  quantity not quality), Looking forward to more eggs from Auchenroy Farm,

recent_reviews.author: Kristan Monarch
recent_reviews.text: I was only providing fibre,  but customer pleasant and eggs looked fresh

recent_reviews.author: Amie Gault
recent_reviews.text: Great wee place  for buy fresh eggs from

recent_reviews.author: Kasia S
recent_reviews.text: Lovely meat, fresh and tasty. Very friendly  Family xx

recent_reviews.author: Orra Clyesdale
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic free range meat. Would highly recommend.

pumpkin_patches.address: East Mosside Farm Fiveways, Hurlford KA1 5JR

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Hayes Garden Land & Hayes of Symington

recent_reviews.author: Scotty ScotsMan
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely disappointed with the value for money at this garden centre. Weâ€™ve been loyal customers for years, living just a short walk away, but the prices have skyrocketed while the quality has declined. Today, we paid Â£7.35 for a half sandwich with a few tiny slices of beef in plain brown bread and a tiny cup of soupâ€”shocking for the price. To top it off, a bacon roll costs Â£5, which is equally outrageous. Enough is enough; we wonâ€™t be returning.

recent_reviews.author: Alan Dapre
recent_reviews.text: Quality cafÃ©. Quality items. Quality service. Eclectic mix of things for sale. A77 is nearby so you have to think about the best way on and off it, depending on the direction of travel. The staff really know their stuff so feel free to ask them questions about the plants on display. I really like their cakes in the cafe. Worth a visit just for this.

recent_reviews.author: Graeme Wood
recent_reviews.text: Excellent range of all things needed to make a garden look fabulous with such wonderfully friendly staff.  A great garden centre experience!! Not forgetting the amazing cafÃ© with an array of tasty treats to choose from.  Definitely worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Jean Hamilton
recent_reviews.text:
Great venue with a nice range of food in the cafe and good and quality service.
Enjoyed exploring the vast range of plants.
The toilets are a little small! Bagged I to a lady as she came out the cubicle and I was walking in the front door. Nicely decorated inside!
We will return. ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Derek Hosie
recent_reviews.text: Love the lambs.  Especially Muley.

recent_reviews.author: Lynsey Mcgarry
recent_reviews.text: My kids have there horse riding classes at salterhill with sharon and they love it. 10/10 patient understanding and always friendly great for all ages and stages of learning

recent_reviews.author: Leanne Morton
recent_reviews.text: The owner of this establishment is so kind and helpful! The decor is a combination of rustic/bijou and there is plenty of space. It's really child friendly and the coffee is super affordable. Great place for catching up with a friend.

recent_reviews.author: Johnny Groats
recent_reviews.text: Nice coos

recent_reviews.author: Scottieboyuk
recent_reviews.text:
Really enjoyed it here, passed it many times and never went in, until now. None too bad, just had a coffee, so no hassle and I would like to say the staff are all very young but oh so, so friendly and exceptionally polite, honesty they were all lovely!
That made our day, thank you!!!

recent_reviews.author: I S M
recent_reviews.text: Went for breakfast after enjoying tea and cake on previous visit.  Service was not good, no one checked if we were ready to order, and when we ordered a few things were not right. Asked for hot milk got cold, didn't ask choice of bread white/ wholemeal.  Ask for soft poached egg got medium to well done. Bacon was dry , butter had melted in the packet.  Had our breakfast finished and left and not one member came to ask if everything was OK.  The farm shop Service is excellent,  just the breakfast Service 21/07/25 around 9am.

recent_reviews.author: Robert Cameron
recent_reviews.text:
I visited Blacketyside Farm Shop while in the area and was absolutely delighted by the whole experience. I arrived via the back entrance by mistake, which meant a lovely drive through the berry fields â€” it brought back fond memories of picking strawberries and raspberries during school holidays to earn money for new school uniforms.

The farm shop itself is spacious, well-stocked, and full of fantastic local produce. I was thrilled to find Stornoway black pudding by Charles Macleod â€” exactly what I was hoping to take back with me to Thailand. I also picked up some beautiful strawberries and a delicious Highland brie.

The attached bistro looked very inviting too, with a great selection of coffees, teas, and home baking on offer. Iâ€™ll definitely be back the next time Iâ€™m in Fife. A proper gem of a place â€” highly recommended!

recent_reviews.author: June Davis
recent_reviews.text: Great outdoor seating area. Staff pleasant.  We were late in the day so hot food was not available. Cake range limited by then too. Would be better to refresh. Pricey farm shop and usual stock of sauces jams etc. Does have a butchers.

recent_reviews.author: Craig Paterson
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely relaxed experience. Kids loved it!
You get in beside the lambs and goats and they are all very friendly. Farm is also insanely clean and tidy for a working farm!
Restaurant on the other side of the car park is pretty good too

recent_reviews.author: Rose Taylor
recent_reviews.text:
Iâ€™m a foodie & animal lover. This place was a delight!
The shop is one of the best I have visited in terms of organisation, space, and variety of local produce.
Frozen & fresh section, dried goods & unique alcohols.

Bought home made custard cream biscuits, was a joy to find Lacto-Free shortbread, a variety of zangy berries with good quality chocolate.
Pistachio croissants.
Easily could have spent 45min browsing & buying BUT we had an appointment with some lambs.

Prices in the shop I get were reasonably as these are small companies. You likely donâ€™t want to do a weekly shop here but Â£30 on some treats or unique items to try is nice.

Lady on the till was very patient & friendly in explaining our lamb experience & to other customers.

We had an appointment little time to wander the farm & see pigs, chickens, goats & llamas before a group of around 14 had the rules explained to them & taken into a pen. We were given bottles of milk with corresponding numbers marked on 2wk old lambs.

Had so much time with them which was really lovely to watch them enthusiastically jump & bleat, be fed, cuddle & take photos and chat to the amazing farmer. He is so friendly & funny and great with the young kids too.

We could see the 2day old lambs with their mums in the next pen.

Facilities to wash hands afterwards.
Learning about his work, the orphaned lambs and cuddles was a superb experience to see how hard the farmers work and the cycle of life.

recent_reviews.author: Stephanie
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic place to take younger kids. The farm is so clean and well cared for. You can see that the animals are happy and looked after. Kids can go into the animal enclosures and feed and pet them. Lovely farm shop attached to grounds too selling beautiful fruit, condiments and meals.

recent_reviews.author: Steve Sklenar
recent_reviews.text: Had a lovely hour or so down at the farm with our grandson. He loved getting up close to the goats, pigs and sheep. We then had a wonderful lunch in the restaurant, great food, good value and brilliant service. Fully recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Arina StankeviÄiÅ«tÄ—
recent_reviews.text: You can buy strawberries from farm shop when there is season. There is an opportunity to pick and buy strawberries directly from field.

recent_reviews.author: Ivanna Havryliuk
recent_reviews.text: Very good farm!

recent_reviews.author: Ğ’Ñ–Ñ‚ÑĞº Ğ‘Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½
recent_reviews.text: The best one)

recent_reviews.author: Susan R
recent_reviews.text: Strawberries galore! ğŸ˜‰

recent_reviews.author: Julie Anderson
recent_reviews.text: I took my son here as the market was called off and they do really good cheese i phoned on the off chance they had a shop they dont but said we could pop up . We have never felt more welcomed my son has autism and adhd and they were amazing with him let him feed a lamb seen the goats and he even got to see how eggs are sorted and made a box up I can't recommend this place enough my son is tryin to get the cheese finished to go back again lol

recent_reviews.author: Linda Griffiths
recent_reviews.text: Love it - very nice flavours .

recent_reviews.author: Sylvia Sandeman
recent_reviews.text: Delicious eggs, great service.  Double winner.

recent_reviews.author: Carolyn Blackshaw
recent_reviews.text: Lovely eggs delivered weekly we are now adding in cheese and supporting local business.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Wheems Organic Farm and Campsite ( Book Direct For Best Prices )

recent_reviews.author: David Field
recent_reviews.text:
The campsite is a bit random and rustic and quirky, but it grows on you.
We stayed in a shepherd's hut which had a fabulous outlook, and was perfect for 2 adults, a 13 Yr old and a chocolate lab.
All amenities are there, and yes they can be a bit up and down with water flow, but it just adds to the experience. The kitchen/lounge just adds that something special the place (plus the curious chickens).
Rob the host was brilliant with communication and seeing to your every need best he can.
If we are back in Orkney we'll definitely book this again.

recent_reviews.author: Karen Wilkinson
recent_reviews.text:
Weâ€™ve just had a lovely stay in the self-catering cottage at Wheems. Itâ€™s situated on the edge of the campsite with its own sheltered patio garden and parking. Whilst we didnâ€™t use the shared facilities, we did get a tour from the owner and they looked great, especially the communal kitchen and sitting area for campers.

Wheems is well situated, close to the ferry and a half hourâ€™s drive to the capital town of Kirkwall. It has great views of the coastline and is just a short walk to the beach. We used bikes to get around and the roads were quiet, allowing us to enjoy the surrounding countryside.

Thank you to Rob and Vicky for your hospitality and good luck with the ongoing project, we are looking forward to returning next year!

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Jarre
recent_reviews.text:
What an incredible place.

I had originally booked on four nights stay then ended up staying an extra four night.

My only regret was I had not booked my whole duration here. When I visit again I will defo book my full slot here for sure.

Shower and toilets very clean, love the rustic feel this place has. Shop via honesty box which is cool. They have a washing machine to which is huge and again run of honesty box.
