I really loved the pizza oven they have here and I actually made some pizzas to. Pop some wood in and give this a try and make some fun memories.

The kitchen had a microwave and air fryer and all the utensils you need. Along with a huge fridge and a separate fridge and freezer.

The communal space is brilliant with a dining area and a lounge which you can pop some logs on the fire if you wish to.

Love the chicken which roam freely which I bonded with along with the pet cat. Honestly there nothing not to like about this place, it feels like home.

I could quite easily sell up shop so to speak and go and live here it's amazing. The beach is a stroll away along with a brilliant restaurant and shops locally.

The guys who run this place are so nice and friendly they should be so proud of there development its beautiful just like them!

recent_reviews.author: Adrian Dobson
recent_reviews.text: We very much enjoyed our stay at Wheems despite storm winds which threatened to demolish our tent. Being able to move into a pod for three nights definitely saved our holiday. Thank you, Rob! The communal cooking and seating areas gave us opportunities to meet, chat and share experiences with some lovely people. We also appreciated the cleanliness and tidiness, as well as all the plants, birds and natural materials which provide interest and a feeling of being constantly close to nature. The atmosphere that Rob and Vicky have created is homely and, on the whole, their guests respond very positively to this. The fledging starling family was a constant source of delight. I hope they continue to enjoy their nesting facilities for many years to come.

recent_reviews.author: kocourek 4e RE
recent_reviews.text: All fine

pumpkin_patches.address: 1 Morridgehall Farm Cottages, St Boswells, Melrose TD6 0EY

recent_reviews.author: R M
recent_reviews.text: Great place to go fruit picking. Well sign posted and easy to find. The cafe was lovely and everyone was friendly. I love that there was no cost to park or visit, a rarity these days. Everything was well thought out and organised. My children had the best time and were so pleased with their strawberry haul. It was towards the end of the strawberry season but we had some luck hunting for them which was fun. Would definitely come back.

recent_reviews.author: Vamsi Gali
recent_reviews.text: Great farm, well signposted and easy to pick the berries. Loads of tasty fruit. Highly recommend the place!

recent_reviews.author: Gemma Twinning
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful PYO site, staff really helpful and friendly. Kids had a wonderful time and the produce just so tasty. Such a reasonable price. Will definitely be back

recent_reviews.author: Joseph Shambrook
recent_reviews.text: Really good and way better than what I expected. Loads of space, chill atmosphere, friendly people and plenty of fruit to pick. Way better than anywhere near Edinburgh.

recent_reviews.author: Ron Bailey
recent_reviews.text: Great location for a Shetland holiday. Beautiful views from the farmhouse size kitchen and big living room with log burner.  Super sized rooms with all amenities. Voe is a charming little harbour town with a brilliant bakery practically next door to the Picking shed.

recent_reviews.author: Julie Rickards
recent_reviews.text: If you are looking for a modern, minamalistic property, this is not for you!  I loved it because it had character and was quirky.  It is spacious with 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms (offering the option of both a shower and a bath), a large kitchen, with plenty of utensils and saucepans, etc, with table and sofa and a good sized living room also with a table.  Handy utility room with washing mchine and tumble drier. Plenty of room for a family to spread out. We found it very peaceful and the beds were very comfortable. Books and games are provided.  There is a wood burning stove in the living room for you to use but the cottage is very warm and we couldn't have had the stove going too!  Around the cottage you will find paintings and ceramics all done by the highly talented landlord, we bought a couple of the ceramic birds. There is parking next to the cottage for one car.  Views are superb over Voe pier and bay. Wifi is provided and is good, phone signal, as in all areas of Shetland, is hit or miss, I found making the odd call that I needed to make through Whatsapp worked perfectly.  There is a bakery next door that you can get your fresh bread, rolls, pies, etc, from.  Coop is around 10 minutes drive away in Brae.  Also in Brae is Frankie's Fish and Chip Shop and a Chinese Takeaway, can recommend both! It was a great location for exploring from and I would definitely stay here again.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Tattie Shack Farm Shop & The View At Monktonhill Restaurant

recent_reviews.author: Steve Galloway
recent_reviews.text: Tattie Shack Farm & "The View" at Monkton Hill Restaurant outside Troon is a local "fave" featuring a farm shop and restaurant/cafe with a well designed menu. The location is situated with ample parking and easy access, and the beginning of June marks a special time for those in search of Ayrshire new potatoes as the crops start finding their way to the shelves. Great find.

recent_reviews.author: Louise Crawford
recent_reviews.text: Visited today for lunch with family and was very impressed. We had booked for a large number of us and staff were very efficient and friendly! Food was delicious and coffee was yummy! Also pleasantly surprised with the dedicated vegan/vegetarian and gluten free menus. Wish I lived closer so I could come back sooner!

recent_reviews.author: Linda
recent_reviews.text: First time visitors, we will definitely be back.  The staff were very friendly and the food was outstanding and so flavourful, the portions were great.  I would highly recommend ğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: Mary Stewart
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely place and also plenty to choices from.
Outdoors seating and the dogs can come as well.ğŸ™‚
There are horses that are lovely to see.
There are also books you can have just to leave a donation..
It's worth a visit.

pumpkin_patches.address: Farmhouse, Monktonhill Rd, Monkton, Prestwick KA9 1UL

recent_reviews.author: Tommy Butler
recent_reviews.text: Had passed this location few times but never stopped off at it. Then one day me and wife visited the location. What a fantastic place with shop selling great range Scottish goods and Food. The Restaurant is great good choice food great staff. This is a real hidden gem.  Been back few times for lunch can tell you sometimes its 20 mins wait. well worth it.

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Underwood
recent_reviews.text: Great place for the kids. Feeding the animals and giving the pigs some head scritches was fun too!

recent_reviews.author: Ola MOLIK
recent_reviews.text: We absolutely loved our visit at Santa's Grotto and also we had lots of fun during the tractor ride . It was an amazing experience.

recent_reviews.author: Roberto Smillini
recent_reviews.text: Probably best to book in advance to avoid disappointment, as this is a very popular & very busy place to visit with family of all ages. On the day I went there was hardly a space in the car park, and diners seated at all tables, so glad I had made a reservation. The food was nice and staff were very helpful and friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Stephen
recent_reviews.text: John's humour always makes a visit enjoyable.

pumpkin_patches.address: North Mains of, Cononsyth, Arbroath DD11 3SA

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Murton Farm, Tearoom and Nature Reserve

recent_reviews.author: Kirsty Moore
recent_reviews.text:
A great family day out ... lovely walk around the nature reserve and lochs.. amazing scenery with lots of lovely view points especially on a dry sunny day!

Friendly tea room with amazing cakes.
Reasonably prices too.

The animal farm was great for my toddler! Loved seeing the bunnies, chickens and donkeys. Great facilities including swings, trampolines and toys to play with.

Would definitely recommend it for a cheap day out too .. Â£2.50 for kids and free for adults!

recent_reviews.author: lan Sturrock
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic venue for a birthday party. The facilities are perfect with lots of shelter areas if required. Don't want to say too much. You will have a great time if you book

recent_reviews.author: Daniel Went
recent_reviews.text: There is a really nice tea room here with good food, high quality high chairs and toys and books for children to play with while they're waiting for their order. The farm itself is nice enough but a lot of the pens were empty when I visited with no explanation. The playground is amazing though, with loads of things for children of all ages to do. We were planning to make this a quick lunch stop but ended up staying for much of the afternoon as well.

recent_reviews.author: DEWAR BARBARA
recent_reviews.text: Popped in for a coffee n cake....yum!  Lovely.  Later came back with family for lunch.  Very quick service.. despite the poor girl being run off her feet.  Lovely fresh sandwiches in a lovely location. There is an outdoor adventure type play area too.  It was a great day.  Thank you.

pumpkin_patches.address: Murton Trust for Education and the Environment, Arbroath Rd, Forfar DD8 2RZ

recent_reviews.author: Stephen
recent_reviews.text: Good quality seed

recent_reviews.author: Alena Cowsert
recent_reviews.text: My husband and I did the farm tour and it was incredible. Lou was so kind and a great tour guide for the farm. She gave a lot of great information about the farm and the animals. All the animals were so nice and loved getting pet. It was clear that all the animals were very happy. The farm was beautiful as well. We would recommend this tour to anyone who comes to visit the area

recent_reviews.author: Laura Scanlan
recent_reviews.text: Booked a highland cow tour and it was everything we imagined and more! We took a quick ride to the field with the cows and then were able to walk over and brush / pet them and get lots of photos - the cows themselves were so amazing and loved getting brushed, it was so cute! Afterwards we got to feed some llamas and see some goats before the tour ended and I even got a little highland cow stuffy (named Angus!) as a souvenir! The owners of the farm are the ones leading the tour and we were able to ask all sorts of questions about the farm itself and the animals they tend to! They even have tours of the farm for Halloween which Iâ€™ll be sad to miss. Couldnâ€™t recommend Newton Farms more, next time Iâ€™m back to Scotland Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back!

recent_reviews.author: Nhu Bui
recent_reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights for a birthday and did the Farm Tour and Highland Cow experience. Shout out to Lou for making it such an amazing and personalized experience, even arranging a birthday cake. Lou and Graham were great with the farm activities, they are extremely knowledgeable and open about their animals and their land. And the animals themselves are delightful and friendly! Highly recommend a stay or visit for anyone looking for a heartwarming, memorable experience.

recent_reviews.author: Johnny Farrell
recent_reviews.text: We did the highland cow experience and it was the best value, most immersion tour you could do! Only tour I've seen where you not only get to interact with the cows but also see the love put into caring for them. The owners were also incredibly helpful, friendly and flexible as we had some car trouble and needed to change our times! They also have a gorgeous cafe so make sure you get down early to experience it!

pumpkin_patches.address: Newton of Fothringham Farm, Inverarity, Forfar DD8 2JU

recent_reviews.author: Laura Fraser
recent_reviews.text: On entering Nature's Harvest, friendly staff immediately tended to me. I had been told about amazing cherries and plums by a number of people. Toni showed me where they were and I was given one to try! The quality was insane. I won't be going anywhere else for fruit in future. Extra helpful that they offer a delivery service!

recent_reviews.author: Aemy Henry
recent_reviews.text: Great wee shop, AMAZING selection of fruit and veg. Store cupboard items not to be overlooked too! Super staff - friendly and helpful.

recent_reviews.author: Roger Carter
recent_reviews.text: Popped into Nature's Harvest, lovely selection of fruit and vegetables, how wonderful to see and to taste the difference. A delivery of fresh locally grown mushrooms arrived as we were in the shop. We could miss the opportunity to purchase Chestnut mushrooms and Lion's mane and just cooked them with a spinach risotto, what flavour!!

recent_reviews.author: James Scally
recent_reviews.text: I just wanted to say a huge thank you to Team NH and especially Kevin. He took time to answer my numerous questions and was very knowledgeable about the products he was selling (and how to prepare and cook them to their best) at the Spring Festival at Loch Lomond earlier this month. The veggies I bought and the following stir fry was out of this world!

recent_reviews.author: Marie Purser
recent_reviews.text: Had to visit Drmmuir Farm for a lovely ice cream. I had a bueno Sundae , and my husband got a caramel sundae. My daughter is vegan, so I tried the new chocolate ice cream amazing. When you taste the chocolate, it tastes like a mouse texture and not too rich. Lovely. She also had the non dairy vanilla, too. We had the privilege to try it first as he only done the chocolate for the first time, and I would definitely recommend it. They also lemon and Lime sorbet. Staff are very helpful and service top.

recent_reviews.author: Dav Nathaniel King
recent_reviews.text:
Great place, loads of flavours prices are decent. Its tucked away from everything so driving is best but definitely worth it!
A park for the kids while you have a wonderful cuppa & enjoy some yummy ice cream
I went with my family inc 2 6yr olds & spent less than Â£50 on 3 sundes, 2kids cones, 2coffees, deluxe hot chocolate & 2juice cartons. We'll all be going back

recent_reviews.author: Arthur Milne
recent_reviews.text:
Very popular ice cream farm, great for kids. Also serves a nice range of savoury treats and very good coffee.
Only down side were the ice crystals in ice-cream indicating poor storage

recent_reviews.author: Shona Mcgraw
recent_reviews.text:
Gluten free bread and rolls available.
Best of all gluten free ice cream and cones also stocked.
Ice cream is delicious. Large variety available.
The staff are also helpful and cheerful.
I highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Joshua Tann
recent_reviews.text:
2nd visit date 18/7/25: Large room for improvement on the lamb rumps, food temperature (compared to other pubs), and the gravy which seems to have worsened since earlier in the month - seemingly watered down, extremely starchy (left a lot of starch on the fork!), and virtually cold. Please take note, and take action on this feedback.

Visit date 6/7/25: Great food and atmosphere, good decor, service efficient and pleasant. Roast meats delicious and crumbly texture. Improvements to the gravy thickness and roast potatoes consistency should be highlighted to ensure a 5* review in future.

recent_reviews.author: Hungry Dragon
recent_reviews.text:
Was booked for my 40th birthday meal.
The staff where very friendly and warm. Please looked immaculate and very inviting.
Online photos and website where really great to usw for bookings. Was a great atmosphere and would recommend going.

Overall a very memorable experience that I hope to repeat when we are this way again as we are from Skegness area so not local.

recent_reviews.author: MaryAnn Atkin
recent_reviews.text: Second time coming, The food is consistently good quality. However I would say service times arent the best, the first visit I understood as we were a party of 11, however  I visited 2 days ago with just my sister and my 2 year old and we were there for just over 3 hours with most of that time just waiting around swetting our faces off with no air-conditioning. The food is ok and staff are friendly though , and there's a lovely little play area for kids.

recent_reviews.author: Margaret Link
recent_reviews.text: The food and drink were phenomenal! The best I've had while on holiday! The wait staff were friendly and patient with questions. A lovely experience.

recent_reviews.author: Victoria
recent_reviews.text:
My 3 year old enjoyed this place. Really reasonably priced, no time limit and no charges for parents! The cafe was good for hot drinks and sweet treats.

It wasn't very busy as we visited during the afternoon on a weekday. It started getting busy for a birthday party at around 4pm. The staff were very friendly too. Would recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Matt Fisher
recent_reviews.text: Not bad for mixed ages groups of kids.  But a little dated on the kit. Some of the soft items need an upgrade.

recent_reviews.author: Chloe Collinson
recent_reviews.text: The staff were incredibly friendly and we practically had the place to ourselves. Food was tasty and an extensive kids menu on offer. There is a toddler only section but all of the soft play was suitable and very clean ğŸ¥°

recent_reviews.author: William Little
recent_reviews.text: Excellent place , plenty to keep kid's amused

recent_reviews.author: Siobhan's Journey
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant place for kids. Great indoor soft play area, big outdoor play area. Cafe has a great selection of food, food that we had was amazing. Kids loved the chocolate making. Definitely worth the money.

recent_reviews.author: Tommy Dickson
recent_reviews.text: Had probably one of the best days out with the grandchildren.  The indoor soft play and the outdoor play area were brilliant. The cafÃ© served amazing food too. Last but not least the chocolate factory. The kids loved making their chocolate using their imagination. I will definitely come back here even if the kids are not with us.

recent_reviews.author: dean kirby
recent_reviews.text:
The children did a chocolate making experience which they loved. Good value for the experience.
The place itself offers an amazing indoor soft play and a great outdoor play area too. The menu is lovely, great quality if a slight bit on the pricey side. Overall an excellent place to visit for the family.

recent_reviews.author: Veronika McCann
recent_reviews.text: Great place for family day out. Both indoor and outdoor playgrounds were good fun. Didn't do chocolate making as our wee one is still too small for that, but will be back.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Alpacas Of Scotland Experiences - Hannahston Alpacas

recent_reviews.author: Derek Semple
recent_reviews.text: Great day out. Angela who lead the experience was knowledgeable and very supportive of my niece who was a little scared at the beginning.The Alpacas are well looked after and it was a great experience walking them. Thoroughly enjoyable time.

recent_reviews.author: J
recent_reviews.text: Super fun if you're looking for something different to do! The alpacas are ADORABLE, staff are friendly and informative, and pricing is very reasonable. Toilets on-site. Great for all ages. Can't wait to come back!

recent_reviews.author: Kayleigh Wyllie
recent_reviews.text:
Have booked a wedding package and part of that included meeting the alpacas with our wedding party before the wedding.
Angela was very accommodating to arrange a time that worked best for everyone.
When we arrived we got an overview of how the alpacas would act and how we should act with them. Angela was super knowledgeable and passionate about the alpacas. It was great to learn about them and where they come from etc. would highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Leeanne Ross
recent_reviews.text: What a fantastic experience, great for adults and kids alike. Staff are so friendly. Angela and her wealth of knowledge on these beautiful creatures shown through. Answered every question and enlightened us into the amazing life of an alpaca. I can see how much these animals are loved and are so very well taken care of. An impressive farm under impressive construction, blown away by this wee place. Visited from Edinburgh for the day, great day out.

pumpkin_patches.address: Farm, Drongan, Hannahston Ave, Ayr KA6 6NG

recent_reviews.author: Sam G
recent_reviews.text: Visited here for 3 years whilst on bike rides. Stopped by for the first time this year and I am absolutely staggered. I can handle price increases,  but to charge Â£3.20 for 7 strawberries is absolutely outrageous.

recent_reviews.author: G
recent_reviews.text: Best strawberries around, easy parking right by the hut, and picnic tables if you want to use them. Fabulous!

recent_reviews.author: Peter Chalmers
recent_reviews.text: If you want the best strawberries you can get then this garment produces them. I hav never even as many because they are so good, I also get them from my fish man Marc ....best ever takes me back to when I was a wee boy.

recent_reviews.author: Michelle Mason
recent_reviews.text: Best strawberries Iâ€™ve ever tasted - no exaggeration. The vending machine is brilliant too. Easy to use and different items in each box for sale. Go get some you absolutely wonâ€™t be disappointed. If you are, Iâ€™ll take full responsibility haha!

recent_reviews.author: Mark Davidson
recent_reviews.text: We have driven past here, hundreds of times. Google said they had a cafe and a shop, so we popped in for breakfast. WOW. Freshly cooked, hot, good ingredients, lovely coffee and very reasonably priced. Helpful friendly staff. They bake their own bread/scones and cakes. A great selection. We would highly recommend this place.

recent_reviews.author: Lisa Currie
recent_reviews.text: Worst experience ever! Cafe was diabolical! 45 mins wait for cold drinks, stale scones, gluten free soup served with GLUTEN BREAD! Baker man crumbled his so called "scones baked fresh this morning" infront of my face arguing they were not stale. Was trying to video state of kitchen but was interrupted. One chopping board for everything, working in a kitchen that looked like a building site. Birds (ducks, peacocks) all looked i and neglected. Don't waste your money on this place!

recent_reviews.author: Liz Kane
recent_reviews.text: Just not the same anymore.  Used to be packed with people waiting to buy warm fresh bread just made on site.  Strangely there is hardly any bread now, lots of empty space on the shelves.  Iâ€™ve been coming here since 2014, maybe earlier.  But I just had my last visit.  it used to make me feel I was shopping somewhere very special.  Not really anymore.  Very sad.

recent_reviews.author: Julian Cruft
recent_reviews.text:
A nice lunch stop in the Cafe, I had the antipasti platter and my wife had the New York burger.  The platter was a tasty generously sized selection of meats and salamis with olives, pickled onions and three cheeses along with some salad. The burger was tasty and a lot meatier than some burgers.
The service was friendly and efficient and it was all good value for money.
We will definitely return if we are in the area again.

recent_reviews.author: Alicia Ormond
recent_reviews.text: Had a wonderful time at the farm!  The place is so well organized and I couldnâ€™t believe how close we could get to the Highland cows!  They were calving and there were so many babies to adore - the calves, lambs, horses and baby goats.  All so cute and our tour guide for the Highland cows today experience was excellent.  So informative.  Gorgeous farm location and wonderful time.  Made our trip extra special!

recent_reviews.author: Ed S
recent_reviews.text: This is family owned working farm but they open tours for people to come learn about the animals and what they do. The tours were run very efficiently and they were happy to answer all of our questions. I toured in May and there were lots of babies curious about our visit. The website made it seem like a very easy commute from Edinburgh, so if you are a tourist, know that is not really the case, but it is worth it. It is about a 1 1/2 hour scenic train ride and then you either take a taxi (about 50 pounds) directly to the farm or catch a bus to the closest town. If you are touring the cities but want a glimpse of the countryside, this is a great way to spend an afternoon up close to the farm animals. We were able to get pretty close to the highland cows and then could walk the farm to see a lot of the other animals they have also, after the tour. Thanks for a memorable afternoon!

recent_reviews.author: Marian Coppola
recent_reviews.text: My adult daughter, son-in-law, and I all thoroughly enjoyed this experience.....being city folks our entire lives, this visit to a working farm with those amazing Highland Coos was the "stuff of dreams"!  I truly never imagined being able to get so "up close and personal" with these adorable animals.  The calves were very curious, and one was so comfortable, that he laid down among us, for scratches and cuddles!  Fenwick was quick to answer a lot of questions about the herd, and very proud. The feeding interaction with goats, pigs, sheep, and Highland cows was also a lot of fun.....even for adults.  The ram was scary beautiful....those eyes!!  Keep doing what you are doing!!

recent_reviews.author: Jozie Jennings
recent_reviews.text: Our visit to the farm was the highlight of our trip to Scotland. Customer service was amazing all the way from initial inquiry, through moving our experience time due to travel delays, all the way to the end of the visit. Highly recommend!

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Highland Cows of the Peak Experiences

recent_reviews.author: B F
recent_reviews.text:
My daughter & I visited for the highland cow calf experience. Was absolutely amazing. The lovely lady (forgot her name) who hosted
Us was so friendly, knowledgeable & answered all our questions and more. We had a brilliant time and loved it. Then found out what an amazing Trust this place is & the lovely opportunities they give to those who cannot learn or work in the â€œmain streamâ€ which made me donate. Thank you so much for a great experience but even more for the amazing work you do helping others to have a purpose & to learn.

recent_reviews.author: Sam Pike
recent_reviews.text:
This is a must if youâ€™re a lover of Highland Cows! We drove 4 hours specifically for the Highland Cow experience and it didnâ€™t disappoint! The experience was brilliant, getting a trailer ride to the different fields where the highland cows were, getting a chance to get up close and personal to lots of the cows and getting to brush the calfâ€™s was amazing. Richard is amazing at what he does, he is friendly and full of knowledge. During our experience in one of the fields, Mac the highland bull and the Dexter bull in the field opposite got a bit noisy towards eachother and as entertaining as it was to all of us on the experience, Richard and his co worker ensured that our safety was top priority and that we gave the cows their space that they needed, it was handled so well and really interesting to witness.
We canâ€™t wait to come back and do it again!

recent_reviews.author: Hannah Whitaker
recent_reviews.text:
All I can say is wow , what an amazing experience ! Havenâ€™t stopped talking about it since , we booked the deluxe experience for my dads birthday as he is a huge fan of highland cows and it did not disappoint ! Richard was amazing and answered every question we and my highland cow mad dad had , which showed his extensive knowledge and care and love for the fold and his job ! Nugget was the star of the show and was so affectionate , even coming over for a fuss and a neck scratch and enjoying a moment with Richard ! We expected to groom them but for a calf to allow us so close and to enjoy it was a truly special experience!

Couldnâ€™t reccomend more ! Also on nice days like the day we came I thought it was so lovely to be able to go out to them in the field and groom them in their own environment rather than in a barn as the cows were loving a graze in their natural environment and a nice groom to scratch their backs and it felt much less â€œmanufacturedâ€ than other highland cow experiences !

recent_reviews.author: Jass Dryhurst
recent_reviews.text:
This was such an amazing experience.
We were a family of three(2adults,1child).
We did the peak highland cow experience, around 2 hours long.
We did a safari ride with the older highland cows and there beautiful newborns, even getting out on the field with them, within metres.
Then we met the 3 year old coos and then on to the mini moo, meet and greet, this was amazing, it was hands on, lots of scratches, grooming with 6+ highlands.
There a little shed by the mini moos that sell highland cow gifts (fairly priced aswell).
Our tour guide was absolutely fantastic, full of knowledge and easy to talk to and happy to answer and questions.. and Alfred the dog was a bonus!

On the farm they have a little area, of goats, geese, ducks, sheep, rabbits, guinea pigs and chickens to have a look at, however during term time the inside is closed as they use this for intervention for children who donâ€™t settle with a educational environment which I think it absolutely brilliant, giving them something to focus on.

All of over we thoroughly enjoyed this and will be back next year!

Thank you again.

The Dryhursts

recent_reviews.author: Daniel F
recent_reviews.text:
What an awesome experience living here for a couple of days! 100% recommended

Both owners are very helpful and will help you with anything!

Only 45 minutes to the isle of skye

Lots of stuff to do !  like feeding the animals or walking alongside the beach which is always empty

recent_reviews.author: Meghan
recent_reviews.text:
The animals need to be rescued from this "farm"
They live in very poor conditions with no enrichment or species specific enclosure requirements (perches, hides) and inappropriate housing sizes (the owl absolutely broke my heart)
The sheep are skinny and wormy, the goats feet are overgrown and yeasty, the Llamas fleece is overgrown and matted.
Also was told by a family member of the amount of Llama Cria's that have died on the property from various reasons including being hit by the train.
Very very poor considering how much money they make from this property.
Don't get me started on the attitudes of the owner Patti and her family members.
Please do not put money in their pockets - it is NOT going to the animals.

recent_reviews.author: Benedict Cave
recent_reviews.text:
I first came to Craig a couple years ago and stayed in the Top Lodge. This time I brought a friend and stayed in the Small Lodge. Both times were delightful and I look forward to visiting again. The farm covers a beach, a railway bridge, and acres of sometimes step hillside and looks after loads of animals. Our favourite were the llamas and the cows. We even saw wild pine martens in the evening! The lodges have wee balconies and big windows so you can watch the many birds that come to the birdfeeders or the amazing views across Loch Carron. Up at the farm you're high enough above the water to be able to mostly avoid the midges. The lodges themselves are well-stocked with kitchenware, towels, & linens. They are clean & comfortable, and provide heaters so are very easy to warm when needed.

Don't be concerned by the peat coloured tap water it is perfectly potable and pretty normal in these parts. It's one of many ways that the farm is self-sufficient - you can also buy plenty of eggs on site. I really cannot compliment Craig Highland Farm enough, it's a true haven in a beautiful part of Wester Ross and if peace, trains, nature & wildlife is what you're after then this is the spot!

recent_reviews.author: Mia Scott
recent_reviews.text: We had an amazing stay in the glamping lodge, couldnâ€™t fault it! The owners went over and above to make our stay special. We ended up booking another night because we loved it so much.

recent_reviews.author: Lynn Posnett
recent_reviews.text:
We haven't actually been on the tour yet but I felt that I had to write a review on the booking service. We have caused Neale and Janet extra work through one reason and another, asking questions etc and all through they have been so patient and helpful. If this is the booking service then we can't wait for the tour. I know it'll be brilliant. Lynn

UPDATE

I was right, it was brilliant from start to finish.
Excellent guide, wonderful scenery and gorgeous coos. Delicious cakes afterwards.
Do not hesitate to take this tour.
Lynn

recent_reviews.author: Roy
recent_reviews.text:
Friendly and pretty, spend a perfect afternoon with a lovely girl.

Visited once in 2023 and just back again, everything still perfect. Neil and his farm are the best places to visit Highland Cow in my heart.

recent_reviews.author: Trip 15
recent_reviews.text: Great experience. Get up close with Highland Cows in a totally safe environment. Finish the tour with tea and cakes. Highly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: steven bates (s & r productions.)
recent_reviews.text:
What can we say that others havent.
We had a great steady walk and saw plenty of coos and the history etc was great to know.
Neale and janet are great hosts and very friendly and cant do enough for you.
Lovely shop to buy your gifts too.....
Julie came away with the biggest smile ever..
Janet the cakes were spot on..

Thanks again.

Julie and steve.

recent_reviews.author: Jo Parker
recent_reviews.text:
Unfortunately we were quite disappointed with our visit. We were directed to the barn after paying Â£3pp and Â£1 for food. Inside the barn were pigs (you couldn't pet), 1 rabbit, 1 chicken with chicks and some goats which only 3 you could pet. No staff around so no chance to hold the goats. We were only there for 15 minutes. Website incorrectly says Â£1.50 each; that would be a fairer price, felt I had been ripped off at Â£3 each.
We bought some milk and burgers in the farm shop. Burgers were amazing. Was super happy to be able to buy gluten free burgers. Â£7 for 4 (500g) and they were very meaty, no fat/water came off when cooking. Would buy again.

recent_reviews.author: Lindsay B
recent_reviews.text: We had a wonderful relaxing weekend in the Honeysuckle cabin. Ollie gave us a friendly welcome and Nikki was so lovely on the extra tour of the farm. The cabin was perfect and had everything we needed. Loved watching the wallabies, emus and meeting the water buffalo, goats and rabbits. Would definitely recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Toby Scamell
recent_reviews.text:
We visited for the private farm tour, which was great and very informative. The kids were able to feed a "baby" buffalo! There were rabbits, emus, buffalo, wallabies, pigs, goats, and hens. The kids loved petting the rabbits and having them on their laps.

You can also purchase a range of products from the shop, from buffalo sausages and steaks, to honey and apple juice. All of which is sourced from the farm itself.

There are now a few lodges on the farm that you can stay in too, with access to a fun climbing frame and trampoline.

recent_reviews.author: Julie James
recent_reviews.text:
Just back from a weekend at Thorabella Farm with James. Nikki and Ollie and the kids were very welcoming. We had a great time watching and feeding the animals in the Barn Walk. Primrose Cabin was just right for us. Both the cabins and play area are safe and enclosed so perfect for toddlers on the go ğŸ˜‚. It was great just listening to all the aimals and farm noises and its the best sleep, I've had in a while!. The views include wallabies from one window, goats and hens from another and the peacocks popping up to keep us on our toes. They are definitely
the bosses on the farm!. James's best bit was the homemade ice cream and the animals. The Highland Burgers were amazing washed down with their own apple juice too. We will be back and next time will book a farm tour. You have done an amazing job. Looking forward to what's to come!ğŸ’œ

recent_reviews.author: David Smith
recent_reviews.text: What a beautiful place, filled with homegrown and homemade delicacies. From local veg to jams, spreads, eggs, alcohol and meats. Everything is sourced from the borth and borth east of Scotland. There isba restaurant at the back and some wonderful things to buy. I will be back often I am sure

recent_reviews.author: Lynn Sutherland (lyn)
recent_reviews.text: Good selection of local produce, local eggs at a good price. Range of grocery, chilled and frozen items as well as non food aprons,  oven gloves, etc. Fantastic wee cafe / restaurant where the food is freshly made from local ingredients and good coffee.  Well worth a visit

recent_reviews.author: Ryan
recent_reviews.text: Great selection of food, gifts and fresh produce. Visited a couple of times when in the area and the staff were really friendly too.

recent_reviews.author: Angela Fettes
recent_reviews.text: I dont recommend the allarburn farm shop cafe my husband and I went in for a bacon roll this morning we got our drinks and before we even had a chance to sit down at the table the server came through with our bacon rolls which was cold and the bacon was obviously cooked before hand ready to serve. My husband had a latte it didnâ€™t look or even taste like a latte.

recent_reviews.author: Natalie Kiely
recent_reviews.text:
We enjoyed our time, but didn't feel like there was much here to look at (in terms of animals) compared to other experiences.  We've been to a lot of farm parks so it's hard not to.

There were loads of toys and things to play on and with and I love the sheltered areas.

Outside near the hut that you sign in, they have what I describe as a large garden with plenty to play on.

I love the self serve shop and the little book swap cupboard which is a really great idea.  I'd love to see this in other places.

Our day was maybe slightly dampened by the strong wind we experienced, but it was still a good day out.

recent_reviews.author: Hilary Prosser
recent_reviews.text: Great visit to the farm with our 5 year old twin grandsons and our 13 year old grandson. Great play areas and animals to feed. The archery was great for older child (and grandad) and they all loved the hay bales!

recent_reviews.author: Helena Brown
recent_reviews.text: Great fun for my 9year old and 1year old, actually it was great fun for me too! Lovely feeding the animals.

recent_reviews.author: Rachael
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant for a family trip. Wasnâ€™t too busy, safe and chilled. Plenty for kids to do and snacks and toys were very reasonably priced. So nice to see animals well looked after too!

recent_reviews.author: Guman_R4 Khaptuwa
recent_reviews.text: Very fresh and healhty local stuff we get it from the Farm shop. Very friendly staff. I love to visit again. But the eggs and foods are feel a bit pricey compared to other farm shops in Narin and Elgin.

recent_reviews.author: Herbert Duffus
recent_reviews.text:
I attended this real gem of a Moray Farmshop , with our Men's Group (our experience 16), today.
I just want to say how pleasant our visit was. The selection of soups and sandwiches were outstanding,  with a great selection of sandwiches .
The staff were so pleasant and considerate towards our elderly group.

The entire experience was second to none and we would highly recommend a visit all including children.

Thank you to them for making our visit so nice.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Honeychurch
recent_reviews.text: Great food and good service. Loved the fact that children could play away from the main cafe. Quiche and salad was tasty, chutney was very good

recent_reviews.author: Joyce Evetts
recent_reviews.text: Took our grandsons for a wee visit and some lunch. They were really pleased to see the little calf. The staff at the cafe were so helpful as the boys both have allergies. They had ham sandwiches which were on a lovely little platter with cut grapes cucumber and crisps. The homemade soup went down a treat and the salmon salad was a delight. The boys enjoyed playing with the toys in the big barn which made for a very pleasant lunch for us all.

recent_reviews.author: Kevin Bridges
recent_reviews.text: We made a stop here at Thorneybank to get a quick bite to eat, and got so much more from Eric, Neal and Murry.  We were on a mission to find some family history from Auctherless in the 1700's.  Eric gave a us numerous leads.  Aside from the information, the local grown food and handmade desserts were so good, we plan to order some back to Alabama.  If you are close by, go see these guys for some "hometown" conversation and food.

recent_reviews.author: Helen Hollingsworth
recent_reviews.text: What a great little self service shop! From the minute we walked in , we loved the look of it and itâ€™s super easy to use. Just make your selection from the screen, after browsing the fine array of fruits, veg, awesome ready made  meals, cakes and dairy products, in their little glass cubicles, and then pay by card or cash. A wonderful system. The ready made meals are amazing and not a preservative in sight. Love it!

recent_reviews.author: Pat Whitman
recent_reviews.text: The absolute ideal farm shop, excellent produce, excellent choice. Very happy that you can get fresh milk from a local dairy, I'd highly recommend this place.

recent_reviews.author: meldah speight
recent_reviews.text: My daughter Gail Irvine from meikle wartle  got me a mother's day treat 2 boxes of delicious  cakes and savouries  everything  was really  nice and fresh and a nice variety  of home made cakes l would highly recommend them to others.

recent_reviews.author: Aaron Dean
recent_reviews.text: They hold a farming thing i think its every 2 years for families to go and see the animals, drive tractors, dinosaur adventure in the woods, get a run the on the horse and kart and theres plenty to do and see worth going my kids loves it ğŸ˜€ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Victoria
recent_reviews.text: A fantastic day out! A really well organised and fun event. Thank you.

recent_reviews.author: sean carey
recent_reviews.text: A great day at the open day.

recent_reviews.author: Jemima Crawford
recent_reviews.text: The latte was lovely but the victoria sponge was even more tasty. We sat outside in the sunshine & the view was stunning. The shop was interestingly stocked with food & gift items. The staff were welcoming & friendly. We will go back again

recent_reviews.author: Sophie Griffiths
recent_reviews.text: Love lochend. Am a regular with my Mom. Has an old world feel. Good old fashioned service. The cafe has raised loads of money selling second hand books. Great cakes.

recent_reviews.author: Paul
recent_reviews.text: Great wee shop popular cafe and lovely local produce in a working farm setting with nice rural views I was 40 when I entered and 65 when I left, the slowest service for food and till. Sadly there appears to be nobody in charge and coordinating took forever for a well fired toastie to be served and twice as long to pay for it because you have to join the end of the shop queue. Think after my second visit ill be giving it a wide berth from now on. Pricing a bit high for what you get, coffee average. Plenty of parking and outside seating.

recent_reviews.author: Giuseppe Manzoli-Private Chef
recent_reviews.text:
I stopped for an espresso, that was nice and tasty
Then I worked from there on my emails
It was nice, plenty of space
Then I had a nice and very fresh salad
At the end I spent about Â£50 as they got also fresh vegetables and very interesting things like soaps from goats and chutneys
Etc

Is a very nice place where staff is friendly and with products of niches

Thanks ğŸ™

recent_reviews.author: Scott
recent_reviews.text: We has a meal in the cafe and the food was nice. We asked how much it was for outside play and the waiter said just to go ahead for free so maybe when you dine there they let you outside for free. I agree with some other reviews about broken seats on the go karts and the stone ground isn't good for the karts also. The new indoor play area seems good for the kids with a big bouncy castle, 2 pool tables and a soccer table also. They have added outdoor seating now and a small bouncy castle just beside the seating. Plenty of farm animals to go and see.

recent_reviews.author: Linsey Donnelly
recent_reviews.text:
Barnhill farm, has potential to be a great wee day out but it needs a lot of maintenance and upgrading.
The double decker soft play bus looks lots of fun but it was so dirty inside I didn't want to let my kids play in it, the seating outside was broken and dangerous.
Crazy golf was a big draw for our kids, however there was no golf balls, we got one eventually that we all had to share one ball and lots of the course was broken.
The soft play inside had a soaking wet floor, so after the kids take their shoes off to go in they all ended up.with wet socks, it wasn't just a little wet,  it was soaking.
And the gocarts were in a terrible state, some not working, missing seats, just not taken care of.
Overall it was really disappointing.
Seeing the animals was the highlight of the trip.

recent_reviews.author: Andy Murray
recent_reviews.text: This used to be a free day out to wander about the farm and look at the animals and pop into the cafe for a coffee afterwards.They are now charging Â£7 per child and Â£3 per adult. The kids play area is very run down, go karts with flat tyres, missing peddles and seats. The soft play bus needs sorted as it's a major health and safety risk with exposed corroded metal work that kids can cut feet on, front of the bus where the number plate is hanging off. It's an accident waiting to happen. This will be our last visit

recent_reviews.author: Karen Wilkinson
recent_reviews.text: Visited with my two young sons and charged Â£17 to play outside and see the animals overgrown grass and the Go karts were mostly all broken with no seats bust tires and some without even a peddle very dangerous especially on stones and rocks for children. When complained was told they do maintain it certainly didnâ€™t look like it!

recent_reviews.author: Richard Marshall
recent_reviews.text:
Had a lovely wee hour in this very welcoming wee farm. Lots of variety of rescued animals with lamas, pig, sheep, geese, chickens , guinea pigs, ducks horse donkey and pony.

A very friendly young man took us round (didn't catch his name but he is in p7) and told us all the animal names and all about the farm. Very thoughtful touch giving us a guide about helping out with my son to touch the animals.

Very well deserving of donations if you can!!

Will be back!

recent_reviews.author: Ray Addam
recent_reviews.text:
I had a ton of fun at Lamont farm with my wife today. They have a plethora of animals living happily including goats, lamas, ducks, chicken, horses, and shetland ponies.

The volunteers are incredibly friendly, was a great atmosphere.

Lamont farm doesn't even have an entry cost, so I think it is a great project to donate to via the website if you can afford. Especially considering many of the animals have been rescued.

Thanks for a great day. Ill be back for sure!

recent_reviews.author: lisa avery
recent_reviews.text: Great wee place to take the kids. We're out Paisley direction a lot, so we've popped in here 3 times in the last fortnight and spent about an hour here each time. Its not big, but lovely to see the animals, sometimes they're walking about the courtyard too, and then we take a wander up the back fields to see the horses and sheep. Take your time and enjoy the peace and quiet whilst meeting the animals â¤ï¸ xx

recent_reviews.author: Ross Drummond
recent_reviews.text: A very nice place, volunteer ran and they were all lovely and very happy to help. The animals are great and mostly very friendly, but the big bad goose didn't like me ğŸ¤£ but we had a lovely time there. There's not a lot to see, but what there is is fun. Good as part of a bigger day out.

recent_reviews.author: Katie Scott
recent_reviews.text: Better than expected. Reasonable priced cafe as well Â£5 for a toasties bit more if you add chips. Also Â£2 per person for train ride and Â£1 per person for the tractor. Everyone was friendly and the day we had was 20 degrees. Wonderful day! Was a nursery trip.

recent_reviews.author: Loopy Lou
recent_reviews.text: A full family day out! Activities for all ages in the place. Mining museum to catch a glimpse of history in the area. Animal encounters (we got to pet the chick's, guinea pigs and polecat). Outdoor adventures with a new fort on offer to climb and slide. Jumping pillows, excavation sand pit and go-karts to name a few. Great value for money and reasonable priced drinks and snack at the outdoor snack van too.

recent_reviews.author: Iain Weir
recent_reviews.text:
Was slightly disappointed with my family visit having read about it on their website. In no particular order:

1. The interactive items in the museum were not working
2. Many of the soap dispensers were out of soap and they have lots of hand washing stations
3. The train ride was listed as 30mins on the website but only lasted 15mins.  It isnâ€™t circular, it goes along the track, engine turns and then you go back
3.  The cafe was quite good - look out for the specials menu though as we never seen it tucked on the side wall until leaving.  They forgot our salad that was listed on menu but they quickly rectified this.
4. There are no prices displayed for any of the drinks or ice creams.
5.  If you have an EV forget about using their charger - itâ€™s is a slow charger with a Â£1.50 connection charge and a maximum stay of 1hr before a Â£10 overstay charge occurs; I recon you might be able to get 5/6%.

The museum was informative and interesting to look at.  Once you go outdoors however you can see poor maintenance and condition of a lot of things unfortunately.

Tractor drive was something to do.  Only takes you along passed the horses and back again.

Train journey doesnâ€™t take you past any of the animals.

Play park area is good for the kids but very little shade for a sunny day.

recent_reviews.author: Stuart Dalziel
recent_reviews.text: Plenty too do my girl loved it  no bad price too get in good variety of animals too see  only thing a felt was it was waste ofÂ£Â£  for train ride as we only seen couple of horses and sum sheep couple of ducks     another down side was the wasps that was going about  still five star for me

recent_reviews.author: Mahendran PK
recent_reviews.text: The farm tour was a wonderful experience. Mr. Ben Mrs. Lindsey and the staffs are amazing.

recent_reviews.author: Karen McChesney
recent_reviews.text: Very nice experience. A bit difficult to identify exactly Where it was but we found it eventually. The staff are friendly and it was well laid out. It wasn't a cheap shopping experience so if you are going to shop on a budget choose carefully as it is an organic farm shop and although many items are cheaper many are not and there is such a large choice it's hard to know when to stop.

recent_reviews.author: Pamela Barnes
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful to visit Grow Wild, and able to significantly reduce plastic packaging. Staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. Lots of choice of organic fruit, veg and staples. I've even got a fresh granary loaf ordered for my slot next week.

recent_reviews.author: Dorothy Warren
recent_reviews.text: Attended author's talk by Monica Wilde. Beautiful setting watching the swallows. Shop looked well stocked with organic produce but wasn't sure if it was actually open. My photo was taken from the entrance to the shop.

recent_reviews.author: Bebhinn Gallagher
recent_reviews.text: Drove past whilst the farmer was herding in some cattle that all looked to be in excruciating pain due to overfull udders. One cow was having to lift one of her rear legs to try to accommodate her udders and all looked miserable.

recent_reviews.author: Denis Mcmanus
recent_reviews.text: Cleaned roof slates roughcast and sand stone.buildings look really good now.roughcastcleaning.co.u

recent_reviews.author: Liz Johnston
recent_reviews.text: Friendly bought a kitten she is doing great

recent_reviews.author: john gibson
recent_reviews.text: great place

recent_reviews.author: David
recent_reviews.text:
I had a fantastic experience at New Hopetoun Gardens. Despite my complete lack of plant knowledge, I was able to find everything I needed on a long list thanks to an incredibly helpful and diligent member of staff, Vicky. She went above and beyond to guide me and made the whole process easy and enjoyable.

The garden centre itself is very impressive, with an excellent stock of plants and a huge variety to choose from. Itâ€™s clear they really care about both the quality of their plants and the customer experience.

Highly recommended â€” Iâ€™ll definitely be back!

recent_reviews.author: Douglas Wilson
recent_reviews.text: Disappointing visit today. Following previous visits this time I was very dissatisfied with my experience. By 10.30am the cafe had run out of all breakfast items apart from bacon. No sausages or black pudding and the bacon was cold by the time it reached the table. The staff were not friendky as on previous occassions. An outside door was left open causing the cafe to be cold .  Not an enjoyable experience .

recent_reviews.author: Lynne Harkes
recent_reviews.text:
Unfortunately this garden centre is not dog friendly .Today, we drove here especially from North Berwick, to browse the Art in the Garden exhibition, with an intention to look for a sculpture for our garden. We were carrying our very elderly 3 kilo Maltese dog and were stalked by a member of staff and rudely â€˜thrown outâ€™. It was made clear to us that the resident cat population in the garden centre means dogs are strictly not permitted, whether being carried or not. We had absolutely no intention of putting our dog on the ground and were shocked by the policy being so unbending and by the extremely rude manner of the staff member.

We will never be back to this garden centre which is a pity. The choice of plants and sculptures is wonderful, but unless it is cool enough to leave your dog in your car, or your dog is large enough to be tied up outside, l would recommend avoiding New Hopetoun Garden Centre and instead take your business to one of the many garden centres that do welcome well behaved pets.

recent_reviews.author: Jacqueline Soane
recent_reviews.text: Lovely garden centre and the cafe was excellent, plenty of choice of cakes, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The lady working in the cafe, Katrina, couldn't have been more helpful as my friend and myself both have disabilities with walking and Katrina looked after us by carrying our tray to the table and sorting out cutlery for us. We will definitely go back again.

recent_reviews.author: Donald
recent_reviews.text: We really enjoyed our visit to Grains farm. Itâ€™s less than 10 minutes drive from Stonehaven. There is a small shop which sells snacks, coffee, cold drinks, ice cream, etc. and bags of feed for the goats, sheep and pigs. All the animals were curious and happy to be petted (for food of course). The very cute Alpacas were shy but just looking at them close up was a treat. And getting close to a Highland Coo was a rare treat. The variety of cute animals, chickens, ducks and a turkey kept us four adults and an 11-year old entertained for a couple of hours. The owners are very responsible on hygiene with clear instructions and a sink and soap next to the shop to wash hands during and after petting. Itâ€™s a fun day out and highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Claire Mckenzie
recent_reviews.text: This is a wonderful farm experience! We went as a home school group & our kids loved it. The staff are very friendly & gave us a lovely tour around the animals, telling us all about them. The animals are clearly used to having visitors as they are so friendly & come running up to see youâ€¦especially the goats. You can buy a bag of feed to feed the goats, sheep & pigs. I highly recommend this farm for a truly fun afternoon out ğŸ˜„

recent_reviews.author: N R
recent_reviews.text: We have been attending the Little Lambs toddler group at Grains Farm and would thoroughly recommend it, or just a visit on the weekend. Lots of animals to see, things to do and space to run around. Holly was also so understanding and flexible, both when we were trying to book and when illness prevented us attending. Her communication is also great, and the team are so friendly and also clearly passionate and knowledgeable about all the animals. We love it there and would really recommend a visit! And thereâ€™s even a wee shop for a nice coffee or a treat!

recent_reviews.author: Tina Mann
recent_reviews.text: What a fantastic place for kids & adults. The lady is fantastic, goes above & beyond to answer any questions you may have. Superb friendly animals. Great play area, we have visited twice now but will definitely be back. Canâ€™t rate it high enough. Well done guys x

pumpkin_patches.address: Grains of, Kirktown of Fetteresso, Stonehaven AB39 3UT

recent_reviews.author: Grzegorz Pastuszak
recent_reviews.text: Service hopeless girl for 10 minutes.sears for phone coverage, maybe longer because I did not want to wait any longer, eggs you would have ÅšwierÅ¼e as he lives in this world more than 50 years I have never had. spoiled egg in them for the first time and it's 3 pieces, potatoes after less than a week broke in addition unpalatable, more times I will buy nothing there than 3.

recent_reviews.author: George Webster
recent_reviews.text: Had lunch. Really good andthe staff were very helpful.

recent_reviews.author: trailmax trailmax (trailmax)
recent_reviews.text: We stopped buying veggies and eggs from supermarkets after we discovered Roys little shop. He always have fresh green veggies and homegrown free-range eggs. Comes summer-time he also has strawberries and raspberries and sometimes jam. Also prices are half of what you pay in supermarkets with a lot better quality/freshness.

recent_reviews.author: Tess Stuart
recent_reviews.text: Great wee farm shop, saw the 12 day old piglets which were affy cute. Pumpkins to pick and take home veg and eggs .also ponies in the field to pat be careful though as ponies do may nip ğŸ˜highly recommend to shop local. ğŸ˜ğŸ·â¤ï¸

pumpkin_patches.address: Cove Bay, Aberdeen AB12, Aberdeen AB12 3GP

recent_reviews.author: Steve Smith
recent_reviews.text:
Great place to visit once a year near Laurencekirk if you're looking for beautiful peonies at this time of year.
Service from the lady in the farm hut was also excellent for maintenance guidance for these stunning flowers.

recent_reviews.author: Bruce Macdonald
recent_reviews.text: Good quick and efficient staff

recent_reviews.author: Dave Murphy
recent_reviews.text: Visited here after it was recommended to me. Shop had a great selection of quality food. The food in the restaurant was lovely and large portions. There is a good kids play area and plenty of parking. Staff across the butcher counter, till and restaurant were all friendly and attentative. Looking forward to going back.

recent_reviews.author: Richard McLeod
recent_reviews.text: What a great place to break a journey for lunch! Amazing variety of food, all food allergies and diets catered for, and an area dedicated for people with pooches. The farm shop is great, too, with a huge range of food and drink

recent_reviews.author: Marius Popa
recent_reviews.text:
Nice place to eat outside Aberdeen. The portions are generous. The food is relatively simple, nothing fancy but seriously good. They serve alcohol but this is not a place to drink, this is a place to eat, drink coffee and eventually a beer.
The farm shop is also good, for many aspects I will say gourmet and has a nice selection of drinks for sale.

recent_reviews.author: MNRS
recent_reviews.text:
Been before and liked, but this time was different.

Food was ok, but the tables were frankly disgusting. When we arrived our table was cleared but not clean. We did that ourselves. But we were seated for over an hour and no one came to clear the surrounding tables (photo attached showing four of the uncleared tables, but I couldn't fit them all in!). The wasps were having a field day and sights like this always make me wonder what it's like in the kitchens where you can't see.

Shop itself is a good stopping point without the food though.

pumpkin_patches.address: Boghead Farm, A96, Kintore, Inverurie AB51 0XD

recent_reviews.author: Mehwish Abbas
recent_reviews.text: Had an amazing experience there with lovely staff, views and food. The gelato cones  top notch and even the smallest one is big enough for one person. The thick shakes were a game changer, especially the fact u can choose any flavor of gelato and get it as a shake. We tried maltesars and honeycomb flavours. The pizza we had was Marinara flavoured and had loadso sauce on it. And also nice spots for pics, so u can grab a meal and eat it in nice spot. Also, can watch coos as well.

recent_reviews.author: Anne K. L
recent_reviews.text: Amazing gelato - had the maltesers and the hazelnut! Both were equally as good! Would definitely visit the next time I am back in Aberdeen!

recent_reviews.author: Elizabeth Bandeen
recent_reviews.text: Super friendly staff, love the bubbles to sit in outside, great coffee and ice cream AND cake. Loved that it was also wheelchair access friendly too. My parents loved it.

recent_reviews.author: lukasz luk
recent_reviews.text: Friendly service. I've been buying fresh milk from the milk vending machine since 2019. The milk is fresh, and you can make yogurt, buttermilk, sour milk, and cream from it at home. I highly recommend milk from this farm. It's always clean, including the milk vending machines and the farmyard. They also have delicious ice cream and many other delicacies.

recent_reviews.author: Javier Da camara
recent_reviews.text: All the decorations are really nice

recent_reviews.author: angela carter
recent_reviews.text: We have just had your strawberrys from marksy and they are dilicious ğŸ˜‹

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Godden A G Logistic Solutions Ltd
recent_reviews.text: Nice people, always unloaded quickly

pumpkin_patches.search_query: pick your own pumpkins Argyll and Bute

recent_reviews.author: Janina Salmon
recent_reviews.text: Visited here twice whilst staying with family in town. Nice gift and card area in the shop selling some local items, and the coffee shop was lovely! Really classy yet cosy. Had breakfast twice, which I thought was excellent value for money for the standard of food served. Everything was cooked to perfection and the staff were all super friendly!

recent_reviews.author: Rebekah
recent_reviews.text: I came because it was stated that you were a garden centre, but just a few plants outside the front left us feeling disappointed. A garden centre you are not. However a great place to pick up the DIY needs and I heard they do a cracking baked potato!?

recent_reviews.author: Alan Gray
recent_reviews.text: Walkers is a brilliant place to visit. There's a fantastic range of hardware, paints and wood treatments, garden equipment, and garden care. There is also a really good home section with candles, ornaments, false flowers, and other ideas to choose from. The cafÃ© is the best in Dunoon. Table service, friendly staff, and really nice food. They also cater for gluten-free on request, just ask the staff at the counter. The shop and cafÃ© are really clean and inviting. There is also an outdoor seating area when the weather is nice. There is a free car park, which can be busy, and easy wheelchair access from a disabled parking area. One of the easiest 5 star reviews I have awarded.

recent_reviews.author: Natalia O
recent_reviews.text: Lovely spot for tea and cake, friendly staff and a relaxed atmosphere.Will be back!

recent_reviews.author: joe C/U
recent_reviews.text: Good strawberrys

pumpkin_patches.search_query: pick your own pumpkins Dumfries and Galloway

recent_reviews.author: Dino
recent_reviews.text: Very friendly great for fresh eggs

pumpkin_patches.search_query: pick your own pumpkins Dumfries and Galloway

recent_reviews.author: Barbara MacGregor
recent_reviews.text:
We visited the coffee shop.  Very decent fruit scones, and my husband says his breakfast roll was good.  Latte not bad considering it was a machine.
Nice conservatory to sit as it wasn't that warm.  Terrace with lovely view if it's warmer.
I had a look round the plants and there was an interesting choice, and looked very well kept.

recent_reviews.author: Eilidh Black
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic big garden centre with everything you could need - even birds or guinea pigs! Incredibly impressed by this place and all the staff were very helpful. Plenty of parking available.

recent_reviews.author: Deanne Ingram
recent_reviews.text:
Popped in for a quick bite to eat and potter around.
Cafe staff all looked very miserable, not one of them smiled.
Garden centre staff were lovely, happy bubbly and happy to help.
Here on holiday, probably wouldn't recommend this place to other holiday makers where we are

recent_reviews.author: Callum McIntyre-Loughlin
recent_reviews.text:
Staff lways friendly and welcoming. Lovely little cafe with nice views out the rear of garden centre. Good selection of plants and products all year round.
My little girl loved the parrots, fish and animals also.

pumpkin_patches.address: Heathhall Garden Centre, Edinburgh Rd, Dumfries DG1 1SE

pumpkin_patches.search_query: pick your own pumpkins Dumfries and Galloway

recent_reviews.author: CATRO R
recent_reviews.text:
If youâ€™re looking for a truly memorable countryside experience, this family-run deer park is a must-visit. From the moment we arrived, the warmth and friendliness of the staff made us feel genuinely welcomeâ€”like visiting an old friend rather than booking a tour.

The highlight, without a doubt, was the one-hour guided tour led by owner Richard, whose depth of knowledge about deer and local wildlife was nothing short of captivating. His storytelling, paired with the tranquil beauty of animals in their natural habitat, kept us so engaged that the hour flew by in what felt like minutes.

Whether youâ€™re a wildlife enthusiast, a curious visitor, or just looking for a serene outing, this park delivers in spades. We left feeling enriched and inspiredâ€”and will absolutely be returning.

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸ Highly recommended!

recent_reviews.author: Mel Maxwell
recent_reviews.text:
We had a brilliant lunch at the cafÃ©, not a long wait time at all. Lovely atmosphere and gorgeous view from the cafÃ©. Perfect for families, couples, everybody really!
Then we booked a deer tour, and it was fantastic! Very passionate and knowledgeable guide, who  made us feel very welcome and we left feeling very well informed.
10/10 recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Christopher Sweeney
recent_reviews.text: Thank you so much for a fantastic experience today we had lunch in the Bistro and it was fabulous, sitting watching the deer was a great start to our trip. The 1 hour trip into the park was memorable and a must do. Don't miss out on such a great experience

recent_reviews.author: Fiona Clayton
recent_reviews.text: We took a tour with Logan as our driver and guide.  It was excellent - he was knowledgeable and helpful and we were delighted to see so many of the beautiful creatures around us.  The views from the higher ground are amazing too.  If you're planning a visit, I'd also recommend you fit in a lunch in the cafe - a great choice and the food was lovely.

pumpkin_patches.search_query: pick your own pumpkins Dumfries and Galloway

recent_reviews.author: Caroline C
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful castle and surrounding scenery. Booked a tour in advance- well worth doing and very interesting. There is a Rembrandt painting that can be viewed as part of the tour- a nice bonus! Our tour guide was incredibly knowledgeable and had a great sense of humour. The gardens are beautiful and well maintained. We had lunch in the Castle Cafe afterwards which was tasty with generous portions. Lovely gift shop with a great selection.

recent_reviews.author: gaybrielle hastings
recent_reviews.text: This is the home of one of my ancestors, so I was thrilled to be able to walk the grounds! The castle is very large. There are plenty of parking spaces, also an area to park and have lunch. Visitors were having a great time riding bikes while I was there. Dog friendly and sheep for as far as the eyes can see! Visiting the grounds was free and well worth the time as there are several trees on site that are very old and beautiful. Recommend a visit!

recent_reviews.author: Richard Moore
recent_reviews.text: Drumlanrig castle and grounds are beyond anything we have been to before, the pink castle is stunning packed full of history amazing paintings and furniture. To be able to get so close to the Rembrandt was a real honour and a highlight of the tour. Gary the tour guide was brilliant really helping us understand the history easily he is very knowledgeable. The grounds are perfectly manicured itâ€™s a real credit to all  the staff who maintain the castle and grounds, the castle is still used and lived in by the duke and family he was there on our visit. Make sure to book the castle tour in advance as they fill up quickly

recent_reviews.author: Laura Young
recent_reviews.text:
Beautiful place and so impressive. The building is amazing and the tour we had was superb. The lady was very engaging and knew her stuff so the tour was fascinating.  Lunch was delicious and the staff were all fantastic.
My daughter is 10 and enjoyed the adventure playground, but so did my 14 year old son.
Can't recommend enough!

recent_reviews.author: E M
recent_reviews.text: Great fresh products! Arbuckles is easy to access, with plenty of parking. The outdoors is gorgeous, with a lovely play park and a view of the farm. Inside the store there's a little bit of everything. There are fresh raspberries, blackberries, and strawberries, both fresh and frozen. As well as a fridge with cakes, tray bakes, and cheesecakes. The shop also offers a variety of produce from the farm as well as local producers. The smell of honey is dreamlike. The staff is fun and polite. It's a great experience!

recent_reviews.author: Kyle Wilson
recent_reviews.text:
So after finding out how good a reputation this place had i decided to take a drive up today, only an hour's drive from me, i was expecting to go up to go "strawberry picking" / fruit picking which i assumed was something they offered but was told I could today, unsure why if it's out of season or just not something they do, none the less the place is a lovely venue shop inside has extremely and friendly staff amazing variety of stuff from the farm the honey is out of this world absolutely delicious!

Little one also had an ice-cream was tasty she said she enjoyed it.

Nice little play bit for kids and also nice little seating areas too.

Only reason I've scored a 4* is i was disappointed about not being able to go picking (if I'm wrong and you don't offer this please notify me)

Staff 5* review friendly and helpful and extremely patient also!

recent_reviews.author: Michal Brichacek
recent_reviews.text: Delicious berries and other snacks. Convenient location next to the road. Worth a quick stop!

recent_reviews.author: Owen Glasby
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic farm shop- huge range if products, from food and fruits to lovely home items like beeswax candles. Very reasonable prices for fresh local goods!

pumpkin_patches.address: Star Inn Farm, Invergowrie, Dundee DD2 5EJ

pumpkin_patches.search_query: pick your own pumpkins East Lothian

recent_reviews.author: David Howard
recent_reviews.text:
Just had 3 Nights at Carfrae Farm , Lammas Cottage.

Absolutely Superb quality accommodation , very comfortable and has a wonderful peaceful relaxing atmosphere.

Trudi is a true gem, she and her staff made us feel so welcome, and were a delight to talk to.

The farm shop is one of the best stocked I have ever seen, with so many local treats.

I would recommend to anyone looking for a quality break in the beautiful Scottish Borders countryside.

recent_reviews.author: Sharon Coman
recent_reviews.text: Stravaig 2 Bed holiday cottage on the site of Carfrae Farm near Haddington,  offers super accommodation which is well equipped/designed and very clean and comfortable.  A lovely garden, on-site parking a Farm Shop and shared facilities (hot tub, sauna) are available in this rural retreat.  I can highly recommend this excellent accommodation in beautiful surroundings.

recent_reviews.author: Andy Prele
recent_reviews.text:
We stayed here for three nights, great accommodation in a rural location but only a short drive from great beaches and local towns.

We were greeted with a warm welcome from the hosts and everything from the accommodation and facilities were above expectations.

Would recommend Carfrae Farm to all.

recent_reviews.author: Ritika Arora
recent_reviews.text: Ordered groceries from the Carfrae Farm including fruit, milk, jam  butter and bread which were all very fresh and delicious! Would highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Bill B
recent_reviews.text: A big garden centre with a lot to choose from. Some really good unique things to buy as gifts or just for yourself. Some of the things are a little expensive, but sometimes you can find some reductions. There is a cafÃ© inside which is very clean, lots of tables and good food, with excellent service. Will definitely be back.

recent_reviews.author: Jason Cooke
recent_reviews.text:
Large and well presented garden centre.  Plenty of plants and flowers and various garden tools and outside living you'd expect of a garden centre.

The cafe/restaurant is large and offers a varied menu incl. Sunday roasts which I've had previously and was well priced and good quality.  Also good for a coffee and a cake.

Plenty of parking and friendly staff justify the star rating.

recent_reviews.author: Donald Farmer
recent_reviews.text: This garden centre is deceiving as it has everything in it. From shoes to clothes and plants to foodstuffs. When you go you need to try their restaurant as it too caters for all tastes whether itâ€™s cream cakes of steak pie. You choose. The staff are welcoming and friendly. Donâ€™t just drive past. Call in.

recent_reviews.author: Trevor Peach
recent_reviews.text:
Huge place not just a Garden centre
Shoe shop as well, cafe , fresh Veg area , ample food shopping area,

pumpkin_patches.address: Klondyke Garden Centre, Beancross Rd, Polmont, Falkirk FK2 0XS

recent_reviews.author: M MacDonald
recent_reviews.text: A classic Scottish bothy. Really good selection of homemade cakes, sandwiches, souvenirs. We came for the milkshake machine which has incredible prices, and tastes so fresh. Once we discovered this, we came back twice in one week! Polish man working the outside food truck is so lovely and hospitable.

recent_reviews.author: Tracey McDonald
recent_reviews.text: Lovely farm shop and cafe. Fresh produce is very fresh with a good selection of items available. The milk vending machine is a great idea Â£3 for a glass bottle which you can use again and Â£2.50 for a plain or flavoured milk. The cafe is really nice, we had the burger and the minute steak baguette, both were really tasty. The chips are homemade.

recent_reviews.author: Tyler Mckinlay
recent_reviews.text:
Easy to find, just of the A873. Great layout with a huge variety of meats, preserves, gifts, sweet treats!. There is also a vending machine with fresh cows milk from Farrahs farm
Toilets are easily accessible and are top quality.
The cafe has a nice layout, waitresses are really kind and good service. Had lentil soup for lunch, quality of bread served with it let it down.
Would definitely recommend Smiddy Farm Shop

recent_reviews.author: Nicola
recent_reviews.text: Visited here whilst on holiday in Scotland. There is a good range of food from bakery section to butchers to cakes. The cakes were amazing wish i had bought some extras. We had lunch in cafe which was really nice excellebt service. The following morning we visited the express van outside for breakfast which was really nice. Worth a visit if in area.

recent_reviews.author: Sharon Robertson
recent_reviews.text:
Awesome Garden Centre, not just things for the garden but lots more beside, pet supplies, lamps, lights, homemade products and lots more including a cafe where myself and 3 friend's had lunch food was excellent as was the service.
We had macaroni cheese which I had chips and salad and my friends had ; macaroni and chips, baked potato cheese and beans and sausage quiche/pie and mash all homemade and truly fabulisciously scrumptious ğŸ˜‹
Staff always smiling in cafe and in store I highly recommend a visit next time your in the area prices in cafe Â£-Â£Â£ very reasonable

recent_reviews.author: Carole Carlisle
recent_reviews.text: I meet friends here once a month. I really like the cafe and must mention one of your staff. Linda. She is so helpful and cheerful. Nothing is any trouble.

recent_reviews.author: Ros Houldsworth
recent_reviews.text: Always a pleasure to visit here. Great products, excellent cafe (Blossoms) and dog friendly areas. Small play park for toddlers/young kids and the staff are always attentive and helpful.

recent_reviews.author: david davies
recent_reviews.text: Torwood Garden Centre is an absolute gem! From the moment you arrive, the beautifully maintained grounds and vibrant displays make it clear this is more than just a garden centre â€” it's a full experience. The plant selection is outstanding, with healthy, well-cared-for stock and knowledgeable staff always on hand to offer helpful advice.

recent_reviews.author: Berglas71
recent_reviews.text: A variety of fruit, veg and eggs available, all organic, so give them a good wash to get rid of dirt, etc. before cooking. Prices were reasonable. Unfortunately, I didn't get any eggs as they were all sold out. When parking, it's best to reverse in as getting out will be easier as the main road is very fast.

recent_reviews.author: Cali Knows
recent_reviews.text: Omg - so awesome, a must stop farm stand ! Sweetest berries ever ğŸ˜ƒ

recent_reviews.author: Grant Westland
recent_reviews.text: Good if you drive. Has good parking  and some outside seating for eating the ice cream. Bus stop is a few minutes from the shop but the moffet & Williamson 63 will pull over at the shop if you say and informally will stop if you wave and they see you but it's every hour and the only direct to Guardbridge main street - the frequent buses are 2 stops to Dairsie then change bus for St Andrews so Guardbridge inn then cross the road for the 99 to get into Guardbridge main street if you bought a ton weight of potatoes.

recent_reviews.author: That Marta
recent_reviews.text: We stopped here to do some shopping and we could not leave. All the products are fresh, from the area and delicious. I wish there were more places like this one. We also had a lovely chat and got some tips for area.

recent_reviews.author: Dennis Smalley
recent_reviews.text:
Visiting this estate is a really nice experience.It is a very. relaxing tranquil place
There are many  peaceful  spots where you can marvel at the sheer  explosions of Colour in the gardens .The house is not open to the public as it is occupied by the current  clan McMillan chief and his family.
