There is a lovely garden tearoom, a  big pond full of birdlife and and an adjacent animal sanctuary with separate  entry which is only Â£2 extra. Very reasonable in this greedy age. Here you will find  Alpacas, Llamas, beautiful horses and ponies. You can feed pigs.Pet Guinea pigs.Kids will love it. There is ample parking close to the tearoom. Staff were all helpful and friendly.Its a great day out.

recent_reviews.author: Pauline McSorley
recent_reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights, brilliant, all the staff are helpful and friendly. Accommodation spot on, lovely gardens and woodland and nearby cafe. Very dog and child friendly. Hope to return in September.

recent_reviews.author: philip dunning
recent_reviews.text: Lovely trails to walk, with a range of trees and plants. Basic cafe, tasty. Places for kids to play, swings etc. Bike trail coming soon. Six pound entrance fee.

recent_reviews.author: Arslan Rauf
recent_reviews.text: Over priced, outdated, requires TLC especially some of the woodland paths that need maintenance. In its current state it is not worth visiting. Dumfries House, Calderglen Country Park, Drumpellier Country Park even The Kelpies (Helix Park) has more to do and they are all free as well.

recent_reviews.author: Liam McGeachan
recent_reviews.text: Shopping was fine. Went into the cafe for breakfast. The tables were absolutely filthy. Nobody had cleaned them, so I had to resort to cleaning the table myself. Afterwards, I went to the toilets. They were absolutely filthy, too. The main toilet was blocked with poo and dirty toilet paper. There were visible faeces stain on the toilet seat and bowl. Plus, the smell was abhorrent. It was a very unpleasant experience. If you are going into Morrisons, make sure that you don't need to use the toilet.

recent_reviews.author: Lass from Greenock
recent_reviews.text: I was usually a Tesco user, but have recently been using Morrisons now, as Tesco got rid of their counters whereas In Morrisons you can get fresh counters with butchers there for your meats  and fish, etc. They also do handmade pizzas too, and have a whole bunch of freshly made cakes. This place offers so much more than Tesco in my opinion. And a wider selection. Some of their items are cheaper too! And so much more selection on flowers ğŸ’ if ur a bit of a gardener. I highly recommend this place. Oh and soo much more points here too. if u love ur Clubcard, well Morrisons do a lot more points here ie Â£5 gives u 5000 pints whereas Tesco itâ€™s like 5 pints for every pound?

recent_reviews.author: Jacqueline McCafferty
recent_reviews.text: I am expressing my concern regarding the lack of organisation I have observed at my local Morrisons store in recent weeks, specifically concerning the fresh "Make Your Own Pizza" counter. My daughter particularly enjoys this service, which is advertised as being available from store opening until 7:00 PM. However, I have repeatedly encountered the counter either completely unmanned until staff are specifically requested, or closed entirely without any prior notice to customers. This has resulted in unnecessary waiting and confusion for shoppers. When I enquired about the situation, staff appeared unsure of the expected procedures and simply stated that the counter was closed, without offering further explanation. This inconsistency is disappointing and does not reflect the level of service one expects. I strongly suggest that, if the operational hours of the counter have changed, the signage should be updated accordingly to prevent further inconvenience. I hope you will address this issue promptly to improve the customer experience.

recent_reviews.author: Audrey Hitchinson
recent_reviews.text: Lorna in the cafe is an absolute star. I have visited this store for years and this woman is a massive attribute to Morrisons Greenock. She deserves a payrise, so helpful, so caring, always smiling, always so mannerly, and even when they are rushed off their feet and you see customers being unreasonable like today, she is such a fantastic representative for Morrisons. Calm, level and always doing her best. Something I think that is so lacking now days. Well done Lorna, excellent customer service and we appreciated it today. Thankyou. â¤ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Lass from Greenock
recent_reviews.text: Had a quick shop for water and something for dinner. Its good for a meal deal too, if ever needing a little something for work. I'm usually at the self-checkouts and if there is ever a 'big' queue I find it goes down quite quickly. They're toilets are usually clean too. Staff seem friendly. They have a nice cafe and good selection of F&F clothes. Good amount of car parking if ever needing to park.

recent_reviews.author: sara ~
recent_reviews.text: Pretty good groceries.  The organization was a bit confused, but we eventually found everything.  Interesting produce that distinguishes between Scottish & British.  Managed to find vegan & Asian style foods.  The store brands & others seem to not have the packages that can close/reseal. Huge parking lot. Easy to understand prices. Finally found an example of 'Fairy Liquid' ğŸ§šâ€â™‚ï¸ ğŸ«§

recent_reviews.text: A pretty good Tescos, plenty of parking, there is a Timpsons, a CafÃ©, etc. Prices are pretty good, with good quality items. I come here regularly for shopping. Quite clean, and tidy. Staff are nice and helpful. Will come again soon!

recent_reviews.author: Kenny Tait
recent_reviews.text: Gents toilet in Tesco, Greenock, 16 July 2025 am. Three hand wash stations but none working. Toilets supposed to be checked regularly but obviously not much of a check.

recent_reviews.author: James Robinson
recent_reviews.text: Good shop good prices. But be carefully you don't overstay in there car park.

recent_reviews.text: Although the price of pan cake  was high from the last time when i purchase , the taste was the same as good as before

recent_reviews.author: Mark Crawley
recent_reviews.text: It's Aldi, good wee deals but don't expect any customer service.

recent_reviews.author: Mr David Jones
recent_reviews.text:
One of the best!
Fantastic restaurant and great fresh produce and friendly staff.
Fresh soup and scones to fish and chips to morning rolls and so much more to choose from.
Lots of plants and Christmas stock now in as well as free parking, what more do you want.
Great Mac and cheese and cakes and the easy ordering service on the app if you prefer.

Donkeys and alpacas coming soon and other dates to remember see pictures .

recent_reviews.author: Anne Shearer
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic plants always fresh and well cared for. Reasonably priced with some good deals.

Great coffee shop. Also excellent home made baking and soups etc

recent_reviews.author: Kris Bleakley
recent_reviews.text: Had a lovely visit to this bustling little garden centre, the cafe is top notch and very well staffed with lovely smiley people ready to welcome and seat you. Two breakfasts and a sizeable pot of tea for twenty pounds is great value and very tasty with noticeable quality in ingredients. Highly recommend especially those with dogs as there's a sperate seating section along with lots of offerings for your furry family member. We'll definitely be coming back whenever we're in the area.

recent_reviews.author: Aileen Smith
recent_reviews.text: At Panola cafe today for coffee and a cake. Very disappointing. Waited 30 minutes at least for our order to be taken. When it did come,  I couldnâ€™t even say coffee was even lukewarm. My friends commented that the cakes were far too sweet and sickly. We were shown to a table where the floor was filthy with residual food. The waitress even wiped one chair with their hands adding even more crumbs on the floor. It wasnâ€™t particularly busy. The screens in front of the food were cleaned 3 times by different staff in the time we were in (90 minutes). Staff chores need to be better organised.

It was a great experience! Still plenty of berries! Hopefully, will be back again before the end of the blueberry season.

recent_reviews.author: Kara Shea
recent_reviews.text:
Blueberry picking with Mimi and my 4 kids in 4 years. I've never had better tasting blue berries in my life!

The staff was ALL extremely kind, certious and helpful. So if you have questions or are buying their home grown fruits and vegetables, it's a very pleasing experience.

You walk to the patch area you pick from. It's rows of blueberry bushes that are loaded. My kids and I were in heaven! So don't wear high heels mmk?

Thinking of going back before blueberry season ends! Then.... Blackberries! (I could live off berries). Fun adventure for the kids and adults, no entry fee -pay for whwt you buy or pick only.

I need more of their berries....

recent_reviews.author: Fiona Rushworth
recent_reviews.text:
Fantastic experience from start to finish.  Arranging funeral flowers for my father, staff were very professional and knowledgeable.  Offered advice but didn't push choices.  My daughter and I chose a few specific flowers and then provided a "colour scheme".  The flowers were absolutely perfect and exactly what we had imagined.
Emails sent stating each stage of preparation/left premises/delivery were very welcomed and put my mind at ease they would be there.
Seriously can't fault this process, staff, premises layout and will 100% be recommending this florist, shop and cafe to others.

recent_reviews.author: Lorna Murray
recent_reviews.text: Lovely items in the shop, some unusual, great array of plants, good amount of parking. I only have it 4* although the coffee shop was beautiful and spotlessly keen, and a great array of cakes.... The choice of mains and light bites for vegetarian lost it a star, even poorer for vegan. Saying that I had sweetcorn soup and that was delicious. I would go back again.

recent_reviews.author: Fiona Bowes
recent_reviews.text: Nice place, enjoyed a browse in the shop after meeting a friend for lunch. Soup was beautiful in the cafe. Only reason for 4 stars rather than 5 :- Bought the last slice of lemon cake as it looked lovely, however was disappointed as it was a bit stale on the outside. Will visit again in the future and hopefully will be able to change to 5 stars if the cake is better next time â˜ºï¸

recent_reviews.author: Cheryl Hobart
recent_reviews.text: I received a beautiful display of flowers for my birthday, the arrangement is stunning and a great variety of flowers. It's been on display a week today and they are all doing really well. I highly recommend this florist.

I wrote an email to Dobbies expressing disappointment that they didn't have any stock of a folding egg chair that was on display.
I was very surprised to get a nice swift reply from the General Manager. She very kindly offered to get one for me the next day from another store.
I was very impressed with
such kind and excellent customer service.

recent_reviews.author: Natalie Hogg
recent_reviews.text: We had such lovely service from Bonnie who couldnâ€™t have been more helpful with my mum and with the dogs. We tried to give her a tip as we were so impressed with her but she wouldnâ€™t take it. How nice to get such excellent service, hope she gets some recognition for her hard work.

recent_reviews.author: Laszlo Novak
recent_reviews.text: This afternoon I visited the aquatic section, as I was looking for pond plants. From the staff there was a bearded guy, who was extremely helpful and very knowledgeable. He helped me to choose the best plants for my new little pond. He explained to me why he recommended those particular plants, what conditions they need, how big they grow, etc. He also helped me to choose the best looking healthy plants. I left the store delighted and I'm sure I will be back again soon....

recent_reviews.author: George B Dickson
recent_reviews.text: This was a return vist after a long time as the servery had seem to have improved. Clearly that was a mistake as there is no consistency in the quality & content of food delivery. On this occasion it was clearly not value for money and very poor presentation and quality of food was well below expectations.

The outside seating area is dog friendly, there's also seating in a shed so some weather protection available.
Hot drinks available from the potato van and cold drinks in the farm shop :)

recent_reviews.author: Noa Sinclair
recent_reviews.text: The best Jacket potatoâ€™s in UK for sure! The farm shop itâ€™s a great source of local produce and the views are worth visiting by itself. But regardless the place thatâ€™s also lovely, this food is definitely a must to go even if you donâ€™t live in Wales. Honestly, itâ€™s sensational!

Friends recommended we visit Hooton's for the baked potatoes. What a great place - lovely farm shop with a good range of local produce and the baked potatoes were delicious.
We chose beef chilli and 5 bean chilli, both with butter and a sprinkle of cheese - absolutely delicious!

With a Hooton's rhubarb crumble for afters, it was the perfect comfort food pairing.

Next visit, we'll be back here for sure. Recommended â¤ï¸ğŸ´ó §ó ¢ó ·ó ¬ó ³ó ¿

recent_reviews.text: Visited whilst on holiday, would recommend the farm shop and the jacket potatoes which were delicious! We also did strawberry picking down the road and enjoyed this with our little boy. Would definitely visit both again.

recent_reviews.author: Desirella Watkins
recent_reviews.text: Bought a lamb and leek pie from the frozen section of the Farm Food shop. The pie was delicious with tender lamb and firm pastry and at Â£11.50 represented excellent value.

A good time out with the baby. Lots of photo opportunities, large field of pumpkins, and a warm welcome from everyone there.

recent_reviews.text: How this place passed environmental health inspection is beyond me? Tiny tots handling pumpkins that have been got at by the rats first ! Please ensure your child is protected from disease by thoroughly washing pumpkins .There has been a Rat infestation for at least two seasons.

recent_reviews.author: Peter Roche
recent_reviews.text: Okay pumpkin patch but at Â£10.48 for parking I thought it was excessive. The cost of pumpkins I felt was extortionate. Happy to pay more than supermarkets but 4-5x as much I felt wasn't fair. We have been to a number of patches but feel this has got someway to go.

recent_reviews.author: Emma Millar
recent_reviews.text:
So was a lovely experience and beautiful place, the barn was set up great with bales of hay and pumpkins to take cute photos, kids tractors to play on, face painting and you could even try lassoing a make shift bull. Great that it's dog friendly too, a corn maze to run around and have fun in and making your way through a  pumpkin patch to hunt for the best pumpkins.
However the only thing I did not understand is why the tickets were Â£10 to park your car, and then she'll put quite a bit of money as the largest pumpkins were Â£10-15, it was a lovely time on the farm, but I do think one decent sized pumpkin around have been included in the ticket payment and then if we wanted others I think fair to pay extra for them. It was a great set up but we did drive quite far to come out to this farm and it doesn't say on the website pumpkins weren't included in the price, you should make people aware exactly what they're paying for at least.

recent_reviews.author: Lauren Powell
recent_reviews.text: Always incredibly friendly staff and extremely well put together and clean.

recent_reviews.author: Sam Wood
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful area, has the sun all day and there is a nice little stream nearby to cool off!

recent_reviews.author: Daniel Moreton
recent_reviews.text: Great place to walk. Lovely spot. Can be busy with dogs and wildlife

recent_reviews.author: Chris Thorne
recent_reviews.text: Some wicked mountain bike trails

recent_reviews.author: dan k
recent_reviews.text:
Great little farm, for a little family. Very well laid out and clean for a farm. Our 3 year old loved feeding the animals and stroking the tiny ones.
They had the usual animals you expect on a farm apart from Cows and Sheep.
The CafÃ© was well priced and had a lovely wooden soft play, where you can watch your little ones, with a couple of slides, sand and ball pits.
Outside had plenty to do.
Overall great value, probably wouldn't recommend it if it's a really really busy day.

recent_reviews.author: Marian Pickett
recent_reviews.text:
We really enjoyed our visit this morning and had great fun interacting with the animals.

The facilities are excellent and well maintained. The staff were all friendly. The entrance costs are reasonable.

It is also wheelchair accessible although the slope to the outdoor play/farm area is very steep. The surface is good but for a self propelled wheelchair it may prove a challenge. Certainly my son could not have managed it without assistance. That said, everything else was smooth and flat and there were ramps and lifts where required.

My son has already advised he would like to go back.

For families with children who love the play centres or soft play there were loads of options which would likely make the visit a longer one. There did not seem to be much of the play facilities that would have suited a wheelchair user; however, we went for the animals so this was not an issue for us.

Overall, we really enjoyed our time there and will hopefully return for some of the events in the future.

recent_reviews.author: Chris Powell
recent_reviews.text:
We had a great time there. We were able to feed and pet the animals in the barn. Our boys played on the climbing frames and zip line. They have giant pillow trampoline things that they loved as well. There was an indoor soft play.

But the highlight was the farming academy. It cost a little extra but there is a range of really fun, activities that they could go through before graduating as farmers. They absolutely loved it. And the lady that was running it was brilliant with the kids. I would highly recommend doing this.

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Watkins
recent_reviews.text: Our first time visiting here. A cute little place! We really enjoyed it. Entry fee very reasonable, as was the animal food. We didn't do the additional add on of the tractor/barrel ride as it would have added almost Â£10 on to our entry fee which I feel was a bit expensive. If it was Â£1 we probably would have gone for it. But in fairness the children didn't ask anyway as were pre occupied with everything else and we weren't outside when it was running. We loved the inside bit where you could pet the animals on the tables, and the indoor play structures were great. Outdoor bits also great fun and plenty of animals to see. I also thought the gift shop prices were very fair too and didn't mind treating them to a gift on the way out. We would visit again!

recent_reviews.author: RoyalTacticsFPS
recent_reviews.text: We had a great day out here, got here early for around half 10 (booked online which was easy enough with a lot of available slots) and stayed until the last thing on the timetable which if I remember correctly was petting and feeding the rabbits their dinner before closing for the day, my 3 year old loved that! We did watch Lottie the cow being milked, I did think all of us would get the chance to actually milk the cow but I think I just assumed wrong! It was still entertaining and educational for the older kidsâ€¦My daughter is called Lottie so it was funny the cow had the same name. Petting the rabbits, Guinea pigs and tortious was fun, be good if there were a few more for visitors to pet as it felt you were mainly watching others petting, my daughter loved the petting she got to do. The tractor ride and the cafe prices are the main reason for the 4 star rather than 5. The tractor ride was fun for my 3 year old as she is easily entertained but I noticed there wasnâ€™t much to actually look it and a lot of pens were empty which is disappointing as the long wait to go on it two times add up, itâ€™s best to go to the ride ahead of time to avoid not getting on the first ride around otherwise youâ€™ll have to wait another 10-15 minutes, not a big deal if your kids are playing/distracted but if theyâ€™re tired or impatient then make sure you get there early. The cafe was very pricey and they didnâ€™t do hot food by the time I went in there so I bought a muffin and a piece of fruit which I felt like I needed to take out a mortgage to afford. The sand box play area and the play area with the little tike cars and tractors was very fun and that kept my toddler entertained for ages, including the big tractor with the slide. We did do the walk around the lake but didnâ€™t see any fish, the camp fire area must be good if they do event nights for scout clubs ect, that could bring in some money for the farm! We really did enjoy our day and I think the staff were friendly and knowledgeable. The kind lady that worked in the gift shop was helpful when it came to me asking plenty of questions about the yearly membership and the mum group that happens on Tuesdays. Unfortunately I moved so I wonâ€™t return for a while but I hope to visit again one day! Recommend others going and doing a few round trips on the day with animal food to prolong the stay to make the entry fee worth it.

recent_reviews.author: haley jackson
recent_reviews.text: Very friendly and knowledgeable staff,lovely animals to feed and a nice little tractor ride. I'm disappointed about the play area not being open and the farm in general is looking a little tired. We sqeezed 2 hours out here such a shame as I used to be here all day with my older children

recent_reviews.author: Debbie Downton
recent_reviews.text: Very family friendly. Great for toddlers and little kids. All of the animals were very friendly and plenty of hand wash stations everywhere. Loved it! Was so much fun to be able to feed the animals and pet them

recent_reviews.author: Kim Evans
recent_reviews.text: Amazing farm, went for a birthday party. Great food and games. Tractor ride was a blast, baby animals, goat hugging is a must and generally splashing in muddy puddles.  If you're squeamish about poo and smells, I suggest a peg for your nose!!!

recent_reviews.author: Tracey Sainsbury
recent_reviews.text: Excellent place to restock our flock. Great selection of hens

recent_reviews.author: David Pollitt
recent_reviews.text: The Pumpkin Patch... What a lovely place. The kids loved the cupcake and pizza making class and baked fantastic food.

pumpkin_patches.address: Allt Y Gog Farm, Abergorlech Rd, Carmarthen SA32 7AY

recent_reviews.author: Anna Korimbocus
recent_reviews.text: This was our second visit to Brynteg Farm and I can't rate it enough. It was just as amazing as our first visit a year ago. The atmosphere in the farm is so peaceful and calm. Phil was very informative and engaging. It's clear how loved and well cared for his animals are. My son loved meeting and learning about all of the different animals, as did the rest of us! He also felt confident to try pony riding which was down to Phil's reassuring and positive approach. We really enjoyed our time at the farm today and will definitely come back for another visit!

recent_reviews.author: Rosemary Nutman
recent_reviews.text:
Friday to Saturday stay, an over night gift with friends, bought as a surprise for my 60th.
We had a love welcome from the proprietor.
The farm is set in a beautiful landscaped. They have a mixture of animals that you can pay to see as part of your package, but we didn't as we didn't include this option.

They have a hot tub that looks out onto the surrounding landscape, which during the daylight/evening hours would be spectacular...but we used it at night. This enhanced the experience for us.

Our cottage which is attached to the main house, has all you could ask for.

Fully central heated. Functional kitchen, with a small fridge/freezer. Large bathroom with a shower.
1 seperate bedroom with a double bed. A 2nd double bed is actually in the living area, which didn't matter to us.

TV in the lounge had limited viewing due to connection, but Netflix made up for that.

I would definitely recommend,  and I'd definitely go back.

recent_reviews.author: Gill Clarricoats
recent_reviews.text:
Had a fab 1st visit this morning,  my granddaughter of 19 months loved it she got to hold the animals and brush them, she also enjoyed watching the other children holding the animals. All the children took turns to stoke and feed them
The owner was very welcoming and obviously loves the animals, will definitely be returning

recent_reviews.author: Katie Wilson
recent_reviews.text:
Phil was just amazing! So passionate about his pets. Straight away he had my kids at ease, filling them with confidence to touch animals they wouldn't of done beforehand.
Brynteg Farm is a much more personalised experience, getting close to the animals you would normally see behind a fence! Allowing you to feel a connection with them, a calming effect and a sense of freedom.
It's so lovely to see someone's passion and beliefs unfold before your eyes!
Phil, you are a special person with a massive heart, not only for your pets but the effects and bonds that are created between humans and animals, which you seem to unlock.
We left here feeling fulfilled and relaxed, with massive smiles on our faces!
This place is highly recommended! *****

pumpkin_patches.address: Pen Coed Isaf Rd, Bynea, Llanelli SA14 9TW

recent_reviews.author: Trudie Willcox
recent_reviews.text: Lovely pumpkin place, not too crowded or over commercialised. Great field for kids to run around and choose their pumpkins and then suitably themed free activities in the large barn. Face painting, spooky dressing up box, mini kitchen to concoct magic potions as well as coffees etc ğŸƒğŸ•¸ï¸ğŸ„ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Anastasiya McAvoy
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic day, indoor and outdoor areas perfect for all weather, beautiful well kept animals, staff and owners are all lovely. We always say we go for a few hours and end up spending the whole day. We have made some lovely memories there and will be sure to come back.

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Jones
recent_reviews.text: We visited here on 30/07/2025. What an amazing place. So much to do like feed the barn animals, hold the rabbits they had 3 baby goats running around the barn which was the cutest thing ever. They have out door play area an indoor play area. The owners and staff are super friendly. We can't wait to come back here in a few weeks time. The animals are looked after. Thank you so much for the amazing experience.

recent_reviews.author: Milinda Wilson
recent_reviews.text:
Great little place, just a little disappointed today as my son got stuck on the peddle boats and no help come from the owners.
Amish teenagers came to the rescue, when they should of been enjoying themselves,  thank God for them..

recent_reviews.author: June Lincoln
recent_reviews.text: Great little place for children and their adults.  Animals well looked after.  Enjoyed a couple of hours here.  Loved it.  Loved the baby goats, chickens and rabbits.

recent_reviews.author: Suzanne Paws-Lodge
recent_reviews.text: We really enjoyed at the black cat. First we looked at the animals. Then we picked our pumpkins. After that we visited the cafe for food and a drink.

recent_reviews.author: Gemma Davies
recent_reviews.text: Great! We've been every year since they opened and we love it!

pumpkin_patches.address: The Barn, Mansant Ganol, Pontyates, Llanelli SA15 5RL

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Louisa
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic day out! This is by far the best Farm we've been to. The barrel rides, the raptor slide, panning for gold and pedal carts were all great additions. we spent a full day at the farm and took our own picnic. The highlight was the pig racing, great fun! We ended the day with the 'Summer fiesta' party which the kids absolutely loved. The staff were all fantastic, full of enthusiasm and everyone was so helpful and friendly. Id highly recommend a trip to Manorafon Farm to anyone visiting North Wales.

recent_reviews.author: Melissa Baugh
recent_reviews.text:
We had an amazing time here!
Was very wet and windy but it was still a great day out. Made many memories that we will cherish and feeding the animals was so fun. We will definitely be trying to make another trip here in the future.
Definitely a place to visit ğŸ™‚

recent_reviews.author: nick haywood
recent_reviews.text: The Farm Park was amazing, lots for the kids to do and lots of experiences. My 2 (3 & 6) had a great time was are still talking about meeting the rabbits. Only downside is a personal issue I have with all places that charge adults almost the same to get in! It's not on. I'm there to supervise the kids not take part in the experiences. Your views on this may differ. Due to this pricing I doubt I'll be going back.

recent_reviews.author: Jess Cardwell
recent_reviews.text: Very reasonably priced considering the amount of fun that the kids can have. Lots of them to do. Some do cost extra but optional. Can very easily spend the whole day being entertained.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Rhug Estate Farm Shop, Brasserie, Takeaway, Drive Thru & Organic Skincare

recent_reviews.author: Donna
recent_reviews.text: I always stop at Rhug estate farm Shop whilst on my camping trips in Wales. The farm shop has great locally produced items, including food, drink, pet foods, toiletries, gifts etc. Im in love with their filter coffee, but the star of the food show (for me) is the Lentil Burger! It's filling and tastes delicious. It's great to see a farm offering plant-based food for those of us who don't eat meat. (Check with staff regarding the green sauce/brioche bun if you don't consume dairy) I hope to see a few more plant-based items appearing on the shelves in the future ğŸ˜‰ The ultimate star of the show is indeed their Bison herd  They are beautifully majestic & where else do you get to see them in the UK? Take a wander on the bison walk, and hopefully, you'll get to see them up close. (The viewing platform is a nice touch!) ğŸ¦¬ğŸ¦¬ğŸ¦¬ğŸ¦¬ğŸ¦¬ ğŸ¦¬

recent_reviews.author: Marika Stanway
recent_reviews.text:
We stopped here for lunch and boy, that didn't disappoint! We ate from the grill outside and had bacon and cheese burgers, a beef burger and my own was the lentil veggie burger. They were all absolutely delicious! But I would give a special mention to my veggie one. They are often dry and like an afterthought on the menu. This wasn't! Crispy and well cooked patty on the outside and beautiful vibrant and moist veggie galore in the inside. Delicious! All the burger buns, chips and sauces were really beautiful, too.
The shop itself was a bit on the expensive side, but then ğŸ¤·ğŸ¼â€â™€ï¸ Rhug is also a working farm, so as a bonus we saw some bisons while we walked about a bit..There is a proper farm walk, but we weren't prepared for that this time, so we will go back ğŸ™‚
My 5 stars is definitely for the food and atmosphere. It was a good stop.

recent_reviews.author: Maria Burton
recent_reviews.text: Make sure you have cooler when you want to buy organic meat, great and clean facilities, car charging points , plenty of seating indoors and outdoors. Could do with more vegetables though

recent_reviews.author: Gavin Holloway
recent_reviews.text:
Superb Farm Shop, Cafe and more. Produce is very good and very local. Recommend the Welsh Rarebit in the Cafe, really good.

Does get very busy so bear that in mind. Lots of parking though.

recent_reviews.author: Steve Burgess
recent_reviews.text: My wife and I have used thisTesco for many years, and was impressed when they gave the cafe a pleasant makeover. Over time though the customers seem to have dwindled. Like us, they were mostly pensioners or small families, but the incredibly rude staff member seems to rejoice in humiliating people. I have seen older customers treated so disrespectfully, and in such a loud manner, that it amounts to bullying. I think it's time the manager spoke to this man, as he openly declares his dislike of the job. This, together with long wait times, consistently incorrect orders and poor food quality means we won't be returning in the future. This man has humiliated us once to many times.

recent_reviews.author: Sue Richards
recent_reviews.text: Llandudno Junction - Emma was very helpful on 26.04.25 12:48, I wanted to buy a certain brandy but there was none on the shelf, she very kindly checked stock & brought out the item I wanted. Very good customer service, thank you Emma! ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Louise Carter
recent_reviews.text: Just been to Tesco Llandudno junction. A young girl at the self service tills named Aaliyah was helping people. What a credit to Tesco this lovely young girl is. Such a breath of fresh air.

recent_reviews.author: Al Jones
recent_reviews.text: Very clean store and staff were really helpful and friendly. Had a small bite to eat in the cafe. Server was really happy and hot fresh food and drinks were brought out in a timely manner. Good value for money. Car park was plentiful. Store well stocked. Fuel station on site.

pumpkin_patches.address: 6, Tesco Stores Ltd, G Road, Llandudno Junction LL31 9XY

recent_reviews.author: Walker IPhone
recent_reviews.text: Bought  2 hybrid pol hens , lay appx 12 eggs a week, now very good friends with my dog ( see pics ) .very pleased with them

recent_reviews.author: David R Wright
recent_reviews.text:
We had spent some time searching for some hens but most places were either too expensive or too far away.
We feel lucky to have found Pwllhalog Farm.
They have a very comprehensive website giving details of all the poultry they supply and a lot of useful information.
When we collected our 4 new hens we were a little concerned as there were hens of just about every type and size wandering free every where in a large area of rather tatty and weedy buildings and grounds.
All the the birds were clean and healthy and they are supplied innoculated and warranted.
The manager was very pleasant and helpful.

recent_reviews.author: catherine Proctor
recent_reviews.text: My husband and I went to Pwllhalog Farm, we bought 4 Black tail chickens, they've settled in so well, we are absolutely chuffed.Thank you ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Pejay Evans
recent_reviews.text: We bought 8 hens of different varieties last year from here to take us up to 13 and I have to say they are definitely the best hens we have ever owned....We are wanting to increase our collection now due to us having a larger coop and field for them to be out all day should they wish...Super quality hens and literally on our doorstep .....what a bonus...Recommend to anyone buying poultry

recent_reviews.author: Roberto Ferraris
recent_reviews.text:
Great vegtable products and eggs  they have a dhelf with the honesty box in the front which is handy when the shop is closed.
I went a couple of times on Sunday and was closed but there were some products available.

recent_reviews.author: Leena Traverse
recent_reviews.text: Great place to go

recent_reviews.author: Darren Wilkes
recent_reviews.text: Great place to get your fresh vegetables and eggs

recent_reviews.author: Carol Rotherham
recent_reviews.text: Idyllic surrounding

pumpkin_patches.address: Derwen-cornel-smallholding, Caerwys Road, Rhuallt, Saint Asaph LL17 0TU

recent_reviews.author: Raymond Jackson
recent_reviews.text:
Great few hours pumpkin picking this morning. My 4 year old loved seeing and feeding the Reindeers, having is photo taken in all the wooden cutouts boards, and the maze. After he picked his pumpkins itâ€™s was some very nice Hot Chocolates and Marshmallows on a stick which can be toasted on the fire.

Staff where super friendly and had worked super hard to get everything clean and ready after yesterdayâ€™s floods.

If you havenâ€™t been then definitely grab your kids (donâ€™t forget the wellies) and go check it out.

recent_reviews.author: Nikki Hannah
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely little farm to see the Reindeer, they are well looked after and all staff involved with the reindeer are knowledgeable. We got to feed the reindeer, there was a fire pit to toast marshmallows (Â£2 a stick), hot chocolates were lovely ğŸ˜‹ nice photo opportunities around and face painting (Â£3 each)
On arrival we paid Â£3 each and was each given a wooden Christmas decoration to write a wish on to put on the tree and a candy cane. Look forward to visiting again

recent_reviews.author: Steven Goodram
recent_reviews.text: A nice little site with clean facilities and plenty of play area for the kids The guys on site where great and very helpful,  they had about 10 Reindeer on site the kids would love to see, A pleasant stay the 2 night we where there

recent_reviews.author: Kirsty Jayne
recent_reviews.text:
Cannot express how amazing this place is! We have never been welcomed by such a friendly bunch of blokes who made sure we had the best stay we could have wished for! Family friendly, safe, vibrant yet peaceful and quaint. Pods were spotlessly clean, the welcome basket was such a nice touch! Wood provided and charcoal for your own personal BBQ and chiminea. Shower block/loos- again- meticulously clean!

More than highly recommend this site, Clint the owner, and his 3 co-workers (that we met), were just brilliant! Ensuring we were well looked after during our stay, and we even had a visit from Billie, the very friendly reindeer! Fishing in the beautiful pools was also a real treat.

Cannot wait to get back here! Thank you Tarvin Sands for an amazing break! You're all awesome ğŸ˜Š

pumpkin_patches.address: Christmas Farm, Llay Rd, Cefn-y-bedd, Llay, Wrexham LL12 9UG

recent_reviews.author: tanya Brindle
recent_reviews.text:
â¸»
We stumbled across this hidden gem of a farm shop on our way to Corwen. Sadly, itâ€™s closed Sundayâ€“Wednesday, so we couldnâ€™t pop back straight awayâ€”but that just gives us the perfect excuse to return! The staff are friendly, the butchers are knowledgeable, and the whole shop has such a warm, welcoming ambience. The homemade produce is to die forâ€”scotch eggs and pork pie heaven! Weâ€™ll be heading over Wednesday morning for more of their amazing Denver steak and flavoured sausage , and no doubt calling in again on the way home. Canâ€™t wait!

recent_reviews.author: Samantha Crichton
recent_reviews.text: Me my husband and daughter have been for the first time today. My daughter loved the lady who served us. She was very polite and friendly. We bought the beef tacos which were amazing. Absolutely gorgeous. Will be back again x

recent_reviews.author: Ja Lloyd
recent_reviews.text: I've been going here for a while. It's a very good farm shop selling local produce. 3 weeks after a burst appendix operation and loads of pain and discomfort, the first time I saw a smile on my lads face was when I gave him a steak pie from swans. He was eating tiny bits like a sparrow. First decent thing he'd eaten in weeks. After a crash on a local road, closed, a year ago. we drove about 10 miles around the houses to get to swans farm shop, just to get the weekends bacon and tomatoe sausages. ğŸ˜ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Neesha
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely love this place! Clive and Gail are so lovely and the produce is very yummy! Love treating myself to their chicken pies for a naughty lunch! Very homely/family feel and the staff make you feel very welcome. Xx

pumpkin_patches.address: 1 A5104, Ffordd Corwen, Treuddyn, Mold CH7 4LL

recent_reviews.author: Antony Wheeler
recent_reviews.text: Wouldn't make my omelette with any other eggs, the best by far. Great service and great people.

recent_reviews.author: Justina Zagorskiene
recent_reviews.text:
The tastiest potatoes and fresh eggs. friendly
service, I recommend a visit.

recent_reviews.author: denise hughes (Grosvenor-Davies)
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic farm grow potatoes great price free range trays of eggs are fresh and tasty

recent_reviews.author: mark hill
recent_reviews.text: Always have good fresh eggs

recent_reviews.author: Alice Roxana Matei
recent_reviews.text: Good

recent_reviews.author: Linc The Sink
recent_reviews.text:
Very good place.
Lots for kids to do and food prices ridiculously cheap.
Would definitely be returning.

recent_reviews.author: Hayley Phennah
recent_reviews.text: A fantastic family day out for everyone. For just Â£13.95 you really canâ€™t go wrong, thereâ€™s so much to do. The food selection is excellent value for money, there are no hidden costs when you arrive except for food/ice cream - every single activity on site is included and the kids were kept entertained the whole day. Staff are fantastic and the ice cream was delicious.

recent_reviews.author: Annuncia Skeldon
recent_reviews.text: This has got to be one of the best days out on Wirral. Not just the maze but so many other activities to keep kids entertained. Really great value to get all that included in the entry price. Really reasonably priced food too. So important for families to have somewhere fun to go within their budget. Well done to those who run it.

recent_reviews.author: S B
recent_reviews.text:
Review based on under 3s experience.

Absolutely amazing! If you're a young toddler parent at under 3s it's even more worth the price but I would still come if he was over 3 because this is such a fun outdoor and indoor experience at such a good price. There is so much to do and you definitely need the full day. We're currently still here but it already deserves my review. So far my toddler has played on the outdoor playground the jumping balloons and the indoor soft play which may I add is brilliant, it's so big and clean given it's on a farm! The layout is great better than any soft play that's open all year round. Really wish they would stay open all year round and make something suitable for all seasons because this is such a fun place to be. I called before hand and the man who picked up the phone was also ever so friendly and informative. We will be back! Wish we got a season ticket.

recent_reviews.author: Yuqi Fan
recent_reviews.text:
What a hidden gem! This lovely little farm is completely free to enter, with free parking right next to itâ€”canâ€™t beat that. ğŸğŸš—

There are loads of adorable animals to see (some even have their own names on signsâ€”so cute!), and you can buy feed to give them a little snack.

The staff are super friendly and clearly care about the animals. Itâ€™s such a great spot to take kids for a fun and relaxed day out.

Highly recommend for families or anyone who just loves animals!

recent_reviews.author: Natasha Carr
recent_reviews.text: Visited today for the first time. Lots of parking and free entry. Animals feed available to buy for Â£1. Friendly staff on the front and also gave some vegetables for the animals as donation at the front. Cute way to spend a morning as a family. Very happy to leave a donation to support running of the farm

recent_reviews.author: brenda waters
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant day out with my nephews children. Plenty to see and do. Interaction with the animals. Children's play and picnic area. Plus a restaurant. I would highly recommend, you won't be disappointed!

recent_reviews.author: Jemma Williams
recent_reviews.text:
Can't believe it's free to visit! Food pots to feed animals only Â£1 each. Lovely place to spend an afternoon feeding the animals. Also has lots of hand washing stations, clean toilets, a cafe, picnic area and children's play areas.
bought some lovely fresh eggs to take home too

pumpkin_patches.address: Boundary Rd, Bidston, Birkenhead, Prenton CH43 7PD
2 Manor Farm Cres, Capenhurst, Chester CH1 6HL

recent_reviews.author: Melody Warner
recent_reviews.text: had an absolutely amazing stay here! we stayed for 4 nights and wouldâ€™ve stayed longer if we could! everything was clean and the campsite was lovely and cosy, we loved relaxing in the day and exploring the area and the forests! the kitchen was always clean and stocked with milk, the bathroom and showers were clean and had absolutely no faults! Dafydd was always around to help out and made sure we were okay! cannot recommend it enough! will definitely be back, thankyou for such a lovely camping experience :)

recent_reviews.author: Wendy Scrase
recent_reviews.text: Just stayed overnight in the bell tent for a 10th birthday party and a family gathering. It was so comfortable and spacious. The highlight for me was the dawn chorus! The sites are really well spread out and private. The bell tent is quite luxurious with a very comfy bed, warm duvet and rugs all around. Facilities are excellent and very clean. Thereâ€™s even a well supplied shop! Lovely friendly staff. I shouldâ€™ve stayed longer if it wasnâ€™t for work commitments.

recent_reviews.author: David
recent_reviews.text:
Well worth a visit for fresh vegetables and local products
I live 20 miles away so outside the vegetable box delivery area
We make the car journey every 2 weeks just to have access to this amazing produce including the fantastic bakery lines. Thank you to people who run this place you are our modern day food ambassadors and the produce is of the highest standards.
Keep up the great work

recent_reviews.author: Jessica Hodge
recent_reviews.text: Some of the best UK gown tomatoes I've ever eaten - juicy and flavourful. Definitely the best UK grown aubergine I've ever had. Superb basil, absolutely packed with estragole.

recent_reviews.author: Ewan Mason
recent_reviews.text: very decent sleepover john was a bit annoying but other than that prettyn  decent and free kfc so that is pretty chill and john is sus

recent_reviews.author: Jessica Lazenby
recent_reviews.text: Really enjoyed our strawberry picking today! Very friendly and welcoming. Also purchased coffee and ice cream which were all fresh and amazing!

recent_reviews.author: Paula Roberts
recent_reviews.text:
What a lovely way to spend a morning picking strawberries at Porth Farm
Followed by delicious coffee and cake and ice cream and of course the sweet strawberries ğŸ“ ğŸ˜
There's a play park and a zip wire too !
Definitely recommend a visit ğŸ˜

recent_reviews.author: sammy Jones
recent_reviews.text: Made to feel welcome, my 2 boys really enjoyed picking the strawberries, they also enjoyed the play area bit. Strawberries were lovely, Looking forward to picking veg in the summer

recent_reviews.author: Elaine Moore
recent_reviews.text: So happy to have had my first taste ofthis season's Porth Farm strawberries today. Fabulous place, lovely people, deserves everyone's support!

pumpkin_patches.address: Porth Farm, Moat Ln, Caersws SY17 5SE

recent_reviews.author: Ezra-May Hollis
recent_reviews.text: Kids absolutely love it here (3 & 4 years old) there's so much to do here to tire them out! There's a massive indoor and outdoor play area's with big slides to run up and down of. They love seeing and feeding the animals too!

recent_reviews.author: Christopher Davies
recent_reviews.text: The perfect mix of indoor and outdoor space for a little one to burn off their energy. No need to worry about socks getting dirty for the slide, they (and you) can keep your shoes on. Grab a coffee, feed a donkey, and the goats. Then run some more. Great place for a kids party.

recent_reviews.author: Jo Thomas
recent_reviews.text: The grand kids love it here. There are plenty of large spaces for them to run and play both inside and outside. It offers a large wooden play area for babies and older children, and the kids slso get to feed the small array of animals.

recent_reviews.author: danni fender
recent_reviews.text:
A great day out. I was really pleased with the great pricing. The set up outside was a big field with the animals around the edges so it was nice and open in the middle where you could sit and the kids could play.

Small but between the indoor and outdoor play areas, animals and the woodland walk up to the duck pond (no ducks atm but the girls had lots of fun climbing trees and running around the wood)

There were good paths, so despite it having rained tonnes in the days before it wasn't mucky. Food was your basic chicken nuggets, Sausages etc and chips. There was plenty of parking

pumpkin_patches.address: Tai Mawr Wy, Merthyr Tydfil CF48 1LN

recent_reviews.author: Jessica Bowring
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely lovely time picking pumpkins. Karen and her family were so lovely, welcoming and informative. The selection of pumpkins was fab, lots of different sizes and colours. They also had some hand-rared lambs in a barn for the children to interact with. The field for the Ivy Tower was open for us to explore and they had some delicious burgers available. Highly recommend a visit. We will be back at Christmas!

recent_reviews.author: Dayne Stone
recent_reviews.text: The Ivy Tower is a quaint folly which has in recent years fallen into a state of disrepair. It can be see from miles around. We spotted it from the valley below and drove up Fairy Lane to park and access through the sheep-filled fields surrounding. At sunset you can see the rays leaking through windows and doors. Nice to visit along with the reservoir.

recent_reviews.author: robert hill
recent_reviews.text: We took our 2 kids to pick some pumpkins for Halloween and we had a really good time, lovely couple of hours out! The pumpkins were great, the barn was brilliant with all the arts and crafts. The kids throughly enjoyed. The reason I have 4 stars was because the burger van was way over priced and the burgers were tiny. It cost Â£7 for a small cheese burger for the kids and it had one small burger, 1 slice of cheese and 1 slice of small bacon when it was meant to he a bacon stack burger. It cost us Â£14 for 2 burgers smaller than a rustler, thought it would have come with chips and a drink for the price and being for kids. We will come again but won't be using the burger van.

recent_reviews.author: Todd Marshall
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic tree farm and worth a trip up there just for the views. Thanks for a brilliant tree!

recent_reviews.author: David Hall
recent_reviews.text: Absolute worst pumpkin Iâ€™ve had. Would rate lower than 1 star if possible!

recent_reviews.author: Adam Gair

recent_reviews.author: Tommo
recent_reviews.text: Worst pump king Iâ€™ve ever ate

recent_reviews.author: McKenzie Sinclair
recent_reviews.text: Best pumpkins around

recent_reviews.author: James Christopher â€œOldWelshGuyâ€ Edwards
recent_reviews.text:
What a hidden treasure this place is, a family working farm bringing livestock to the people at close quarters.

The animals are under cover making this a great venue for a rainy day.

Visitors interact with the animals, with staff and family, young and old on hand to answer questions.

There's also a small pedal cart area again undercover.

Seeing smiling children holding chicks and young piglets, feeding animals, interacting with them just warms the heart.

The sun was shining and families were sat outside the barn enjoying snacks and drinks from the farm snack shack.

We were there a little over 90 minutes and it was a fantastic experience from start to finish.

recent_reviews.author: M
recent_reviews.text: Came here for a hour out with the kids. Very interactive with all the farm animals, would be happy to return again.

recent_reviews.author: Maxine Beaumont
recent_reviews.text: Had a really lovely time visiting Pentwyn farm and meeting Father Christmas. The barn had such a pleasant festive atmosphere. Santa was extremely engaging and funny. Kids and adults enjoyed.

recent_reviews.author: Stephanie Davies
recent_reviews.text: So lovely to be able to interact with the animals. Thank you

recent_reviews.author: Chris V
recent_reviews.text: Having made an online order with this company I was really surprised with the speed, quality of packaging and consideration taken in shipping the items. Their wax foundation needs special mention as it is simply sublime. By far the best I have found from.any supplier. Really good.stuff.

recent_reviews.author: Keith Morgan
recent_reviews.text: Outstanding after sales customer service. Purchased a 9 frame Konigan extractor only 12 months ago from them. Motor burnt out as I started this seasons extraction. Contacted Ian at Old Castle Farm Hives; no questioning, no argument, just great service in replacing the motor within 24 hours, plus video link with him to remove the old motor. Absolutely over the moon with this excellent service. Cannot recommend this company enough.

recent_reviews.author: Ian H
recent_reviews.text:
A nice set up. A showroom with a lot more bee related items than you'd expect. Everything in stock from foundation and all the expected consumables, right up to stainless steel equipment for the more commercial keeper. Owner was helpful and knowledgeable, with an open mind to different beekeeping methods. He can even supply queens if needed. Good to have such wide range of kit not too far away.
Not over priced. Shop prices were the same as online and competitive with other outlets. Nothing to complain about.

recent_reviews.author: Jacqueline Cole
recent_reviews.text:
I ordered a 30 kg honey bucket I did not expect this to arrive until the Friday.To my amazement it arrived the following day even though I had missed the timescale.
The honey bucket is brilliant and the packing was very good.
Thank you to the lovely lady I spoke to with a query over the product before ordering she was so helpful.

recent_reviews.author: Steve Mills
recent_reviews.text: Good fresh produce, a selection of delicious cakes too! We will be definitely shopping there regularly. There are also a fabulous collection of plants and flowers for all occasions. We wandered through the shed/ outbuilding section too but just a little too expensive for our budget. Highly recommend to anyone to make a trip.

recent_reviews.author: Nathan Williams
recent_reviews.text: Great little shop with great products and produce. The veg was fresh and reasonably priced. Staff were friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Rocio Perez-Tattam
recent_reviews.text: I am so thankful that we live within easy driving distance of the Mount Pleasant Farm Shop. The veg is absolutely lush - particularly the potatoes (of which there are several varieties), carrots, parsnips and leeks. More expensive than the supermarket for sure, but totally worth it in terms of quality and supporting local trade. You can also buy local eggs, honey and cakes, and there are a number of other businesses on site - gift shop, florist and sheds. Try it out - you are in for a treat!

recent_reviews.author: Rhiannon Taylor
recent_reviews.text: Lovely shop fresh produce at fair prices, pleasant staff, beautiful gifts for all occasions and ages hand crafted and unique. Fantastic florist who is happy to help you with any requests, easy to get to and easy to park.

pumpkin_patches.address: Mount Pleasant Farm, Farm Road, Cefn Cribwr, Bridgend CF32 0HA

recent_reviews.author: Oldandnew 123
recent_reviews.text: An absolutely Great Day. We had so much fun. The Pumpkins were well priced. We go as a family every year. I highly recommend.  ğŸƒ ğŸƒ ğŸƒ ğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Julie Brown
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic views over Carntown and Abercynon.  The walk takes you past Llechwen Hall and into Llanfabon.  There's a nice little pub to enjoy a well earned beer part way through the walk

recent_reviews.text: Hiw amazing is this place, took my children to pony club. Staff were great horses were amazing lovely little farm highly recommend ğŸ‘Œ

recent_reviews.author: Kerry
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely place snd do much fun

recent_reviews.author: Claire Greenhouse
recent_reviews.text: Attended women in the woods today.  Had a fab time, cooked a pumpkin on an open fire. Made bread and carved a butter knife to spread the butter.  Was so much fun and such good value.  If you want to go somewhere different to switch off and reconnect with nature then I'd highly recommend ğŸ‘Œ

recent_reviews.author: Julie Brown

recent_reviews.author: Kabir Abdul
recent_reviews.text: Good day out, nice place, decent variety of animals and that's about it. Things to make place better - need much better toilet facility, very poor! Most of the wash stations didn't work properly, need better play areas for kids and it's expensive for what it is. Extra charges for animal encounters, animal feed should be Â£1. Foam party was cool, kids enjoyed that, but as it was at 4pm, we had to wait along time as you will go around the park in 2hrs max, should bring it forward a bit. If you haven't been then it's a decent day out with kids, but doesn't have repeat visit appeal.

recent_reviews.author: Melanie Gant
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous park. My 10 year old granddaughter loved seeing the different animals - and particularly enjoyed feeding the goats and llamas and being able pet  them. Nicely laid out with picnic areas  and lovely play areas too..will definitely visit again

recent_reviews.author: Iovane Marques
recent_reviews.text:
Went on a family outing to the Park (2 adults, 1 child) and everyone had a fantastic time. Even as you walk in towards reception you already get to see some gorgeous peacocks and ducks.

Friendly greeting at reception and easy sign in.
We were handed our animal feed (purchased in advance with our tickets) and explained the rules very clearly.

We stopped for a snack first at one of their picnic tables and then proceeded through the park.
Amazing animals right as you start with information about them on a poster by the enclosure.
We were extremely lucky to have been there at feeding time and we got to see one of the volunteers feed the meerkats and he even took the time to tell us about their personalities and behaviour. It was amazing to see the animals up close and being cared for so nicely.

As we carried on, we got to see some animals we donâ€™t usually see in these farms, like a Kookaburra and a skunk. Continued on towards the goats who were hungry fellas and very gentle, my child had a great time feeding them. We then headed towards the llamas and alpacas who were also very gentle and easy to feed, it was a fantastic experience.

Throughout our visit we got to see swans, ducks, horses, lemurs, capybaras and even wallabies! One of the wallabies had a baby in their pouch! So cute!!

Foam party at 4pm by the reception which all the kids seemed to be having a blast with!

Iâ€™ll also mention that thereâ€™s a lovely play area for smaller children with a sand pit and some little houses.

There were hand washing stations all throughout so you could consistently wash your hands after interacting with the animals. If I have one small note, it would be that a few of them had run out of soap but that wasnâ€™t that big of an issue as there was always another one nearby. Weâ€™ll just bring some hand sanitiser next time, no biggie.

We didnâ€™t sign up for the animal interaction this time - they have goats, bunnies, Guinea pigs and tortoises - but we will for sure go for it next time.

All in all, it was a brilliant time, there is something for everybody there. You can see the animals are well taken care of and they all looked very relaxed. The staff/volunteers are incredibly nice and more than one took the time to have a chat with us about the animals.

Will definitely be visiting again.

recent_reviews.author: Kharis Hayne
recent_reviews.text: Genuinely a really lovey place, animals are very well cared for and interactive. We were able to get involved and meet so many on the mini experiences. Taking your time to enjoy everything you can easily spend the full day. Seems the whole place is really made for the animals. Staff are really knowledgeable and friendly. My only down side is we were let to believe the reptile meet and greet to be more interactive, felt a bit, misleading. It's a extra show room to view reptiles and insects. Over all a good day out for all the family

recent_reviews.author: David Silvester
recent_reviews.text: Tremendous value and everything I've bought has been very nice quality

recent_reviews.author: bryony davies
recent_reviews.text: We do equine feed, supplements and clothing etc. trying to keep good quality and pricing throughout the store. We have a range of meat that we can cater for businesses and public alike. Pop in and see what we can do for you ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: Helen Mawson
recent_reviews.text: Fantastic quality products, proper no frills local farm shop that includes an equestrian, farm and small animal supplies outlet.

recent_reviews.author: David L Silvester
recent_reviews.text:
I've visited a couple of times now and I got to say how impressed I am with the quality of the meat I've bought. I bought some steaks, pork and and some burgers.
I picked up a 1Â½kg joint of pork which I cooked for Christmas Day. I made a  marinade for the whole joint, OMG it cooked beautifully and was so tender.
I filled my Freezer completely, I spent just over Â£74.00 which with how much I bought was fantastic value

recent_reviews.author: Victoria Wontner
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely loved seeing all the new born animals. Lovely walk through the land. Super friendly farmers.

recent_reviews.author: Stevo

Commercial, refined-sugar-charged honey is nothing compared to it so if youâ€™ve never tried proper, natural honey, i canâ€™t recommend it enough. Well worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Huw Jones
recent_reviews.text: Get your free range  fresh eggs here - nice people. Or near the entrance to Cefn Onn park, Sundays 12noon. Local honey, beef, bacon and gammon too.

recent_reviews.author: Kieran Harris
recent_reviews.text: Lovely place to go for a walk or camp. Met the farmer David. Top bloke! Very nice family & top quality eggs! ğŸ‘Œ

recent_reviews.author: Ruth
recent_reviews.text: This garden centre is lovely at Christmas.  But cafe isn't great. They serve nothing between 11 and 12 except toast. So I find that bit strange for a cafe. As most people like a brunch . They were just all standing doing nothing.  Just for people to be aware if they fancy a late breakfast there.

recent_reviews.author: Sherman
recent_reviews.text: Like to wander around here. Always have something interesting to look for. Thank you for the selection of products, and the good planting here.

recent_reviews.author: Mel Hill
recent_reviews.text: Lovely garden centre with a large selection of indoor and outdoor products. Dogs allowed on leads, good disability access and helpful staff. Ample parking too.

recent_reviews.author: Irene Bressington
recent_reviews.text: Love this garden centre and they do the best biscoffi frappe.

pumpkin_patches.address: Old Nantgarw Rd, Nantgarw, Cardiff CF15 7UN

recent_reviews.author: Laura
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful place, attention to detail is lovely. The hosts couldnâ€™t do enough for us, they met us when we arrived to take us to our tent in there Land Rover, they made sure the hot tub was heated up ready and lit the fire inside the tent for us so it was warm. Provided us with more than enough wood for the fire. Gave us an extra light and some batteries for the lights inside the tent. We had delicious fresh pizzaâ€™s delivered to us on the evening and a breakfast hamper brought to us in the morning. Such lovely peaceful surroundings, done some stargazing by the fire pit and listened out for the owls and foxes. Very cosy, loved that there were lots of blankets and a hot water bottle. Was warm enough, even in December. One thing Iâ€™d add is a little bin, there isnâ€™t one in the tent, we like to be respectful and not leave a mess. Would definitely return again with our two young girls in the summer. Thanks Tog Farm for a lovely stay :)

recent_reviews.author: Toby G-S
recent_reviews.text: Had a great stay at the family run TOG farm, the farm is in a great setting surrounded with amazing picturesque views. Lots of great animals on the farm too, some rare breeds you arenâ€™t likely to find at similar places. Also situated in close proximity to Cardiff and Caerphilly if you fancy something more urban.  Highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: Jordan Embo
recent_reviews.text: We have just come away from a wonderful weekend away to Tog Farm. I organised a surprise birthday get-away for my girlfriend and Tog farm definitely did not disappoint. From the moment I booked to the minute I left, I was greeted with excellent customer service and fantastic communication. When first booking, I highlighted that this was a trip for my girlfriendâ€™s birthday and the host was incredible. She went above and beyond decorating the pitch with balloons and banners, as well as organising a birthday cake. The host was attentive in ensuring we had everything we needed and ensuring everything was in place before our arrival. When we arrived, we were greeted by a host who was welcoming and helpful. Due to the weather conditions, she provided us with a lift down to the field and on our return. Facilities provided were clean. Additional duvets were provided due to the cold weather. Overall, we had a fantastic experience at Tog Farm and look forward to planning our next visit.

recent_reviews.author: Jacob Hussain
recent_reviews.text:
Our stay at Tog farm couldnâ€™t have been any better. The staff were amazing and very accommodating. We woke up feeling very refreshed.
Couldnâ€™t have had a better bank holiday.

Thank you tog farm youâ€™re the best!!

pumpkin_patches.address: Pentwyngwyn Rd, FARM, Rudry, Caerphilly CF83 3DG

recent_reviews.author: Scott Goddard
recent_reviews.text: We bought some speciality heirloom tomatoes, salad leaves and basil today from you in Hwest farmers market and it made the finest salad combination with feta cheese I've had in years, wow  , thank you

recent_reviews.author: Daniel Sawyer
recent_reviews.text: Good selection of veg, even through the winter. Everything just has more flavour, from winter sprouts and parsnips to the summer strawberries and salads, well worth a visit!

recent_reviews.author: Ben Reade
recent_reviews.text:
A new find to me as a regular visitor to west wales and what a treat. Not just organic, but veg thatâ€™s unique and special. When ingredients are this good, cooking is simple.

What better than a plate of ripe mix tomatoâ€™s!

recent_reviews.author: Lea Schuster
recent_reviews.text: Nice small shop with different vegetables. Good price and super delicious.

recent_reviews.author: Dale Stephens Bar46
recent_reviews.text:
Cambrian Trees is truly a hidden gem! From the moment we arrived, the local and special atmosphere made the experience unforgettable. This small, family-run business works seamlessly as a team, creating a welcoming environment that made us feel right at home.

Our 2-year-old absolutely adored every momentâ€”from meeting the donkeys to exploring the charming little shop. The warm drinks were a perfect touch on a chilly day, but the highlight was undoubtedly the magical winter wonderland they had created. It was like stepping into a festive dream! So much thought & effort has gone into this.

We canâ€™t wait to return next year. Cambrian Trees is a special tradition in the making for us and a must-visit for families looking for something unique and heartwarming. Highly recommend!

recent_reviews.author: Carys Evans
recent_reviews.text: Great day out, highly recommend. Plenty of activities for the children to do in the barn. Thereâ€™s a sheep in the barn for the children to pet. And the two farm dogs which love a cuddle. Lots of pumpkins to pick from. Super tasty cakes. Take wellies as the track can get a bit muddy. We went for a lovely walk around the Christmas trees and tagged one for Christmas.

recent_reviews.author: Catrin Evans
recent_reviews.text: We recently went pumpkin picking at Cambrian Trees, and was thoroughly impressed! We were so satisfied by the variety of pumpkins! Adam and Jane were incredibly welcoming and helpful, the cakes were delicious, and we really enjoyed the atmosphere! We had a wonderful experience, and i canâ€™t recommend Cambrian Trees enough for a fantastic family day out! We also got to tag our Christmas tree, and are already looking forward to revisiting Christmas time to collect our treeğŸ„

recent_reviews.author: Nicholas Thompson
recent_reviews.text: Very good service. Throughly helpful staff, answered all our questions, gave good advice. Good price as well 100% will be using again

pumpkin_patches.address: Bryneithyn Farm Ysbyty Ystwyth, Ystrad Meurig SY25 6DE

recent_reviews.author: Arron Nicholson
recent_reviews.text: Good deli with wide range of tinned and jarred delicacies. The food is more artisan than everyday for sure. They've got a counter for pork pies etc and a small fridge with a few cold meats and veg. Good selection of local booze too. Very friendly and very easy to spend a ton of cash on stuff you've never heard of.

recent_reviews.author: Andy Evans
recent_reviews.text:
Our first time here, but will be definitely returning.
We had a BBQ Pork Paninni and Cappuccino each. Lovely food and reasonably priced.

recent_reviews.author: Avril Cowley

Fabulous Coffee!
Lovely, friendly service and a great selection of local, speciality food products.

recent_reviews.author: Antoinette Piercy
recent_reviews.text: What a great place such a varied and unusual variety of produce great cheeses wines and loads of other items plus you can chill with a coffee make a detour to go highly recommend

pumpkin_patches.address: Cherry Picked Farm Shop, Sarnau, Llandysul SA44 6QT

recent_reviews.author: Benedict O'Leary
recent_reviews.text:
An amazing find situated just outside the community of St Dogmaels on the road to Cardigan.

Fresh homegrown organic fruit and vegetables mainly grown on the premises. If you are looking for fresh, locally grown and seasonal produce this is the place to come! When you walk in, if you're a foodie, it's like walking into a sweet shop of fresh fruit and veg. You can pick up a range of squash and pumpkin, Swiss chard, cavolo Nero, calabrese, carrots, potatoes not to mention apples, pears and other fruit.

Preserves from local companies such as Foxhill Preserves and fresh bread from Crwst are available too, as well as organic tinned beans and pulses.

Open from Thursday to Saturday (10:00 - 5:30) and is one of the few places open on Sunday (12:00 - 3:00). Covid restrictions mean that no more than two people are allowed in at a time, so there may be a slight wait, but it's definitely worth it.

recent_reviews.author: Dave Hall
recent_reviews.text: Great place to get fresh produce, quality was amazing.

recent_reviews.author: Chris Willis
recent_reviews.text: If you're in the area, this is an absolute must. Fabulous fresh produce, local and organically grown. Very sensible distance arrangements etc. Great variety  - while we were there, they had huge bunches of basil (perfect for pesto).

recent_reviews.author: Clive Jenkins
recent_reviews.text: Just a wonderful place to go for freshly grown local food, especially at Christmas. It's like the Santa's Grotto of Veg. Always pleasant staff with a smile.

recent_reviews.author: neil solly
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Lygo
recent_reviews.text: Such a lovely time wandering through the sunflower fields - our teenage boys were hesitant at this suggestion for a family activity, but everyone loved it ğŸŒ»

recent_reviews.author: John Llewelyn
recent_reviews.text: Great visit to the sunflower farm. Lovely to see different varieties and colours. Play area was a big hit with the kids, thought they were going to stay. Disc Golf looks fun, we are coming back with friends for that. Burgers and coffees were spot on. Simple outdoors fun.

recent_reviews.author: Gemma Handley
recent_reviews.text:
We went to Pembrokeshire Sunflowers today following some recommendations off Facebook.

We had a lovely time here, a nice long walk all the way through the sunflower fields trying to find all the scare crows made by local schools.

Afterwards we went down the amazing wooden play area, it's a long walk down the farm path, it feels as if your walking into someone's property but when you find it, it's amazing our kids loved it, especially the rope swing and the amazing tree house structures!

When we got back to the car there were two containers which had been opened and was a bar and some sweets, there was also someone doing face painting!

I would highly recommend getting a visit in before it closes for the summer!

recent_reviews.author: Eleanor Croot
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful farm, reasonably priced and amazing honey! We had a great time here with our children and I highly recommend visiting if youâ€™re in the area. Super friendly staff :)

recent_reviews.author: Tricia Peters
recent_reviews.text:
We stopped here to go to the Lavender Tearoom but also ended up buying plants from the garden centre as well. It wasn't a  big garden centre but there was a good choice of plants at good prices.
The tearoom was lovely- food and drinks were on a par with most places pricewise. We had drinks and cake which we enjoyed. It was clean and tidy, staff were friendly and there was a lovely view- particularly if sat outside.
There was an ice cream parlour too but we didn't try it.
Plenty of parking.
Will definitely visit again.

recent_reviews.author: Simon Wooding
recent_reviews.text:
Went and had our Breakfast this morning, they were crazy busy, the staff were amazing and so helpful and friendly. Rachel the Chef was silly busy and on her own, really should have someone helping with the cooking.
Did this stop her from doing a brilliant Job and cooking food to a very High standard, no it did not.
Myself and my Wife think she is a delightful person and we hope she gets the help she really needs.
They all work so so hard and I hope the public appreciates what they do.

recent_reviews.author: Harry Brookes
recent_reviews.text: Lovely simple garden centre with a tearoom for getting your gardening goods. seeds and vegetable seeds, Potts and potting, loads of compost. Shrubs, trees, Annuals and perennials and some houseplants and garden features inside.

recent_reviews.author: Andrew Cornford
recent_reviews.text:
Great little Garden centre, with friendly knowledgeable staff. A good selection of plants, shrubs, trees, gifts, tools, compost and garden funiture. As far as I'm aware there is local delivery. The centre is wheel chair accessible as is the cafÃ¨, which serves a good selection of cakes, ice cream, tea, coffee and hot food.
There are toilet facilities for customers and ample park. Just be aware when you drive from the centre you are joining the A470 trunk road which can be busy.

pumpkin_patches.address: Llanrwst Road, Pentrefelin, Colwyn Bay LL28 5TH

recent_reviews.author: SCTT G
recent_reviews.text: Stopped by for some fresh veg. Lovely wee barista coffee shop inside too using speciality coffee. We picked up fresh garlic, courgette and lemon. They had Phenomenal looking big heirloom tomato punnets too. Lovely place and proper produce grown on site.

recent_reviews.author: chris o'callaghan
recent_reviews.text: What a fantastic gem hidden away in north Wales! We booked a 2hr donkeys walk through Airbnb and it has been one of the standout things of our holiday for my two boys!  They loved looking after and grooming them donkeys and then lead them on a lovely walk though the countryside with Chris.  Chris took the time to talk to us about the countryside and plants/animals we came across.  Just all round a great experience where we were made to feel very welcome by both the volunteers and donkeys!

recent_reviews.author: Francesca Whitting
recent_reviews.text: Great coffee and cakes but the most impressive thing was the produce. Beautiful quality and so fresh.

recent_reviews.author: Terry Hughes

recent_reviews.author: Michael Whittle

recent_reviews.text:
Perfect. Genuily perfect to me. Nice farm, plenty of animals. You can feed some but not all. Food and toilet. Gift shop has loads for kids. Not too expensive or for ticket entry either. Staff were genuinely and quite lively and funny
Pony ride was brilliant. My disabled son managed very well and I really appreciate the patient staff. Park on Site too for kids and some things adults can have a go. It was honestly fantastic. I'm going again whenever I can. Loved it

recent_reviews.author: Lance Owen-Williams
recent_reviews.text: Brilliant day out for the little ones. Our 2.5 year old loved her time there, was thrilled to be able to feed and pet the animals. We got to hold the rabbits and ride a pony. The park is excellent and well maintained. A lovely cafe with plenty of options of food and hot and cold drinks too. Great day out, would recommend!

recent_reviews.author: CJ
recent_reviews.text:
A lovely little farm for the kids.
The food is good on the farm.
Family of 4 itâ€™s Â£30.
Animals look well kept and the play park is really good.
Facilities on site are really clean.
Nice to have a place to take the kids.
You can hold/pet the animals.
We will be back again soon.

recent_reviews.author: Dee Benson
recent_reviews.text:
Arrived about 12pm lunchtime, weather OK.
First visit with daughter and twin grandsons age 3.
Easy parking, smiling staff and well laid out.
Park excellent, plenty to do.
Wide variety of animals to pet and feed.
Took a picnic, stayed for 3 hours and could have stayed longer but had other plans as well for the day.
Excellent ice cream, reasonably priced.
Would highly recommend.
Thanks to all of you for a wonderful day out ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Abbey Carter

The milk shed is a clear winner along with the pasties.
Recommend a visit to anyone
