recent_reviews.text: Found this place today by chance and what a great find with farm fresh milk that can be bought in a traditional glass bottle from the vending machine. A good selection of fruit and veg and hot and cold pies etc. Great coffee and a selection of Gluten Free cakes available as well. We even came back to take away more of the Lemon Drizzle and get the dogs a sausage roll. Staff were all really friendly as well which makes a difference. Glad we found this great little place and we will certainly be back for more of the milk, coffee and cake!

recent_reviews.author: Catherine Smith (Kate)
recent_reviews.text: Fabulous visit - exceptional host.  Booked to bottle feed lambs and a surprise to have an interesting and entertaining tour of the farm.  My grandson is still regaling the family with the facts!   A well stocked farm shop and take away with lovely staff.  What a lovely morning!

recent_reviews.author: Simon Jacobs
recent_reviews.text: This place delivers the best coffee & breakfast rolls in Abersoch by a country mile. They also stock a host of locally produced goods, which are much better quality than items you can get in Abersoch centre. Itâ€™s a true gem, I would definitely have breakfast here every morning if I lived in the area. The owners are super welcoming and provide a superior standard of food/drinks than any other eateries in the vicinity. You must visit this place, itâ€™s only two miles out of Abersoch. See you next year. 5 stars all around.

pumpkin_patches.address: Coed y Fron, Mynytho, Pwllheli LL53 7SG

recent_reviews.author: louise R
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little stay as a family of 4. Perfect for what we needed. Welcome gift is a very nice touch. Bed was very comfortable and clean. Great location. Thank you very much, we'll be back!

recent_reviews.author: Angela Hyams
recent_reviews.text: We had a great stay in one of the pods at Crugan Farm. Very clean, comfortable and practical. In a beautiful quiet spot. Nice waking up to the farm animals nearby. The owners were super helpful and friendly. And the farm shop on site, with the freshly baked sourdough, was a lovely bonus. Weâ€™d highly recommend Crugan Farm.

recent_reviews.author: Karen Jordan
recent_reviews.text: It has been the best holiday.  Caravan  park is so lovely  and relaxed well worth staying

recent_reviews.author: Lucy Henry
recent_reviews.text: Really good location, enjoyed seeing all the animals on the farm... toilets and showers good. Only negative for us was no play area as expected, this was all closed off & looked like there was work ongoing.

recent_reviews.author: Rebecca Ball
recent_reviews.text: We're on holiday  here at the  moment  definitely  coming  back  cottage is so cosy fresh milk to lovely  farm hosts are lovely  to very  helpful ğŸ˜€

recent_reviews.author: Kai
recent_reviews.text:
We had a wonderful stay at this charming farm cottage! The owner is incredibly friendly and welcoming, making us feel right at home from the start. The cottage is spotless, cozy, and warm â€“ perfect for a relaxing getaway.

One of the highlights was the fresh milk produced on the farm.

Thereâ€™s also a lot to do around the farm, making it an ideal spot for families. Whether youâ€™re exploring the surrounding countryside, engaging in farm activities, or simply enjoying the peaceful environment, thereâ€™s something for everyone.

We highly recommend this cottage for anyone looking for a family-friendly escape with a genuine farm experience. Weâ€™ll definitely be back!

recent_reviews.author: Bryn Wiseman
recent_reviews.text: We regularly use the milk hut to get fresh milk for our guests. Fantastic produce and great to have locally!

recent_reviews.author: barry britton
recent_reviews.text: I didn't expect much owing  to the  price  but was  pleasantly surprised  at how nice everything was, the owners  were helpful, the facilities  were good,  all in all excellent  value for money

recent_reviews.author: Sally Fargher
recent_reviews.text: What a fab time we had today thanks to inclusability for the tickets and marlborough grange farm shop.  We were pleasantly greeted and shown to our own where we met Daphne one of the lambs and our little lamb who didn't yet have a name . We were told we could name him so we called him shaun  ğŸ˜Š . We ( all four of us ) had time to feed him his milk and fuss over him. A lovely experience for the kids and us and we will definitely return !! Thanks again.

recent_reviews.author: Mohammed F
recent_reviews.text: Cowbridge Farm Shop is a lovely place to take family and buy fresh fruit and vegetables, children are able to play with animals. There is no charge to enter! The staff are all very friendly and helpful. I met the owner of the farm, he truly is humble.

recent_reviews.author: Alethea Muston
recent_reviews.text: We had a fab afternoon yesterday with my partner and his great grandson Jack, who has ADHD ğŸ˜ƒ I'm amazed they didn't have a donation box, I would have left something.

recent_reviews.author: megan lewis
recent_reviews.text: Very clean and sanitary! Went lamb feeding and there was a place to sanitise shoes before entry and hand sanitiser on the way out..saw an article online blaming this place for illness but those at fault are the people themselves for not cleaning again when they got home!!

pumpkin_patches.address: Marlborough Grange Farm Cross Ways, Cowbridge CF71 7LJ

recent_reviews.author: Hannah Weaver
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful little place with gorgeous trees, wreaths and ornaments. Very friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Lynne Nicholas
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful!!!! Great field of pumpkins, fabulous Halloween things to buy and a lovely, cosy cafe with plenty of drinks and cakes. We had the best time ğŸƒğŸƒ

recent_reviews.author: Nigel Sayers
recent_reviews.text: Found by chance driving down A438 towards Brecon. What a find real array of lovely christmas decorations - trees and wreaths at very reasonable prices. Sign posts on main road just a few yards up to the barn pull in and take a look you won't regret it.

recent_reviews.author: Jill Willison
recent_reviews.text: Lovely things to look at but a bit expensive. Only bought a couple of things to go on the tree. It was very cold in there, so l did not envy the staff!

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Rosedew Farm Holiday Cottages & Wedding Venue

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Lambert Photography
recent_reviews.text:
Rosedew Farm is one of my favourite venues in South Wales. If youâ€™re looking for a rustic setting, that you want to put your own mark on, and that offers a varied backdrop all year round, this is the perfect venue for you.

Gaynor and the team are the BEST. They will make your day magic, and nothing is too much trouble for them. ğŸ¥°

recent_reviews.author: janine c
recent_reviews.text: WOW. Had the pleasure of attending a wedding at the farm on Monday (9/6/25).  The venue was absolutely gorgeous, and the accommodation was clean and tidy as well. As for the staff were amazing, they went beyond being helpful. They were outstanding and could not do more for us. Thank you so much, everyone, for making the new Mr and Mrs Jordan and Josie Carran-pace  a day that was truly magnificent and outstanding.

recent_reviews.author: Rob Brown
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely venue for a wedding. Stayed in one of the holiday cottages and had a great time. Everything about the wedding was excellent, much of this must go to the owners of the venue who helped ensure all ran smoothly. The food was excellent quality and plentiful. Drinks prices at the bar were also quite reasonable and not rip-off like some other similar venues.
No breakfast included, but self catering facilities in the cottage are great if you want to sort something yourself. Or, a short walk is a cafe at Acorn Camping which is run by the same family, where the breakfast was excellent.

recent_reviews.author: Carl Woodward (Wedding Photographer)
recent_reviews.text:
As a wedding photographer, I had the pleasure of capturing a wedding at Rosedew Farm, and I canâ€™t recommend this venue enough! The setting is simply stunning, with the sun setting beautifully over the farmâ€™s vast fields, casting a golden glow that creates the most magical backdrop for evening portraits. The rustic barn is full of character, providing a charming and intimate atmosphere perfect for the ceremony and reception.

The farm fields offer endless opportunities for breathtaking bride and groom portraits â€“ the open space and natural beauty are a photographerâ€™s dream! The staff at Rosedew Farm were wonderful to work with, incredibly friendly, and attentive to every detail, ensuring the day went smoothly. They truly went above and beyond to make the day special for the couple and easy for everyone involved.

If youâ€™re looking for a wedding venue that combines rustic charm, stunning landscapes, and fantastic service, Rosedew Farm is the perfect choice. Every moment here was picture-perfect!

recent_reviews.author: Julia Faulkes
recent_reviews.text: A lovely, well stocked local garden centre. The staff are so friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The centre is well stocked with lots of lovely, varied and many times locally grown plants. I love being allowed into the greenhouses if you want to find something not on display. Clearly the cats are in charge and help to make the experience of visiting all the more enjoyable. One of my favourite places for plant buying â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

recent_reviews.author: lucy thomas
recent_reviews.text: Went today on the off chance as we needed seed potatoes for our allotment , well what a beautiful place , so much to see ! As a disabled woman who struggles to walk far I managed to grab a trolley which aids my walking , plenty of room to manoeuvre around the aisles and sections without getting in people's way , everything was well cared for and set out nicely and loads to see , my daughter particularly liked the houseplant section and picked up a few plants, we had a few kg of potatoes of many different varieties all in perfect condition , cats and dog were also a friendly welcome . Can't wait to come again and spend a bit more time looking around.  Staff super helpful and friendly too.  I've been to a few garden centres and this has so far been my favourite hands down.

recent_reviews.author: Mari Jones
recent_reviews.text: Always a great visit! Fantastic, high quality plants that are reasonably priced. Friendly staff and great service and knowledge everytime from Gavin and the team. Would highly recommend, definitely worth a visit!

recent_reviews.author: cosy home
recent_reviews.text: Great shop. The cafe was much more than I expected, spacious, decent coffee in proper cups instead of disposable ones, nice cakes and friendly staff. I liked the dog and two cats as well.

pumpkin_patches.address: Evesham Gardens, Church Ln, Llanfoist, Abergavenny NP7 9LF

recent_reviews.author: Frances
recent_reviews.text:
Impossible to speak to someone on the phone. Just wanted to know the time you need to allow between visits to the car park to avoid a charge.
Tried every option, listened to long drawn out unrelated information, advising me to search online for my own answer (which isnâ€™t there) or to call to store. I was trying my best to do that without being issued a parking ticket. One size doesnâ€™t fit all. Sometimes you just need to talk to a person!

recent_reviews.author: Don Nuwan
recent_reviews.text:
I had a very embarrassing and disappointing experience at the self-checkout in this store. While finishing my purchase, a shop assistant came over and asked whether I had paid for the shopping bag I was using. I explained that I had already bought the bag the evening before and regularly use reusable bags.

What made the situation worse was that a second staff member came and questioned me again, even checking my bill in front of others. It felt humiliating and made me feel like I was being accused of something dishonest.

I asked them to check the CCTV footage to verify my explanation, but they showed no interest and offered apology for the way I was treated.

This is the first time Iâ€™ve been put in such an uncomfortable position while simply doing my shopping. I expected better treatment, especially when trying to be environmentally conscious by reusing bags. The staff could have handled the situation much more professionally and discreetly. Very disappointing.

recent_reviews.author: Christina Price
recent_reviews.text: Was at this store yesterday. The toilets were disgusting, with used sanitary products hanging out of bins, toilets were dirty. When we told customer service they said cleaners don't start until 11am. We went up for breakfast which turned out inedible. Food was cold and dried out. Really not the service you expect from a Tesco superstore

recent_reviews.author: Nabeel Tariq
recent_reviews.text: Good place to shop for everything. I mean groceries, household stuff etc. There are a lot of options. The prices are a bit towards the higher side but the quality is really good. Having a membership helps as well. I definitely recommend this place for shopping.

recent_reviews.author: Thabani Hlatshwayo
recent_reviews.text: Friendly service. Good parking.

recent_reviews.author: Billy Kynes
recent_reviews.text: Good choices. Excellent selections

recent_reviews.author: Cherie Nash
recent_reviews.text: Plenty free parking amazing deals .

recent_reviews.author: Gareth J Jones
recent_reviews.text: Good offers store was full of promotions

pumpkin_patches.address: 2B Triangle Business Park Rd, Pentrebach, Merthyr Tydfil CF48 4TQ

recent_reviews.author: Anna Webb
recent_reviews.text: Took my daughter for her first bra fitting. Brilliant service. Maria, the lady who was carrying out the fitting, was understanding, explained everything clearly and made sure my daughter was comfortable with the whole process. We came away with the right fit and selection of underwear that my daughter was very happy with. I would certainly recommend.

recent_reviews.author: Ty X
recent_reviews.text:
Super disappointed in the cafe! The food I asked for on the menu wasn't available so the tomato soup was recommended. Although I didn't have an appetite for soup I figured that because it's M&S it should be nice. Mistake! Tomato and basil, it was so bland and had lumps in it! I've had better canned tomatoe soup from Lidl! The hot chocolate cost over Â£4 and the picture looked amazing, tall cup with loads of squirty cream and chocolate dust, when it came, the cream was flat with a stupid swirl of what was probably meant to look like a chocolate pattern! Greggs hot chocolate is half the price and way better.. Onto the cakes. After all my disappointment with the soup and chocolate I thought I'd give them the benefit of the doubt, their cakes MUST be nice, this is M&S! ğŸ˜‚ Where does M&S get off charging nearly Â£4 for a smidgen of a slice of lemon drizzle cake that is a weak excuse for one of the best cakes on the planet?

In summary

Overpriced nasty food. I won't be going there again.

This is not just food! this is not food at all actually!! Shame on you M&S, what happened to your quality?

recent_reviews.author: JK J
recent_reviews.text: Good range of clothes and the food hall is brilliant. Slightly busy but being just off the A470 this is expected. Plenty of parking available

recent_reviews.author: K Dumbo
recent_reviews.text:
Smaller than other stories but very well stocked and clean
Staff really helpful friendly and kind

pumpkin_patches.address: Cyfarthfa Retail Park, Aberdare Rd, Newton Road, Merthyr Tydfil CF48 1HY

recent_reviews.author: Mike Gray
recent_reviews.text:
My family stay at the Murton Farm Cottages for our Gower holidays. We always go to the Murton Farm Shop for food and treats. Great range of fruit and veg and always great quality. Friendly staff and plenty of parking.
Thank you

recent_reviews.author: Louis Hudson
recent_reviews.text: Lots of nice local produce! Friendly staff and a wide range of fruit and vegetables.

recent_reviews.author: Reddy Mog
recent_reviews.text: Amazing quality of plants and very reasonable price.  The fruit and vegetable selection is amazing and of the highest quality

recent_reviews.author: David Johnston
recent_reviews.text:
Superb quality and a striking difference to the fare offered up by the supermarkets.

Sadly, these establishments are too few and far between.

recent_reviews.author: phillip jones
recent_reviews.text: Roads are a disaster

recent_reviews.author: Frazer Jones
recent_reviews.text: Really enjoyed seeing the tulips for an afternoon, my girlfriend loved it! Will be back for the wildflower meadow, thanks Kerry Vale PYO

recent_reviews.author: Harvey Jones
recent_reviews.text: A beautiful field with wild flowers, sunflowers, toys for the kids, and a fantastic maize maze. A brilliant day out. Highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: lucky keyring

Bit pricey and my mother-in-law pointed out that there was a hygiene rating of 2, which is gobsmacking! But i liked it anyways. Really yummy looking cakes at the till and the staff were friendly. Was so excited to see lots of broccoli there cos i love broccoli, and the glasses of milk were so cute. Iâ€™d say iâ€™d pop in here again. Love from Lucky Keyring xx

recent_reviews.author: Vanessa Brown
recent_reviews.text: Donâ€™t bother complete rip off. Average tomatoes Â£10.40 per kilo in the summer! And donâ€™t get me onto the cheeses that are up to Â£30 a kilo just be careful if you do visit as there is also only a two star hygiene rating on this place ğŸ˜±

recent_reviews.author: Stuart Duncan
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful little farm shop. Fresh cakes, cheese galore, local fruit and veg piled to the ceiling. The smell of cold meat, quiches and fresh bread inspires the foodie imagination and the variety and quality of food on offer did not disappoint.

recent_reviews.author: Karen Riley
recent_reviews.text: Fab farm shop . Lovely staff..  the best truffle cheese ..

pumpkin_patches.address: Derwen Farm Shop, Guilsfield, Welshpool SY21 9PH

recent_reviews.author: Hollie Brookes
recent_reviews.text: Our favourite farm shop to visit! A great selection of fruit and veg, an incredible butchers with the best meat, and so many lovely plants. The gift section is also good too, with Jellycats, Lego and Britains toys. Definitely worth a visit, especially in summer when their ice cream hut is open!

recent_reviews.author: Gareth Thomas
recent_reviews.text:
Oakchurch farm shop is our favourite place to visit it's not just a farm shop it has a cafe, garden centre,it sells clothes and toys.
For us it's like a day with friends or family it has picnic benches and they sell their own ice cream which is amazing
It's situated in the beautiful countryside with amazing views.

They call it the Harrods of Hereford unfortunately the toilets are not, this is somewhere where they need to put some effort into they are disgusting!!

recent_reviews.author: KD
recent_reviews.text: Great produce here as well as homewares, clothing and plants. Good quality fresh fruit and veg and bread. Great place to go for a mooch and cup of coffee. Very friendly staff in cafe and good scones! All in the Herefordshire countryside

recent_reviews.author: Joy Johns
recent_reviews.text: A beautiful little farm shop, fresh made food , lovely plants and unique flower stock ( they had queen of the night tulips) they also serve the best chocolate ice cream ğŸ¦ ğŸ˜‹ sadly not allergy friendly but an excellent spot for an old fashioned ice cream cone .

pumpkin_patches.address: Brecon Road, Staunton on Wye, Hereford HR4 7NH

recent_reviews.author: Willow Jackson
recent_reviews.text: My house. Go away

pumpkin_patches.address: Beacons National Park Authority, Cambrian Way, Glamorgan St, Brecon LD3 7HP

recent_reviews.author: Paul Evans
recent_reviews.text: Very good place to rent units and also to visit the cafe on site. The cafe is not the cheapest, but the quality of the food is excellent. It was a lovely place to visit. They also have an amazing ice cream manufacturer on-site called Fablas. It is a really good quality ice cream made on-site by a mum-and-daughter business. Well worth a visit. Very busy place, and they will soon be moving into another unit as well. More units are being developed. Lovely place and improving all the time. Good place for renting units, some available at the moment.

recent_reviews.author: Rachel Dando
recent_reviews.text: The daliah picking was a fantastic experience. Such  a lovely memory made. We will be returning in the next couple of weeks. The two girls serving were so welcoming and very helpful. Thank you.

recent_reviews.author: Kathryn Thomas
recent_reviews.text: We thought they would have put something down on the field for the cars and people walking. It was extremely  slippy with the mud  due to all the rain, Or , made a proper car park with the amount of money they are making. The coffee and hot chocolate  were disgusting and we threw them away!

recent_reviews.author: Gavin Owen
recent_reviews.text: Here for some chainsaw training with Arborcraft Solutions. Estate manager was very friendly and Arborcraft provided a great service, highly recommend for forestry/arboriculture training and services.

pumpkin_patches.address: Estate Office The Lodge, Llwynhelig, Cowbridge CF71 7FF

recent_reviews.author: Alexandra Morton
recent_reviews.text: The ice cream, just like the milkshakes, was absolutely delicious!! Would highly recommend!! Went for a scoop of bubblegum and farmhouse, had been craving ice cream all day...definitely satisfied that craving ğŸ˜‹! Will be returning to try more flavours! 10/10 ğŸ‘ŒğŸ».

recent_reviews.author: Hybrid Hipster
recent_reviews.text: Really friendly and welcoming people, lovely cute animals to pet and the fresh milkshake is worth the visit! They had other little goods in their shop too! Will be visiting again!

recent_reviews.author: Gareth Griffiths
recent_reviews.text: What a brilliant place we took the Grandchildren to see Santa today and picked up some beautiful bubblegum milkshake. There's also a bbq grill on site and we had a combo meal wow! It's big and beautiful highly recommend a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Lucy Williams
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely lovely little farm with the sweetest animals would definitely recommend! Had a great time with my friend â˜ºï¸

pumpkin_patches.address: Pencoed Fach farm, Bedwellty Rd, Blackwood NP12 0BQ
Pen Yr Orsedd, Tynlon, Holyhead LL65 3YY

recent_reviews.author: Mark Wyke
recent_reviews.text: Fron Goch is hands down one of the best garden centres weâ€™ve ever visitedâ€”and weâ€™ve been to enough to call ourselves part-time plant whisperers. The staff are brilliantly knowledgeable and genuinely lovely; they somehow manage to answer even the daftest gardening questions without flinching. The service is top-notch, and to top it all off, we had a cracking breakfastâ€”so good it almost distracted us from the houseplants (almost). Itâ€™s no mystery why theyâ€™re voted number one. If only all garden centres were this good, weâ€™d never get anything else done!

recent_reviews.author: Trisha Owen
recent_reviews.text:
Large garden centre, variety of selection of all things garden. We visited MegaSheds to purchase  a Summerhouse which we will be having soon.
All good

recent_reviews.author: T J Blasting
recent_reviews.text: A great garden centre tucked away in the hills near Caernarfon. Plenty to see and buy they have a lovely cafÃ© where they serve hot and cold food. Delicious cakes and a variety of drinks. A lovely day out!

recent_reviews.author: Peter
recent_reviews.text: Whilst recently staying in Caernarfon we randomly asked Trevor taxi were the best local breakfast cafe was and without hesitation he said Fron Goch garden centre. With a little bit of anxiety we set off and arrived at probably the nicest & welcoming garden centre cafe ever. From front of house to all staff we were made to feel so comfortable via excellent service with great ambience obviously enjoyed by every other customer who return regularly. We will definitely return to this fabulous again for the perfect breakfast ğŸ˜‹

pumpkin_patches.address: Fron Goch, Pant Rd, Caernarfon LL54 5RL

recent_reviews.author: Naomi the Mermaid
recent_reviews.text: Great choice of food. Delicious pork pies, apples and scotch eggs. The scotch egg choice was particularly outstanding. Really friendly service and not overpriced for a farm shop. Highly recommend â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

recent_reviews.author: Richard Steele
recent_reviews.text: Quite simply the larger gentleman behind the cafe counter should not be in customer service. The rest of the staff were very pleasant. He was obnoxious and made inappropriate remarks to my 80 year mother in response to a simple polite enquiry and rude to my sister. It turned what would have been repeat custom into a single visit. What is a lovely shop and nice cafe let down by one individual who from previous reviews can only be the owner. We felt very sorry for the rest of the staff having to work with him.

recent_reviews.author: Helen Wade
recent_reviews.text: To be honest we went to this place partly because we were so intrigued by the horrific reviews. We thought how bad can it be? And our answer, not bad at all. It is quite expensive but I expect that for homemade quality food and have no problem with that. The staff were friendly and obliging and the friendly lady on the till asked me where I was from, what I was doing that day and gave me some recommendations for visits including beaches. Our experience here was good.

recent_reviews.author: Laura
recent_reviews.text: I wouldnâ€™t come back here for food. Had the Sunday Carvery, the food was mediocre, Iâ€™d compare it to school canteen food. Very expensive for what it is - small portion of dry meat, signs up and staff strictly policing how much veg you have, one of them snapped at my friend because she took two scoops of cauliflower but she hadnâ€™t bothered to look at her tray and notice she had 2 plates as one was for her partner. If Iâ€™m being charged almost Â£20 for a carvery and a can of pop Iâ€™d expect to be able to have more than 3 chunks of carrot and 1 floret of cauliflower. 2 stars rather than one because the food was at least hot and the gravy was tasty.

recent_reviews.author: Sally Greenhow
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely coffee and food. A great place to take children. Play park and animals.
Although since the front part of the cafe has been turned into a produce shop,which is great BTW, leaves the back part with canteen style tables,  and chairs and a very few soft chairs for the cafe.  This was way too noisy for me.  High ceilng, no soft   furnishing or curtains, to dampen the general chatter and general cafe noise.
It is overwhelming for me.
I  was sad that I had to walk away. I was really looking forward to the usually excellent coffee.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Macey
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely superb little place to visit with children or your pooch. Beautifully kept animals to see, beautiful gardens and fantastic play area for the kiddos! It's just fabulous and free. Really gorgeous tea rooms and gorgeous breakfast. If I could give more than 5 stars I would!

recent_reviews.author: Thomas Lynch
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful place to stop. Chickens and llamas to see and a childrens play park which is a decent size. Pet store and cafe above with a lovely menu and really nice food. We had the special pork and apple sauce bap with chips. The homemade cakes and giant cookies were to die for! Food and drinks quick and service was great. Can't fault it and a little win when visiting Camarthen Bay Holiday Park.

recent_reviews.author: D Williams
recent_reviews.text:
Sadly been coming here for years, however the past few recent visits has left a very a poor taste in my mouth.

Food was very basic, something served in a canteen environment, service was fast enough but with zero care as it was busy,  halfway through eating our food it would appear the music was turned up to the point I could not hear my daughter across the table to talk to.

The cost for the food does not way up against the quality it used to be.

recent_reviews.author: Gareth Lewis
recent_reviews.text: Great array of products on display,staff were lovely and friendly, it is on the high end but the produce is to.Cherries were lovely, was a bit shocked at the price of the watermelon ğŸ‰ had half of a quarter of a slice and was Â£6.50.

recent_reviews.author: Charlie L
recent_reviews.text: It's amazing. It's full of amazing fresh fruit, veg, produce and an insane array of herbs spice and sauces. I like it anyway. The highlight had to be a cucumber grown locally that was as big as my 12yr olds arm ğŸ¤¯. Highly recommend to anyone passing by.

recent_reviews.author: Thomas Kramer
recent_reviews.text:
What an amazing place for locally farmed food. We came 4 times during our 5 days stay in Tendby area ğŸ˜
Very friendly staff, and the selection and taste of local vegetables is incomparable.

recent_reviews.author: Steven Gurney
recent_reviews.text: One of the better farm shops Iâ€™ve been to. Plenty of parking outside, lots of produce on offer - locally sourced and from further afield too. The staff were very friendly.

recent_reviews.author: Dave Whiteley
recent_reviews.text: A family run farm producing great lamb, beef and honey.

recent_reviews.author: Hedviga Takacova
recent_reviews.text: What a wonderful experience, we truly enjoyed it. The family is very welcoming and gives much information about all the beautiful animals they have. I highly recommend it! The animals are very friendly! It was the best experience in Wales for us.

recent_reviews.author: fiona Morton
recent_reviews.text: Really lovely day out getting up close to the Highlands friendly informative host..on our visit got to bottle fed some calfs too and the were lambs bunnies goats and others to pet and feed.

recent_reviews.author: Seren Griffiths
recent_reviews.text: An absolutely wonderful time here today, we got a really intimate and personal tour of the farm animals alongside the booked Highland cow experience. The owner was a pleasure to be around and we had a lovely chat. Thank you very much ğŸ¥°

recent_reviews.author: Glyn Davies
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful experience. All the animals were very friendly, well in control, loved the attention.

pumpkin_patches.place_name: Mill Farm Shop at the Tweedmill Shopping Outlet

recent_reviews.author: William Webster
recent_reviews.text: Nice Variety of Goods, each department has its own till so don't have to Que up near the exit. Enjoyed this and would recommend it.

recent_reviews.author: yasmin osman
recent_reviews.text: Absolutely love it, I live in Ipswich so when I visit my sister and brother in law in Wales this is a ritual for my sister and I to visit especially the restaurant.  Wish there was a tweed mill closer to. Ipswich.

recent_reviews.author: Geoff Baldwin
recent_reviews.text:
They sell a fantastic range of clothes gifts household items and lots more
Great farm shop and cafe

recent_reviews.author: Nigel Connor
recent_reviews.text: Visited recently huge selection of clothes and other stuff reasonable prices Cafe excellent.

recent_reviews.author: RaÃ¨ Christalea
recent_reviews.text:
So I bought a few things from here. And the next day I used the veg and fruit.
And apart from the ones shown in the photos I bought cauliflower that was very rubbery, the cucumber was also rubbery and watery.

I had been once before and the veg wasn't too good. But I thought it was a one off. Unfortunately not.

The only other thing was painted on the wall behind the till, is support our farmers. Yet a majority of the fruit and veg isn't from the UK.

I did email them directly but no response.

Sorry Unfortunately I wouldn't recommend here at all. Very poor quality fruit and veg

recent_reviews.author: Frog Boi
recent_reviews.text: Delicious cooked breakfast. Good quality bacon and sausage and a perfectly cooked egg. My son had the eggs Benedict with bacon and he said he would highly recommend. Nice little walk around the farm shop and the teens enjoyed seeing the animals.

recent_reviews.author: Stew Alford
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely little farm shop , the staff are great and very helpful

The produce is phenomenal!!!!

recent_reviews.author: racerunner1234
recent_reviews.text: I came here for my work experience, end enjoyed it so much! The staff are all so friendly and helpful whether you are a customer or not, and the selection of products is great with a lovely cafe! You can bring you DVDs and books and then swap them for what others have brought in. 5â­ï¸

pumpkin_patches.address: Drury Farm, 76 Drury Ln, Drury, Buckley CH7 3DX

recent_reviews.author: Julianne Sims
recent_reviews.text: What a wonderful, amazing, educational experience. Having been bought an adoption package as a present I attended the adoption day today with a friend. From the minute you arrive you are made to feel welcome. Being able to be in amongst the reindeer and hand feed them and stroke them was magical. This family run experience is amazing, I learnt so much about the reindeer and was lovely to see their different personalities. Whether you adopt, have a reindeer experience at Christmas, just visit to buy a tree or have a hot chocolate, you wonâ€™t be disappointed. This is more than a 5 star experience run by a lovely family and equally as lovely helpers. Attention to detail, friendly welcome and amazing hot chocolate, cake and huge marshmallows to toast on an open fire, do not miss this opportunity! Adults and children alike will have an amazing time!

recent_reviews.author: Curtis Meldrum
recent_reviews.text: My fiancÃ©  and I had an incredible experience at North Hills Farm. From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed and treated to a full tour of the farm. Getting up close and personal with the reindeer was a highlight of our stay, and staying overnight in one of their cabins, specifically the Cedar Lodge, was an absolute delight. The cabins are equipped with everything you could possibly need; it truly felt like a home away from home. We particularly appreciated the comfortable memory foam mattress and the full-sized shower with amazing water pressure. The attention to detail throughout the entire property, from the cabins to the outdoor spaces, is impeccable and speaks volumes about the passion and care the family puts into running the farm. As animal lovers, we were thrilled to learn about the reindeer during our visit and even had the opportunity to meet them up close. The level of care and love given to the animals here is truly remarkable. Whether you're seeking a weekend getaway or just a night of relaxation, I wholeheartedly recommend North Hills Farm. It's an experience that will leave you with cherished memories and a desire to return.

recent_reviews.author: Wendy O'neil
recent_reviews.text:
You wonâ€™t be disappointed, what an extra experience feeding the reindeer. Staff are very knowledge and you didnâ€™t feel rushed plenty of space! Got to say we had one of the best hot chocolates with the works which is not over priced!!!
Plenty of areas to sit around the fire and get warm! The enchanted forest trail to find the elves was fab my daughter loved this! The only thing missing was hot food like wood fired pizza or jacket potatoes just something simple as we would have stayed longer if we could get our tea there!

recent_reviews.author: Richard Hughes
recent_reviews.text: Been here a couple of times now and really enjoy the festive spirit amongst the Christmas Reindeer. The fully loaded hot chocolate is a real treat and with a log burner keeping us warm it was a lovely to stop here a while and chill out. Plenty of quality Christmas trees for sale and a festive shop to browse while wearing a face covering due to indoor covid rules. A nice cheerful place to come and visit for all ages.

recent_reviews.author: Paul Taylor
recent_reviews.text: Great place to stay the photos on line don't do it justice

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Bailey
recent_reviews.text:
Great place , lovely surroundings , good local  beaches and pubs
Accommodation clean , well presented and some lovely farm animals

recent_reviews.author: Blazej Kozdron
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful location

recent_reviews.author: Bob Draper
recent_reviews.text: Well equipped cottage in a great location. Very comfortable.

recent_reviews.author: Clive Haycock
recent_reviews.text: Great locally produced meat and fantastic tasty quality sausages. Their produce is definitely the best quality in the local area and far better than anything that you can buy at a supermarket even if it's supposedly their premium product! Living locally I wouldn't go anywhere else.

recent_reviews.author: Angela Sullivan-Brown
recent_reviews.text:
We stopped by today to visit the beautiful slate shop next door and popped our heads in the Butcher's farm shop just to have a look.

What a gem of a place and the loveliest two gentlemen (butchers). Nothing was too much trouble and so friendly.  We left with a great shop of eggs, veg, meats - exceptional value for money. We had the lamb for our dinner tonight - absolutely delicious. All their meat looked beautiful.

Highly recommended.

recent_reviews.author: cate glasson
recent_reviews.text: I got a lovely head of broccoli, some really fresh mushrooms, some delicious local honey and some delicious lamb chops that made a great hotpot. The gentleman that served me was very helpful. Thank you

recent_reviews.author: Robert Sanders
recent_reviews.text: Arrived just now 15:43 and itâ€™s closed but says 4pm online â€¦ gutted

recent_reviews.author: tegwen alsop
recent_reviews.text: Walnut tree farm park is a lovely family run farm park with quite a variety of animals which you can feed (50p per feed bag). At Â£8 per adult and Â£7 per child found it was exceptionally good value for money - with lovely quality food in their cafe which was clean, hygienic and kept on top of. There are plenty of washing hands facilities around the farm park, and overall a really lovely experience. Great place for all ages, not just kids but adults too. Â£1 per person for the tractor ride was also great value to finish off the day â˜ºï¸

recent_reviews.author: MD MASUM Ahmed
recent_reviews.text: I recently visited this farm and overall, the experience was just okay. I was expecting to see a wider variety of animals, but there really werenâ€™t that many, which was a bit disappointing. The place itself is fine, but if youâ€™re looking for a proper farm experience with lots of animals to see and interact with, this may not be the best choice.

recent_reviews.author: Paul Griffiths
recent_reviews.text: Great selection of animals, laid out well, chance to feed the animals as well. My Grandson really enjoyed his time here. Cafe was very good, lady serving us was very friendly, kind and a very good Chef, all home cooked food! Well worth a visit!

recent_reviews.author: Luann Cross
recent_reviews.text: This was a wonderful farm. Very healthy animals, we loved the Highland cows. Cafe was good, good coffee, reasonable prices. The only disappointment was that they oversold on the tractor ride. When we arrived to get on, the trailer was full, and we couldn't get on.

pumpkin_patches.address: Walnut Tree Farm Park, St Brides NP10 8SQ

recent_reviews.author: Saifuddin Safarov
recent_reviews.text: I personally visited this places, very dangerous, overuse of chemicals, can't breath in greenhouses, poor quality and hygiene control, never recommended to have connection to this places

recent_reviews.author: David Collins
recent_reviews.text: Wonderful staff

recent_reviews.author: Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½ĞµĞ½ĞºĞ¾
recent_reviews.text: A good, well-established company. They pay on time.

recent_reviews.author: Rahi
recent_reviews.text: CHEESE FESTIVAL - what a day!! I love all the different stalls, however I didnâ€™t see many cheese stalls!! Live Gig which everyone really enjoyed! Stalls comprises of chocolates truffle, biscuits, cakes, (all hand made) Chinese vans, milk chicken van, soup van, beers van, other stalls which has information to share for carers, college, banks etc, there was also some beautiful eagles on show which were magnificent.. for a small fee ride donkeys for little kids, see baby animals too..And there was a fun fair which is well priced for little ones!

recent_reviews.author: Wendy Smith
recent_reviews.text: Very disappointed when visited on Saturday. Thought it was a farmer's market but no farmers produce to be found. I was expecting cheese, meat and veg stalls not crystals, pet treats   and clothes.  Won't bother again.

recent_reviews.author: Alun Evans
recent_reviews.text:
Not just food but artisan items too.
Set in two places inside and out at Y Galeri and Twyn Hall.
All set within a short distance of the Castle

recent_reviews.author: Andi Hudson
recent_reviews.text: Lovely little farmers market. Great eggs and celia has delicious meat from her farm!

pumpkin_patches.address: The Twyn Square, 1 The Twyn, Caerphilly CF83 1JL

recent_reviews.author: Penelope
recent_reviews.text: They delivered my mum a beautiful arrangement for mother's day. I called and spoke (I assume) to Nicola about a point on the order and she was really friendly and helpful, and clearly working incredibly hard to fulfil mother's day orders and make sure her customers are happy. Fantastic flowers and fantastic customer service.

recent_reviews.author: Jon Case
recent_reviews.text:
This was my first time ordering flowers online so was a bit nervous of the process but they arrived perfectly and they followed my delivery instructions.

They are also very responsive when I followed up on the phone - Highly recommend!

P.s. My girlfriend loved them - she was left speechless

recent_reviews.author: Jordan Baker
recent_reviews.text:
Absolutely blown away by the incredible talent & vision of Nicola for our amazing Wedding flowers! We cannot thank you enough for how amazing & hard you worked in creating our perfect wedding flowers! ğŸ’

The flowers were outstanding & took our breath away! You are an absolute star & you have been so lovely to work with through all our planning! ğŸ˜

We cannot recommend Nicola enough, Nicola helped us so much in planning our flowers, had so many ideas & really worked with us to understand exactly what she thought would work for us! The results were just incredible & totally beautiful! ğŸ¥°

Thank you for making everything so perfect! ğŸ¤—

Fantastic service! Great quality! Helpful & friendly! Thank you so much! Love us Both! â¤ï¸ x x

recent_reviews.author: Dan Faulkner
recent_reviews.text:
Nicola is a real professional and guided us through everything we needed for our wedding flowers.  Outstanding service and such stunning arrangements!   We can't thank you enough for your help, having had a bad experience with another florist in town it was like night and day walking into Nicola's shop!
All the guests were blown away by her designs and I cannot recommend her enough, she has an incredible talent for floristry.

Thank you again Nicola, we are still enjoying our flowers at home ğŸ˜Š

pumpkin_patches.address: Nicola downie florist, Portcullis House, 18 Cardiff Rd, Caerphilly CF83 1JN

recent_reviews.author: Cher
recent_reviews.text: Dirtiest Aldiâ€™s iâ€™ve ever shopped in. Trolleys stinking dirty, carpark and entrance covered in litter and stained with discarded food and drinks. Floors unwashed so stained and grimy. Fridges empty and the cashiers donâ€™t speak or even smile at you. Wonâ€™t be visiting this store again!

recent_reviews.author: Adam Ayres
recent_reviews.text:
Did shop during Monday day time so wasn't so busy and was a nice shop.

Had almost all the items I was looking for.

recent_reviews.author: Christine Karanja-Jones
recent_reviews.text: Always a bargain and quality is great ğŸ‘

recent_reviews.author: Theresa Ann Flloyd
recent_reviews.text: The food quality is generally good, with a wide variety at reasonable prices. In addition to their regular stock, they offer a changing selection of extra items, some of which are great deals, while others may not be to my taste. However, trying them out could help you save some money. Overall, their food is similar to, and in some cases even better than, what you'd find at other supermarkets.

recent_reviews.author: Adrian Beale
recent_reviews.text: Good food, good company and good farming.

recent_reviews.author: Ashton Beale
recent_reviews.text: Nice people

recent_reviews.author: Geraldine Bradley
recent_reviews.text: The Pumpkins ğŸƒ are looking great this year again and the lovely Linda is doing a spot of modeling.

recent_reviews.author: Brian Pundyke
recent_reviews.text: Went buy black butter and bought sauerkraut as well. Fabulous range of foodstuffs.

recent_reviews.author: E O
recent_reviews.text:
Great farm shop
Lovely fresh products
Owners work hard to have it well stocked
Plenty space for parking
Not to be missed if ur in the area

recent_reviews.author: Elizabeth Ford
recent_reviews.text:
Good veg and nice lady. I have been a few times each time I have listened to the older man give off about children and other customers . He has told my granddaughter off for choosing my apples that I was buying.
On my last visit he was explaining to me how the local honey is useless like water and the Spanish honey he brings in thousands of pounds worth a month was much much superior . So this was my very last visit . Canâ€™t stand rudeness and I especially disapprove of a grown man ridiculing others .

pumpkin_patches.address: Kernohans Ln, Broughshane Rd, Ballymena BT43 7QA

recent_reviews.author: MrWhatnextforme
recent_reviews.text: Great variety of products, you can actually find well looked after plants to buy. Nice to see such big reductions on end of season garden furniture and BBQâ€™s. So nice that it is dog friendly. Staff are always so helpful too.

recent_reviews.author: Marie Mcgrellis
recent_reviews.text:
During a Friday lunchtime, it seemed there was not enough staff to facilitate the restaurant. Took a while to be seated, once seated Took a while for order to be taken as it seemed only 1 person was taking taking orders for the entire restaurant. While waiting with a toddler for 2 sandwiches and a kids pizza, 3 tables got orders taken and served and we still had no food.
When politely asked about our order a rude reply with no apology, about they may have easier orders and the food comes out when it comes out.
Paid for drinks and left. Sitting waiting at least half an hour for food with young child isn't really acceptable, especially when other people, who came in after us where served and finished their meal.

recent_reviews.author: Karen bell
recent_reviews.text: Went today for lunch. Understand now why the restaurant was empty. Waited a while to be seated, then a longer wait for order to be taken. Food arrived first then drinks. Sat finished for quite some time, had to go to welcome desk and collect menus ourselves for desserts. Staff were either talking amongst themselves or no where to be seen. Interrupted them chatting to place our desserts order. Desserts arrived, again drinks after. To our uncleared table. 1 dessert was smeared on the bottom side of the plate, the waitress wiped it with a napkin instead of taking back for a clean plate. Had to clear the table ourselves onto the table beside - as 1 Staff took her break and another stood chatting away to her. With multiple tables left uncleared. Not even a thank you when payment was made. Really disappointing. Won't be returning and definitely telling others not to waste there time.

recent_reviews.author: Kate Houston
recent_reviews.text: Loved my visit, so much to see, so much to buy, could of spent all day, great prices for everything that I liked, my granddaughters both 11 yrs old loved also loved going around, they even had a little go in one of the luxury garden room, playing hairdresser, wanting me to buy the building , I even got rest bite when in the building playing the role with the dressing table, I was able to have a quite walk around the plants to shop for my garden, Massive variety and great prices. I will be back every week, as there was so much I didnâ€™t get to see, as I had a limited time to get my granddaughter s home to their parents, just loved my visit so much and so much more to buy. Staff were lovely and very helpful and polite,  ğŸ¤©

pumpkin_patches.address: The Junction, 111 Ballymena Rd, Antrim BT41 4LL

recent_reviews.author: Val Devine
recent_reviews.text: Another fantastic afternoon with Amanda,Ballykenver Farm shop.(Jam at the doorstep.) The minute you walk into this cozy farm kitchen its complete joy. No airs and pomposity here,  just pure joy. An excellent afternoon filled with laughter and delight. First a lesson on cranberry chutney making, then the most scrumptious tea ever.  All local and the finest N.I. has to offer. So much to eat the food never stopped coming. Thank you Amanda you certainly know how to entertain. The best value tea I've ever eaten. Such high quality food. We were certainly  well looked after.

recent_reviews.author: Kate Davison
recent_reviews.text: Booked the afternoon tea for my mum and myself as a treat for her birthday coming up in June.  Amanda and Jenny are so welcoming. Part of the experience was a demonstration of how to make lemon curd which was fab. The actually afternoon tea was amazing. The food was delicious and it was great that the jams and drinks were all locally sourced products. All round this is a very cosy, friendly get together over delicious food and great chat. Would highly recommend ğŸ˜Š

recent_reviews.author: cheryl crockett
recent_reviews.text: From a tiny farm shop a couple of years ago to now supplying some of the most delicious foods from our beautiful wee province.  The chilli jam is beyond delicious.  The lemon curd is outstanding.  Wheaten kits. Belfast coffee.  If you can imagine a trip around Ulster collecting artisan foods well its all here in one place from home baking to savouries to Christmas pudding or sticky toffee pudding.  Located in Armoy just a stones throw from my home in Ballymoney I feel blessed.  Amanda the owner is every inch the happy host and prepare to leave with some amazing foods and some great chat.  It truly is a happy place filled with joy causeway coast chatter and best of all the love of great food â¤ï¸.  Five stars is not enough.  Dr Cherry #ballymoneygirl

recent_reviews.author: Karen Atkinson
recent_reviews.text: Amanda's farm shop is definitely worth a visit.  Plenty of choice of all locally sourced products.  Amanda makes her own jams/chutneys and her sticky toffee pudding is unreal!  She is very helpful and it's great to see that her children love helping out too!

recent_reviews.author: Lisa Stone
recent_reviews.text: Nice place, lots to see n buy. Staff friendly. I love my hedgehog ornament I got for my garden

recent_reviews.author: Mystery Tea Drinker
recent_reviews.text:
My mother, aunt and uncle visited Coleman's last week and never got round half of it so I took her up today so she could see everything.
The outside is very deceptive as it has an abundance of shops within the premises. I always go to Menarys to see their Christmas decorations and was pleasantly surprised that they had a sale on so came away with a few stand alone ones and a hot water bottle. There is a lot of merchandise for such a small space which was evident when they were unboxing products.
We stopped in at the cafe. You have to stand at the front to be seated. Lovely staff who kindly assisted my mum as she has walking aids. Loved my toastie and my mum must have loved her all day fry judging by the empty plate. It got really busy around 12.30 so I can understand the suggested 1 hour table stay. Quite a variety of food beverages and treat choices although charging 40p for a small soya serving of milk with my tea was a little excessive. Might look for a compromise there?
Clean throughout and would recommend a visit if you were in the area.

recent_reviews.author: Jonathan
recent_reviews.text: Garden centre and shops are good however the cafe is not fit for purpose. If your happy to queue for 25 minutes plus watching staff running around aimlessly with at least 15 cleared tables then this is for you. Told to go to table and look from menu and order from the counter which involves another 20 minutes queue to order. Food came and to be honest it was poor. Asked girl for ketchup and wad told it up at a table even though she was walking past. Several people around where unhappy with food and the queuing. It's poor for elderly people / disabled to have to stand or sit waiting. Table displays you must vacate table within an hour. Save yourself the experience and drive ten minutes to Ashers or Logwood Garden center for quality food and service from your table. Won't be back to Cafe.

recent_reviews.author: The Travelling Camera
recent_reviews.text:
Really good garden centre.  Great cafe.  Clean and spacious toilets.  Household, crafts, books, clothing, gifts and foods all catered for.  Brands include Pavers, Klass, Mountain Warehouse, Belleek, The Works, Edinburgh Woollen Mill and Ponden Home.  Kids will find plenty of things in The Works - books, toys, crafts and games.  The food selection is amazing too.

Always run out of scones every time Iâ€™m here.  Down to 3 stars as a result.

pumpkin_patches.address: 6 Old Ballyclare Rd, Templepatrick, Ballyclare BT39 0BJ

recent_reviews.author: Jess C - she her
recent_reviews.text: You have to stop in here! The ice cream is so so gorgeous. Flavours we're incredible. Bring a freezer bag and ice blocks so you can bring a tub home. The milking machine was fascinating and the cows were gorgeous!

recent_reviews.author: Alan Briggs
recent_reviews.text:
Lovely place, lovely creamy icecream and very interesting to see the automated cow milking facilities.

Edit March 2022: the automated milking machine appears to be away now, I think there are a lot more cows now though so it possibly could not handle the extra capacity. Ice cream was still lovely and it was great to sit out on the lawn in the sun.

recent_reviews.author: Darren Caldwell
recent_reviews.text: Third visit here.Kids love watching the cows in the big shed(they do stink though).Lovely ice cream and nice setting off the main road.Good size car park and we will definitely return.

recent_reviews.author: Lynsey Johnston
recent_reviews.text: Excellent flavours of ice cream and sorbet. Lots of choice and reasonably priced. Well worth a visit.

recent_reviews.author: Bry M
recent_reviews.text: Been going here for years! Always one of my favorite places to be. Lots of pick your own fruit options and the store has a wide variety of fun things! A great place to make memories and have a fun time with the family.

recent_reviews.author: Amanda L
recent_reviews.text: I love Sunnycrest Farm! Apples, blueberries, raspberries,, flowers, ice cream, and the market. I love supporting a local family/farm making our community a better place to live. Thank you Sunnycrest!!

recent_reviews.author: Anastasiia Shults
recent_reviews.text:
We had a great time at this farm. We were picking up peaches and raspberries. It costs $6 for raspberries and $18 for a medium bag of peaches ($35 large). The farm is very beautiful and clean. Staff is very welcoming and friendly. The store has a lot of fresh vegetables and fruits. I especially like their own zucchini and tomatoes.
Now our weekly grocery shopping is not complete without this place.
It is so sad that we missed the strawberry and blueberry season to pick it.

recent_reviews.author: C Elizabeth H
recent_reviews.text: I had a beautiful picnic with my daughter. The apple trees were in full bloom. Thank you Sunnycrest for the memories and yummy lemon filled muffin.

pumpkin_patches.address: 59 High Range Rd, Londonderry, NH 03053, United States

recent_reviews.author: Karen
recent_reviews.text: Stopped for ice cream at the end of a day out.  Lots of variety of flavors and all delicious.  Also visited the farm stand and everything looked yummy.  Very pleasant stop.  Fresh corn!

recent_reviews.author: Karyn Martin
recent_reviews.text: Tenney is terrific! Everything you want in a local farm experience and more! The ice cream is the best around. Be on the lookout for specials that feature sauces made from their fresh fruit. The flowers & herbs are beautiful, hardy and well-priced. The farm store offers the freshest produce and features products from the areas best artisans. Whether you pop in for their farmâ€™s produce or to pick up a summer hosting gift - this gem has it all.

recent_reviews.author: Tess V
recent_reviews.text: Friendly, awesome service! The vegetables, fruit, and other products were high quality. We brought home some corn which was absolutely delicious. So glad they are within a short distance; I will be a regular customer.

recent_reviews.author: Lorena Drouin
recent_reviews.text: Love picking up veggie, fruit plants and flowers etc. here! They have good Ice cream too! All kinds of other great things inside the store area as well! Produce, breads, gifts, etc!

pumpkin_patches.address: 1 Main St, Antrim, NH 03440, United States

recent_reviews.author: Fan Up
recent_reviews.text: Good food but delivery to London is over Â£15.   Delivery doesnâ€™t need to be that expensive in these competitive times, so many delivery companies around that charge so little these days.  Much cheaper alternatives in UK with free range chicken.  Shame.

recent_reviews.author: Charlie McKinley
recent_reviews.text: Not long back from breakfast. Took my daugher out for a treat for her GCSE results and it was great. I got the special French toast and my daughter got French toast with Nutella and my son a kids meal. All meals were delicious. My toddler isn't a big eater so I ate one of his sausages and they are really good quality. Far better than most kids meals sausages. And then my daughter got a free ice cream cookie because of the GCSEs coming out today. Both girls serving are very polite. I aways forget about this restaurant but will be coming back. Thanks

recent_reviews.author: Michael
recent_reviews.text:
Went today with my wife and kids mainly to visit the sunflower maze which was being run for donations to the air ambulance. There was an impressive amount sunflowers, but don't be expecting anything spectacular.

Before we went to see the sunflowers we went into the cafe for some lunch. I had the angus burger with cheese, relish and crispy onions. My wife had a chicken wrap. We also shared a side of chips. My kids had sausages and french friesand chicken goujons and french fries.

To start with the kids meals came out 15-20 mins before our meals came out which i wasnt impressed with. I was a bit disappointed that the sausages weren't from the meat counter, but rather looked like just your standard sausage you get in any other cafe for a kids meal. Kids meals did come with a drink of juice and an ice cream (which choice of toppings and sauce). Kids were happy enough with their meals and portions were big enough.

When mine and my wifes meals did finally come out they had a measly side garnish of pretty pathetic lettuce and half a cherry tomato dirzzled in a salad dressing. There was no apology for the delay or even an acknowledgement that we had been sitting so long without food. The place wasnt busy and always had free tables, but there was a steady stream of people coming and going. My burger looked like a half assed attempt at a smash burger which about a third of it over cooked because it was so thin. The meat didn't taste like it eas great quality and it left a funny after taste in the mouth. My wife was happy with with her wrap saying it was nice and had plenty of filling. The chips were burnt and possibly recooked looking at them, but i like them like that so no complaints from me there. We also had a coke and coke zero, with the bills coming to almost Â£40.

I will say the staff were fairly pleasant when speaking to them, and never seemed to flustered at any stage we were there.

All in all, I was happy to go and support the air ambulance, but dont be expecting too much from the sunflower maze (there were 3 or 4 games scattered throughout the maze for the kids to play e.g. ring toss and giant jenga).

I would not be back in the cafe again if that's the quality of food that they are serving.

recent_reviews.author: Graeme Ferguson
recent_reviews.text:
A wonderful farm shop with their own meat, the 28 day aged beef, dry cured bacon (none of the white scum when cooked), free range eggs (amazing yellow yokes) and speciality sausages as well as wonderfully fresh vegetables.
The cafe has really tasty freshly cooked foods and does speciallity evenings.
Well worth going to.

recent_reviews.author: Oliver Calvin
recent_reviews.text: Excellent ğŸ˜‚

recent_reviews.author: Richard Stewart
recent_reviews.text:
Good range of produce and sweet treats but vastly over priced compared to other farm shops I use.
The pricing lost them stars in my case

recent_reviews.author: Viv Stringer
recent_reviews.text: Restaurant closed..for good it seems. No info on website. Seemed like wasted journeys for many people who kept arriving as we left. Not very businesslike

recent_reviews.author: Kim Sterritt
recent_reviews.text: What a little gem! Lovely friendly helpful staff. Very well laid out, great menu. We got a booth. I tried the carrot, apple and ginger fresh juice- very zingy and uplifting. I ordered the chicken stack meal- it was divine. Good sized portion of creamy mash, delectable chicken alternated with thick slice of good bacon topped with 2 big onion rings and fresh peppercorn sauce. My mum had the baked potato cheddar bacon and salad. Very filling, no room for dessert! So we will definitely be back to try more of the menu and sweet.

recent_reviews.author: Robyn T
recent_reviews.text:
Decided to stop at Chapmans to let our kids pick some beautiful fresh produce. The staff was very standoffish from the moment we entered.

It was so uncomfortable that I put my kids back in the car before proceeding to purchase anything. I asked about certain produce and was met with a very blunt (unfriendly) answer.

The produce is beautiful, the shop itself is well laid out. But the staff are not very welcoming, they seemed to be very judgmental and all together not nice at all.

*only getting as many stars because the produce was beautiful.

recent_reviews.author: Sarah Stevenson
recent_reviews.text: Great wee day out with plenty to do. It was great that the outdoor play parks weren't on top of each other. There was plenty of space. The animals were friendly and the children enjoyed feeding them. Such a good range of indoor and outdoor things to do!

recent_reviews.author: James Bradley
recent_reviews.text:
Prob 2.5-3 *s, in general a very good for a day out but be warned its very expensive, my main issue with this place is they charge the same price for adults and children Â£7.50 per person which means a family of 4 is paying Â£30 before you even see or do anything. To avail of quad rides and animal feed it will set you back a further few pound.

The facilities were great, in terms of seeing animals (although not too many, but definitely enough), petting the dogs, bouncy castles, ride on go carts and tractors were all great. There was a great soft play area indoors that catered for most kids ages.

The outdoor play park was also great and the kids thoroughly enjoyed it, however this is weather dependant and I wouldn't recommend attending here on a wet day if you want to get your full money worth. Very scenic in the sunshine and you could spend the entire day here if you wish.

The food here is also very expensive for what you get, I. E. A family basket is 5 nuggets, 6 cocktail sausages, chips and a jug of juice. Â£2.50 for a 500ml bottle of coke and Â£2 for a fruit shoot. Again not really worth it, however you can bring your own picnics, which given what you pay for entry I would highly recommend.

Overall a very good day out if the weather is right and you can spend the whole day here. However be prepared for the price.

recent_reviews.author: Louise Mcsorley
recent_reviews.text: 2 adults & 3 kids went, such a lovely place, plenty to do for the children, nice hard working staff, my only peeve as such was that adults paid the same for children, the farm is for kids so I don't understand why we paid through same price, I felt it could have been cheaper for us adults but a brilliant place with loads of activities and really well set out, the children were well entertained

recent_reviews.author: Shauna Herron
recent_reviews.text: A few small animals to look at, a few more bigger ones outside. Barn full of trampolines and go-karting. A big play area with multiple trampolines, swings, slides, and a big hill slide with sleds. 2 year old had the time of her life, so it was a good wee afternoon out

recent_reviews.author: lara doherty
recent_reviews.text: My first visit to Mullygarry Farm, such a pleasure to have something so special in Enniskillen. Just had some of the Chutney, absolutely gorgeous, can't wait to try the rashers& the lamb roast.

recent_reviews.author: Jonathan Coyle
recent_reviews.text: Delicious hand reared lamb!! Thanks to Emma, Rodney and Sam

recent_reviews.author: Steffi Otto

recent_reviews.text: We are now regular customers and will keep returning due to the high quality of the meat and reasonable prices, always met with a smile, a chat and leave feeling better

recent_reviews.author: Clark H
recent_reviews.text: I had my first time Apple PYO experience here. The left was the one I got from Costco, the right one was picked from Moose Hill Orchard. You can tell the difference. This is why I love the place !

recent_reviews.author: Joshua Deshaies
recent_reviews.text: Beautiful place to visit! Especially in the fall.  Apple picking, pumpkin picking and freshly made sweets for everyone.

recent_reviews.author: Stephanie Tozzi
recent_reviews.text: Great selection of pumpkins, apples, squash etc. Love going to their store. This year (2023) they did have caramel apples so I was super happy about that. They have a variety of local goods to buy as well. 4 stars because pretty much everything is slightly expensive. Also, line to get donuts was super long but to be expected.

recent_reviews.author: Grace
recent_reviews.text: Perhaps the timing was off when I went but it was a beautiful weekday in June. The hanging plants out front were mostly dead. Inside, there wasn't much for sale but I purchased a frozen chicken pot pie, medium in size for $17.99. I cooked it for dinner that evening. It was full of peas, carrots and gravy but very little bits of chicken here and there. I was disappointed to say the least. I expected more chicken for the price. Mrs Bud's has more. 3 Stars as the staff are very friendly and it's kind of difficult to judge a place based on just 1 visit.

pumpkin_patches.address: 230 Mammoth Rd, Londonderry, NH 03053, United States

recent_reviews.author: Matt & Jackie Foodies
recent_reviews.text: Wanted to mix it up and try another ice cream spot. Ordered the apple cider donut sundae. We thought this was perfect for 2 to share. The warm donut with the ice cream was a perfect evening treat. Lots of outdoor picnic tables along the water as well as shaded seating.

recent_reviews.author: Jessica Featherstone
recent_reviews.text:
Mackâ€™s apples will always hold a special place in my heart. When I was growing up I used to practice soccer down by the willow tree and pond. A gorgeous place! So when I was looking for a last minute place to get married I instantly thought of this spot. The owners donâ€™t normally hold weddings here but they made an exception for my intimate family gathering. THANK YOU! It was absolutely gorgeous and my photographer could not shut up about how beautiful the photos were gonna turn out with the sun peaking through the weeping willow branches. Another photographer came down after to take photos of other people. It is quite the location!
Shout out to Chris, Maria, Lisa and Kyle for making this possible and for helping me put together the cutest favors for my guests! We got little maple syrup jars and Mackâ€™s made jams that everyone was very excited to receive. Thank you for being a staple in this town and being apart of the best day of my life! ğŸ’œ Jessica

recent_reviews.author: Julie Block Sampson
recent_reviews.text:
It was so much fun to pick our own apples. The farm stand had all types of "pack your own" apples, if picking your own isn't your thing. They also have pumpkins, maple treats, fudge, ice cream, and so much more. The apple cider doughnuts were delicious.

There is extra parking behind the barn, if you go when it's busy.

recent_reviews.author: Megan Bissonette
recent_reviews.text: Been to a lot of apple orchards, fall farms, etc., in multiple states, and this is honestly THE BEST ONE! Here's why - plenty of activities all spread out with plenty of parking, the largest selection of pumpkins, gourds, and apples that I have ever seen - ever color, shape, size, etc. Blown away! They have tons of gift shop items. The apple cider donuts were hot, fresh, and the best ever! You can get a sack of them, unfortunately not individually. They have an ice cream shack with the most flavors and add-ons I've ever seen. I would have loved to try the apple cider Sundae or maple creamee, next time! The fresh apple cider was great, and we sipped on it while we did the U-pick. Our little Halloween bucket was $15 I think. The pumpkin house in the field and hay bale maze were adorable, and they had the largest blow up pumpkin I've ever seen! Check the photos for a list of what is at the three stations. Heads up, while they have portable toilets, they have a real and clean bathroom inside to the right of the ice cream area. I got a fresh whoopie pie to try, and it was great! All staff were friendly and helpful! (Was very crowded, but it was no problem in my opinion)

recent_reviews.author: John Bashford
recent_reviews.text: Good size, popular Supervalu supermarket in Lisnagelvin shopping centre with plenty of free parking. The shop has a hot food counter, butcher, Frank and Honest coffee machine and off licence.

No wait, scratch that one. Of course they're friendly; something in the Derry water forces them all to be from birth.

Very good supervalu
Very large carpark
Very nice staff

recent_reviews.text: This shop has been central to all that live nearby  catering your weekly shopping, hot food, post office, and off licence easy access open planned car park with disabilities bays on level ground. Definitely would highly recommend this shopping centre to other individuals it is extremely near to various other shops that cater to a variety of items.
